mLHkpxOCV-j1Ul79B52GIg.text: When we got to the front of the line there was a little boy taking orders- it was cute- but illegal, nonetheless. We placed a large order. In it, We ordered a pound of catfish. We got four pieces that were really thin. We asked for the sweet sauce (that is not outside) and our server initially refused and said there are outside sauces. We asked if we accidentally received 1/2 pound and the guy looked away and said no it's right ($15 catfish plate provides 3 pieces, no way on Earth 4 is a pound). After spending $50 and tipping, I feel like my experience did not match my basic expectations, which are to get what I pay for.

sO4s5EYJJLQ2oSDaxUlC3Q.text: I've lived in Vegas for 40 years.  I'm from Texas.  I know good BBQ!  I know, I know, peeps judge BBQ based on where they are from: Texas, Kansas, et al.  Different regions = different tastes.  Rollin Smoke has been, for years, my go-to, 5 star place in Vegas to go.  But I took one star off my review.  I don't eat pork ... and I can't find any place in Vegas that has great BEEF ribs.    Yes, I know Rollin Smoke has a beef rib (it's great -- but expensive ...more like a rib-eye steak on a bone).    ...Still looking for great Texas BBQ beef ribs in Las Vegas.

4bwcQfuNpPyCrnESaNfLgA.text: I have been a patron of theirs since you could only get it from the side of Russell road and Valley View. It has been several years since they've open the restaurant location. Today I finally had the opportunity to enjoy this heavenly BBQ. The ribs are melt in your mouth, the smoked meatloaf was better than any I have ever tasted! The only reason it didn't get five stars was due to the fact they have such limited hours. Service was good, location not so easy to get to, and the dining rooms acoustics weren't desirable especially when it became busy. I suggest getting there no later than 10:45 am after that a giant wave of hungry lunch patrons start coming through the door. I recommend this BBQ delight to everyone, the portions are definitely shareable.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Dam&#34; good smoked meatloaf and loaded potatoes!

oY6LCHqGqMxF6-xJg5BfeA.text: Pretty damned good.  The old saying is that the best food comes from a "hole in the wall" which fits this place perfectly. The dining area(s) are small, but from what I could tell, most people were carrying their food to go anyway. Oh, and don't expect to find it on the strip... do some exploring and you'll find this place a little out-of-the-way.  For a barbecue place, Rollin Smoke has a decent sized menu w/ some more odd options like the baked potato, or giant burgers not usually associated. Their sauce is really good with a nice kick, and spice that adds flavor to anything from ribs to their awesome fries.  Try the sides. I love how they add spice by-way-of jalapenos to macaroni, and beans.   Is it the best I've had? No, but its close.

nDs146qz7aXxoErGzjpb-A.text: Had this while in Vegas it was absolutely one of the best. Had a taste of the brisket ribs and pulled pork. All of them great! The sides I tasted were Mac and cheese and baked beans. They were fresh and from scratch the baked beans had a lovely consistency they were not from a can.  On top of the food tasting good I thought it was presented well. The dining experience was clean but it is extremely casual, this is not a place to take your significant other for a candle lit dinner. It's BBQ I will definitely stop back the next time I'm in Vegas.

HADx3btiagvpFzuWSi6veA.text: Phenomenal!  This is hands down the best barbeque in Las Vegas.  The real deal!  We ordered, didn't have to wait for very long, and really enjoyed our meal. I had pulled pork and brisket duo, and it did not disappoint.  Sauce on the table went to good use.  My husband had an all you can eat with ribs that fell right off the bone.  He also tried shrimp and rib tips, which he said were terrific.  Hushpuppies were seasoned to perfection and the sides were all delish!!  Definitely adding this to our list of regular stops!  And check in for a dessert, the banana pudding was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and rib tips - yummy!

wWC4gpJqwp2cYXafT46g7g.text: Soooo yummy!!! We get some south in our mouth every time we go to Vegas! We had a party of 4 and all of us got something different - brisket, sausage hot link, meatloaf, pork, corn nuggets,mac n cheese, green beans corn bread- ugh my mouth is watering just thinking about it! Can't wait to go back- the staff is SUPER helpful and friendly!!

Qqxdq-JAvUR1eWKYdMB6Mw.text: I'm from southern Cali and don't even really care for BBQ. This place was AMAZING! The corn nuggets are a must! The pulled pork was so tender and juicy. Everybody here was absolutely friendly especially Lizelle at the register. I will most definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two meat combo with pulled pork and sliced brisket. Had the corn nuggets and Mac and cheese for my sides

9ZeHbbgcptCOcTrKqnN17Q.text: Man let me say that this place is legit! I search out  BBQ places when I travel and this is one of the best.  I had the two meat plate, brisket and ribs. And the meat was very tender, the ribs were cooked perfectly, not fall off the bone, which is not what I like.   I would say the BBQ sauce is perfect as far as heat and spice goes. It's a vinegar base and you can tell it's made from experience.   The man n cheese is a must. Super good flavor and the cheese isn't runny or too thick. Cooked perfectly and by far one of the best I have had.   Chef Justin and Matt hooked us up with dessert. We had banana pudding and berry cobbler. Both very good.   I will be coming back when I am in town and would def recommend this place to anyone in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lAeC7rx_m0chuwR615CpsQ.text: This is the best BBQ I've ever had in Vegas and the food is a solid 5!   The 4 is actually a 4.5 (unfortunately Yelp doesn't offer that option) because I rate my dining experience on food, atmosphere and service. My few niggles to follow later.  If anyone is hesitant about the area,  don't be.  You can smell the smoky goodness down the block and it will draw you in like the crack den of BBQ that it is.  This is a family run hole in the wall and the plastic cutlery atmosphere suits it.  We sat in the mural covered back room, our first hint that the owners hailed from Arkansas.  We didn't even know that Arkansas "did" BBQ, my who knew concerning that state began and ended with the now Vegan Bill Clinton; little did I suspect that I would be in for a presidential Q.  We arrived around 3:00, as they close at 8:30 PM Monday-Thursday and made our way to the back room before we placed our order at the podium in the front room.  And here comes a niggle-most of the tables were not wiped down and nor would they be for some time after we arrived.  I don't mind lolling around in my own juicy, fat and Q juice runoff, but I'm not a fan of cleaning up someone else's.  Niggle two was a less than pristine bathroom.  I'm hoping that all this was due to the time of day, more than a recurrent daylong drawback.  We both ordered the $24.95 all you can eat, so we could sample a greater number of things and graze off of each other's plates.  We placed our order with John (one of the owners) I was trying to gauge the amount of food that we would be getting and he thought my beef rib order would be a bit too much, but I let him know I was a good little eater.  I may be short, but I do have some amazing chow down capacity.  We then prepared ourselves for a leisurely wait, eagerly sniffing in the smoke fumes.  There were only two diners in our room, and one of them decided to share his phone Gangsta Rap at mega-volume, I stopped sniffing at the air and unleashed a very annoyed and loud "REALLY!?!?!" but it wasn't until his food arrived (fortunately quickly) that this rude dipshit lowered his personal jukebox.  Then our meal arrived and the gluttonous food orgy began.  For sides we had the corn bread, fried onion straws, greens, corn nuggets-all contenders for a pure outstanding deliciousness award, some tasty curly fries and a ok roll.  For meats we had pulled pork, hot links, beef ribs, pork ribs, rib tips-all perfectly smoked and overwhelmingly delectable.  The chicken and brisket were good and the sauce was nicely spiced not too sweet. We ate till it hurt; leaving the final stretch of mass stomach expansion for dessert, a tasty berry cobbler and banana pudding.  Halfway through my cobbler I hit my max and gave up.  If we could have lolled around and napped we might have been able to finish, or explode.  I stopped short of saving a well picked bone to save and use as a Pebbles Flintstone hair clip just so I could savor that smoky goodness for the rest of the day.  Big kudos to John and his family for taking the chance on this business.  We loved their attentive service, hospitality.  We will be back once we recover from the meat sweats and BBQ hangover!

xvztiD7mH0CPi9HR2g8qPw.text: This is good stuff, its yummy bbq. The line a majority of the time is outrageous and long, BUT the service is very fast so you will not be there too long. Also, food comes out no later than 10 minutes. I have a bbq place in Vegas that I ADORE, and I have to say Rollin Smoke gave them a little competition. Great experience. The only reason why I didn't give it another star and made it 4 stars- there's no room to eat peacefully. Its so small and cramped with a ton of people that it gets claustrophobic in there and I hate eating messy when someone 3 feet away can see me pigging out haha! Also, parking is a mothaf**cka, too small of a venue for the volume of customers.

0u9liBJ6yWRq5ZfcQVY_oQ.text: Hype?....Legit?....or needs a second chance?!?  Hidden beyond the Vegas glitz & glamour, just underneath the Desert Inn Arterial over pass, comes a well known local bbq/soul food establishment of roots from Arkansas.  In what seems to be a shady location just blocks from famous Vegas strip clubs, comes a place called Rollin' Smoke. Yes, the area & location can be a little sketchy to those unfamiliar especially at night...but don't let that stop you from coming in.  Featured on TV...the marketing campaign and Yelp reviews can speak for it self. With more than that....The wifey and I thought we would pay homage and taste what all the hype was about...considering it too was recommended by friends and co-workers. We went on a Thursday night, about an hour before closing and service was pretty quick with a good amount of customers dining in and carry out. Fairly a small southern hospitality type of place, it caters to a back yard southern type of feeling.  We chose to try the 5 meat platter to taste the different flavors. Ribs, pulled pork, sausage, brisket, & chicken. Came also with 3 sides of your choice as we opted for loaded mash potatoes, mac & cheese and corn bread.   To our disappointment, the ribs were a little salty & the flavor wasn't all that. The ribs were a little dry and not fall off the bone tender juicy. They also only had 3 types of sauces on the counter to choose from...one of which tasted like a mixture of mustard and ketchup. Still it was decent sauce. Not really sure what it was, maybe I got caught off guard because it was almost closing time, or maybe the meat wasn't as fresh or maybe I was just expecting too much from all the hype.  Maybe I should have said something or ask for recommendations and favorites...but I didn't want to make a big deal. Food was still good and plenty and did fill us up & even had left overs to take home.  Still, I only knocked off 2 stars because of my expectations. Service was excellent, atmosphere and staff were very friendly. I do want to give them a second chance and maybe even try their famous outlaw burger. I definitely want to give them a higher rating. I mean I could be wrong, because everyone else seems to love their BBQ.  Please Rollin' Smoke ... Make me a believer and want to come back...because whether it was hype or not...the place is legit & deserves a second chance!

JHwgQ2Dufwoxdk7BwfytZQ.text: Right off the bat, they answered the phone really friendly and super pleasant. It felt like talking to your favorite family friend. I had lots of questions about portion sizes and sides. I was advised to try the potato salad, Because their mama made it. (Heard in the background say yup) haha.  Main course : I ordered the baby back and beef ribs, both were off the chart. Meat fell off the bone, and it was cooked with just the right amount of seasonings. Potato salad was indeed really good.   I did not eat inside but the atmosphere was lively and super chill and diverse. Everybody's head was down looking at their plate.   Overall, I knew I was in the mood for bbq but with the great customer service on the phone, friendly environment inside, & kick ass food, I'm definitely coming back for more.   Ps the house sauce and vinaigrette was my favorite.

xK_9kUQcPTBO0b_vPTmRWw.text: Review #300  4 Stars *****  This place is located in a less than desirable area. It is on Highland Dr near the strip club district. Nonetheless, it was definitely worth the trip.  I am giving my 300th review to Rollin' Smoke BBQ. Definitely a solid 4 star meal when it comes to BBQ beef brisket. I just tried the Brisket 3 Ways which consisted of sliced brisket, chopped brisket, and burnt ends. The meat was very good on its own, but I added some of their Arkansas BBQ sauce to it. I thought their bbq sauce was excellent. They also offered a sweet bbq sauce, but I preferred the tangy version. I also ordered a side of waffle cut fries, which were seasoned very well.  I will definitely be back to try the beef ribs and some other menu items. I will probably add another star on my next visit if the beef ribs are as good as the brisket.

N1h5gyZzNH44U4mGIECbZQ.text: I don't usually speak about where I eat because honestly they're usually just pretty standard. Coming here while visiting Vegas was just by chance as we were looking for some BBQ. I can honestly say I'm blown away!!!    Let's start with the atmosphere upon walking in, you feel like you've left Vegas and entered the south. The people could not have been any nicer!  They gave us fantastic recommendations (get the smoked meatloaf) and we're not wrong in any of them.   You want to talk about FAST FOOD?!  We had our meals before we even sat down!!    Honestly this place is top notch BBQ and I'd even say it's better than any of the bigger names found in Texas!    We decided we needed to try some dessert so we ordered the peach cobbler and the banana puddin. The cashier told us that the pudding was all out and we were totally bummed...a few minutes later someone came back to our table and said "wait...I'm going back to make more pudding for you right now!l. What?!!  Are you kidding me?!!!    This place is fantastic!  Everyone came by to make sure we were taken care of and didn't need anything.   If you're ever in Vegas and love BBQ, you MUST come here and patronize them!!!    Thank you for making our trip end on a memorable note!!!!

PuvcBhEcFoCTagbbQS1VxA.text: I started looking for barbecue in Las Vegas and had already bookmarked a few, but nothing looked like what I had in mind.  Then I stumbled on Rollin Smoke on Yelp and thought, this could be it.  Now the name Rollin Smoke has a completely different connotation if you're not thinking about smoked meat, but let's not go there.  Let's go to the 'cue.  What to get?  I read about smoked meatloaf, and the pictures look good, but hey, it's meatloaf.  You don't judge a barbecue place by the meatloaf.  You want brisket and you want ribs.  I was particularly interested in beef ribs, and they have them on the smoker here every day.  How about some pork ribs?  They have a rib platter with baby backs, spare ribs and a beef rib.  Add another beef rib for $6.  Sounds good, but too much for today.  The beef rib was just what I was looking for.  Thick and meaty, dark with smoke on the outside, and juicy and fork tender inside.  Just pull gently and it releases from the bone with a puff of steam and meat juices rolling down to the plate.  The meat is seasoned, but not overdone.  There's some rub and some smoke flavor, but it's not dominant.  You can really taste the meat.  Barbecue sauce is offered, but with meat this good, who needs it?  Spareribs were also terrific, again partly because they are nice and thick.  They have good texture and are juicy and moist, with good smoke flavor and seasoning.  Baby backs were a little disappointing, still tender, but a little drier, and at least on this day, didn't stack up to the flavor of the spareribs and beef.    There are two dining rooms inside and a few tables outside.  The store is just a few blocks off the strip, just on the other side of I-15.  Parking can be tough, but come between the lunch hour and the dinner hour and there's no trouble.  Who doesn't like linner?  Staff was friendly and helpful, joking and laughing, and made a point to come around to all the tables to check on everyone to see how they liked their barbecue.   There are plenty of sides, and I had the corn fritters.  Folks rave about them.  They're good.   They're fried nuggets of batter encapsulating some sweet corn kernels, but I was here for the ribs, and was not disappointed.  I'll be back again for the brisket and some burnt ends.

xzRlTBavM920moyDLk5-rg.text: Found this gem on Yelp, hands down "Best BBQ Place I've ever had!" Fast Service, Christal our server was super sweet, Amazing!

FDgzcLEKb4XG4oF8EhTBHw.text: We found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try.  It is a pretty small place with a couple of different small rooms for seating.  You order at the front counter and then they bring you your food when it is ready. I had the Smoked Meatloaf and my husband had the Chopped Brisket Sandwich with the Chipotle Coleslaw on the side.  The Smoked Meatloaf was so GOOD!!  Better than your mother's meatloaf for sure!  It is a HUGE portion though so either share with a friend or be prepared to take some home for another meal.  My husband really liked the brisket sandwich and coleslaw too.  Someone who I assume was the owner or one of the owners came out and talked to us.  It was apparent that he cared that we actually enjoyed the food.  We loved it and will put on our list anytime we are in Vegas.  Thanks for the great meal!

8vmLRNnKgU_03_Y8Br6eVA.text: I almost feel bad giving this place only 3 stars, but they just don't get me there!  However, at their price point, I can't say that I'm sad that they don't.  I've said before, "Nobody's ribs are better than my grandma's!"; a True southern Virginia cook.   I've been here 3 times with my husband who loves their food so much, that he wanted it for his birthday dinner.  I'm just not a fan having tried baby back, beef & pork spare ribs, pulled pork, chicken wings, catfish (which were thin and not meaty), waffle fries, Mac & Cheese, greens, yams & the peach cobbler a la mode.... so, I have given them a fair shake.  I grew up on dumps and dives which I'd love to find one in Vegas that I can fall in love with.  Rollin Smoke BBQ just isn't it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Catfish 1/2lb and Mac &amp; Cheese

U1eTlp9KJGRVeoTsDxT53g.text: Lost and loving it. On the way to find a gun range, arrived here. Place looked decent, under the bridge next to the tracks. Place must be good, right?  Pulling up you see a giant smoker and I'm not talking Chad with his peace pipe. Parked the car (double locked them doors) but didn't let it stop me. If this is where it ends it ends.  Walked in to the friendliest smile I had ever seen. Gave the place a quick overview and thought maybe I should just keep it moving. But that smell drew me right back in. Looking at the menu I had no clue what to order. Walked to the counter & im ashamed to say it, asked "what's good". At this point I wanted the sauce over the glock. Everything pictured on that menu looked great. My eyes were to big for my stomach. I ended up going off the what the cashier had recommended. Which was the pulled pork and brisket nachos. A bottom layer of waffle fries with beans pulled pork brisket layered with all your hearts desires. As well as your arteries worst nightmare. With a side of pickles?! Oh baby!  Food arrived at the table and let me tell you this, it must of been a pound of food. I thought this was a side, or a small appetizer. But no this was the real deal the match had begun. They have their trademark sauce but you don't need it. It was perfect the way it was. This plate should defiantly be shared. But momma didn't raise no b*#$h. Sadly she might have half the plate was left, I was forced to tap.   This is where my review ends. As I waddled back to my car I realized some of the best places here in Vegas are these little hidden gems. If your visiting Las Vegas don't be Afraid to go off the beaten path. You never know what you might find.

zvo_SlxBzNw5gVdDdau22Q.text: Holy sh** that was some good BBQ... I went here based on Yelp reviews. Quite unassuming building and reminiscent of a hole in the way. This is wear all the hidden gems are located. Ordered combo rib plate. Meat was cooked to perfection and portion was huge enough to split into a couple meals... I highly recommend Rollin Smoke!!!

xABMvFegfLNtGAiH6cvrBQ.text: I am writing this review because I made a promise normally I do not ever write anything on Yelp or any type of review service however for this particular business I have to say 500 million thumbs up and I especially want to thank the manager LIZELLE THAT truly made me feel right at home.  I'm from SC, and if you know anything about SC, we know great food, especially BBQ.  FROM the time my feet touch the pavement of the parking lot, I could smell that great southern cooking.  And I told my guests that were with me that they were in for a treat.  Not only was the food great; however, the care and hospitality that we RECEIVED FROM MS. LIZELLE made me feel like I was back home in my grandma's kitchen.  I want to thank MR. DUSTI AND MR. JOHN for putting together a great team, and y'all make sure you give LIZELLE a great big ATAGURL for ME....YA HEAR...  GOD BLESS Y'ALL AND GOD BLESS AMERICA.....TY JESUS O'LORD....   COL. W, INC...  CEO OF TEAM W, INC...

gZ7-8kMluygpByjBeUgBMQ.text: Lousy. Went in May 2018. Pulled pork sandwich skimpy and meat dry! Mac and cheese terrible,  I left it, can't remember any other sides. My son complained about the serving amount for the price (cause he'd been there before.) Someone came out from the back and gave him another sandwich. His fish tasted lousy to me. As for me, they didn't offer me anything. Which was ok, I probably would have refused it anyway. Go back? Not on your life!

3vvtvaZy_YzvamKFh2XiCw.text: Called on a Tuesday for a Thursday Catering Service for 100 people. With only 2 days to plan, we are so happy we called Rollin Smoke BBQ!!! Very professional, so polite, awesome attitude, easy to work with.  I have never heard or tried this place prior to booking here. This place is the real deal!!! Everything came out amazing!!! There was not one thing that I did not like. The ribs, brisket, chicken, baked beans, potato salad, EVERYTHING was amazing.   Thank you so much Corey!

RTISid1atDqVgPwo6Fm2SQ.text: This is probably some of the best BBQ I've ever heard. It is off the strip but what an amazing place. The stories are True and the quality of meat is fantastic. The prices are very appropriate for the city and quality. I will make this a must visit spot whenever I'm in LV.

Z9VUlrh5FZ7FHD3Ue6SR5A.text: Great barbecue at a decent price! Came here with a group and left feeling very satisfied. I ordered the brisket sandwich. The meat was tender and flavorful and I loved the BBQ sauce options they had available. My husband and I got coleslaw, beans and mac and cheese as our sides. They were very tasty but since our meals only came with one side, we bought the third. For the price, I think we should have been able to order two sides. Would eat here again though.

qCDWYTNHmvg6bf0s-fkEAw.text: This place was delicious. Outside the strip. Everything was made with love full of flavor.  We got the sample platter with grilled chicken, beef brisket, links, ribs and pulled pork and choices of BBQ sauces.   Side we had the Mac and cheese and sweet potato yams.  Must try if you are a BBQ lover.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sample platter. Finger lickin&#39; good. Beef brisket, chicken, pulled pork, ribs and links.

GZtTQiUnG5HZSM80guw3Cg.text: Had family from out of town and they wanted to try a place they don't have where they live so we decided to try this place out. You order first and then seat yourself.   We ordered one of the party packs. It was just enough food to feed the 7 of us. I haven't tried many BBQ places but this place is so far better than the few I've tried. & I don't know if it's because I'm a local or because we were first timers but they gave us a discount. So that was a plus!

GKe8wXCEqXYypNh_dvQTMg.text: Super great BBQ !!! Pulled pork is great !!!! Loved the onion straws!!! Sweet BBQ sauce was soooo yummy !!! Great find ! Very nice staff !!! Thank you Josh S and Lizelle ! You guys were great !

cCiCUgUC3yOhB8HWlNsg5w.text: Super good BBQ. But kind of expensive. Their spot was small but they had tons of sauces and portion were generous.

QP2gETV2m2iaLt2t4T_koA.text: Delicious BBQ (and I'm from SC) and great service (Christal was so sweet). I will definitely be back when I want a taste of home.

2XL9TI9oCPrKcyxQVVOaPw.text: Best bbq in town recommend to anyone who lives or is visiting Las Vegas. A little pricey but it's worth the price.

QPqMj0RX7-4vAZocIs-Oog.text: This place is really cool it looks a little underwelming when you see it but trust me these guys know what the hell they're doing everything I got from here has been amazing I recommend the pulled probably sliders!

gTzNTSuzLUS_2TfdvjXCQQ.text: The best BBQ I eaten in years. Must go/taste this food!!! Antonio and Derick where very noligable about BBQ'n... And that's amazing.... noligable good customer service. Will definitely come back. My friend says it's the best BBQ sause ever.

oTxnkq-6fFP-2A84YW-_yg.text: Some of the best BBQ I've had in a loonggggg time. There were the three of us. The Father in law wanted ribs. We got the rib tips, a rack of ribs and the wife wanted the catfish. The waffle fries, greens were great. I'm told the mac & cheese are off the charts...I mean how much can you eat. As it was, we took home three styro's. It's the original place downtown, kind of in an industrial area and certainly not a first date place, however everyone in there were friendly and sweet folk. If you want ribs, brisket, catfish and whatever BBQ, it's the place to go for sure!

sA3NgRVWNAfqxx6_r63GNg.text: The food was delicious. The location is strange in a commercial area not far from a huge marijuana warehouse dispensary. We walked in kind of tight and layout and flow of the place was awkward. It was warm inside. When we walked out we looked to our right and they have another section over there with a really cool bbq aquarium and the air conditioning was great.

o9ayCIQALMV3LFpdEc-HhA.text: Although not being a huge fan of barbecue I went with a friend to rolling smoke. I had a hotdog with the chopped brisket on  top. It  was amazing. It's a little bit out-of-the-way but worth it. Don't pass it up next time in Vegas.

BZhBN83L-ZdqWj0GOm1_eg.text: Don't be fooled by the shoddy exterior appearance located by the underpass! I believe that the food is reflective on the staff -- warm and puts a smile on your face! Our hostess/cashier was sweet Sophia who laid this impression (as well as the rest of the staff), and the food definitely delivered.   Ordered the duo meats with 2 meats of your choice and a side, 1/2lb rib tips, and a side of cornbread for 2 people. It ended up being way too much food, but to be honest who doesn't love a generous amount of food for the great prices? Rib tips were more meat than cartilage, juicy spare ribs, and moist sliced brisket. You really can't go wrong with any sauce because they were all delicious, but my favorite was the "sweet country girl" which was mustardy.

xMlKT4Mgm8nhVtSHYO5Nvw.text: The food is amazing and the staff is the bomb. The biggest con (more than the prices) is the location. This place is literally under a bridge. Imagine someone tells you to pick a place where you don't want a restaurant. You will definitely pick this place. Now since good that out of the way. The food is amazing!!!!! You have to give to go here.

m8_SqWDje1Gx4bOjP1qoXw.text: The brisket was really good. The collard greens were the best I've had in a long time.

ngvib5kHQvaGrNqdJrTJcg.text: We came on a recommendation & loved it! SO so good. I got the trio platter special with brisket, pulled pork & white chicken. We splurged and had to try the peach cobbler a la mode too! Everything was really tasty, I loved the "arkansauce" with every meat. The pork was really good with the sweet mustard sauce. Highly recommend!!!

ymZyroXjQHtIqmXyfhuV7Q.text: Wow this place takes the cake for best hospitality. It is rare nowadays to find a good place with superb service and have the most amazing food. This place takes care of you like family!  On to the food: The corn fritters... OMG! Can I say a party in my mouth?!!! I could probably eat these forever or until I get a heart attack. I was never one for corn fritters but this totally converted me!  The outlaw burger: totally agree with reviews of having the best burger in vegas. Prepare to share as the portions are huge! Or don't share and keep it all to yourself   Will definitely be back for this place. Thanks for an amazing experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The outlaw burger! It should be illegal to have a burger this good!

IABo6rmkVSxImt7D5q1JfA.text: The food and the service here is the BEST!   We literally ordered for 20 people and handled everything so smoothly. When our order came out (which it was super fast too we waited like 15 minutes) they gave us a printer box to carry everything cause we had so much.   Okay for the food some of my favorites were:  + BURNT ENDS are a must get! Super tasty and soft..  + Ribs: Literally just fell off the bone when I was trying to eat it. It's that tender. Oh and it's marinated perfectly fine.  + Mac & Cheese - Ooey goeey goodness. Totally must get. + Corn Nuggets + Waffle Fries  There's also an AYCE option for 35 which considering the ribs is already 18 I suppose it's a good deal (if you can eat that much :p).

cXrFiuMtjjVZ2w7oAazsFQ.text: Great food with a great price. Location is good and you can eat outside. Food comes out nice and hot. I recommend the arkansas spicy sauce.

Yams are delicious!  The place looks a bit shady outside and the bathrooms are eh but it's not worth taking away stars. The food will speak for itself.

netDFdDlpWKzgx8yTyRivg.text: Great food and a laid back atmosphere. Brought me back to Texas! We got the BBQ Sampler and added a rack of ribs everything was excellent!

nqIaa93HwMy6TYPmj08Xyg.text: 20% local discount. Best BBQ next to TC's Rib Crib I have had in LV. The Local discount makes its worth it. Food was delish. All the sides were right on, little small, but very tasty.

wY9i8oKqXhTVkI-lGs7FFg.text: The service is really quick I was so amazed at how fast we got our ribs. Everything here is delicious try the corn nuggets ! I was skeptical at first because it's kind of dark outside but once you get inside its well lit and the workers are nice very happy with my experience definitely coming back here next time I come to Vegas.

imNvTrga4nyEknA4ADYmxw.text: Amazing bbq!!!  We had the St. Louis and Baby back ribs. Both were delicious and fell off the bones!   The variety of sauces we great, too!

2N0l53VGqxu3kT7sPLYGAw.text: Absolutely delicious. Friendly staff, tasty food, relaxed atmosphere, what more could you want? They have a variety of dipping bbq sauces to choose from. We have to say that they had the best waffle fries, softest sweet cornbread and closest to mom greens I've had (im super picky).  The brisket sandwhich and any 2 meat plate was great just enough to satisfy and leave you full! Definitely coming again!

XaNmX3L_hLxAmZGwPA1XhQ.text: First time here. It's definitely real BBQ delicious place. The area the restaurant is located appears skeptical but the food is good. Their brisket has a fantastic flavor and their Mac n cheese.

pPED3l9U0NxgBCHjYTdevQ.text: I've been eating at this spot since the first few weeks they opened. Every time I go back, they are growing and busier than the last time. This time, the line literally wrapped around the restaurant but I patiently waited anyways because I couldn't resists!!!  Everything I've ever had here has been amazing so you can't possibly go wrong! If you love BBQ, you won't find anything like this anywhere within 1,000 miles of this place!

gGC8lEuUEmOhrkwpMEV7CA.text: Omg!! Thanks to my friend for recommending this place...  Food is awesome...very delicious & tasty....prices as very good..you get a bang for your buck....they got a very good menu....it's hard to choose what you want cause everything on there is so tempting... It's a place to come to if your in the mood of good bbq...

aO60-uKlXnFjYkWIPDXFEA.text: Keeping this short and sweet. This was stop #1 on my Food Adventure Bachlorette Par-tay! One afternoon - 4 restaurants off the strip. Exploring was fun :)  Living in Oklahoma has lent me a very specific palate for Que.  I like my meats with little sauce and plenty of seasoned flair. Rollin Smoke could give the mid-west a little competition! We were also fortune enough to drop by on a day where they were setting up a photobooth for a children's charity.  The decor was minimal, as it should be. Sort of picnic style. Ordered at the podium. There was plenty of room for large groups. My party consisted of 7. We order a couple things to share and it was more than enough.  Chicken and pulled pork. Holy. Hell. Both were super moist and tender. The chicken was my favorite by far. Nice smokey goodness. It had great smoke flavor and fell off the frekkin' bone. My two favorite things!  Brisket- Sad to report that it was too dry for me.  Kudos Rollin Smoke! I'm bring the man zone here when we're in town!

k1sZH2c7dCXSmmC0rP7PQQ.text: I've been here about 4 times and every time was positive except once. That's a pretty good ratio for me. For me, this is the best BBQ in Vegas hands down.   Let's start with the positive corn nuggets sweet tea BBQ Chicken baby back ribs BBQ beef ribs   I like the casual restaurant vibe, they bring you your food but it's pretty quick and easy to eat and go. Prices are reasonable-hope they don't change.   On to the negative-brisket and pulled pork was almost identical. One of them was dry and I forgot which one. One was good. Guess I should have remembered.  The mac and cheese was nothing special. BBQ beef ribs was burnt one time and small the next time. Collard greens-just ok.   I would suggest sharing food to try more things. We get the same things each time we go and I guess I am okay with that.

XiaJaqAJ2iL3fuAa0SM1PQ.text: The best burnt ends in town. Smoked and tender to perfection. I don't need any additional sauces with this meal. Burntendmazing.

0y7Blq3DgXeJhRkDUCjBXg.text: Shrimp was ok. Greens were good. Ordered the banana pudding and it was horrible!!! Idk who made it but pudding had clumps and there were no cookies at all which is the best part. If I didn't order delivery from postmates I definitely woulda sent that back. Yuck!

vMvpsnxRK7xocrLR8bVnaw.text: Loved the food!   I remembered a BBQ place from DDD in Las Vegas and figured I'd try it on my next trip to Vegas. The place is not far from the strip but does look a bit sketchy from the outside. The inside of the restaurant is very clean and the sports tv's are a bonus.  I tried the pulled pork sliders and the rib platter, everything was tasty. The BBQ sauce is delicious, our ribs were cooked perfectly.   And the corn bread is too die for!!!!

-MO93LmU7RuWMtqMhXtgUw.text: [Update 7/1/19 - Dined again a few weeks ago. Food remained amazing however the wait was 63 minutes for two pounds of food for a take out order. Staff was very friendly however]  Those super-annoying gluten free hipsters?  I live with one, except she tries not to be.  Super-annoying that is, not the gluten-free part, which she can't help.  You see, she is part of about 1% of the population who has Celiac disease, which is a genetic lottery prize that bestows upon the lucky few the ability to projectile piss out of one's poop-hole for extended periods when the smallest morsel of pasta or bread comes into contact with one's stomach lining.  The monotony of the resultant, laborious bathroom breaks are broken up only by extended bouts of abdominal cramps comparable to those involving giving birth to over-sized children.  By sheer, weird coincidence she has experience with this also.    In any case, tonight we ordered our usual two orders of meats taking special care to put "no bread please" via our Uber-Eats app.  The ribs and chicken orders promptly came an hour later served on a bed of fluffy, glutinous bread.  Disappointing, but no big deal.  Having lived with this curse her whole life, she has grown used to disappointment--perhaps this is why she is currently dating me.  Undeterred, I simply reported the discrepancy via the app and attempted to re-order so that our lives and bottoms can live on without issue or anal pain.  I get the notification from the app that the order was received and that the establishment was currently preparing our second order of the night.  We smile, turn back on our Fortnite, and I pick up the phone to make sure it doesn't happen again.     A gentleman answered the phone.  Requesting the manager, I was told that he could help since there was no manager tonight but he has been there the longest and could address any concern I had.  I informed him of girlfriend's Celiac disease and the name of my order and was promised that this next order would be prepared minus the bread this time.  Minutes pass and Uber notifies me that my order has been cancelled.  I call back, the same gentleman picked up and I asked if the order could be un-cancelled somehow.  Apparently it was because the chicken was out.  No worries, I informed him that we would take whatever meat was left over.  Starving women can't be choosers, after all.  He puts me on a brief hold so that he could speak to the manager who has now magically appeared from when minutes earlier there was none on duty.  I was then informed that their iPads turn off at 9:30 and that there was no way to have something ordered unless we had a driver come out there.  No problem, I said.  I would personally drive out because I was in no mood to deal with Ms. Hangry at home all night.  At this point he promptly hung up the phone.  Perhaps it was a dropped call--no matter, I'll call back.  I let it ring ten times.  I called back a second and third time and the prompts looped me back again and again to the robotic voice asking if I want directions or hours.  It was now 9:40PM and they were about to close.  So here I sit now with delicious barbecue in the garbage unable to be eaten yet I still have a bad taste in my mouth from Rollin Smoke.  In the past two months I have ordered five times from the Flamingo Location as a treat for the house for the one time we get to order out during the week--we ordered from this Highland location this time since Flamingo closed at 8:00pm.  It will absolutely be the last time.  I have no doubt that the food here is amazing also; however, the apathetic customer service and poor execution of operations leave much to be desired.  I humbly suggest that the transcription process between Ubereats and the restaurant be reviewed.  The yellow receipt on the bag made no mention of the allergy request but the Ubereats receipt clearly did.  Per the restaurant was swamped during this busy holiday weekend, but extra care should still be taken to be vigilant of customers with awful food curses who would rather not play diarrhea roulette during dinner.

I2TTqjFeyiwDMcgfvLsjCQ.text: Ordered carry out via their website.  Smooth, easy process. Delivery was OK -- average, but not speedy.  The food was good, but nothing remarkable.  I had the 3-meat combo with brisket,  chicken and spare ribs. The ribs were good, the chicken average, and the brisket mediocre. Baked bean side was very good.  My wife ordered the 2-meat combo.  Her pulled pork was good, but the chicken not so good as they delivered dark meat when she had ordered light. Her green beans were OK.  The convenience of delivery on a 112 degree day was nice, but we probably should have ordered a pizza. Or, there's gotta be better BBQ in Vegas.

b4AL8eDVlzyklbwsavcifQ.text: This place is delicious!! The service is excellent! It's clean! The bathrooms were spotless. My husband ordered fried pickles, baby back and spare ribs, green beans, beef brisket, and fried shrimp! He wanted to taste all of his favorites! We were not disappointed!! The location is perfect, not far from The Venetian.

1khGpD4vWfelMlasuLXWfA.text: Hmmm, evidently I never wrote a review of this place. Very very good BBQ place. A bit difficult to find, as it's in a "random" location. However, very worthy of looking for it, as their beef ribs are FANTASTIC! I've never been a fan of beef ribs (always preferred babyback or spare ribs), as they've always been too dry/tough and just not good, but Rollin Smoke made me change my mind. Matter of fact, we've come back to this place 2 more times since our initial visit, just for said beef ribs.  And the 5-star review is just for the beef ribs. Holy brontosaurus ribs, as in Fred Flintstone would be proud.  Their sides are.. OK. But I'm more than happy to scope out another place for the fixings, as long as I get more of the beef ribs.

Dby10VFv_LVGSiq1xufGWQ.text: Found this locals spot quite by accident but sure glad we did.  We've been in Vegas for 8 nights and we have eaten there 3 nights (planning on 4th time tonight).  Brisket, pork and ribs were all very good.  Service was very quick, staff was extremely friendly and tables were constantly being cleaned.  It is legit BBQ!

Bhm7k6y87UkT6jldfT-I6Q.text: First time in my life, I've been craving BBQ almost on a daily basis. I credit (or blame) Rollin Smoke for that. I come to LV several times a year, and almost always end up eating on/near the Strip. But this time, I took a drive out here, under a freeway overpass, next to a strip club, in a less than glitzy part of Vegas. But so what, it's all worth it.  Upon entering, you'll see the seating is communal, resembling picnic tables & benches. Once you decide what you want, place your order at the counter. Grab a table and in a mere minutes, someone calls out your name. You better answer, because he's holding your food.   I would've gotten the 5 Meat Pit Special, but the wife isn't exactly a carnivore. So I ended up with the Trio Basket; 3 meats and one side. Chose ribs (of course) brisket & pulled pork.   Ribs: F-ing awesome (and I rarely swear about food) Smoky, salty, tender and a bit fatty. I'm craving hard as I'm typing.   Brisket: Covered in a crust of coarse pepper, it is so tender with small chunks of fat to give it that greasy coating.   Pulled pork; Super tender but bland as hell by itself. Grab some sauce to give it life. Would not order again  Corn bread; sweet, sticky and moist. Perfect ending to the a meal of meats.   Extra order of Corn nuggets; Because the fatty meats aren't heavy enough, these fried corn nugz are great, and have a slightly sweet finish.   Napkins are on the table, and about 4 choices of various sauces are at the counter w/ small paper sauce cups. I'd say try all 4. They range from sweet to heat. Depends on what you get, it may add a new level of flavor, like the underwhelming pulled pork.   There are separate rooms. First is the main room, where the entrance, the ordering counter, and fountain drinks are. Over to the left, is another room with big screens airing sports. A third room is a bit larger, detached from the first 2 and seems quieter, but I never made it in there.   The food, came out fast and was excellent. The service, not bad. The girl who took our order really didn't want to be there. She was lethargic, and couldn't describe any of the flavors of the food to a first-timer. And all I asked was "how is the pulled pork?' She answered, "it's pulled pork." ...    I would, without a doubt, come back.

O8UGr_2xZRhy0aEbWq5HLg.text: This place is in a pretty ugly location but they have made it as attractive as they can. It does have a tiny parking lot which is full of cars because the food is just too good!!!   The pulled pork was some of the best I've ever had , I actually had a pulled pork sandwich and I paid a dollar extra get a hamburger bun put on it which was really good , also the The rib tips are the cheapest thing on the menu but they're amazingly good the yams are heavenly - not whipped but just sliced - in a sweet sauce and the cornbread was actually amazing !! I felt like it was for dessert because it comes to your table warm yummy and fully buttered which is an amazing experience , they serve you these little straw onion rings with your meal which are just like potato chips you want to keep eating them the service was excellent and I had everything with a root beer float which was exceptional :)))

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sKbiNsgeDUixxGj6PYekUQ.text: Came here for some bbq and want to see what the yelp hype was about.   This place is only an 8 minute drive from the strip.  The parking lot is really small and can be a pain to park if they are busy.  I got the special which was 1/2 pound of rib tips and a sweet potato pie for only 10 bucks.  My wife got the two item meat which you get to pick 2 different meats.   She got pull pork and brisket.   For 3 dollars more you can get burnt tips for the brisket (so worth it).    They give you so much meat for your money here.  The tip tips were meaty and delicious.   The brisket burnt tips were the best out of everything!!    Caution: they use a lot of cracked pepper so it has a kick.   But the meat was so juiced and tender.   Amazing.    I'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the cup.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib tips and corn bread
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket (burnt ends) and pull pork.   Also coleslaw and corn bread.

Moz1PdVSJKSyWhslUt64LA.text: I've never actually eaten here.  We always get take out or I go to events where Rollin Smoke has been catered.    That being said you have to be quite impressed with this place.  If the food is still good after being delivered/picked up and sitting in some styrofoam for longer than it should be then you know you're in for some good eating.  What I like best is that the meats actually taste smoked but not overwhelmingly.  I don't even really use sauce the meat itself is so good.  I love the beef ribs.  So tender and delicious without anything to add.  I will say that their sauces are pretty great though.  Have some pulled meat with a sauce.  To die for!  The sides are pretty inventive and very tasty as well.   Definitely a great go to for a party!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Take out!  Enough for 3 days.  Lol!

42Ka2W7zIcEQ7-idvR8QSw.text: Say yes to Rollin Smoke. This place is a cut and polished.  A gem it is. The food was delicious and the service was fantastic. Southern charm to say the least. I had no idea I was speaking to the owner and when he told us his story and how it all started, I was amazed. True definition of someone never giving up. Ok, back to the food. The shrimp poboy was great, the yams and the Mac and cheese was to die for and I don't eat everyone's Mac. My family enjoyed their food as well. I almost forgot the banana pudding. I'm not going to say anymore, just go see for yourself.

FZVnoRxXqvwL3rJYeB5YyA.text: Delicious homemade BBQ.  EXTREMELY DELICIOUS!!!! ***  I've tried several bbq joints in Las Vegas and this happens to be my favorite one by far. Not only is all of their food extremely delicious and flavorful but it's all homemade. Theirs sauces from bbq to tartar sauce is so yummy. Also their cuts of meats we tried were exquisite. Best rib tips/burnt ends I've ever tried and the brisket was so moist and juicy.... omg, amazing. The Mac and cheese is so different than any Mac I've had but it was delicious, beans, dirty ice and fries were awesome. They use a lot of peppercorn in their food so it gives and extra kick which is so good.   They restaurant looks really small on the outside but they have a lot of room inside. And they have TVs and such. We watched the game it was pretty cool to have. It's kinda in the backstreets of vegas off the strip but it's great bbq. It's totally worth going off the strip. Service was terrific, the only thing I could've asked for is if they wiped down the tables more often but it's no biggie.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket and Rib Tips / burnt ends . Super yummy !!!! Best rib tips in town!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Po Boy (shrimp) sandwich. Made a bit differently than I&#39;m used to but still very yummy (:
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty rice and beans. Both have a lil kick to them

zrYW-Ex8oiRZpKwN6De12Q.text: I went there for a late lunch on a recent Vegas trip and this is definitely some great food!  The burnt ends were the best I ever had and were moist!  I also had the beef rib and slaw while she had the pulled pork and all were fantastic!

lUrCns41aE6kR7rbru7fLA.text: If you're ever in Las Vegas we have to go to Rollin smoke and order the beef brisket in the The beef ribs they areincredible

TygRowX7CilUAoa0Q8sEmw.text: Just the best BBQ in Vegas, hands down. I come here every time I make the trip to Vegas from Sacramento. It is a must have, Brisket is off the chain and today I had the meat loaf. Pretty damn good

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n1UjkRg7HaaTHA3UEQGwSA.text: I came here on my most recent vegas trip after finding it on yelp. The waiter at the front was super helpful at helping explain the menu to me. Food was very decently priced and this spot is located about 10 minutes from the strip. I ordered the 3 item combo with brisket ribs and hot links. I enjoyed the hot links and ribs but the brisket was slightly dry for my taste. Service was excellent here I felt at home. Will be back on my next trip to vegas
