_LaWP0HCBQghtykF0BUeAQ.text: I was very excited to try this place out after seeing all the excellent yelp reviews. Me and my family decided to try it out and I was a bit disappointed. Don't get me wrong, it's still pretty good bbq but it's not amazing. The staff is super sweet and the Outlaw burger was pretty amazing but everything else was just ok. I will give this place another chance next time I'm in Vegas.

NaBOU6JEBRFa9vGZX5iu8w.text: This spot was all the hype it was even on the news. We went there last night. And was very disappointed. The ribs was fatty. No banana pudding and no peach cobbler. No potato salad. We won't be coming back. Very small dining room.

aPlGbAR1Vwa_CSIVrn7tbQ.text: I drove down from Henderson to try this place. Pretty busy inside. I ordered the meatloaf, two spare ribs, and mac and cheese.  I got this order to go, but when I got home no mac and cheese. I made a few attempts to call and left a message before I finally got through to a person.  When I told the guy who answered the phone that I was missing an item. He said "What do you want me to do about it?" Huh? I just spent 23 bucks there and I'm missing something. I will say that I'm pleased with the quality of the food. Just be sure to check your order before leaving...

N5ylRXuyBGy61r-FX_w6ZQ.text: It was a bit too much about being BIG instead of being great. The best part of the Outlaw Burger (the obscene meat building in the photos) is the onion rings. I also thought the red cabbage was a nice touch. Baby backs are not fall off the bone, but good flavor. Really liked the homemade BBQ sauce sitting on the table. Sides: corn nuggets - OK, not much flavor; waffle fries - no Bueno, probably a frozen product and they were served cooler than room temp; Jalapeno Cole slaw - good (not great), I did like the contrasting sensation spicy and cool-slaw. This is a great place for families. And the price is right. Worth a trip - Yes.

6u2bXUds3V7U5fCZWpw72Q.text: Last night on 10/9/14, I ate here and I cannot even give this restaurant one star but they make you pick a rating to post. We went there to eat for a club function. I don't know who picked it but this place is terrible. They serve you with plastic forks, knives and spoons that look like they've been rewashed. When I complained they brought out a new bag and when I took the spoon out of the new bag that I opened it had a dried worm on it. The food was greasy and my chicken was half raw..my friend's was cold. They use breed as filler for everything including massed potatoes.   The peach cobbler had two tiny slices of peaches and the rest was something I can't even describe. I will never ever go back there again and I would never ever recommend it to anybody.

tQdqcG0oEdZvOFZ-XlTanA.text: Like this place needs another review!  But I am a jersey girl so I'm putting my opinion out there. AAAAmazing.  Every BBQ joint I have ever been to I get pulled pork sandwich.  However, I had to break out of the rut and order the BBQ meatloaf and mashed potatoes.  Best ever!!  My hubby and I split it, we ate at 3:00 and didn't eat another thing until breakfast the next morning!!   Would do it again...oh in 2 years or so.  I think I will be working off those calories until then:). But SO worth it!

aRY80b0KFLCLbMZlb3EFiA.text: Great food, great value and excellent customer service. Came here based on the 4.5 star reviews from Yelp and we were not disappointed. The ribs and chicken have a great flavor and definitely coming back next time we come here from Cali!!

LQO2ceFEKVzn6yXTMkhaXA.text: Amazing Bbq from start to finish. Meatloaf is a must, jalapeno coleslaw is an awesome twist

Jc5BOJxtCa3XSARXyeaEnA.text: We got the Pit Special that came with 5 meats and 3 sides. All the meats were mediocre with the exception of the pulled pork which was actually really good. The sides we got were the waffle fries, loaded mash, and bbq beans. The waffle fries were tasty and seasoned well with a nice, crisp exterior. The loaded mash isn't worth it, they tasted like instant mash potatoes which it probably was. Also the baked beans weren't that great either. Lastly, usually if the meat isn't great the sauce makes up for it but not this time. I did like that there were a variety of sauces to choose from but they weren't that great and some of them kind of tasted similar.

TxEGCDMga1iNn6X6fxel3g.text: I was pretty impressed. Never expected to find barbecue this good just off the Strip. My wife and I split a combo plate (I forget what it was called) so we could try everything. So, from best to less best:  Brisket: Top-notch. Moist, flavorful, well-smoked. A delight. Ribs: Split verdict. I thought they were great, wife finds beef ribs a bit too chewy but admitted the flavor was great. Hot Links: Excellent. Spicy and flavorful. Pulled Pork: A bit dry and not up to the standard set by the other meats. That said, there sure weren't any leftovers.  Sauce: Pretty ordinary, really. Not bad, though, and the meats don't need its help, so it actually works pretty well in a supporting role.  Beans: Fantastic. Almost like a bowl of chili. You could make a meal out of these alone. Potato Salad: Maybe the best ever. Bacon really does make everything better. Cole Slaw: Unique and original, but didn't really work for us. The only real misfire in an otherwise exceptional meal.  This is a really good barbecue joint, bordering on greatness. When you factor in its unexpected location, it probably deserves five stars. Barbecue snobs that we are, we just can't quite grant that ranking when comparing it to Kansas City's best. Guaranteed, next time we're in Vegas, we'll be back. Friendly folks and good food bring us back every time.

SCTxZWwWZTrNw6hn1o3aow.text: I know I'm an outlier here but I think this place is 2.5 stars. I'm from the Sout and also lived in St. Louis and went with another die hard BBQer who grew up in fl and la. Everyone was very nice but was overwhelmed with the long lines for dinner and the food was just ok. Had baby back and regular ribs which were tough, brisket was dry, and Mac and cheese just ok. Maybe it was an off night but for vegas ellis island is still my go to place.

CUVhGNIPXf_tTQ15dcv_0A.text: Ok, saw this on triple D and have been looking for good Que since I have arrived 6 yrs ago. I think I have accomplished that!  We had the mighty beef ribs, spare ribs, and boy were they good! Beef rib moist n meaty fun finger food. The 1/2 rack of the spare ribs... also tried the mac n cheese (forgettable.. Very creamy but no cooked crust and not so flavorful), and the kicken beans. I can't WAIT to go back.

EkKjZywmeBXxKKApBDNL0Q.text: Absolutely delicious.  I wasn't sure about it when we pulled in at 830 on a Friday night but the second I walked in the door, I was greeted by the aroma of the sweet sent of BBQ. Pit Special is what was ordered and nothing of it was a disappointment.  I am pleased to recommend Rollin Smoke Barbecue to anyone looking for great cooking, mouth watering food.

14GSjoZIbJbGTQusEUQ8sQ.text: Awesomeness!!! They catered our work lunch and everything was excellent! When they ran out of food, the wait for them to bring more wasn't bad considering it was lunch time and they'd already fed 300+ of us. You could tell that Matt (one of the servers) felt genuinely bad that we were waiting but he kept a smile and sense of humor the whole time. Great food and customer service! Definitely will be having this again and again =)

X3uvlRkN6DV8bq--mTEgVQ.text: This is some of the best food I've had in a while.  We stopped here after my boo wanted bbq! They did not disappoint.  The greens, mac n cheese, the corn nuggets and brisket are allll awesome. I will be recommending this place for sure. And the staff was super friendly. Dave told us the food speaks for itself and it did!!

Wnf6HjEDPOEVjlIujlstNA.text: Wow!  Wow!  Wow! Vegas needs more places like this.  I love that it is not a chain.  I love that it is not in Summerlin.  I love that it makes no apologies.

2lL2lZF7u0FbKdImZJ5rrA.text: Got a full slab of baby back ribs and it was very good.  Meat came off the bone effortlessly and the portion was large.  They were the biggest baby ribs I've ever had lol.  Their sauce has a good balance of tangy and spice to it.  The waffle fries were good and so was the kicken beans.  The peach cobbler wasn't very good.  I'll skip that next time.  Can't wait to go back when I'm in Vegas.  Great customer service.  I will be a regular here when I'm in town.

0TRKjtQZh4KHdrrwi5tCkA.text: I spent $43 there and my dog ate $40 of it. The food was cold, old and unseasoned worst barbecue ever don't trust any rating over 1 star this place is horrible.

fXgapQwLluiL0F3cROSGrw.text: I do not usually take the time to make Yelp reviews (or at least, not to actually comment), but I had to share this secret with everyone... Rollin Smoke is the real deal!  I was in Vegas on a business trip and tried it on a lark... Where have you been all my life, Rollin Smoke Barbeque?!  As soon as I walked in, I could smell it... That authentic smoke that portents rich, savory flavor in meat (if it is done correctly, and Dusty - the proprietor of this gem - does it correctly).  Their prices were definitely solid for definitely solid for the portion size, which is a pretty remarkable thing in Vegas.  There is even a 10% off coupon on their website!  I got the all-you-can-eat deal (which is all you can eat of anything on their menu... anything!) because I wanted to try a bit of many different things, and it was $21.50 after coupon.  But their other meals and combos were very reasonably priced as well.  Now for the feast... I tried sausage, brisket, hot wings, spare ribs, and beef ribs, but they also had shrimp, catfish, baby back ribs, chicken, hush puppies, beans, and on and on and on.  The sausage was solid with a nice little kick.  The brisket was a little lean, but very tender and tasty.  I got the "Damn Hot" hot wings (I have won several wing challenges in my day), and I don't know if they were trying harder to hurt me than normal, but they were HOT, with a building heat that walked that line between pleasure and pain.  All of that was great, but the ribs really shined.  The spare ribs were large and meaty, with a deep-down smoke flavor that spoke volumes about the slow care that went into their creation.  And the beef ribs, which Dusty insisted I try, were the coup de gras... Meaty, mild, flavorful, and tender... The best beef ribs I have ever had, no contest!  And how did I finish this homage to gluttony?  With a homemade bread pudding (covered in whiskey sauce) that was heavenly!!  Dusty himself chatted with me and my friends for a bit - telling us about his cooking process, the pride he (as Pit Master) takes in his food, and the labor of love his restaurant has become - and we even got to meet the special chef whose grandmother's bread pudding recipe would now forever haunt my dreams.  This is THE hidden gem of Las Vegas...  I have lived all throughout the South (Texas, Georgia, Virginia, and everywhere in between), and this is the BEST BARBEQUE I HAVE EVER HAD!!  If you like barbeque, and you are coming to Las Vegas, I highly recommend you give this place a shot.  Note to Guy Fieri: this place needs to be on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives, immediately!

IDYXqm0KSk-4SQehcaltvQ.text: Great food. BBQ counter atmosphere. Counter girl Kamia was helpful with my food allergy issues and sweet, too.  The beef ribs seem pricey, as no sides come with them, but they're worth it. Collard greens spicy and tasty, too!

rf5KgSzOjRyVkPU31iMBMg.text: BBQ seems to gravitate between really good, or really bad.   Take your local county fair, where the only thing in common between the display photos and the food is how plastic, dry and devoid of flavor the food is.   This place is a lot closer to the former, because everything was excellent (we didn't order sides, though). All the meats had a prominent smoky flavor and was thoroughly moist, though I'd definitely give special attention to the burnt ends and the ribs. We also had the sliced brisket which we preferred over the chopped up version. It was leaner so definitely not as moist as the aforementioned two options but definitely still tender. Portions are huge - we ordered four pounds of meat for four people - which we discovered was slightly excessive.  There's literally four (or five? or six?) different sauce options so you can go wild. Of note, though, the spicy is the best. Drinks are refillable and the drink cups are non-disposable souvenir options that you can take home and bring back to get a discount on fountain drinks. Great idea in theory, but I already lost mine  \_()_/ .

4ZSlMdm56wd_CMjnCjD7Fw.text: -Gotta love ribs! I lived in Texas for a couple years and haven't had ribs as good until I went here.  -Service was great. Made my little guy happy with extra stickers.  -Wierd lady in the corner talking to herself, but that's not Rollin Smokes fault and damn it, it wouldn't be Vegas if she wasn't there.

L57sY87Jhg5b2ctjIXe7MQ.text: This place is a serious diamond in the rough. Walked here from the strip. It was shady AF - walking by a bunch of porn shops and stuff. Weird. It's basically under a freeway overpass. Weird. But damn, they have some amazing food! I had a plate with a variety of stuff and it was all RICH and SMOKEY and DELICIOUS. Exactly what I needed.  The staff was super friendly for my friend and I, who'd never been there. They recommended some awesome food.

-ld84JJ64uKcX_afp3_MOg.text: Whether you're starving after lap dances at Spearmint Rhino right down the street or just finished smokin some good weed, this is the place to be for some excellent southern BBQ.   Not the best location in the world (looked dangerous at night), but I will drive anywhere for good food.   My wife and I pigged out on the pork ribs and meatloaf with sides of the corn cheese nuggets, dirty rice, and mac and cheese. The pork ribs were really soft and tender, but it was their spicy bbq sauce that was the icing on the cake. I'm gonna have to get a bottle of that sauce to take home the next time that I'm there. The meatloaf had a lot different flavors going on, and the smokiness was a bit overpowering. Still good nonetheless. The corn cheese nuggets were bomb! Crispy on the outside and soft and cheesy on the inside.   They also have an AYCE option for $34.99. If you have the munchies and you're looking to feast, that option will be worth it for you.   Will definitely be back to try some of their other meats!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C5TACZ1H0i-Whpc_v8lM2g.text: I had the 3 way trio Pork Ribs: falling off the bones Chicken:well seasoned and crispy skin Brisket: a little dry and fatty ends but good. Two sides Dirty rice:probably the best I've ever had Mac&Cheese:Cheesy and creamy and sweet tea to help wash it down amazing and great hospitality

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-v4eYO09zeCaT4HsOJb2yg.text: I first tried Rollin Smoke BBQ from one of their food trucks... while good, I was not impressed, and their brisket was just ok.  Fast forward to going to their restaurant location... Their brisket was excellent... Perfection!  Their 1/4" slices of brisket hold their form, and tear with minimal effort, just like any competition brisket.  Their sausage was also excellent... Spiced properly and good exterior crunch.  I like their BBQ salad... that's a lie, I like everything there.  Totally worth a trip to a semi-industrial area.  Great BBQ joint in the middle of LV!

231qRXJgOhWSis0AXiRsdA.text: This place was awesome and I can't wait to get back! Definitely the best BBQ I've found in Vegas so far!  Hubby, Mr. P and I shared the five meat plate with two sides. I'm pretty sure that their favorite were the ribs. But I have to say that the brisket is what really impressed me! It's served chopped and I couldn't believe how moist, tender and flavorful it was! It says a lot when you don't need any sauce.  It's also worth mentioning the hot links (a little too hot for me) and the pulled pork (tender and mild, but nice flavor).   As far as the sides go, those corn nuggets were my favorite! They had that great balance of salty and sweet that you want.  Now this place is on the small side. I was certainly grateful that we happened to come at a time that wasn't very busy. We had no problem finding a place to park or a table.   Service was fast and our food was out shortly after ordering.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle fries, loaded mashed potatoes and corn nuggets!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Five meat platter - brisket, ribs, pulled pork, hot links, chicken

jjgTfAOSMR_yrOmh89mElw.text: To be honest I did not expect the BBQ to be as good as it was. I'm from Texas after all, with roots in the southeast, and I've had the best 'cue in all of the typical BBQ Meccas: Austin, Nashville, Memphis, 'Carolina (both of them), and St Louis. So when I think of good smoked meat, Vegas isn't even really on my radar.  Well I guess I should have known that a town like Vegas can attract the best of everything, and they've certainly done it when it comes to BBQ. I ordered a three meat with brisket, pulled pork, and ribs, and all three were completely up to snuff. The brisket was tender and had a nice peppery bark (my favorite part). The pork was just as it should be (let's face it, pulled pork is hard to mess up as far as BBQ goes), and the ribs were big, meaty, flavorful, and the right texture.   The meat should be the star of any BBQ joint, and it definitely is here, but the sides at rollin smoke were standouts too. I got the BBQ beans and the bacon potato salad. They didn't bunt on the sides one but. The beans were really well seasoned and were full of meaty goodness (brisket I'm guessing) and the potato salad had a good mustard kick without turning into mustard salad with some potatoes. Plus, bacon.  I tried two sauces, just for fun. The meat didn't need them. The NC style vinegar was perfect for my pulled pork and the spicy sauce was delicious. But again, not required at all. Maybe just a bit of salt.  I'd have liked to see pickles, onions, and jalapenos on the side  like we get here in TX, but that's just quibbling. Major props to whoever is running the pit here. I'll be back, and rest assured it's worth the stop.  Oh, one more thing, the employees were all very friendly and helpful. The counter girl was very pleasant - say hi to Crystal when you stop in. (Hope I got her name right!)

uOogj16AcuwcxjeERbkgvw.text: Just had a fantastic dinner at Rollin Smoke Barbeque!    Being one who smokes meat for a hobby, I sampled their chicken, brisket, pork and pork ribs.  The pork ribs were my favorite, by far, because of their strong smoke flavor, but I would not pass up an opportunity to go back for any of their offerings! The Cole slaw is a vinegar style with a little kick; the mac & cheese is very good and the potato salad has bits of crunchy bacon!    All in all, a great place, that will be on my list of favorites for when visiting Las Vegas!

5Zm0A1CywZG4GF9EIpfB5Q.text: I love BBQ and love trying all sorts of styles  This place was highly recommended to me by my best friend so I was expecting something that would make me say "Omg" But sadly it didn't hit the mark, I ordered the rib tips plate it came with fries.  The portions are generous, the fries are shoestring and have a slight seasoning ( so good  I finished every one ) the rib tips were tender and juicy and once again generously portion & would of eaten more except there was just too much rub for my liking, I wanted to ask my friend if this was exactly how  the food was & if they are always this heavy on their rub , wanting to chalk it up as it being a one time only thing but she seemed happily eating I didn't want to bust her bubble   So I made a excuse that I was full and took the rib tips home   I gave a 3 star for the shop being super clean and the staff being friendly and the fries

VxAv1X14uzm7vGQY9JAjAQ.text: Best bbq ever! My husband  had the ribs 3 ways and added an extra beef rib, coleslaw and hot links and I had the brisket, ribs, bbq chicken and corn bread with a side of baked beans. AMAZING! A definite must go! I love to eat and cook all kinds of BBQ and this is the best place I have ever tried as far as bbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ribs, spare ribs, baby back ribs, hot links, coleslaw, corn bread, bbq chicken , brisket...
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq Side Salad
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MP9B8M1Ov2yo9wafKl7fyA.text: It was our first time in Vegas and we typically like to try new foods when we are in a new town.  For the most part all the places we ate at were good.  Rolling smoke kept popping up on my Yelp so I said lets try it.  Some of the best BBQ we have had!  All of the sauces were fantastic.  Best part was probably the most reasonable priced place we ate at the whole week!

JglqMuRdlMgUJPOv0Mu_xQ.text: Last minute lunch decision before heading out of Vegas. I had this place bookmarked in Yelp and now I know why. I started with a half rack of baby back ribs. They were smokey, tender and juicy. Seasoned to perfection with a course pepper crust. The cuts were great with the perfect meat to fat ratio - more meat than fat, but enough fat for flavor. Served over white bread with a side of dill pickles. The Arkansas sweet sauce paired perfectly.   I was craving a hot dog all week so I had the dog from the kids menu. It was a big, beefy dog on a hoagie roll. It was more than a kid should eat. House sauce on this one was awesome. Added a side of loaded mashed potatoes. Not sure, but these might be instant potatoes. They reminded me of KFC which isn't a bad thing. Topped with cheddar, green onion and bacon; it was delicious. Closer to 4.5 stars overall. If you want bbq in Vegas, this is it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Sc6u3ntJGhppts1YYtKOeQ.text: oh so worth the time to drive off the strip for some well made que.  chicken is moist, brisket is tender, and ribs are just firm enough to offer a nice chew off the bone.  everything is seasoned well, not to salty, with a good amount of smokiness.  the quality of the ingredients are great; including side dishes and sauces (they offer 5 different bbq sauces).  note: you can have your brisket sliced or chopped.

uAV6iu3SorrqtN7q_Tf06g.text: Great foodFriendly staff They have an expansive menu with a wide variety of meats and sides. Ample portions of great tasting BBQ. Their cups say it all: "It's Dam Good"

4nd5jt9qzi1VGZ-Bq4WLVQ.text: Smell good but was just okay.  The portion looked small but the three meat was enough. Chicken was still red in the inside but most restaurants cook it like that.  (Didn't call to tell them because I wasn't going to go back). Mac and cheese was chessy and creamy. Beans tasted like chili to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 17.99 with a side.

y7uHP5GBr97v23kcZNBzVQ.text: Exterior = 3/5 The location is off the strip, but slightly next to the freeway. It was kind of hard to find the place because its further in and side streets had a few turns from the path we took (we were coming from MGM). It looked like a legit hole in the wall restaurant. It was situated in an L shaped plaza with a couple other stores. The parking was open, no validation needed. I couldn't tell if the place was the barbecue place until I walked up and stared at the menu on the door.   Interior = 4/5  Place was nicely decorated. There were two places for sitting, the main area with the cashier and a side area with more benches and booths. It was pretty easy to find seating and they even have all the barbecue sauces in the side with little cups which was so convenient. I can see how it can get crowded especially if the line is long, which can get bothersome for some of the people sitting down since the line wraps around the benches in area.  Service = 5/5 The cashier was super friendly and gave us recommendations on what to get and his recommendations were on point. He took his time to explain everything as well since we didn't know what burnt ends were. After we ordered, and we're eating, the owner went around saying hi and greeting people asking how the food was. So the environment was super friendly.  Order = 5/5 We got a sampler (chicken, brisket, ribs) with half a pound of burnt ends, as well as the coleslaw, corn, and Max and cheese. I loved all of the sauces, so try everything - each has a unique flavor and texture. The food was so yummy. I found the chicken to be good, it wasn't dry like other places and the brisket and ribs were good. What stole the show was the burnt ends. That was beyond delicious and just the right amount of fat so it was soft and full of flavor. I found it cool they served it on bread, I thought it was to soak up oil or grease. Whatever it was used for it was cool. The sides were okay, I liked the coleslaw had a bit of a bite and the boyfriend loved the corn.  Overall = 4/5  Great food experience for barbecue. Probably one of my favorites, since the meet was full of flavor and not dried. Service was welcoming too and makes it comfortable for first timers. I will come back and order a pound of burnt ends.  Hint = get the burnt ends.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our whole meal. Sampler with the burnt ends, corn, Mac and cheese, and Cole slaw

Ke1M6W9VWxz8ujIxM9rsHA.text: This is likely the best BBQ I've ever had West of TX.  The trio of Brisket platter was absolutely perfect, with the chopped and burnt ends being the stars of the show.  We also got one of their signature burgers, don't recall the name but it is a HUGE burger.  Very well seasons patty.  There is basically an entire serving of crispy onions on top, just slide them off and eat as a side dish.  We will be back.

sWMIIKigYhMqfJJEwkkiWg.text: Wow!  What an amazing experience!  Christal was very polite and courteous with us!  Ordered the 5 meat with 3 sides.  Chicken was so moist! Highly recommend the Mac and Corn Nuggets!  Very pleased and very full!

zbq2xObIwu0Yv4C2ri8ZNw.text: My friend took me here today. First time for me. It was delicious! Everything tasted great, I had the pulled piggy sandwich side of beans and Mac n cheese. My friend had ribs sausage and chicken I tasted his as well and I liked it all except the sausage but that's just me. The bananna bread pudding was really good too my friend raved about it, you gotta try it!  To top off the good food the staff was exceptionally nice and welcoming. They seemed to really care how the costumers were liking their food. They came out and were interacting with everyone and making sure they were satisfied. This place is awesome I would definitely recommend. It would even be great to cater a party! Hope they can make it to the strip .. People would love this place on the strip.

RpOjOgcKqKxE5NHMRigYhw.text: The beef ribs are spectacular. I don't know how I can be more positive about them. Beef brisket on the bone. 1 is enough for a big mans meal. I will return.

MmW0RnOrnwmKLkG1osBREA.text: As much as I love barbeque, I haven't been happy with any one place in town.  Some have great meat, some have great sauce, but none had both.. until now.  Hubby and I went with a friend to try this place out and left with full tummies and happy faces.  First, ambiance.. it's a tiny place inside an industrial strip mall next to an overpass.. the word "dive" was invented for this place, I believe.  Trust me, you won't care.  The new tables inside are nice, though.  Service.. great!  Now for the best part.. the food.  The sides were average to good, but we didn't try a lot of them.  Cole slaw was "interesting", mac n cheese was "okay", baked beans were "good!" .. but we forgot those as soon as we bit into our meats.  I had the pulled pork sandwich, the "Piggy", which came with a side and a drink.  The sandwich was enormous.. first thing I did was cut it in half for taking home half of it.  Then I bit into it and all my taste buds jumped up and did a cheer.  It was the most incredible pulled pork I've ever had.  Superlatives abound.. juicy, tender, meaty, saucy, omg nom nom nom.  I'll be honest.. that other half never stood a chance of going home, I ate it all.  Hubby couldn't decide so he got a half rack each of the baby back pork ribs and the beef ribs.  He was exclaiming about how incredible the pork ribs were and then he tried the beef, completely forgot the pork was there.  He's definitely a beef ribs guy, always prefers those, and found a level of beef rib heaven he hadn't known existed.  And the size of those beef ribs?  Definitely brontosaurus sized, massive amount of meat on each rib.    Our friend got "The Biggin" sandwich and the brisket sandwich.  He devoured the Biggin and was making lots of strange noises, occasionally coming up for air to proclaim the food amazing.  The brisket arrived a bit later, and brought out a new level of attention - he said it was as tender as a pulled pork sandwich and we all were amazed that there was moist and tender brisket, because every other bbq joint manages to dry the meat out.  Since he has two hollow legs, he ate every bite of both of those monster sandwiches.  The prices are cheap, the food is amazing, and it's probably good that they're not located closer to home ;D.  I'm willing to bet that the Pitmaster there gets marriage proposals on a daily basis, because of his great food.  Hubby was ready to ask for a divorce so he could marry him, and I would have understood... ;)

ws1bdjwRanXCH-rnIsmWfQ.text: Hands down the BEST BBQ place in Vegas. The meat was perfect! The sides were delicious and the sauces are amazing! The sweet corn bread melts in your mouth and even the sweet tea blew my mind! Makes every other BBQ place taste like a McRib. I could not stop raving about this place afterward... Famous Dave's is for CHUMPS!

AKBbSgiw8eIoSbqy5UIUwg.text: Ordered D's sampler and added an order of beef ribs with sides of potato salad and cole slaw, and it was so worth going. Sure, it might be off the strip...but it was amazing BBQ.   Dusty (D) the pitmaster was an awesome host. He made sure we were comfortable and well taken care of. I've definitely added this place as a must eat for when we're in Vegas.

c9asnhmBWQTnmG99QHFlVA.text: I go to vegas quite often for business.  Because most of my associates are turning in their expenses for reimbursement, they opt for the fancy expensive hotel restaurants.  Me?  although i love a juicy $50 steak someone else is paying for, when i spend my own money, i love to find treasures like RSB.  A hole in the wall that you need to travel off strip for in the industrial district, but, ROLLIN SMOKE BARBEQUE is well worth the effort!.    The menu is pretty simple but with a wide variety of options.  I asked for a suggestion and was told the brisket and rib plate with slaw.  FABULOUS choice!  The brisket was tender and thinly sliced.  The subtle smoke flavor was deep in the meat.  The ribs fell right off of the bone with just the right amount of sauce to compliment the meat.  The slaw was fresh and spicy and had some corn in it to add to the flavor.  Team was friendly.  The place was clean.  If you are looking for a burger, i saw one being delivered to a table that looked incredible.  If visiting from out of town and want a real treat at an affordable price, go here!

SkqzLLvOSC8WYldHtHnEsg.text: This place is amazing.   Immediately stepping out of my car into their parking lot the smell of bbq smoke floods your nose. You know it's going to be good.   I must say, to my disappointment that I did not get to try as much as I should have. I had the Pull "Piggy" as it's called, which is pulled pork on a hoagie roll. I read some other reviews that it was pretty large and since I was coming for lunch I didn't want to over do it. My mistake. It wasn't that big at all. Simple six-inch hoagie roll stuffed with smoked pulled pork with a drizzle of their bbq sauce and some green onions. It was very stuffed, but I still wasn't full afterwards. My fiance got a sandwich as well, the beef brisket. Both were absolutely amazing. The meat is tender and packed with flavor. The bbq sauce isn't overwhelming and heavy - enough to add flavor and more moistness.   All-in-all, I cannot wait to come back to this place. They have AYCE for $25, anytime any item. Challenge accepted, soon.

kIk_KDhxEsxcYQwx2mSd0Q.text: Went here around 7pm on Thurs nite. Not too busy so found table in the side room. Typical plain Rib place without too much atmosphere. Ordered the 4 meat combo and a 3 meat combo for 3 adults and 2 kids. Came with 4 sides. The pork ribs and pulled pork were very good, brisket was good but bit dry, BBQ chicken was fair as was the huge beef ribs. Mac and cheese was better than avg, waffle fries were good, fried okra and spicy beans were fair. Overall we all left full and satisfied. Not the best ribs I've had (love Bone Daddy's in Grapevine, TX) but satisfying. Don't go here for atmosphere or service.

ghBa_ZjB7bnK1_V61vkvjA.text: You absolutely have to get the beef ribs. They are unbelievable. This is, by a wide margin, the best bbq joint in Las Vegas. Sides are amazing but it's all about the meat. Spare ribs, beef ribs, baby back ribs. All unreal.  The beef ribs are so tender you can just pull off delicious pieces with your fingers. Get em!

YngmfOPJ_nLrAhlC3d-oWw.text: Went back for my second try.   Better this time, but not great!  The workers are all very nice!  Again, I got takeout. Brisket was ALL fat and inedible!!  Beef rib was small, but thick; had good flavor, but the top was too charred and crusty.  The pulled pork and dark-meat chicken was wonderful!  I don't usually order hushpuppies, because I think they're dull. I heard there's had a "kick"-I wasn't disappointed with that!  The sauce was fabulous!  It is very spicy, which I like.  If you don't like the heat...stay out of this kitchen!  I think they must give the questionable stuff to takeout customers so they don't have to hear you complain.  Not sure I'll go back.  OK, SO I'VE BEEN BACK A FEW TIMES SINCE THE LAST REVIEW...THE TRICK IS GPING IN AND ORDERING AT THE PODIUM. Whether eating there or taking to go.  You order and pay first, I leave a generous tip, and get the best BBQ ever since!

ol342VRuGXMGAXhuxuhb3w.text: Omg!!!! The best BBQ, I have ever had ... baby backs were my favorite.. Had 3 sides (Mac n cheese, bacon potato salad & mashed potatoes) All great!

QA0kTUcIbJYlQ4RCLc-K-A.text: Best BBQ in Vegas!  I tried the brisket last time I was in Vegas, quite incredible. Will be going back next time, I'd rather eat here over any buffet any day!

QkCkHoSbKaideantNvXkeQ.text: The BBQ was ok.  I'm a big baby back rib fan and these were definitely not fall off the bone.  The sauces were watery I felt.  Also,  the sides were not good at all.  I would not recommend  this place On a positive note the servers were good.

Wv9_aa5LcK4re8l_U6R9MQ.text: This is the spot!!  The brisket made me a believer that good barbecue exists here in Vegas.  The staff was on point, we will be back.

X2xmMf8VZuPI7vU62C3Nhg.text: Little off the beaten path, but it was busy. I had the 3 meat combo brisket, ribs and pulled pork. Brisket very tasty, nice smoke. Ribs outstanding, not as fall off the bone as i like, but good no less. Mac and cheeze, wow awesome. Wife had the catfish, shrimp and hush puppies. Hush puppies over cooked and stiff as a rock. Catfish dry and so-so. But this is a BBQ place, not sure why she wanted seafood when we were at a BBQ spot, but it was not a wise move. For BBQ, its a good spot with really really tasty sauce.! Reasonable prices as well!!

oDZkihf-K6ZbCiJXjb4b5w.text: Loved the Pulled Piggy Sandwich and Hush Puppies. Sandwich was on a soft sesame roll that was like home-made. Only one tiny piece of fat in the pork, so much better than most places. Pork was moist and tender, and had great flavor. The Hush Puppies had a mild jalapeno tang to them, and I thought about ordering more since I finished them early, but the combo meal with a Country Berry Cobbler side completely filled me up. The cobbler was THE best I've ever tasted. Will definitely be back here next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled Piggy Sandwich, Hush Puppies, and incredible Country  Berry Cobbler.

KBbNDKRSF7KOGoJ2Ip1WZQ.text: I see a ton of 5 stars for Rollin Smoke and I can understand why.  I'd give 4.5 for the family atmosphere and the food.    The brisket was extremely well done and the pulled pork tasted amazing, unfortunately the ribs were a little on the dry side but the sauce they have made up for it.  When we visited here this weekend the owner's mom was there and she was such a sweat heart.  I almost feel bad giving 4 stars just because of her.    The place itself isn't much to look at and the location is definitely off the beaten path.    Rollin Smoke is at least worth a trip to give it a try, personally I don't "crave" BBQ all that often and usually Famous Dave's or Lucille's will do the job if I do.  Overall tho, good food, worth a trip to try once, but don't think I'll go out of my way to try again.

FnfMPVMUvGZajUhlbyM7Rg.text: I'm originally from Texas where BBQ is easy to find. Been living in Vegas for 26 years. This is the first place in Vegas that would compare to what we were accustomed to back home. Amazing food and service!!

mUuULby-DfbC6qmw8mtQzg.text: I thought the food was pretty tasty. I enjoyed the Smoked Chicken, and Brisket. The Collard Greens and Mac 'n Cheese was nice too. I only wish the food came out hotter.

3JwlakqBrK6peCwPXG-Vnw.text: This place boils the meat & the sauce is boring. Mom was not impressed... but then she is from KCMO and we are accustomed to the barbeque of KCMO, TN & TX.    My fried-shrimp was great, but I would have preferred a cocktail sauce and not the their barbeque sauce to dip them in.

xdFCyue8JzvwKO0c6QT2Tg.text: Really tender and super tasty meats. Lizelle,Brenda and chef Damon were very nice and courteous. We'll definitely be coming back  here anytime we're back in Vegas

obzVjD4qwYA0dCFQbNMgwQ.text: Legit. I had the ridiculously oversized Outlaw Burger and a side of Mac n Cheese. Wife had the chicken/brisket combo with a side of corn fritters. And it all got demolished. Do you hear me? ALL OF IT.   Rarely am I impressed with BBQ places but Rollin Smoke had it rollin alright. Portions, taste and price were all above the standard. Its definitely part of my Vegas food rotation from now on.   Good job, gentlemen.

1Ge-q1WP-idtHs637GQxeQ.text: My dad wanted us to go grab food with him, and told us about this place. Couldn't believe how GREAT it was. Little hole in the wall place that you never expected to be there. Can't wait to make my way on back!

MVFo-jySTrBWCilV_Ncp7g.text: After reading through the talk threads I kept seeing Rollin Smoke. I was convinced its time for some BBQ. As always there is a nice crowd inside and it's hard to get a table at times. We were luck to grab a seat in the side room. My wife and I split the 4 meat 3 side combo. We had the pulled pork, brisket and double spare ribs. Sides were hush puppies, mac & cheese and mashed potatoes.the brisket was good but I enjoyed the pork and ribs mostly. Great smoke taste and I add a bit of the BBQ sauce for extra flavor. All the sides where great. Mac and cheese and hush puppies are where it's at! A bit small in here but great food!

78nys00cU8Z0AhBPWoT3vg.text: My absolute favorite bbq joint from now on! Yelped this place and decided to check it out. Everything we had was delish! Every time we're in Vegas this will be a must! & the staff was so hospitable!

HAUYVU-nxi5EV_X5q851QA.text: Meh, not awful but far from my favorite in town. I wanted to love it...loud, hot, crowded(good sign) but being 115 outside the only seats were by the line. Kinda uncomfortable having people and kids over your shoulder and touching your back while you scrape the fat(a lot way more than half) off your $7 rib. Good flavor and texture on the 4 bites I did have though.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time visit, 7 dollar rib was 80% fat ick!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smells wonderful!

Ac_aMHOH9K_r16PVDXwXUw.text: This was the first time we ate at this place. We took advice of the cashier who directed us to a platter of different meats.  The food was great and delivered quickly.  The sausage was too spicy for my taste but other meats were delicious. Would definitely go back for lunch next time we go to Vegas.

PPZFhES1hXrZ_4amPujt2Q.text: Best bbq I have had in town hands down. We had the pick 3 with ribs, hot links and brisket and the catfish plate. Our sides were bbq beans and Mac n cheese. Ribs were falling off the bone and the brisket was tender and juicy. Everything was full flavored and smoky. We do not care for sweet sauce at all and their in house "Arkansauce " was perfectly balanced with heat, vinegar and sugar. There was several nice people working who were friendly and warm without being on top of you while you ate. Very laid back easygoing place we will definitely be coming back.

WivxLA7TztI7PcQxCU6GLg.text: This place has the best bbq I've ever had! My boyfriend and I shared the three meat trio and we chose the ribs, pulled pork and Brisket. Every single thing we tried was phenomenal. We also had the mac and cheese, everything is just absolutely ridiculously good. I'm going crazy over this place. Definitely happy I decided to come here. I will be coming back every time I come to Vegas FOR SURE.

k2hD_66cH68SxAlTEU2_Gw.text: The best customer service, a little pricy but get a lot of food per order. Great tasting and lots of sauce choices.

T2PyQbe_NdjlxZeOqymEEA.text: Always great.  I typically get the smoked meatloaf... but I also love the spare ribs and beef brisket.

vBQVzZnpqQ35CDUA-w0-tg.text: Haven't had BBQ this good since we lived in Texas!   3 meat platter was super tasty- got brisket , pork , and ribs.  Side plates were great.    The clientele was all locals; it's a little ways off the strip. No frills but a fantastic meal.  My only complaint is they don't serve beer .

azeLZVjoBgkQh4GS-CAx6g.text: Good barbecue is one of the most rewarding finds in the culinary world. First, one has to learn about the place, then one has to hunt it down, then one has to resist the urge to leave... because NO barbecue restaurant worth it's prices boasts the most upscale  atmosphere or structural amenities.   But then the food comes; and one is suddenly more happy to be sitting at that grubby, sweaty little picnic table than they could have ever anticipated.   So, that being said, Rolling Smoke Barbecue is the finest quintessential barbecue experience I've had in fifteen years in Las Vegas.   I learned about Rolling Smoke from one of their newest team-members, "Chef" Nick. He's been a close friend of mine for years, and he has been doing an amazing job promoting the business. He greeted me when I came in, too, which was classy.   The service otherwise was gracious and friendly, the Atmosphere was as modest as barbecue gold mines can get, and the food...  Wow... The food.  The ribs, brisket, and pork I purchased practically melted in my mouth, leaving behind only the subtle texture of the meats' not-so-subtle spice rub; a rub that thankfully doesn't overpower the undeniably robust flavors of the proteins themselves.   ...A flavor that makes it completely understandable that the restaurant is perpetually inundated with a line of hungry patrons. Don't worry - though - the kitchen has it down and they churn out an order every fifty seconds or so.  Oh, and at just over $15 (prior to well-earned gratuity), this barbecue meal is certainly worth the price.   Please, go check this place out. It will leave you entirely satisfied and grateful that you stuck around.

Evf2BihtdKaORx9etb0BoQ.text: I come from a family that treats bbq as a religion and this may be the best bbq I've ever had.  I've never written a Yelp review before this, but I feel it is my obligation to tell the worlds how delicious this food is.  I came to Las Vegas to play poker and eat good food.  After eating dinner at this place late Saturday night, I am heartbroken that it's closed on Sunday because I was ready to head back the next day for lunch to have the $25 all-you-can eat (ANYTHING ON THE MENU!!!) feast.  The ribs literally fell off the bone.  I cut the brisket with a plastic fork.  The bbq sauce was incredible.  Do yourself a favor and get the smoked meatloaf, which is served on a bed of some of the best mashed potatoes and is smothered in tasty onion strings.  The staff was super friendly.  They were happy to tell me all about the food.  They all seemed to have a great deal of pride and respect for the food they served.  Eat here.

HQzHPW4N8tMsocy3XrshKw.text: Best bbq in Las Vegas. Smoker in parking lot. There is always a line out the door and for good reason. Prices are very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Leftovers for days.

BjrWQIsYIw9RAr8It3YrJQ.text: If you want texas style BBQ, this is probably the best in town.  I haven't found any sides here that I would rate 5 stars by themselves. I won't deduct points for that.

LumV0hf1FiupUfo4gjy-5w.text: Best BBQ I've had since I lived in Chicago!  And I've lived in San Diego for the last 20 years!!!!  Highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone.  Had the catfish...Awesome!  Had pulled pork...Awesome! Had hot links...Awesome! And the rib tips... Oh My Goodness!  Most likely will hit this place again before leaving Vegas!

_gDOmQfrOZRpR2hVk4DS6A.text: PRO: This place is and easy 4 stars.  The BBQ here is simply awesome.  The brisket was extremely tasty and tender (smoke ring very apparent, none of that reheated meat you find some places).  I also had the Pulled Piggy, my favorite by the way, with the sweet and tangy BBQ sauce provided on the table.  In addition, our table also had the short ribs and meatloaf of all things and to say say they were delicious would not be enough.  Eat here for great prices great tasting BBQ, it's as simple as that.  CON: The only downside I could find and the reason for the 4 stars vice 5 is the wait time.  Understandably this place had a line outside but if the wait time could be cut to under 20 minutes a definite 5 star.

3gj3_3AkieVoWSAyIrD5mw.text: I'm a native Texan with BBQ sauce running through my veins and must say this is one of the top 2 smokehouses I've ever eaten at! When a meatloaf, of all things, was blowing people's minds you know Rollin Smoke is doing something right!

JOyn3L-s4cyNbB3dOcPtzw.text: Holy cow! This place is sooooo good. The service was fast. The place is clean and the food is phenomenal!!! Definitely going back!!!

QHroNLXtRrGno_CfWb7Dww.text: The Outlaw Burger was not good at all!! The brisket was the best I've had in Vegas hands down!!

e5ECxz7l8nUTEERpuoNXCw.text: My family was referred to this bbq place from another restaurant in town, and boy were they right about the food. None of us could finish our mean because they gave us so much. Usually that means it would come out and not be as good quality, but the brisket was very tender. The loaded mashed potatoes were phenomenal, and I would 100% recommend this place to anyone in the area. To all southerners visiting Las Vegas, it felt like a little bit of home in this hole in the wall place with some good southern sweet tea and wonderful hospitality from Lizelle and Zach.

AnQdUuAm4fXrvzj6JaZU9Q.text: Lil pricey meat very tender . Not to fond of the sides

3H5ijx1zUP0OZjhu9hiH2w.text: First time here and everything was delicious!!  I had bbq chicken nachos and my husband had the outlaw burger (yeah, idk what he was thinking!). The food was good, seasoned well!!i got my husband some peach cobbler and after it cooled down, he devoured it. Lol. The employees are nice people and manner-able. It's tucked away, so if you don't look you'll pass it up. Overall, a great experience for the first time and will definitely return

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Outlaw

ZHkSQ-omqpHlevUO-Woggw.text: Amazing find! This BBQ rivals or exceeds the best we've found anywhere in the U.S. their brisket is smokey and falls apart ... the staff, especially James and Dusty the owner made the whole experience even better.  No matter what we tried ... every meat was distinct in flavor and texture and their selection of 5 or 6 homemade BBQ sauces provided unique new experience to each.  Don't even get me started on the sides ... from the mac and cheese to the collard greens (oooh those greens)   The best surprise of all was the prices, yes best surprise ... so reasonable and for generous portions.  Take your time when you go ... enjoy the food and the people ... Strongly Recommend anyone from the BBQ novice to a competitive BBQ judge give it a try, you will not be disappointed.

khc2piBVjbtaCB6CoUbanw.text: Came here with my boys the other day.  This is definitely a gem located in a hole in a wall in the middle of red light district.  We were a little skeptical at first but since the reviews were great, we decided to go inside and try it out.  The place is not that big but it is full of people.  It smells great inside... something you would expect in a bbq joint.  You pick a table then go to the guy where you can place your order and pay.  They will then bring you your food.  Drinks and utensils are self served.    The menu is filled with great selection of yummy food. We ordered the following (our eyes were bigger than our stomach for sure):  1) The Pit Special (4 choices of meat + 3 sides) -  We picked the brisket, pulled pork, double on the spare ribs, corn nuggets, bacon potato salad & mac & cheese.  The brisket was disappointing coz it was dry. The pulled pork has great flavor. The ribs is perfect! I love love the ribs... glad we doubled up on this.  The corn nuggets and bacon potato salad are amazing!  The mac & cheese is ok, had better.  2) Meatloaf + corn bread for his side - my son loved this one. The meat taste great but the onion rings are overpowering for me (not a big fan of onions). Now the corn bread is to die for!  It's moist and totally delish... one of the best that I've had.   3) Chicken Wings (Buffalo) + Waffle Fries - my husband loved the hot sauce but he said the wings was alright (he had the hot sauce on the side). The waffle fries was not bad but it wasn't great either.  4) Banana Pudding - this was disappointing for me. It taste like it came out of a package.   Overall, this place is definitely a keeper for us.  We are all looking forward on coming back to try the other food on their menu.  The price is not bad, food is great, ambiance is casual & food servings are good size.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3jnOCBlfutkQnof4VVbzsg.text: There is a reason this joint is so well rated and it's not the ambiance. The BBQ is excellent and the prices are very reasonable. My wife and I both tried a combo plate; $11 including a beverage, a side and two meat choices.  The bbq is nicely smoked and the sides are spicy good. The service is fast and pleasant. But don't expect fancy or you'll be disappointed.  Oh, with a Yelp check-in, we got a free dessert. Nice bonus.  I bookmarked Rollin Smoke and will return!

vAeRWjnnWhJGiO-zLjNbig.text: We shared a single order - 1/2 slab beef ribs and a pork spare rib with jalapeno coleslaw and waffle fries - and finished only half of it and had to put the rest in a box. Enormous portion for the cheap can't be a bad thing, but ... ridiculous would be a better word to describe it.  Seating outside felt nice on a surprisingly warm day in December.  This is one of the best BBQ I've ever had, and... we're still giving 3 stars.  Probably it's just that we're not that into BBQ. We must admit that we need some enlightenment to enjoy that part of American culture.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 slab beef ribs and pork spare rib with jalapeno coleslaw and waffle fries
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu board
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eating outside in December? Nice.

BSSknGqkn3zm6Z8gWepu8w.text: Rollin Smoke wins my vote for best BBQ in Vegas. They are nestled in the heart of the strip club district on Industrial, but worth the drive to the neighborhood. I've been here a few times with large groups of people and I love the pit room in the back, it even has a really cool grill fish tank.   Rollin Smoke really excels at their BBQ and sauces. We always get the pit special, 4 meats and 3 sides, and it feeds my little family of three. Their ribs and brisket are especially good. They do lack consistency though, the first time I had the brisket I could cut it with a fork and another time it was a bit tough. Either way, you want to slather it in the sauce on the table, it's the perfect tangy sweet spicy BBQ sauce.   Rollin Smoke is a bit of a let down when it comes to sides. I've tried many of them and the only ones worth mentioning in my opinion are the waffle fries, the green beans, and the hush puppies. You do definitely want a side of corn bread though, it's so good and sitting in a little butter bath. YES! You also want dessert, the banana pudding is pretty darn good and the peach cobbler is good but a little on the sweet side.   Definitely the best BBQ in Vegas, not the best I've ever had, but the best we've got!

YclPBrwku5Jy0UuYrRkQWQ.text: Best BBQ I've had so far. Great hospitality chef Tim and chef Will. Got the 5 meat special with 3 sides . Good for 2-3 people

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S-m0pmVnhgwiT43LYUcTHA.text: Finishing up on a cross country road trip and didn't feel like we had eaten enough BBQ.  We this place did not disappoint.  From Lizelle at the front counter helping with selections to the amazing food.  We had baby back, spare ribs and hot links.  The meat just fell off the bone and the seasoning was off the hook.  Worth the stop

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l8jOtLSDfrgEF3q6LPF4Fg.text: Hello everybody. If you are looking for tasty BBQ you have found the right place. I have been smoking my own meats for months so I wanted to compare what I am doing to what they are doing. My uncle from Casper loves the place so I wanted to see wassup. I have smoked prime rib, ribs, chicken, steaks, potatoes, onions, and pork butt using mostly apple wood. I asked the waiter what kind of wood my St. Louis style ribs were smoked on and he said "I honestly don't know".  I was disappointed with that answer BUT one minute later he came back and told me "hickory".  I will be using hickory on my next 6 hour rib smoke because it is soooo delicious. I saw a review talking shmack about no smoke ring. "More of a smoke ring on my clothes than the meat". That is BS. See photos. I ordered the half rack of St. Louis style because I have cut racks in half at home and figured I could eat all that. I was wrong. There was way more meat than I could eat for sure. Plus the bomb ass corn nuggets were irresistible. They were playing the Vegas Golden Knights game when we were there. I watched the Golden Knights tonight while eating heated up left over ribs under the broiler. Go Knights!!!  And some people complained about the location.  What??!! I know ghetto and the place is off the strip but it is NOT ghetto or unsafe or "Compton" or whatever haters be saying while sipping Haterade. I didn't feel unsafe at all. I want to add that the staff were super attentive and constantly checked on us. The first two photos are from Rollin Smoke and the others are from my smokin. If you like smoked meat, go to Rollin Smoke and thank them for honing their craft for your benefit.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_xtS__SDjaKb0qe7ZNlCGw.text: The best food experiences are always the unexpected ones. We happened to be driving around off strip and saw this place out of the corner of our eye. Feeling the hunger pangs that had been growing all day we decided to go against the Vegas standard of hitting up a buffet and stopped in. It's a small place, rather unimpressive from the outside and your standard BBQ joint in the inside but you won't regret the food! We ordered the rib tips, the burnt ends and the hot links, all by the pound and shared between the all of us as a snack. Everyone was in agreement that it was some of the best bbq they've ever tasted and I'd have to agree. Spicy, smokey and not the overly sweet stuff other places serve. The favorite had to be the burnt ends, I could've eaten just that with some of the sides that I was eyeing. Next Vegas trip, I'm forgoing a buffet and spending a few good hours and eating the all you can eat special they've got there. Here's to next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib tips, burnt ends, links

eC3PGXCxh97BqRmzERxZ4Q.text: Great place, visited this awesome bbq house Memorial Day. Beef ribs were the take away for me. Meat was absolutely delicious, I cant stress that enough. I got the AYCE for a reason, since I'm in Riverside County it wasn't everyday I could visit even though I wish I could.  The one issue I had was the timeline with the AYCE. The place was a bit loud which was ok with me. When I purchased the AYCE the gentleman at the register said something about the time, since there was a very long line I didn't want to hold it up. In any case, I asked another employee about the time and for some reason he had no idea what I was talking about.  Well the thing is you only have a 1 hour window from the time you purchase it so remember that when you get the AYCE. Since the line gets pretty long you might wait up to 10-15 mins each time which limits you tasting their deliciousness. So keep that in mind.  And last, they had no corn nuggets which was horrible. Thankfully I survived....

rsf6hIfe9DtQ_QIePyNAqw.text: Found this joint on Yelp and was super impressed with the food! The Outlaw burger was amazing in flavor and a huge portion, and the sliders were great if you couldn't make up your mind!  First time here but it's now on my list of go-to places when I'm visiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginormous burger!

KjIk2XKc5eVi7CBejJrTRA.text: One of the best, if not the best barbecue joints I've been to in my entire life. Brisket was succulent and delicious, the Mac and cheese was perfect, and the desserts are just as good. Five stars.

crAwepBpY1Tf3D6jDovjdw.text: Unreal how amazing this place is. Best barbecue I have ever had in my life. My wife agrees.   EVERYTHING on the menu is so amazing! You just can't go wrong.

bu7zrDRGx5MYAqwewmvZ7w.text: After looking at their YELP reviews, we had to try this place. We were truly impressed by their food and great service, and yes, the food was unbelievable! We shared a combination plate that included brisket, baby back ribs, and hot links. We added the rib tips which were also great. The little corn nuggets were a big hit as well.  If I find my self in Las Vegas, this will definitely be on my short list of places to go.  They have a variety of sauces too.

jRwM41GIxPBvZGwskLsH8w.text: Best brisket sandwich ever!  I'm from Texas and I did not know this place existed. This is as close to home as it gets.

Jv6d_yHVMd_njP19fR-JQw.text: I went here on word of mouth, and, I have to say, this place is definitely worth it. I'm from the South (Georgia and Florida) and think this place is really close to my ideal restaurant. I got the pulled pork sandwich and a side of greens. Wasn't to keen on the hoagie roll (mainly because I'm used to pulled pork on hamburger buns), but that's inconsequential due to the fact that the pork was awesome. This is my main method of judging BBQ joints and they passed with flying colors. Added to that, the greens were perfect. If you've been missing collards, mustard, or turnip greens, this is a great combination of all three. Definitely check in first so you can get the dessert. I didn't but the server didn't mind adding the order, which was nice because of the consideration. I got the banana pudding which was good, but I would have liked to have had some bananas in it. Just preference, really, because the overall flavor was inline with what I wanted. Additionally, the service was very courteous and friendly. Overall, it would be really unfortunate to miss this place especially because there are so few good BBQ restaurants in this town. Check it out. This place is worth it.

dk9wi2_WpQzihvP5b5ER0g.text: Are you kidding me? A BBQ place CLOSED on Memorial Day weeken???? Memorial Day can just as easily be BBQ day and this place is closed. Wow. Sorry to say it's off the list

BPUODyOvPLleqGbItFCVhA.text: Best BBQ I have ever had.  Chef Holland was super accommodating to cater a small party.  Brisket & beans were absolutely the best.  Fantastic item not prominent in menu was the pulled chicken - melted in our mouths with amazing flavor.  Cole slaw is very spicy - watch out !  Potato salad was really tasty.  Did not get to try the ribs - next time.  Our experience with Rollin Smoke was just outstanding.

Y5hkzvflgqp-8VieqUpuKQ.text: This place was incredible!!! I like my BBQ with the sauce on the side so that I can taste the meat. The brisket was tasty, the pulled pork was great, and the ribs were outstanding. I saw an AYCE anything of the menu for $24.95. That could be dangerous for me....

sCj2lB37sdK9cGujnPb6wA.text: I visit LV every year and explore eating establishments away from where I stay. I had a taste for BBQ and decided to visit RSB because the reviews were excellent. I love good BBQ, Dinosaur BBQ in New York is fantastic, so is Woody's in South Central LA. When my plate arrived, I couldn't wait to dig in. I ordered a half rack of the baby backs and the bacon potato salad, beans and peach cobbler. The ribs were adequate, very lean but something was missing. The potato salad had bacon sprinkled on top, would have preferred that the bacon be mixed in. The beans were delish. The peach cobbler was inedible. I think I found 1/2 of a peach slice and the rest was a mixture of soggy dough. I spent $34 for my meal, which is outrageous given that I threw the cobbler away. At Dinosaur, the ribs are excellent and a 1/2 slab, cornbread and two sides is less than $20 and believe me, you'll leave with a smile on your face.

HH6GsgWoUPI8vjzndjuxzQ.text: Definately try this place! We went with a large group and everything was delicious. They even gave us desserts because we mentioned Yelp.

O9O0Qu7bUUU_S9uELg5ylw.text: Great food nice clean place! No real BBQ in Vegas and this place is it, let me tell you! Even got a chance to chat with the Owner and the PItmaster! They are both VERY proud of what they do and obviously use the best meats and veggies! FYI get the BBQ meatloaf! Friggin awesome!

MmB6Fc447tzZvdrwP6JkpA.text: Great pork but the Brisket needs a Lil work   but over all good food

eqSMu4EQ-fSVeydwzU8WbQ.text: Excellent bbq....like being back home in Missouri.   They know how to do it rigjt.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Prices are great for what you order.  Definitely worth a try...you'll be back!

uQm_WIq1X1KgDdB03ldkZA.text: We recently read yet another article giving Rollin Smoke a great review so we had to try it. I rarely give anything five stars but here I have no choice. I have eaten BBQ in many major cities and several states and this is as good as I've ever had. We shared a big dinner that included ribs, chopped brisket, burnt ends, potato salad, beans, and mac & cheese. Every item and I do mean every one, was as good as I have ever eaten anywhere, any time. It was somewhat heavy and greasy but hey, it's BBQ! If this were health food I'd have it 3 times a week...as it is, I will probably go there once every month or two and be happy. If you like BBQ you MUST try this place.

ryc-fTPWUbwc-phi_gki_Q.text: A friend had some Rolling Smoke BBQ catered for a party so I got a chance to try it there, but I finally made my way over to see the place in person.  It was even better in person.  I got a two meat plate with two ribs and sausage.  The ribs were smokey and flavorful.  The sauce complimented them well.  The meat was nice and tender too.  The sausage was smokey and delicious as well.  My friend got a pulled pork sandwich and loved it.  We each got the mac and cheese side.  The mac and cheese is a good enough side to have as a main course.  I also got the corn poppers, which are a must try.  They're delicious and addictive.  The staff was really friendly to me and everyone else I saw in there.  We ate inside, but the outdoor tables looked like a good spot to hang out as well.  The place isn't super fancy, but who wants a super fancy BBQ spot anyway?  When I think of BBQ, I want real good food in a good environment.  This place delivers both.  I will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

SAoOTScc7vyxPzShkGKpqg.text: Looks dodgy from the outside, but is absolutely amazing. Some of the best ribs I ever had, and really cheap. Perfect meeting place to go to with family and friends, very easy going atmosphere. This definitely was one of the highlights of my stay in Las Vegas!

Dxx-MSrUQTZYPpK3SjfQTw.text: We were in Las Vegas towards the end of Sept.  We were there in May also.  We ate at a lot of the very expensive restaurants.  Rollin Smoke was easily, easily the best meal we had at any price.  It was also the best BBQ any in my family had ever eaten.  And, everyone at the restaurant was friendly and gracious.  If someone offered me a free meal at Wolfgang Puck's Cut (we ate there also) or Rollin Smoke I go to Rollin Smoke.

ZlIfl3mXW9s7VSAYQsA0dw.text: What a Gem.  I am a Weekend BBQ ER  the food is awesome and the service was great too. I'm afraid this place is so so good that it won't be my secret anymore.

1HqqmZWc0LzCX3Pm44QVnA.text: I'm from LA and I'm coming to this place every time I go to Vegas.  This place is awesome.  Try their bake potato "fabulous!"

xigsghZDdDHnNWqaL0fumw.text: Being from the South it's hard to impress me with BBQ but this place has the best BBQ IV'E HAD IN A WHILE. Had the ribs and chicken yesterday for lunch and the Pit special tonight for dinner. Was great both days. Had a conversation with the owner's son yesterday and his dad today and who are the nicest men you'll meet. The owner also brought me one of the beef ribs to try and he was right. Best on the menu. Also had the Mac n cheese and the jalapeno cole slaw which is the best I've ever had also. Will be a regular stop on every trip to Vegas. Well worth the trip.

vYGPhqVJ2-ZtwKX3aN7OBg.text: Being from Texas, this city is seriously lacking good BBQ places, until now. Weird location but the inside was nice looking and comfortable. Everything was solid and I have my eye on the All you can eat option for next time. Do I dare?

WjXrIrtR_g6BWNaHxVwZYg.text: Best barbecue in Vegas! These guys do it right. Very Friendly and Awesome food.

CdUY-hXVYwm6nhZiS5tZQg.text: Reasonably priced and the food was great. Really is the best in Vegas for BBQ. Servings are pretty big, so expect to take a small box home. And the baked potato is the best I've ever had. However it is a meal on its own.

7V6HO0ib5-2HJWn7buFh9g.text: Best BBQ and amazing people! We tried almost everything on the menu. You must try the fried okra! They were so nice and friendly we will definitely be back.

wum8S6oFgoLhyldqB_EMxw.text: Top Notch!!! The food was amazing, service was almost better than the food and that's saying a lot. Dusty was super friendly. Being raised back east, it felt good to finally go to a restaurant and actually feel wanted!!!! Thank you guys! Definitely get the ribs and the brisket, melts in your mouth and the ribs fall off the bone, perfect amount of fat and the smokey flavor is unreal, you can literally taste the smoke before you put the ribs in your mouth. From start to finish just awesome, we will be back time and time again. Keep rolling out the great food guys, it's humbling to see people have a dream and follow it through.

h3d1N5FAGxlTCq0-AmPrpw.text: I'm going against popular opinion here but honestly, I've had better elsewhere.  I've eaten here several times and it's always been good but nothing to write home about.  I'm gonna go out on a limb here and say, Las Vegas has no good BBQ.  I'm still looking for that excellent BBQ, preferably baby back ribs.  My search continues for great BBQ in Vegas...

VnYDO9oKGun6kpEAvuPugQ.text: by far the best bbq place in vegas!  love their trio sliders! brisket and hot links are the bomb! + their potato salad!  staff and crew are very friendly and nice! good service! good food!

My wife had a spudtastic which was huge and delicious. She had it with pulled pork on it-- great choice. I went for the brisket dog which was amazing. It is a hot link with brisket, cheese, and a huge pile of fried onions. The service was great. The ambiance was, well, appropriate. Bottom line, I would go here again and again.

kXIaLMl0XeFC8rr3L9Dcww.text: Threw up a few times after eating here. The BBQ was good but they use a smoking enhancer that made me barf the next morning.

FFQJzaSrvbReSZueb4c0kA.text: I ordered trio meat plate with ribs, hot link and pork. They were all delicious and not dry! They also have 3 different kinds of homemade sauces. Owners are very nice! Best ribs place in town!

YoPzEkGJ23DzibatiUipYQ.text: ambiance//**** try not to be alarmed by the exterior or surroundings *imagine* 3 females wanting to try some BBQ late in the evening and stumbling across one of undoubtedly many of the town's ROW of gentleman's club to find this place yes i'm the horrible friend that cajoled the 2 others into satiating my carnivorism  while the exterior of this strip mall doesn't say much, the interior is a fun family oriented grub vibe with plenty of benches and long tables for big parties  service//*** the service was pretty much what you expect from a fast food type place  food//***** oohlala~ so their stuff is fall of the bone good and i like the spicy kick of their homemade sauce~ =9  you know the bbQ is good when two mostly vegetarian girls are impressed by how soft and juicy their meat is  everything was devoured...and the portions are decent sized i finished mine and my two friends shared an order ~*~ yelp finds me the best hole-in-the-walls!!  finger lickin' good~~ ;p

t9lG7OzVm8596JE8y97Twg.text: The food at Rollin' Smoke BBQ is awesome! My family and I were first-timers. We'd heard how good it was, so our expectations were very high. Rollin' Smoke met every single one of them. We all ordered different menu items but somehow we all wound up with the brisket, which was perfectly cooked. My husband isn't big on Carolina sauce, but he must've used half of the bottle while we ate. It was that good! I could've eaten a gallon of the Mac 'n' cheese all by myself. Which is a good sign because I'm very picky about Mac 'n' cheese.  I also could've eaten a gallon of greens, they were perfect!  There was so much food, I gave my leftovers to my brother. I think he may have finished them in the middle of the night.  Another thing I liked about this place was how friendly the staff was. Good food AND good customer service? Yes, please! Dusty was such a gracious person, I wanted to hang out with him and talk BBQ for the rest of the night.    We were a little nervous when we saw a line out the door, but once we finished eating, we understood why.  There is no way that food that good wouldn't have a huge line.  The only downside about this place is that it's in Las Vegas and we live in Los Angeles.  But from now on, this will be one of our stops when we're in town.

Sf4g47N9F0lc8iZ0DhyOkg.text: The food is unbelievable.... Once you try it you are hooked.... A must when you come to Vegas... Tried the rest of the BBQ places this blows them away !!!

_IALpAXGHNhREH4Z4RUUyA.text: This place loves hot spicy flavor!  I ordered a platter with ribs and pulled pork. It came with toast and a choice of side. I was hard pressed to find a side that wasn't spicy - jalapeno coleslaw and kickin' beans?! They let me substitute cornbread, and it was the best dang cornbread I've eaten in my life. So fluffy, so moist, so delicate, so smooth and sweet. Next time I need double corn bread! The ribs didn't have much of a smoke ring, but the smoke wasn't lacking and the rub was good. The sauce is spicy, but a perfect amount. The most impressive thing was when I asked for butter, they served me a container of warm melty butter, YUM!  My husband got brisket, which was kind of dry, but the seasoning was great, and it was perfectly salted. The loaded mashed potatoes were awesome, as if they mashed it using some of the bacon grease from the topping - so yummy.  Even my kid's food was good. The hot dog was a fat juicy meaty delicious thing, and he got hush puppies or corn nugget things that I couldn't stop stealing. The only thing he didn't like was that the cheese he ordered was spicy nacho cheese. No surprise.  This place is better than Dickeys, Road Kill Grill, and Famous Dave's, but Lucille's still takes the cake.

teAoAyN20gZ-XK9UejXm_w.text: Seriously good ribs prepared in a pit by a man who is passionate about cooking them to perfection John is an excellent host and the restaurant is very low key but it's all about the food here.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The low key exterior in a back street belies the sensational food served-inside by John.

e6LdNvxU1jb_qTGEVzVLvA.text: This place it awesome..if you are looking for real bbq this is the spot. Good prices excellent service. It's a little hard to find so make sure u have map quest. It is way worth the cab ride.

cvZK_eTQyHd3aJbyJHvPpQ.text: This is the best BBQ in town! Whenever I can in here for lunch. The line is always long but who cares! It's always worth it.

vi6bjDdeuSQXmxVPiqBy-g.text: The Beef Brisket Burger is absolutely delicious!  Lots of great items on the menu and they always have some specials as well.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.  It's an easy to get to location between the strip and the 15 on Highland.   I will definitely be back for more of the excellent food!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Beef Brisket Burger, delicious!

LoNIglTDKJS9fueae7aK0Q.text: BBQ Heaven....Wow....i am glad I stop by to have some bbq and it was very tasty and tender...parking was easy and the service was great...and the bbq was very tasty and juicy...oh yea and the bbq was very tasty and smoky goodness...  Can't miss this place with the huge pits out front....with delicious smoke coming out of them.....

WBnptjNR7-vsww1ObXqTHQ.text: Amazing. Absolutely amazing. People here are so nice. Brenda is amazing and the nicest person ever, the banana pudding is the strongest most delicious banana pudding you will ever introduce yourself to. The chicken wings are the best chicken wings you will find in Las Vegas. Just over amazing. Thank you Brenda and we will see y'all soon!

RHZ4BZ5GZ2ufkdVlC3t03A.text: The meat was pretty good it just needed salt. The sides were very tasty. We tried the ribs, pork & beef, pulled pork, brisket, links,and chicken. If you don't like smoked meat this is not for you. The portion sizes are not very big so we ordered the four meat plate and did the the ribs on the side. Check your order before you leave. So far, this is the best BBQ I've had in Vegas. I liked the ribs and the beans the best, but the yams and potato salad weren't bad. Mac and cheese was pretty good. Waffle fries my least favorite and they needed salt.

psLtEfkT-KJx3WJ-zkFBpw.text: GREAT  BBO  BEANS !!!!    this is a great bbq  place  I have been to many bbq places and this is one of the best, if you love bbq this is a must. one try and you will be like me a customer for life

5TjzWwgQQE0NR2vs9lVENg.text: Had visitors down on the strip so we went here for somewhere close.  And wow was I surprised.  The brisket was amazing.  The chicken and ribs where Ok.  When I go back,  because it's worth driving down to the strip just for this, I'll just get the brisket.  It didn't have much seating but the food is worth it, I'll eat in the car.

xRLPPGyICdgLcaRewXybnQ.text: OMG!  I am originally from Texas and miss very much the ability to get BBQ on every street corner.  This BBQ is as good as I am used to back home.   I had the pulled pork sandwich (tender as butter), the baked beans (spicy with huge chunks of meat), and the cornbread (incredible, not the least bit grainy with the perfect amount of sweet butter). The prices were reasonable, and the smells when I walked up were enough to work me into a feeding frenzy while I waited on my meal.  The service was friendly, and a bit disorganized, but in a very charming way.  You can tell that everyone there was very concerned that every guest was happy.  The location isn't the greatest, but any True BBQ lover will not let that get in the way of the only True southern cooking I've had in the 8 years I have lived here.  I am very excited to try more items on their menu.  I can't wait to go back.  Thank you for easing some of my homesickness.

nX_7gJNyojWtTh8GZTXZsg.text: This is hands down the best BBQ I've ever had!! I hs the "Outlaw" burger and it was amazing!!! The staff is friendly and truly treat you like family. If ever in Vegas, this is a must stop!!! I'll be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Outlaw&#34; Burger

7vpajOBYPkQ0uh7nGl0A7A.text: Spudtastic baked potato with brisket is always a winner for me. Get there before noon or after 1:00pm or you'll be waiting in line with the other hungry hogs. Great BBQ!!

It was so moist. Brought the whole girls volleyball team and their family there the next day and they also loved it. Will for sure go back when we're back in Vegas.

The conversation was kept to a minimal but the cashier wasn't rude at all just kept quiet mainly. The food was great ! But I have had better. The price was way higher than I expected. Overall it's a great place to try for a first time. Maybe my pocket wasn't so happy but my stomach sure was. I will say they had a huge variety of food on their menu

GSduAgWyilqYCUevZPkAjg.text: Happened upon this place when I was on vacation (11/2015) and wanted some BBQ, so I just Google best Las Vegas BBQ.  The place is a hole in the wall but the food is soooooo good! The sauces are really good. I loved the ribs, macc and cheese and the greens.   Would definitely recommend to anyone.
