uOLJTIDL-tTR6R60ytPyvQ.text: Best damn BBQ hands down! If you have any sense at all you will eat here!! Food = Amazeballs! Service = Equally amazing!

TkaWIAGfTKJxzm1j9KI52w.text: Delicious barbecue, fun atmosphere, crazy fish tank. Definitely some of the best barbecue in Las Vegas they've got a couple of locations this one is my favorite.

HPIihN-2AQwfOcE3XHWpLQ.text: So disappointed, we come here every time we are in Vegas and it's usually great, not this time we should have know when we walked through the door and everyone was sitting around with no food. 40 min went buy and still no food everyone is gathered around asking how long finally we were told it was an hour wait, if I had know that from the start I would have gone a different day. We got a refund and headed on out. Not a good day for Rollin smoke

JwB0x7iSsm9cTFIb8Qg5ng.text: Ok, been to both places now...old location (super charming for under the bridge) and the swank Pawn Plaza...um...I don't know how this could be, but the new place is even more incredible. Guys guys guys, get the ribs and they've got awesome craft beers in the can.   RIBS RIBS RIBS RIBS RIBS RIBS RIBS RIBS RIBS...

8mNcKCh9GXrg8LpKdfo9zQ.text: The food and customer service was outstanding at rollin smoke bbq.  Lizelle, who took our order was great...it was our first time there and she gave us a run down of the menu and provided samples.  Mom and the rest of the staff were great as well, always went around and asked how things were going with all their customers.   We had the meatloaf, ribs, chicken and catfish.  It was so delicious! The portions ... wow were large!   This place is in the most random location but it appears to be in a safe area.  I would come here again and I highly recommend it.

TLjT9gtcwZn8SPCyZv8s3A.text: One word:  Legit.  Being a southerner at heart and also from the DC area - this place is as close as I'm going to get to some straight up dirty BBQ in Vegas.  I would go to this place just to smell the beautiful, and oh so addictive smells and then head off on my merry way.  Mmmmhmmm.  I have to mention the cornbread right away.  No BBQ joint would be official without some fresh cornbread.  They've got it right and tight!  So right, that I ordered a ton of extra to-go for a party I was attending later in the night.  Even more right, that I asked for a sample while ordering..  Sad, but very True.  With all the smells, I was a little overwhelmed on what to order.  I had my sides figured out, but my main plate was hard to pinpoint.  I was experiencing one of those "eyes are bigger than your stomach" moments..  Oh wells.  After jostling the idea of ribs around for a few, I kept it real and went with the Beef Brisket.  Ribs are tricky and I'm incredibly picky, so I needed to start slow.  :)  No regrets there.  Flavorful and plenty to eat for leftovers.  They offer a few selections on the amount of grub you order, which was neat in my book.  Now, back to the ribs...  They have a variety to choose from cooked according to whatever region in the states.  Loved that!   Next trip:  RIBS!  As far as sides go, I was also a little overwhelmed in this department as well.   Never overwhelmed in a bad way.  I went all out with the fattiest of the bunch and had the Mac 'n' Cheese, Loaded Mash Potatoes and the Bacon Potato Salad.  Yes, BACON.  POTATO.  SALAD.  #WINNING!  The service was friendly and they even complimented me on being so small but yet ordering so much.  "Is this all for you?"  "Hell yeah it is.. C'mon now!"    Coolest part about this joint (other than the food, of course):  They deliver AND offer party packages where they'll actually wheel their smoker to your party and hook....you....up!   Whaaaaa?!   Rollin Smoke has my foodie heart forevs!    **This is a popular joint, which means.. lines, lines, lines.  Try to skip the food rush and go during a slower time of the day!  Don't get me wrong though, the long lines are worth it in the end.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled Pork and Fried Green Tomatoes.

11YPgRpe2Wjlt5SJuqZSwA.text: WOW. I Love and Hate this Place. I Love the Food. Probably some of the Best BBQ I have had. I Hate the Fact that I live in Rosemead and this place is in Las Vegas. Screwed Again. Portions was Very Generous and the Flavor was Top Knotch. Heck, even the Service was Outstanding. I may go to Vegas just to eat BBQ.

UgRWjK-jRC53ZUDdS7GzwA.text: We decided to check this place out after reading all of the super-awesome reviews.   The seedy neighborhood was easily overlooked when the smokey sweet smell of southern BBQ hit me. The line was out the door but no one seemed to mind the wait. The guy who took our order was a pro and very patient with our indecision and questions. Both the indoor and outdoor dining areas were clean.  The food didn't  quite match up to the expectations, sadly. The burger was pretty dry and the peach cobbler was pretty sad. The brisket was above average, but you could tell that the ribs had been sitting for a while.   Five stars for the service! Our server was attentive, helpful, and very friendly!   We're going to try again when they aren't so busy. Hopefully we just caught them on a bad night.

aFDuhVYywxGm-hX0g7GMAg.text: Good guys, good BBQ.  They are a small BBQ place and the guys there are all nice and attentive to your needs.   The meats were yum yum DAMN GOOD.  They are quite proud of being the little BBQ shop that is making a big name for itself in LV.    The location is definitely out of way, but is definitely worth it.

paeWMVMObgl_p1sYiebRTQ.text: Good heavens I wish my stomach could house more food. At least I got to the cobbler. You must get to the cobbler.

zcjisdKLJPziADEZvyn7mg.text: Some of the best BBQ I have ever had. The staff was azing and the Arkansas BBQ sauce is to die for. I hands down recommend this place to anyone looking for delicious, fall off the bone BBQ.

qLozmYVZmkIrUYqEkNaA8Q.text: What a great place! Not only is the food fantastic, but the staff is top notch.  Everyone was friendly, attentive, and we really felt like we eating at a friends house.  Jeannie went with the smoked white meat chicken salad and I went with the trio of brisket, pork and ribs.  Best bbq ever!  Finished the meal with peach cobbler a la mode.

egkkJSgvLIOjIPxbKtOk6g.text: Move over Phil's BBQ in San Diego and Lucille's of SoCAL, this place is rollin! The beef rib was perfect! It was meaty, tender and flavorful.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I will get ayce just for the beef ribs, corn nuggets and the banana pudding.

Nyu9fifOWraxWv1OHqIgkw.text: Amazing ..  So good. Lots of people here, but so worth the wait. It smells amazing and tastes even better

jN614FaUSDj2j6t1QkgAxw.text: Rolling Smokes Barbecue is hands down, the best barbecue restaurant in Vegas! 6DwI0rxhlAPeRuecjW0FtA.text: Im from Arkansas and this is the best BBQ period.  I brought my wife and baby and for $75 we ate all day and its not a buffet they cook it and bring it to you as you order .    YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!!!!                     GO HOGS!!!!

cq8P_StXvr7fxp1ENGtwgA.text: This place is right next to my work and i pass by everyday and decided to finally stop and try it and the food was amazing. Ill be eating here often and if your in vegas this is a must stop if you love good bbq.

HvxOacaqtpQVP50D5C52zg.text: I am somewhat of a BBQ snob. I've been all over Vegas and Henderson to BBQ places recommended by others. Each one a disappointment. I had the 3 meat platter, mac and cheese and a drink. My friend had the same and hush puppies. We both agreed we would have been better off with the "all you can eat" option. We had burnt ends, brisket, chopped beef, and ribs. The burnt ends were to die for. The meats melted in our mouths. The mac and cheese was good but watery. I wasn't a fan of the hush puppies. The place is quaint, the service was fast, the people were very kind. Finally, a place I will revisit.

EOFecBpXcF_LwZmkghApkQ.text: I was visiting Vegas and planning on driving here after looking at reviews.  But I pulled up the map on my GPS and found that it is around the corner from where I was staying at the Trump Hotel.  So we walked over, (which was a bit scary, due to industrial back side of the strip...)  Food was very good we had the 3 meat option.  I very much enjoyed the Pork, Ribs and Brisket.  This place also has a very good sauce.  It ranks better than anything in Utah, and you have to go to Texas to find something better.  The only reason I didn't say 5 was because of the Texas experiences I have had.

lkDxsihx7KDWoIWQGnTk4A.text: I love the food here, best BBQ in Vegas!  Every Saturday night I'm here and I've been meaning to leave a review for these guys.   Dusty, I love you man!  Keep up the good service!

Stv1iZuyWZluPJ97Mdlz2w.text: After hearing from a lot people about how great this place was I decided to give it a try...I have come to the conclusion that people are crazy.  1st the service was BAD, I ordered a meal for 10.99 and upgraded baby back ribs that was supposed to be a $4 charge and it came out to $38????? When I asked why, she said "I don't know I just put in what you told me and that's how much it is" ...then I said I wanted to change my order and she said it's already been made???  So then we get the food and it was TERRIBLE, baby back ribs should just fall off the bone, these were tough and a bit dry and the BBQ sauce was just not tasty at all...the cornbread tasted "ok" but was completely soggy on the bottom... Overall the service was bad, the food was bad and the restaurant was dirty, I guess I came in on the wrong day or ordered the wrong thing or everyone else is taking crazy pills???

YBSufVw_lQEi9Qf25Bdklg.text: A fellow BBQ nut that was visiting Vegas a few weeks ago told me about this place and that I had to try it out... So here I am on business and I found time on my last night to go. Wanting to try several things and leave my options open, I went for the $25 All you can eat.  It is not buffet, don;t worry, they ask want you want to start with and bring you more of anything on the menu.  I started with the brisket, pork ribs and the beef ribs my friend could not stop taking about.   These are not your normal small, barely any meat back ribs, these are short ribs, and contrary to the name, they are not short or small. These are the "Dino Ribs" and full of tender flavor. Enough of that, the Beef ribs were among the best I had, the brisket was a lean cut, I wish I asked for the moist / fatty , not sure if they have it, but that is what I try to get.  I found this brisket to be pretty good, tender & flavorful, I just prefer mine from "The Point" The Spareribs had a great flavor, the right 'bite', you do not want fall off the bone, many may think that, but the best have a bit of bite, but are also tender.  These were so. The service was great, the guy that took my order was patient, he may be the owner, not sure, but worked with me on my order to make sure I got want I wanted.  The servers brought out my food promptly and since I had the all you can eat, they refilled me with more brisket beef ribs at my request.

IKuPj_UXs_GT9AhQaV3cLA.text: Rollin Smoke is definitely worth the drive from wherever you may be in town. We ordered a whole rack of pork baby back ribs and the duo meat combo with pork and chicken. We had the waffle fries and a side order of sweet corn bread. Everything was amazing. I'm not usually one to write reviews of restaurants unless they are really good or really bad. This one was definitely worth the time. The ribs were fall off of the bone tender. The chicken and pork was smoked to perfection. And the corn bread was out of this world. If you ever get a chance please take the time to make a stop.

fAOOTDMLUh1ebV6qm9Plmw.text: holy. santa claus. s***. if you like bbq, you need to be here. now!  HIGHLY recommend the pulled pork - it's amazing.   The sweet country sauce is unworldly.

yMb6djw734La1TaI5nZ58w.text: All I can say is those darn corn nuggets are to die for!!! The beef ribs were tender and the hot links had a good kick to them! The service was great and the food was amazing! Will definitely come back for more whenever I'm in town.

P632U-ZJkrAy1TDHqnsWvg.text: Besides the amazing food .. Mitch was awesome he made our experience . He guided us Thur the menu .. All you can eat is a must .. Danny was also a doll..

pRZ8H5BAPHzKp-0OAZtzSQ.text: Been looking for some bomb BBQ seen I've moved to Vegas and RSB is the best I've had yet. I order their chopped brisket and it was seasoned pretty and the sauce they give to put on top of it was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TQl-1IaWhB2l3RakO_1iOA.text: If you love that smokey flavor...this is a must try. We got the sampler platter with brisket, ribs, pulled pork and chicken. All were good but I have had better in terms of texture (a little on a dry side for me) and a little on the flavor (minus 1 star). The really got the smokey part down where the brisket leaves the deep red rim below the charred tip.  For sides we got: corn nuggets -  which was yummy as I never had something like it collard greens - i loved it as it wasn't too greasy or cooked with bacon. Instead they used pieces of the smoked brisket to cook it in. Delicious and less guilty to eat. fried okra - never thought this was good but it actually was.  I wanted corn on a cob as one of the sides but they didn't have any which is the first I've heard at a bbq but since their other choices are good, i wont complain.   Cost: Very descent. For our 4 choice sampler, 3 small sides and a soda to share ALL for $19.99!! I'm happy with that!   Seating: Majority are in a big benches. Which you may have to share if it gets crowded. So for some you don't like sharing go when its not prime time or learn to be people friendly.   Parking: Good amounts of parking but not a lot. Location is good for the boys who loves strip clubs because this bbq joint is near and surrounded by most of them.

5eiMQwWkJia_iKoWWU6xqQ.text: Great food with a Backyard style home service

r233s-4gi-6tFxhv_jooaw.text: If yelp had a .5 star rating this would be 4.5/5...  This place maybe better than John Mull's even though I felt like Roadkill Grill was cheaper. It's weird but it's the similar pricing.  I had the trio of 3 meats with Hot Links, Chicken, and Chopped Briskit w/ Mac & Cheese. I also had their ribs as well.   Their hot links are good, their chicken is excellent but their briskit was firrrrrreeee!!!  Their ribs are excellent as well. Most def Top 2 BBQ place that I have been to in Las Vegas so far and the fact that it's so close to the strip (....clubs) makes it no excuse to not go here.

dsg2MpF0j_gNsqtzNIyMQw.text: We had five people, and Christal was terrific at helping us get the perfect meal. The sauces were out of the world, there wasn't a line, and the prices were totally reasonable. It was a delicious meal.

MyoIcY5BDnWaZbfOIFdf4A.text: Amazing BBQ for a decent price. This is a must stop here if you're in town and enjoy great BBQ. Great service as well.

CVGZjUyistzuisvvmBf3Xg.text: The food was freaking good! We ordered D's Delicious Sampler with some extra sides. Our favorites were the beef ribs, pulled pork, and mashed potato. The portions are large. The sampler easily fed two adults, one 7 year old and 11 year old. The kids loved the mac and cheese. This place is located off the strip and not in the nicest area. But, the food is worth it!

e-GseFuJDKDGhaRytybDnA.text: Wow!  Smokin!  OK, I must say I really like this place a lot and for a barbecue joint, it is the highest review I can give.   a. Location - WTF, I felt like I was driving to one of those back alley strip joints or toward that Erotic Museum.  However, I must say, driving there from the 15 Freeway was very easy!  Just in a very dingy area is all.  b.  Size - They must have increased size,  as I was expecting a really small place with like three tables and they seemed to have expanded next door with some bench like tables to sit good size parties.  I would say though, that the max they can have in this place is like 9-10 parties of various size.  c.  Menu - Pretty darn awesome if you ask me.  Simple to order and if you like meats you can make your own combo from the duo, trio or the Pit Special with a bunch of different meats. They even have large party size orders on the menu.  The brisket was great, the beef ribs darn good. I always order baby back pork ribs so these beef ribs were the right size and very tasty.  I loved the hot links and I did not care so much for the pulled pork, a bit dry if you ask me.    d.  Hot Sauce - On the table were two types of sauces, and neither was too hot.  I did use quite a bit on the pulled pork. I generally like a hot sauce. I did not ask them, and I wonder if they have it.  e.  Friendly - The owners and workers here are all very friendly, ask about their food and they want you to enjoy your experience.  That is such a cool added touch!  f.  Ordering, drinking and etc - You order at the front and pay, but they bring the food to you.  The soda fountain and the ice tea area are in a small and tight area, so if it is busy, it will be tough to get to.   g. Leftovers - They plenty of serve yourself plastics for any leftovers you have.  h.  The sides - Plenty of sides.  The potato salad was awesome. The beans were great, the corn nuggets were totally cool.  These were the only sides we had.  Results - Awesome finger licking food, great pricing and great service.  Loved it better than Famous Dave's and Lucille's. GK says check it out.

1yQck5j_2yuFiTe3Egvvww.text: It never fails this place always is on point like an elbow me and my wife decided to try out the the other location on canyon and i was super disappointed but we love this place so much we took a 20 min drive just to get some good grub! Food was hot and came quick and the sweet tea was to fire! Shout out crystal and the chefs (Louie, Kelly i think and Daren i think lol)  that worked tonight! They always show love and provide great customer service! If u looking to try a little of everything get the 5meat plate comes with 3 sides and 2 drinks less the. 40$.

l_ERudXLAEgBR0MWnEADRA.text: Pulled pork sandwich and waffle fries were wonderful! No complaints! We definitely made the right decision in listening to yelp reviews and coming to this establishment while in town!

MR-jO9f4462n3Rcw1V4McQ.text: July 21, 2014:  11:15 AM  Imagine waking up at one of the best hotels on the Las Vegas Strip and you've just had a great meal at a famous chef's restaurant the night before, but you're wondering what the locals eat.  You're wondering if a town like Las Vegas has local places that most tourists don't know exist.  If you're like me, you go to the source, Yelp, for good information, and Yelp came through in a great way.  On this date we found Rollin Smoke Barbeque, and it was a good, make that great, find.  It is a hole in the wall joint tucked into a strip mall off the beaten path, and, as of this review, it was averaging 4.5 stars after 455 Yelp reviews.  This is a very good thing, as Yelpers can be unkind and unforgiving on occasion.  Typically I look for consensus when using Yelp, and that is usually achieved after 100 or so reviews.  On our trip there were three of us arriving, my wife, my sister in law, and me.  Of the three, I was the most committed to the experience, and the other two were good sports.  After the food arrived, they were also sold.  We ordered so that we could try almost everything, as we got enough to share with each other.  We had beef ribs, pork ribs, chicken, jalapeno cole slaw, beans, potato salad, and, as its two days since we were there, I'm sure I'm forgetting something.  We also 'checked in' on Yelp, and when we did this they offered us a free desert.  We chose the blueberry cobbler.  If you are 'high maintenance' this is not a place for you.  You order like you're at Carl's Junior; stand in line, place the order, give them your name, find a seat, and they bring it out to you.  The room does not feature fancy table clothes or fine silver.  It does include a plethora of paper towels (on a roll for your immediate use), and a TV tuned to a sports channel.  In the room with us was a crew of air conditioning repair men, about ten guys, and the fact that they were there, locals, helped me know that this not a tourist spot, but a local's place.  The $40 worth of food that we ordered literally arrived in about four minutes.  It is important to note that we had attempted to avoid any kind of lunch rush, arriving before the lunch hour.  There were probably 10 other people already there, and I suspect that the lunch hour features a lengthy line.  Regrets?  Yes, just one.  I wanted to taste one of their links, but I didn't get the chance, but next time, and there will be a next time, I'll get one.  Las Vegas is many things, and there are a lot of really great places to eat, and, as in all big towns, there are some great locations off The Strip that you've got to find, and Rollin Smoke Barbeque is on that list.

2a2oYodX5ApbWNOankY7AA.text: My husband and I have had the hardest time finding a good BBQ place in Vegas...until now.   When you get out of your car and walk up to the door you are immediately hit with the most wonderful smell. Ordering happens at the cashier up front and the wait wasn't bad but considering that we went on a Saturday around 11:30am it probably gets incredibly busy later in the afternoon.   The lady taking our order was super friendly and she recommended trying the burnt edges brisket. They do have an up charge and I am not sure how much but it was totally worth it. I ordered the combo two meat plate: burnt edges brisket & chicken and for my side I choose the corn nuggets.   My husband got sliced brisket & chicken and his sides were Mac & cheese and collards.   The burnt edges were so delicious and I can confidently say way better then the sliced version. I would pass on the collards and the chicken. The collards were too salty for my taste and the chicken was dry. However, the Mac and cheese and the corn nuggets were excellent.   We will be back from some more burnt edges brisket and Mac&Cheese!

idUD1v2IPx7dnx5hDQx_gA.text: I tried their BBQ today and I got to say I loved the food! I specifically loved the flavored rice which comes as a side. The meat was tender, juicy, and flavorful. I highly recommend this place to anyone who likes BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M0tYAHnSWiXlX9sZ9FO9Ew.text: Chef Cory and Dan were just at a large Christmas event at axis theater and the food and service was absolutely Amazing! The chopped brisket was delicious and the Mac and cheese was also amazing!!! We are from Kansas City where it's hard to beat the bbq there and this was just as good!!! We will definitely be going back for seconds!!

gAj_rgkyYoPte70VvO57CA.text: One of our best finds this time on our trip to LV.  You know when food is good when you eat it at 1030 am and find yourself still talking about it at 10 pm at night! Amazing food. Juicy, tender and flavorful. Hubby had AYCE ...yes they do have that option for only $34.95. Fantastic deal as most buffet cost more than that in town.  The food here is brought to u as you order additional servings and not under heat lamps. My 3 kids and I shared the Rib plate with additional one beef rib and side of nuggets and  banana puddings.  They were so delicious but if I had to pick one meat....beef rib wound be it.  I dont like bananas but the pudding  got me hooked after I hesitantly tasted it that the kids asked I order another one since I ate it all.  Ooopss :).  More than enough food.   I think what is equally memorable @Rollin smoke BBQ is the customer service.  Not too many people can WOW me, but this team did.  Exceptional! Greeted personally and immediately as you step through the door.  Offered help to order if you needed it which I did. Christian was...an employee you want to hire for our business.  As matter fact..I would hire them all. They were crosstrained to do all off it.  Kudos to the management team.   As I sat eating, whether the staff was taking orders, delivering food to the table, making our icecream floats, going to eat table checking on customers or wiping off tables, they did it with a smile.  You can sense how genuine they were to want your experience at the place a great one.  A few customers including myself asked for forks and extra plates not knowing they were on a side table with all the sauces for the taking.  Since we were seated, Christian and his team would not only point to where the items were, they would say " no. don't get up.  I would be happy to get it for you."  You would have items on your table immediately. I felt silly for not seeing it as the dining room wasn't big but hthe staff genuinely didnt want me to have to get up... I mean such attentive service despite them being sooo  busy.   Food delivered quick and hot.  The staff cleans off the tables quick.  The staff truly have this down to a science.  A Definite "you must try this place". No disappointment here :)  Never walked out of a restaurant feeling "pampered." Lol!!!  Eventhough not your traditional buffet, it has got to be our favorite. I encourage customers to tip the staff.  I did as they truly provide 5 star quality service.

v95wkl_pSYKoKOSBpYRIZg.text: Omg! Mind blowing.  I didn't expect it to be this good. I had baby back ribs, spare ribs and burnt ends with corn nuggets.  Everything was seasoned right and juicy. Definitely coming back

pGcIXA6UAxhe9aaya9HEIA.text: Believe the hype folks the flavors & hospitality are the real deal straight up awesome sauce,  from the ease of ordering, super friendly staff, to the variety of sauces to choose from with the condiments we tried almost everything on the menu, catfish, mac'n cheese, dirty rice, pulled pork, brisket, hot link,  cole slaw, & more amazing experience, even if you need a ride back to your destination  they will HIT THE CAB button and a cab is there within a few minutes..  only issue was the dining area we had to clean ourselves dried sticky sauce on a very messy table , ( all over)  not a big deal but they could easily payed attention to that.  We scrubbed it down and got to grubbing.  A+ on the meal :)  the most I ate for our whole trip even bought some dry rub to take home... it's off the beaten path but worth the trip....

yio2b2z_yn2M4R0z6SUaHA.text: I searched best bbq in Las Vegas and this hidden gem popped up. When I first pulled in I was a little hesitant. It is right next to a strip club. Ordering is a breeze. We ordered 2 entrees and it came out to 40ish and some change. I got the meatloaf and omg it was such a heaping size and it was delish! I would come back! Service was great food was great everything was great.

sBPnpgABgOrGcYMHmXIfOg.text: Outstanding find in Vegas!!! All you can eat 35 bucks omg includes desert!! You got to try this place!  Off the beaten track but trust me you will love it. Burnt ends, brisket, beef ribs, pork, baby backs, sausage its all good baby!!

-W_RUQrhbkN9Aapf6Wd1tg.text: Omg- if you like good, authentic BBQ- CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!! The pulled piggy sandwich was beyond amazing. They have a variety of homemade sauces that are all super tasty you can't go wrong with any! The mac n cheese was literally the BEST mac n cheese I've ever had. Super glad we found this place and it's literally super centrally located. It was only a 3 mile drive from the MGM grand and the prices are beyond affordable compared to all the mediocre food at the casinos and restaurants out here. Super satisfied!!!

BOlV_FDmYsXqIPu2MV-IEA.text: Great Bbq!  Cured my hangover with each delicious bite.  Thanks to all the staff that fed us today!  Lizelle, Karina, Mitch, Cristian, and Yancey.  Been here about 10 times now and can't wait to come back!

yJtBDj-lXWuLAACm2sE_Qg.text: Very good food probably the best we had in Vegas. My wife had the meat loaf omg very good I had chicken, ribs and pork very good. We were very pleased with the customer service also staff was very friendly and thanked us for coming in very enjoyable.

Mwh87x-TElj6Ctx-jHUaQQ.text: This is some of the best BBQ you can get in vegas. Zero complaints about the food. The brisket is to die for, as well as all the side dishes. The only down side is that it is somewhat expensive. Good size meal will be almost $20, but you get a lot of food so it is well worth it. Also, expect to wait a while during lunch time, this place is very busy.

WDo7oGu5QM-UQL1HMFsSuA.text: This place is GOOD! AT least the rib tips corn fritters and beans anyway. Brought a friend who thought it was great too! So sad I haven't been here sooner, but so happy now :) I'll definitely be coming here for BBQ from now on!!

wuvD-Dg_l4ySu4In_Oo7IA.text: Let me start off by saying I am a BBQ snob.  I have had BBQ from all across the country and I like all styles.  I got the pit special - 4 meats and 3 sides.  I had no hope of eating all this food, but it gave me a good cross section of the menu.  For the meats - 1.  Brisquit - nice smoke flavor, good texture, but too dry for my taste.  2. Spareribs - nice smoke flavor, good texture, needs no sauce to be enjoyed - my favorite of the 4.  3.  Beef rib - beautiful bark, good texture, flavor was good, but needed sauce to be enjoyed.  4.  Last and certainly least was the chicken.  It was all dark, so I had high hopes, but I found it over cooked, dry (for a thigh) and pretty flavorless.  I can't recommend the chicken at all.  3 Sides - 1.  Kicken beans - not bad, but I am spoiled by Jack Stack beans in Kansas City - none other has so far come close.  2.  Bacon potato salad - just ok, a bit bland for me.  3.  Side salad with Chipotle dressing - my favorite side.  I would give this place 3.5 stars when compared to the other bbq I have had.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 meat pit special

agCp51eXdkFDJ6sVtJxnow.text: I can't give this place 5 stars because the brisket & sides were quite underwhelming. That said, the spareribs (naked, of course) and the bread pudding (flavored with Heath bar on this particular night) were absolutely to die for! Our server (his name escapes me, but he was a big Okie dude) was very personable & very knowledgeable about the menu. We'll definitely be back!

o5-JlN3dpH4hhuItYFIOjg.text: Literally the BEST BBQ in LasVegas..... Great atmosphere & Oversll excellent customer Service as long ass the girl with All the Tattos and Huge Holes in her ears isn't taking orders.... Several issues with her every time I go in there.... But! Hands Down! Best tasting BBQ in LasVegas Ive had everything on the menu besides the pork & the Sides are extremely good BIG BEEF RIBS tender as can be. All Meat is Smoked meat freshly never a bad day consistent great BBQ I been going here since they first opened and witnessed them grow. If you want NON commercial BBQ ....... Well ROLLIN SMOKE IS THE ONLY OPTION IN TOWN!

cAqfusQVSfU_Cb4T25FvSQ.text: good stuff!!!! ribs are tasty .. kinda pricey but worth it..... Keep your cup for free refill next time.

rdjAoj8jDOGqxnXEAZMa-g.text: Best BBQ I've had in a long time. My date and I did the all you can eat and boy did we eat. I ordered their brisket plate and the brisket was cooked to perfection. I also ordered their brisket nachos and they were delicious as well. Will make a trip to Vegas just so I can go back and eat there again.

jvzqvccrZUNOsA9GDYyAXg.text: Try beef ribs.  It is awesome.  Baby back ribs are ok but go with "all you can eat" style with 35 dollars and eat as much as you can.  Brisket is just decent but beef ribs (asado) will give you unforgettable taste and experience-!  Be ready to wait if you go during the peak time-!

YZ4b9nUbK5oHw4UIB2Y43g.text: Good stuff. Lived up to the hype. Had the rib platter and meat was melting in my mouth.

gWPQ947SHQdpCyxHQy81Dg.text: The most amazing BBQ I have had my lips around. It's right on par with Franklen's BBQ in Texas. SOOOOO GOOOOD!

FRP1CjrLGgxy-nWPjKizHg.text: We were in Vegas for our honeymoon and asked some locals about where a good place for decent priced food was.  It was hard to find, but once we found it we were thrilled!  We are from Texas, so we know BBQ.  I had the outlaw burger which was HUGE!  We should have just split it.  It had almost a meatloaf texture, but it tasted smoked and I had to eat it with a fork and knife.  My husband had a full rack of baby back ribs and they were as big as the beef ribs we are used to.  They were fall off the bone tender and we couldn't finish them.  We are big eaters but after this lunch, we skipped dinner.  The owners friend was the cook and he came out and talked with us.  He was super helpful on giving us pointers on what to order and what else to do while we were in town.  Everyone was nice and the food was great.  (it's three weeks later and I'm wishing we could go back for more).

OJwygtrz5-DeG-7iCI4x2g.text: Best bbq ever!! Portions are big and the cornbread is to die for! The staff is super friendly and very helpful.

XrmMvYRMPDuh_vUBgE3R5Q.text: Wowzers. The outlaw burger is so good it should be outlawed... Get it ? No. Kay cool.

wVQ1DGqoCTJsUx0lY-7g6g.text: I had one of my favorites, Catfish and hush puppy plate with a side of Okra and of course the sweet tea. Catfish= 3 tender, juicy, the batter is seasoned and light but satisfyingly crispy. Hush Puppies= bold flavor. Fried Okra=order it. Rollin Smoke is one the best BBQ places in Vegas!

8ECDVr513VBxoQJl2Fopfw.text: The fam bam loved it. Fast easy and delicious.  The hardest part was choosing what to eat on the menu cause we wanted everything!!!

BJARLw0T_RES5AeZ74NP8A.text: Good barbecue for Las Vegas. Not the best barbecue in the world but it definitely hits the spot when you're traveling in Sin City. I recommend the ribs, fried fish, and their greens are excellent. The location is a little bit sketchy after sunset but the interior design is pretty cool. The staff is always polite and helpful and their recommendations are pretty on point. The macaroni and cheese and potato salad aren't quite up to par with the rest of the menu. Overall it's a decent place to grab some barbecue.

UD-wPWGrRShfHeSXuOAqmw.text: This place has some of the best BBQ in town. The pricing is also reasonable.

333M6j5y2ki_Lp1-V15Obg.text: I love their Outlaw Burger! I always take my friends out of town here and they all love it.  Weird location, but awesome food.

1yJKeq86ub1BN5heZI-ZBQ.text: Some of the best BBQ on the West Coast hands down.  Them boys from Arkansas get busy on the grill.

C1LPHT5_eJp_kxBVobR4hA.text: No matter how hard I try, there is no way I can come close to the amazing beef and pork ribs I had here. Amazing smoke, juicy and tender beef with a crispy black crunch bark that can only come from heaven. This is my newest best spot whenever I visit Vegas. No alcohol but you know what? This little dive doesn't need it!

f9kasgdT9VwpvUXAMxSz9w.text: Decided last minute to try this place before work, first time and will definitely not be the last! The owner was very welcoming and accommodating. The menu is very diverse with lots of options for everyone.   The barbecue sundae with your choice of meat (I chose brisket) was extremely flavorful and had a great balance. The barbecue nacho fries also with your choice of meat was BOMB!! Words cannot describe how delicious it was.  Very impressed by this restaurant! Will definitely be back soon!!

zFvtuVoMnksM5gfizbMwtA.text: I BELIEVE!!! I BELIEVE!!! My first visit here, I was very impressed with their B.B.Q. My second visit, I was totally blown away!  I finally got the fellas at work to come here. I've been here before but did not have the honor to try their BRONTOSAURUS RIBS. The pictures left by some honorable Yelpers caught my gut. HOLY BAJAYZUZ!!! They are "DAMN GOOD!!!" The pictures of course do not do it justice. I get my combo. $13 well spent. This is all you really need if you're a beef rib connoisseur. They give you two Gangster Sized Ribs, a side (mine was the bacon potato salad), a slider bun, and a tasty cool beverage to wash it all down with on tap. The best DAMN BEEF RIBS I've ever had! They were freaken GIANORMOUS!!! Fall off the bone tender. I easily cut them off the bone and it looked like I had two big steaks. I cut off one nice slice and made a rib slider with the bun. I usually don't have trouble finishing my ribs, but these were like BRONTOSAURUS RIBS off of the Flintstones! FOR REALLY DOE!!!  Great service, great place to sit your phat @$$ to chow down, and AMAZING B.B.Q. Rollin Smoke B.B.Q. is blowing up. Keep up the great work guys!!! Will be back soon. I've been looking for a new go-to place for B.B.Q. I think I found my home.  EYE LIKA CHU PEOPLES!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So GANGSTER!!! I&#39;m a believer!!!

ojUAnbwnqeZquuiAWkg4fw.text: Brisket was really good and I love the sauces, but the hot link was overcooked and a little tough.

Nbb3QPRtJJj9gIIxacKXnA.text: I would actually give this 3.5 stars if I could. We were in Vegas over the long Thanksgiving weekend and had been craving some good BBQ. I found this place doing a search for "Best BBQ in Vegas" and this was a top contender.  I ordered the Brisket sliders with BBQ beans & my husband ordered the Brisket and mashed potatoes. A friend of ours ordered the ribs. My daughter just ordered a hot dog and Mac n cheese as she's not a huge BBQ fan. (Weird kid) The brisket itself was pretty good. The BBQ sauce wasn't that great at all though.  I would pass on the sliders because the bread was so greasy that I ended up just taking the meat out and tossing the bread. The beans were great. A bit spicy, but I love spice. The Mac and cheese & the cornbread were pretty good also.  Overall, it was good. I can't say for sure if we'd go back or not the next time we're in Vegas, as I think we'll continue our search for amazing BBQ places (which by the way, the most amazing BBQ place is in Austin!)

GB1Lm_i2CBboYE3Wrz_DoQ.text: Best BBQ I've ever had, the wife and I stumbled upon this gem on yelp. The reviews were great so we decided to try it. We fell in love with this place. ZFjd0xiGoyw_s1WdEGBQ9Q.text: Some of the best restaurant bbq I have ever had!!! There was a nice smoke flavor to the meat and the sides were a decent size. I would definitely eat here again!

atxvdGAWw68VZYWFVJfcvg.text: Yes, yes, yes!  Now I usually don't like to buy BBQ, cause my husband has his BBQ business.  But we've been hearing so much about this place.  We have a friend that works in the area, we called him to meet us there.  Well he knows the owner well.  Our friend didn't get to eat with us, but the owner chit chatted with us, and then told the cashier to give us 20% off.  That was cool, so I got cat fish with fries, and my husband got a combo BBQ plate!  Yes, I loved the cat fish, yes, I loved the ribs, sausage, and the brisket! Only thing we weren't crazy about were the sides!  I had Mac n cheese, it was kinda weird, I've never had it like that before, it was creamy mac n cheese, with some sprinkled cheese on top!   And we didn't care about the potato salad.  Just give me some corn on the cob, and I would be good.  But service was good, the owner was really cool.   I could see us coming back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Catfish  and mac n cheese!

dgt3tSspCAx6XdTO1pceMw.text: You know it's going to be an unforgettable meal when you smell the smells here. The aroma of meat tended in a loving way greets you upon approach, beckoning you to come inside and choose your savory adventure. Luckily, we had 5 adults in our party, so we had occasion to order the sampler and try EVERYTHING. Best. Day. Ever.   All of it was good. The meat could stand on its own, prepared to perfection. Smoky in flavor, and complimented (not masked) by the accompanying BBQ sauce. The fried catfish was perfect; no soggy breading, beautiful sauces on the side, just right. We tried the spicy sample. Some laughed. Some cried.   In a day when chain BBQ is the norm, finding a gem like this feels like discovering Atlantis. You can tell the people running this business love their work because both the chef and the servers asked how we were liking the food and toured the dining room to ensure the same with other guests.   10/10 for THE BEST BBQ in LV, 10/10 for the service and welcoming atmosphere - will DEFINITELY come here again.

VjXSg7NtGjz0sW1Q7IFnkw.text: oh my gosh disregard my last review, order the nachos! Waffles fries with brisket..... I am never ordering anything else off their menu. Their nachos were AMAZING.

qu8KXJPphucOjMyROcwvcA.text: Rollin' Smoke has been getting a lot of online press the past few months and I finally got a chance to try them out. The raves are correct. The place is amazing. It is by far the best barbecue in Vegas and some of the best I've had anywhere.  When you pull up into the parking lot, you can see the smokers outside. When you walk in, the smell of barbecue is in the air. The place is inviting and the staff (and owners) are very nice and genuinely proud of their food.  I got the trio platter for $13.99 which includes three meats, a side, and a fountain drink. I chose pork spare ribs (ribs+tips attached), beef brisket, and pulled pork, with mac&cheese as my side. You get two spare ribs as an item in the trio. Other choices were 1/4 chicken or links. It's quite a deal!  The pork spare ribs are amazing. Meaty, well-seasoned, great smoke ring, and the flavor was unbelievable. The brisket was quite good and the pulled pork was tender and flavorful. I wish I would have eaten the brisket and pulled pork before the spare ribs though, because the more delicate flavor of those meats was overtaken by the taste of the ribs.  Midway through my meal, I heard someone order a beef rib. I LOVE beef ribs and it's very rare that a barbecue place serves them. So I had to get that too. $6.99 for a rib, but completely worth it. It is intensely beefy in flavor and gets more and more juicy as you eat it. Sort of tough on the outside, but near the bone it was beyond anything I could have hoped for.  I was so impressed that I was texting my friends all through my meal. I ended up ordering almost $100 of barbecue to take back to my friends. It has been a week now, but my phone still smells like barbecue. One of my friends ordered some smoked hot links, so I got to try that as well and they are really good. I usually scoff at ordering links at a barbecue place, but these were special.  All told, I tried every meat on their menu except for the chicken and the smoked meat loaf. The pork spare ribs take home the ribbon, but everything else was not far behind. My friend's beef ribs did look much smaller than the one I got and he said it was dry all the way through, so ask for a big hefty one to make sure it's tender.  For side dishes, I would not recommend the mac&cheese. It wasn't that good. Other tables had jalapeno cole slaw, bacon potato salad, fried okra, and hush puppies. All those seemed to be well-liked.  The barbecue sauce is made in-house and is very good. It might be very slightly too sweet for my liking, but I order my barbecue with sauce on the side anyway, so I didn't mind much. They also make a spicy barbecue sauce which you can request.  Oh, they also have a buffet option. For $25, you get unlimited everything on their menu. If you like beef ribs, two beef ribs are $15. Eating four beef ribs and a side already puts you ahead.

3nDFfzSYnuP_DrEDbAJiTw.text: This is probably my new favorite BBQ spot in town. It's in a sketchy part of town, almost under an overpass, but that's how you know it's great food. I ordered the baked potato that came stuffed with BBQ brisket and beans, honestly the best baked potato I've ever had. I couldn't put down the fork until I was done. I totally recommend this spot to anyone who loves BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked potato stuffed with brisket and beans

t3EsPTfy_3BqmAfH5HrOCA.text: Killer spot. Sketchy looking location at night; but don't let that fool you, the food is legit. My wife and I both went to school in the south and always love when we find good bbq, and this place is top notch.   The burnt ends are amazing. Excellent smoke flavor, excellent rub on the ribs. Just a solid bbq joint that delivers (consistently if you read the reviews).   Good work guys!

0j93XAUnxc4GiPep9kVhGg.text: Was not impressed Pulled pork was dry & brisket did not taste seasoned at all Im not sure why my experience varies so greatly from the 4 & 5 start reviews but it certainly was not worth the price I paid

DnYzcYZOuZUFK3XmvcDRaw.text: HANG UP THE PHONE! I found this total hole in the wall on Yelp, and BOY Im glad I did!  Hubbys from Texas and cant find decent brisket here despite many a valiant effort.   Until now. Heres the scoop:  This place is tucked behind a strip joint in the seedy area behind the mirage on highland drive.    In fact, if you're squeamish about going to the hood, you may want to come at lunch time rather than dinner.   If youre from out of town, dont expect much in the way of atmosphere. The decor is minimal. There are six tables total in the small front room, and maybe 6 or 8 inthe small side room.  .   This place belongs on diners drive ins and dives for sure.   Service was ok. At times we had to wait a few minutes for servers to emerge from the kitchen. However, When they werent cooking, they were polite & personable.  Despite all of this, the rating is five stars for the food alone.   This food really is off the hook.   1. Biggest beef ribs ive ever seen and thats not an exaggeration. 8oz of beef on each one at least. Sooo tender .& juicy, and the sauce was perfect  2. Best brisket in town, hands down. TENDER, MOIST, unlike at every other wannabe bbq place in town.   3. The fried okra was the best ive had this side of the mississippi, OR north of the mason-dixon line. I dont like okra if its not perfectly cooked. This was. I was frankly shocked!   4. Jalapeno coleslaw was very good if a bit hot!  5. Blackberry cobbler was pretty good. I enjoyed it.   Portions are good sized & filling.  Note: Theres a soda machine tucked in an alcove thats hard to find. At first we thought all they had to drink was sweet tea with no ice lol  In short: if youre from the south and are craving authentic bbq, this place is worth the trip. Oh, and the prices are HALF that of lucilles bbq. Five stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The biggest ribs ive EVER seen!

8at9omp2rVZzCEzIzh1M2w.text: The outlaw burger is fuckin fire my g! I suggest doing a takeout order instead of dining in esp when the summer hits...It gets crowded asf...I see why tho

CMgwws_kZBOSgwCfi7M4rA.text: All the hype is REAL. Excellent BBQ. Numerous sauces to try. Friendly and helpful staff. Best of all, you get a great bang for your buck. We ordered many items and tried almost everything on the menu. Beef ribs fall off the bone. Hot links were delicious (but spicy). The chicken breast was a bit dry though. Next time I'll get dark meat instead.   Definitely swing by this joint the next time you're around. You won't be disappointed.  Cheers!

f62ifXds-9thQnK3cEiUSQ.text: Fantastic BBQ, one of the only barbeque restaurants I've eaten where the meat is flavorful enough it can be enjoyed without being smothered in sauce (although their sauces are quite good too, they have 6-7 ranging from sweet to very spicy). Fun dining atmosphere with different picnic tables in a surprisingly large eating area for how small the building looks from the outside. Good location that's right off the freeway but not on the Strip. Definitely will be coming back!

The inside is very nicely decorated and the staff was very nice and helpful. The fries and Mac and cheese sides were amazing and the country sweet sauce was my favorite. I really enjoyed my sandwich smoky flavor and adding the sauce just perfected my lunch. I will definitely be back to try more dishes!!

WLlVJKFf9I2rfxgMFmZ3kg.text: Great BBQ restaurant. All the meat we tasted was tender and cooked perfectly. I enjoyed all the different choices of sauces. The only thing I wish is you could taste the "smoke" more in the meat. The beans were very flavorful.

JAcKtidxIGZuqz7VQ1vAaA.text: Very good barbecue! Spicy sauce available if you like it that way (I do). Pro tip: there are TWO locations for this barbecue joint, and per the locals you should definitely go to the one on Highland, instead of the one on the Strip. Word is, the one on the Strip is way touristy, smaller menu, maybe even a tad pricier.... Anyway, line out the door here and ALL locals except for our group. I would for sure eat here again!

HpjhKYS8J_bqBIRsVlGxOA.text: If you do not want to go all the bbq places and more of a mom and pop feel, definitely a must try for people out of town. An awesome bbq spot for locals as well who love bbq.   So this place is located minutes away from the strip and you probably would not be able to find it, not unless you drive by a lot near the S Highland area. I actually randomly got this as one of the places to try, so as usual, my fiance and I were curious. After looking at the pictures and with the reviews we had to check this place out.   We arrived around 2pm, and luckily there was no line, and the lunch crowd was gone. As you walk in, there are two doors. One door appears to lead to the back section of the establishment, and the other door leads you to the register and main dining area. They have lots of room to eat, however during peak time you probably can imagine to come when they are not busy.   The menu: pretty extensive and lots to choose from. What I loved about the menu was being able to choose from 3 meat to 5 meat, and boom the ONLY bbq place in Vegas that does all you can eat bbq for $35. Their sides also were awesome ranging from the waffle fries down to their bacon potato salad. Their drinks, oh my, they had Kool-Aid not just for the kids, but for those adults who grew up with it. Prepare to be brought back to your happy place down your childhood memory lane. Last, but not least, the desserts, fairly priced, and nothing but that southern hospitality to top the icing on the cake. They have peach cobbler and banana pudding!   What we ordered: after long contemplation, we decided to have the 5 piece meat. This is The Pit, on the menu (contains: chicken, hot links, ribs, brisket, and pulled pork) and you pick 3 sides. We got the collard greens, bacon potato salad, and the waffle fries. They were extremely fast and attentive, which makes the experience better. After waiting for a good 15-20 minutes our food was brought out.   The taste: 5/5 omg the ribs, by far the most juiciest, yet tender, and perfectly seasoned you do not even have to put their house made bbq sauce on it. Although, you can add the sweet country girl sauce to it to add a sweet kick and some tanginess it. This honestly makes you want to try the all you can eat. The brisket and pulled pork, tender and smoked to perfection. Hot links, spicy and juicy all around. The chicken, it was juicy, only thing is it could of been cooked longer and possibly a bigger portion. As for the sides, the waffle fries were awesome. Almost had a Cajun seasoning taste to it and you can never go wrong with these. The collard greens was 3/5, I was hoping for more bacon grease to add that I cannot stop eating feeling. The bacon potato salad, 3/5, it had that egg taste, with a little bacon and I think the bacon overwhelmed the taste of the actual potato salad. Possibly, more onions and a hint of relish would of made it more mouth watering! Loved the concept as no one cannot day no when you see bacon and potato salad all in one.   Overall, great first time experience! Hoping to be back as we were unable to try the dessert and want to try the all you can eat. Hats off to the cooks in the kitchen, as it can be hard to please two people who love to eat and love bbq. See you soon!

TH0qWhV9D0sZVLpzw6vyYg.text: Went here based on strictly dumplings review. Customer service was amazing. Seriously, everyone from the cashier to the guy that brought us our food were super friendly and attentive. We went this morning around 1030am. Not crowded since they had just opened up, but by the time we left the people were starting to roll in. Now for the actual review:  GOOD - the beef rib was very tender and had very good flavor. They just pulled off the bone just right. Ordered a side of collard greens and enjoyed the flavor and texture. They had various flavors of coolaid to choose from which was neat. Plenty of different sauces you can try. Portion size was pretty good. Not massive, but a good value.   BAD - Now the part that pains me to talk about. The special came with pork spare ribs which were dry. Not a little dry, but borderline dried out. I sauced the heck out of it, and it did not help. I am slightly perplexed since the beef ribs came out very good. I'm going to assume the pitmaster had an off day on the pork ribs. If thats the case, they should not have served them.   The cups they give you to put bbq sauce in are very small. If they had med size ones that would have made things easier rather than filling up a bunch of small ones.  OVERALL - I would come back again. I would give the pork ribs another try. Overall, very good service, clean and food was good(excluding the pork ribs). Highlight is the customer service and friendliness.

mD25oLP6aVDlcd_JK0FqNA.text: The best BBQ I ever had was on tour in Arkansas, so its only fitting that I finally find a BBQ place in Vegas I'm 100% happy with, and where are they from? Arkansas! They get everything right: the meats, the sauces, the sides. And the service is great.

I had pulled pork salad.

mRbNGyHH9o4nqyYwzDgzbw.text: Found this hidden gem by accident, after reading many reviews. When we got into Las Vegas, feeling hungry, we wanted to have a fulfilling meal, a really good meal and worth the visit. Glad we made the right choice. Ordered the Pitt and it was so delicious, beyond words. Perfectly smoked ribs, beef brisket, pulled pork, hot links, and chicken... all tasty and perfect. Not forgetting their sauces, my favorite was a mixture of vinegar and spicy sauce as well as the sweet country girl. Sides were green beans, smokin bean, and waffle fries. Service was excellent, friendly staffs, and fast. Not to mention, their Arkansas special housemade dessert, cherry coke berries with nuts was marvelous, my first time having it. A definite come back place in Vegas.

h8cUyh9ksWY5Zyx-l1KZBg.text: Nice hole in the wall joint. The kids at the front counter were polite and helpful - felt really like a family owned joint. 09OLBJZq9siSqx4OiZereA.text: First time here. Cool little local spot. Nothing fancy about the inside but also very local homey feeling. I like it, walking in you know you're about to eat some delicious bbq. You order at the counter and food is brought out to your table.   I ordered the 5 chicken wings in the spicy sauce. They're whole wings so it's quite a large serving. The Wong's don't come with sides but you can order those separately. The one regret I have is not asking how spicy it was, she asked if I wanted buffalo but I opted for the spicy. Now I know why she asked lol. The spicy is reaaaallllyyy spicy. I could only eat 2 wings. It was good but holy hot!  And I eat spicy. My thai food orders are usually a 8 out of 10 or 4 out of 5. I order everything hot. If I come back I will not be ordering the spicy, it's way beyond what I can handle.   The bf ordered 3 meat plate. Baby back ribs, hot links and pulled pork. They were all very good. I had a nibble of each. The side of Mac was also very delicious. I had to steal his slice of bread because my mouth was on fire lol.   I love all the sauces in the side. The vinegar is great on the pork, the mustard base one was great on the wings and the Arkansas was good on everything. Regardless of the lava level spice on the wings it was still very good.

ibLT5JTVYhsR9wPX9hy2og.text: Firstly, I'm NOT a foodie, but I have good taste. I'm picky and rarely crave things. BBQ has typically been good once every couple weeks for me but I've never had any BBQ in Las Vegas that wowed me like Rollin Smoke did/does. I literally have dreamt about it. Woke up earlier today and my mouth was watering from thinking about it, and I can't remember that happening in years. I do enjoy good food; can't stand fast food more than once or twice a month and generally the only meats I really eat on a regular basis is beef, chicken and turkey. Not huge on veggies unless they're prepared well. Anyways, on my first visit I ordered the chopped brisket and the 1/4 white chicken with loaded mash, fried corn nuggets (I think that's what they're called), mac n cheese, and cornbread. Everything was unbelievable. I went back a couple days later to make sure it was really as good as I thought and it was at least as good as (or better) on the second visit, I think because I was more familiar and confident with the menu. The superb rating score and reviews are completely accurate. It's a little expensive but it is incredible worth it. It does close a little early on the weekdays as well, but I'm a little bias because I work nights/grave and am typically eating my first meal of the day around 3-4pm so it's hard for me to catch a REAL full meal there, except on the weekends when I can come in at 9:30 and not feel too bad about being the last customer. More specific on the food: (just because I don't mention something DOES NOT mean it wasn't exceptional, I'm just elaborating on the few things that completely blew my mind...) The brisket was equal to, or better than any I've ever had (I'm a world traveler and been everywhere that is worth going to) and the cornbread was without a doubt, the best I've ever had. The corn nuggets also deserve an extra mention as well. Even though I'm not very adventurous, I'm thinking that I could probably order anything here and love it. I'm sure I'll try other items on my upcoming visits, as Rollin Smoke probably is now officially in my exclusive 'twice a week minimum' rotation. If you're really hungry and haven't been there before, the "All You Can Eat" for like $35 is probably a good choice, as you can try any and everything and $35 is really only about $10-12 more than you would spend on one of their smaller meals. IF YOU'RE A LOCAL, MENTION IT AND GET A DISCOUNT !! Also if you have an event to cater and BBQ is an option... Rollin Smoke will make an extremely good impression and will be the star of the show. And their stuff doesn't get cold quick and lose its texture like so many restaurants that cater. I can't think of a better place to cater a non-formal event.   By the way, I don't write many reviews. Only the absolute BEST OF THE BEST, or any horrendous experiences that have no possibility of redemption. But I'm seriously mad at myself for not trying Rollin Smoke sooner. I've been wasting my life away (hah)

Z29oDPSTz9fowboB5a2JrQ.text: Located on a street lined with strip joints and tucked away from the strip lies amazingly delicious BBQ at Rollin Smoke BBQ. Service is so warm and friendly here. The way it works is that you order your food and then they bring it to you.  There's also an all-you-can-eat option, which is characteristically Vegas! There's no limit in the all-you-can-eat option. You can eat anything that's on the menu -- bbq, burgers, sides, etc. I couldn't bring myself to do it, so I opted for the three combo plate. It comes with one side and I just added another two more.  It was a hearty meal shared between two. The baby back ribs were an extra charge but we had to do it. It was smoky, flavorful, and tender. Rollin Smoke has bottles of homemade bbq sauce. There was a sweet and spicy one that I really liked but can't remember the name of!   We also got brisket. I ordered it chopped because you get the option of chopped or sliced. Looking back, I wish I got sliced because the chopped brisket was more so shredded brisket. I wish I was able to have some more texture to my brisket! Nonetheless, still good.  We also got hot links, which were nice and spicy. The sides we got were mac and cheese, corn nuggets, and potato salad. The potato salad was okay. The corn nuggets and mac and cheese, however, were so delicious! I am a mac and cheese aficionado and I want to steal their mac and cheese recipe. It was so cheesy, creamy, and satisfying! The corn nuggets were deep fried creamed corn. They might've been my favorite side order! I highly recommend their mac and cheese and corn nuggets. I don't know where else I can get my corn nuggets craving.  This will definitely be a routine stop whenever I am in Vegas! If you love bbq, you've got to try this place out!

E2BksXEnfYLnrUVWYBWCHA.text: This is our go to stop whenever we are in Vegas. What a delightful and wonderful experience from the family to the food. All the sauces make memories for everyone in the family.

_IZ25NWNO6AnUJulYpy9BA.text: Rollin Smoke was our first stop in Vegas & definitely don't regret that decision. This place will not let you down! Perfect place to fuel up after a long flight in. Very authentic bbq smokehouse vibe. We got the three meat plate with pulled pork, brisket and ribs- all of which were phenomenal. The corn bread was to die for. Mac and cheese and bbq beans were also top notch. They have an awesome variety of bbq sauces as well. The service was great - everyone was so nice & there is plenty of space to sit.

lkkR9oi3UoVaEa3OeOoSEQ.text: We came here on a Sunday; made a mistake by walking from the Wynn. Catch Uber or taxi you won't regret it. It was further than I thought plus area we walked through was a bit shady. However this is probably the best barbecue joint I've been too in a long time. Great sauces to choose from and the brisket was on point. Ribs and sausage were delicious.

7D3rr_jVVockUnFe50AcYw.text: They do have a good menu and good BBQ when not sold out (i do usually come around closing time) and the beef ribs are Great!

lonPaeHa5f22x5CxcPfQBw.text: The best BBQ I've had in Vegas.  Truth be told, I haven't had many options, nor do I think I want to; nonetheless this place is really good.  I typically judge a place by their beef ribs. Yes it's tough to screw up because it's such a great cut, but these guys do it right.  It's so tender and fall off the bone, but still holds it's shape.  Their sliced brisket is just as tender.  The hot links is always a favorite of mine.  Whether they make it in-house or not (not sure), it's still good.  The space is a little weird, stand in line, then find a picnic table to get your meat on.  The sauces are good, I like the spicy.  They compliment the bbq really well without being overwhelming.    I've had bbq all over the country and this is definitely one of the best I've ever had.

W7fTJJjw_s3tX4VE3aEhnw.text: Closed by the health department... take a look at dirty dining. Sad that had to happen, not surprised when I was there things where a bit sticky. Not sure I can go back.. they keep taking my review down. I have.   Now I'm getting flack on my review because they couldn't keep the place clean...lol   Like I have control over how they choose to run there business

G2W3nopVRBl-Y4zttQT6_w.text: This place is a must. One would never know it since it a small place in an industrial area. The prices are decent since it is a BBQ spot. There is a small parking lot and plenty of street parking.  We ordered the platter that contained chicken, ribs, pulled pork, Tri tip ends, and 2 sides. We were able to share between my wife and I. The meat fell off the bone and was super tender. For our 4 meals and 4 drinks  it came out to a little over $100. Food was delicious! W all had left overs since the portions are pretty big.

xRh2gW7yQVWEc9YBFgzzUQ.text: Oh what you thought i forgot about y'all? You thought the inglorious one faded to black like an underappreciated Jay-Z documentary? Look i was just galavanting doing life, i was gon' get right back. Anyways no introduction needed, but you in the presence of Soapy Knuckles whatever whatevers, aka Brisket Baron Davis, aka Steak Fries Steelo, aka the Baby Back Boss Hawg back with that heat rock for ya and today we talkin Rollin' Smoke BBQ in Vegas.  First off this joint not on the strip, so to get there i had to cross the red sea, commune with a tibetian monk, and solve like 50eleven riddles just to grace their doorway with my presencr. Once you get there tho, aint no games are to be played. You know this place real cause all the cats who work their look they been through some thangs in life, and put all that love, heartbreak, triumph, and disappointment into the meat they chef up for you. I don't want to taste no ones bbq that aint been the storm and the rain. Every bite of the rib tips felt like an intrusion into a therapy session... but like a session where they had delicious life changing bbq, and overly accommodating people.   I got the trio-meat plate, which was wild ambitious cause between the beef rib, spare ribs, rib tips, and greens w/brisket i didnt have room for my peach cobbler (but you damn right i ate it, cause momma aint raise no quitter). The best thing was the rib tips, the fat to meat ratio was perfect, cause literally felt like you threw it in your mouth and it started melting. The sauce? Pro tip: Mix the arkansas sweet and the spicy, i call it the femme fatale. It does a fantastic job of letting the meat talk that cash, but also making a statement on its own. The beef rib tasted like dreams fulfilled. Like if you could be Tom Brady for a day... minus the butt chin and being unable to dance and being a cheater and having to live in Boston... okay so nothing like Tom Brady, but you get the point.   This is what two straight 5 Durag reviews from me? *checks to see if Trump still in office* nope, nevermind im not dreaming and neither are you. Look man, i had to come through and give yall something to chew on. Go there, eat it all and tell em the Villainous one sent you.  #VillainsVittles   Score: 5 out of 5 shimmering durags.  Follow me on IG: @jothamkitara

J40PgDncbcUvzwEIO8zVQw.text: Solid BBQ not from the 3 BBQ capitols of America! I had the Burnt ends, brisket and sausage combo for $17.99. I'd say it's worth the trip off strip to eat here!   Burnt ends gets 4 stars Brisket 3.5 stars Sausage 3.8 stars Barbecue sauces 4 stars Corn nuggets 4.5 stars

o3PTbRJedDJ5Bx1koLzwWw.text: The bbq here was amazing! My boyfriend and I came here with our friends right after a music festival that literally drained the life from us. We wanted to eat somewhere that's savory, delicious, and popular of course! We originally saw this place on YouTube, through a food blogger. There's an option for "all you can eat" bbq, since Las Vegas is known for that right? At first, my boyfriend wanted to try AYCE, but after seeing the portion size, he opted out, lol!  Let's get started with the portion, they do not skip on the meat! Our baskets were fully loaded and made fresh to order. I ordered the baby back ribs, which fell off the bone. My boyfriend ordered the burnt ends, which had a nice char and crunch to them. Our sides were corn nuggets (these were so good! ), corn bread, yams, and criss cut fries.   The yams were sweet and delicious, makes my mouth water just thinking about them. The corn bread was soft and packed with flavor. The fries, not as crunchy as I thought they would be, but still good. Now, the corn nuggets...I've never had them before but everyone loves them and now I see why. They tasted amazing! My taste buds were in heaven!  We tried all of the sauces with our bbq, but the Mama Sweet sauce really stuck out. The blend of sweet and savory hit it home.  In summary, we would DEFINITELY come back if we were ever in Vegas again. Make this your last spot to stop at before leaving!
