Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The huge Outlaw burger our friend ordered, he finished it!

C90mDQ7th7ujn71KMWmGbA.text: Destiny,   You were tremendously helpful to our group of 8+ for Calvin's bachelor party. You're a legend.

vzpj5XaA27RezBxFmG85ZA.text: Friendly environment, good fresh food, Mama's sweet was my fave bbq from the selections. There are about 6 different ones

40P-Kq6rB7nxJfY-2t4K6A.text: My daughter is a Club soccer player. My wife is from Texas. We always try to find a BBQ place on our road trips. Vegas has incredible food but often times at a premium price. I am fairly certain the chefs at Rollin Smokin Barbeque are not nationally known but they should be. Great food! Great price!

4VLTrGoaJWS1e_lAbLyiuQ.text: A little off the strip (like a five minute drive) and a little hole in the wall place. But don't let the looks fool you. The food here was awesome and priced reasonably. All the meats that we tried were flavorful and moist. The sauces that they had on the side were spot on.   We will be coming back the next time we are in Vegas

Hm3Upk8xUwQ3rDjHTEYJRA.text: Wow. Just wow.  On recommendations from both here and elsewhere, I decided to stop in tonight.  Ordered the 3 meat plate with chopped brisket, ribs, and chicken.  Service was friendly and fast, and the food came out in under 5 minutes.  Took one bite of the ribs - best I have EVER had. By far.  Chicken - further love.  Brisket - a *relative* meh. Not bad at all, but nowhere close to the ribs and chicken.  The side of fries were also just ok.  One more place I'll seek out each time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 meat plate - Chicken, ribs, and brisket

8gdoYvnyy8j2amNCYT1YCw.text: Rollon Smoke was an overall good barbeque experience.  The barbeque itself was good, and was somewhat reasonably priced, but that's where the good part of it ended.  Now it's expected that a barbeque establishment would have a number of sticky, somewhat dirty decor, but this place was at least a little bit more than that.  Very little cleaning up happens here and everything looked like a big hot mess.    Service was decent, although a bit slow for a night that didn't have a lot going on.  They were starting to close up however so I wouldn't ding them too harshly for having a likely busier part of their day that they're recovering from.  As for the sides, and rest of what was offered.  The sweet tea was a letdown since it was sweetened tea, not sweet tea.  The sweet corn cornbread was decent, along with the mac & cheese and other items, but it didn't wow me.    The ribs though, I may come back and endure to at least have another taste of that. I will definitely try this again and give it another shot, and maybe change my original first impression on the venue.  Oh yeah, the sauces were forgettable.

rGF3akOdUlQDuQ1ihMmunw.text: Brought back 2 bags of this stuff on the airplane home. I was getting dirty looks on my flight back because all 250 of them could smell the smoked chicken, brisket, ribs, corn bread and Mac n cheese.....  I wanted to scout a place off strip as I do with all my trips to bring back some good local food home. Something which isn't available in the DC area. BBQ, no good or even average places in/near DC. So once I heard about this place being featured on Travel Channel and highly rated on Yelp I decided this is it. I got about everything on the menu from meatloaf to brisket and dirty rice to baked beans.  The brisket was wonderful but it definitely needs the sauce which they provide. The chicken is the best I've had. Forget about Peruvian chicken.... Even the best Peruvian chicken in DC can't hold its own. The beef rib was a dry rub which was also moist and had a nice kick. The meatloaf was wow, all meat. The dirty rice was spicy and the Mac and cheese was epic. The corn bread was fantastic too. Definitely do yourself a favor, step off that tourist trap (the strip) and give this place a go!!

xpS13Epjrn_VVkhneeimoA.text: PROS:  Food was amazing! (Except the Baked Beans, didn't care for those)  All the workers we came in contact with were super nice!  Location is very easily accessible  CONS:  Seating arrangements kinda sucks. We found a spot so it wasn't an issue for us but I can definitely see where during peak times this could be a huge problem.   Also, it's a little pricey. Family of 5 we spent $75 here on lunch (and my husband and I even shared a meal). Kinda crazy for a place where you aren't served.   Overall we really enjoyed it here! But next time we're definitely going to have the kids share a meal as well, the portions were HUGE.

p9n0anW3l3VRx-QViHxL5w.text: So it was our first time coming here. We pulled up and it was in the most random area ever lol. But gps does amazing things. When we went inside, we didn't know what to order! The cashier told us about something (I can't remember the name but it's 5 meats and 3 sides) which sounded perfect for two people! We got the meats and it was like 3 ribs, pulled pork, chopped up brisket, chicken, and sausage. The sausage was perfect. It was spicy, but not too much to where you can't taste it. The flavor in that was amazing! The pulled pork was so damn tender and fell apart perfectly. Brisket is normally dry when I go to other places and it's always chopped into big awkward pieces but I love how small these were cut because it savored alllll the juices. Now what's better than juicy brisket?! And finally the chicken was the least dry chicken I've ever had!   Now for the sides....  The Mac n cheese, my only complaint was that I wish the cheese on top was melted but other than that it was delicious. It was so creamy and amazing. We also got the mashed potatoes. It had bacon so it was automatically amazing so there's that. And the corn nuggets were so good for something so simple.   To top it off, as we were leaving the owners mom was talking to me and she's so sweet and amazing. She's so proud of her son and does anything to help him. I felt the love through the food as well. I can't wait to be back. I found my favorite bbq place in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 meat and 3 sides (the pit special) is perfect for a couple who&#39;s never been here before! You get to try a little or everything

xr3pbaX1CakVwUEt3ROOHw.text: I must say really surprised. Off the strip in the industrial area. Friendly service and great food.If you are in town it's a must! Brisket 3 Way with loaded mash!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PIyUamUEWVKL1otE8WS_8Q.text: Love my last experience here. The ribs, pulled pork, the ends, chicken were all so tender and flavorful. Thank you, for our excellent dinner! Definitely recommend trying it.

CYdiGXS0trbfaxWuHsLQkg.text: We were off for an adventure! A friend told me, if you want good BBQ you have to come here. I haven't had BBQ in quiet some time now so I was looking forward to it. Location is in a run down shopping center and not a frequently used street for the local but aren't all the good places like that? It was a place you order and grab your seat. They offer an ample amount of picnic bench seating so don't worry about a rush and not having a place to sit. Just think you can make friends with someone new. I got here around noon on a Friday. I just beat the rush. But as I said don't let that steer you away; quick and efficient service.  I ordered the duo plate; chopped brisket, hot links, mac & cheese and an order of hush puppies. My mouth is watering thinking about this meal again. There was so much flavor in every bit. My favorite was the brisket though. The hot links definitely had some kick to it so be sure to stock up on your sweet tea beverage. Hush puppies are like no others I ever had. They have jalapenos in them! Oh and I forgot the corn bread. This was like dessert, no butter or honey needed. It was almost like the consistency of a pound cake and never once crumbled.  The part that always gets me & deserves that extra star is seeing the chefs come out asking how everything was.  Always puts a smile on my face seeing how much pride they have in their cooking. A must try off the strip restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lunch plate; brisket, hot links, mac &amp; cheese &amp; hush puppies.

Bs6PI1TwvT0LSDFU0O9o_g.text: At four and a half stars with over 2000 reviews you can bet you will not be disappointed. We just tried this out and it was definitely worth all the hype absolutely excellent. We will definitely be back. My favorite thing were those little corn nuggets which cannot be missed. All of the ribs were great the shredded pork was wonderful the coleslaw was perfect and my favorite sauce is the country girl mustard BBQ sauce. Cheerful service very clean atmosphere.

lCcE-pcDeypzz0khu3vUZg.text: I'm really not into barbecue like that but this place i could have every day if i could. The decor is really good and the food is just bomb! The ribs are to die for so perfect and he extra sauce bomb! The corn bread is incredible the Mac and cheese feels like home. And don't forget the dessert. So good you won't be disappointed

QOeiViF4mdFnoD5Fho7DBg.text: Omg! Their bbq was heavenly good. My kids super loved the mac n cheese    My fave was the corn nuggets    I will definitely come back on my nxt visit to Vegas. The employees(Lizelle, Yandy, Mitch, Karina, Christian and Moses) were very friendly and greeted us with smile.    Definitely going back here again!

6CnofLFw-tXs5Xtfnyl4aQ.text: I stopped in yesterday for lunch. I've heard tons about this place and had to check it out. It was lunch time so of course there were quite a few people inside. After a few minutes, I ordered the Brisket 3 Ways, which came out pretty quick after ordering. The brisket was down right amazing. My favorite was between the chopped and burnt ends. Makes me hungry just thinking about it... I got the Mac n Cheese as my side, also delicious. Pretty much nothing fancy, just Meat and Mac n Cheese. As for the food, probably the best BBQ I've had. The location kinda sucks but it is close to work so I guess that's a plus. The only drawback that I can think of is the price. It was $21 after tax for my lunch. It wouldn't be a place I would go every day or else I would be broke, but definitely the place to go if you have an itch for delicious BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EsnzRPJi4zHyY82BogfNcQ.text: First time here with coworkers. I ordered the pull pork nachos. It comes with waffle fries, bbq beans, bbq sauce, nacho cheese,  scallions, and a white sauce. It tasted like mayo, but I'm not sure what it what it was. It was so much on that platter I couldn't finish it. There wasn't a long line or wait for food. I got a bottle of water, pay attention to the label it gives you 10% off the next meal! There's seating inside and outside. The customer service was great! The atmosphere was cool I felt like I was at a bbq shack. Minus the smoke from the pit. I'll be back with more friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dvf8Ual2lt_3EKioIQkwow.text: Real friendly good people.  for 4 adults and 3 small kids (under 6 yrs old):  Ordered:  2 Pit Specials with the followings sides:  2 jalapeno cole slaws, 2 waffle fries, 1 corn nuggets, 1 dirty rice Peach cobbler a la mode (would pass on this)  Pit special was delicious.  And love all their bbq sauces I combined the hot links, cole slaw and pulled pork and made a delicious sandwich.  Cole slaw was great Not a fan of the waffle fries Corn nuggets were good but you can't eat too much of them. Dirty rice tastes like rice pilaf (won't order this again)

E5wcQyKCDCQ-YbQ0Dk4hqw.text: I have eaten here several times and each time food was great and delicious. But today I went to get an early lunch and I was sooo disappointed. I ordered the rib platter and 1/2 lbs of brisket. The brisket was sooo overcook and dry, no smoke ring at all, it seemed to me that it was left over from the day before. And the beef brisket was the same...I wanted to the food sooo bad...should have but I stay in NLV. Never going back again...

S0Q6AAko21lm7DDFLCkD0g.text: I'm not from Nevada. Me & my bf came to Las Vegas for a darts tournament. We love bbq. So I was looking on yelp to see the best bbq. Then this place came up. I love all of the great reviews people was giving this place. So we decided to go. This is after our 1st dart tournament that took so long to get started.   When we got there a nice small place. We enter inside got in line to place our order looking at the menu a lot of good stuff. The loaded baked potato looked really good. Me & my bf decided to get the pit plate. It comes with spare ribs, brisket, pulled pork,  half chicken plus 3 sides. Which we got mac & cheese, corn bread, & bacon potato.  It didn't take long for our order it came out the minute we sat down. I got the chicken it was very tend & moist I love the skin of the chicken then the ribs was good too. But the best of the best of everything was their mac & cheese. It was so damn cheesy & creamy. I loved it so much. Plus the corn bread was super moist & soft.  I couldn't finish all of my food it was so much left. So we box it all & took it back to our room to have for our next day dart tournament. Overall this is a great place to have some bbq. A mus to place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the pit plate. With ribs tips, 3 sides brisket, spare ribs,hot link. Damn well time to eat
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh. Wow. There&#39;s a holographic photo mirror. Awesome

Hv0471zsqMvWT_Sx_4IROg.text: This has to be the best BBQ in town. The Smoked Meatloaf is a delicious.... highly recommend trying this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FrGoBJtyfVvQjvchoLbyog.text: A definite reason to make a trip off the strip when visiting Las Vegas. It's the Small places off the beaten path that seem to have the best BBQ. From ribs to pulled pork nothing wasn't delicious.

ko-IEFWbdrpyKdVwwG7TtA.text: Best BBQ I've had. We stopped here for a late lunch on a Saturday afternoon. It's in a strip mall located near a Christian radio station and other assorted businesses.  I had the BBQ club wrap and DAMN was it good. Delicious, filling, tasty, flavorful, cheesy, meaty. Plus they have sweet tea and I'm a sucker for sweet tea.  The man had 1/2lb of brisket, and it was sooooo tender and delicious.  Did I mention the BBQ sauce on the tables? Delicious.  Our friends got a plate of various ribs which were fall off the bone good, and the same wrap as I.  You must try this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2lb of brisket
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Club Wrap

d9txCb0Xa73eCzlvNX8CCw.text: Great food with good value. Only issue was the shredded brisket was a little fatty...ribs were AMAZING fall off the bone tender! Probably THE BEST green beans I've ever tasted too. I highly recommend the spicy sauce if you don't have a weak tongue. The chicken was SUPER moist and tender as well!! We will definitely be back next trip! The staff was great too...food came out fast and was accurate!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absolutely amazing food! Great way to feed a group if hungry teenagers...no bellies left empty...service was fast AND friendly!

CWzA7ekQlLfxaYHYUub0Vg.text: Hands down the best bbq. Including the side dishes and desserts are good. Nice portions super cool staff.

lrpvSMKx2_oIVj_Q_TmyEg.text: Great food along w great southern hospitality type of service. Seriously nice people. The food is great. I had the chicken BBQ sandwich. It was perfect. And they even sang happy Bday to my buddy.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket , tri tip, and ribs. Delicious. :)

Z5WqeLwC7X5Hg4wMOyj4CQ.text: If you're a fan of BBQ you have to check out Rollin Smoke BBQ. It is great, quality BBQ! Found in a strip mall behind all the casinos and strip joints, you would never guess this place is serving up delicious BBQ! One of the best BBQ experience I've had. Walked in and I was immediately engulfed by the sweet smell of BBQ smoke. I bellied up to the counter and looked over the menu. They have all your typical BBQ meats - brisket, chicken, pork, ribs, and hot links - however the taste is definitely not typical! They have sandwiches, plates, and even an AYCE option! I ordered the 3 meat plate (brisket, pork, and hot links) with 2 sides (jalapeno cole slaw, hush puppies) and corn bread. Everything was delicious! There are bottles of BBQ sauce on the tables if you wish to add.The sauce was excellent  You have to try #RSBBQ next time you're in #Vegas!

H0k2GlPk9UJ3L1MyaPwvVw.text: Oh boy, oh boy, oh boy!  I have to say that BBQ is one of my least favorite cuisines, but this place made me reconsider.  ALL of the meats are full of flavor, tender, and juicy.  Those waffle fries though.......why are they that good?!  Between those burnt ends, the meatloaf, and the brisket...I have to say that everything is simply delicious.  Shout out to the Chef (think Chef Tim) who is absolutely wonderful, personable, and friendly.  "Heads up" If you like beer with your BBQ, you'll be disappointed to find that one of the locations (bigger one) does not have a bar or sell alcohol.  You MUST check this place out when in Vegas!  Hands down, some of the best BBQ I've had in my life including that from Kansas City.

DkdJq_Kemnv0r9_nnG2Wog.text: I've been by several times and loved everything I had each time. The employees are very courteous and make you feel like family when you are there. I like how affordable the menu is for the quality of food that you get. For $7.99 I got a "Smoked Brisket Sandwich" and for a few bucks more I made it a combo which included a side and a drink. I also added an additional side of "Cheezy Mac & Cheese" to my order. The brisket is smoked for 18 hours and is the best brisket I have had in town. The meat has such great flavor! When it comes to flavor the beans have it and like the brisket, the beans here are the best I've had in town. The macaroni and cheese was very good too. I'm not the type to eat meat off of the bone, but I did try a rib and I enjoyed every bite! So tender and flavorful! For dessert I had "Banana Pudding" priced at $3.99 and it was the perfect ending to a perfect meal.   Inside is clean and smells like heaven. So does the parking lot where you can on most days see the man himself outside smoking up some of the tasty meats they offer here. If you want to eat at home they offer a variety of party packs. They will even come to your home and bring their own grills and smokers to cater your event. Call them to find out about the packages they have and pricing. I am going to definitely keep the catering in mind for the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Banana Pudding&#34; @ Rollin Smoke Barbeque
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Ribs&#34; @ Rollin Smoke Barbeque
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Smoked Brisket Sandwich, Cheezy Mac &amp; Cheese and Beans&#34; @ Rollin Smoke Barbeque

x8pmgxdWO-3yPmcFsuDkbQ.text: You can easily missed this spot even though it's just off the strip. It's in this dingy little corner lot that no one cares to notice.  Not going to deny but I had high hopes and it was sort of a let down. We had the Pit Special 5 Meats 3 Sides. While the flavors are good it was barely lukewarm. And why would you chop up the brisket? More like scraps to me. All jokes aside.  The menu did indicate it is served chopped unless otherwise requested. Again, who notices that? Shouldn't it just be mentioned when you order upfront? I personally think they just want to get rid of their scraps as obviously captured in my photo.  The sides are pretty sorry. The waffle fries is nothing more than criss cross fries. Cheesy mac and cheese was not only cold but the worst I had. The yams is more of a dessert.  Tip: Ask for their special spicy sauce. It is so damn good! Skip the regular bbq sauce and vinegar out in the open.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sides - waffle fries, mac &amp; cheese and yams
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pit Special 5 Meats. Ask for unchopped briskets or get scraps like here.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mvkdQ37247Q_BqCGsyTERA.text: Very authentic and delicious BBQ. The staff is all very friendly and brings your order to your table. Picnic tables inside and a few outside, don't go there if you are looking for a fancy place, just tasty grub!

KZumzBuIAfOwC9LQZkjukw.text: AWESOME food that won't disappoint you!!!! The best BBQ brisket, bakes beans, and corn bread I had ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best BBQ I had ever had!!!!

PIhH5ySMzMlUybxAXDFq2w.text: came here on my last trip to vegas .  my husband and i hardly ever deviate from our normal go to places in vegas but we decided to give this place a try.    he got the trio of the meats ( chicken, brisket, and pulled pork) and an extra slap of ribs for me =D  and i also ordered a side of corn bread.    The ribs were SOOO good!!! my husband is pretty picky w/ his meats and he really liked them.. there was really good flavor, good smoke and definitely good chew!   the chicken was also pretty good too! brisket and pulled pork were just ok for me.   i loved the cornbread! it was super uber delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 slab ribs ; cornbread and trio ( pulled pork, chicken and brisket) can&#39;t forget the sweet tea !
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s some good looking rib !

uVffQnm7_AR0N-iJ_vkhEg.text: The place smells like heaven.  Delicious BBQ.  A little off strip but it's worth the cab over  Check out the babybacks.  I want to give this place 5star but the cashier rolled her eyes at me as I asked her what she said because she was slurring her words.  Granted I'm sure it's been a long shift from her,  no reason to be prissy  Update:  The owner of the establishment got in touch with me and offered his apologies to the service issue I mentioned above.   I'm updating my rating to 5, and hope to go back next I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby&#39;s
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac n cheese

4Ql73iAWB3tgvPChCQ3ztw.text: Stopped in before the show..sliced brisket BBQ beans and coleslaw..everything was awesome.. Thanks yelp for another hidden treasure

DnSK3iks_11y6upEjc_Fcg.text: Easy review.. The best BBQ in Las Vegas!! I come here often and it has never disappointed.. Love this place!!

JLNYptUjah-xK-P_Jw6Dnw.text: This is easily my favorite BBQ spot in Las Vegas! Everyone is friendly and the food is great. Makes me feel like I'm back home down south! Kamia helped us at the register and was very sweet and helpful and made our experience just that much better! I'd definitely recommend coming here if you're in Vegas.

_1hmhNKfXxr3p9NAZjCZIg.text: I'm most definitely a fan of BBQ so with that being said why wouldn't I try this place out to see what all the hype is about? I've had this bookmarked for at least a couple months but being that is a couple of streets over from the strip I've procrastinated actually driving down here to eat! I left the fashion show mall this past week hungry and not wanting any nasty mall food lol. When I looked around the area for places to eat on yelp, this bookmark popped up! Headed on over in a hurry! When I pulled up I thought the outside was interesting with the picnic tables and yeah just the whole location is weird but needless to say who cares the food is good! The menu is posted on a HUGE window outside so that you are able to get your ordered figured out prior to going inside however in this 1000 degrees of heat I opted to read my menu INSIDE ha! The 3 meat trio priced at about $17.99 was fair and the only thing I didn't like was they could've gave me a little bit more of the mac n cheese for my side :-/ In addition to that order we also got the BBQ Nacho Fries with the brisket! Amazing! Wow all I have to say is if calories aren't a concern and you are in the area looking for great BBQ, LOOK NO FURTHER!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Nacho Fries w/ Brisket
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 meat combo plate! 1/4 chicken, spare ribs, hot links side of Mac n cheese
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interesting entrance

QG5R64y6SImNkviZFTGcqw.text: Saw the ratings and decided it was time to get off the strip and give it a try. The food was delicious! My husband and I had the spudtastic- mine was topped with the best chicken and my husband had the hot links on his. We will definitely go back to try other menu items.

3voBQPqjTduMGaSCnSNwdg.text: Awesome food, with exceptional service. Workers come from the back food prep area to check on customers. Every one is truly courteous.

mNOe7GN8T04CGd7ecCIFXQ.text: Excellent! Ordered the 20 dollar four meats and three side combo! It was delicious! For a three dollar up charge you can get the best part of the brisket! Holy smokes! This was finger and plate licking good! A must if you are in vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All three sides were delicious especially the potato salad and beans!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portions are epic!

r8B72kOgzxVso2zbOhR-ZQ.text: I am a local foodie so I had to try this place because I have seen their truck around town. I ordered the 3 meat trio with ribs, brisket and hot links and the collard green. I have to say really enjoy the meats I chose. They were really tender, flavorful and very meaty (just how I like it).   However,  I deducted 2 stars because the BBQ sauce was terrible and they had the nerve to charge for extra BBQ sauce. It tasted like tomato sauce with pepper (YUCK) and nothing BBQ about it. For me the sauce will make it or break it. I also was disappointed with the collard greens.   If you place a to go order, be sure to check it before you leave. My order was wrong when I first received it and wrong again after they tried to make it right.  Bring your favorite BBQ sauce it will go great with any of their meat.   In the future, I will get the meats there and make my own sides and use my own BBQ sauce at home.

fqRtppxeu7q6GLwUw8IJcA.text: Went here based on the good Yelp reviews and the proximity to my hotel (the Trump). Note that this place is in a strip of office buildings in an industrial part of town off the strip. Lots if different BBQ options on the menu - I had the half chicken and green beans and it was really good. I saw some other patrons eating ribs that looked really good. This is not a restaurant but instead you order at the counter and the food is brought out to you at self seating picnic tables. The prices aren't super cheap so you are paying for quality. Overall, was enjoyable although not sure it's a must visit if you visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half chicken

1tFWFXEJNwjvgdNPAFe18w.text: Back again! This time I had the brisket dog. 1/4 lb beef hotdog with brisket, cheese and onions. Pretty good. My gf had the rib and chicken combo, we brought a friend and he had the same.  Everything was good as usual!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib and chicken combo. Good choice and potato salad is da bomb!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket dog.

mSsOHEd0UaZhOW0xrToieA.text: This place is absolutely ridiculous(in a good way). I had the rib plate(beef, baby back, St. Louis) and my buddy ordered chicken and brisket. We also tried a couple sides, and everything was unreal. One of the best bbq joints I've ever been to, definitely go check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aVTaqCpxp7WEKybatsY2fg.text: Having moved from Kansas City, I wasn't hopeful on finding quality local BBQ that's even in the ballpark. However, this place is light. Great food & service! The building is located in a seedy area and the facilities is a bit of a dive... so, it's the perfect authentic barbecue spot!  The three meat combo is the way to go! Their ribs, pulled pork and brisket will not let you down. I had fried okra as my side & the dipping sauce gives it a unique flair. I'll be heading back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs, pulled pork &amp; okra for the win!!!

pKv9EJSMDlhkG_R4xuke_g.text: I just needed to update my review to 5 stars. Food is great every time! I love the new additions to the menu, specifically bbq sundae for $8.99. Lunch time can be very hectic, so I try to go in before/after the lunchtime rush.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seriously soooo good!!!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Piggy Waffle Fries&#34; (Made with Brisket) Amazing!!

SEEcQKatNvYFzCddZXfJIg.text: This place never disappoints weather I'm here with clients or just being a fat kid. The service is good the food is amazing sometimes you even get to hang out with the pitmaster Dusty which is a treat. And no matter what you eat there don't ever forget the banana pudding.

3FYqcKaoLJ_rHdkNmVKYAg.text: Loved this place. Absolutely met the hype. There was a wait, but it's well worth it. Got the smoked chicken sandwich and it was excellent. Tried all of the different sauces and they were excellent. Got mac n cheese as a side and it was very good as well. Loved everything about this place. Just became a Vegas staple for me.

mU6L7HCbwWZPrGGMm272hg.text: Great BBQ spot close to the strip without the hassle of the casinos. The brisket is very good I prefer the sliced to the chopped. The ribs and chicken are amazing. I use the Carolina sweet bq on everything. Max and cheese and loaded mash are my go to sides. They switched the bread recently from a slice to a roll I preferred the slice. It's great spot overall!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XLEbdWuW39Q7vvV7ndx1xw.text: It takes a lot to satisfy me, I'm known to out eat men, maybe that's why I left feeling unsatisfied.   The place itself is not hard to find, unless your GPS gives you the wrong directions and makes you drive right by it, thanks a lot Siri!   I came in for dinner on a weeknight with my friend, since it was my first time I had no idea what to order and I failed to read the recommendations of others. I ended up ordering the beef hot link sandwich combo. It came with a drink and one side. When my order came out I looked at it and knew it was not going to be enough to fill me up. The price you pay for the amount of food you get was not justifiable to me. You get a small side that's as big as a KFC side and a plain hot link on bread. For my side I ordered the mac and cheese, it was okay, nothing spectacular, I've had better. The hot link was okay as well, it tasted like the ones you buy at the grocery store.   Service was fast and cashier was friendly. When we came in there wasn't a line so we were in and out pretty quick. I'll update my review once I'm able to try more items but I was really not that impressed with my first visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef hot link sandwich. Was not filling.

vmyE9_7k35aUh3KPHCDcgA.text: So where do I begin. This place is very high on my list of places for BBQ. Too bad I don't live in Vegas because I think I would be coming back again and again. We ordered their whole chicken wings, which was flavorful and delicious. We also had the baby rack ribs, which were already cut so we didn't have to be too messy. The ribs were meaty and flavorful as well. For sides we had the yams, waffle fries, mac n cheese and baked beans which all were tasty. They have a pretty good variety of sauces. I highly recommend having a taste of Rollin Smoke BBQ while you're in Vegas We had a great time here and will definitely be back before our trip is over!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sides!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ ribs and whole wings

pdZMZ_mfeDWKoXTfUqQWag.text: My favorite BBQ joint in town. It NEVER FAILS, at anything! My go to is the brisket 3-way. Chopped, sliced and brisket burnt ends...and if you have never tried corn nuggets, you owe it to yourself. A well kept secret about this place-while they have some great iced tea, they are also byob (shout out to Karina for telling us about that years ago)that's right, just bring your alcoholic beverages and enjoy. - pictured is the amazing Outlaw Burger! Banana pudding and cobbler for dessert.

8IxtMdie5_MR6MwoFD8_pQ.text: Awesome food everything was good we got the all you can eat because we're greedy  it really worked out for us. U can order everything on the menu except drinks but drinks are $3 all u can drink. Come here if you're hungry.

u8bg4ZLC96jLy8-dUKpGpg.text: I love this place I can't get enough of the brisket the burnt ends and the corn nuggets I could eat two orders if I could handle it but there's so much food on the brisket Trio three different types of brisket shopped sliced and burnt ends oh yeah don't forget to order cornbread because it's crazy good and the atmosphere is really awesome it must be like that happiest place on the planet and polite everybody's happy when they're sitting there talking and waiting for their order or about to place their order keep up the good work I'll see you Monday for lunch

c8GEOZa2Q4VIHjwoEXZcyg.text: Best BBQ in Vegas, hands down!!  Other than the delicious food they're Super friendly, cozy atmosphere, and affordable.

qW659jv1WXsf_QWieKXduQ.text: After I drove so long to get the food, when I came home my order was messed up and the links that I was craving were not there, but they still get five stars cuz the owner was such a class act and so sincere. Offered us free food and gave the money back. This is how every restaurant should operate when they make a mistake not by just giving u free food but by being so sincere about it. Dustin is the man! And that's why this place is worth a hour drive.

WeiS5oCkI7B01BGFPflQbg.text: Rollin Smoke Barbeque was the first restaurant that I tried when I got to Vegas. I ordered the combo plate (ribs and brisket) with a side of coleslaw and mac n cheese.   The ribs were perfectly seasoned, and the meat just fell off the bones. It was barky, tasty, and smoky. I loved that the ribs were garnished with spring onions on top.   The brisket was just as amazing as the ribs. It was moist and had lots of flavor to it . Their seasoning had some secret spices in it, it was not your typical Texas seasoning. I liked the fact that they only put a tiny bit of sauce on their brisket. They didn't drown their meat with sauce. The meat was flavorful to a point that I decided to scratch the sauce off the meat. The brisket also had a great bark. You know what: it was barky, tasty and smoky.  Sadly, the sides were not on par with the meats. The coleslaw was bland, and the mac n cheese was too runny. It didn't taste fresh to me. I usually don't care about the sides as much as I care about the meat. I will be back next time that I am in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AQTCCEZNbH9QGa8TrrH2dg.text: This place is good I came here on a trip to Vegas. It is DAMN GOOD BBQ and the folks were great. The sides were delicious they had everything you could imagine. Next time in Vegas I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saturday rib tip special!! Six bucks for half a lb I couldn&#39;t finish it all. If you enjoy good bbq this is your place.

IEFt648qnxfdQ58mxtjFeQ.text: Everyone needs to try the outlaw burger! It is so soft and juicy it is almost ridiculous how good it is. The food comes out very quickly. I did the $34 all you can eat option. It was quite worth it. Must try! The girl working in the front was smoking hot :)

8jawh4tsSkHCt9xrvhPFkA.text: I need to go back here!  Great people and food!  Not many places to sit but you can always get it to go!

5Tsd7Yy2HM4dAn60lMRD9A.text: The Good. Let's just say The last time I had barbecue this good I was in St. Louis Missouri. I had the trio of the brisket, pulled pork, and spareribs. My sides were the dirty rice and the chipotle coleslaw. Let's get into the meat of it. The brisket was fantastic nice char not dry flavorful and delicious. The pulled pork is tender moist and succulent. The ribs were delicious flavorful and not even close to being dry. Lets get going to the sides.  the chipotle coleslaw was flavorful but not overly creamy. Just the way I like it! The dirty rice was fantastic combination of rice ground beef red onion and something else I couldn't tell what it was. I had all this for the paltry price of $24 it was a great deal for the amount of food that I got.  The Bad. It was a little bit of a drive from the strip, but that's not a problem because to find places like this you have to get away from the strip. Places like this that are affordable with great food are not always on the strip.  The Ugly. When I was done I wanted more and more and more. This could've gotten ugly.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The trio of brisket, pulled pork, and spareribs.

aYVOnLttOfdf-9ljiMAAsw.text: Best BBQ ever! Do not be discouraged by the subpar location; The food makes up for the fact that it's under the overpass. I had the baby back ribs with pulled pork, which did not disappoint!  All of the sauces are unique & delicious... definitely an option for everyone. Highly recommend this joint, especially if you know good bbq

GGIXdbtKy1o1E2cL08EQXw.text: I had the pleasure of dining here with nine other people after one of them suggested it for lunch.  Admittedly there was trepidation at the idea of eating at some new location at of all places on...Highland Dr.    Located in an area known for plumbing supplies, auto repair, strip bars and this that or the other thing and BBQ!?  RSB was a totally unexpected "Hump Day" treat.  It was the rave upon our return to the office.   The outside upon initial glance may look greasy spoonish but this is by no means the case. The inside was comfortable with seats to spare.  It has a contemporary look inside but the smell and hospitality which leaves no doubt that this is serious BBQ.  That and the large smokers out in the parking lot.  I went with the "Spudastic" a baked potato filled with beef brisket and smothered with cheese and sour cream.  I combo'd the meal ordering as my side the jalapeno coleslaw and refreshing sweet tea.  It was pure joy to eat.  The ten of us dining while marveling the smoked pieces of brisket, pulled pork and sausage on a lone picnic  table outside in what is almost December...INCREDIBLE!   I will no longer tolerate the now benign flavor of that served up by the corporate so called BBQ joints. My taste buds are forever ruined.  SUPPORT LOCAL BUSINESS!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Spudtastic!

o2qHk2zqBK09IVK8-MnOtw.text: It was a nice spot to stop by for a little fill me up for the road. I would most likely come back. Maybe try something else, but the pulled pork sandwich was good. For MY personal likings tho, i do love a drenched pulled pork. So the sauces on the side helped a lot. It is a bit pricey, but worth it! Oh and I'm a HUGE fan of Mac N Cheese, and this one hmmmmm hit the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled Pork Sandwich..... hhhhmmmm oink oink

3rBkPE_CKP3EdvW9CKDjrA.text: Here we go, brace yourselves. I'll be that guy. This is actually a friendlier version of my review for RSB; the original had cuss words and comparisons that probably would get me in trouble that's the version you needed to brace yourselves for.  When it comes to BBQ, American BBQ, I've gone to St. Louis, Memphis, Kansas City, Texas, the Carolinas, various states in the East, South, Mid-West, and West, pre-Yelp and current Yelp days, and have experienced both good and bad BBQ. You can say I've had more than my share of BBQ and can tell a good BBQ from just a decent BBQ place but no way am I an expert. I've hated BBQ spots locals loved. So IMHO and friendlier version RSB is just decent, OK is being nice. I've been here a few times and well I am NOT a fan. Each time I've been disappointed with one thing or another. Yes I've gone back but that's just cause everyone's been raving about RSB and I wanted to give them another shot and then another.  One of my first visits was with a group of 5-6 from work. I don't remember what everyone exactly ordered but remembered me having the chopped pork sandwich and another having the chopped chicken sandwich which neither I can find on the menu, must have been a special. Anyways from both of the sandwiches we created a community pile of what's this!? tiny pieces of chicken bones. There were a lot of chopped up chicken spine and rib bones all mixed in our meats. Even if I was mistakenly served chicken with my pork, bones, really RSB. I had more typed out but I leave it as that. The only good thing about it was I had a free dessert with Yelp check-in. STRIKE ONE.  After writing off RSB for a couple months the group made it back out. This time ribs and Outlaw burgers were ordered. They certainly took their time bringing the ribs out.  Ribs were ordered first and was last to be served. What exactly were they doing!? Warming it up or cooking them as it was ordered. I actually asked for and ate my dessert first cause I was hungry. The ribs that came out was beyond disappointing tough, rubbery, had little taste, and sucked. I've had way better.  I noticed my ribs were different from the others. Oh there's a "rib plate" and a "rib platter special". STRIKE TWO.  After working up an appetite playing basketball all morning I came here looking to finally clear things up and getting the rib platter special. It was a lot of ribs but it lost all its luster. The beef rib wasn't as tender as I was hoping but tender to some liking. The rest were decent nothing exciting just a lot of meat covered in sauce. I smelt all the smoke inside and outside of the RSB but I got only a hint of smoke taste. STRIKE THREE. Throat slash.   The best BBQ in Vegas!? I don't know about that. Maybe, than again Vegas aren't known for BBQ and the ones I've enjoyed no longer are open so maybe I don't know anything about BBQ plus I sometimes enjoy buffet BBQ ribs. You want more info there's AYCE BBQ for $24.99. It's located off a few side streets near the Strip. They have a small parking lot which is shared with the other businesses. They're from Arkansas. They're friendly but I wouldn't call the service great. There's large tables, small tables, and booths. Lines for ordering can form out the door. Just go if you like go.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs and baked potato salad
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw burger

aFTBsDXGaYo7dy3R1_RjvA.text: Good quality and good quantity!!! I had the pulled piggy sandwich with waffle fries, and my husband had the beef rib plate.  The quality of their meats are excellent, very tender and very flavorful. I am quite picky about bbq sauce.... and theirs is really good... I slathered extra sauce all over my pulled pork sandwich!  If you have a big appetite... you will not be disappointed by the amount of food they give you either.....very big portions! The beef ribs are gigantic.... We left full!!!  I really recommend giving them a whirl, location is a little rough, and the ordering process can be a little tricky. oh yeah, and the closet you step into to get your drinks is another strange aspect that you just go..... "okay, whatever".....  I can deal with a few quirks for some good food!

I4ARwrDLtU0z274apyXdRQ.text: I found this place on Rollin smoke barbeque on Yelp because I wanted some BBQ that was close to home made. I must say this was close as possible to home made as you can get. The atmosphere was great; Crystal was amazing she provided excellent customer and she knew the menu very well. I will say this first time really writing a positive review but I shall return. Man oh man I hope my brother never see this me review somebody's BBQ better than his.

MTaj7guNXMNgCfS0BB1pnA.text: My wife and I were very impressed with the food here. We are not typically barbecue meat people. We got the rib platter and waffle fries. It was filling for us to share and the flavors were great. The staff is very warm and welcoming. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib platter. My wife and I shared it and had a little bit of leftovers. Sooo good.

m7mf7Ssc9ZUbzYpSomBvrQ.text: Best barbecue ever Lizele was awesome she has wonderful customer service skills very friendly we loved her so much we're definitely coming back for our Thanksgiving dinner      If you're looking for good barbecue in Vegas Hand's down Rollin Smoke Barbecue is the place to go

frJStg7UetlPl1ir9qAlgA.text: This is the most amazing bbq spot.   I live in California and I will now take a weekend drive just to eat here!   And all of their sauces are amazing!!!  I'm in love!! We are now die hard fans of this spot. Las Vegas is lucky to have them in their city!!

9V_wZ5dEb8QlKUG6yfoUJw.text: I have been coming to Las Vegas for 30 years and just now heard of this place.  It is a small place that is a little hard to find, but worth it.  My boss and I had a great meal and couldn't pass up the desserts.  It is now a staple when I come to town.  The staff is friendly and will help you with the menu if you have any questions.  I can't wait to come back.

NRItw_0i37_3GOblq48iKA.text: Came here for dinner on my most recent visit to Vegas on 11/23 around 6:30 PM because I saw Nadine's check-in and read a bunch of other highly recommended Yelp reviews.  We weren't super hungry so we decided to just order the "pit special" which came with the 5 meats and 3 sides.  Since it was our first time here, I wasn't sure which sides to decide on so I did what any newbie would do, ask the cashier for her suggestions.  To my surprise, Jessica's rude reply in a rude tone was "everything is popular, just pick something!"  I was kind of taken aback, even if I was trying to be understanding that it is dinner time & there were five other people behind me.  The food was a 3.5, maybe 4-star, but I am deducting the 1-star for Jessica's rudeness.  Out of the five meats, I liked the pork ribs and pulled pork the most.  The hot links were pretty good as well.  Although, the chopped up beef briskets were dry & flavorless, but the BBQ sauce definitely helped.  The chicken was ok.  The three sides we chose included dried up mac 'n cheese which was very plain & dry.  The infamous corn nuggets were pretty interesting, but not as delicious as they looked in the photos.  They ran out so we had to wait about 10 minutes after our food arrived for the corn nuggets.  However, the baked beans were the saving grace of those three choices...I pretty much ate the whole thing to myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cXPf_aiBj_IlAUHuMYcEsA.text: We came here with very high hopes. We tried duo plate with hot link & sliced brisket w beans.  Brisket sandwich w macaroni and cheese. Brisket was nice and smoked with a delightful pepper crust. Hot link was average. Macaroni was below average w little flavor to speak of. Beans also lacked a depth of flavor as well. House and the hottest sauces were both below average.   Wishing we had tried a different BBQ spot this trip:/

OmnA2RTlRKqxfcJwvxvZjg.text: BEST BBQ EVER, i would highly recommend coming here when your ever in Vegas, service is great, food is even better !

pimWfAeD5XgA44Dy1Tky6g.text: I got the bbq rib platter with the Mac n cheese side. It was definitely very tender meat but it wasn't as flavoursome as I'd imagined it. Definitely value for money because they were quite meaty ribs. My only issue was the beef one was extremely fatty. Don't get me wrong, I love the fat on ribs but this was just way too much for my liking. Also, I have an Aussie palette so we like everything well seasoned so that's probably why the flavour just didn't do it for me, the smokiness however was spot on though.

PJwkxV42ySTuVslJSwcqfQ.text: Bring on the hate mail!  As an update to my prior review from June of 2013...this place is decent but it seems their success is getting the best of them now and things just aren't what they used to be. It's not only me who is noticing this...I rarely, if ever, see anyone check-in here anymore whereas 2 years ago it was occurring nearly every day.  Service; not as good as it used to be, plain and simple.  Prices; seems like a 30% increase across the board.  Quality; meh, this is now on par with Lucille's if you ask me.  The last few times I've been there or had delivery the food was not fresh and seemed to be of lower quality.  Some items were cold, others old left overs and rubbery.  Don't believe the hype...anymore.

cnz3k6kHrUO7H5Q1pviCGw.text: Let start off with the good!   The ribs, chicken , hotlines, mac and cheese , BBQ beans and the corn was good.   I couldn't tell which was the brisket and which was pulled pork. I thought the pulled pork would have the BBQ already one it and the brisket when it says chopped I figured like chopped into slices not demolish. Maybe I got the last of it idk? However when I think of brisket I think slices not a pile of shredded beef.   I may try this place again however going to try to find another joint first.

5gbPCl2tbSFdo6sT-foVSQ.text: The meat tasted really good and was very tender. A little pricey but you get what you pay for. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was comfy.

mXQPcWN7gzj_JbIQCiDUww.text: I'm giving this place 5 stars, because they made my friend happy. She's never happy with eating out. Everywhere we go, when we get back home and I'm all excited because I've had a good meal, but she just sits back and say, "It was ok."  No seriously, everything was awesome. We got a lot of food, not JUST because we were starving, but because we wanted a large variety of food so that we could give them a fair chance to impress us. Well, job done! I have to say, we were impressed!  With the help of the perky and oh so passionate cashier, we ordered the Pit Special 5 Meat 3 Sides for 27.99. It came with Brisket, Pulled Pork, 1/4 Chicken, 2 Spare Ribs and Hot Links for the meats and we got Mac & Cheese, Yams and Kick'n BBQ Beans for the sides. We also ordered a Peach Cobbler on the side.  We enjoyed The whole meal and we ate every bit of it. The best part to me was the Hot Links and maybe the Mac & Cheese, if you force me to pick. To be honest, when we go back, the only change that we would make is, instead of the Peach Cobbler, we would order Mama's Banana Pudding.  I do want to mention that the Peach Cobbler was really oily. It was probably because of the cream that was on top, but either way, we've both had better. I wouldn't order it again.  All in all, the customer service was great and the food was more than just good, it was great lol! We added this place to our Favorites list.

Liz Elle was kind and helpful, really seemed excited for us to try this place for the first time when I told her I'd never been here before.    Food = 10 Customer service = 10  Bringing home a bottle of their home-made "Arkansauces" (Mama's Sweet D-Licious)  Got the duo choice with Brisket/Spare ribs, and do yourselves a favor and don't skimp out on the corn bread!    #goodish

J-WOW0t1My1ExIImJkf5Jg.text: Buffet for bbq lovers. Nothing even comes close! If you want toe sample the WHOLE menu , then the buffet option is the best in town!  The meats are smoked and carved with love by the awesome people at Rollin Smoke. Just a tip. Come in very hungry ;)

ot3M1qIcQSkQrDXqhR06fg.text: My husband & I were looking for a place with some good BBQ! This place did not disappoint!!! They exceeded our expectation! Food was amazing as well as the customer service. Christal was so nice & helpful! We highly recommend this place!

oiTZWhz6zJGTCBuNod4qSg.text: Love this place! It is most definitely for meat eaters, sorry vegetarians. Everything is so flavorful and packed full of meat. My favorites are the brisket, hot links, bbq beans and dirty rice they all have a great kick to them! My husband loves the brisket three ways meal especially the burnt ends (he's a big fan of the marblization aka fat). Desserts are also quite tasty but the food is for sure the main attraction.   The only issues I have with this place are some minor taste preferences: Mac n cheese -I like mine baked theres isn't Greens- tasty but a bit sweet (thankfully they weren't vinegary).

6qM19WOVPPlZycPfmraC1w.text: We decided to go out and venture outside of our comfort zone, so we decided to eat some bbq. We yelped for bbq places and it was the top choice. No wonder why LOL. It is sooo good. Especially the beef ribs, they were probably 3 inches thick but we cut it so easily with a plastic knife. And the servers were super nice, I think 4 ppl asked how we were doing. My friend and I left with a lot of leftovers.

EMpeHinc5vl7QbzOAkUTPA.text: Wow! Great friendly fast service! Food is Awesome!! Visiting Vegas from San Diego and was recommend to try there BBQ! Thankfully I did!!

1aRblSjWsCbs6tlpi_h1TQ.text: If I could give this place 10 stars, I would!!! This place is amazing, definitely worth the short trip off the strip. My boyfriend and I split the "pit special" and we got Mac and cheese, corn bread, and green beans for our sides. The pulled pork, chicken, and hot link were my favorite of the 5 meats, but don't get me wrong, they were all amazing! The pulled pork was tender, and dipped in the Sweet country girl sauce - over the top! The green beans were delicious, buttery and dusted with Parmesan cheese. The Mac and cheese was probably the best I've ever had - very cheesy and creamy with big noodles. It's even topped with shredded cheese! The cornbread was sweet and cakelike. If you're not drooling by now, this place ain't for you! A MUST in Vegas!!!

8IJzKjaHgby2LsDg1aeLVw.text: By far the best bbq I've had in years! From the bbq to the catfish and shrimp everything was delicious. We will definitely be coming more often

fQ9ihzwLesHfJVucXrUkBQ.text: My boyfriend and friends all love BBQ. They all really wanted to try this place before we left Vegas. I ordered the trio meat plate: two orders of the St. Louis pork ribs and brisket burnt ends (+$3). For the side, I chose mac n cheese.   The food took awhile to come out, but everything was piping hot, except the mac n cheese, which was just okay. The indisputable star were the brisket ends -- so juicy and flavorful. All of their sauces were amazing. My favorites were their house Arkansas sauce, hot sauce, and Mama sweet(?). This place is definitely worth a stop. We all plan to come back here whenever we're in Vegas again!

NLGU12WQsSr_cJBC9xJ3lA.text: Best BBQ I have ever had in Vegas. The beef ribs are off the charts. I very much like my brisket with some good bark on it and I asked for that and they were very kind to accommodate it.  The burnt ends were on point. Mac n cheese was outstanding. They also have an all you can eat option which I can't imagine anyone doing well on, the portions are huge!

nCQs2-946ncXj84kQTYlqQ.text: Oh yea! This great bbq joint tucked away behind the strip from MGM has fantastic food in a comfy, cool atmosphere.  A great menu, brisket cooked to perfection with, tasty sides and friendly service make this a gem for lunch and dinner.  The Mac and Cheese is killer and collard greens were um world class too.  We split a hot link and sliced brisket.  Smoked to perfection and served in on tray with paper lining was mowed down on outside on a clean picnic bench with handy paper towels.  A self served drink dispenser and iced tea was available too.  Highly recommend this bbq place if you like good southern comfort food.

HSW3ipG8LeOq3_YiMX4fXQ.text: Fantastic BBQ. Got the combo plate with spare ribs and sliced brisket - absolutely delicious. Brisket was tender and moist with a great course pepper crust and the perfect amount of fat. Ribs were tender too and had great flavor.  The collard greens were good too, but they dripped all over the place in the bag of my to-go order, a bit messy. I would have appreciated it if they had wrapped the container up since there was so much liquid inside.  Service was friendly.

xJhBHQniuo3-FPkGofZ2VQ.text: more like 4.5/5 stars. this place is the real deal.  when most companies state... "best bbq in (insert city here)"  i don't believe them and typically think they're bullshitting us, but i'm still craving this place a month after visiting.  we ended up getting the The 5 Meat Pit Special Smokin' Plate, which comes with 5 different or same meats of your choice and 3 sides and 2 pieces of bread.  as for meats, i recommend getting the brisket, and for the sides, i highly recommend getting the corn nuggets.  perfect bite size appetizers. the female cashier also hooked us up with free drinks, since she was OC as well. they also have different types of sauces for your meat...(this statement sounds weird)  but rest assured, the sauces will make your meat finger licking good.   this place has been featured on the food network.  this place is located on the "bad" side of vegas... its located right under a freeway and nearby the strip clubs and sex shops..

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The 5 Meat Pit Special Smokin’ Plate

YNChjWCngWx76bSE8ZAosQ.text: Yooooooo, I don't care what anybody says with regard to BBQ in Las Vegas. This joint here is flat out MEEEEEEAN... in the most positive and praise worthy way. My goodness, my goodness! There's not a single BBQ joint in Vegas who can touch what they've got going. The ribs -- like butter... mac and cheese -- money... burnt end --- freakin' unreal... Yo, if you're in Vegas and want some damn good bbq. Get here ya hear me... Get here!

hRKy6yfJj1017G5v7PGmUw.text: Just ordered through Grub Hub, got the great tasting brisket sandwich and hot link sandwich which both showed up half the size as before. The banana pudding was excellent and back to normal size. The last time we had delivery the pudding was half the size. All in all great tasting but two tiny sandwiches and some pudding aren't worth $40 or even $25. They need some consistency or they're going to start losing customers.

833chqxnTy99kv-vmFZARg.text: I order a delivery from Rollin Smoke Barbeque fro GrubHub - twice.  So yeas the first time was good solid BAR-B-Que.  I got the two meat special with Ribs and chicken (Dark meat) really good and still warm.  The ribs were a little dry. However, they still disappeared quickly. The chicken was good.  I also got the Banana pudding - great!      The second time I got the salad with chicken and a half chicken.  The salad was VERY good and the half chicken was left half eaten because the salad was so filling.  But I still had room for another banana pudding.

8MtjoVbUaUnccYZ4y_TS8g.text: Food was really greasy and horrible and expensive for no reason John mulls road kill grill !!! Is wayyyyy bettter

_2IcCDWq0k5bUSXTTH4CnA.text: After a long break, my friends and I decided to come back on a Thursday afternoon.   The food got decent reviews from everyone, I had the beef ribs and they were tender and tasty. My friend who ordered the brisket and ribs said they were just ok. My gripe would be over the root beer float...at $3.99 a small scoop of ice cream and 3/4 glass of root beer (after the foam went down). Not a good value there.  So...maybe up to 3.5 stars but that's about it.
