DxVeED12X49_W8-2TIAg1Q.text: Epic does not begin to describe this amazing BBQ place!  I ate there 2 times on my trip to Las Vegas and i'll be back again on my next visit

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KiwHIN9s-MGS3pMsZy9xgg.text: Mr. V from San Antonio.  Great service and killer bbq.  Great food all around.  Can't wait to go back!

x_PSKEKrbR75-JKx6CAXkQ.text: Probably the best American bbq spot to go to in Vegas

RoByLdIhTOuxYgbNTjr2mQ.text: Brisket!!! plain n simple the one thing that consistently keeps me coming back when I am in LasVegas.  Make sure you have your GPS on because you'll blow right by this place because its tucked back off the strip.  The have GREAT food and the prices are good.

vJn_mg-2VIaWJY1ADxJ6dg.text: Omg so I went there yesterday and I can say it takes out famous daves the staff was so friendly including the owner one of the workers I forgot his name but he let us know how they started and everything it was nice that they take their time to talk to customers I loved the BBQ sauce and the damn hot sauce was really good too I walked out of there with 3 jars of BBQ and 1 of their Rub to bring back home .... When I'm in Vegas again this will have to be one of my spots to come to :)

--xnymO6aEa0NGxSvKm__Q.text: You can't get better BBQ than this in LV. It's BBQ heaven. They offer an All You Can Eat! We had the brisket, chicken, spare ribs and the Best Beef Rib this side of the Atlantic Ocean. So tender and juicy! All the food has serious BBQ flavor.  The beans (omg) are what BBQ beans should always be. Don't forget to ask for the Damn Hot BBQ sauce, just to kick up the flavor to spicy. Great staff that will make your visit more enjoyable.

mUtUJbKE9u6QR3lxHlBTCg.text: I saw this place on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives and thought I would check out something local the next time I was in Vegas (as in non-chain and not in a major hotel).  Pulling into the location, it looked a bit shady.  I hesitated.  Then I noticed there was a good sized line inside.  Maybe this is a local favorite after all then, right?  The staff was super friendly.  The food was meh.  I've from Tennessee and I grew up having great BBQ so this didn't quite meet my expectations, especially after reading all the rave reviews online.  I would probably not venture this way again, but I also wouldn't complain if I got dragged along with someone else.  Maybe I have a different standard, but I though it was just okay.

iXZaLMgbfTQ1V8dthA8JqA.text: Had the outlaw burger. Fantastic!!!! Would go there again, my buddy had the ribs, they fell off the bone!!!!....whatever meat you get, get in pulled. Its juicier that way. Or all you can eat meat plate for 25.00 cant go wrong....

ZyyJpc3I0ntiND3Bhl8T8w.text: Me and my family are regulars, but stopped coming for a bit due to price changes and latency issues. Previously I gave them a one star review due to this. But we came back although it's not what it once used to be, they are definitely trying to make a solid effort to improve. I was greeted upon entering and told by the pit master, "let's see if we can do better this time around." It was definitely an improvement and me and my family will continue to be regulars at one of our favorite BBQ joints in Vegas.

mOvSGWk1KL3sl4sj8DyqjA.text: Hands down some of the BEST BBQ I have had in a LONG time!!! This is now my staple go-to place! Service was AWESOME! Food was PERFECT! The corn bread was like CAKE! The bacon potato salad was like Mom's but with BACON! The Mac n Cheese, was on point! Again, the experience and the service was just AMAZING!

dBOlUi-n2OPmZD25tgYJqw.text: All you can eat BBQ, costs a little bit but you get to keep going up to the counter and stuffing your face with new delicious things. All the BBQ is well executed and seems like a great family run joint.

plerQotEU1ZKFdK3ZJlgPQ.text: From a Kansas Citian-home of the world's best BBQ.  This place is outstanding; will definitely be back on my next trip to Vegas.  Great food, great service and very friendly employees.

cbTD9AFN3NKqecACGz33qA.text: I was recommended here from a friend who knows his food. And we where deffinatley good food

pr5x08q6-YwKyh2PxC0LTQ.text: Awesome!!!! Had the spare ribs, brisket and pork and was phenomenal! Highly recommended with fast and friendly service.

-aOYaXZTeE65FmRjtxMTYw.text: Simply delicious, the ribs were super tender and the brisket was out of this world. Friendly staff, and the food was out in no time.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Duo- choice of two meats, a side and a drink. All for $10!

br62ndNoXFMvpPWkSMhvcA.text: One of the few places left in town that understand and shares my love for beef ribs. Although I've had all there stuff and it's always amazing. Noting is better to me than a nice fat juicy beef rib! Thanks so much guys your all scholarly gentlemen :)

_NgwljYYaeaHV0RS1VSYcA.text: I haven't eaten at this establishment. I just watched the staff prepare the food on the travel channel.  No one wears gloves. The RAW MEAT LOAF IS MIXED WITH BARE HANDS!  When "liquids" are added...more bare hands.  Meat cooked more bare hands...oh my.

lRIHyMnt4ByZTqm0GONBYg.text: "I found love on a two way street and lost it on a lonely highwaay"(Stacy Lattisaw). We decided to hit this place up after a night of Tikibombs in Frankie's Tiki Room.   I mean its only RIGHT. This is a little hole in the wall place but packs the BOOM! In BBQ.  I Had the 3 meat platter which you can choose any combo of meats.  I opted for the ribs, brisket, and smoked sausage or as I call it The Holy Trinity. We also shared Bacon potato salad, loaded mashed potatoes, and macaroni and cheese. YES, YES and YES.  The BBQ was so tender and savory and topped with a vinegar based BBQ sauce that enhanced the all the smoked goodness it could make a grown man cry.  Now to address the sides....as if the BBQ wasn't enough to leave you in meat nirvana the sides comes at you from the left and pulls you in tight.  It comforts you and makes for a very happy tummy.  I am very stingy with my ratings so the 5 stars speaks the universe about this place..but hey you'll only share my joy until you go in and taste for yourself....let the meat sweats begin.

w3cRA8riy4jFjeRHGw77XQ.text: I don't understand how this place has so many good ratings. Terrible place for bbq especially for how much they charge. I ordered their 3 meat combo.  Their meat was dry and the amount that they give you is just disappointing . I had better bbq then this crap. I'd rather go to Famous Daves atleast you get what you pay for.

yTeSyAyAcWJ8Qf0Y1v74DQ.text: I don't know how this place gets so many stars. For the price the serving sizes are terrible. The brisket and pork were dry and so were the hush puppies. I'm extremely disappointed in this place. If you've had Big Paul's bbq then you know what real bbq is like and this isn't it.

CSlXsFGIYQEZeXGkPGVOvQ.text: Absolutely delicious! Better than Phil's BBQ and much cheaper! If your craving comfort food like meat loaf, hush puppies, peach cobbler or banana cream pudding than this is the place to indulge!

bjfB2zRayf_-1ipLJWmMiA.text: What a great find, thanks to Yelp! Vegas has just about everything, but after 4 trips I was still in search of some BBQ! This time I finally remembered to check yelp and I found a gem. This place is a short Uber away, has great (read: normal) prices, and really tasty food. If you're a sweet tea lover like me, look no further!   They're an Arkansas-loving joint, so that's exciting is you have ties to that southern state. The food was all good, fresh, and flavorful. I had the BBQ pulled pork sandwich meal with corn nuggets (new to me) and tea. I think it was $14...maybe? In Vegas I feel like that's a steal! Plus, service was pretty quick and the staff members were all friendly and sweet.  The rest of my group had ribs, all the sauces, waffle fries, mac and cheese, the sampler platter, and corn bread. YUM!   Be advised that it's not a huge place, so if you do have more than 4 people maybe consider going at an off-peak time or prepare to sit at a picnic table out front.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet tea! YAAAAS!

MxYe4utX-qJI_HXpQRxvAA.text: So I can't say nothing wrong with this place.... Fantastic, famous and absolutely wonderful. Me and my husband decided to give this place a try. Yes it is all that!! Loved the flavors of the bake beans and Mac n cheese the meats were perfect proportions and the three meat plate combo with three sides were a  great price... fed the both of us. I new BBQ spot definitely recommend this place.. Calling all foodies and Elites... come over and get impressed by the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And a bit of heaven peach cobbler with ice cream
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Various sauces
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. With three sides

UvDcPIE_Xvbi_StvcTycAw.text: This was the best BBQ place I have ever been to. The food was absolutely delicious. The macaroni and cheese  it is a must get! I got the chicken and rib plate.  I chose the "mama sauce" but, the name might be incorrect.  It has a sweet but tangy taste.  I recommend getting the all you can eat plate. You will be able to try a little of everything from the menu. I was disappointed I didn't choose that. It is worth the price!  I'll be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken, ribs, potato salad and macaroni and cheese like no other!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My nephews, I&#39;m not sure what it is called. He added an extra patty. He said the taste was awesome. He did not finish it.

DXXDe-PXzNd7oorLeLa58Q.text: Love this place. Casual environment, great employees very friendly and the meats are excellent.

beBDGPwZfrkvHlgA_KZ1cQ.text: My boyfriend and I love southern BBQ and after going to Phil`s San Diego, we thought we would never find a place that comes close to their level of BBQ perfection. This hole in the wall place is a must visit!  That is until we came here to Rollin Smoke. We ordered two different platters to try as much of the menu as we could. They have the absolute BEST pork ribs I have ever had in my life. St. Louis and baby back and spare ribs, they were all delicious!! So tender and fall of the bone and meaty with the perfect smokiness to it. We also got half a rack of beef ribs and they were definitely meaty and smoky and delicious but we love the ones from Phil's more. The one thing I didn't enjoy as much was the brisket as it was all chopped up like it was for babies. The pulled pork was good too and it came with a couple of soft warm dinner rolls that I used to make pulled pork mini sliders with. They have so many options for sauces and I had to try them all. In the end I couldn't pick a favorite because they were all so good.   The Mac and cheese was so good and the waffle fries were super yummy. My favorite had to be the friend corn fritters (don't think that's what they're called but you'll see it). Fried balls of cream corn inside what it tasted like to be cornbread batter. This was my dream come True. Can't believe this was my first time here even though I have visited Vegas countless times.   This is definitely a bucket list must try thing to do in Vegas!!

9aJRXP9g9kuMGOCYSCLZrg.text: My boyfriend & I drove to Vegas for the day & was craving BBQ. Saw all the hype comments on yelp & thought to give it a try. We got the plater that feeds two & OH MY, the baby back ribs are amazing! The meat falls off the bone. The mashed potatoes were soooooo good, they used fresh bacon bits. Shredded bbq pork is delicious even when you dip it any choice of bbq sauces.   I would highly recommend it if you're in town & craving some BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a0pJnClPODI8s70r3Wg7pg.text: If you get away from the Strip, you'll find this incredibly charming BBQ restaurant calling your name. What called my name was the $35 AYCE deal, quite literally a bargain for any big eater and lover of barbecue. I can't recall ever seeing All-you-can-eat at a dedicated BBQ restaurant that wasn't just some dinky buffet. AYCE gets you access to everything on the menu, from mains to desserts, and it's well-worth the money. My favorite main dish here would have to be the giant baked potato, a beast of a spud topped with meat, sour cream and cheese sauce. It cured my carb deficiency in a right hurry! Most importantly to me, the people who run this establishment are incredibly polite, friendly, and welcoming. It's a great mix of values that describe the best of places I've eaten in Vegas, Victorville and beyond. If you love burgers or BBQ, you need to eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The wings are not small by any stretch! The &#34;Dam&#34; sauce (far left) features the ghost pepper, so you know you&#39;ll be on fire
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The decor is original and offbeat to the point of being charming. Who puts a burger in a fish tank!?

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seems like the &#34;Outlaw Burger&#34; is something of an unofficial food challenge. There&#39;s NO WAY that thing is fitting in your mouth!

ATSXTWd9P2ELoZoGw4BERA.text: Amazing BBQ every single time.  I have been coming here for years, and it is time to rave about it.  The location is not great, but I find that to be a great sign of awesome food inside. I have tried every item, and I love them all. The meat options are delicious, and I keep coming back for me. I have tried many BBQ places, but I keep coming back to this one. Great deal of food for a reasonable cost. I always leave full, and satisfied.

Vr3WUhioqQTtgAo0KtIwfA.text: Rollin Smoke has high reviews for a reason, because the BBQ here is excellent. It seems the owner knows how to prepare the best BBQ in Las Vegas. We didn't eat anything on the menu that wasn't good. So, if you are looking for a recommendation, I would recommend everything on the menu.   The sides here are excellent. You cannot go wrong with anything that you order here. The prices are good for a BBQ place and they have an All you can eat option.

v_1FjPY06dkU4cRLC1yl4A.text: This is my new favorite BBQ place.  The food is amazing.  I had the brisket sandwich sliced instead of chopped, baked beans and some damn good corn fritter thingies.    Something like 6 different sauces.  Every one of them tasted great.  The hot one was really good too but a little bit hot for me.  The rest made it to my food.   Along with all of the soda flavors, they have a few different choices of cool-aid.  Such an awesome idea.  I went for the unsweet iced tea.  Their cups are practically souvenir cups and are going in our China cabinet :)  The service is very very friendly.   It doesn't take much to be nice so why can't this be the norm for all restaurants!?  Atmosphere inside:  A+  got to sit at the picnic tables.  Just goes with BBQ. Atmosphere outside:  was great weather so sitting on the picnic tables out front is perfect. Neighborhood: ehh, it's off the strip Vegas. Taste: A+++ Quantity:  actually pretty good portions. Employees:  A+++  not over the top but genuinely friendly.   Cost:  BBQ ain't cheap but I didn't feel like it was over priced, especially in a tourist area.  Went for lunch and tried to talk my family into going back for dinner or brunch tomorrow but they vetoed me.

JndbsPtcQ59IMOqmxxZBmA.text: Went in Labor Day at 6:00 PM, obviously the cook was done for the day.   I ordered a 3 meat combo. Brisket was good, hot link was sneaky good real mellow but as soon as I told my wife it was bland, the flavor hit me, deceptively good. ribs cooked right but ...ehh. 7 of ten.   My wife had two meats, said the chicken was not as good as what we do at home.   Overall meal suffered because the food was warm at best, maybe we need to get there earlier???  I would go back one more time just to check, it was late on a holiday.

cuzQcqfHX9wSqEvC_Zj4QA.text: We lucked up on this place through the recommendation of a valet at the Artisan Boutique Hotel many years ago. He was so enthusiastic about the barbecue he insisted on sharing his with us. We were instantly hooked and make it a point to visit Rollin Smoke each time we visit Vegas. Each item on the menu is equally delicious. Should you visit, you will not be disappointed.

lUpzD-SJak0-Q0TzuuD4kg.text: Soooo good!  That hardest thing was to decide what to eat.  It all smelled & looked delicious.  I had the two taco special,  chicken.  It was awesome and filling.  Great friendly service! Hard to come by these days.  Highly recommend!  PS:  don't move ChumLee!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken taco, loaded mashed potatoes &amp; beans!  All soooo good!

f1FmeXjF822Gln8BI5AUMQ.text: I ordered delivery for my visiting family. I'm a barbq and southern food snob. Every single Dish they delivered (and we ordered practically everything on the menu!) was addictively delicious! ALL of Their meats are perfectly spiced and cooked and their side dishes are perfect! Try the greens, Mac and cheese, and something sweet for dessert!   You can't order a bad meal here!

hPP7P82zta0T9nRE2zSwcQ.text: The food is really, really worth the trip.  I grew up in the south but traveled most of my adult life..That being said it's hard to find really good brisket, cornbread, etc.. This is now become one of my favorites.. They don't cover or drown the meat with a ton of sauce...you can actually enjoy the flavor & texture...

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Family outing

N1ktXuwkjmK4w4koU0viww.text: Wow!  This place is authentic!  Great food, great service and very friendly employees. My son had just eaten here while on a business trip and texted us about the great food. Since we were on our way to lunch we changed plans and headed for Rollin Smoke.   We both had the 3 meat platter with one side and it hit the spot. We chose the sliced brisket, ribs and chicken. The brisket was the best I've had and so was the chicken. The ribs were brought home and are awaiting my next snack time.   Prices are reasonable and the menu offers a wide variety of choices. This should be a definite stop for locals or visitors.

WzMaN99Zv9CZw3IQG3FmCg.text: Went to this BBQ joint in Vegas with my wife today. Great service, fair prices, and high quality food. The selections are numerous and the St Louis Ribs, Hot Links, and Brisket are a must! Add their wide selection of sauces (all are homemade and available for retail sale, you just need to be patient as they make them fresh at the time you order).  We will definitely be returning! With the general lack of high quality, TASTY, fair priced food in the valley, a BBQ place like this is a hidden gem!

gFZ8Iv-CLrpjePB5gxdOsg.text: The 3 meat plate was the jam!  Tasty sides of Mac and mashed made it off the chain!  Service was fast and great. To top it off they had grape drink (aka grape koolaid) on tap!!!  Definitely a go to when in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 meat plate. Was off the chain!!!  Side of Mac and mashed we&#39;re just as tasty!!!

Eufbdl5XDkmwlT7Bs7RsCQ.text: This place is great!!! Awesome bbq, Smoked meat Loaf the best !! That picture is the outlaw Burger stacked with onion Strings it's a beast.they have corn nuggets just try them you won't be disappointed also Don't forget they have cool-aid and country time lemonade

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yS1FLtDtxM_9BsC8uV_czw.text: Looking for great bbq? Look no more and feast on their delicious selection of burgers, brisket and ribs.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ogNXU3JW0uWjzMrt8Vb-nw.text: Today, Me and my friend went here for some BBQ. It was amazing! The food was great. The lines were short. And the food was amazing!

kSmIhWUYB8HnXJlGku8cwg.text: Hands down best BBQ in Las Vegas. I have now been a couple times and quality has always been consistent. As soon as you walk in the aroma of their signature bbq-sauce floods your nose and the picnic style tables and comfortable setting puts you at ease.  I recommend the brisket or the burger!

sunEvnwDsl9lWM1Lpax8gw.text: Great food! ! Visiting from san diego,  definitely try the meat trio! !  Service was fast an definitely a good experience

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food an service

cn4n6SLvYOkQFwUiHlQ01w.text: A place hidden off the strip. The place is nothing to look at but the BBQ? OMG some good stuff right there. I love their ribs, yeah, all of them. Their green beans are amazing. GO! You wont be sorry. The selections of sauces are amazing and each compliment the food so well. I judge BBQ by how it tasted before you add the sauce. These come with a ton of flavor and an amazing bark on the carved meats. This is just a handy tip,their cups for soda are re-usable and were so handy to take back to our hotel and use for beverages that actually need a big cup to enjoy.

tQYW_MSzSzOwDkphpg5hrA.text: This is hands down the best BBQ I have ever had.  I had the three meat platter that consisted of beef hot links, ribs and chopped brisket.  It included Cole slaw, and a corn muffin - which was the best I ever had.  I have had both the sliced and chopped brisket and prefer the chopped as it is more moist and juicy...you will defiantly walk away with the meat sweats!  If you are a local from Las Vegas you can save 10% off the bill by letting them know at the register.  If you are in Vegas do not pass up this place if you like bbq!

qyrdeE2ExPABCuX-EkorQw.text: I'm primarily interested in ribs when I visit a BBQ spot and usually do not visit a place if I don't see smoke and can't smell BBQ from about a block away.  There is a big pit on the side of the building but I got close to it and it wasn't hot, not even warm so it was obvious that it had not been used that day.  I have also noticed that "BBQ" places that serve things like nachos, seafood and meatloaf usually have bad BBQ.  I saw excellent reviews here so I decided to give this place a shot.  I ordered the two meat duo with spare ribs and links.  Took forever, about 25 minutes, they should be able to get food out faster, especially if the food is not cooked to order.  The ribs were OK, very little flavor, rather bland, the links tasted like spicy hot dogs.  I also don't understand the green onions.  I've never, ever seen that on BBQ but as I looked around they were on everything.  I'm still on my quest to find decent BBQ west of Texas, doesn't look like it's gonna happen.  I've had BBQ at a gas station in Texas that is better than anything I've found in Cali or Nevada.

efpYepkQvTxfDHRseENQtw.text: If I ever decide to give up having a meaningful physical relationship with another human being, I will buy a booth in this place and proceed to eat BBQ and "the fixins" for the rest of my days.  Until that time, I try to keep my visits here to a couple a month.  Given how good the food is, that has proven difficult.  Two weeks ago, I took some co-workers here and one of them ordered the fried shrimp.  I know!  Stupid, right?  WRONG!  Because she eats like a bird, she gave each of us a piece and dang!  That was some amazing fried shrimp.  The batter has a lot of spices and is similar to the cornmeal batter used for catfish.  So good.  The regulars in our group agreed that the fried shrimp is our next order.    Lately, I've noticed that business is really picking up.  Glad to see it, but I considered keeping my mouth shut about this place from now on.  My duties as a Yelper won out in the end.  I go to lunch pretty early, so my current mission is to make it here when the greens are ready (these take a hot minute to cook right), because there's really not much I love more than good greens.  If my meaningful physical relationship with another human being does not work out, I may marry The Pulled Piggy with a side of kickin beans.

hiZW2_2AzUcj3SveWqPTgA.text: I really shouldn't be writing a review while in a food coma!! But this place is amazing. It is one of those places where every time I go to Vegas I will be stoping by!

fbpkgoEgTmR_wEhInQy21A.text: This is the rare restaurant that lived up to the hype.  As many note, Rollin' Smoke is not in the best area.  But, there is a decent amount of parking close to the restaurant.  There are also plenty of places to sit, including tables outside.  But, since I came during the Las Vegas summer, there was no way I was sitting outside.  I was having trouble deciding between the Outlaw Burger and the 2 meat duo with pork and brisket.  The guy that was helping me suggested the meatloaf, which is made up of both brisket and pork and smoked.  It comes with potatoes on the bottom and BBQ sauce and fried onions on the top with pickle slices and a roll on the side.  I added fried okra, because if a place has fried okra I have to try it.  I was glad I took this guy's suggestion.  The slab is ENORMOUS, it easily fed me for dinner as well, and I'm a big eater.  The smoke in the meatloaf was incredible, very impressive.  I could have used more fried onions, but what dish couldn't?  I'll order more next time I eat here.  When you had a bite with the sauce and the onions, it was the perfect blend of crunch, meat and a bit of spice.  The okra was very good, but not the best I've had.  Service was fantastic, it took a bit to get my food, but they are super popular and making your food when you order.  So, it's worth waiting a few minutes.  Highly recommended, and the leftovers did great that evening with a second heating...

iQYlYqUm62U9CYQ5voKaAw.text: This was my first real BBQ experience and I couldn't have asked for anything more! David the owner was so welcoming and helped my boyfriend and I order. We got the half slab beef ribs, Mac n cheese, corn nuggets, and the trio slider combo (2 brisket, 1 chicken) all for under $30! Everything was delicious and juicy. David even came over to check on us at the end of our meal which was greatly appreciated and added to the comfy, homey vibe of the restaurant. It's a little off the strip but definitely worth the drive. I'll be coming back next time I'm in Vegas without a doubt!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 beef sliders, 1 chicken slider and a side of corn nuggets
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half slab beef ribs

Umcgjr2ctfLsHtEI7BnVAw.text: Another post Caesar's craps session visit to Rollin' Smoke.  Arrived around 1 pm and the place was still hoppin' with the lunch crowd.  Ordered totally off special menu:  Smoked meatball sub with side ( went with mac n cheese) and drink ( $9)  Slider trio with side( picked cole slaw) - meats were pulled pork, sausage and chicken ($11 ?? )   Rib combo - beef, st louis and baby included ( $16)  we've yet to try the ribs since the other food filled us up !  The meatball sammie was actually 3 sliders - each had cheese and a decent sized, dense meatball drowning in a very spicy sauce - loved it !   The trio sliders - also spiked with the spicy bbq sauce - loved the pulled pork and the sausage - would've preferred brisket for the 3rd slider ( probably could've had if i asked ) - large pile of meat on each slider;  smoky goodness - all good !  As usual, the sides complimented the meat perfectly.  I've kicked my rating up a star since they've maintained the quantity/quality of the meat AND the service was excellent.  Oh yes, I'll be back !!  pics included

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slider trio - yummy
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked meatball slider - Spicy !

CUrqSw2UkjxsIA2kEqMIZg.text: I want to give this place five stars on their catfish alone but, sadly it's not a fish and chip shop. The bbq brisket and chicken is nothing to right home about. Small portions and lacking in flavor. I want to like this place as much as my mates do but, for me the bbq at the Venetian is much better at the same price point.

kGTCItKnC8FXIWziPIIIQA.text: This place doesn't look like much from the outside, but every time I've been here there's been line. There's a reason for that. The food is TO. DIE. FOR. I am from Tennessee so most of the BBQ out here doesn't suit me. But when I took my first bite of the pulled piggy sandwich I swear I had an out of body experience. This place is seriously the best BBQ in town.

8b4cBtFtFiPCLz6z5gon8w.text: I am literally experiencing a food coma because of this place. Although everything was amazing, my favorite items were the corn nuggets and brisket. I got the 4 meat and 3 side plate that came with a drink for $20 + tax and tip. It was a great decision. Anyways, I was worried about the wait for the food, because the joint was packed. It took less than ten minutes for us to receive our order. I will definitely be back.

yNn6D-ctMffzL_791EE7Hg.text: When Ms. Brenda is away, the atmosphere is not the same. We miss her presence during our lunch break. The food is always delicious and hot! Love you guys to pieces!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best customer service you can ever get. Ms. Brenda is loving, kind, and oh so sincere. She lights up the room. Love her to pieces.

mL71hMCxhGEi2c8k_vNwHQ.text: This place is really good. Got the pit platter. 5 kinds of meat. Sausage, chicken, pork, brisket and ribs. Also comes with 3 sides. I will be back.

0xBTsLJ6sF07HbVxemJSIg.text: Some of the best BBQ I have ever eaten!!!! I had the brisket 3 ways and it was amazing.

rFzOlWCCqFdr4Mx8pW32oQ.text: Good food. Terrible service. Indifferent staff.  My friend who ordered right after me got his order 40 minutes before I did. They lost my order twice--I asked for help when I watched the 25 people who were after me in line get their food while I still waited.    Employee checked in the back, disappeared for awhile. I wait ten more minutes and then find her again. This time she asks for my receipt and disappears for another ten minutes. Only sheepish apologies are offered  While I like the food, I would probably not go here again because of their indifferent attitude about their service error.

R_aYf7MkQxhy1uC0CAAFEw.text: Wow 3 smokers in the parking lot. Hard to add any more Kudos to previous reviews. Arrived  around 12 noon and lunch was in full swing. There were 4 people ahead of us in the order line. Had to wait a little while as only one person was taking orders. (Not a complaint just a comment)  The order taker was friendly and conscientious. He would repeat the order back to you after entering it into the system.The entire time we were there the order line never had fewer than 3 people.  Food is delivered to the table by calling out your name to determine where you were seated. The tables that were mentioned in another review have been replaced with ones that have clean stainless steel tops.  The following items were all excellent with the right amount of smoke. Pulled Pork, juicy with just the right amount of sauce. Sliced Brisket was fork tender.  Ribs perfect fall of the bone. Several delicious sides. Jalapeno cole slaw, pinto beans. Sorry no room for dessert. Maybe next time  These folks are doing some fine BBQ. They could be serious contenders at Memphis in May if they choose to compete.  Keep on Smokin!!

5u4IuPe0KrdRxhm-RqLv-Q.text: Once again, I've found a 5 star BBQ that is not even 500 miles from home... nor anywhere close to the south?! *sigh  This place fires on every cylinder!  From the main meats down to the sides.  I mean, I wish I could in some sense describe my experience here so that it even comes close to the actual event....   I ordered a rib basket, and for $14.99 I got a beef rib, pork ribs, and a half rack baby back rib.  Now that may not sound like much, but the ribs are HUGE.  The beef rib was the largest I've ever seen.  The meat was tender, juicy, and just shaved off the bone with my plastic fork.  The pork ribs were good, more dense as it should be but still juicy, flavorful meat.  And I can tell you I've never had a baby back rib that even came close to this baby back rib.    Onto the sides.  I've never had a jalapeno slaw that came close to this one, a fantastic blend of spice and sweet, not soppy wet and not dry either.  Mash potatoes with melted cheddar and chives!  Holy crap.  The potato salad was fantastic.  Now I have one rule about BBQ is that I ALWAYS have room for the banana pudding.  I'm sorry to say I broke my rule, so I am not going to be able to inform on the banana pudding.  On my next trip to Vegas, you better believe this will be on my list to return to.  Maybe twice :)  And this says something, because the BBQ place is not a walk from the strip, it's a definite taxi ride, but if you are a fan of the show, Counts Kustoms is a little less than a mile walking distance from this place, up the same road so you may kill two birds with one stone.

kErLQZCLUtEMkFfphNEzbw.text: The only thing I can suggest is needs more smoke or different type of wood. Smoke ring needs to be better.I come form the Midwest and smoke meat all the time not as good as them or even close but this is my opinion. The other is need more moisture. But great potions great price you need to get there ASAP.

EnX4_uojw2VXwpJNa-UFTA.text: The ribs were over cooked and dried out, and the sweet potatoes and mac & cheese were bland. But worst of all, the place simply wasn't clean. We did like the sweet tea and baked beans, and the servers were friendly enough, but that doesn't make up for the dirty floors and soiled table clothes.

P38t291C0VPJvPZiGtXgyw.text: Our family of 4 stopped here for lunch.  We try to avoid The Strip, so the anti-glitz location and easy access from the freeway were pluses for us.   The moment we stepped out of the car and caught a whiff of the 'cue, we knew we were in the right place.  Dusty at the order desk was great.  His southern hospitality was a welcome break from our power drive (SLC to LA). The adults in our party shared The Pit Special so we could try lots of things.  For $20 you get a choice of 4 meats and 3 sides.  We had the chicken, pulled pork, brisket and spare ribs with cole slaw, onion strings,  and potato salad.  We filled up and still had enough left over for one of us to eat for dinner.  We will return!

kswsUsOrLQ9f0Dvx0LyP9A.text: Get here now to have some of the best BBQ in Vegas! Awesome food nice people clean inside dining.

TTMIyde_JUlEuYOr4TF7UA.text: The best BBQ that I have ever tasted and I love me some BBQ!  Our family travels a lot and I try to sample BBQ where ever we go and this was hands down the best so far.  I come to Las Vegas a few times a year because my friends and I drag race so this will definitely be on my list of food places that I must eat at before going back home to Los Angeles, CA.

4HRSzPr7FY76HBh91p_KKw.text: After hearing about Rollin Smoke from one of their employees, Dusty, that came into my shop to get a tire replaced, my wife and I decided to give it a try. Being someone who barbecues and smokes a great deal, I was a bit skeptical since other "bbq" joints we've tried just never measured up. I am happy to say this one did. We both had a three meat combo, with both of us having the pulled pork and brisket. My wife went with the spare ribs and I had the hot link for our third meat. We both found the brisket to be moist and tender with a great flavor and just the right amount of smoke. The pulled pork was moist and tender as well, though it could have used a bit more smoke and maybe some bite to it, more of a personal preference though. Fpr the sides my wife had the waffle fries which were good, but it's hard to screw up fires. I went with the bacon potato salad which was excellent, I also got an order of the corn nuggets which were nothing short of Oh my God good. Though it is a bit of a drive from where we live, we will be back.  To Dusty and the rest of the folks at Rollin Smoke, thanks for giving Vegas good bbq.

_q3SWQAwAVtzqV8xfEJAXw.text: I've been wanting to go here for quite some time. I tried their food at the Las Vegas Ribfest, and it was decent. I had company in from out of town and we are a bunch of gluttons, so all you can eat bbq sounded great. We checked the website to make sure they still had it. They did, and the website said $24.95 per person. We walked in, and there was a piece of paper over the price on the menu board that said $34.95. I told the girl that was ringing us up that her website said $24.95, and I didn't think it was right to do the bait and switch, we had driven two cars 20 miles to get there. She said "you could access the website?"! I pulled it up on my phone and showed her. She went to talk to someone in the back, then returned and said, sorry, that's the price. I said, "so you're not going to honor your advertised price?". She said, "do you want to talk to somebody else?". I said only if it might make a difference. She went and got the owner. He told me "sorry, I had to raise the price or I'd be out of business, that's been our price for three months". I of course said, "you've had three months to update your website and you're not willing to honor your advertised price?". He said sorry. I really wanted to eat there, it smelled great. I can not however patronize a place that will not honor their advertised price, especially if it's been wrong for three months on their website. I can't imagine how that can't be intentional. I will not ever walk back into that place.

PiL7Ffn4fx6QfGVBkptBdQ.text: Havent found any real good BBQ in town till I tried this place. They just opened and renovations were in order but the food was top notch. The staff is very friendly and eager to earn your patronage.  They cater, deliver and sell by pound. The meat is tender! Definately will return, my top southern style BBQ joint

UMswpBp030qLMp1cwINR2Q.text: Looking for GREAT BBQ in LV? Not much selection but 1 mile off strip is some of the best BBQ I have ever eaten. Look for smoking smokers in parking lot. If you are a beef rib fan as I am you will simply not find a better smoked beef rib as good as this except maybe in Texas. Baby backs were top notch. Spares were also excellent but I like mine a bit more fall of the bone then these. Did not try pulled pork but will next time. Not fancy and no booze but who cares? Area is industrial but safe. Quick cab ride from strip.

_gYz5w-Up5_Ic085bKd2CQ.text: Finally got a chance to give this place a try. I got to say I was pretty disappointed. Maybe it was high expectations due to the many 4-5 star reviews, maybe I just don't know good barbeque when I eat it. By no means am i a BBQ connoisseur but here's my take on this place. I can only comment on the brisket and the sides I ordered. I got a to go order of 1lb. of brisket, a side of loaded mash, yams, & mac n' cheese. When I opened up the container with the brisket I was really irritated because it was chopped. Maybe that's my fault because I assumed it would be sliced. I know some places ask if you want it sliced or chopped like Dickey's but the cashier never asked so I guess I assumed. Ok fine it's chopped no crying over that. However it wasn't really even chopped it was really in small, tiny pieces, like the kind of little pieces that are left from sliced meat. I feel like it was all the scraps leftover from slicing. All of the pieces were dark, like the outer crust of the meat. I couldn't find any pieces in there that were grayish like it is in the center. This probably explains why it was overly salty since it was all the outer pieces. Thank goodness there was a slice of bread underneath because it would have been really hard to eat alone. I didn't even want to put any sauce on it since it was too salty. Oh and I got a little small container of sauce for 1lb of brisket but I guess in my situation it didn't matter. It just wasn't enjoyable at all. As far as the sides go, they were ok. Nothing spectacular. Yams were good, mac n cheese decent, loaded mash was similar to Dickey's mash which is decent. Maybe I need to try their brisket sliced, maybe I need to try something else on their menu. I don't know. I don't think I'll be going back any time soon which is too bad because I really wanted to love this place.

LgZju73mXxHOkZh8HvJ5xg.text: WOW ! The BBQ was very good. The brisket could be cut with the side of a fork which is how I judge BBQ. The peach cobbler was outstanding. After just one spoon I could tell this was heaven in a bowl.

K8LvlZqgynOlidc5AOqefw.text: best BBQ ever great taste nice portions great customer service and talk with owner Mom on the phone best potato salad ever

Gt3_LcNFvo4brAqUz5kQlw.text: I saw Rollin Smoke on the tv while in Vegas....decided to try something different.....what a disappointing meal. While trying to decide what to order a young very pleasant waitress/server offered a suggestion....can't remember the dish...but it had 3 diff kind of ribs, she said it would be enough for both myself and husband to share - I would strongly disagree the portions aren't that generous. An older man took our order...unfriendly, he'd be better staying in the back. The meal came with one drink...he slipped another $2 pop on the bill - the order came with a bun....in fact that is a slice of stale bread which the remainder of the meal is stacked upon...interesting! We also ordered a side of onion rings. Food arrived, minus onion rings - they would follow per server. The waffle fries were stone cold....I went to the front - grumpy guy wasn't there so I mentioned it to a server...she could've cared less, I offered her one to touch, it hadn't felt heat for some time, she declined, she said she'd get us fresh ones.....10 mins later, ribs gone - fries arrive - 3 mins later the worst onion rings arrived. I will say the ribs were good, but the kitchen obviously is disorganized and they need new frontline people. I will not follow the recommendations of any tv show again....McD's would have been a better choice for overall satisfaction.

1LKREavbctkSDaeyld10ug.text: Pulled pork sandwich was excellent.Baked beans had way too much black pepper,and the portion was extremely small for $2.00.Some of the prices are very high,28.00 for a full rack of baby backs?The guy that took my order said they would be using larger containers for the sides soon.As another poster said the staff is very friendly.I will definitely go back,its close to my work,and i would like to try some other menu items.

WTZj0F2W5Hn5w8FzNsiCWg.text: An awesome experience if your looking for great BBQ! It's more cafeteria style in that you order, then sit down and then the food is brought to you. I ordered the brisket sandwich. The brisket is very soft- almost as soft as the bread itself. The sandwich consisted of the brisket, BBQ sauce, and some chopped green onion. I appreciate the simplicity, but everything was the same texture and it could have used a crunch. I liked it though, and I would order it again. My boyfriend got the rib sampler which consisted of spare ribs, baby backs, and one beef rib. Baby back are excellent, spare ribs are everything you would expect, beef rib is very good as well but he doesn't normally like beef ribs. The sauce itself is good and I liked that they only gave one option, because that's the only one you need. We also had the sides Mac n cheese and jalapeno coleslaw. In my opinion, these two sides can be skipped. Mac n cheese tasted a little too artificially cheesy, and the coleslaw had an overwhelming jalapeno flavor. Cornbread was everything you want, sweet, soft, warm, delicious. What really made my experience though, was the amazing staff! They are so helpful and so nice throughout the entire experience. Go here. You'll love it.

Ynfzi-jtrnT4d-jV1qV1bQ.text: This is a new out of the way bbq restaurant that recently opened on Highland Dr.  I know that Highland is an industrial and seedy area west of the strip, but these guys are turning out some good bbq and making the most of what they have.  I recently tried the Biggin sandwich (brisket, pulled pork and sausage) and it was very tasty.  The sandwich was loaded with meat, literally falling off the bun, all of the meats were tender and had a good smoke flavor.  Along with my sandwich was a side of bacon potatoe salad, which was good.  The potatoe salad had good flavor and bacon in just about every bite.  Total for my sandwich, salad and drink ran me $11, which I think is a good value for quality food. This is a spicier bbq than most people are used to, but it works.  It reminds me more of a kicked up Kansas City style bbq.  I stuck with the original sauce, which was plenty hot and did not try the spicy or the extra spicy.  All in all this place is making some pretty good bbq, which is much needed in Las Vegas.  The biggest draw back is that they are located on Highland next to Diamond Cabaret and they are only open until 6pm.  I would like to see this place do well, hence my review, but their limited hours and location create much doubt. Good Luck!

s8fhOpemMyk18m1Dc-dywg.text: I am from Arkansas and eat a lot of BBQ... I tried the ribs and a BBQ wrap and both were awesome!! 1st BBQ place I have found that beat the ribs from my fav BBQ place In Arkansas! Very friendly staff!! I really hope there business does well. I recommend this place to everyone!!

Km4WipoECMIcHpIC2NQMsg.text: very good bbq.  when you walk in you can smell the smokey flavor.  wide variety on the menu at a reasonable price all entrees include a side and a drink.  i had the rib plate with 3 baby backs 2 spares and 1 beef rib with the mac and cheese.  i was very hungry when i walked in and couldn`t finish it the beef rib was hugh and tender mac and cheese was good.  my friend had the pit master special 4 meats 3 sides brisket was a little dry but still tasty we left very full and happy.  i will return!!!

PF-NSuMgcTIp5djbPrdrBA.text: Las Vegas, full of restaurants everywhere you walk on the strip. I decided to find the best bbq in Vegas and stumbled upon this place which is not on the strip. I'm glad I took a chance since it was off strip as it paid off. The vibe was very chill and the staff was great. The food was amazing. There were lots of choices. I decided to do the 3 meat combo platter with the chopped brisket, ribs and hot links sausage with the side of Mac and cheese. There were different sauces to choose from as well. I mostly left the meats alone as it didn't need any sauces but it def added some extra flavor to the brisket. Mac and cheese had great flavor as well. Overall great place off the strip although it wasn't too far off. Definitely recommended if you're around the area.

OIOgeoUtHedAafHQAl62sQ.text: Best bbq in Las vegas!!! Hands down!  Great food, friendly staff and relaxed vibes all around!

Y7Df564EMKnn0oY4RXM_KQ.text: Im confused about what the fuss is about this restaurant because it was terrible. If you have ever been to Texas, North Carolina, Oklahoma, or even Kansas City you have an idea about what I'm talking about because you can smell all of these places food as soon as you pull your car up.   First of all, I should have known better when I walked into the restaurant and didn't smell the smoke or the BBQ.  The food taste like they either boiled it first and then cooked it in an oven or kitchen grill top.   Secondly, you are given small portions for big time prices. Far to expensive for a mediocre food.  Now if you are from Las Vegas then I can understand why you would like them because you don't know any better.  Nevada Chicken is much more better and at an affordable price but they were closed for the 4 of July.

iGdGyDpxg4GmLjb0OLd2Hw.text: Oh brother... the fake reviews would lead you to believe this was edible... you'd be WRONG. Watered down sauce!!???? Beef ribs??? Where did they come from. Guaranteed to be let down.

ni5EmyaHbHjQjdWIKlcVSw.text: The stuffed potatoe is so good usually don't finish it all and save some for when I get hungry again

OJZr_fu8rN4zH15pPbdqig.text: Texans in exile rejoice!! The food here is better then anything Texas can offer!, yes, even (much) better then Rudy's, First and foremost there is the brisket, its do die for, you will not only pick every moesle off the plate but will lick the plate afterwards. Pouring ANY bbq sauce is sacrilege and should be punishable by law. Baby backs: most xlnt, the flavor is right on, zero room for improvement. Pulled pork: very good, great flavour. not the best I ever had but very good never the less Links: very good. Chicken: good flavour, mine was a bit on the dry side. Bbq sauces: all exceed all expectations, these folks know exactly what they are doing. Potato salad: very very good, xlnt flavor and consistency. Baked beans: good, abit too sweet for my taste, Coleslaw: just ok, didn't care much for it,I like mine crisp. All in all, even considering the "industrial location" its a 10 out of 10 Sure its not cheap....BUT well worth it.High dollar joints such as Texas de brazil got nothing on it, nothing.

Gjg3RU4b5BHmaZ9hb9xgwQ.text: Pretty good BBQ spot! I haven't tried many here in Vegas, so I can't definitively say that they are the best, but I enjoyed my meal.  First, don't come expecting anything fancy or close to it. While not a hole in the wall, it's pretty basic, picnic benches, wait in line to order your food (luckily, when we arrived, there was no wait, but there was a long one about midway through the meal), and a server will bring your food to you. You get your own drink (fountain drinks), plastic ware and plates. It's very close quarters, so people will be all around you while you eat.   The cashier was very sweet and a real jokester! She told us that they were out of everything but hot links and got a good laugh out of seeing my face drop! She reassured me that she was just kidding and we proceeded from there.   My friend and I decided to split the 5 meat, 3 sides platter ($27) and get an order of cornbread on the side. The platter comes with: chopped brisket, pulled pork, hot links, 1/4 chicken, and 2 ribs. Of everything, I liked the ribs best- they were tender and seasoned well. The hot links were spicy but good. The chicken was fine, but nothing to write home about. I was slightly disappointed in the brisket- it was SUPER fatty. Like almost all fat. It tasted great, but greasy and just not enough meat. The pork was pretty dry, sadly.  The sides, however, were all awesome. I could have eaten a tub of corn nuggets, they were that good! The Mac and cheese was delicious, and I really enjoyed the baked beans as well. The cornbread was yummy- sweet, dense, moist.  We had enough food to take some home, so that's always a plus. Someone did check on us during our meal, which also was appreciated.  Next time I crave some bbq, and I'm in the area, I may stop by!

2laxVUpEpOwVEjJ850f0UA.text: Four of us stopped here for lunch after hiking yesterday.  This has been bookmarked for a long time so I was glad we were going here.  We ordered on the right side where you enter and then waited at a table on the more dining room side.  I ordered the meat trio with pork, ribs, and hot link.  I also showed them my Yelp check in offer for a free pudding with a sandwich which they honored even though I didn't order a sandwich.  Since the trio is more expensive, I guess it doesn't matter.  I could tell from the time we walked in that they did their own smoking.  The place is heavy with the smell of smoke.  In fact, the first thing I did when I got home was to change my shirt.  The trio of meats was OK.  The pork was lukewarm at best and was dry.  It needed their BBQ sauce.   Two of us had gotten that and both were the same so there was something not right with the heating in the kitchen.  The meat fell off the ribs and was very good.  I'm surprised I liked them as much as I did.  The hot link was also good.  As a side I got the kicken beans but there was nothing these beans were going to kick.  They were just normal baked beans with some spice.  The banana pudding was OK.  It was nothing special and I'm sure it comes from some kind of bulk make your own package.  The serve yourself soda was great.  I was really thirsty after the hike and I went back and refilled several times.  I guess I sealed the deal yesterday and realized I'm really not a BBQ person.  Lunch was OK but it's nothing that I would crave nor go out of my way to get again.

Forget wasting your time on the strip . This food is amazing & excellent service I even saw the chef walk around ask every one how's everything. Best spot . *amazing food  * hidden gem * excellent service *clean

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dam good is right
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best bbq In the world !!!!! They need all bragging rights they earned it everything is delicious

RM0Ms1BpmNVHU2JYmA2USQ.text: Oh man, where do i start...  Now that I have recovered from the behemoth meal that was Rollin Smoke Barbeque, I can now gather myself to write this review.  First of all, if you come here expect to wait in a line. Don't worry though, the line moves fairly quickly.  Here's what we ordered:  1/2 slab baby back rib plate (4/5) - Very meaty ribs, not fall off the bone but still juicy. I give it a 4 instead of a 5 because they didn't remove the casing from the outside of the rib and it made it a little hard to eat. Overall, I liked it and would order again.  Outlaw burger (5/5) - My boyfriend who is a total burger aficionado tells me that this is the best burger he's ever had! Keep in mind that he loves bbq and bbq sauce so this burger did not cramp his style. There are tender pieces of brisket paired with ground beef, fried onion strings, barbeque sauce. Don't be shy because this WILL get messy!  Service is good here and people are really friendly. Unlike other casual dining places, the staff actually comes to check up on you after they've delivered your food.   Oh yeah and we checked in on yelp and they gave us a free ice cream sundae due to our burger order. Can't beat that!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 slab baby back rip plate w/bacon potato salad

1QtdauFm5_W1W03k32sDZA.text: Good thing me & my boys rented a car! This place has really good BBQ. The burnt ends are the best! Was visiting Vegas for the 1st time, while celebrating my birthday. This was the best food I ate during  the entire trip! This will be a spot i eat at every time I visit Vegas!

Hnh39kuR-XYNcc-QS9MP2w.text: I don't know why it took me over a year to come back. Rollin Smoke deserves more of my visits.  I brought a friend in today for dinner. It was her first time, so she spent a few minutes to look at the wall-sized menu. I also found myself staring and trying to decide what to get. I wasn't feeling up to tackling a big portion today, so I didn't get the outstanding Outlaw Burger again. Instead, I went with the Catfish Po Boy ($8.99) and a dessert of Country Berry Cobbler (free with purchase of sandwich and Yelp check-in).  I spent some time nibbling on my friend's Dad's Favorite, which is actually a sandwich (and thus qualifies for the dessert, although we didn't know it at the time). The brisket, pork, and hot links were all pretty tasty, although my friend could have done without the hot links because she is even more heat-averse than I am. She definitely went for a soda refill at least once.  My po boy took upwards of 10 minutes longer to come out, which I felt was a good sign. It was worth it for that catfish. It was quite moist and flaky, properly seasoned, and lightly crunchy on the outside. The catfish was definitely the star. No complaints about the spicy and tartar sauces, which I ended up spreading all over the sandwich. Lettuce was fine, lemon was helpful, and tomato brought a nice lightness. Only thing I would have liked is if the bread was buttered or something. The bread was merely toasted, and it actually looked a bit burnt, but thankfully had none of that off-putting flavor.  The country berry cobbler actually came out at the same time as the po boy. Unfortunately, by the time I was ready for dessert, the whipped cream had died. I actually had the peach cobbler last time, and while I would probably take the peach if forced to choose one, the berry cobbler is also very good and has enough of a tartness to offset the sweetness. It was also still warm, since it was served in a foam bowl, but I'm thinking that it contributed to the downfall of the whipped cream. I'll have to remember to try to ask for a delayed dessert presentation if I do this again.  I noticed that at least 3 tables had people doing the AYCE, and that made me wish that I hadn't had lunch today. I definitely want to try the all you can eat option some time. I enjoy that sort of thing, and I would finally be able to get my hands on all of their meats at once. Maybe I'll be ready to bump it up to 5 stars on that day, but until then, I still highly recommend Rollin Smoke Barbeque to all lovers of meat - and catfish.

yTJNmlOolf9pA0FTh22Flg.text: As with anyone who has been to Vegas a few times, you grow sick of the options on the strip, so one of my goals was to find a few places off the beaten path for us to try this next time around.   BBQ is really the reason I started yelping and everywhere I go, I usually seek out a BBQ place to try, so when I saw all the positive reviews of Rollin' Smoke, naturally I was a bit excited.   After our first long night in Vegas, we decided to skip breakfast and hit up Rollin' Smoke for an early lunch. Our cabby didn't know where it was, but it was a fairly quick ride from the strip.  Walking in, you are greeted with a glorious, thick, smoky smell that always accompanies good BBQ. As with all my BBQ reviews, I usually seek out a way to try out most of the meats, so we ordered the three Pit Specials (3 meats, 2 sides) and one order of the Beef Ribs. We quickly realized we ordered too much food for the four of us, but it was no matter, it was all delicious. The meats:  The Pulled Pork - The pulled pork was flavorful and moist, with a moderate smoky flavor. If you like pulled pork, you won't be disappointed by this.   The Hot Link Sausage - Despite how good the other meats were, the Hot Link made a good run to be one of my favorites. This isn't like most hot links you see which are red in color, both on the sausage meat and on the casing, with that annoying spicy flavor that seems to linger forever. These had a reddish-brown casing and a very delicious and unique flavor too them, with a nice spiciness as well. Definitely recommend.   The Ribs - The baby backs were delicious. Moist, tender, fall off-the-bone good. They seasoning added some nice flavor as did the moderate-to-strong smokiness. Another awesome dish.  The Brisket - The brisket we were served was from the lean side and had a nice smoke ring to it and despite being from the lean side, was not dry at all. Very solid brisket and only due to the greatness of the other dishes was this our least favorite.   The Beef Rib - Holy crap, the other reviewers were not wrong. This thing is amazing. It should be called The Flinstone or Brontosaurus Rib. It is massive. It has an amazing bark, strong smokiness, and tons of meat. It wasn't too gristly either, like many beef ribs tend to be. You get two ribs for 15 bucks and you think that is steep until you receive them. That will be more than enough to fill you up. A must order here.   The Sauce - I think good BBQ can be graded as to whether it needs sauce, and the BBQ here stands on its own. However, the sauce was pretty good if you like sauce. The rust-colored sauce starts out sweet and ends tangy and is fairly runny too. It is great for dipping and doesn't overpower the  meat.   So the 4.5 star rating for Rollin' Smoke is spot on and consider this to be a 4.5 star review to match as well. This Arkansas-style BBQ just made it on my mandatory to-do list in Vegas for each trip. If you like BBQ, don't pass this place up.

l348ghKhpxUNnXYOvuEL0A.text: This place is fantastic! Slightly pricey but not bad at all especially for what you get! We spent $35 for 2 of us and it was well spent! Excellent service! Packed on a random Tuesday night tells you something!

dEQWm-JzEhXydMpxfkI_4w.text: Food is great. I'm not a huge fan of their BBQ sauce but it's good. Just not my favorite. Place is always packed at lunch time hard to find a place to sit at times. I would eat here again. I think they need to come up with a couple more options on sauces. I know all places have their own unique style of sauce. Just my opinion.

vHrBRFxAhmPeeGQxfTWkkA.text: This is my favorite BBQ place in Las Vegas. The pulled pork and ribs are my favorite and the corn nuggets are a must! They're like a side and a dessert all in one. The sweet tea is always spot-on as well. It's usually a pretty steady crowd during lunchtime on weekdays. I've never been there for dinner or on weekends. Everyone I've ever gone here with also loves it.

rexJEybGAtCvG7VurX6MDA.text: You have got to be kidding me guys...It's 106 degrees outside, your prices are not fast food and you expect us to sit and sweat inside your restaurant and eat. Not only is it disgusting, it's downright RUDE to your customers. Who wants to sit and smell people's body odors along with your smokey BBQ...What a waste of my time today....Get a clue and act like a real vegas eatery, not some cheap hole owners that can't afford to run the A/C at $20. bucks per person.

gstdljdLpzqyegoJ_JiiQA.text: The BBQ is absolutely fantastic here! I had the brisket sandwich and cornbread and it was amazing. When my friend ordered their famous burger and they ran out of it, they took care of him and made him something extra special. I would definitely come back here.

uLiXSxZUamg5p4cdqLruWg.text: Loved the food!!!   The only reason why I did not give it 5 stars because the set up is a bit confusing. 2 entrance doors one to the dinning area and the other to the main entrance with a few tables, does not have any signage IE seat your self, order here...  So at first we sat down and waited 10 minutes and we realized that we had to order up front.  The menu is massive with all these delectable choices and sides and the smell inside makes you even hungrier.  The writing on the board on the wall is a bit small and intimidating since there are so many things to choose from.  When you get to the counter they only have one menu for you to look at so it holds up the line when you are trying to order.  I chose the mixed platter and the girl at the counter choose my meats and I had potato salad and mac n cheese as my sides, friend ordered all you can eat.  Food took a little bit longer than I would have wanted to but it was 4th of July weekend so it is totally understandable.  When our food arrived it was hot, and it looked amazing.  The food tasted even better than it looked if that is even possible.  I had baby, short and beef ribs and my friend had one of everything on the all you can eAt.  The ribs were perfectly cooked nice bite to it but still fell off the bone.  The bbq sauce on the table was refilled while we were still eating and it was warm and complimented the ribs perfectly.  These guys definitely know what they are doing and they have the recipe for success.    Just a suggestion for first timers (I will be coming back and I will have your system down)  Place a hostess podium with menus, make signage saying pick up menu, wait in line, place order and find a seat.  By having menus available people will stand in line less time and it will be easier for the order takers to expedite service.  Other than that I have absolutely nothing negative to say.  Thank you for all the delicious food you are serving us.

faY557-Vp7c6C5czd7Kfig.text: This place is a bit out of the way from the Strip. It's about a 15 minute walk from our hotel at the Trump International. The doorman suggested we take a cab because the restaurant is in a bit sketchy location next to a strip club. As usual, we found this place on Yelp and decided we must visit this place. The place is a bit on the small side and the tables and chairs are a bit stained like the other reviewers mentioned. My wife and I ordered the special for 2 persons and it came out to $20 with a fountain drink. It also came with 2 sides, we ordered the home fries and the mac & cheese. Home fries was tasty but on bit on the greasy side and the mac& cheese seemed a bit tasteless and stale. We ordered brisket pulled pork, and short rib. The short rib was the best of the three. The brisket is a bit on the dry side. My suggestion is double up on the short rib when you order and get the pulled pork or the chicken for $20. 3 choice of meat for $20 enough to feed 2 hungry people from NYC. Not a bad deal at all. All you need is new chairs.

adW8kiZMyK1IhXxZxnV1cw.text: Thanks to other reviewers for this recommendation - this place was definitely worth the side trip. Everything we had was great - even the seafood platter I had, which had a nice gritty corn-meal coating, and was not greasy at all. The corn bread, hush puppies, and fried okra were all as good as I've had, and I'd definitely recommend them. Especially the okra, as many places ruin this dish.   Very friendly owner from Arkansas made us feel welcome. The free refills on the drinks were welcome, as some of the sauces were pretty spicy. The only bad part was that the neighborhood was pretty unseemly, even for Vegas. We ate out at the picnic bench, and let's just say the sights were pretty interesting. But a very authentic restaurant with excellent, inexpensive food.

2o4FLw6h1CvGUNRMkJQTsg.text: Yes, I too had to do a quick u-turn to get to this location.  Located off-strip in an industrial part of town by an underpass - yes, it is by strip club alley.  But, this mere fact should not deter you from getting some of the best BBQ in LV.    I opted for The Biggin "Dad's Favorite" I was confused thinking it was a plate; it is actually a sandwich with beef, pork and hot link.  The meal includes a side and drink.  Each meat had its distinct flavor.  The portions are big; I was quite content with just eating the meats, I didn't even get to the roll.

8vfiIb825kt2ozWqUi98Jw.text: Honestly left that place feeling like I was part of the family. Dusty sold me on the place before I had even ordered my food. I have never experienced "Good Ol Southern Hospitality," but if its anything remotely similar to the way we were treated at Rollin Smoke Barbeque, I'm moving to Arkansas!!   We ordered The Outlaw, The Piggy, and the Brisket Sandwich with Mac and Cheese, baked beans, and corn bread as our sides. All three of us left 100% satisfied with the service, food, restaurant, and everything. 20 min later and we're still talking about it.   Dusty and John built that place from the ground up and if you treat um well, they'll return the favor. I'll definitely be stopping in again!!! No complaints here. 5/5

ANYn_-YGZ3-3TZtGynjCWQ.text: This spot use to be the business. But between the prices going up and me getting stomach aches the last 2 times I ate there, I'm over it. qSmB_mu-7MEC_l2MNp85NA.text: I heard so much about the Outlaw burger from Seven and Las Vegas Weekly that I had to try it for myself! To take a bite I had to open my jaw as wide as possible and smash the burger down in the process!  There is no doubt I can say this is the best BBQ burger I've had in my life and for $8 it left me very full (that and the free dessert I received for checking in on Yelp!).  I'm really looking forward to trying other BBQ items on the menu, there was so many good looking things to choose from that it was overwhelming.  6/10/13  Just had the brisket sandwich over the weekend and it was awesome!  Very tender, melt in your mouth good.  I brought a group of friends and everyone thought it was amazing.  I'm so glad they have a large menu because I will want to come back here and try everything!

Vlemriw6emKd1U62BhZnmQ.text: This is a must stop while in Las Vegas. Eating here makes me think I've never had BBQ before. I've always been focused on the sauce and sides. You don't need sauce for these meats. Had the burnt ends,ribs and pork. All the meat was extremely tender. The rib coloring,  flavor were above and beyond my tasting experience. I'll be back many more times.

BftCvx0Bb-vLsHOmO4OV4A.text: 200th review! And yes, it is a worthy one! First of all, this is a True hole in the wall place...I would have never tried it if it wasn't for Yelp, and I would have barely found it if they didn't have the BBQ grilles parked out front! Start off with the food....the Pulled Pork sandwich is truly amazing : yelp.com/biz_photos/roll... Beautiful char carmelization on the outside...tender juicy goodness on the insides....and the tangy BBQ sauce sets it off! Not spicy, but it has that flavor depth that is needed for an interesting (but not overpowering) BBQ sauce. It is easily the best pulled pork sandwich I have had, but it is actually one of my most favorite ways I have consumed the pork beast himself. For the side, I asked what was most recommended. I was told to try the mac and cheese : yelp.com/biz_photos/roll... It was good! Lots of spices in here...not spicy, but with more depth and distinguishing tastes put into the food here than a normal mac and cheese at most other places. I can feel the love :P Yelp check-in merited a free dessert...I was recommended the Peach Cobbler (pictured with the sandwich). It came out piping hot, gooey and tasty....just wish I had some crust in there like the one I love so much at Wing King. But besides being crustless, this was an excellent rendition. I will say that there was a miscommunication at order though, and my side also never came out with my food until I reminded them it was missing. I was strongly considering dropping my 5 to a 4 star, but the food and prices are so good, that I feel guilty holding it against them. If the order was taken correctly the first time, I doubt I would have had anything to complain about...again, just a miscommunication. I'll be back!

Y9NaTWA1n_2IUhG3DLBIsg.text: Fantastic BBQ and super friendly staff.  The best ribs and sauces I've ever had. The corn nuggets were AWESOME.   Go! You won't be sorry.

jbSLWC2TrXzbdoxlwekKDw.text: This place is amazing showed up and they just had closed and they still made us fresh food and were so nice the place is clean and smells So good Dave was funny and nice and the food is to die for I'm so happy we found this hidden gem thanks everyone for being amazing

cWMD7GeJw_3DZ1JpUJlDtg.text: I've had better BBQ outside of Vegas, but this place was pretty good.  Service was friendly.  Food was good.  The brisket was moist but a bit bland.  The ribs were smokey, but I prefer a thicker bark.  We had to park on the street because the lot was full.  I would return.
