IBb9DBRzh4U-eKpgFkApcA.text: First time eating here and it was GREAT. I had the "duo two meat combo" pulled pork & brisket.  The meat was extremely tender and moist as it should be. The flavor was pure BBQ greatness. They have a nice selection of bbq sauces and are very friendly.  My order was out in less than 3 minutes.  Great for lunch or anytime you want great BBQ.

gmm_oDxI1iifRU9PRi8KoA.text: Found this place on Yelp! while on vacation.  We were about to give up when we saw the dirty industrial area you drive through.  We found it and it looked small but smelled good.  We were glad we stuck it out. They're food is well worth the drive.   PROS:  Great taste Good portions  Cool tables outside  Meats were very tender  CONS:  Area is very industrial  A little hard to find at first  Staff do not come and wipe tables often

mzjresZAhY35zXX5ecAQ2Q.text: I was tired of paying 50 a head for food on the strip and yelped this place out of curiosity.  We went a little before closing on the Saturday before memorial day and unfortunately they had run out of all meats except the pork ribs and pulled pork. The person who took our order was very kind and cheerful. Unfortunately the ribs were a little chewy, not fall of the bone tender, but the aside from that was tasty and had a nice little bit of spice to it. I got the combo with the loaded mashed potatoes and they were okay; potato with green onions and shredded cheese on top.  I would definitely like to try this place again during earlier hours to try their other meat choices.

_b0MV_lx6-nAqWQ7-xWOJA.text: Huge portions of amazing tasting food. A wonderful variety of menu options. Great customer service. Never had an encounter that wasn't less than pleasant. Great prices considering the amount of food you get. Highly recommended!

XBzP6gBiKkRQcZZKXpAdiQ.text: The restaurant is located close to the Vegas strip but not in it.  So parking is easy and don't need to park in a structure.  There were quite a bit of people during lunch so we had to wait in line.  The outlaw burger is awesome and delicious.  The spare ribs were alright, and the brisket was a bit dry.  The portions are pretty big so come hungry.  I would come back next time I'm in Vegas.

6jbsxRh6lyMikmZbST7J9w.text: I am taking liberty of writing this review for both my wife and I. I leaned more to a four and my wife a five. Rounded off to a five. My issue is not really a complaint but a preference. The barbecue sauce had a good flavor, but a little too sweet for perfection and not spicy enough. I got the stock flavor and did not ask for options so partially my fault. My wife loved it so much she ate the trio burger without missing a step. I had the meatloaf with an extra side of Mac and cheese. The portions are a good size and get a free dessert with a check in. The staff also seemed to care about their product and asked me three times how I was doing.  Would definitely recommend and return.

vx0R4-ntkTPwjq2-4Y7J8A.text: OMG!!!  My boyfriend and I tried Rollin Smoke BBQ for the first time tonight.  Can you say YUMMY and SCRUMPTIOUS???  Let me start off by clarifying that this awesome restaurant is NOT in the ghetto.  It is in an industrial area.....big difference.  We found it to be clean and very comfortable!  Great service.....they made you feel welcomed, like you are a part of the family.    We had the 4 meat combo with 3 sides and the hot wings.  All items were super yummy!  The brisket was moist and basically melted in your mouth!  The ribs fell off the bone and were very tasty!  My boyfriend is addicted to wings.  He could not stop raving about their wings!  Next time, we plan on trying the "damn hot" version.  The hot link sausage and chicken were delicious also!  But let me tell you about these addictive corn nuggets!!!!  Woohoo!!!!  Sweet and yummy bites of heaven!!!  YOU must absolutely try these morsels of yummy goodness!  We will definitely return for more!!!  Thanks guys!

EA5zy7KrCl_8L7G6dNYr8g.text: Went there for lunch..... again.  They never disappoint. The food is great, the service reminds me of the mom-n-pop places back in Georgia.  Will keep going back again and again.  Easily the best BBQ place in town.  They do it right there, and make you feel at home.

4VrZKraQpIQIZbMjxoZ42g.text: I was going to be generous and give three stars but then I tried the peach cobbler.   When I walked up to the podium to place my order I asked if I could sample their BBQ sauce. The man said he would bring out the house BBQ sauce and some type of sweet BBQ sauce. I did not like either sauce and this should have been an inclination of what was to come. I ordered the two meat plate with pulled chicken and pulled pork and for my side I chose the baked beans. 10 minutes later my food was ready. First, I tried the pulled pork and the pulled chicken and both were less then impressive. I used some BBQ sauce that I had at home to spruce up the meat. Next, I tried the baked beans. The beans were good, I liked the chunks of brisket and I think their house BBQ sauce tastes better when it is cooked into something. Lastly, the peach cobbler was inedible. I took one bite and that was it, all I could taste was nutmeg. Still in search of good BBQ in Las Vegas and that includes the sides as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn bread; all of their sauces; coleslaw; baked beans; pulled pork
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 meat plate- pulled pork and pulled chicken, side baked beans

-TOz33PhUR6-uRk3X_oaRQ.text: This is the best Barbeque in Las Vegas! Great prices for the amount of food you get! Everything was delicious  Especially the brisket. This place has a great feel as well super home-y. Will definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pit special (4 meats &amp; 3 sides) with loaded mash, dirty rice, and corn nuggets.

y7Nb3uiemi4ls7-vp275uw.text: I was visiting town and wanted some good BBQ, and Rolling Smoke delivered. We got there just before the lunch hour rush, so we were the only ones in line (I was told that is a rare occurrence). Since I hadn't been before, the super helpful cashier gave us the run down, before we decided on a platter. On the platter there was ribs, pork, chicken, brisket, and hot links, and we got sides of mashed potatoes and slaw. Everything was awesome! We left so full. I was so satisfied that I stopped for lunch again on my way out of town. Will for sure be eating here every time I'm in town.

Om4Ex5uQhDHJX-G2_f_JCw.text: Such amazing food here, would highly recommend trying this hidden gem if you are vegas. Great service at the counter, had a small talk with the chef seems like a very happy team. Wait time for food was not long at all. I give this 5 stars because it meets basic standards and tasty food. Location is a little hard to find but once you do u will be happy.

T1CJufcGPlto83xySCFFow.text: I probably won't eat at another barbecue restaurant in Las Vegas. By far the best barbecueI have ever eaten.  No benefit to me writing a post other then giving this great little restaurant thumbs up.

Q-8Ww2bJUU7U5g24PjF_1w.text: Great bbq for vegas.a very big portion of food and it tastes great.nice and flavorful and a nice big menu to choose from.and the sides are good to.and the deserts.this is a must do everytime you visit vegas.

GWwHo-oNJQW48DJIJUkqVA.text: Really good BBQ in Las Vegas served here. A bit off the beaten path, but not far from the strip and pretty easy to get to from the highway (15). Family owned it seems, friendly service.   I like the menu a lot. Decent mac & cheese, slaw, and other sides, and interesting items like wraps, stuffed with meat and other fixings. There's even fried fish if you're in the mood, and yes, it's just as tasty as the meat. The prices are reasonable, and the wait is never too long, even on busy days. I started eating here every time I needed my BBQ fix - check it out.

Hz1R4t-_xV2QxJCJe-SDHg.text: Beef ribs. Got the full rack. Delicious and huge! Wife had the outlaw burger and it was very good as well. Will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes. Yes. Yes.

rDIrX_EZdPwTSW_kwHIqhg.text: Went for a quick bite before a business meeting. The food was awesome, fair prices and loved the painted walls. Would definitely go back.

8_AZCg3HiBTkJX-slnVM9A.text: I love their burnt ends. Their BBQ sauce isn't my preference, but I don't think their burnt ends need it. I tried a little bit of my daughter's ribs and they were good, even with Arkansas style sauce, but I doubt I'll ever order anything other than burnt ends for myself. I haven't tried any of their side dishes, because the burnt ends are too good to eat anything else when I'm there. The sides on the menu sound good though.

6tQHDdjOR29VNjI28fTFjQ.text: Seriously some of the best BBQ in Vegas. This is a BBQ place, so there's no need to go too much in depth with this review. It's good. Go and get messy and full. You're welcome.

b5ViDk4Rjj-A5JQQFc-EBQ.text: My wife and I stopped by last night to get a brew on our way back to Downtown. The bar was closing, so we turned around to get another uber. John, the GM and Owner called us back up the stairs and personally bought us each a beer. It made our night. We were unable to try the food, but the bar looked amazing, clean, and has a cool patio. We will definitely be back, and will be giving the food a try. Thanks a lot John, you made our night and look forward to coming back!

uUH_cLDABa5fOSuWeH1Vqw.text: I've been here several times for lunch because it's close to work and the food! It's a location that leaves a lot to be desired. Very sketchy area, no ac in main room, terrible and tiny parking lot and I wonder about the neighboring businesses and the cleanliness of the area. I was introduced to Rollin Smoke by their food truck at a convention I worked. Their ribs and brisket have amazing taste, flavor and texture. I just wish they would change locations now that they've grown in popularity and business.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love the super huge menu for those of us that are half blind.

038gAIfTbcJJM2z4aODTWQ.text: The food was good, but the hot links and smoked chicken are better at John Mull's meats. Rollin smoke has totally awesome juicy brisket, though, and super delicious sides. I had fried okra, even though it's not listed on the menu. I found the collards a bit on the salty side. Love the selection of sauces to choose from- even had North and South Carolina sauces.

nv980d1TGHNlG4L12_X2Cg.text: Best beef ribs EVER!!!  I'm so happy to find this place in Vegas!!!  Absolutely incredible smoked meats!!!

MsxK0XLhHFtuusSRlJHtbg.text: Dave the rocks excellent food excellent customer service and I recommend you to come you will be back

xwH5geSX079weNpaVu5P2w.text: I've been there a couple of times because people keep telling me how great it is and I think maybe I just caught them on an off day.  The ribs (my weakness) are just adequate. There wasn't enough of a smoke/grilled flavor. Road Kill Grill is king.

RrHLxRhCiPipZhwnJ10ZNA.text: The excellent reviews were appealing enough to draw me here. I wasn't disappointed. Beef rib and sides were very tasty! Can't wait to come back and try more options!

_S7YcqqJjytFJBB_5lY0wA.text: Food is good at an ok price. I've had better barbecue, but the food here is decent.

JCvx1p68mcL6LBwTjONlSA.text: Great food!!!!  OMG it is so nice to find a restaurant that serves a good barbecue ribs and the briskets is to die for!!  Amazing amazing delizzz barbecue food!!! Im sooo glad my kid brought me there.

d5e6Dl90Mos8NG1yBDQNVA.text: Tried this place on Saturday.  We read it was the best BBQ in Vegas.  Now, we haven't had others in Vegas, so that very well may be True.  However, comparing to other places we've eaten BBQ around the country and at home in AZ, it's not even close.  It was decent food.  Just a little over peppered and a bit dry.  I had the rib sampler.  Had beef, spare, and baby backs.  Beef was very dry, very fatty.  Best of the 3 were the baby backs.  They too were a bit dry as well.  My wife had the duo.  Hers was dry as well.  The brisket she couldn't finish because of how strong the peppering was.  Next time in Vegas, we'll try elsewhere if we want some Q.

4myOrQgePwPadLoWg0RIIA.text: amazing food and service. the price for desert is a little bit much but i got it for free with my check in. never knew this place was here.

0xcqO6OnX_ZB68lLnl6o1Q.text: We heard about Rollin Smoke through a show on the Travel Channel.  Since my family are True BBQ fans, we had to try it.  It's off the strip in an industrial area, but it is SO WORTH leaving the strip to try this restaurant.  When we arrived, Dusty was at the smoker & spent a few minutes showing it to us & chatting. I ordered the pork BBQ & beef brisket & it was the best I've EVER had & we have had BBQ all over the south.  The sauce was terrific, but the meat was so good, it didn't need sauce, so I ate 1/2 with & 1/2 without.  My son was excited to have good ol' sweet tea since we now live in Utah & it's hard to find.  The banana pudding was the best I've ever had at a restaurant & truly tasted like grandma made it.  Dusty joined us again & chatted some more, showing us the overflow room & the cool cooker fish tank built by the guys from Tanked.  All in all, it was one of the highlights of our Vegas trip.  Can't wait to go back!!!

pynuiQTBcIbUg538EhH9nQ.text: I have been here twice now and have had similar experiences both times. The food is very good especially for las vegas. I'm not comparing this to franklin bbq or anything but it is good. We have tried all of the meats they have to offer. The ribs are decent and the hot links are quite tasty. The brisket and chicken are also above average. The sides are extremely good at least most of them. Corn nuggets are really delicious and sides like loaded mash, dirty rice, and baked beans are flavorful and we'll prepared. The winner here is the service. The owners regularly come out to check on tables. All of the staff is attentive, kind, and welcoming. Both times we have been asked where we are from, and explained the restaurants style and philosophy. My kids are always given stickers and pens and treated as guests rather than burdens. I will continue to support these guys because they create really good food and make service as important as the flavors they achieve.

dwpURD0LylxjjtPY5TGI9g.text: This place has some of the best BBQ I've ever had. The pulled pork absolutely melted in my mouth! I didn't have a sandwich, yet, and I can't wait to try one.

WuL9kZ_qf-gozRp8fubrqw.text: BBQ was so flavorful and tasty. The family loved it. Plenty of food for the price. Awesome service.

Z0BnSm6pfWM6OIOGxnqkPQ.text: If I could add more stars for this review I would. Let me be brief. If you are in Vegas and you have a soul, go to Rollin Smoke and let them satisfy you. Their BBQ is possibly the best I've ever had. The beef ribs are out of this world. Lord, the Jalapeno cole slaw?!? and those cream corn poppers?!??...need I say more? It's a hidden gem just off the strip. Plenty of parking and seating inside. The service is great, everyone is friendly. I've been three times now and the last time I decided to be a hero and take an order back to my family in LA. The waiters carefully packed my meal in a foil carrier and even added dessert as a bonus. I've had the pleasure of meeting the chef and his wife, they are very passionate about their restaurant and you can taste it in the food. I LOVE THIS PLACE. YOU MUST VISIT....thank me later. I can no longer visit my grandparents in Vegas without stopping here...oh and maybe hitting a slot machine or two ;)

0r9F7h2gHdsGBPZTfrC6JQ.text: On our last visit to Las Vegas we decide to try Rollin Smoke BBQ.  We arrived at around 6PM and they were already out of brisket.  It is what I use as a benchmark for BBQ so I can only provide feedback based on what we had.  We opted for the Baby back ribs and the beef ribs.  Overall the food was great.  I would certainly recommend the beef ribs.  They were fantastic and meaty.  The service was prompt.  This is a dive so don't expect a fabulous setting, but we knew that going in.  The staff were very friendly and the place was packed.

diqRXxT6VMlhTRqi9KGBYw.text: Absolutely delicious. Ribs and chicken were both perfectly seasoned and smoked. This is the only place I've seen corn nuggets outside of Alabama and they are crunchy and creamy sweet. Be prepared to wait because the line is usually out the door.

rIGpG6libi1eR-yiZAd3gA.text: Was drawn to this place by yelpers.  We over ordered and there's nothing to write home about.  There's no smoke flavor, spare ribs were dry and cold, catfish soggy, and the rest is meh.  Dickies or Phil's would smoked this joint any day of the week and pun intended.  Oh, a little guidance during ordering would have avoided us over ordering...but after tasting the food, no wonder you're eager to push out as much mediocre meat as you can.  One and done for me.

VGlMLPANthfLbSGvmd1mLg.text: The BBQ here is amazing! I've been all over the US and live in Texas so I know BBQ. We had the chicken, brisket, something burnt edges, the spare ribs, mac and cheese, and greens and it was all great.

bJ7khiY5s7NY4YvPSBJM0Q.text: THE place for BBQ in Vegas. Check in on Yelp and get a free dessert. The people working here are super friendly and helpful. If you're not a local, do yourself a favor and leave the strip for this place!!

aawcSPpwHS1zQA0JG__I7Q.text: Super awesome bbq. Been coming here once a week for couple of months now. The brisket is the best. Never had a bad meal here. This place gets packed if you're heading here for lunch.

e2WPABX5Htp_7v_kWmL_8g.text: Having tried many barbecue places we finally found The Best!  Absolutely the most delicious food!  My husband is a grill master but the ribs here were sooo delicious!   I also had the potato salad with crumbled bacon,  mac n cheese and the bbq beans, my taste buds were in heaven!  If you've tried other bbq restaurants and thought they were missing something you really need to try Rollin Smoke.  The very BEST in Vegas!! Top notch customer service and very clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zhp1M_oR8un800j0bVjN7g.text: Let me start by saying the food was good, once I got it.  I came here for a business lunch with the rest of my coworkers from my office. I ordered The Outlaw Burger, and I ordered 2nd out of our line of 7 people.  We all went to sit outside and wait for our food. Fast forward a bit to after everyone else has their food, I decide to go in and see what's up with my order.  The lady checks my ticket and goes to see where it is. She comes back and tells me "it'll be right out". I wait another 10 minutes and see many other orders come out, but not my order. I ask again and she checks again, then tells me "just a couple more minutes". 10 minutes later I ask her "am I going to get a burger today?", so she checks again. 5-10 minutes after that she comes out and says "they have it on now".  A full hour after I ordered, after all my coworkers have finished their lunch, and after every other table in the place received their order, they finally bring my burger out. I had to take it to go, since I spent my whole lunch break waiting for it.  The guy who brought it out was nice and threw in some fries, but I was upset at that point. I paid $13 for a burger, even left a good tip when I signed the receipt thinking I'll be the nice guy who tips at these places, and the lady who caused all of this didn't even attempt to apologize.  Needless to say, even though the food was decent, they just lost business from 7 locals, out of which I was overly excited to try the food here.  We most likely will never be back.  Thanks for the fries, mr. server.

wS191SpK_XxnuDs8SPC1CQ.text: This place was recommended by a family member who aye here last week. Just got done running a 1/2 marathon and was looking for some protein. BBQ here we come! It was tough to pick one thing to get so we shared the pit plate. Pulled pork, tri-tip and ribs. Sides were Mac-cheese, greens, cole slaw and corn bits! Everything was so good. The smoke ring on the ribs were pure perfection and everything tasted great. They have this burger that is the size of a football and looks awesome, but it would take a REALLY big stomach or to be shared by two.   It was too hard to find and it has lots of seating. Staff was awesome!!! Will return the next time we hit Vegas!

U45O27OBkN_7XlvftQJ5Cw.text: Beef brisket is insane, the best. I send guest here all the time from both hotels I work at and half the time get a free meal from my guest bringing it back to me.

XKyPDWmyuOC6W1IqV719rQ.text: I came here with a few friends during my first ever vacation to Vegas, and boy I was glad we did!  Before you even walk into the place you can smell the barbeque, like the smoke is just rolling towards you...  So hey! The name is quite fitting.  Anyways, if it smelled that delicious already before even walking in through the door, then I knew it was going to be a good time.  The menu was very extensive, but ultimately I decided to order the Rib and Chicken Combo with the waffle fries.  The meal was massive!  Now usually there's something to be said on quality vs. quantity, but this place most definitely had both down, and the price was good.  The ribs were so juicy and tender, and peeled right off the bone.  The chicken also was juicy and delicious, and the skin was well flavored with great texture.  I barely managed to finish it all and hardly left any room for the fries.  Needless to say, I didn't need to eat again for the rest of the day and my stomach was quite satisfied.  A lot of locals drop by here, and now I can see why.  Plus, it's more fun to mingle with them and get off the strip for a little while to try some real flavor. The staff was very friendly and the food came out lickety split.  Overall, it was an awesome experience and probably one of the best BBQ I had ever tasted.  The only negative I had was that they didn't serve any alcohol.  I will be back!

L_QDLrfNebV3BFbHGeQFTw.text: the most AMAZING BBQ...chopped brisket, ribs, burnt ends, Mac & Cheese, loaded potato salad, and corn nuggets...you must try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sL-fOvm05nnV_iYdkFDRoQ.text: First off, it's a little pricey. Some may argue you get what you pay for, but for some reason it just seems a bit overpriced. For a single person eating lunch, with a sandwich, side and a drink and you're close to $20. If you get a meat combo or such, that'll push it up even more. That being said, the stuff is good. The signs all say Alabama BBQ, not sure what that means but it's good! One caveat...when you leave this place all of your clothing will smell like smoke for the rest of the day. Sauces are good too, they have several to choose from, the house and the Carolina vinegar are my faves. They have a hot one too, that is pretty spicy. Also, the neighborhood is a bit sketchy, its in the shadow of the DI super arterial.

5Z02Nmn16dIsX9XcNdAb3A.text: Very good extremely packed though. Potato salad was amazing. Burnt ends are delicious. You have a long wait but there food is good

UXNiqTXQa3EPjZEsp0q4lw.text: Come for the BBQ meats baby back RIBs MELTED right off the bone! super tender and delicious with a nice smokey touch Brisket was delicious! and tender and just great Pulled pork, needs the bbq sauce. it was good, but i would not get this again mac and cheese and fried okra were standard, not amazing but it went well with the bbq.   the service was great: the guy told us about each dish and checked up on us to make sure we were enjoying the food. its not a sit down restaurant, but he took the time to do so anyways  restaurant: this is a shabby place in a shabby neighborhood. nothing special about it at all.   Coming back to this place for sure! the food was delicious!

65iy6UwlHwwx8Dx8iuszFg.text: This is a hidden gem.. We were right up the street and the reviews were good. At first it's in a very industrial area so we weren't sure but the food was amazing. Their baked beans had a sweetness to them. Our son even finished his whole meal whereas normally he'd barely touch it. Definitely one of the best bbq places we have ever been to.

Ke0UKacJTdSZ3VqDnQImwg.text: I travel a lot for business and I always make it a point to find great local restaurants.  This time I was traveling with my family and we ended up in Vegas.   This is a must visit. It is easy to spend the entire time eating on the strip but this is only 10 minutes away.  It is definitely worth the trip.  The beef ribs were cooked perfectly.  The burnt ends were moist and tasty. The baked beans and yams were also great side dishes.  Did not try any of the pork products but I am sure they were the same or better.   The place is very informal.  You order and pay on a line then site at one of the picnic tables either inside or outside.  They will bring the food to you.  The staff is great, friendly, and as I was ordering for 5 strong willed people they were patient too.

jqJBxj9IZSX1gPtQ2uz77w.text: Okay I have got to say I am EXTREMELY satisfied with the service. The story was that me and 2 other friends ordered the $50 sampler plate and were extremely dissatisfied with what we were given. The actual plate looked nothing like the photo. The plate we received was probably half of what was shown in the Yelp photo. When we compared it to the duo plates my other friends got (which were less than $20 each) the size of our plate wasn't that much bigger than theirs. When I went up to question the cashier about it, he told me that the uploaded Yelp photo was meant for Photoshoot and the quantity was exaggerated for photo purposes. And then he proceeded to tell me that the sampler plate we got is what they actually intended to serve. At that point I was extremely upset with the False advertisement and started giving the cashier attitude. In my head I was thinking "you scams......we are definitely leaving you guys 5 one star reviews." However, instead of taking it in negatively, the cashier took it really well. He told us he can solve the problem and will just give us more food to make up for it. The amount of food they brought out afterwards definitely exceeded what was shown in the Yelp photo. Our whole party really appreciated the awesome customer service and yummy food. We are also very satisfied with how fast the foods were brought out. It definitely went from a potentially bad dining experience to a very positive one! I would like to thank the staffs for making this dining experience so pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The extras they brought us. They were even kind enough to bring us new sides!

3wH9F2fivPdyvW9D7JHniQ.text: BEST. BBQ. EVER. You must go.  First off, thanks to all the yelpers for the reviews! Burnt ends, ribs, brisket, hot link (aka sausage) all fabulous. Corn nuggets are a definite to order. However, if you never order anything except the CORN BREAD it's all you really need in life. Light, fluffy, buttery perfect. Can double as a dessert. Why? It's the perfect finish. Having said that, I got the recommended peach cobbler. Ahhhhhhhhh......good choice. We ordered corn bread to go. :) Yep. Shout out to Matt, great guy, nice smile. The staff was super. We even met the Pit Master. This staff wants one thing-for you to really like the food and have a great experience. My regret? We didn't eat every meal here. I am crying because we have nothing that comes close to this. A family member has travelled all over and said the only thing that comes close is in San Antonio. Please, do this. Any wait is worth it.

uG1qi5tEKP_kYbpEZH1YPg.text: Wow! Found this gem as I was searching on yelp for a good place to eat while we were in Vegas for SEMA... I sure am glad I found this place! Their food was amazing and a great price. The beef ribs are insanely good, definitely a must try if you are in Las Vegas!

bz4d0AxfQtUmft-yUg4xoQ.text: This is the best bbq spot in vegas IMO. I've been to a few places here and it's always been meh. This spot however, DELICIOUS. When we have guests from out of town come to visit, we always bring them here for the brisket burger (which is always massive and freakin yummy), combo plate (they have to sample the other things too!), and the banana pudding! They've won me over. I have not one single complaint about this place. Hopefully they keep up all the good food and service. : )

bFezYUBLZkPvE9msTmkk7Q.text: Great food, great service. Cant go wrong if your in the area and craving bbq food. GO HERE!!

n_4BTfM9wR25Md7ore0mxg.text: This place is awesome food here is excellent. I would really recommend getting the ribs they are so good. They fall right off the bone yet still retains a nice bite that you would want to get from a good piece of meat. Their sides are also really good the cheesy mac is super creamy and cheesy.   The prices here are also pretty good. I would not consider it cheap but its a good value for the quality and amount of food you get.   Service here is really good too. Everybody is really nice and helpful. Sometimes when it gets really busy it gets a little chaotic due to the tight space they have but you can still tell everybody there is giving it their all to try and provide the best service they can.

0lR-dKgkAQEb5628vuvCGQ.text: The night before, I had dinner at the Bacchanal Buffet at Caesars. Their brisket was dry...so I decided to venture forth for better smoked meat.   Yelp led me to Rollin Smoke.   This place is the definition of a hole in the wall (which made the contrast with the Bacchanal Buffet all the more pronounced). There's a strip club two doors down. Do not judge the book by its cover.  I ordered at the counter and got the 3-meat combo (brisket, pulled pork, pork ribs) with a side of onion strings and a piece of catfish. Everything was incredibly delicious. The pork rib, particularly, stood out among the meats  - tons of meat, falling-off-the-bone, great smoked flavor.   But the catfish was the star. There was a delicious coarse cornbread breading...like a hushpuppy around the fish. Unreal!  Maybe it was because I was eating alone, but there was something magical and welcoming about the atmosphere (a weird word to use for a hole-in-the-wall...) There was a stuffed boar watching me from the corner; i filled up my soda club in a dark closet, but the whole thing was unaccountably perfect.   One of the DJs from the strip club came in and ate the taller, biggest burger I've ever seen. The two of us chatted with one of the other patrons about how great the BBQ is here. The owner (manager?) noticed that I had done a Yelp checkin and gave me a free dessert (I hadn't even asked). And just as soon as I was wondering how I was going to get back to Caesars...a cabdriver walked in to check out the place.   I really wanted to go back the next night to try the beef ribs and maybe the baked beans, but alas...it wasn't in the cards.  My mouth is watering for my next trip to Vegas.   One small note: Rolling Smoke closes kind of early (8 or 8:30) during the week, but it's open late on Fri and Sat.   Go there now. You won't be sorry.

amn_YowE3ijehfz3sKOnmg.text: Fantastic barbecue, food is awesome. Parking is lacking and I often am forced to go somewhere else because I don't want to hassle with the parking. That clearly doesn't deter other people because they are always packed!

afzc26Z8Ge0oWrASyfAnhg.text: Ordered a brisket sandwich and an order of baby back ribs and two drinks for 33 bucks. Over priced for the quality of the food. My order was to go and we ate the food about 15 minutes receiving the food.   Brisket sandwich was horrible. It was so dry that I couldn't take more that 2 bites. Waffle fries were stale hard and cold. The baby back ribs we're ok but cold and they forgot the side item I ordered. Will never go back.

E8fcjwFITC9TZ9rOuARKPg.text: I've heard very good things about this BBQ spot, even though it is a bit hidden you cannot miss the bright colors of this place. So my bf & myself decided to try it & lets just say we were not disappointed! The corn nuggets were beyond good & very tasty, I've never tried anything like it. The brisket was good & so we're the hot links & brisket. The one thing I was not such a fan of was their ribs. I'm very picky with my ribs BUT the customer service we received was beyond our expectations! My bf & myself work in customer service so we both know how crucial it is to meet certain expectations, but everyone there was extremely nice & welcoming specially Brenda she was very helpful in letting us know what to get since they have so many options to choose from. We will definitely be coming back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fpLn6WmsWslBHzj4yyXG9w.text: This is just an overall review of all my visits over the years. The business has really grown exponentially over the last few years. Still, the quality has stayed the same on all my trips...excellent. Obviously BBQ has so many different styles that this place may not be "the best" for everyone. But, I think it's highest quality. I've been to the road kill grill, pot liquor, and many more chain style locations in the valley, this is the best overall. I've never had a main dish here that i thought was just "ok." For the people saying it's not the best in Las Vegas, please offer up your alternatives then. They have a tone of variety of sauces but honestly the ribs and pulled pork could be enjoyed without any sauce and still be amazing.

hyoPkl9NSayJg-yWPR5SIg.text: BEST BBQ hands down!! You get what you pay for, don't let the prices or line of people detour you from trying this place. Come hungry as this place offers generous servings and everything is hot and fresh. Ribs fall of the bones and the corn bread tastes like a dessert so sweet and warm!

JCSMe6wkyrAK1nNIFTf3eA.text: I ordered to-go, but I felt so comfortable while waiting on my food that I decided to eat there. Great service + Great food= 5 ALL DAY!   I ordered the burnt ends with the corn nuggets, both were DELISH!

95pMaM5FTI9zObIl5MKCnA.text: Chef Tim and his crew catered my wedding, and then another chef catered my dad's work Christmas party! Whenever family is in town we have to go to Rollin' Smoke, partially for the fond wedding memories, but mostly for the best BBQ in Las Vegas. I'm not even a huge meat eater, but I have never eaten something here that I didn't like. I recommend EVERYTHING on the menu.

x27DmzI-TZ39aof5WhawMg.text: Fantastic! Great smoke flavor and very moist. I had the sliced brisket, 1/4 chicken and pulled pork. Sauces were great but not needed. Worth the short jaunt off the strip. Walking distance of Trump, TI, Wynn, Venetian. Definitely will return!

TCqJ6wJZmwo4OB1z4ppusw.text: Pros-Great place with authentic bbq. Flavorful and very southern style.  They missed my order once and gave me extra for being patient.  Will go to again.    Cons-the area is a little sketchy.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw burger.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana pudding, peach cobbler, berry cobbler.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pit special.

IRhnBpT7YuawV9yPQuLqyg.text: I wouldn't want to come here during busy lunch time, because I don't think there's enough parking.  Anyone who knows BBQ knows it ain't cheap, so don't come here looking for a six dollar meal. However the duo meal is affordable (two meats, a side and a drink with slice of bread) for about 11 bucks. Limited seating so u may have to take ur meal to go during busy times. Fashion show mall is nearby so go eat there and cool off with their air conditioner. The BBQ Sauce is the star of the meal here. It's on the tangy side and there is a bottle of it at your table so u can add as much or as little as u like. The place is clean and the staff is very friendly. Note* not the best accommodations for wheel chairs. I witnessed a patron struggling to fit in through tight spaces .

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the sauce

cQrGElJJTjAFrsW_NCVegg.text: It's DAMN GOOD BBQ. I came here in here with my boyfriend after a fun night on the strip and the food completely took my hangover away! It's a small hole in the wall family style place with an exceptional menu. Brenda (?) was there to take our order and she was so friendly. I ordered the loaded baked potato and let me tell you it was the best potato I've ever had. Not only did it have Bain but it had white meat chicken and sweet baked beans. I was in heaven. The portions are awesome. I was eating on my potato most of the day. I mentioned it was my birthday and some of the staff, I believe James and Will came out to sing me happy birthday and have some AMAZING banana pudding. They really made my birthday "brunch" a great one! I'll be back the next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fully loaded baked potato. Perfect cure for a Vegas hangover. Lol.

P44ekBpJdUda_kG98r-UFA.text: One of the few great BBQs in Las Vegas. My favorite is the beef ribs, but watch out, they run out sometimes. The atmosphere is laid back, with wood benches and outdoor spaces. It is in a shady industrial part of town, next to some strip joints but don't let that stop you. it is worth it.

XNZiPzZdgkanATGhs2lKuw.text: Wow. What can I say? We found this place on yelp and had to try it. Got there right as they were opening and were greeted by the very friendly staff who helped us navigate through the menu. We ended up going with the all you can eat option for $25. Totally worth it. We got to try everything and had the staff bring us what they thought were the best options.   If you're in Vegas this is one of the spots you have to try. You wont be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat baby!

GE6GVJwP75SfTWmWqqTRhg.text: I had been to Rolling Smoke a few years ago.  I had a good brisket sandwich. I decided to stop in for a brisket sandwich for lunch.  There was a long line which wasn't a surprise since it was lunch time.  What was surprising is after about a 20 min wait in line you find out when you place your order it'll be another 20 min. I only ordered a brisket sandwich,  so I don't know why that would take 20 min. But it did.  What was very disappointing is the sandwich was cold when I finally got it.  Also the brisket was not anything special.  I was at Sin City Smokers recently and that brisket was much better. More like real BBQ, not high volume BBQ.  Given Rolling Smokes reputation I thought I'd try the Summerlin location since it wouldn't be as busy.   I ordered the chopped brisket sandwich.  The meat was not chopped,  it was mushy and had the texture of bad pulled pork.  Not much meat on the bun for $10.99. I won't be back.  The real pain is this last visit was my 'cheat' day. I've been eating well and losing weight so I thought I'd treat myself to a nice brisket sandwich.  GRRRR!

HPjSwRARol_0-Bhm3sn_lw.text: The food and service were above and beyond amazing. The ribs fell off the bone and melted in my mouth, the brisket was tender and juicy, & the sides are just out of this world. I've Been back three times and each time it gets better and better!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket French dip is amazing!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw is gone!

6tjrWuoMI1FD-2SaAi2Pgg.text: I had to try this place out after hearing so many good things about it - and I got to say, it's lives up to the hype! Food is absolutely delicious and the service is great. I ordered the duo combo which comes with choice of two meats and a side. I got the brisket, hot links, and potato salad. Brisket was nice and juicy - hot links were savory - potato salad was very tasty with bacon pieces and pepper. To top it all off, I tried Blue Bell ice cream for the very first time and it was a great sweet finish to my meal.   TIP: Don't go at 12 unless you have time to stay. First time I went, the line was out the door! I only had an hour lunch break so I came back a few days later after 1PM and had plenty of time.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket, hot links, potato salad to go!

VNdkg2t5hw-FoXsDZ8aKWA.text: Hands down the best BBQ I've ever had! It's a little gem by the dumpy strip clubs off the strip of Vegas. Totally worth the walk! Big portions and it's cooked to perfection. I would totally recommend the corn nibblers and ribs.. The meat comes right off the bones

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A1AFpJQ8VtZQmUI8EzNBQQ.text: OMG this place is delicious....i usually go to Memphis Barbecue on Warm Springs and im not sure which i like best..

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W8o6zNTpwz-yend_6xPxDw.text: Okay again. Glad I drove 25 min to this place instead of wasting my money at other BBQ places. This is THE REAL DEAL LAS VEGAS NV. If you want real BBQ this is real BBQ!  Can't say it enough. Their love shows through the food,   it's not just another person trying to get rich off of another popular food item.   They ARE smoke masters!!   Clean, fun, chill envirement! Everyones there for one thing. Good BBQ. SPEEDY service and worth every penny. Make sure you tip these guys. They deserve it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This rib platter special though OMFG look at the size of that thing. Thanks Rollin smoke for showing so much love

po0muKWZL5D7FRnkroYtXQ.text: I am glad we tried it. At first we had doubts when we drove into the parking lot. I had the burnt ends, my husband had the beef brisket three way, one of the kid had a burger, and the other had a hot dog & Mac & cheese. We also had the corn bites and the candy yams. The food was very good, the fries were season, which we loved. We took our left overs which we normally do not take.  Definitely a place to try if you like BBQ.

fLhawlQ-HPbmVVHwARnpPw.text: Experience:  wanted to grab some Togo for lunch, so I looked at my bookmarked spots close by and this came up.   Facility:  this is a pretty small spot, in a strange location. Not convenient to a lot of different traffic, but good for the workers all along Highland Dr. The restaurant is extremely casual with picnic tables inside and outside. There was an additional room with seating off to the side, but I did not peek in.   Service:  the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Chef Will was awesome! He noticed I was staring at the menu for a very long time, so he asked if it was my first time here. Then he proceeded to go through the menu with me, and even let me taste a few things before ordering. What great customer service!!!!!!  Food: I really wish I could give the food a higher rating, but it was just not as good as I hoped. The corn nuggets were delicious!  The pulled pork and beef ribs were pretty good too. But the jalapeno cole slaw tasted more like black pepper cole slaw. The bacon potato salad was good, but too many onions for me. The biggest problem was I got my food to go and there wasn't any BBQ sauce in my bag. Not sure if that's standard and you have to ask for some or they just forgot it. Either way, it just wasn't BBQ without the sauce.   Overall:  amazing customer service, and good food, by not great. I'd come back with friends, but I'd try something different next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small main area and picnic tables
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu on the wall
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon potato salad and jalapeño cole slaw...should have gotten all corn nuggets.

4OAeX1NvHPWd8AMY4ACA8Q.text: Just went here yesterday for the first time and it was delicious.  My husband and I split a full rack of ribs and got a couple of sides and it was more than enough (we still had left over ribs)!  It's moderately priced and definitely worth a try if you have a craving for BBQ!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full rack of ribs! So many fun sauces to try with it :-)

ti8vX4KOM-kl8xeM5_LhWQ.text: I've been using Yelp for years, but I signed up today just to tell you how great this BBQ place is. Kind of a hole in the wall off the beaten path, but soooo good. Probably the best greens, too. The staff is very polite, friendly, and helpful. They have 2 smokers running, it's the real deal! Go now before they're discovered!

IyuupqCNRm4dS27uEsg2vQ.text: I could swear I wrote a review about this place a month and a half ago, but it seems Yelp ate it or something.  Anyway, I've been here a few times now (twice today, for some reason!) and the food and service are always top notch. This place puts the other BBQ places in town like Memphis Championship and Famous Dave's (Famous Who?, now) to shame. Their sweet tea is the bomb!  John even convinced me to eat something different tonight, because I always get the same thing otherwise, so I tried their Outlaw Burger. I think Wilford Brimley wants to have a word with me about Diabeetus or something now, because I ate way too much. Enjoyed every bite, though!  Good luck to the Yelpers participating in the rib eating contest tomorrow!

AdaNTzmeyiCzlUCZI1uEbg.text: Very good BBQ! Only issue; the line and the seating.

6Kf1e2E1ZKiGG8CIPqLe2w.text: Every day im hustlin...for some lip smackin good bbq!!  So glad I found this place thanks to good 'ol trusty yelp here. Was craving some bbq late sat. night and saw that this places closes at 1:30am! Hollah! Its off of South Highland and if you're like me, I discerned the location to be close to Spearmint Rhino. When we got there looked a lil sketchy on the outside but saw that they had these huge smokers out in the parking lot. Walked in, the lady was really nice suggested some things. I got the ribs, 2 BIG A$$ ribs and a side of fried okra. THE BEST RIBS I'VE EVER HAD. Thats it. you can stop reading and go getchur grub on. I've never had ribs that meaty and juicy before and even the fried okra was fried to perfection. And it was all for $13!! please don't raise your prices Rollin Smoke! Apparently there was a rib eating contest that same day, bummed I missed it! So thankful to have found some southern bbq here in the city. No longer going to Famous Dave's!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs an a side of fried okra
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My delicious beef ribs

anssrWN8N2ezCBdZM4fMiw.text: Best beef ribs in vegas. A must stop when you visit sin city

unQ0qSgqld5L1w34-4meyA.text: The best of American BBQ in the heart of Vegas. As soon as you open the door to the restaurant it's pure authentic BBQ style, friendly atmosphere and staff making you feel very welcome especially Lizelle. Do not miss and will definitely be back.

GowdDEEtEpuq32-xZcdUHQ.text: Went here on Friday night with some friends. This place was packed, but the service was great! I got the rib platter special. While the flavor was good on all of them, the beef rib was the only one that was fall off the bone. The other ribs were pretty tough. I also had the bacon potato salad which was awesome! I tried a bite of the onion strings which were tasty and stole a corn nugget which was really good. All in all, pretty good bbq experience. I would definitely love to go back for the beef brisket sandwich. That is what my friend went with and it looked phenomenal.

vCr6rGC8T03_ZfgfGHnBNQ.text: Highly impressed.  We do not order takeout from restaurants much, but a friend surprised us with this take out instead of pizza or Chinese.   She ordered a family style of meats, rolls, mashed potato and green beans.  Could not criticize anything.  Even the green beans were a perfect crisp, garlicky goodness.  The rolls were nothing fancy, but just a good fresh roll.  All the meats were tasty too.  I had this place marked in my to try forever, but now we will definitely stop in to finish trying the menu.  The meats all included BBQ chicken, sausage, ribs and something pulled.  Not even sure what it was.  Very smoky, flavorful and moist.   And mashed potato were served loaded and were tasty as well.

H0B6m7SPNbq0HFs4LTMosg.text: Solid barbeque establishment that is worth trying out.  The brisket and pulled pork are decent but when at the Rollin Smoke Barbeque you will definitely want to order their ribs.  Their pork baby back ribs has an excellent smoky flavor to it and the meat is very tender. It isn't quite fall off the bone but nonetheless it is very tasty. The prices aren't too bad either and the quality of the food puts it above Famous Dave's. The baked bean sides is about average but the macaroni and cheese is quite creamy and smooth. The noodles they use for it is different and the cheese isn't as sharp. It's more of a mellow flavor. The macaroni and cheese isn't bad, it is simply different.  The portions unfortunately aren't large for a two meat combo.  The service here is excellent with a friendly staff that is attentive and kind. The decor here also is neat as it represents the hole-in-the-wall kind of grimy joint.  I would eat here again.

Dix4MwDehG7ZfrPl-VUGRw.text: Ended up yelping up a place to grab some bbq.  We ordered bbq fries and baby back ribs, both were delicious.  Lee, the owner I believe, was very helpful making sure we had everything we needed.   Will be going back next time we are in  Vegas we will visiting.   Highly recommended for fantastic food (get the bbq fries) and the amazing customer service.

TOXSNu1ZrnZDDaaptukVJQ.text: Nod yes. Nod yes while chewing. You're going to be nodding vertically all through the meal if it's your first time. Beef ribs were tender juicy fall off the bone with a perfect char on the edges. No one gets close to this style cooking. Brisket was okay. Chicken was perfectly spiced with hotness. It was a normal sized chicken as it should be. Bbq sauce was fantastic!!!!!!

naCNnSMaGG5bVn1CsaGPtg.text: This place was recommended by a friend so the next time I was in Vegas I went looking for it.  It was well worth it, great food!

tXoN9m77B8fqFSiEKhZWGw.text: Only been twice been pleased both times..Keep up the great work...Always great service fast and friendly

HKMti-ilfpTfdzPj9xhFqw.text: I really loved this place! It's in a random sketchy strip mall close to the Strip, but this is legit BBQ. Me and my friend shared a platter with five meats (brisket, pulled pork, sausage, chicken and ribs) that came with three sides. Sausage was a little spicy. We chose mac n cheese, corn nuggets and loaded mashed potatoes as our sides. I LOVED the mashed potatoes, they were the perfect guilty pleasure. My favorite of the five meats was the brisket. Oh and they have a bunch of sauces, from vinegar sauce to mustard sauce to hot sauce. There is indoor and outdoor seating. We chose to sit outside on one of the long picnic benches and it was perfect. Chef Willie brought us a delicious dessert...it was some sort of apple tart topped with vanilla ice cream. I will be back!

0hUUKTIqkcgt0wDp4mMPyw.text: The food was cold! The brisket was fatty, cold, and nasty! The hot links tasted like smoke sausage! The beans were good but had too much pepper! And Lastly, the fried okra wasn't crispy!

ro0MpMjqDtg0WrckHMhNyw.text: By far the best BBQ in Las Vegas! Absolutely amazing food and great service, if your looking for real BBQ in Las Vegas this is definitely the place! Amazing section of items to choose from. I definitely recommend the all-you-can-eat for $26 and that includes everything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IFse4EGLs8DlCQEMkeckgw.text: I don't understand how this place doesn't have 5 stars!!!!!! Maybe the missing .5 comes from the fact that it is floating in a sea of strip club??? This BBQ is BEYOND AMAZING!!!!! You literally can taste the smoke off this meat.....& boy do I like that. So we tried the beef brisket sandwich with the spiced mac & cheese as the side. My sister and bro-in-law got the wings and the trio. Everything was so darn yummy!!! SAVORY!   The service rocks and I can't help but talk with a Southern drawl with these Alabaman owners. It made me miss the South so whenever I feel nostalgic I know to come here.

XLLgsOZuTboB4XkRxFpEXw.text: Yes Virginia, there is a barbeque place in Vegas!  I kept reading reviews on this place and finally got out there to try it. I escaped work for a bit and hit it for lunch. I lived in NC for several years and really missed having great barbeque. This has filled the void.  First the meat, I had pulled pork sandwich and my husband had two meat option, pulled pork and brisket. They were both awesome! Cooked nicely on the smokers outside, just enough sauce, not too much, perfect smokey flavor.  Next time I will try the links.  The sides were terrific too. So many places seem to haves sides as an after thought but not here. I had jalapeno coleslaw. It had a nice kick, not too much mayo, super flavorful. Husband had the beans. So good with extra chunks of meat and a smokey flavor. We were both stuffed at the end. All very affordable too! Two meat special, two sides, sandwich combo including drinks for both just $22.  With the great weather I wish they had more tables outside. I could lounge out there and smell the smokers all afternoon. I also wish they could sell beer since that pairs so nicely with barbeque. But that great meat trumps those issues.   I've been to the other places in town and this one blows them away. We will be back soon!

vsuB8wMP9rAyoEhP4qHIuQ.text: I came across this place when I was in Vegas for 4th of July weekend. OMG! words can't express how good there food was. The guy helping us behind the counter was great. Me and my husband didn't know what to pick, there was way to many good choices. The guy asked us simple questions like "do you like spicy food, do you eat pork & how hungry are you". He ordered us so many different delicious things that me and my husband couldn't finish it. Even tho there's no hostess you can ask for a tray for your leftovers so that was a plus being that it was a bit pricey (Free refills on soft drinks). Seating is first come or whatever is available there is an outside area to eat as well. GREAT STAFF, GREAT GOOD!

PLUjCsyfldJMKFoevou4Og.text: This a review on the second time around. The first I went food and service was great the owner (who I believed to be) made sure we were fully satisfied. The second time however the service was ABSOLTUTELY HORRID. They took over an hour to bring out our food. The entire time they never put our order in due to horrible miscommunication that the server made us feel as if it was our fault! The guy even had an attitude. One of the mgrs on duty tried to offer banana pudding  without even knowing i dont like bananas. I even noticed him having some of his thumb in another customers dessert while he dropped it off! So all in all because of the food itself I round up 3.5 to 4. Hopefully the next time we wont have such horrible experience because it is so hard to find great BBQ in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meatloaf dinner, HUGE and tender spare ribs! All delicious and the owner really takes pride in the food! I will be back!

EqlihHxYczNWSVAWx8J-WQ.text: If you are going to eat such meaty goodness in Vegas, this is the only place to go. Outlaw Burger...mmmmm. Burnt ends...omg. Love it all

Pu2fGSDZtsHzqNOd9C2V6w.text: Not too fancy on the outside but the food here rocks with flavor! Such a great value for all the southern treats you have been craving. I'm from San Diego and WISH this place were closer so that I could frequent it weekly. Service was A+  and the cook came by to offer us samples of the various cobblers and bread pudding. I thought I had died and gone to heaven!

nkYStX4DRllMyQtkolg6HA.text: I'm a bit picky when it comes to BBQ.  Rollin smoke BBQ definitely is a legit place!  AWESOME food as well as service!  A must now every time I'm in Vegas!

MImV7EIvy4-DP-0TsM0Faw.text: Nice cashier.  Ribs, corn nuggets, hush puppies, bbq sauce: Good. Brisket was normal brisket..  Pull pork - dry. Resolution: bbq sauce. Burger - it was huge with lots of fried crispy onion. decent. to share. Desserts - normal.

xWZTpRw9a6zEGlUxrHN-YA.text: Really good BBQ.  This location closed on Sundays, made that mistake!  But the other location is only 5 min. away.  Cool staff, a bit on the pricey side, but the day we were there for $20 we got choice of 2 meats, chose chicken and brisket(very fatty, but delicious), and got 2 St, Louis style ribs.  and 2 sides, chose bbq beans (a bit spicy) and corn bread (good but too sweet).  Best I've had in Las Vegas.

gfkWKJnlRaw0PPCZh7pwBg.text: This place was awesome! My girlfriend and I just got back from a trip to Texas, where we had our share of BBQ.  I was still in the mood for more when we got back to Vegas, and we found this place on Yelp.  The spudtastic was A MAZ ing!  Loaded with pulled pork (my g/f got brisket on hers and loved it too), shredded cheddar, sour cream and onions.  I actually ordered the $24.99 all-you-can-eat.  I couldn't believe it at first, but it really was as much of anything on the menu as you can eat, as long as you eat what you order.  Awesome deal!  My only regret - not going with a bigger appetite because I was too full to try the desserts.  We'll definitely be going back for more baby ribs, more potato salad, more spuds and dessert...OH, and the meatloaf was great (and I'm not a meatloaf person)!  Thanks to the guys at Rollin Smoke!

CK6iXd1o5fIOUwWTMZB3HA.text: I'm more of a baby back rib guy. The lean, tender, fall of the bone meat was the Holy grail. I found beef ribs to be chewy and stringy, until I found this place. They may have pulled a game changer. Their beef ribs were incredible. Better then any pork I have had so far. Frankly I'm going to have to go back and try again just to see if it was a fluke. It may be the best litmus test I have ever had to do.

aXDqCzLbxHTj1UZ-W79q0g.text: The food is delicious! I am in love with the cheesy Mac n cheese and their corn bread! It's a must!

WDHpzHMwMjR1YvYaFTUEng.text: My name is Robbie and ive lived in Vegas for 4 years now and let me tell you, It was the best BBQ experience I had here in my whole time living in Las Vegas. I can't believe I never heard about this place until my friend showed me where it is. Don't be fooled by the location, on the outside it may look like you're not even from Vegas at all and you'll contemplate why you're there, but the moment you step inside, it felt like I was actually in Arkansas and the overall vibe was awesome! All I ever saw when I walked in was all the awards that this place got. Not to mention the service was excellent! David (the guy who took our order) is literally the most helpful guy who can explain the best options to get for the menu. We got the "Rib Special Platter" (27.99 after taxes) but everything on it was enough to feed at least 2 people and we were a party of 5 so we all shared and pitched in for the food. I can tell you right now, the food was so appealing and mouth watering that when you see it being served, I felt like an animal ready to attack it's prey. LMAO. I was just that hungry to be honest and I've never been so happy and impressed with the service. David complemented me and Daniela (my friend) and just gave us super funny compliments about our names saying I had a cool name and she had a beautiful name. We just bursted out laughing and I swear I couldn't forget that moment. Working in the food industry also for Las Vegas, it reminded me a lot about how much we work so hard in the industry to make sure our customers have the best experience. I have to say this place has really lived up to the standard and as a fellow worker in the food and beverage industry, I salute the men and women who work hard in this. They really give you a one of kind hospitality and make you laugh haha. Maybe it's just the southern hospitality, but you have to experience it to really have a great time. Not to mention this place is perfect for sharing and the food is instagram worthy!!!! I swear I'm coming back to this place now to take girls out on dates and stuff just because it's so unique and fun. Anyways I've had enough to say. I really liked this place and you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rolling Smoke BBQ was so good with Lorenzo, Daniela, Azel, and Dana

iT5q8eov1cNcUkD1TTLRtQ.text: friends have been telling me about this BBQ for over a year. I went tonight...it was the best I ever had, I will be back soon.

e2ErFFOjMKzVJ4Ccb0ugjw.text: If I could give 10 stars I would. This is the best best BBQ I've EVER had. The beef ribs were so tender it  fell off the bone. Banana pudding good too!  It's all I've been talking about this week.

Zw3rykLoB70GlOIcA0yw8g.text: I usually question a place so close to a strip club, but the food was so awesome. Had the duo meat plate with brisket, ribs and mashed potatoes.  Yeah a real fat boy meal but I was starving. The brisket was very tender and tasty,  complemented by their super good bbq sauce that you should make sure you get more of. Ribs were also very tender. Not fall off the bone tender since the skin is cooked rather well but remains juicy. My favorite part of the meal though was the mash. Not to take away from other parts of the meal, this was just that garlicky, bacon infused, cheesyness good. Def worth it.

sjRHJ7wWa6Kf7-t5MSEPEw.text: Absolutely the best bbq ever! Everything from pulled pork,  brisket,  sausage,  chicken, we had a platter with it all, it was super good! The staff here is amazing as well! The cashier was here from opening,  and you would never have known it. I will make sure I tell everyone visiting,  you HAVE to eat here!

ac3bFPrtEshhtgTgABnOIA.text: Off the beaten path of the strip in an area you may not blink an eye at. THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! Affordable and amazing staff. Everyone is kind and the food is to die for. Do not pass on the corn tots.

nqDK9_6ufN4NwG9of_LLKw.text: Soooo good at a phenomenal price. I could happily just eat sides at this place they were all very tasty: okra, potato salad, bbq beans. The brisket was my favorite, but the chicken and ribs were also great. The pork had great smokey flavor but wasn't very moist. It was the lighter meat which always seems to be less juicy no matter where you go but with a little sauce it was fine. Staff was exceptionally friendly and the decor was cheesy but fun & endearing.

cRmhOMaA53zW6Oki2ga-JQ.text: Went to Rolling Smoke for the first time. I had heard so much about this place. I wanted to check out all the hype about the best BBQ in town and was very disappointed. All six of our meals were cold. The burnt ends were extremely fatty, and all of our pulled pork plates came without any BBQ sauce. I brought this problem up to the person behind the counter and was told someone would be right over to help me. No one came. I went back to the cashier but she was too busy and couldn't acknowledge me so we tossed the food and just left. I will never go back to Rolling Smoke nor will I ever recommend it anyone. I would rather pay the higher price and eat at Lucille's, better food better service.

TGg6losYA87A1ZsMMaHIhw.text: Amazing BBQ joint. My husband and I found it from yelp a few months ago and have been back many times since.. We have been satisfied with the food and staff every visit.

mbYVwA8Tv2tfQ_gmRdfVSg.text: Excellent BBQ and deserts. The hotlinks have the perfect amount of spice and the brisket has an amazing smoke flavor:-))

BVEX9P_3bFm7ulCpgQOa0Q.text: Serious BBQ!! Dusty really knows his stuff!!  I ordered the mixed rib platter minus the babies, and instead subbed another beef rib. To round out my meal was the loaded mash and I added some greens. I won't be hungry again until at least this time tomorrow!!  Rollin' Smoke's rub compliments the flavor of both the beef and spare ribs nicely. I added a little of their spicy BBQ sauce because I like my BBQ to have a bit of a kick. The spareribs were perfect and the beef ribs were very impressive. Smokey but not overpowering. Dusty came to my table and asked how everything was, and I couldn't compliment him enough. He shared his technique on how he preps the beef ribs. I guess I'll be back, because I certainly don't have that kind of patience!!  If you're in Vegas craving BBQ, this is the place to go. The portions are big, the prices extremely fair, and the atmosphere removes you from the strip and puts you in a True BBQ joint that you leave smelling smokey! This is real BBQ and not that over salty crap that Famous guy prepares in several spots around town.

iXsaJe7bitBIcHKKjKAJ3Q.text: The ribs were burnt to a crisp and the brisket was so dry.  I can't believe this place has 4 1/2 stars. Wtf

Uu4rfbGIRuYCS51k5C4OOg.text: Very good BBQ in fact some of the best in Las Vegas BUT Very bad service... call in order 30 minutes ahead, food ready but had to wait in line for others to order while mine is ready and getting cold while I'm in line twenty minutes? Hmmm stand and wait to pay $70 for cold food????  Naaaaaa so sorry!  (Needs a better pickup for to go orders)

upmp8wlon8XZ6Sr5ZnlURQ.text: Okay ya'll, now I'm FROM The South, and I gotta say - this is some of the best BBQ I've ever had. I tried it all: the brisket, pulled pork, gumbo, baby back ribs, Mac n cheese, loaded mash, and even the house brewed sweet tea. Trust me, it's ALL spectacular. The smoke on the ribs and brisket really packed on the flavor, not to mention the meat was so tender. If you want to send your tastebuds on a cheesy adventure, snag that mac and cheese. When it comes to the sauces, I recommend trying them all but 100% do NOT skip the Country Girl. That poured over the pulled pork was dynamite. Top all this off with staff that were friendly and down-to-earth. I'd call this a sure-fire winner. I'll definitely be back!

REkJPc1kh20SOw7jymb26w.text: Hands down the best bbq I've ever had so far I came straight from San Diego to try this place heard many great things about it and i am speech less being a chef my self I was amazed of how great the favors were incorporated into the type of meats the rub the sauces everything about this place was awesome customer service was great as well I'm definitely coming back to Vegas just to eat here

HkPXvXCJtDzVpLFlPYlWOw.text: I would have given 5 stars, food is great, a picnic atmosphere, fantastic customer service.... Lost one because who in their right minds makes you pay for sauce when you order$30 worth of good?   Granted you get a measly 8oz container. If they gave me two I would bumped them up, as it I will rethink coming back.  Such a small thing to cost them business.  Just can't make one container stretch for the four people it says it feeds.  Bummer. Upon several more visits the good is good but $30 for five meats and three teeny Lil side fishes. No mo.

LwNvVDB7rFb-D9g_lTk_9w.text: Great food, clean friendly atmosphere, with plenty of food! Wait staff offered suggestions, and free pens, and stickers to share with friends. Although you cannot buy alcohol here (expanding to accommodate alcohol service) you can BYOB! Everything we ate was very good, definitely coming to try more of the menu! Seating is the only drawback. Can't wait for the renovation!

aF7GXv2lhDh5zroftkZsfQ.text: Quality and flavor of meats is excellent. Typical hole in the wall atmosphere with picnic tables and cement floor.  Food served on plastic baskets lined with paper and because of the moisture, the paper disintegrated which means I probably ate some paper with my food. Overall, I think this was one of the best barbecue surprises in the Las Vegas area. Stuffed baked potato with burnt ends was delicious. We also tried ribs, brisket and coleslaw. Everything was delicious. This was not a cheap meal though! This experience comes second to eating tacos at el tacos Gordo on the strip....

bfk-ycNf7La-LVXrPQoJOQ.text: This place is the bees knees. Absolutely love coming here to gorge on some fat, juicy ribs and brisket. I'd say that the ribs are some of the best in town. Can't even begin to explain how juicy and savory the ribs are, with or without their sauce.  Ooh yeah and their sauce. Man do they have a wide variety. You can go with the regular bbq sauce, spicy, vinegary sauce, sweet bbq sauce and many, many more.  They also have great options for sides. I personally like the dirty rice and it goes so well with the meat selections. You have a choice of getting the 2 meat or 3 meat choice. My favorite are the ribs so I get two orders of that and if I'm really hungry I'll get the briskets as well. The 2 choice is about $13 bucks while the 3 choice is around $18.  The waiting time can be a bit long but it's not crazy. The parking lot is small and sometimes you need to park across the street.  All in all, love this bbq joint and I highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BM_JwiqZfAbhi5xsAsYgTA.text: Best BBQ in Vegas!!! Ribs are fall of the bone and brisket will melt in your mouth!! Very flavorful!!

YCUZI32bxzH8TqZTiLuTHg.text: This BBQ place is the top BBQ place I've been to this far. Not Lucille's, Rollin Smoke by far. You know you have made it to a masterful BBQ restaurant when their sides have love in them. Not dry, over cooked, over salted, taking hours to get your food. This place actually had a great, not good, great mac and cheese. On mama's top 3 mac cheeses I've had. Just behind my wife's and my mom's when she's in her bag. And that is big for me to say. Most BBQ restaurants gave trash sides and if you had their mac and cheese you just wanted to cry after. But this almost gave me tears of joy. Now on to that BBQ. Their sauces are killer. They have different versions depending on the meats you get to pair more appropriately with your dish or pallet. Some people can't handle the smoke and I won't judge you for it. When I went I got brisket and short ribs and was not disappointed in the least bit. The only thing I wish was that I was hungrier so I could have tried their hot link. No joke I have only ever had one good hot link in my life and I was hoping this place could fill that void in my heart. I wish you guys could move a location to L.A.

8mWNzR4RCFh5hsIwNdCfvg.text: Been here several times and everything is wonderful. Most recently had a Mac Wrap which is a tortilla with brisket and Mac and cheese inside of it. Fairly amazing. All the standard BBQ favs are wonderful here too and the people are nice.   Crystal was a pleasure to deal with. I'll be back, I'm a big fan of what's going on here and I happen to work close by... so I'll be back.

c3pjwCweyO7TF9JKkwiMeA.text: Christal was great! Food is great as always. Got it to go and it was ready in about 5 mins.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket Sandwich!

f7COCttDY_9XIlmPYt970g.text: We travel to Vegas 3-4 times a year and Rolling Smoke is always on our eating list.  They always have burnt ends available, which is the family favorite.  Christal Willis was extra helpful today   We have had authentic Texas BBQ and this is the closest to it!  Worth the off-strip drive!

tspV4thl4c4hkLGNejzYeg.text: This is an amazing BBQ restaurant!! Southern hospitality at its finest!! Great food and wonderful homemade sauces. Just look for the Ed Bernstein billboard and the restaurant is right under it. Come hungery and leave full and satisfied.  A single dinner plate will serve 2 hungry people. We will be back.

_c0yb530GgOYatklqVHzqA.text: One of the best barbecue places I've ever been to!  When you walk in the door, follow the path on the right to get to the register and place your order. They have a large menu behind the register but they also have individual ones hanging on the wall for you to look at while waiting in line.   I was really tempted to get AYCE (all you can eat) for $34.99. You start off with three meats and then keep going til your heart's content. What was enticing about it was that beef ribs are included and the AYCE is equivalent to a full rack in price. I told myself to be rational. "You JUST got to Vegas. There's so many places you want to eat at today. Don't jeopardize that by tapping out at the first restaurant."  Using my head, I ordered a 1/2 rack of beef ribs but then self-control went out the window when I also ordered the brisket 3 ways. I figured my daughter and I can share; don't judge. = p My husband went with the duo of choice of meats; he chose chicken and spareribs.   I sorely underestimated the size of the beef ribs. See, I'm from the SF Bay Area and in my experience, it's been difficult to find places that serve decent beef ribs, or beef ribs at all for that matter. There are 2 places I found and well, they weren't very meaty at all. I ain't trying to pay for for mostly all bones.   Anyways, I was full from one rib and a couple pieces of burnt ends. My daughter couldn't even finish one rib. By the way, they fell right off the bone and were fork-tender. Dip some in a bit of sweet country sauce, and oh my. So gooood! Side note, the sweet country sauce wasn't even sweet. It was thin and more on the mustardy/vinegary side, which I prefer over sweet bbq sauces.   My husband took a bite of chicken and murmured "oh my god." He then took a bite of his spareribs and made a noise of appreciation. He was pretty much non-communicative for the rest of his mea, which didn't last very long because he devoured that ish.   We got a chance to meet Chef Will. He was super nice! Hats off to you, Chef!

fsP3n4GoUvmZQ5FcXnOYYQ.text: Great bbq place ,enjoyed the ribs and steak was good .definitely worth trying while in Vegas

HnGeuWwlrfkecUNlRYsylQ.text: This BBQ place is just ok. Nothing really stood out. Customer Service was ok.  Bought the brisket sandwich with loaded mash. Both were served COLD!! It was a to go order and didn't find out until later!

xTYoLPiUg6jOkIj4hDhu4Q.text: Amazing food. Definitely one of my favorite BBQ places to eat. Nice young Gentleman Ricardo brought us our food and made sure everything was fine. Crystal was good to us as well.

BbczyZTmlxpCB_jLNqThSg.text: My boyfriend and I visited this place for an early dinner/late lunch on a Saturday.  We got the Pit Special with sides of mac and cheese, loaded bacon mashed potatoes, and cornbread. We ordered to-go and had to wait about 20-30 minutes for our order, as it seemed to be quite busy. The layout of the restaurant was a bit odd, so we awkwardly stood in the center, where there was the only open space, while we waited.  Overall, the meat, while all tender, was not as flavorful as I would expect. I tried the brisket, sausage, and chicken. The barbeque sauces themselves were very flavorful, with a hint of some complex spices that really made them stand out, so if you doused everything in the sauce it was tasty. For the sides, the mac and cheese was more on the creamy side rather than cheesy which I wasn't a huge fan of. The bacon mashed potatoes were excellent; with the cheese and onions on top, they were delicious! The cornbread was also good, soft with melted butter on top.  Overall decent food for the price, but not what I expected of the 'best BBQ in Vegas'. I also did not enjoy the wait for our to-go order.

ieRgGNds56f1i9X7UFO0pA.text: I would give them five stars if they had not forgotten my waffle fries.  This is my second time here, the meat is delicious. I got the duo meat combo and ordered the brisket and and ribs. They both were fresh and juicy. They were out of some of the sauces but the sauce they did have was super tasty.  I wish they would have remembered my fires though.

qIm5HdacFCZcbQbjzbwBNw.text: Always a visit to Rollin Smoke BBQ when visiting Vegas !! A pleasant smile and good help from Chrystal. A warm thank you visit from Momma makes the visit complete ! Food is the reason I keep coming back ..

0E1_3LAUzmlIqUrUNGRV2g.text: This is coming from a Memphis native.  This BBQ was FABULOUS.   I injured by leg so I ordered delivery because I thought that they would bring it to my door.  The casino's don't allow that.   The delivery driver was kind, thorough,  and caring.  His name began with a W.  Thanks.  I will order again when I come back to Las Vegas.

F3873gv154XoiLPXsn_MMw.text: Literally the best ribs, best food period that's really all I have to say if you want good real "legit" ribs how there supposed to be cooked try rollin smoke they mean everything they say and have the food to back it up would suggest this place to everyone!   P.S: my favorite rib is the beef rib but I always get the rib platter special which is a great price and features every single rib for you to try :) I like to order an extra rollin smoke bbq sauce if it's an to go order just to pour on my ribs cause there literally right off the grill, hope this helped.

We were headed back to Cali, so now I'll have to wait until our next Vegas visit. Can't beat the $27.99 deal with 5 meats and 3 sides...greens, mac&cheese, dirty rice..paid extra for sweet corn bread. I luv their sweet & spicy bbq sauce. Yummmmmmy!! Enjoy!
