maC6Tx5QgPu6QDAxQFLuEw.text: This has been my favorite meal while in Vegas.  Next time I would be a glutton and try the all you can eat special (anything on the menu) for $34.99.  I really enjoyed the smoked chicken wings, spare ribs, corn nuggets, and peach cobbler.

TXfrMB0cdvzHdoS1oxv6tQ.text: This place is hands down the best BBQ food in Las Vegas. Seriously - I didn't know there was such a place until recently, and thank God I found it! The staff was polite, and the management very friendly. But most importantly, the food was amazing!   I had the brisket 3 ways - you seriously should try that. Don't hesitate getting the cobbler, too.  I ate so much I couldn't walk afterwards. This is now bookmarked, and it's a favorite spot for my girlfriend & me! Nothing but good things to say about this place. Thanks!

RJqRajTo0BhxAP0HvzKdjQ.text: Started off trying out Rollin Smoke Barbecue around two years ago with my wife and a friend. Our experience left a lot to be desired as our ribs were tough, pork was fatty with no taste and chicken was very dry. We decided then to not come back.  Fast forward two years and WOW, what a difference, This food is dynamite!!!  Let me start with my favorite menu item, the beef ribs. These things are insane tender with a ton of flavor yet simple, literally fall of the bone, fall apart in your mouth and moist with a great pink smoke ring. The server that brought my food told me it was like "prime rib on a stick" and boy was he right! Bring your appetite if you order these, they are huge.  Brisket is darn good as well. Great flavor, nice deep smoke ring and thinly sliced. I have been back three times in the last two weeks (Hi my name is Paul and I'm addicted to good Q) and I have yet to get any point, only flat. I one day will ask them if they are smoking full packers or just the flats. If you ever get the opportunity to get smoked brisket point don't pass it up, it's heaven! (Point brisket is where the "burnt ends" come from)   Pulled pork is good, but this is where they lost that coveted fifth star from me. I know it's tough to please everyone ( I have been doing BBQ catering for years) but I believe it's a big part of pulled pork to have a finishing sauce added when you pull the shoulder to add that extra level of flavor. I use a home made clear eastern Carolina style finisher on mine and everyone loves it.   In all this is the best Q restaurant in the valley bar none and I am so happy to see a fellow pit master doing well on his own. While my co workers and I ate lunch today ( 5-1-14 ) the line of people went out the door and never let up the hour we were here. Rock on Rollin Smoke, keep doing it right, you have a loyal customer in me, but only when I'm not doin my own stuff!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tanked fish tank smoker!!

hgHQZwSITf34p9GLkpXTag.text: I love LOVE small businesses.  I can't  really call this a "Mom & Pop" place because its more of a manly man joint (which I like). They REALLY care about the food here, it shows and you can taste it.  You can NOT go wrong with ANY choice here. It's a GREAT place for lunch... I have to find out if they do catering... this is SERIOUS Bbq!!  I forgot to mention that my daughter got her braces off today and she wanted to come get ribs here ASAP!!! LOL

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauced up beef rib!!

VoBadc6xZhmYNrcN-B9FUg.text: Not worth the money at all. Basically they overcharge for bad service and regular bbq. No real reason this place costs 15 bucks a plate. On top of that they messed up my order. They paid for an ad on the radio which is why so many people think they are great and they have a good burger which I won't be tasting because I will never go back. The Po-Boy left much to be desired, the blueberry cobbler tasted like a 10 year old made it in elementary school, and I never tasted the mac and cheese because they never brought it to me. Even tho I paid for it. If you are going to charge me an arm and a leg (Considering the quality) and not have the food be worth the price, they should have at least gotten my order correct. I didn't even bother to bring it up to them because I didn't want to bother with the mac and cheese after the rest of my meal not being impressive at all. If you want to post on social media that you went an expensive place then this is the spot. If you want something worth the money then go somewhere else. You may not be able to brag about spending 40 dollars on a meal but at least you would get full. I would give zero stars but Yelp won't let me. This place was trash.

7RSALAtkuZgw5rqJ1a03yw.text: Great food, cheap for the size you get. Make sure to come hungry or order one dish for two of you

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4KjeAyUzeygvjEhiYjjk1w.text: Best bbq ribs I ever tasted. All you can eat for 35 bucks is a steal. Also try the burn ends, awesome pork ribs and babyback ribs. All their ribs was perfectly cooked and comes right off the bone, just how I like it. Great sides, I loved the fried corn and potato salad, beans are good too. Then I finished it off with a root beer float and banana pudding- amazing meal to spoil yourself with!

xQIckuTfzB625WARctpp9g.text: I enjoy these self-serve spots where you refill your own drink and clean up after yourself. Don't even have to tip and you can quickly eat and leave if you're pressed for time, rather than having to wait on someone to refill your drink and bring you the bill. This is similar to a fast food spot in those aspects, line up to order and pay. When your food is ready, they'll bring it out like a sit-down restaurant and call your name.   Prices are reasonable.   Outlaw burger: it was good but nothing amazing. Lots of onion straws.   BBQ nacho fries: I like the waffle structure of the fries, it gives it a different texture.  The pulled pork in it was flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw burger and their special fries

Hd4JnXEei1O3qrDfStKEcw.text: Talk about a hole in the wall foodie's secret! Neither the bellhop at the hotel nor the taxi driver had  heard of this place and we had to pull out our smart phones to map the way there. Located in a semi-industrial area that's just 10 minutes away from the strip, it took a bit of convoluted driving to actually get there. It's not a fancy place, simple benches, plastic utensils, noisy, with an order counter and serve your own drinks, but oh man... the food... the food! (They also have sweetened tea - have to have that in a Southern BBQ place, right? Right??)  This place was suggested by a couple of local friends when I was visiting and we met up for dinner. We got what I think was the "Pit special" which was the variety platter, 5 meats and 3 sides - Pulled pork,1/4  chicken, hot links, ribs and brisket - an extra order of the corn nuggets - think of tater tots made with kernels of corn and corn meal, green beans and coleslaw. The slaw was good but we had to dole out the corn nuggets to be fair or any one of us would have hogged them all.  Best Southern BBQ I've had in a long, long while - so good I did not try any of the other sauces - they make several - on the meat. They did not drown everything in sauce either, but encouraged you to try the various sauces. Crisp, well seasoned chicken skin, saucy (but not too saucy) pulled pork, ribs with just the right amount of char, tender brisket, spicy links... it was all good.  Then it was time for dessert and the chef was walking around talking to customers and we asked about dessert, with a friend asking if "Mama's Banana Puddin" was made of real custard. Hoo boy, you'd think we just insulted his Momma. "You think I would use box vanilla pudding? Man, you gotta stand there and stir that custard by hand or it ain't good! That's the only way you can make Banana puddin!"  We settled on the banana pudding and the blackberry cobbler and shared - because we were so full from dinner (and we had left overs to take home) - we scraped those bowls clean! Talk about greed... I was tempted to get another! The Banana custard was smooth and tasty, the consistency of the custard just perfect - none of that grainy fake pudding mix in that!. The cobbler topping was not overly sweetened which let the blackberry taste shine through.  Altogether, a wonderful gustatory experience - and the cost for this wonderful experience? Oh... about $12 each.

5e-ZyR9unpMCFcdTG0bZyw.text: Meh...not blown away.   The meat was good, but I don't like their sauce.  Slow service.   If I had liked their vinegar based sauce, I may have rated higher.  If you like the sauce, you'll love the place....if you don't, there isn't another choice and you'll be disappointed, as I was.

hOa-3DutQrTAC_aQMZ9viw.text: Yet another great BBQ place in Vegas In a "shady looking neighborhood in a very small strip mall in the "porn district". BUT worth the trip for sure. The pulled pork was amazing the ribs and other meats all look fantastic, cant afford to try them all, though I will eventually with every trip the Vegas. Inside and out were super clean, love the picnic tables outside wish it wasn't so cold when I was there. The prices were a bit high but the food was amazing.  You have made my list for Vegas must visits

lnRBiJSUgm5b5mKY3JCRtQ.text: Went here 9/21/2017 after reading the great reviews.  All 3 of us ordered the pulled pork sandwich with potatoe salad.  Here's what I thought,,,IF the pulled pork had been HOT it would have been a great sandwich.  Sauce was flavorful, bun fresh, but I don't like warm food so that's why I'm giving it only a 4 star review.  Potatoe salad was wonderful.  Prices fair, but don't forget if you are staying on the strip, it will cost you 17.00 R/T on Uber.  Also, NO atmosphere.  Just a room full of tables.  Kinda disappointing. Next time I'll try Gilleys at T.I. or I Love This Bar, where I've had the Pork and it was good, plus walking distance and great music if you love Toby Keith.

fnlPnSTEab5yqXXDtl_Nuw.text: Good all American bbq. Friendly staff  good portions, and good price. No complaints. Will be back for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5eMMgiqfuYDzzx7QPtzwHg.text: Are you kidding me with the wait?   The wait was way too long. I waited 1 1/2 hours and was quoted 25 minutes for my food. Had I have known it would have been that long of a wait time, I would have left. The order taker was not very friendly and did not make a good first impression. She seemed rushed and annoyed that she was taking orders, even though I already knew what I wanted and only asked one question about the pies.   After waiting an hour in a half for our food, I was really hoping for amazing barbecue. In fact, I was so hungry at that point, I didn't think I could tell the difference. Anything seemed like it would have been yummy. But, I was wrong. I could definitely tell that the food was just okay. Definitely NOT worth an hour in a half wait.   Ribs were good, hot links were good, but the chicken, pulled pork, and chopped brisket were bland. I had to drown it in sauce to make it worth eating. And even drowning it in the sauces (I tried all the sauces), it still did not help the flavor get any better. The baked beans were average, the corn nuggets - I did like and would say is above average. The coleslaw was mehhhh. Not impressed.   One of the order takers was 'smart mouthing' customers who complained about the wait on their food. i was appalled. I kept my mouth shut. But, customer after customer steamed with frustration after their wait time pushed way pass 45 minutes, then an hour, then an hour in a  half. What was more frustrating is the order takers were still quoted a 25 minute wait on food, when they knew full well the kitchen was backed up to over an hour. I have no idea how this place got such stellar reviews and no one mentioned the crazy wait.    I love BBQ and for the past few days I had been going to Famous Dave's. After this ridiculous wait at Rollin Smoke Barbeque, I'd rather go to Famous Daves. The food at Famous Dave's is just as good. In fact, what I ordered there was quite possibly a tad bit better. The atmosphere, service, sauces, and speed of food trumps Rollin Smoke Barbeque any day!   At Famous Dave's, the wait was only 15 minutes for our feast for 6 people. In my opinion, a 15 minute wait for a feast of 6 is totally worth it. Plus, there was so much food we had left overs. The feast for 6 comes out to be $11 a person (if you have 6 people) and was so well worth every penny and every bite.

5jCdGNNl2VxGOEALRn_Pmw.text: Working at Zappos, I've seen many of my coworkers order catering from this place, I've also had a taste of the amazing ribs pulled pork.  I hosted a team building for my team and thought I'd order from here to switch things up from other typical places I order catering.  The team was super excited for my choice..   I ordered the "super sampler"!  The ribs were my favorite. Tender, smoky, and the BBQ rub has just the right amount of flavor.  The pulled pork with the sweet bread is a great combo.  Spicy sausage has just the right amount of heat.  The sides were good, especially that potato salad with bacon! Wow!  I tried to order the corn bites, I hear they were out and will be out for awhile.  I had the opportunity to meet chef Tim twice. I let him know the food was superb.  If you want good BBQ, I would recommend ordering from this place  :)

Frkv5EsFF_HFzrGTNVDdJw.text: If you've been to Vegas a million times you should be tired of the buffets and bland commercial restaurants. And oh I forgot about my grandson SPUDTASTIC loaded  potato, he ate it all!  Many blessings to this family from Arkansas who has made their mark in Las Vegas

dyfFblYqyA9p0vvPDglMBQ.text: It's been a while since I've been to Rolling Smoke, and time has not been kind to what used to be one of my favorite BBQ places in Vegas or West of Kansas City for that matter.   My wife and I decided to give them another try and $40 later, much of what we ordered is sitting in a styrofoam box in the fridge and will likely end up in the dog bowl or put in the trash. We ordered a combo plate with 5 choices of meat and 3 sides along with something to drink. Service is not a problem, the staff was as friendly as ever and our food arrived in 5 minutes as promised. But from there, things kinda went downhill quickly.   I'm curious as to why Rolling Smoke doesn't put bottles of sauce on the tables anymore? You get to choose from 6 big bottles of sauce at the side counter that you pour into small white paper cups...and the labels on the sauces don't tell you very much about how hot, spicy, or sweet they are. You kinda have to experiment with the sauces and we ended up trying them all. And the sauces didn't impress us at all. They were kind of blah and on the watery side, to be honest.   While the chicken was cooked to perfection, the ribs were a little on the thin side and had a little too much fat left on them. We substituted a meat choice to double up on the ribs...which I regret doing. And they didn't even properly cut them either so we had to pull them apart. But the cardinal sin in my book is the brisket. It was cut way too thin and the worst part was the 1.5 inches of fat left on the end of all of the strips. I wanted brisket, not fat, and to me it seems like someone just doesn't care too much about the quality of the product being sent out of the kitchen these days.   And one more thing. BBQ beans should not be overwhelmed by excessive black pepper. I have never been served BBQ beans anywhere in America that left me tasting the pepper to such an extent that the beans and thin pieces of meat came across as more of an afterthought.   The bottom line for my wife and I is we don't intend to go back. I would much rather pay to ship in BBQ from Kansas City than to go back to Rolling Smoke.   In short, it sure ain't what it used to be. Not even close. 1 Star. I hate writing 1 Star reviews but I can't honestly give Rolling Smoke anything more. And that's sad as I used to love this place and visited it as often as 3 times per week for years.

jXYJnV4gKOptZ3JOnhtXHA.text: This place is not really a "All you can eat". We love to eat at AYCE places because we can eat a lot. The menu says AYCE Everything on the menu, but that is not the case. We have a frustrating time ordering our food because we tried to decided what types of meat we want & the different sides we wanted. We got to the cashier and they said that if we order AYCE its only "3 meats and 2 sides" but that means you can only get 2 pcs of ribs, which are small portions at a time for 1 hr only. Sooo basically NOT everything on the menu.   I suggest just either adding the rules on the menu or getting rid of the AYCE BBQ because the food is good just that the menu is confusing.

B6Q_2arZMCuZQbskY_ll-g.text: 4.5 stars. I had Rollin Smoke Barbecue booked for quite some time, and finally got over to try it.  The parking lot is not big so parking can be an issue at peak times. The restaurant itself seems to have several dining areas though for dining in.   You will smell the smoky goodness as soon as you walk in. Line up and place your order at the counter then wait for your food. There are physical menus as well as a big menu posted up on the wall.  I opted for a combo to try multiple meats, and I ordered my food to-go. The meats themselves were succulent and juicy, and packed full of flavor. I enjoyed it thoroughly, but wasn't impressed enough to give an outright five stars.  The prices are medium but pretty much what I expected. I definitely recommend this barbecue place. It is a bit tricky to locate under the overpass, but it is worth the trek!

9w0urO2QwvRr4IlkKi6MBg.text: This establishment is actually featured on the Travel Channel and I was literally nudge to make a stopover. It is a little confusing to find this location but once you see the Overhead Bridge, you'll know the place is nearby. Just make sure you take a good look because it's definitely hidden. It's True what they, the restaurant is a hole in the wall. But after having tried a few of their menu items, I am convinced it's a Must-have in Vegas and a Total keeper.  He ordered the Brisket Sliced Spare Ribs with Corn Nuggets ($13.99). I wanted to try a few sides of my own ($3.50 each): Corn Nuggets, Yams, Sweet Corn Bread, Cheesy Mac N Cheese, Waffle Fries, and a Side Salad with chipotle dressing. And for dessert, I shared a Banana Pudding ($4.99) with Vanilla Ice Cream ($2.00).   I felt like I just had a Side Item Sampler with a dip of every barbecue sauce. The Side Salad is good and everything else is flavorful. I love the Crispiness of Waffle Fries and Savory Corn Nuggets with Creamy, Cheesy Mac N Cheese.  The Sweet Corn Bread is moist and fluffy, and it taste amazing with Sweet Potato Yams. My favorite is the Banana Pudding with Vanilla Ice Cream. It's just the right amount of sweetness and they even add a hint of Crunchy Vanilla Wafers which makes it so yummy. Did I mention they have Blueberry and Southern Peach Cobbler Pies too! I already love this place.

vftYnueV-VzJUcD4j8Vo6Q.text: I have been on the hunt for the best BBQ here in Vegas. I am from Georgia, so I have always had my pick of VERY good BBQ places. I placed a to go order here yesterday thinking 'I really want BBQ, they are on the way home so let me just try them out'. I got two of the 2 meat plates- 1/4 chicken, pork, brisket, ribs with mac and cheese and collards.   This was the best BBQ I have had here in Vegas, hands down. The meat was tender and SO flavorful... and the sauce... man that sauce. I got the House Sauce and it tastes like the sauce my grandfather would make at home to go with the homemade skins(pork skins) he would make.  I definitely give this place my Southern stamp of approval!

Eylum93rxmFM-OXHEPVI-A.text: This was a great restaurant the food was good and the service was good and quick. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Vegas

THuV1DCWz55PC5J4B65XIw.text: This place rocks!  Best Bbq I have had here in Vegas.    I ordered a bbq chicken sandwich and it was delicious!  The side of coleslaw was my fave.  The coleslaw was not full of mayo and it was so tasty.  5 stars for the coleslaw alone and 4 stars for the yummy chicken Bbq sandwich. I highly recommend this place.  It is a little tricky to find, but if you follow your gps you should be ok.

LPch70KeiIlpu6J2WwWZCA.text: As many times as I've been here, why have I not reviewed it!? This place is THE BUSINESS!! BqFXWoDgutWxiMdhvBy5Lw.text: I don't usually speak about where I eat because honestly they're usually just pretty standard. Coming here while visiting Vegas was just by chance as we were looking for some BBQ. I can honestly say I'm blown away!!!    Let's start with the atmosphere upon walking in, you feel like you've left Vegas and entered the south. The people could not have been any nicer!  They gave us fantastic recommendations (get the smoked meatloaf) and we're not wrong in any of them.   You want to talk about FAST FOOD?!  We had our meals before we even sat down!!    Honestly this place is top notch BBQ and I'd even say it's better than any of the bigger names found in Texas!    We decided we needed to try some dessert so we ordered the peach cobbler and the banana puddin. The cashier told us that the pudding was all out and we were totally bummed...a few minutes later someone came back to our table and said "wait...I'm going back to make more pudding for you right now!l. What?!!  Are you kidding me?!!!    This place is fantastic!  Everyone came by to make sure we were taken care of and didn't need anything.   If you're ever in Vegas and love BBQ, you MUST come here and patronize them!!!    Thank you for making our trip end on a memorable note!!!!

fQxlKw-LK0ED8qVD2paUCQ.text: This place is bomb. Must have when in Vegas. First tried two years ago - had to come back and bring the gang with. Brisket, burger, hot dogs, waffle fries and mac and cheese. All delicious! Plenty of parking, plenty of seating.

KZirbm21anGOCeGKEpERQQ.text: I came here the other day with my dad and brother under the impression that this place is supposedly "the best bbq in Las Vegas". My brother ordered a plate that included a bunch of meat that he could eat/sample with my dad. I had a couple of spare ribs and the mac & cheese. The ribs were decent, but definitely lacked flavor in my opinion. I enjoyed the mac & cheese because- well it was cheesy. I tried one of the sausage slices that came on my brother's meal and that was my favorite thing. It had a lot of flavor and went well with that mustardy sauce. I tried the beans and they were not best by any means, but my brother enjoyed them. One thing I noticed is that all of their sauces had a twist and none of them were "traditional", which is a good thing, but I wish I could have had a traditional bbq sauce that I could use for the meat. Maybe they had one, but I didn't see it. Also, the layout of the restaurant was sort of weird, it was just really closed off and the two rooms felt like two different restaurants. The last negative note that I have is that the restroom is right by the kitchen and it had no lock for just being a single restroom. So it's in a small hallway and you're having to walk sideways so you're not in the server's way or whoever's leaving that kitchen. So the no lock thing made me uncomfortable and I had my dad stand outside of the door so no one would enter while I was in there. The restroom looked as if it hadn't been cleaned in days. I understand that the restaurant gets busy sometimes, but that's unacceptable to me. I will end by saying the server/busboy was really helpful and kind. He was cleaning the tables quickly, yet efficiently to let other people sit at the tables. He came by to pick up baskets and clean our table off so that was cool to see. So this place isn't the best bbq in all of Las Vegas, but I would recommend you try it and form your own opinion. It's definitely a decent restaurant, but I wouldn't come racing here every time I visit.

I5vcIpBqmwtV6gcv77gyOg.text: OMG....we hit this place on our way out of Vegas and I have to say....BEST BBQ out there!  That sauce is like hitting the jackpot....so good, I couldn't get enough!  I HIGHLY recommend

mzhXkePkQQ6nwdi2UEHBgg.text: This was our last meal, on our way to the airport, after a few days in Vegas.  This was a GREAT choice.  As other Yelpers have mentioned, this is a small, unassuming location, tucked away on the side of the road.  I ordered the pick 2 dinner option.  Smoked sausage and ribs with 2 sides, dirty rice and green beans.  I also ordered a side of corn bread.  We ordered at the register, and proceeded to sit and wait anxiously as our food arrived a short time later.  The sausage was perfectly smoked, generous portion, the ribs were tender and meaty.  The dirty rice, ohhh that dirty rice was tasty, nice flavor and perfect accompaniment to the meet.  The greens beans were perfectly cooked, not too crunch and not at all mushy, and the cornbread was fluffy and sweet.  My husband had the smoked sausage sandwich and enjoyed that as well.  We will absolutely return on our next trip to Las Vegas!

x5BF8Rxub42rsRq32N4I4Q.text: I must admit that I'm not an expert on this type of BBQ due to growing up in Hawaii. The closest thing to this is our Kalua pig. The term BBQ is used to describe anything grilled in Hawaii. The only place I can compare Rolling Smokes to is BB King's. This place blows them away! The food is really good, the staff is very efficient, and our food was delivered to us in a timely manner. We had the "D's Delicious Sampler" and especially liked their ribs. We'll definitely eat here again!

rS-aV0tUKekmpHTdzmEhwQ.text: Surprisingly I have been to Rolling Smoke on the strip, but today I visited the Highland location.  I enjoyed looking at all the memorabilia and merchandise. There was a short line, but it moved quickly.  I ordered the 2 meat combo. . .with bacon potato salad because I have never had anything like it.  I was not very fond of it, however, I also ordered a side of collard greens and that more than made up for my dislike.  Really enjoyed the brisket and spare ribs, I am becoming a fan of Rolling Smoke.

e0ZFFCg-a6okrgGoW7VA7A.text: It's good. But "As Good As It Gets?' Taste wise?  I dont think so. There are not many dedicated bbq places in town, so there's not much competition for RS BBQ, hence "Best BBQ in Vegas"  and the anointed darling amongst the Yelp community.   The bbq does have a nice smoke ring I give it that, thin pink line, crisp crust, easily pulls off the bone. The bbq hickory smoke aroma in the air is intoxicating and draws  you into this place!  Taste wise it's good, not great. I've had better bbq with better spice rub mix and sauces.    First impression was a hit for the ribs, a miss for the brisket. It was not as moist like our favorite place. Our recent returns here have been good. Although sometimes the ribs are a tad dry. It could be because we got the ones left in the warming trays longer.   They did a nice job expanding the dining area. As far as picnic bench seating; it's great if you are with a large party and you take up the majority of the table. But when you have to share a table with strangers that have no table manners or have poor hygiene, it puts a damper on my dining experience.   The price they charge for what you get is great! That is always the highlight of conversations I've had with other diners and why another reason this place rates high on here. It's cheap! For two meat two side combo meal under $10,  For the amount they charge for decent bbq there's no reason to leave here disappointed. That's why I don't mind coming here.

Got a side of Mac n Cheese which was delicious and a side of yams which really wasn't sweet they tasted like butter so those could've been better but over the food was pretty good. I plan to go back

OrKn3-POyd2xtZF1aolpZw.text: An amazing BBQ place... Especially that brisket, with that sweet mama sauce... Personally, growing up from the South, i always expect perfection, when it comes to BBQ. But this place, hit it, out of the ball park... For some good old fashioned, southern style BBQ...

H6zwrkklGrPhACO0KwMDJQ.text: Can't say enough about this place!!! Meat was cooked perfect, sauce was flavorful, potato salad with bacon was a question, but I must say I was very surprised, actually wished I'd a got a pint lol, beans were ok, a lil spicy I can actually do without the beans... yams tasted like a sweet potato pie!!! Very tasty.. corn bread was moist and hot.. willl definitely be back when I'm in town!!! Two thumbs up

UxU69N6L8lOy0_TL6AOOvw.text: Omg, we found great bbq in Vegas and it's home is Rollin Smoke! Delicious pulled pork, awesome chicken, both sandwiches served on hoagie rolls with house sauce that is lip smacking good. The mac and cheese and corn nuggets (cream corn that's deep fried) we're both delicious. Right down to the pickles, this place is the real deal. Only draw back was that we were too full to try dessert so we're planning on coming back next weekend. If you like bbq this is a must try.

XaycfT-LhNnIBQjNII5Zdg.text: The hype is real. Rollin Smoke is bomb. I took my man here for his birthday dinner and he LOVED it. He got the AYCE special for $34.99, and I got a 2 meat combo plate and added a drink. The total was around $60 for both of us. This is an order at the counter, seat yourself place which I dont mind at all.   The AYCE special is anything on the menu any day and anytime. The menu consists of a plethora of meats, burgers, sandwiches, sides, and desserts. My bf loaded up on the meats, I think he tried pretty much every meat in the place. Ribs, meatloaf, chicken, pulled pork and wings, just to name a few. His consensus is the meatloaf is bomb and the baby backs are delicious. He enjoyed the other meats as well, but those were his favorite. He had 3 plates each consisting of 3 meats AND sides, so he definitely got his moneys worth. If you have a hearty appetite, AYCE is the way to go.  For my meal, I got a 2 meat combo with chopped brisket and spare ribs, and for my side I chose mac & cheese. The food was delicious. I really loved the ribs. They were so tender and meaty and fall off the bone. A good rib needs no sauce, and these did not need any. Speaking of sauce, they have like 5 different bbq sauces, ranging from sweet to spicy. I personally love a good vinegar based sauce, so I enjoyed their Carolina sauce the best. But they have something for everyone. The chopped brisket was yummy too, although I would probably get the brisket sliced next time. The only thing I did not like was the mac and cheese. It was realllly runny and pretty bland, but they have like 10 other sides to choose from. I can't wait to come back for some more yummy BBQ.

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf, burnt ends, spare ribs
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf and pulled pork

KZGrs-zZ-APtn06XBsDMGg.text: 4.2 in all reality I really want to give it a 5 star but something doesnt allow me to. Don't get me wrong delicious brisket, sausage, ribs, pulled pork. The load baked potato also blew my mind.  They only have one BBQ sauce, gracias a dios, it was really good. I just like a variety of tastes in my mouth... take it as you will. My personal favorites were the sausage and pulled pork. The initial kick of the brisket was good (we got burnt tipped) but I was over it after awhile.   There sides are what really blew my mind. They were all really good, coleslaw, beans, mac n cheese, everything!! They were so good, i recommend all of them. We dropped about 40 dollars which was enough to feed four grown men... or three grown men and me, which is the equivalent of a 13 year old boy. So 3 and a half people.   This is also on the outskirts of the city BUT it is totally worth the trip if you are in the mood for BBQ.  THE VERDICT: Get your BBQ on here... i have not tried anywhere else but... I am pretty sure there are other places but... this is now my place in LV. The sauce will will light up your mouth, and you will not be disappointed. In fact you will be happier than you have been in years... and thats a guarantee.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the heavenly goodness in my review

pi5oI-FPRGvT-lggeh32Cg.text: Everything is amazing here!! We have tried the duo meat plate with lean brisket (by request) and the shredded pork with potato salad and beans, the meatloaf (just try it!) it's so damn good!, and the Biggin. Even their fries are super good! AND THEN they have all of these mouth watering barbecue sauces to choose from! And to top it off the customer service is phenomenal and they really go above and beyond to give you a good experience. We really love it here and will always come back.

-i7szzIWriz1cJgfBDtkcQ.text: Very Good BBQ, and I know BBQ Tender, flavorful, and the choices, Make you want to go back ASAP!

D1voe9epMCZJJ1U0AONPIw.text: I guess its fine for vegas, or we went on an off day but it really wasn't very good. It was just, ok. I understand the reviews because vegas isn't exactly known for its bbq. But when you're a BBQ lover, and have had bbq in just about every state, your expectations are a bit high. So having gone here based on the reviews, i was pretty let down. The brisket and the chicken were both dry for me. And they tasted sweet. The sides were nothing special,  just alright. The burnt ends were a bit too burnt. I think everything we had was either a bit overcooked, or had been sitting out for a while. Either way, not worth it for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That wild boar tho

p79jW-yiow5VL1mjy2HOTA.text: This is one of the best BBQ place in Vegas! It's a new found tridition that I come here every time I'm in Vegas. I order the Trio choice of 3 meats with Burnt End, Brisket, Pull Pork. The Burnt End is amazing!

1b8mAjjp4IFlKqgSaERJ-w.text: Oh lord.  Mac and cheese, and ribs ECSTASY. There's nothing new for me to add to the reviews besides it could be worth having your ashes spread here when you die. It's on my list of places to be a ghost. Mmm free smells :))))))

kjRG9As9YLgi3nz7OchLxA.text: This place... Went on Saturday for brunch and decided to come back the next day so I could try something else on their menu and my date wanted to order the same meal he had, but they are closed on Sunday's! Needless to say, BOMB. I mean, we did try to come back the next day! Haha.   I ordered the half rack of spare ribs, naked. Meat was perfect, beautiful smoke rings, meat was tender and juicy and just had great flavor that appreciated the flavor of the ribs itself (like, didn't overpower-ing-ly just taste like seasoning). The half rack was more than enough for me to eat. The side of green beans I had was simple, but flavorful. My date had the smoked meat loaf over mashed potatoes with Mac n cheese. I tried it and it was delicious! Nice smokey flavor, AWESOME SAUCE, meat was moist and perfectly seasoned, mashed potatoes were creamy and a great compliment to the smokiness, the Mac n cheese was very creamy, thick and super cheesy. He wanted to order the same meal again!  The ambiance of this place has a small town, hole in the wall kind of feel. It's kind of in an odd location, a True gem not too far off the strip. I can't wait to go back and explore the menu and I wish I would tried their banana cream pudding! It looked sooo good, but I was just stuffed!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs, smoked meatloaf, green beans and Mac n cheese!

SitA2ab5xfPGLLfJT1njXQ.text: My family and I were in town and looking for a kid-friendly place for dinner and had a bit of a hankering for BBQ. Found this place and decided to check it out after reading some Yelp reviews.   The location is off the strip and is the very definition of a dive. I mean that in the very best way.   Unfortunately, we got there right as they were getting ready to close, so we decided to get it to go and spend the night sitting in our hotel, scarfing down pounds of smokey, fatty meat with no utensils. Vegas baby.  We got the kids cheeseburgers and we ordered a combo that included pulled pork, pork ribs, chicken, brisket, hot link and choice of sides. We went with Mac n cheese and corn nuggets. Also ordered one ($10) beef rib that was enormous. Everything was really good and perfectly smoked. The chicken was a little dry, but besides that, perfection. The pulled pork was amazingly tender. The ribs pulled off the bone perfectly. I'm a big BBQ guy and this is the real deal. The beef rib was definitely the highlight. The perfect smokey, meaty bite. The corn nuggets ARE A MUST as well.  Strongly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That rib.

gbf-2AZAoFC6tTvke0KdLQ.text: Best BBQ in town. I have not found a place as good as the South for BBQ until this. I am an avid BBQ restaurant goer... up until I moved to Las Vegas. This is the only place I recommend to people coming in to town and really want some tasty BBQ!

oivOltOgG2TxeB66H2slQw.text: Ah! Why are you only located in Vegas? Tis not fair. Your prices are friendly and your portions will give me that year-round winter body. I adore you, Rollin Smoke Barbeque.   $49 and that was more than enough for 3 people. There was still a full box of leftovers that I lugged back to my hotel to feast on later. We got the Pit Special for $28 and a Loaded Mash for $16. The portions we got here would have easily cost over $100 back in Orange County. Brisket, pork, chicken, mashed potatoes, corn nuggets, mac n cheese, dirty/fried rice -everything was just so gosh darn tasty. Nothing was dry, overly salty, bland -everything was perfect like Chippendale guys on the billboards.  My only regret was that I didn't bring back any bbq to Orange County. Forget the blackjack table. This is where you want to spend your time and money at.

b94fGtHK9KkmntKzQ3llHw.text: Always the best BBQ. Everyone is polite. Food comes out quick, fresh and delicious. I make it a point to visit everytime that I am in Vegas.

DV7_4U2_8BLcm33JXsyB9g.text: Seen all the reviews for the spot so I said well let's go an see what's really burning on the pit.  I wouldn't say its a hidden gem as some would say.  Definitely ducked off on a side rode next to a strip club.  As you walk up your hit with all the signs letting you know its a BBQ place an when you walk in you clearly see the owner is from the razorback state Arkansas.   Now to the food. I got spare ribs, brisket, corn fritters.   The meat was tender but didn't fall off the bone. I wish they had more burst of seasons for all the meat. All our dishes tasted that they had been dipped in pepper. But no other herbs was taste.   If they didn't have there house sauces I don't think I would had finish my meal.  Now the corn fritters was to die for well o ly cause I'm from Texas an that's what we do with BBQ an fried chicken places. The batter was grand so don't change that.   I would come again to try the meatloft possible.   Hard to find good BBQ cause there's different kinds when it comes to ethics

b_MDiRPhQgS49nI7dBiOfQ.text: We enjoyed the pork baby back ribs (meat falling off the bone and juicy). Fried okra, cross cross French fries and 2 hot links.  When arriving this building isn't very inviting, but once you order, your glad you came! #greatribs #greatsauce

BbYOVqvmfUJ1clyx15UDfQ.text: I don't eat red meat, so I had to go with chicken which was cooked to perfection and the size was very generous.   The atmosphere is awesome, little cute family owned place, worth to try.

qvpeQPhNdbtxCX3Dk9v-TQ.text: The bbq is delish! But the service takes it over the top! Everyone is so nice.. And don't forget to try the banana pudding!  Can't wait to go back when visit LV again.

F_9IJf9SF-gVjcAnI5UnFg.text: Since I moved away from Texas over 10 years ago to the California, I never thought I would be able to find a decent BBQ place until I came here a couple weeks ago.  This is the by from the best BBQ, I had since I moved.  Before Las Vegas, we were in Orange County, we never found any good bbq place there.  We did find Phil's down in SD.  Rollin Smoke BBQ is better than Phil's in my opinion.  This restaurant is a hole in the wall place.  There is one line to order at the counter.  The line was out the door on a 110 degrees.  We're thinking about ordering ahead of time and going in to pick it up to eat there next time we go.  I didn't see a separate line for pick up, it seems to be only one line only because this guy in front of us had a pick up order.    Portions are huge.  I ordered the Duo Combo, Chopped Brisket and Pork with the side of mashed.  My husband got the Rib Platter Special with Mac.  Our friend got The Pit Platter 5 Meat 3 Sides.  That my friend is a lot of frickin food!!  We all didn't finish our food and ended up taking the leftover home and had it for dinner.  We did get a chance to try their sauces, our favorite is the Arkansauce.    There is an AYCE on the menu for $34.99....any day, any time.  If you're a big, huge eater, you should go for it.  It wouldn't be worth it for any of us.    Locals do get a 10% off, you only need to show them your Nevada ID.  I believe if you go on their official website, anyone can get 10% off at the moment.  =D  We can't wait to be back!

M3rPj6Cj3pG9AJrEHrO1yg.text: I visited here a few times and have yet to be disappointed. I have had better BBQ elsewhere but I prefer the Austin style vs this Arkansas style cue here. It was still very good. I had briskett moist and it was. Various sauces available for different tastes.

_FtogAsPhm55cRvIC6VwSQ.text: When I think Barbeque, I think stringy dry pulled pork that gets stuck in your teeth.   I always forget how much I love this place, tonight my partner and I ordered the Smoked Meatloaf and a plate with pulled pork and burnt ends.   The meatloaf is laid upon a bed of rich and flavorful mashed potatoes, then showered with onion straws. The pulled pork was juicy and delicious, the burnt ends were anything but, they were so tender and felt like a delicacy.   Eating here is epitome of treating yourself.  If your man don't bring you here, he don't love you.  If you don't come check this place out, you don't love yourself!

FBCp20jXsrPI-rdKp69v0g.text: On my first day back in Vegas, decided to take Lyft to Rolling Smoke, the Highland Drive location, since it's literally right down the street from the strip (and the Palazzo where I always stay when in Vegas.) Quick $4 Lyft trip and we're there. Came to get some grub on one of the hottest days of the summer (It was 115 degrees out and their ice machine was broke.) I ordered a 3-meat combo plate but because they were out of spare ribs, you either had to order chicken or hot links OR be forced to pay $3 extra for pork ribs. To me, that was bush league, why should we the customer be charged extra because you ran out of spare ribs? If anything, they should have absorbed that cost due to their lack of planning. It was July 3rd, so they should have figured an influx of patrons the day before 4th of July.   At any rate, I ordered the mac and cheese with my combo and had a seat. About 5 minutes later they delivered my plate to me (pictured below.) I should have known that so quick to get my plate, it would likely not be hot and rather, the meats likely already sitting on a heating lamp. Such was the case. Neither the porn ribs nor the brisket were hot. Heck, they weren't warm, either. They were room temperature. I would have taken it back and asked for hot meats, but I was famished, as I had just flown in, and wanted to eat ASAP, so I made do with what I got.   Moving forward, I'd be leary about this place, if they keep feeding you room temperature meat in favor of moving the line and selling low quality food. Having previously been to Franklin BBQ in Austin, TX, that remains the holy grail/standard for ribs and especially brisket. This time around, Rolling Smoke BBQ didn't compare.

uJDJuJ0VlLrLzbbwzIx42A.text: Went to Flamingo location which I had raved about to my family,, tonight however was an absolute disaster. We ordered our food to go, after 20 minutes, no food. We asked the lady and she seemed like she could care less. When my husband had enough and went up front to cancel the order, we found out that half of it wasent even made! Burgers sat in the window the whole time. The cook came out and tried to make it right but the cold food and missing items means I won't be going back. Everyone around me had great smelling food though....

QyGIUQ57ZkW8gcwsqBPeOg.text: Ordered the Meatloaf and it was delicious!! Lizelle was amazing and was a great help at the front!

1HBtVwGxqo3PYv_uW1HqzQ.text: Located in a really... interesting area of Las Vegas, right off the freeway, this place is a HIDDEN GEM!!!!   Parking lot is small, but a good size for the establishment. Right outside are two or three picnic tables (the kinds you'd see in the park), and on the door there is a menu for you to look at. In the room where you order there are a few more picnic tables, menu is along the back wall and the cash register is in front. The lines can get very long, but thats because a lot of people have a billion questions like WHAT DO I GET?!? WHAT'S GOOD!??!  Yes, lines are long but they get the food out pretty quickly.   Hot link is super spicy IMO. So if you like spicy, then go for it! Best bang for your buck would be any of the platters. My bf and I got the rib platter or something like that, it came with spare ribs, pork ribs and beefy ribs along with a side of your choice and a piece of bread. It was about $30, and the tray of food gets brought out to wherever you're sitting. Make sure you listen for your name. When I saw the platter I thought... meh, nothing special, presentation isn't great, just seems like a bunch of burnt meat piled on top of each other. BOY, was I wrong! Don't eat the beefy ribs FIRST because they are SOOOOO good. Everything just falls right off the bone. Save that for last! The spare ribs and pork ribs aren't bad either but, seriously if you had to pick just ONE thing off the menu, go for the beefy ribs.   Add some Alabama (?) sauce to that and it'll be like a party in your mouth. Also, I'm not a huge fan of banana pudding but the one here is delicious.

6WkPITXbXxouUzt5xJsBXw.text: Really good food! Clean place! Big portions...Nice people and service...pricey! Family of 4. $80.00. Worth it!

I9UTZbgGuqAJ38MspsA2MA.text: Wooooot wooooot wooooooot.  Baby momma pregnant and was craving mac and cheese and ribs so I stopped by ordered the spare beef ribs. (Epic) ordered a pulled pork sandwich (sick) mac and cheese.  Satisfied all my bm craving. Everything was amazing.  And service was fast. There's a good chance there will be a line but be patient it's worth the wait. 10 mins tops

e1fZl6kxwiUP6Bngqse4Sg.text: While visiting Vegas for New Years, I had to try the "best of the best", this place did not disappoint! Exceptional quality and a team of craftsmen that know how to get the most flavor out of their meats. Generous portions and many sides to choose from. Very friendly staff that was quick to point us in the right direction for recommendations. They even have a cool fish tank created out of their original smoker...now that's dedication to their craft!

Bhu3I7z3IjsLxFQ6LZ495w.text: One of my favorite BBQ joints in town! Brisket dog is fantastic and their burnt ends are some of the best I've had. House made BBQ sauces are on point too!!! Ill be back again and again and again! Keep up the good work!

Ng-x0xQ6o_bqjMQ0ti7brQ.text: We were on vacation and heard this place was good. We didn't know when we would be back, so we ordered the pit special 5 meat 3 side platter and a half rack of beef ribs. The beef ribs are amazing. They are tender and have just the right amount of fat and smoke. The brisket, spare ribs, chicken, and hot link were nicely seasoned and cooked, but could have used a little more smoke. My only real complaint is that there are no to-go cups for the sauces.

po5xZIP3TRwtJTuwfiqgPA.text: I just ate some of the best barbeque in Las Vegas or anywhere else.  I had the 2-meat platter with an extra side: I picked pulled brisket, spare ribs, mac n' cheese, and loaded mashed potatoes.  Everything was AMAZING.  The brisket was rich, tasty and melt-in-my-mouth, with some interesting hints of sweetness in there: I did add some Arkansauce, which added punch to the flavor.  The ribs (there were supposed to be 2, but there were 3; maybe because I was a first-timer; recommended by the countergirl) needed nothing.  Best ribs I've had, anywhere.  Charred a bit on the outside (with the smoky-salty rub cooked right into the surface of the meat), tender on the inside, came off the bones with little effort.  Loaded mashed potatoes had good flavor to start with; bacon and green onions just added to the richness.  Mac n' cheese was richly cheesy.  Better than the food was the attention (I came in between lunch and dinner rushes, so 3 other diners and me had the place to ourselves).  I got visited during my meal by the countergirl, the dining room attendant, the manager, and the chef/smokemaster-in-chief.  I didn't have much to say to them, except that I was beyond words at how GOOD everything was.  The boss man was so happy to hear that, that he had a small dessert sent out for me - so I can also tell you that the blueberry cobbler a la mode (he asked what I'd like, and I asked the dining room attendant to surprise me; great choice, dude!) is also fantastic - sweet and just enough tart and tangy.  This was my belated birthday treat to myself, so that was a perfect ending!  The dining room is simple - benches and trestle tables - cheerful and fastidiously clean.  A great oasis from a rare rainy Vegas day.  Do note: Vegas locals get 10% off our bills when we show locals' ID.  This is real, local, down-home barbeque at its best.  The friendliness, flavor and authenticity can't be beat by any of the chains.  If you haven't had Rollin Smoke yet, you haven't experienced the rich, off-Strip local foodie scene in Las Vegas.

webJ6lMiFUXEU6FyQgPzLw.text: We ate here after reading all of the great reviews from Yelp. Usually I like 95% of the places with high ratings but this falls in the 5% NOT.  We ate inside (MISTAKE) and ended up smelling like smoke so bad that we had to shower and wash our hair TWICE to get the smell out.  The owner was incredibly kind and he alone deserves 4 stars but this review is based on the food.   The meat wasn't as tender as I prefer my ribs and the sides were bland. I wouldn't go back and probably wouldn't recommend it either.  The restaurant is very dim so it was hard to see our food but the taste is what's more important.  Overall, I've had much better.
