And the mac and cheese..OMG! I'm a mac and cheese fanatic and this is one of the best I've had from a restaurant. Very cheesy and seasoned very well. I will be making it back there when I go back to Vegas.

6h_UhvCqQ-98dqlTo0ykHQ.text: After finding this place on yelp we decided to try it out!  Real good food!  The meatloaf was of the charts!  Mashed potatoes are GREAT!  Their yams were so good too!! We pretty much had a little of everything and can't say anything bad at all!! Great service too.  The venue is a little bit small but the food is worth it!

QN54-90o9AXyHljjvflWwA.text: The smell of that place alone is amazing .. :p the pit special was enough for two, soo good can't wait to go back to try more

Qw0_EH6occENtdlcd49OBA.text: To quote Leonardo Talbertini, "this place was fantastic!"  In Vegas for a business meting and chose to dine in here and get some local BBQ and we are glad we did!  Portions were plentiful, food was fantastic and the service was great as well.  The amount of food you get for the price was also great.  This is a BBQ place that knows what they are doing!

S1ZMPsLoBfylpUjomvCGKA.text: Amazing food! The potato salad is my favorite ever. The neighborhood is super sketchy, though.

FN-MiDXqba17kH8H4GlUog.text: Oh my god this place is amazing. It reminds me of the Deep South. The service is good, and the food is amazing. Go in for lunch and they have great specials. Rarely do good places pop up in this area but this place is a gem.

vCjRDy53buFX7zwcsnMb6Q.text: I absolutely fell in love with this place the first time I had the brisket where you could taste the smoke in the meat! Then I took a friend back for a second visit and had the rib tips...not a good idea...I had the bubble guts for the rest of the day and felt horrible. I would still go back however I will definitely avoid the rib tips! Besides that, everything else is amazing!

I0qtv_ylGE8NO2_cCMNZ3A.text: Legit!!! Had the ribs and loaded potato. Wow! It was great! Highly recommend this for anybody looking for authentic non commercialized BBQ!

shOG3sMRK5BkrfjVGOkwug.text: 5 STAR FOOD with 5 STAR SERVICE! I ordered the 2 meat combo. 2 ribs, sliced brisket and Mac n cheese. Everything was GREAT! I first tried them at the Pigs for Kids BBQ competition. My favorite BBQ place in Vegas. Thanks RS BBQ and thanks to Karina at the front counter!

XxuhnntnRLD31fvtQEtQvw.text: Amazing amazing amazing! We fell in love and can't wait to go back. The brisket was wonderful and so was the CORNBREAD. The loaded mashed potatoes were definitely worthy of getting again. The only thing I would pass up is the Mac n cheese. Just not cheesy enough for me but everything else was so delicious!

W_m0sndVLSNjNsFIs05AwQ.text: My family is originally from Kansas City and Memphis.  This is the best BBQ, we've had this side of the USA.  We will definitely return the next time that we are back in the area.

dQYv5Bum9Hih5i1IHqW0Hw.text: Everything here is delicious! I ordered the trio plate with sliced brisket, chicken, and pulled pork with bacon potato salad & cheezy Mac n cheese! So much food & such original flavored & taste. The best BBQ in Vegas!

iRX105X7cRPO9U_R9MCw9w.text: I always look for different places to eat in Las Vegas for my bowling gangs yearly trip from Hawaii.  This year it was BBQ!  Rollinsmoke, was the best BBQ ribs my gang and I have had outside of Hawaii.  From the generous portions to the fall off the bone, meaty beef ribs...It was ONO(Hawaiian for DELICIOUS).  Anyplace with an AYCE option always attracts Hawaii Folk...But, lemme tell you that with the generous portions;I could hardly get past the first plate.  However, there's always room for dessert!  The cobbler with ice cream did not disappoint!  YUMMY!  Looking for Rollinsmoke was a lil challenge from the highway...blink and you may miss it.  Small on outside;big on inside...With seating inside and out;there was plenty of room to accommodate my group of twelve and then some.  Our group also included 4 kids(they have a kid's menu)this place is very family friendly.  In or going to Vegas? Check this place out!  I know my friends and I will!  Until next time, Aloha and Mahalo

zsanvcZ-WKdvflWTkkUK6g.text: This place never lets you down. Kind of an awkward dining room set up but the food makes up for it then some. The menu is on the wall with alot of options.  The outlaw burger is the BEST burger in Vegas & huge. I usually get the duo which is a 2 meat combo its $11! Also they have all u can eat! So many awards in the wall you lose count. If you're in Vegas you cant miss this hidden gem.

4T8mqs5O9h1jvt1Kz9hpLg.text: Loved Loved the food while on our visit to Vegas.  We wanted to get off the strip and try some really good food and this was the place.  I highly recommend it..

XvIBxScz0kN5yQst84uB4w.text: Excellent barbeque!! We had the three meat plate with brisket, pork, and hot links. My husband loved the pork. I got the chicken nacho fries and they were amazing!! Ended our meal with peach cobbler. Great experience and not far from the strip. I highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken nacho fries

3GfJdAmRr4-5Z9XOOneakw.text: Great tender brisket.  Loved the hot link, not oily, meaty with a bit of burn.  The Arkansauce was good.  Corn nuggets were good, but I will try potato salad next visit.

f06KbtJnEswsDW3EMVa74A.text: Love this place. Try the corn nuggets. It's great. The brisket is amazingly good. Everything here is good. Even the pickles are good. Customer service is an A.

H68wjrEkvIt5eJJsRmna-A.text: Great, great, great BBQ. I had the Brisket 3 ways. All the meat was cooked to perfection. Loved the variety of sauces. If you're in Vegas and want to have a little taste of Murica' served with a side of freedom, this is the place!

883G8vwsbbRlpuUv4u1muA.text: This place is pretty darn fantastic! It's crowded most of the time, but you'll understand why once you've experienced the food.

6U9lzvEdgu80vWCmskQ3Ww.text: great dive location...can't beat the food. Industrial area behind the fashion show mall.

tIBlPnxxRRN6HAKbt8Tvbg.text: I'm from California and apparently I have been deprived of good BBQ for the 27 years of my life on this earth. This stuff is melt in your mouth, I can't stop eating good. I'm pretty sure I left 3 lbs heavier than when I walked in. We ordered and loved the pulled pork, brisket, and hot links. The loaded mash potatoes and green beans were great as sides but the yams were too sweet for my taste. I was impressed by the service too. While we were eating a gentleman sitting nearby complained about his bread. The manager (maybe owner?) personally came out to apologize and make things right. It showed how much he valued his customers and how passionate he is about the business.  Side note: they're BBQ sauces are gluten free! Yay!

02FCyY_MJwVNsqf92H6xfQ.text: Excellent food.  Good service.  I'm a fan.  I have had this on my restaurant bucket list for quite some time, but I finally tried it.  I will go back.

NX0xPPJ2ft_zd5ar5S0TRw.text: 31 years living in Las Vegas and I just found the holy grail of BBQ.  I've been everywhere including the strip and this is the place.  If you are visiting,  do yourself a favor and eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best bbq in vegas, hands down no contest.

g5Wi6yYcSUOno1Gl9UG8Cw.text: Arguably the best BBQ I have had. The mac n cheese is hands down amazing. The corn tots are addictive, and dangerous, and your mouth will salivate at every bite for the pulled pork and brisket. If you pass this place up you've made a big mistake, HUGE!!!!

3L_FOdOa_fvb4FhFhqPZRg.text: BBQ place that just don't go wrong.. I ordered the PIT Special and it was delicious!  The brisket was so soft it melts away in your mouth, the sauce is so good and it's on every table! So you can pour as much as you want.. All over them ribs! Chicken!! Hot link!! Anything!!  The chicken was the same as many bbq place, but the Hotlink are made special and it has a nice kick to it!  Don't forget the sides... Ordered the loaded mash, cheesey mac and the fries.. All delicious! And come with big portions!  So id you want a good BBQ meal with a good price this is it!  Worth 19.98 for the pit special w/drink...so come down and give this local area a try...

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken,hot link, and brisket.. With my 3 side of mac and cheese, loaded mash and hash fries..

G2ZfyoxQ0vjOLy4XeU7W-Q.text: Excellent food!! This was our first time here and we were certainly not disappointed. The line was long but moved quickly and we were greeted by their chef who patiently helped us select our food. My husband got the Outlaw burger and loved it. I did the combo brisket, chicken, and hot link which was also heavenly. Don't forget to add the jalapeno coleslaw and bacon potato salad. Oh and the corn nuggets were Amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw Burger and Bacon Potato Salad

fkVjJQ0nd1IHI0DTnrjykg.text: Read about this place while on the and and decided to come here straight from the airport. Was not disappointed at all. Ribs just fall off the bone,  the outlaw burger is huge!! It has brisket in the party. Prices are good.  We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DaaXC7hCHO2gh4MhSFHlrg.text: My first time here! Very great customer service. My boyfriend got the Outlaw burger, it was humongous! Very good. It does take a bit longer to make, but it's worth it. Everyone was super friendly! Their mama's banana pudding was delicious. Can't wait to come back to try more BBQ goodness!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw Burger and corn nuggets!

CPo0nJPjOuZah4t0Jj3i-g.text: Found this place searching for good BBQ in Vegas and was not disappointed.  My boyfriend and I got the 5 meat combo and it was more than the two of us could finish.  Our hostess/cashier Sophia gave us great recommendations, and her kind and upbeat personality was just the start to an excellent meal.  I think my order of preference of the 5 meats we got would be:  brisket, pork ribs, beef ribs, pulled pork, then chicken.  However, all were delicious.

1BgzivoYd6gRy86McMgTRg.text: Vegas might finally realize good BBQ is a necessity!  This place has really good BBQ and generous portions.  We tried a bit of everything - beef ribs, St. Louis ribs, babybacks, chopped and sliced brisket, burnt ends, pulled pork and chicken.  All moist, tender and delicious.  The corn nuggets and bacon potato salad were excellent.  I'm a bit on the fence over the different BBQ sauces.  They were tasty, not bad...just different.  Inside and outside seating.  We got there very early and had no wait, but the lines quickly fill up.  I'll be back when we're in Vegas.

LwtYtZhHTIA6olG8oPQO2Q.text: Hands down the best BBQ I've had in a while and the best BBQ in Las Vegas...off the strip but not by much....   If you want BBQ do not hesitate to go here.   It's small and casual, Just how a BBQ joint should be  Plus the soda is a fountain machine that you can refill yourself.    So no going thirsty while eating. Here.     Overall I know I will be back here anytime I come to Vegas and recommend to anyone who wants BBQ

CG1LA0ypHpVL_hHHFxAViQ.text: We stopped by here for dinner a few nights ago while traveling through. Things are a little pricier than I would imagine for the amount of food you get. I did the two meat meal for $10.99. I got two short ribs and two strips of brisket on top of a soggy piece of white bread and a side of macaroni and cheese. I thought the short ribs were very good and would recommend those. The brisket was good and the macaroni and cheese was forgettable. My wife got the $7.99 brisket sandwich and thought it was pretty good.  Because we checked in via Yelp, we got a "free dessert." We ordered the Blue Bell Ice Cream Sundae. What they brought us was a shot glass sized plastic cup filled 2/3 with ice cream and 1/3 with whipped cream. If that dessert really costs 3.99, it is a complete rip off. It's more likely that they only gave us a sample size dessert as the "free dessert" that was advertised. Don't they know better than to cut corners with people who use Yelp? Whatever the case, I was less than impressed by that.   Overall, I might stop back by here to give it another shot if I was in town for a bit and looking for a meal under $15 a plate (although they have many options that would put you over that limit, including an all you can eat thing for $25). But with so many other places to eat in Vegas, it's more likely I'll try somewhere else.

FmCm4Cuy-_DloR-5BI2E8g.text: I lived in the South for about 10 years or so and while I was there, I got real taste for good barbecue, so when I heard about this place, I was excited to try it. It did not live up to my expectations.  I had the two meat plate with pulled pork and 1/4 chicken, with a side of mac 'n' cheese. This comes with their house sauce, which seems to be some sort of Arkansas-style sauce. I didn't care for the sauce and while it didn't affect my rating, my decision to avoid the sauce did.  So here's the problem:  even without the sauce, I should have been able to tell that the meat had been smoked. The pork tasted like...pork. Not smoked pork. Just pork. The same with the chicken. I could have gone to the grocery store and picked up a whole rotisserie chicken and it would have tasted exactly the same.  According to the web site, they use rubs on their meat. I did not see or taste any evidence of this. Both the pork and the chicken were bland. I can't say either meat tasted bad, but I also can't say either meat tasted like they'd been barbecued.  One other thing -- the service was a lot slower than I would expect for meat that's supposedly been cooked already. I took 20 minutes for me to get my food. I've never had barbecue take that long.  I don't think I'll be going back.

dtRVlUCygnbBSOtReHqRDA.text: BBQ nirvana!  First time there.  We are always on the hunt for good 'que.  This is the best in the valley. Eat in at the picnic tables or take out.  Unknown if beer is available.  Spotless clean.  Order at the counter and the staff will bring out your food quickly.   Lots of sauces to samp!e on you r meat. Hubby ordered 1/2 rack beef ribs (2) that must of had 1/3 lb of meat each.  Tender and smoky.   I had chicken that was so juicy and tender.  Love soul food so I ordered collard greens plus mac  and cheese.  Their greens were the best I've ever had and the mac a close second. Also ordered beans that hubby was trying to slow down as delicious.  Not sweet.  Beans with a little cayenne kick.   Since we were doing take out, we got corn nuggets for the road.   Creamed corn in a light batter that is deep fried.  The nuggets were gone and enjoyed by the time we got home.  Definitely enough to share. Use your GPS to get there and on your way back.  In a small strip mall under an overpass near the strip. Wow wow wow.  Going to get my Rollin Smoke BBQ again and again

L-rDY-aSdIVdHu49D4vk-A.text: I really enjoyed everything words can't explain how much I loved it just go try it !! I PROMISE you'll love how the meat is cooked so nicely the sides are flavored great ! I'm a picky eater and enjoyed everything, my order was took  but the chef  came out & let me know & then remade my food very fast he also gave me a FREE banana pudding !! I'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana pudding for later
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not a fan of greeens but I loved them I can&#39;t wait to try everything!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maccaroni sooooo good (:

_rm3H7UjzCOwUZ1FKUBbww.text: One of the best pulled pork and pork ribs i've had.., must try... hope they have it on our country.

t8ACQ04Fa8p4Ev1BVY7TaQ.text: Ahhhhhh! Came to Vegas to visit some friends and was tried of eating crap from the strip. Saw this on yelp and had to drive over for dinner. This joint is a straight hole in the wall with lots of people waiting in line to get them some BBQ. Friends and I ( party of 3 ) ended up deciding that the $50 party platter ( feeds 4-5 people ) would be the best choice for our hungry selves . HANDS DOWN!! The best bbq I've ever bought from a restaurant . Meats were succulent , the sauces were everything . Portions on point! The employees were super nice and down to earth as well. Will totally come back here when I'm in Vegas!

xdLiulGGvmIfrNo7uu1-ZQ.text: Don't let the hole in the wall location in a ghetto strip mall scare you.  We got the Trio Plate and Duo Plate (Chopped Brisket, Ribs, and Pork) with sides of Corn Nuggets and Bacon Potato Salad.  All the meat was so tender and the sides were amazing.  They also 5-6 different types of sauces to pick from.  The tables around us were all locals so you know it's a legit place!  Our tummies were happy and we left with food coma.  We will definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

SrvzhUElux0d7LpWiTSEgg.text: SO GOOD! My brother and boyfriend split the Pit Sampler ($27.00) and it was sooo worth it! Both of them are big guys and were very full afterwards! My mom and I split the meatloaf, and again, it was AMAZING! This is a little hole in the wall, but the great customer service and food makes it five stars!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bx4JAh7TxxBdLJfNSpH0Ag.text: The food was much better than we expected.  We ordered the Tri tip and ribs.  They were both cooked to perfection with just the right amount of smoke flavor and moisture.  The collard greens, corn and cornbread made perfect sides.  Another score for Yelp! Will definitely add this to the list of Vegas spots we will hit on our next trip!

00_nsB4ZwYR1yYMgSucE0w.text: Holy smoke was this the right bbq pick!! First of all the price is not bad for the amount of food you get.   We shared the 3 way brisket plate that comes with one side. We chose the bbq baked beans which was really good and I don't even care for beans.  The plate comes with chopped brisket soooo good put a little of the carolina sauce on it and you'll stuff yourself because you can't stop eating it.     The sliced brisket had a nIce little smoke on it with enough fat on it so it's tender, I mean practically fork cutting tender.    But the star is the burnt ends!!!!  Seriously melt in your mouth and the  sauce is just clinging to each of the moist, flavorful morsel of meat.  It is by far the best burnt ends ever conceived.     The other sides we bought were the corn tots, I can't remember what their actually called but they are good. It's creamed corn that's deep fried .    The other side was the collard greens. Perfectly cooked. Delicious!!    One more time,  get the burnt ends!!!!!

objW3-z5OjSWMgUJSPSSZg.text: Corn nuggets  definitely a must try!  Sauces are a little thin for my liking but the food was good and the service was great!

UlX3CPI4CPereohbsI5mGQ.text: It seems like every person in my office had been here and was in love so I knew I had to give it a try. So when we had to choose a place for an in office lunch there was zero disagreement that we had to order from Rollin Smoke. The location is a bit of a hike from my home in Henderson, but not too far from work (lucky me!).   We've now ordered twice since it was such a hit the first time. We ordered the Super Sampler which was definitely the right amount of meat for 8-10 people. It looks like a lot of food, but nobody will be able to resist seconds. Six pints of sides will not go far if choosing six different sides. I would suggest choosing three different items instead of six to make sure there is enough to go around.  The MEAT. You come here for the meat because it is the best BBQ meat you'll have the pleasure of putting in your mouth. All of the meats are obviously smoked and they do it to perfection. The flavor is really sealed into the meats. The ribs fall off the bone, chicken and pork are tender, and the sausage packs a nice heat.  I have enjoyed almost all of the sides as well. My favorites have been the Collard Greens (with brisket of course), Macaroni and Cheese, and Baked Beans. The only side that wasn't awesome was the Loaded Mash. Maybe my taste buds were off this day, but it tasted instant.   If you haven't been here then you are missing out on great BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e1UONZlJE-wOu3-ilaDl8A.text: First time it was great. The second time was not. I ordered the rib and pork combo and the meat was really tough and not so meaty. Your better off going to Nevada chicken cafe where the ribs are so good and meaty and their chicken is really good too. I don't know what happened..it must be the cook. I ordered online too and they forgot to make the green beans...i had to wait 10 minutes more for it. The cashier had to remiind the guy in the back twice before putting in a batch. No apology or anything. Won't be coming here again. Nevada chicken won me over with food and good customer service.

LmsHe8DKGquX9Fq7OgVQNg.text: We went to the location across from Spearmint Rhino and after hearing great things about this place and how much better than our usual bbq spot.....not good at all? So disappointed! Service 5 stars.

eN4FN6o7G34njCZG9K71Lg.text: Awesome BBQ spot!!! Great service, thanks Christal. A must try in vegas!!! Get the burnt end sandwich and the corn nuggets!

bTKxLbrCbO36sZJC9k2WeQ.text: Fantastic 'Q'.  In addition, try the corn nuggets.  Friendly and attentive staff.  We got the 5 meat combo and left full.  The cobbler was a good addition, so leave room.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

510nHmnTMdJH8d9E59qPjQ.text: An absolute must for fans of good barbecue! This place is clearly a local secret and is a bit off the strip but well worth the extra five minutes. Parking is free and it's not crowded or overpriced like everything else on the strip.

7fap7M0E2BS5aGClhCUHAw.text: This is a hidden gem! The food is delicious and not too badly priced. I usually go there around 11:30/12:00 during the week, and my food is always served relatively quickly. There is more seating than you anticipate, too! There's some inside where you order, a couple of picnic tables outside, and then there's a whole other room full of picnic tables on the west side of the building. All their barbecue sauces are in both areas, too, so don't worry about grabbing some near the cash register before you sit down.

xnSVjwQrUwGkQhRoa0xNXg.text: This place was not all that. Eat at your own risk. Be careful when you enter you might hit somebody with the door

or25jMP_CLsGujb9xg5bIg.text: Decent turkey wrap - average food. You can do better in Vegas.

PfCVw4_3QR19WmoYhPGp2g.text: I never tried BBQ in the southern states but Rollin smoke is for sure one of the better BBQ places in Vegas. The location is I NV a weird place by the industrial strip mall behind the strip, but the food is good. Don't let the outside looks fool you.  I order a two meat combo which comes with a side and a dinner roll. For their side you have to try the corn nuggets. I always change my choices of meat between the hot links, ribs, and the brisket depending on what I'm craving. This place is always busy so be prepared to wait for your food if you come in during lunch hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gNZTTgG1718MxbqbLaQ5Kw.text: Went here on all of the good reviews and I was not disappointed.  The staff was very friendly, and the food was excellent.  The only issue was the seating.  I sat on some benches and they were not comfortable at all.  The slats on the bench were not level.  It was like sitting on the edges of the wood.  It just made it uncomfortable. I guess then people would not stay a long time since it was busy and most of the tables were taken.  Another issue but not a big one is that you may have to sit with other people.  I sat at a long table with 2 other people.  They were sitting on one end and I sat at the other.

ewITetrV3aWzeW623tW68w.text: AMAZING!! Best BBQ I have eaten in a long time!!! Cole slaw and macaroni and cheese are awesome as well!!! No bad food at this place!!! Definitely worth waiting in line so don't pass this place without trying it!!  Staff is very helpful!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gkCdTxsYYqPW4y7t-aJgXA.text: Been here numerous times. Nothin fancy at the hole in the wall (actually two storefronts combined), but damn good BBQ and sides.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s the real deal -- SMOKE not oven-baked.

_1xx7LT10v2xdsAEvrvs_w.text: So many good options to choose from!  Love the brisket!  We got takeout from here while we were working nearby.  Great service and great food!

4ba-bZPXdCLPFBiGLLaOcQ.text: Fantastic food and fantastic people. Met their pit master and he let us try practically everything! Their pecan pie was Divine!!!

K_jK7qzaCbVGumGzwOL7xA.text: As I write this I am about 60 minutes removed from the table and I am uncomfortably full yet wholly content. I was told about Rollin' Smoke Barbeque about a week ago and I have been wanting to try it since.  I can check that off the list now.  I went with a co-worker, the very same man who told me about it in the first place.  Immediately upon my exit of the car in the tiny parking lot I noticed the smell of BBQ smoke.  It was only enhanced as I entered the establishment.  Aside from the delicious smell of BBQ, which has permeated every fiber of my clothing and still lingers, I was greeted by a huge version of their menu posted to the wall.  I opted for the smaller hand held version though.  It was easier to read.  After looking at said menu for a few minutes I decided on the brisket dog.  I also ordered a side of corn nuggets based on reccomendations from my dining acquaitance of the day.  The hot dog was immense to the point where I gave up eating it with my hands and went with the fork and knife method.  It was a heavy gauge dog with a fantastic red color and the nice snap of a natural casing.  But it was difficult to actually see that beneath the truck load of fried onions, chopped brisket and nacho cheese.  What a gut buster this behemoth is.  Then there are the corn nuggets.  Little bite sized fried pieces of corny goodness.  It is best described as fried creamed corn.  It is crunchy on the outside and creamy on the inside with the sweetness I have grown to love.  Frying it just adds to the alure.  After eating the dog and these corn nuggets along with drinking a cup of lemonade, I am stuffed.

Zc0N0CwIlpjCPES0WSH3AQ.text: Best BBQ in Vegas! Love the brisket and ribs..but cant go wrong with anything on the menu!

tjiESCJFVYJEzqqdu2Tv0g.text: it was damn good!!!! $! hands down the best bbq in viva las vegas they allow you to try everything on the menu with there varity of combos. everything is prepared and cooked to perfection from the entrees, sides, & desserts.

D4IdBYBxwdw__aoJIFU--Q.text: Everything's hot and tasty. Can't go wrong with the brisket nachos! Busy but always goes fast, perfect lunch spot.

WFWv_PLBbW6rmUyR3B4XfA.text: Holly cow, the best barbecue places I've ever been to or at least this side of Texas.  It's a good place to stop by after you visit "Count's Kustoms" down the street.  Enter from W. Desert Inn Road and look for the big BBQ sign on the store front.  Make your order, find a table, make your drinks, and wait about 10-15 minutes.  They'll bring your order to you with a smile.  My first visit, I went for the 3 meat choice (brisket, chicken, and hot links).  The brisket, soft.  The chicken, most and tender.  The hot links, full of taste packing sneaky heat.  As the saying goes, "broke da mouth".

lQ2nD3e4PwWl7NZAGybe8w.text: So I was looking for a BBQ place off the strip and this place came up the moment I ordered my beef ribs I knew I was in love the ribs,  they didn't fall off the bone but there was smoked just right there is sauce was right on the table so I was able to smother my ribs,  the macaroni and cheese was to die for it's really creamy and really tasty the collar greens were good I love this place so much I went back twice in a row will be coming back if I ever have a need and taste for BBQ in Vegas

8kDC6RbvLljbg1ykQNiEwQ.text: Definitely the best barbeque I've had in Vegas. Don't waste your money at expensive restaurants on the Strip. The quality of the food is amazing at this place and the portion sizes are generous. Will definitely be coming back!

3NS8x2qAiDy0vvkfXilkEQ.text: We were pleasantly surprised, both by the quality of the barbecue (in Vegas!) and the exceptional service. The sides are also deadly delicious.

XhCOo2eSnlBAf9QJ9PlXTQ.text: Amazing, amazing, amazing! Our first stop when we get to Vegas. Hands down best BBQ I've ever had. Such tender, flavorful masterfully cooked meats and super yummy sides. Cute decor & extremely friendly staff. Wish they had one in Cali!

6cRD5owQQXT6h3UpKM8aDw.text: Best Mac n cheese I've ever had. The only one I would ever eat again. The bbq is good but expensive.

VloEpfxIDPcTogpCj-TP7g.text: Ok nothing but praise on this one. All staff were friendly and informative as this was our first trip. Then the food came, only planned on eating half and saving the rest for drunchies. That did not happen the food is great. Had the smoked links, pork and brisket. The corn nuggets are soo good. Check in on yelp and get a delicious dessert. A for sure return place.

M0Pyb72MqQ4KoQO6bOBwiw.text: Definitely a must try if your in the mood for ribs. Hot link was tasty!!   Brisket was just ok but all in all a great little joint.   I'll be back for more!!!!  Don't forget the fried okra!

57Mz0KnGiY5DxBnIVvEdGQ.text: Hands down the best BBQ in Las Vegas. The side dishes are the best I have ever had at any BBQ or restaurant. If you have not been here yet what are you waiting for? Corn bread corn things (forgot name) are amazing. Bacon potato salad awesome. Ribs are the best. Pulled pork check. Brisket is my least favorite but I would eat it everyday if I could. This place now makes me go to the gym three times a week just so I can constantly eat here. Owner is the man too loves what he does and it shows in his food.

OV1LXiu7nU5kWwXhlQh8UA.text: OMG This place is amazing! If you're looking for the best BBQ ever then you should definitely come here! Seriously I was so full and I wanted to keep eating because it was that good!

oTvr-oshAMCol9yGHCfhXg.text: This BBQ place has very good food. I had the five meat combo brisket, ribs chicken hot link and pulled pork with three sides. Now this is touted as enough to feed two or three. I ate godanm near the whole fucking thing in one sitting, and I know my 150 lb twenty three year old son could have wiped the whole thing out. Maybe from Bakersfield our appetite for Que is a bit too much? Anyhow very good food, very nice people and the food was very fast too, literally within five minutes I had my food. I will come back if I am in the area. Highly recommended!

YV9ZHMcTK9VazqlOPqw5OA.text: The BBQ here is amazing! I tried it today for the first time and I will definitely be returning.  My favorite was the BBQ nachos with beef brisket. The meat was smokey and tender...pretty much perfection! Service was also great. They greeted everyone upon entrance and really made you feel welcome.

gOwNrm0t9UKS02zNRQaSpg.text: Definitely GOOD BBQ  I live in San Diego and we have a few decent BBQ spots one being Phils which in San Diego seats about 300+ and always has a line out the door.   This place blows phils out of the water, they use a rub on the ribs and a little bit of BBQ sauce you can add more to your liking. I usually prefer a moloasses based bbq sauce with little to no vinegar flavor. There sauce was a great combo of both and add it to the rub on the meat its like a match made in hell at high heat cooked to perfection.   I was in vegas with my father so we split a half rack of ribs and the meatloaf which is a looks like meatloaf but thats about it because they fill it with pork and different bbq favorites that take it to the next level.   Great spot off the strip, went on a weeknight no lines, parked in front, great food and experience. BTW if you have had Phils BBQ in San diego this blows it away.

mEJh8JLBFwiUZuibHau05A.text: Best BBQ in Vegas/ everywhere  I am from Texas and this BBQ is better!  You have to try the bacon Potato salad, co slaw, mashed potatoes! We get the pick 3 meat chicken, sausage and pork ribs fall off the bone. Sweet tea taste like its from Texas!  Eat here if you want amazing BBQ!

MVEWp4iv3p7_8aIjEgnPRg.text: I don't know where to start!  First of all this was an order for takeout and to get 5 stars from me on a takeout order is a pretty big deal!    I ordered the brisket trio which was exactly as described. It was not drowning in spicy barbecue sauce or seasoning. Only down side was not enough to be off putting, but again with the darn green onion garnish on top of all the food!    I can't even with this banana pudding too!  Probably the absolute best I've ever had!  It's almost like a frosting consistency but not overly sweet or banana flavored in any way. Incredible!  Can't wait to go back for more corn nuggets and pudding!

N6ARWSuy0U55s6JJHLS-Pw.text: My wife picked up some food from here and holly crap it was soooooo gooood best BBQ I've ever put in mouth especially the cornbread wow amazing

UatLoKImTJSk_ws-d3mc8w.text: In full disclosure I used to own and operate a BBQ restaurant so I may be a bit more critical of a BBQ place.  Rollin Smoke is decent place , but they do not really explore the depth of tastes that come from with a real smoker. and sauce  I don't have anything ill to say about Rollin Smoke, but it is far from the best BBQ in Vegas (I am not yet ready to name that place).    I ordered the brisket, chicken and ribs.   If you are nearby and need BBQ, this could work for you.

x32Sc7Iumu_UeORebRfb1g.text: The best BBQ I have had in a very long time. Ribs, pull pork, brisket, everything was good. The beef rib was the best!!! very juicy and tendon, it melts in your mouth. Also love the BBQ beans that have so much smoke flavor and waffle fries was crispy. A little bit disappointed with the corn bread compared to other sides but we still ate them all :)   10% discount if you go to the restaurant website and show the coupons via your phone to the cashier.

xlOQMY_tETpyUt23alN5tw.text: Barbeque is dear to my heart - wait, I done said that before ain't I? Damn, I'm starting to sound like a broken wagon wheel. Well hell, I ain't ashamed to say it - I love me some barbeque!    Yeehaw!  I spent a good bit a time in Texas, so it ain't no surprise Texas barbeque ranks up there on my list of the some of the best eats this here world's got to offer - brisket, ribs, sausage and of course, smoke. There's this little barbeque shack in Austin that smokes its brisket for 16 hours, can you believe that - 16 hours? It comes out crispy and as black as coal on the outside but just as juicy as all get out on the in, with the prettiest pink smoke ring, it just about makes you wanna cry. Why, I spect it's about as close to heaven as one could ask for. The fella who runs this place is a real arteest - leavin' just the perfect amount a fat to make that brisket as moist as a Guadalupe mud pie. Anyway, when I thinks of barbeque, well, that's what comes to mind.  So it ain't no surprise to the folks that knows me that Rolling Smoke Barbeque just doesn't cut the brisket - or rather, it cuts too much of the brisket. Where's my crispy, burnt, smoky edge, where's my juicy, tender beef, and where's my smoke ring - what the hell did you do with my smoke ring? Boy, angels is weeping in Amarillo.  Now don't get me started on them there sausages - they's got so much flavor, why did you have to go and overcook it like that? I mean this stuff was drier than a West Texas desert. It's a good thing them corn fritters was damn tasty (course, I'd had better) or I'da went to bed hungry that night.  Okay, I'll admit it, for Vegas this shit ain't bad - hell it just might be the best barbeque joint in town, but that's no damn excuse.   For pete's sake stop cutting off the good stuff  for dem sissy-pant  intellectual types from Henderson. They's so terrified of this part of town anyway, they drive in and out of here so fast you'd think their asses was on fire.   This is barbeque dammit! People's food. We knows its got fat, we knows its got calories, we knows it ain't healty, but that's the way we likes it - if we's wanted healthy we'd go to Henderson. Besides, it'a give us a chance to put a scare in dem locals up there.  Shit gets a 3 cause this is Vegas, but don't go thinkin I'm all happy or anythin'. Ya'll make me miss Texas.

s_fQ9ATL6EGiDD9gO-B_cA.text: I got the trio meat plate with brisket, chicken, and ribs and I'm telling you it was the best bbq I've had in a while. This is real bbq in the heart of Vegas and a must stop if you're visiting! My brother finished his outlaw sandwich in about 5 mins because it was so good Hahah

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You must try this place!!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It was so good Trio meat plate!

wo2clACyBsoi_oLWVh9AlQ.text: Found this spot by accident bcoz of Yelp. Reviews were great so we decided to give it a try. As we drove in i started getting worried bcoz the ambiance wasn't what I expected. It was a saturday noon when we arrived. We were in line waiting to order when suddenly people started coming in in groups. Suddenly they were busy... Oh coz it's lunch time. Wow! I guess they really are popular. Since it was our first time we ordered the 3 meat meal with macncheese and extra order of mashed potatoes. I can't remember how much we paid but it sure was very much affordable than what we would usually pay at  Lucille's for the amount of food we got.  I wasnt able to take pictures as we were starving and we just ate soon as our food arrived. What we ordered again was a 3 meat meal with mcncheese and extra side of mashed potatoes and drinks. The meat meal also came with a roll. The serving was enough to feed 2 adults a preteen and a toddler. They were yummy!!!! Very flavorful. Serving was ample to actually alot (atleast for us).  Staff were excellent. The lady who took my order was very helpful. She gave suggestions and didn't quite rushed me despite the line behind me.   We liked this place so much that i recommended it the same week when my workplace offered to treat the employees for lunch.  Too bad this place is far from our place. But we'll surely eat or take out again when we are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cup says its dam good. Well it sure is!

3YQMglCTiFHyPEc8Jw4lWQ.text: This place was absolutely delicious. The staff was very friendly I had the rib tips mac and cheese greens cornbread and the potatoes.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Hk6oZquTHPOHswnMWCb2rQ.text: Excellent food and amazing customer service!  After a long day on the road, my girlfriend wanted bbq so we decided to give Rollin smoke a try, and I'm glad we did.  The person who took our order was super friendly, informative and just great to deal with. His name was Dave and this establishment is lucky to have a person like him working there. Keep up the fantastic work Dave!  Our food was also amazing, everything was flavourful and the portion size was huge.

KN5bOEbSoTwo7GJ5V70BWA.text: Wow! Eating it as I type! Awesome taste, portions, and customer service. We got beef ribs, rib tips, and greens are they were all so delicious! Liezel had awesome customer service and the food was great! Would recommend to anyone looking for good BBQ!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb BBQ

RbvvK9_0X6T7GgszzdWIJA.text: Man...thank you Nelson Q for checking in! I came right after he left! We had the Pulled Piggy sandwich for $7.99 and the Trio Choice Plate which gives you a choice of 3 meats. We got the brisket, pork, and 2 spare ribs for $13.99. Oh it was divine! The meat on the spare ribs just slips right off of the bone, and the pulled pork was just juicy and full of that smokey flavor.  The owner conversed with us for a bit, and based on his choice of decor in the place, you can tell hes an Arkansas fan. He was super humble and couldn't stop being grateful for all the Yelpers who had Yelped about this place. He also helped us with making choices. With a party of two he suggested the trio plate and the pulled pork sandwich if we wanted to have variety since the plates were more than enough to share. We chose beans and mac and cheese as our sides, and I tell you it was also just as good and homemade tasting as the meats! He also told us a little bit about the process in which they smoke the meats in their smoker right behind the restaurant, and smokes it for 16 hours (no wonder it's so good!). He wanted give Las Vegas a taste of good old Arkansas bbq, and he sure did!  When you check in you get a free pie with your meal! I got the sweet potato, ala mode of course! Super delish, and a must try. I will see you soon. Hands down one of my favorite places to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork sandwich got you pulling your hair out in goodness.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib platter. 1 beef rib. 3 baby back 2 spare ribs. Definite must.

eV9y3UAX5DmbQeWFifbLcg.text: Touched down into Las Vegas, typed in "BBQ" and this spot popped up. Before I even walked in, Danny was right there offering help as a newbie. What a great choice! Definitely coming back with friends during our weekend trip. Thanks, Danny!

MDpiGrDOchra6Iw8b_8Msw.text: Given all the yelp hype, Rollin Smoke was not as good as I had hoped.  I really like tender fall off the bone meat with some bold sweet, hot, mild, vinegar based sauce options. While the portions were huge, and the prices good, this didn't quite do it for me.

BvHbp_jkE8ZHTcvSnPFCFA.text: Good smokey bbq with some very nice owners Typically going to Vegas it's the same restaurants or small food/snack shops that keeps the stomach satisfied, but on the last trip a couple friends decided to come here for a birthday dinner. Upon reaching the premises my nose was hit with the mouth watering smell of bbq. Our party of 18 or so people were given a spot at an empty room and were greeted with great enthusiasm and hospitality. My gf and I were probably the 4th to put in the order of the Outlaw burger and the Rib Plater special. After waiting in the room slowly everyone started to get their food and were enjoying the dinner while we waited. After coming in to check on us (forgot the gentlemen's name) he explained the food was forgotten or being remade, which I can't remember, but long story short they got us the food and also gave us a free A LA MODE Black berry cobbler.  Rating of the burger and ribs  -Jaw dropping sized burger filled with such tasty bbq flavor that's complimented with the onion strings (DROOOL) -Very flavorful sauce (More on the tangy side) on the ribs and the meat slides right off -The cobbler is something that needs to be ordered either by you or someone in your party. I was so full after the burger and a few ribs but was able to have a bite off the cobbler and it was amazing. Full of flavor and just takes over all that meat/bbq flavor in your mouth.

MGKOt7d1NPT47XEmioxzEA.text: The single best barbecue I've had in my entire life, me and my fiance are already saying we want this for our wedding party. I only wish I could give it more stars. The original location is the best one (and is a little cheaper than the touristy ones called ricks rolling barbecue), though they are all amazing in the food they give you.

Lz5kMz5nEMPpWyUex3XxNg.text: This is my favorite place to visit every time I come to Vegas. Their briskets and beef ribs are delicious. Their service is also good..

g5FAIzRX71nXp0eAz3aQKw.text: The Best Bar Que in Vegas! Chef Tim takes great care of his customers with that finger licking good flavor!! The Beef Brisket is to die for!! The ribs are out of this world!!

6ESyj0BBDrw3TgzWt4K5Aw.text: Great BBQ in Vegas, excellent service from Will & Lizelle.   Would definitely go back.

TVJi-oeUNAgRF99aaoV6dg.text: Best BBQ in Vegas, and possibly anywhere else. Any time I have visitors in town, or a special occasion, or any excuse to stop by, I make it happen. The brisket is the best I've ever had, as are the burnt ends. I can't tecommend Rollin Smoke highly enough.

RmhNw2XqyLH8YIMzHFvi3g.text: The super sample was so much food!! It fed 10 plus ppl!! My fave was the pulled pork, bread, bbq sauce and Mac n cheese!! I would try this again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cTxOl06y91qstVOUmrHvIw.text: So many different combinations to choose from, settled on the The brisket and ribs and they were out of this world. Don't let the neighborhood scare you. It's worth the trip ! Great friendly caring service.

c5K0NtGcvBASqeDlLwi2NA.text: Outstanding Southern style BBQ with great prices for all budgets.  And there are so many choices on the menu to keep you coming back.  Best BBQ in Vegas and maybe the best in the Western US.  Saturday afternoon the line was 5 deep.  Walk up, order and find your seat.  Food was out in maybe 12 minutes.  Family run, served by the son and cooked by dad.  Can't do better than that.  Good food and good owners.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket.   Observe the smoke ring, done right!

UYZhRY3U04AhuSk346Gwlg.text: Best BBQ I've eaten in YEARS! We are foodies and are often disappointed when we go out to eat.  THIS PLACE WILL NOT DISAPPOINT!!! It will exceed your expectations BY FAR! We tried 5 of the sides and 5 if the meats.  All I can say is ALL of them were top notch amazing!!!! You get your money's worth and walk away satisfied.  FANTASTIC PLACE.  Food, staff & atmosphere are wonderful!

aRF3Fy5sQD73Bo9UvHaMEg.text: The good: very good smokey taste, lots of meat, place was nice looking.  The OK: barbecue sauce wasn't the best, a little too spicy. The better: they fixed the ordering and the drinks are. Much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The duo
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This little piggy went...

mCEQu1w7n6JY2cnRJacj8w.text: True, authentic barbecue in Vegas! Food takes some time, but it's expected for the quality that they serve. Don't let the exterior (or interior) fool you, these guys know what they're doing and how to do it well! I ordered the Outlaw Burger as it is touted as a "Best in Vegas" burger. It didn't disappoint, by any means!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw Burger to go, no cheddar, no Chipotle aoili. Damn good!!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of 7/25/2015
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

imsfaJmO55laAOd4rk1jTw.text: Hands down amazing BBQ!!!! The brisket is absolutely perfect, the meat falls right off of the rib bones, and all of the sides are on point. We really appreciated the banana pudding one of the guys brought out for our little one!!! We are looking forward for their second location over by the pawn stars shop in September!!!

OdlZvWJuf51WevUQ_-jplw.text: This is the BBQ to go for. Take an Uber/Lyft if you don't have a car. Worth the drive. We had the sliders and burnt ends. Brisket is amazing, burnt ends so good. A little peppery. Highland Ave location has benches inside and a couple out front. Building is nothing special but food is oh so worth it. People inside are very friendly and service is fast. Don't miss this.

qbGDegfwydv94pUWXlWm_Q.text: Best BBQ in Vegas hands down. I had no idea what I was missing! Plus they offer a locals discount !!!!! I'm smitten

8vJmt8o44xefcFG5v7nFCw.text: This place is AMAZING and you're definitely missing out if you don't stop by here.   Went to Vegas for vacation and thanks to fellow Yelpers, we decided to go even though it was off the strip. They deliver to the Mirage but only for employees, not guests. If you take the taxi, make sure you have the taxi's company number or your hotel's front desk so they can call a taxi for you on the way back. Or you can try to walk to Trump hotel and get a taxi.   It is a MUST you try their meatloaf and brisket. We eat a lot of BBQ joints and this place is hands down have the BEST brisket and cornbread. Trust me.   The place is tiny, you order at the counter first then grab a seat.   You'll know you're in good hands when you see a bunch of locals.

ViglWtBXkp48FlIh53FSGg.text: First time in from Los Angeles with my family got the $50 meal it was delicious for a family of 4 and still have leftovers + we made a lil room  for a slice of peach cobbler it was delicious as well Best BBQ in Las Vegas plus people where very friendly and nice will definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From Los Angeles first time in this Bbq place delicious + peach cobble great will recommend to my friends and family will come back
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3ABy7AtePN9pCSpi99-fCA.text: OMG - this place blows away the Phillips and other ethnic BBQ joints!    Perfect bite, smoke, and 100% guaranteed to fill you up!  Beef rib was awesome. Pork baby back ribs perfect. Chicken was juicy and yummy! BBQ sauce was just perfectly executed! Gotta try all their sides - worth every penny.  Owner was very nice and bought us some extras when we mentioned we found them thru Yelp!  Must go to - get away from the casino buffets!

Znlio-MiC_GanUtsikhGdQ.text: The food here is phenomenal. Rarely do you see a barbecue restaurant that has great ribs with great sides. You definitely have the support of this Henderson native family

lElMVVe-pX28AUEhG7xJ2w.text: The best BBQ I've had in a long time. My husband and I shared The Brisket Three ways, and it was moist and delish! Just wish we had room to try and eat more.

kKYAwY6UUdSFttdGMKI70w.text: The food was good although I will never eat here again because the girl at the counter was very rude! Horrible customer service!!!!

WLIPVW0jIx275hFsEmqeWA.text: Wow some of the finest BBQ we have in Vegas, everything made with complete love and passion! You pay for what you get 100% I'll be back again and again! Amazing job Rolling Smoke team

GVBHIRQqYCMVXiBXaxUVAg.text: I've been here a couple of times and the food is usually on point.   Hot links are juicy with the right amount of heat (I like spicy food)  Brisket is pretty good although the their burnt ends are actually burnt ends.  Burgers are pretty good value and most of their sides have good flavor (try the corn nuggets or loaded potatoes)  The real problem is that their service is pretty bad. I've spent over 20 minutes waiting while my friends got their food in 5 minutes. I asked them to check on the food and they said "I'm sure it's coming" and shoved my check back in my face.   Their new reusable cups are a plus for repeat visitors, $1.00 off for refills. There is also a locals discount as well as coupons on their website.  Good for food. Bad for service. Come hungry. Leave spending a little more than you wanted to.

k-CDCgkGHo-ZH_jfikSzcw.text: BEST BBQ I ever had!! Went to school in South Carolina and had lots of great BBQ and this place tops it all! We ordered the Rib Platter and spicy link sausage.  Would definitely go back! Friendly service too!!

grtpXp5j2HFmDWgQ6p-1BA.text: First time at Rollin Smoke. Absolutely the bomb. The rib tips were smoked perfectly. They didn't need any sauce, but the Carolina sauce just complemented the rib nicely. The brisket dog was a meal in itself. The three meat combo was more than we could eat.

7L_xEb0MdhKgEBNJFOq8Ww.text: Solid bbq place. Their Smoked Meatloaf was apparently featured on Travel Channel's Food Paradise (BBQ Paradise) back in 2014. Made with smoked pulled pork and smoked brisket, served with loaded mashed potatoes, sweet bbq sauce, and fried onion strings, it's a totally crave-able meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pit Special: 5 meats, 3 sides. Swapped out the 1/4 chicken for more brisket :)
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Meatloaf

dbAJPl-wIrC10eIlZHM_yA.text: I've been here about three times and tried almost everything on the menu. Briskest my favorite. I'm not crazy about ANY of the sides. The BBQ must be authentic because the flavor of the fixings are just edging on soul-food and I'm not a fan. It's also rather pricey for what you get. If this is the best BBQ in Vegas then I guess it's time to head to Kansas City or Austin.

FGNBeSZeHxho6fPdBKHylw.text: Came here because of the ratings and the fact it was rated #1 for BBQ. I'm not a big BBQ fan so this wasn't a stop for me. I got the corn nuggets, which were tasty and golden brown.   Also got the two meat platter of brisket and ribs with a side of Mac.   The Mac was very very good and cheesy. It tasted different than any other Mac I've had. It's not too thick or thin and the flavors melt together nicely with the tastebuds.   The sliced brisket was cooked low and slow and tasted tender and had good flavor. The brisket was a bit on the fatty side, more than usual.   The short ribs were smoked very well and weren't too fatty.   The downfall is the $3 drink. That's very high especially for the size cup.   Worth a stop  and seems like the place to be with the line nearly out the door.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn nuggets.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and brisket with short ribs.

lKKHl1OBwQsPRC3srJx7Xg.text: Rollin Smoke Barbeque never disappointed me! It's definitely one of my favorite bbq place. Me and my family comes here every time we have a craving for bbq. It's comfort food!  This is not a big, fancy Vegas style restaurant. It's actually kind of hidden in the intersection of DI and Highland. You can definitely find it by the piggy, bbq painting on their walls and doors.  Their menu is huge, a variety of bbq meats (pork, beef or chicken) fish, shrimp and the sides.  My usual favorite is the Pulled Piggy Sandwich ($9.99) plus $4 for one side and a drink. The meat is so flavorful, delicious and tender.  I order this a lot! We also very often have the The Pit Special 5 meats and 3 sides for $27.99. It consists Brisket, Pulled Pork, 1/4 Chicken, 2 Spear Ribs, Hot Links. No substitution! This meal is so big! It's good for sharing, or if you are starving, maybe you can finish it! LOL I can't for sure! By the way, any or all substitution subject to an upcharge!  We never had, but they are offering All You Can Eat for $34.99. Anything on the menu. Any day, any time! No sharing and no Togo's!   They also have Salads, Wraps and Spuds.  Also Kids Menu is $9.99, includes one side and a drink. Lil' Bitty Piggy's Menu for ages 10 and under.  Did you know that all smoked meats and sauces are gluten free? Yes! And they are delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled Piggy Sandwich Combo
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled Piggy Sandwich
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side with my sandwich

U6irj0qEk8vsEiEZ1A89hg.text: I visit Las Vegas a couple times a year and we always make it a point to stop in here- it's a nice break from the strip.   This place is AMAZING! I promise you will not have a bad meal. The baby back ribs and brisket sandwich are a must. Also, don't sleep on the corn bread, it comes out warm with melted butter.

EJhwMFgVol_qCh4YM7KsOQ.text: Awesome place...we came across it by accident. But wow what a pleasant surprise....you want be disappointed. It's a fast food place but one of the best BBQ place you will find in Las Vegas.

yx97yD2aRnyoaztjbm3mag.text: Wonderful value, and my favorite meal in Vegas under $30. The Pit Special is a good deal - $27.99 includes tons of meat and 3 sides. All sides were excellent (sweet cornbread; kick'n bbq beans with meat; and collard greens cooked in brisket juices). Sauces were okay - nothing transcendent, but good variety of bbq toppings to try, including a North Carolina vinegar. Meats were so good (except for the unfortunate desiccated low-quality steroid-laden chicken) that you could eat eat them without sauce - they even tasted great cold, the next day. All of them were excellent - pulled pork, pork ribs (delightful, and next time I'll pay the $6 to try their beef), brisket, and hot links. So, so good.

SyTNRIy5osKCGPYLprs1pA.text: This review is for 4.5 stars.   I was lucky to get invited to a neighbor's catered event today. I saw the catering truck in front, and they kept hauling out more and more food (it looked like a pretty big event). It smelled so amazing outside.   The setup was nice, several long tables, all covered with a red/white tablecloth (which gave a family picnic feel). The catering event was organized very well- everything needed were set up on those tables. Plates and cutlery packets were on the left side. Napkin holders were in several spots.    The two employees were very nice. They served the food on my plate. They seemed to enjoy their job, as they were smiling, the conversation was good, and kindly asking what I wanted. The food: Coleslaw, Mac & Cheese, Ribs (they were huge!), Brisket, Chicken (choice of white or dark), and Cornbread. The fixings (sliced pickles, green onions) were in the middle of the food and the sauces (on the far right) (-there were about five or six of the sauces), butter, extra seasoning, and wet naps, alongside the sweet tea and ice (and logo water bottles- save the label, has a 10% off coupon on it).    I really liked the flavor of the brisket, which was lean, but not dry (no gross fatty pieces) and the chicken thigh (very tender) as well as the coleslaw and mac & cheese (creamy). I didn't get the cornbread until I made some room on my plate as I was headed out (I was expecting a visitor) so I thanked the host again before leaving (I didn't completely eat & run).   I'm so glad that I got to try it, and it makes me curious to visit the one near my place (and it's funny, because we were just talking about trying it, too). I was able to get a menu and sticker to go, too.

jwXuYEOjCQh0wXahECTRDg.text: Everything about our experience today was top notch. The restaurant was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the service was super fast.   But, of course, let's talk about the food. We ordered the Pit Special because the staff said it would be enough for two. There was way more than enough for two to share! We could feed another person or two with this meal. The Pit Special came with 5 different meats and 3 sides. Meats included ribs, hot links, sliced brisket, chicken, and pulled pork. For our sides we chose the green beans, loaded mashed potatoes, and corn nuggets. The meats were all so flavorful, tender, and juicy. The ribs just fell right off the bone as soon as we sunk our teeth into it. You could see that pink smoke ring on the brisket, and even on the chicken, so you know they smoked it just right. The sides were all done well and paired well with each of the meats. The green beans, which were actually haricot verts, were tender but still crisp. The mashed had big pieces of crispy bacon mixed in. The corn nuggets were my favorite, though. They're small nuggets of sweet, creamed corn coated in a batter, or maybe cornmeal, and deep fried to a golden brown. A must try!  To top off a great dinner, the owner/manager came in and asked every table how their dinner was. Amazing customer service! I'm really impressed with this place and can't wait to go back for more.

GCfuR2OoQQk5qkZXyCvl0A.text: Saw this place on the Travel Channel and was excited to remember that they're located here in Vegas. I had to come and try this place out before we return home to Hawaii. My youngest son ordered the cheeseburger with waffle fries, my oldest ordered the 1/2 rack St. Louis spare ribs with fried creamed corn balls. I ordered the Brisket 3-way (shredded, sliced, and burnt ends) with mac-n-cheese. I substituted the shredded brisket for more burnt ends for an additional $3. The spare ribs was very flavorful, but wasn't fall-off-the-bone tender. My burnt ends was amaaazing. The brisket slices had some flavor, but tasted bland towards the middle, but the various sauces they had made everything taste waaay better. Not sure how much Southern food goes nowadays, but to me it's a bit pricey. Once in a while, it's totally worth it. Now, I can cross this place off my bucket list.  The parking lot is a decent size and they have a lot of tables and chairs to eat at. You order at the counter and they deliver the food to your table. All the staff were friendly and helpful.

r6nArod0OKX0N9IeYmkhEg.text: Great Arkansas BBQ.   Beef Ribs- Fantastic/ Tender / Great Flavor / Delicious rub... falls right off the bone when you maneuver your fork to tear the meat.  The Outlaw Burger- AMAZING Flavor in that patty! Even the fried onions stacked on top of the burger  were delicious, you can tell they put their heart and soul into the recipe of that batter they fry the onions in. I also enjoyed the sliced pickles that came with the burger and the pepper on top!   Brisket Salad- Delicious. Meat was great, Chipotle sauce was outstanding, tomatoes were fresh.  Collard Greens- The best I have ever had, packed with great flavor. You could drink the liquid as a soup it's so good.  Mac N' Cheese- Not bad needs a little bit of work.  BBQ sauces- weakest thing there shockingly.   Ambiance- Very cute I loved it.  I even loved the drink cups they give, they are re-usable and make for a good souvenir from your experience! I also really like their logo!   I give this establishment 4.5 stars out of 5. And I rarely give anything 4.5 or 5 stars!

RhNiUNSFi7dWTstkqtsnsA.text: Best barbecue in an odd location. We drove past the restaurant and had to to turn around because we missed it.  We had a variety of meats and sides and everything was delicious. The pulled pork sandwich is a hefty sandwich that fills you up. The burnt end sandwich was flavorful. The rotisserie chicken, brisket, & ribs are all delicious. We had the macaroni & cheese, chipotle cole slaw, potato salad & corn bread. The macaroni and cheese was flavorful and had a nice peppery heat. The cole slaw was one of the best we've ever had anywhere.  The service was fast and the employees were all very friendly.

a8dhH54I_L8ch9c9gmbI0Q.text: Rollin Smoke never disappoints, excellent phone, large portions, and excellent pricing.   I will return when back in Las Vegas.

mjEC_MTQqKM9YZxfQ7Ro5g.text: Each time I visit Vegas, I always strive to check out new places to eat. This time I chose this BBQ joint for my pre-birthday dinner. 5 adults and two babies. We went on a Monday maybe an hour and a half or so before closing.   The place definitely looks a bit dumpy from the outside but as soon as you pull into the parking lot, you can smell that sweet smell of meat.   I was going to order the package deal for either $50 or $80 bucks but decided to do a la carte instead since none of us wanted to have hot links. Boy, the damage was quite a chunk of change but the food was delicious.  There is seating on the outside, inside where you order and pay, and there is an additional room to your right hand side when you exit the main entrance. I don't know if we were just lucky or what but we seriously got the entire back room to ourselves. It was awesome. Picnic style benches definitely made it an authentic country style bbq feel. There is a drink station in the cashier's area and the back room where we were at. They have the sauces, to go containers and bags all out for your to bag your left overs.  brisket: delicious, tender and seasoned just right. There was pepper speckles on the edges which gave it a nice taste. There was a thin strip of fat but when it is hot, it melts in your mouth. I tried one after it had cooled and it definitely did not taste as good.  beef ribs: super pricey. I had asked how many ribs a half rack came with and the lady said two. I thought I heard wrong but I ordered a whole rack anyways. When I got it, it was seriously just 4 ribs but they were huge. Melt in your mouth heaven for sure and definitely worth it.  pulled pork: this was probably the only item I did not care for. It was not that well flavored and even with the sauce, it was bleh. Next time I will not order this.  burnt tips: everyone was raving about these burnt tips on yelp so I had to get some. It was good. Nice and saucy but not a crazed fan.  corn nuggets: yummy. nicely fried and sweet.  waffle fries: like your normal waffle fries with a hint of dusted sugar. yumm  bacon potato salad: this was also an item I saw a lot of people raved about but honestly, I thought it was just alright. Didn't taste amazingly good and did not taste bad. I would prefer regular potato salad.  The food came out fast and we definitely had leftovers for two more days so it made it worth while. The establishment is kept clean and friendly service staff.  Next time, I would definitely skip the pulled pork, burnt tips and bacon potato salad. Good to try it at least once but I will definitely be going for the main food items like brisket and beef ribs :)  I would definitely recommend this to any meat eater/bbq fan. As my husband said, this is a Vegetarian/Veagan person's version of hell. Meat, meat and more meat!

k-cnTxeIz0w8KYhX_PVPuA.text: By far the best BBQ I have had anywhere.  I opted for the catfish with loaded mash.  The fish was flaky inside, moist, and the cornmeal breading was crispy and seasoned well.  The hush puppies were excellent and full of onion.  The loaded mash was the best potato side I've ever eaten.  It was so good I refused to share with my companion!  It's a taste I'm trying to replicate at home but have been unsuccessful in doing so!  The drinks here are self-serve and might seem pricey, but you keep the cup and bring it back for a discount.

WROYaUu9c77Y00iDzUeySw.text: LIVED UP TO THE HYPE! Saw this business on a food channel about 3 years ago. Have wanted to eat there ever since...and FINALLY got to last weekend! Had a hard time finding it at first. For one, I couldn't remember the name. And two,  there is now a second location, located next to that popular pawn shop that has its own show. I was told that the owner of that store liked Rollin' Smoke so, much that he went in with them on a second location. So most searches yield the new location first. Of course, not knowing the name isn't helpful...  Anyhooooozen! We stopped for a drink on the way to dinner, and I just happened to ask the bartender if her heard of this BBQ place that was owned by a family from Arkansas and they made smoked meatloaf. He knew exactly what I was talking about, and gave me directions to the OG location. It was HEAVEN. the food. The location is cool, don't get me wrong. but the FOOD. Definitely satisfied the carnivore foodie in me!!

VLDrv8tmxMLhn-9sbr-oOQ.text: Had a lousy lunch today.  We've been here before and it was really great.  I tried the Outlaw Burger and it was no bueno.  It's ridiculously tall and has to be dismantled to attempt consuming.  It's a ton of fried onions over a giant softball size chunk of well done ground beef.  No, no, and no.  I love burgers but this is purely a novelty menu item to awe the masses.  I just gave up and left it.  The BBQ was great last time but not so much today.  Brisket came cold and not a lot of flavor.  Didn't like the way they pulverized it.  Sliced is better like Franklin BBQ.  Maybe that's the way they do it in Arkansas.  Ribs and hot links were okay, sides of potato salad, collards, and cole slaw good.  They have great homemade sauces.  Maybe the screaming kids that were as loud as a police siren the entire time may have influenced our experience today.  Oh, did mention their mom broke out loudly in song at one point?  Very odd.    That burger was still pretty stupid.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Outlaw&#34; Burger fail.  What a waste and mess.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot links, spare ribs, chopped brisket, collards, potato salad, cole slaw.  It was okay.  Wasn&#39;t feeling the love today.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw Burger.  Novelty.  Not a practical thing to attempt to eat.  Not that good either.  Sorry Rolling Smoke BBQ.

eZeargUIpAiC3SnfvRq5zA.text: This review is only for the sides they offer and not for their meat.   I was greeted by Sophia who was super friendly and helpful. She asked if this was my first time here, which it was. She made some recommendations but I had told her that I was mainly there to try their mac n cheese. I'm not much of a meat eater but I love a good mac n cheese. I asked her what the corn nuggets were and she let me and my bf sample some before ordering! How awesome is that? They were yummy! Even my bf who was planning on getting pho after I got my mac n cheese fix, said he wanted to get some.   I ordered a mac n cheese and some corn nuggets. Both were delicious. The mac n cheese was really creamy and filling. The corn nuggets were crispy and sweet and complimented the mac n cheese really well.   While we were eating, I noticed that the restaurant was filling up with customers pretty quickly--all waiting in line to order. It definitely showed how popular this place is among the locals. Maybe when I'm in the meat eating mood, I'll come back to try their ribs!

CQ2EZ5RUOakFZ8IfH-JdGw.text: My brother had to try this place after seeing it on the travel channel and I'm glad we did. This place is great!  The man at the register greeted us with a friendly smile and showed extreme patience as we decided on what we wanted to ordered. While waiting on our food, this same man came to our table to check on us and told us how he started this business. His humbleness definitely proved how grateful he was that God had blessed him. Everything we ordered was delicious. The hot link, brisket and chicken sliders were excellent. My family said the macaroni melted in their mouths and my brother plate was completely empty after taking his last bite of the shrimp po boy. Please make your way to Rolling Smoke. You won't be disappointed.

OW5x6DPk_nOhodJhElL0zA.text: My husband ordered a brisket sandwich and I ordered "st.Louis spareribs" (quotes heavily exaggerated). The brisket was really good: a little fatty but that was fine. The ribs were a disappointment and were not really a St. Louis cut. They were full spareribs. I thought they'd gotten my order wrong but when I went to ask he just said all they have are spareribs.
