c92rHh8LcNFD8DJ7BSfpEw.text: Got the BBQ platter Pretty pricey but overall good  Mac and cheese was good Cornbread good Waffle fries  good   Chicken just OK  Pulled pork just OK  Ribs pretty good because I don't like ribs  Hot link very good And the highlight To me, was the brisket... thought it was excellent   If I could do it over I'd get a 2 meat combo with hot link, brisket and some sides

5nh3arypZcude_OAKUg9ow.text: I had heard that Rollin' Smoke was the best BBQ in Vegas, I hope that's not the case because it was only pretty good.  I've had some amazing BBQ before and I can't give this the 5-stars that you would imagine "Best BBQ in Vegas" would get.  Didn't even reach 4-stars for me.  Was also a bit inconvenient to have to hunt down the sauce that I wanted for my pulled pork.  All-in-all, I'd say Rollin' Smoke is good BBQ, but nothing to rave about.

Rn6U8XVO84Le6nW5N0DHhA.text: My brother brought my mother and me here a while ago after reading the splendid reviews about it. We arrived sometime at night when it was pitch dark, and the place looked like it was straight out of a horror movie: It was dead quiet, and there were no lights around; the only thing to illuminate the dark night was the ominous flicker of the defective red "Open" sign. My mother and I were ready to bolt and drive straight back home to enjoy a dinner in safety, but my brother urged us on, so we reluctantly pushed open the door to Rollin Smoke Barbeque, and boy, did the atmosphere change!  Behind the dingy exterior waits a warm, casual, and welcoming locale that can only be described as a home away from home. The types of customers who eat here range anywhere from families with small children to single men with their buddies. The walls are painted with cheerful people, flowers, and green, and there are TVs for people to enjoy a little bit of entertainment while eating.   Our orders came out quickly and were delectable. The meat was tender, soft, and buttery smooth at the same time, and the flavor was just perfect. At the end of our dinner, the owner even came out to talk to us, asking us if it was our first time, explaining to us how he prepares the meat, and giving us some insight on the Arkansas way of barbeque-ing.  This must have been one of my most memorable restaurant visits, and I love how it ended. Definitely do not be scared off by the awkward storefront. This place is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-a9tbugEaB41ymD1NRRFhg.text: Came in during lunch time, definitely busy but the wait was so worth it. Everything we got was hot, tasted fresh and was just plain amazing. Definitely worth the hype. I got the chicken sandwich, my boyfriend got the beef brisket sandwich and my mom got ribs and we all split a GIANT baked potato that was loaded with everything you didn't know you needed on a baked potato. Not someplace to come to if you're in a hurry during lunch hour, but if you have the time definitely worth the wait.

0MvDwFJ-edah51X-vy-ZUQ.text: If you're looking for some good Barbecue in LV, try Rollin Smoke.  It has a hole-in-the-wall feel to it which was unique, being a stones throw away from some of the nicer restaurants in the US. We went on a Friday night around 6:30 PM. Not only did the food come out really fast, but the staff was as friendly as they come.   After a long internal debate, I ordered the Duo plate with Ribs and Brisket. The ribs were seasoned perfectly and fall right off the bone. There is also a healthy selection of barbecue sauces (the "Sweet Country Girl" mustard sauce was spot on).   The meal was so great that, before we had even finished, my friends and I were discussing when our next stop in would be.

fAaSkRmugx1Zkmxb6jhB9A.text: We had to he baby back ribs, very meaty and soft, not fall off the bone soft, but good. Some were burnt, hard and chewy, but most were good. The beans were a bit on the hard side ( bit under cooked? ) but still not too bad. The mashed potatoes were on the dry side. The slaw and corn bread were tasty. I have had Bbq ribs many places around the country so I may be a bit picker than others when it comes to bbq ribs. I bit of a hole in the wall place, which I like, small and clean, workers have a good attitude. Give this place a 3.5 rating overall.

OEPpte96bVSSPEPJlAdpxw.text: Sooo good!! Big portions too! Friendly staff and speedy service. Would highly recommend!  Only thing is it's a bit hidden and not very populated around, easy to miss.

36ktAYfqRcwRlqZrCOKhHg.text: First time eating here......AMAZING!! Thank you Karina,look forward to dealing with you when I caterer my daughters graduation!

Gd0Snhu_oEhsAK9ZM98I2A.text: Great Arkansas style BBQ.  Woo Pig Sooie!!!  Loved seeing college football on the TV and great food.

mhqxw7IY8AQpvZp6X57oXg.text: Since this restaurant was featured on The Travel Channel as one of the best BBQ restaurants in the US, we decided to give it a try.  It was very quaint and felt like a 1940's family BBQ place.  Our order was taken by a charming young man of maybe 10-12 years old.  I ordered the BBQ meatloaf because that was the dish highlighted on The Travel Channel.  It was a very large portion and OK but I wouldn't order it again.  My wife ordered "burnt tips" the ends of BBQ brisket) which the owner said was very popular.  It was also OK but nothing to rave about.  My son (a sous chef at The Cosmopolitan in Las Vegas) ordered ribs which he liked.    A lady at the next table ordered a hamburger which came with an 8 inch stack of fried onions wedged into the bun by a long stick.  It was clever and looked pretty good and I overheard her say she really liked it.      The bill was over $75 which I felt was very high for what we ordered and for a counter-service BBQ restaurant.    We lived in the BBQ belt in NC for 30 years so we are very picky when it comes to BBQ.  Unfortunately, this place doesn't measure up.  I doubt we will be back.

AZC77el9dYb0Tu0JJ0LPkA.text: Very popular, casual, and delicious BBQ! Prices are very affordable given the city and location, with high quality meat cooked deliciously. I advise you to visit this place! 5 stars :)

A9xfowHfW0IGhrmUtWva7w.text: For the past month I've been visiting different BBQ's in the city and I can honestly say Rollin Smoke has a fierce reputation for being one of the best BBQ's in Las Vegas!!!  I ordered the trio plate which consisted of the brisket, pork and hot links.  Sides: Baked Beans and Mac&Cheese. The pulled pork is smoked perfectly, and goes great with the BBQ sauce.  The hot links were quite peppery and succulent. I felt that the brisket was slightly over cooked, but it was okay when i mixed it with sides.  The portion size was quite filling, and I only paid $20 so it was worth the price tag!!! The staff was friendly, courteous and overall the place has a great vibe.  I can't to wait to try other stuff on the menu like the smoked meatloaf looks incredible!

svMGCiKxsLe3MiafcVtZsQ.text: Great food! Great service! Lizelle helped us. She was super nice, patient, answered all my many questions about allergens, and even allowed my son to sample the beans before ordering them!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DELICIOUS BEEF RIBS! Greens made with brisket- so yummy. Sweet and moist corn bread!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. He loved the chicken wings and beans!

CCFnsM_T0dJrrmsMguaUgg.text: Love this place. The pulled pork, beef ribs, catfish, and yams are the best. They recently updated their establishment to accommodate more customers. The food is delivered to your table typically within 5-10 minutes always fresh. Drinks are self serve and they offer free refills.   If your interested in getting your food catered then this is the place. They always come through for office parties and get togethers. It's definitely one of the best BBQ places on the west coast.

z79V8JRx20KOz2hiVpStMg.text: This is a for sure stop for us any time we are in Vegas. What my husband enjoys most about this place is the all you can eat bbq for a reasonable price. The main thing that he always brags about when we tell others about this location is the BEEF RIBS they are ridiculously HUGE!!! NO EXAGGERATION!!! The Mac and cheese is delicious and the pulled pork never disappoints. The wait is never long when we get there and the place is always full of people which lets you know the food is damn good!!!

6aVIHRYwIVH7hlzszrGEnA.text: Good barbecue is hard to find in Las Vegas. I moved here from the midwest where I could easily get to St. Louis, Memphis, and Kansas City. So... I'm a pretty harsh judge of barbecue, I have high standards. This place has actual good meats, well seasoned. It's not just sugary pulled pork like a lot of the places here. It's not perfect if you expect midwestern barbecue, but it may be the closest you'll find when you get that particular itch.

e9me-ZX41qqrWCgzpg_1_w.text: Haven't had much BBQ in town but this is my go to spot with the trio platter of meats and sides.  Noticed a price increase on their menu recently which bothers me but I don't mind paying for their excellent food.  Always have leftovers so better make sure you're hungry.  Sides I recommend include the cornbread, greens, mashed potatoes and onion strings.  Made the mistake of going on a Sunday when they weren't open so check them out Monday through Saturday!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio of meats platter: brisket, spare ribs and hot links.  Side of loaded mashed potatoes

FS-KPDWVw83TyVqImhBM5w.text: The staff were super nice & friendly. Although the food, it was VERY MEDIOCRE and overpriced.   I was craving bbq and went yelp for some good rating. I don't know if they got good ratings cause of the service, cause they're really nice! But the food  ... I wouldn't come back again cause its nothing special  I mean I get it, they wanna sell stuff but while I was at the counter, the guy kept up selling & upselling. Idk.  Not a big fan. It's super hidden, expensive, & they dont inform you about the prices. me and my boyfriend ended up spending $50 and thats us not even saying yes to all the things the guy was offering.

ynGOxvc9UMVXIm2a3lVXFw.text: Here's the rundown regarding Rollin Smoke BBQ; 1. Huge, I mean gigantic portions. See pictures for yourself 2. No one can compete with their prices when it comes to BBQ. 3. Hole in the wall type restaurant, my favorite type 4. Great service 5. Conveniently located near my favorite type of clubs. Joking...I think. When I first met Heather H, the first thing that came out of her mouth wasn't "Hi, nice to meet you". It was "have you been to Rollin Smoke?, You have to go there ASAP". Actually, she did say "hi", but Rollin Smoke stuck in my head. If you don't know Heather H, she's a well respected Yelper in the Las Vegas community. And if Heather and her boyfriend love the food here, then it must be pretty damn good. Read the reviews, rarely any complaints from anyone about Rollin Smoke. When I found out that we were having dinner at Rollin Smoke one Friday evening, guess who I reached out to? Heather H of course. I thought it was funny that while she responded to my questions, she was also on her way to Rollin Smoke for lunch. She's a die hard for sure. As for her suggestions, she suggested something she never had and the rest of the menu. I guess this means a Win Win situation for me. My Meal: Chicken and Ribs Combo: Read this closely. Don't look at prices because it's deceiving. The portions are huge!!! Portions are so big, that I only was able to finish half my chicken and one rib. I loved the chicken BBQ. It's cooked perfectly, chicken still tender (not dry), and the flavors poured out of it with every bite. As for the ribs, I only had one and thought it was just okay. I hate to admit that I've had better ribs elsewhere. But for the price, it was a great deal. Their mac and cheese is a must eat as well as their corn bread on steroids. I finished the mac n cheese, but could only muster half my corn bread. Both had a little kick to it. Yes, even the corn bread had a kick to it. Service was pretty good too. You need to order at the counter and the food is served to you. Like most BBQ places, the food does take a little time to cook so be patient and enjoy your company. I ate a lot, Terri R ate a lot, and Chad S ate a lot. I guess that equals to all of us eating a lot. $40 for 3 people to eat on a Friday night is not bad at all. It's such a bargain here that you'll even be left with a few bills to hit the nearby clubs and make it rain. Chicken and Ribs Combo (Rib Portion): yelp.com/biz_photos/roll... Chicken and Ribs Combo (Chicken Portion w/their Mac N Cheese): yelp.com/biz_photos/roll... Corn Bread: yelp.com/biz_photos/roll...

pkJc0J5OiYfIZ94cBioXJA.text: Tried this place for the first time and I loved the ribs and corn nuggets the baked beans were a little hot but still very flavorful I will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn nuggets and waffle fries

tVaiiYUAZSPf3QVuiJQ0tA.text: Epic spot for meat! The employees and small space makes for a great BBQ joint to eat at. Consistently coming back and enjoying all the choices they offer. It comes highly recommended

aMDLBCbYTfT2-xWdodCz6w.text: Must try for vegas. And best BBQ in Las Vegas. We were gonna go grab something typical like in n out but then found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try. It was UH-MAYZING! We ordered the pit special and it fed two grown men and a lady with plenty of food to take home for leftovers. The chicken was our favorite with the brisket right behind but everything was delicious. For our sides we ordered mac n cheese, BBQ beans, and corn nuggets. All super good!!! Corn nuggets were the best. Can't wait to try different varieties on our next visit!  Staff was incredibly polite and friendly!

ToXxrrtzH6lDY0nb3kA2tQ.text: All you need to know:  Peach cobbler is so good, it'll make u slap ur momma!  Brisket is moist, juicy and melts in your mouth.  Fried Okra is the best in town hands down.  Catfish is properly seasoned, crispy on the outside and juicy and flaky on the inside.  So we walked in on a Saturday night at around 11 or so and we were the only ones in there. So I will admit, I wasn't sure if the reviews were going to be right. I mean if this place was going to be as good as everyone said, then why isn't this place packed?  But we sat down and the guy was friendly and down home. I love a southern gentleman, they win me over every time. He told me that they were out of the beef ribs but if I wanted to wait 45 minutes that they would be ready. So I didn't want to wait 45 minutes and went with a meat platter. I got the brisket and st Louis ribs and hot links. Already told you about the brisket, the ribs I enjoyed too. They were tender and smokey and very flavorful. If I am being honest, then I would probably pass on the hot link. I think they were just bbq'ed too long for me.   So we got dessert with our yelp check in and I wasn't too sure that they would taste so good based on their appearance. We ordered banana pudding and peach cobbler. I would alone come for the peach cobbler but again, if I am being honest I would pass on the banana pudding.  I love BBQ. It is just always so hard to find a good decent eats for BBQ in this town. But the quest for me has ended here. I rave about this place to everyone.   The BBQ sauce here is amazing too. Sweet and Spicy. I tried to see if they bottled it and sold it but they don't. So instead they gave me a to go container for free.  I can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ribs plate
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Catfish po&#39;boy. Amazing!

6TRzFumg5-hQaV_9I2TKVg.text: Seriously this bbq is so good you will want to smack someone! I'm not a pit master but I know some Q and Rollin smoke is amazing.  Food wasn't oversmoked, meat was tender, and customer service was just phenomenal. I went with a large group so I got to try everything.  The highlights are the brisket and chicken, and I wasn't a big fan of their dessert.    This is a bbq you should check out when you are in town! Thanks!!!!!

UFJNdX9emmbUEmD_dDnxGw.text: My boyfriend wanted barbeque but then again he always wants barbeque, and at first we were planning on going to a barbeque chain restaurant in Henderson but then I remembered reading reviews about a really good BBQ place near the strip clubs. I looked on Yelp and voila, there it was, Rollin Smoke Barbeque.   We came last night around 9 PM and it wasn't busy but there were people there enjoying their dinners. You order and pay at the counter/booth and they bring the food out to you. I got the beef brisket sandwich with a side of okra and my boyfriend got the trio with ribs, brisket, and pork with a side of mac and cheese. My sandwich was delicious! I ate it with a fork because it was so stuffed with meat that I knew it would spill out of the bun once I had it in my hands. The okra was good too. My boyfriend couldn't stop raving about his trio of meat! He loved every bit of it.   It's a small, simple restaurant located down the street from Spearmint Rhino. The person who took our order was sooo friendly! My boyfriend was having a hard time deciding on what he wanted and the guy offered several suggestions, even stating which ones were his mother or grandmother's recipes. He even told us how he and his brother got started in the barbeque business.   I wonder if they've ever been featured on one of those travel or food network shows? Because if not then they really should be!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio with ribs, brisket, pork.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef brisket sandwich with side of fried okra.

PaJzfP6_gAoc1qBlkBqj9w.text: ALAS!!!  I finally found a delicious go to BBQ spot in Vegas!!  Rollin Smoke Barbecue did not disappoint as we had the smoked pulled chicken with added onion strings, seasoned waffle fries (best ones I've ever had), smoked brisket, and the green beans.  You know how you visit a restaurant and sometimes you don't expect for everything you try to taste good?  Well, this was not the case here.  Every last dish surprised us and was absolutely lip smackin' good!  Whenever friends and family come to visit, this will be one of the spots we take them to for sure.  What a hidden gem!!!

3SdsnFOwpXVSUNhthkD_tg.text: Phenomenal. These guys get barbeque, AND southern hospitality.  There's not much to say. I'm from the deep South and they made me feel right at home.   There's a little more Arkansas flavor to the bbq than a Texan is used to, but don't get it twisted. This is the best barbeque in all of Vegas.  If you're considering going, just do. You'll be glad you did. And yes. They've got sweet tea!

o6iHs-CJmNoMOSZG17CcuA.text: The briskets and ribs were so moist and perfectly smoke. The pit master did a great job.  The kickass beans were also very good. The bbq sauce they have at the table is more of a vinegar base. I am not a fan of the sauce but it  was decent. I like the sauces at Famous Dave's.  Will be back to try other meats.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H3shfbk-GahIbypdqsYtvw.text: With all the great reviews I was expecting a little more.  Rolling Smoke is good bbq for Las Vegas but don't expect it to match Texas or Missouri greats in the taste department.  Their portions are big, the restaurant is cool, and the prices are fair for usual bbq, but the meats just aren't as good as they were hyped up to be.  I had the two meat platter with pork and brisket.  The brisket was fine, but I did not like the pork at all.  It was spiced rather than an authentic bbq-esque dish.  I also had the chipotle coleslaw which was just average.  The house bbq sauce was actually quite good, though.  I'm gong to need to try other bbq places in Vegas to compare, because Rolling Smoke could still be the best in the city, just don't expect the meat to compete with the well known bbq throughout the U.S..

cS0J89Z3mDCuoT2TlJINGg.text: "HOW MUCH FOR JUST ONE RIB?"  Actually if Chris Rock only ordered one beef rib here, that would be all he needs. I made the mistake of ordering a beef rib on the side because I thought the dual meat combo of beef brisket and pulled pork was not gonna be enough because I was really hungry. The beef rib itself  does not look like it came from a cow because if it did, the cow would have been as big as an elephant!  As you can tell, the beef rib stole the show. So lets break down my other choices.  First of all, those two black smokers you see outside are legit and im not talkin about Snoop Dogg and Dr Dre. They use hickory wood to smoke all their meats and it aint no joke! Their smoke flavoring is just one of their key ingredients that makes their barbeque so good.   The dual meat combo of beef brisket and pulled pork smothered with their signature barbeque sauce will definitely get your salivary glands working overtime. The brisket has just the right amount of smoke flavoring and if the pulled pork was any more tender, Elvis himself wouldnt be any more proud singing "Love Me Tender".  As much as I would of loved to try all their barbeque being the carnivore that I am, that only warrants another trip or three to accomplish that. I would also like to mention their sides. I chose the bacon potato salad, but if you ask me, I think you cant go wrong with any of them. Just recently, they added fried okra and corn to their menu.  As for the desserts, assuming that the button on your pants has not busted off already, the peach cobbler is literally the icing on the cake not to mention the banana pudding.  Some random info: Yes they take cards. Yes they have sweet and unsweetened tea. Yes they have a decent amount of room with enough tables and chairs. Lastly but most importantly, their service is very remarkable (no surprise because they have the southern hospitality demeanor).  Oh, and one last thing. The area they are in is kind of suspect. Im not trying to scare you guys or anything, but the street they are on is dominated by strip clubs. Dont worry though, these guys are not open late so I dont see any problems, unless you are into strippers. LOL.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pit Special!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These Beef Ribs are no joke!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Catfish, Beef Ribs, Pulled Pork, Beef Brisket, Fried Okra, Bacon Potato Salad, Mac n Cheese, Loaded Mashed Potatos.

sp1HdQ24ZhiVW3C_fRcT4Q.text: Went here yesterday on a last minute journey for some good, cheap food. We definitely found it! This place was smokin'!   The place had a large amount of people, but the wait wasn't long at all. This isn't a sit down and get served type restaurant. It's more of an order at the counter and pick where you want to sit joint; a style that is very appropriate for a BBQ place in my opinion.   We had a party of three so we got to see a decent amount of the menu. My boyfriend got the talked about Outlaw Burger and it was HUGE! Only 12 bucks for the combo, which includes a drink and a side. It comes with a ton of onion strings and an optional sauce if you want to kick up the heat.   As for myself, I got the Brisket Sandwich Combo($11). For my side, I got the corn nuggets which were absolutely delicious! I tried a sample in line and it was love at first taste. As for the sandwich, it definitely was good but could have used more sauce.   Our other party member got the sausage link combo($11) with mac and cheese. He wasnt digging the sausage sandwich but I think he wasn't in a sausage mood, unfortunately. The mac and cheese on the other hand...oh baby! So creamy and delicious. They use shells instead of elbow macoroni which definitely is a strong point for the dish.   As for the staff, very friendly and made us feel at home.  Overall, everything was amazing! My faves include: - Corn nuggets - The Outlaw Burger - Mac and Cheese   Definitely going to come back to try other items. Looking forward to the Loaded Mash especially!   Thanks for the wonderful meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage Link Combo with Mac and Cheese - $11
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket Sandwich Combo with Corn Nuggets - $11
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Outlaw Burger Combo w/ choice of side and a drink- $12

6277puol2fgjiU_Jkz0RoA.text: Great food!  Definitely worthy of a visit! My only hesitation was the space and flow of this facility. It feels too crammed and awkward to sit at the tables.  Perhaps that's the charm! If you are hungry this is the place to go! Reasonable prices and good service!

t3p0SjS4viBQ4a2TmKZ2Kg.text: Don't let the outside scare you off this is probably the best BBQ place my wife or I have ever been. We got the sampler and everything was freakin' delicious. If you're in Vegas you MUST give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jD4kL9mwQStSnry0rZhhvA.text: This is da bomb for BBQ in Vegas and what's even better it's not packed full of tourists yet very close to the strip.  Don't be afraid of the office park feeling, get in and get down and bone greasy with some tasty sauce....I'd recommend the brisket. YUM  Oh and bring your appetite, portions are solid.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spudtastic

LKNO1k5uEOGAgHjZIO-OZg.text: Good food. Delicious burnt ends! Just don't come here starving because its gonna take a while to get your food. If probably call ahead next time but will go back!

h89Ps32AriEyQ7Wy4oPr5Q.text: Just ok.  I had the beef ribs and the bark was too smoky, and the meat was too chewy. My 3 year old seemed to enjoy the green beans and collards. Will try the brisket or chicken if I ever go again.

fO3RQkW7WOo7-9_0Vk8ppA.text: Tried the 3 item 2 sides with the wife. Brisket, Ribs and Pulled Pork with Mac and Cheese and the Potato Salad. I'd say the food was really good and that we'll probably come here again the next time we're in Vegas. I liked that they had a variety of sauces, some sweet, some vinegary and some spicy which gives something for everyone to try.   I will admit, that in the great world of bbq, this probably doesn't go much higher than a 6 out of 10, but in Las Vegas you're gonna find yourself hard pressed to find something better.

h9vR8KwOhZp4sN10WLCzmw.text: Extremely great BBQ. Im from the south so I definitely know great BBQ when I taste it

cr-EGR3I0GJ68klsQzCORQ.text: I love discovering new places. Don't mind the shady location - food is awesome! I tried the two meat plate with the brisket burnt ends and the hot links . I absolutely loved the brisket - I usually have never liked it. So good. The hot links were good and hot!!  Mac N Cheese was great as well as the corn fritters! So much food, I'm ashamed but I ate it all ! Mom would have loved this place!! At least my5k is tomorrow  And a shoutout to Will and Lizelle. Thanks!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing grub

Uwn0MO4HvzJAGO7CjIeFrg.text: My boyfriend and I came here after we saw this place on the Travel Channel. I was very skeptical because its Las Vegas and its barbecue and those two words do not usually go in the same sentence, boy was I wrong. The food was amazing. I had the smoked meatloaf topped with fried onion strings, on top of a bed of pillowy soft mashed potatoes. My boyfriend had a plate of protein ( I forgot the actual name, but the plate came with beef brisket, chicken, ribs and waffle fries). The brisket was okay, but the chicken was fantastic and I do not really care for ribs. I would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate of Protein
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Meatloaf

5BpVdM9ghgh5IBk15pFo8w.text: The best BBQ and service I've had and I've been to many across the U.S. Everything I've tried at Rollin Smoke has been above and beyond amazing. Ribs always fall off the bone. Their pit masters know exactly what they're doing. Experience was complete with a super friendly service. Do yourself a favor and stop here.

XYGDWeogmAOjSYZmsvTdzw.text: I like to eat. Ok, I like to eat a lot. You'll not be disappointed at Rolling Smoke. We got the rib platter for $24.99. You'll get 3 baby back, 3 St Louis style  and 1 beef rib.  Get the extra beef rib for $6 and you have plenty of meat for 2. The beef rib is huge and legitimately reminded me of the Flintstones.  Platter doesn't come with sides so get yourself some yams or Mac and cheese. With sides and drinks the total is under $50 and worth every penny. The location is a bit off the beaten path but the trek is definitely worth it and who wants to deal with strip traffic anyway.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ps0FdByoHfcf3o9LCcQNsQ.text: I don't know how this place got so many stars the service was poor girl at the register has a straight attitude pulled pork is dry like choke it down dry bun to meat ratio is wayyyy off you get about 5 oz a Meat and a huge hoagie roll with nothing but meat and a drizzle of sauce def wouldn't return perks though the sweet tea is good only reason I even gave 2 stars. Not to mention way over priced

rCpdOdKACaRp9Bo_Vfjbmw.text: The best barbecue in Las Vegas. Everything was good the spare ribs absolutely amazing and the barbecue sauce was to die for.

oY2WrdEl7sCW7x9GiIZSaw.text: WARNING! Don't come here in clothes that are dry-clean only unless you want to make an extra stop!  This place is one of Vegas's hidden gems. Located under an overpass on the backside (i.e. More seedy section) of the strip in an industrial area, only the locals know where to find it. You can smell the hickory smoke before you even park the car.  The place is small, and consists of some wooden picnic tables for dining, and a front counter with register. There is only one menu, on the wall behind the counter, so make sure to know what you want before you get to the front.   I personally suggest the brisket three ways and the chicken sliders (served on sweet Hawaiian rolls to boot). You will not be disappointed in the quality of meat, customer service, or level of smoke infused into your meal. The Arkansauce is pretty darn good too, although the meat doesn't necessarily need it. This place is awesome!  The only down side is you come out smelling like you work in a smoked meat factory, which makes for interesting conversation (including stares and people asking to smell your clothing) when you get back to the office after lunch!

rxVMkQh_SRBMFGDNvYXMLQ.text: Wow this hole in the wall rocks! Their food is great and huge and for a great price.   I took close friends there and they loved it ( being that they are over 6 feet tall and 200 plus and always hungry)

977C5hgdzmuDdKQ29RS7xg.text: Definitely love the beef ribs here. The second time I went, the beef rib wasn't as big as the first time I had them, but it was still a hearty rib. The baby backs and spare ribs are both delicious. The spicy BBQ sauce is awesome. This is my go-to spot for BBQ. I'll have to try the outlaw burger sometime, but with ribs this good how can I stop myself from ordering a big rib platter???

NtBTneHbbdkQpQky5y5Cpw.text: So GOOD! I did not want to stop eating! I had a pulled pork sandwhich, and I was not disappointed. The Arkansas bbq sauce is pretty good. I definitely wanna try everything on the menu after my first experience.

kUHQjbREIsBVs_gY0l_Qlw.text: My family and I went there on 6/15/16 and we had the full rack of ribs, pulled brisket, mac and cheese, and baked beans. Everything was good especially the mac and cheese but I did wish for some kind of green side besides coleslaw. The seating area is small with a long family style table in the middle and a wrap around bar. The staff was super friendly.

5G3t7BmERoLBFMbAjrkYiQ.text: Man on man! Just got done eating here and it was awesome! There were things that I had that I don't recommend like the chicken and pulled pork..not the best that I ever had but you gotta put alot of bbq sauce on it...but the most amazing things were the fried catfish, beef ribs, pork ribs, corn nuggets,brisket, hush puppies. mC6ev1EEIZ_PpmGBKk6Z1Q.text: My family and I just got Rollin Smoke to go. Ordered at the counter. Saw a long line but figured that was a good sign and it would move fast. Wait ended up being 15-20 mins to order but once ordered 5 minutes to get our food. Got home to find the "brisket dog" had no brisket. Which was a real bummer especially paying $8.99 for a plain dog and $3 extra for a side. My husband had the "big Hawg" (huge pulled pork sandwich) huge was right but the flavor lacked without sauce. Unfortunately we didn't pack extra sauce. Aside from the messed up dog order and flavor lacking pork, the outlaw burger was amazing! Would definitely get that again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket dog with no brisket :( lammmme

Je_7ondFAQytsue2vTlAXQ.text: I've been here before but last night was the first time I did an online order. It took a while but I didn't mind. The staff was awesome. 4 people keep me updated and asked me what I was waiting for. One person even offered me water and I know they were busy. That is amazing customer service I wish my employees were like them. And of course the food is always amazing.

b475F2yo3FVE3a_Ygynikw.text: This place was amazing...the only reason I gave it a five star is for the MEAT and meat only! The sides are just okay okay, the Cole slaw was below average and the potato salad I thought was great it had BACON (nice touch), but the hubs said that was the only reason the potato salad was decent. The sauce I could do with or without.  Okay let's get to the main reason I'm posting this review, the MEAT! The meat was amazing! The flavor is spot on. I'm originally from Oklahoma and haven't been able to find BBQ that is even is the same wheel house as Oklahoman BBQ. You guys have completely nailed the BBQ. I can't even put into words just how good the meat is! So for me I will purchase the meat on its own and do my own sides. Love love love it!!!! Thanks for helping me find a great main meal! Yum!

JytNi_kDLto2VyNi8XDZeQ.text: *Military discount*   Went on Saturday 2-20-16 at 5pm.  This restaurant is located in the dark seedy underbelly of Desert Inn & the 15, surrounded by strip clubs and industrial yards.  We actually came here one time before but it was dark and we were scared of the area so we went somewhere else.  We're fraidy cats! I'm glad we gave it a second chance.    $18.91 got us a two meat combo and an additional side of corn nuggets.  For my two meat combo I chose chicken and pork, and chose mac & cheese for my side.  The combo comes with a drink in a cute re-usable cup.    They do have one high chair for the kiddos.  The ambiance is casual, staff is friendly, and there's more seating than you'd think from looking at the outside.  It was a little cleaner than I was expecting but not much.    The chicken was juicy, tender, smoky, and wonderful.  The pork....oh deer sweet 8 lb. 10 oz. baby jesus that pork is somethin' else.  It will melt in your mouth.  And their house bbq sauce is perfectly sweet and tangy.  The mac & cheese is made with perfectly cooked cavatappi and swimming in runny cheesy goodness.  The corn nuggets were served hot and fresh.    Next time I wanna try the catfish, collard greens, and banana pudding!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smokin plate duo $13.99. I chose chicken and pork with mac &amp; cheese.  2-20-16

pceQqdUHGJNopwmjGbWecA.text: Been wanting to try this place forever. Went to the one on Grand Canyon and walked out cause it was so busy. Was a Wednesday afternoon so figured we'd try the original location.  Got right in and ordered. Ordered a lot so we could try everything.  The fries were just ok, nothing special.  The burnt ends were good but loaded with black pepper, was all you could taste. The chicken was really good, enjoyed it a lot.  The brisket was also very good, smoky flavor and not all dried out.  The ribs were good, smoked right and I dipped them in the sauce and yummy.  The pork was ok, not my favorite thing.  Overall it was good, but the burnt ends are my favorite and they had too much pepper, have to go back and try again, maybe the cook spilled a thing of black pepper on them?

rI7KeOkHzl6Jwq6vgZWYzg.text: True Story.....  I get a text from a long time friend that he had some amazing BBQ and now is at a strip club next door getting lap dances.  Friend: Dude they have over a 100 beautiful women.  Me: What? Wait BBQ??  Friend: Sends pictures of this drop dead gorgeous brunett in a red,white, and blue bikini.  Me: What? Wait BBQ?  Friend: They even have this amazing short person stripper.  Me: What? Wait BBQ?  I had to make this my first stop straight from the airport...and I am glad I did. I was lucky I hit them at an off hour as right after we ordered...the line went out the door!  The food: Lean baby back ribs that are thick, meaty, smokey, and flavorful. Brisket to die for....incredibly tender, smoke ring ladden...OMG....get a combo of the sliced and chopped.   I would also recommend the burnt ends ( this is something not a lot of places offer). Tons of crunch, tons of flavor, and little fat.  Great sausage and great smoked chicken...but I would not waist stomach capacity on those two.  They offer four great sauces: I had the momma sweet delicious...get it, it is delicious and complex. I also had the sweet country girl....both complemented the meats...and are great to drip the rolls and bread in.  Sides that were outstanding were the bacon potato salad, the jalapeno coleslaw and mac and cheese. I would pass on the cornbread (tasted very pedestrian), corn poppers ( hard as rocks if they are to go), and Yams ( too sweet and syrupy).  I was lucky enough to meet one of the owners and she was sweet as pecan pie and just  a nice person to talk to.......they care about what they serve and how they treat their customers and employees.....nice.  If you like bbq and your in veags this is the place...easy to get to from McCarran airport....and if your bored after the bbq...you can always watch a short person pole dance!!!!

u4umm4H1uShllE2ECKRUbw.text: We had the outlaw burger, the meatloaf and the St. Louis pork ribs. Everything was good, but we probably should've just gotten the meatloaf and skipped the burger, it was the same meat for both. The place was a bit pricey but their servings are huge, we were overstuffed and couldn't finish all 3 main entrees. I like the hole in the wall feel of it, this location is a BYOB, bring your own beer place which I thought was cool if you drank with your friends over some ribs. I definitely will come back for the ribs and meatloaf and will probably try other things, I probably won't over order next time.

4-KBMsEbsSD14oUJ3b0OSA.text: Note: rating is relative to similar restaurants in the area, and not relative to all BBQ restaurants I've ever been to. Giving this place five stars and Salt Lick in Texas four stars does not necessarily mean I like it more than Salt Lick.   With that out of the way,  I was really surprised that BBQ this good could be found in Las Vegas. It's not just good 'cue, it's very good 'cue.   I'm not entirely sure what convinced me to try this place out. I think I was tired of the huge sprawling buffets here and I wanted something a bit more novel. This place happened to pop up as being open and serving non-brunch items. As someone who has gone to every major BBQ town in the country- Lockhart, TX, Kansas City,  Memphis, the BBQ trail through the Carolinas - I am difficult to impress. But I'm also fair, so I went in with low expectations.    I can happily say those expectations were exceeded. By a lot. No, it's not on the level of Franklin's or Gates or Sugarfire, but it stacks up really nicely against the best I've had in every non-BBQ city I've visited.    I got the three meat platter with the ribs, chopped brisket, and burnt ends. The burnt ends are as good as any I've had outside of KC. The only ding was that they were pre-glazed with their regular bbq sauce, which made them a touch sweeter than I usually prefer. But that's personal preference. You may find that a plus.  The ribs were solid, with a nice smoke ring and a little bit of fight to the bite. Unlike some hardcore fans,  I don't like too much pull to my ribs,  so be warned if that is your standard of excellence. For me, it was nice and meaty and juicy, just the way I liked it. What separates this from the very best is the lack of assertiveness of the smoke. The ribs are definitely smoked and not grilled, but for people who prefer grilled and are more used to "BBQ" from places like Chilis or TGIFridays, the milder smoke undertones that were less successful for me might be more successful for you. I am a lot more aggressive in my love of smoke and carmelization. But again, that kind of art is almost unheard of outside of cities that revolve around 'cue. It is more of a nitpick than a genuine bone of contention.   The brisket was the least successful,  with it being fairly ordinary. It was a good place to try out some of the sauces without fear of messing the meats up. I liked the spicy sauce the most. Hardcore 'cue folks will find the regular way too sweet, but casuals will appreciate it. I was not into the vinegar based sauce at all. It isn't similar to the Carolina vinegar sauce, which was my expectation.   In the end, the only thing left on my plate of any significance was the brisket. I really enjoyed everything else and would come back if I'm craving something a little out of the ordinary in Vegas.

d3v4W7yBlzOcyGI4LTCdTA.text: We had our wedding reception here and boy am I glad we did!! The food was AMAZING, the service was great, and they bent over backwards to accommodate us in any way possible. The manager lady (sorry, completely forgot her name) was more than helpful in every way imaginable, and for that I thank you. When we move to Vegas next year, this joint will be at the top of our list for some kick ass bbq!!!

_UXya5BzhJlLimKkCsOEdw.text: Can't say enough about this Barbeque joint. Everything here is over the top. From the brisket to the huge beef rib, it is all good. Must go to when in Las Vegas. Back again for the third visit and found everything just as good as previous visits.

MT7Zvf4gvRr6s3CbOW_Qaw.text: best burger with amazing fried onions folks. Their bun is absolutely delicious. A bit pricey but well worth the experience. a solid 4 star rating. I'll be back.

F5jcQweJazOZdNhYvkHb0Q.text: I yelped my way here and Im super glad I did!!  The BarBQue was AMAZING!  Over the course of 3 days (yes I went 3 consecutive days) I have enjoyed the succulent pork ribs (they also have beef), the brisket, catfish, 1/4 chicken, and collards.  They also have 4 great barbeque sauces as condiments to add.  Their NC Vinegar sauce is AMAZING!  I absolutely love this place!!  Its a must to try when here in Vegas!!!

hS-bU1O_clM68_YYdQmm_Q.text: The staff was friendly. I got the all you can eat so I tried a little bit of everything. The food was good but a little too salty and too peppery for my taste. Almost everything had whole peppercorns in the seasoning which is a little overpowering. The meats were served a little above room temp. The burger was essentially spicy meatloaf. The Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes were good. The cobblers were not good because they were overly sweet and tasted liked canned fruit. I definitely recommend the root beer float. Good place to try but the all you can eat wasn't worth it to me.

Cr13hCrtkDlJh-YD39gT3Q.text: Fire.   After eating here 3 times its time to leave a review. I honestly think this place has some amazing bbq. I've had some great bbq all over the US and this place is up there with the best of em. Ive had the ribs, brisket (chopped and sliced), chicken, and tried out alot of the different sides. If you're looking for some good barbecue that wont disappoint come and eat here. If you like a little kick to your bbq sauce use the spicy bbq sauce cause thats all I use when I come here.

l-uNK4buNT958q_YwhCBTQ.text: Best bbq near the strip!! Lizelle was awesome taking our order.  We had the baby back ribs and the brisket 3 ways. Just like everyone says the burnt ends are really good but so is the sliced brisket. Ribs were a bit dry but they do have sauce. Ribs were cooked so they come off the bone easily. Would defiantely come back. thank you Lizelle!

3rbHSQBiwx5zJ_B6g1IMbw.text: Best BBQ in town! Located under a freeway overpass, it doesn't get more hole-in-the-wall than this. While Rollin Smoke's location may be subtle and discrete, its food is definitely not. All their smoked meats and sauces are gluten-free. The meat here is simply phenomenal. If you you're a big boy or girl that can eat, go for the AYCE for $35 - anything on the menu is fair game.   The times I've been here, I've stuck to the combos. The pit special is more than enough for two people if you like variety. I love the brisket, pulled pork, and spare ribs, but less of a fan of the chicken and hot links. Today's visit, my friend and I shared the rib platter special and were not disappointed. The baby back ribs and St. Louis spare ribs were some of the best I've had. One beef rib would've been enough to share, but we added on an extra for $6. To top it off, we added a 1/2 pound of burnt ends with a side of waffle fries and corn nuggets. I've had burnt ends before, but they were nothing like these. These burnt ends were juicy, tender, and so flavorful that they required no sauce. The corn nuggets are now my favorite side! I've also liked the mac & cheese and cornbread in the past.   Despite having over a thousand rave reviews, I like to think that this joint is still one of Vegas' best kept secrets. It reminds me of Freddy's BBQ from House of Cards - amazing ribs and food, but only if you're in the know. I still have yet to try the infamous outlaw burger, but I saw it pass by today and it had me mesmerized. Until next time my hungry friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib platter, burnt ends, corn nuggets, and waffle fries

l64irWmzK4NLLfR9tI-pJw.text: This place is the real deal. Soo good! The price is good too. The wife and I went out from the strip and we are glad that we found this place l. Soo good.

l4cxO0hWQ6fXwkuooK5e4w.text: Best flavored meatloaf! All around great food, highly recommended! Large location plenty of seats, large portions bring an appetite or share a plate

nB6DQQGiJ1GGaQX1z8GewA.text: We had supper delivered to our hotel via Grub Hub, which was very convenient.  I tried two different ribs, the brisket, and sausage.  Both types of ribs and brisket was very good, tender and flavorful, but the sausage was only average.  Nice sized portions with good presentation.  And the sauce was OK.  They are 'Southern Based' BBQ, so I was worried it would be to mustardy or vinegary.   I'm more of a Kansas City or Memphis BBQ fan, but this was still good.  Mac and Cheese was slightly below average, but Potato salad was slightly above, so it evened out.  They are not the stars of the show, so I don't expect too much.    Cobbler (Peach and Blueberry) dessert was disappointing.

nnNaiJMTtZCIAWw3kzn3xQ.text: Oh. My. Gosh. What else can I say about this barbeque? The food was absolutely incredible! The service was great, and did I mention the food?! I am a bit of a brisket and burnt end snob, and it was absolutely amazing!! I would and will go here again! I've heard that the barbeque is award winning, and rightly so! Wow!

xSQb_UxMTOQXe-2zWBAK-w.text: WOW! Awesome food and great service. Our cashier was very friendly and her suggestions on food were on point. The food was fresh and fast we waited less then 10 minutess ( family of 8 with food all coming at the same time). We will definitely be back next time we are in town.

wIPlA3MvAv_op90qa-t6CQ.text: Great! Smoked meatloaf plate was wonderful. Way too much to eat! Smothered in crispy deep fried onion rings and a terrific smoky taste. Ordered a side of green beans, but too much garlic for my taste. Another side or free desert was offered, but I was too full! Overall very satisfied, and I'll be back.

_9guojA_9oHwTG-JTkpU-w.text: BBQ On point! I got to meet the owner the first time I came here, he was cleaning the tables. I asked him what style BBQ was his favorite and where his main influence was from. He told me Arkansas style but less spicy. He also told me that in his opinion Las Vegas doesn't like the real spicy BBQ.  I personally feel like he should just do what he wants to do, but he's the boss. He has great grub. I have now had all but one item on the menu. I can say it's all dynamite.   The meat is all tender and juicy. the sauce is light in flavor and texture. All the sides are great and fair size.  My father in law asked me when we were done eating, "can you put this place in my gps?" When I told him yes he had a big smile on his face. We've been going back ever since.

tHdBsVV2KFMU65t_gRO27Q.text: Talk about hole in the wall! Do not judge this hidden jem by its looks. This place offers delicious BBQ that does not disappoint. The portions are more than enough, and the flavor is only intensified with their home made sauces. I'd recommend getting the sauce 'Arkensause'. The sauce adds a great kick to your food. Overall great experience. Will come back again.

C0uBgu0aYTM6GaQvS2J3mg.text: Great BBQ. I travel all over the country and this is one of my favorite stops for a barbecue. The brisket is where it's at. It no frills just great food.

TkYmUdVTABOCpAA8VqSk6w.text: Ordered via yelp. Arrived and asked about the order. Was told it would be right out. 30 minutes later it was ready. Noticed patrons in the restaraunt were upset with the long wait times, which I felt bad for as it was clear this was due to high takeout orders.   Corn nuggets were freshly fried, moist, flavorful, and well seasoned. Baby backs were dry and lacked sufficient smoke/ring. They were also warm at best. Keeping them moist and at the right temperature by the end of the day was a challenge for them as I suspect they were smoked earlier in the day.   Have eaten here before and found it excellent at times, and a near miss at others. This time was a total miss.

WDnAKc8HwnEH-jyfB6I_ww.text: WOW, great place!  I'm from Texas and have been in Vegas a 1 1/2yrs.  Have not had a good BBQ plate in that long.  Food was great, service great and restaurant was clean.  Now I didn't have the pleasure of trying the Ribs or banana pudding they had already sold out.  Will try my luck again soon.  Everything I did try was great.  Forget about the buffet around town.  This place is where it is at.  Will be taking all my visitor friends here.  Keep up the great work.

8brM-cujMtx9dkXaujYYrQ.text: We got the sampler plate, for 50 bucks they sure did give a whole lot of slider buns and not a proportionate amount of meat to put in them. Also for being a BBQ joint, why would y'all not put barbecue sauce in our takeout? The pulled pork and ribs were so dry! My family and I loved the sausage though and I would go back just to get that and the sweet, soft, honey filled cornbread.

6wEaxonJUlyodKIh_fRm5w.text: Amazing place, Michael is the sweetest and most attentive bartender who is so happy to see you and take care if your party. A must see in Vegas.  Luv.

ZpaarbWXeRRRmRZuGxRreg.text: This place was absolutely amazing!  The service was great. The food was well presented and tasted delicious!! Would def recommend this place to any and everyone. A must try while in Vegas!

g1PWtSajoTzh2fe2Yogqnw.text: Been here a couple of times, I like to try something different each time. The food is amazing, never disappoints. Staff have great vibes- thanks Christal.

7b8-YMf8PKpaYP4G4CU-gg.text: I'd say if you need a BBQ fix, this is probably your best option because not only is it affordable but it is also very close to the strip.   It's hard to come up with a comparison to this spot because it was my first time having Arkansas style BBQ. Now, if I compare it to BBQ i've had in Austin, TX (which isn't quite fair to be honest) the meat wasn't as tender and as flavorful as I had hoped. Although for being in Nevada or anywhere in the west coast region, they do a pretty good job. It'll definitely fix the BBQ craving!  Upon our arrival, LV was having a downpour so there was not many people in line to order. It was my first time here so I ended up deciding on "The Pit Special" that comes with 5 different meats and 3 small sides. I'm huge on beef ribs and "The Pit Special" unfortunately didn't come with one so I switched one of my meat choices for it (extra charge of $6). If you're like me who can't stop at a BBQ joint without ordering a beef rib, I'd say it's better if you just add a beef rib to your platter instead of substituting so that way you get to try everything. Our cashier, Sofia, wasn't the happiest of campers to be honest when it came to us ordering. Obviously as a customer, you're going to ask questions about what to order and you kind of except some sort of recommendation but this lady wasn't in the most pleasant of moods. She asked me if I would like my brisket either chopped or sliced. I asked her what the difference was and she said "Well, one is chopped and the other is sliced." I was definitely taken back by her response but I was hoping she would be able to say, one had a thicker cut or if one sort of cut of meat had more fat than the other. Anyway, this lady had zero patience and I was just ready to pay and step away because i didn't want my meal ruined due to one sour apple.  The food was brought out by a young boy who prior to that was making his rotations around the tables cleaning and wiping them down for the next customers. He was very attentive and I think most of the people waiting for their orders noticed his efficiency and great attitude.   I immediately started with the cheesy mac and cheese and I think that is definitely the way to go! One bite of the mac and cheese and another into the chopped brisket!! The House Arkansauce was great on EVERYTHING!!!! I had it on the beef rib, the chicken, and the brisket!!  As far as the rest of the sides, the bacon potato salad was delicious but I'd say the yams were a little too sweet for my liking.   The meat was definitely delicious but I did notice some parts being a tiny bit dry. Maybe it was just my beef rib, but the rib had parts where it was extra tender and other parts where it was a little tough. Overall I would still recommend ordering it.

5Db5Ha_TbcxEfuu4doMvaA.text: The BBQ Brisket and Ribs were amazing. We got sides and they were all excellent. I could not pick a favorite.  Customer service outstanding. Employees checked in with us throughout our meal...all around awesome.  Mahalo Josh and Lizelle!

hDj3BBbdnUsTKl5w9D0hhQ.text: 3 stars... If there is one food I'm most passionate about, it's BBQ! Yelpers gave this the nod and pointed me in the right direction... We split the 5 meat platter to get a well rounded lay of the land. Chicken was perfectly moist and flavorful, piled pork was tender and soaked up the sauce readily. Hot link left a bit to be desired as it was tough and loaded with black pepper which overshadowed any smoke. Ribs lacked a depth of smoke I look for in top shelf specimens, but were very tender! Least impressive was the brisket which is disappointing as it was a bit greasy and the extreme chopping left the consistency a bit to be desired. The sides were fan with the best mac & cheese I've had from a restaurant. Creamy cheesy and hints of other flavors(garlicky ranch?!?) that kicked me right in the tongue. Beans are loaded with meat and a perfect spicy sweet that finished the 1-2 tongue punch combo. Ambiance is strip mall picnic, service is "self", and prices are in line with expectation. Don't get me wrong this food was solid 3 stars, I was just hoping for more out of the  food from a place with smoke in the name. I'll give it another shot, but at first glance this joint does. It make the list.

mfc3cPpfNIKSu3YIW5r1fA.text: The best barbecue I've had in Vegas. The brisket 3 ways is amazing. Service is friendly and helpful. Their sauces are excellent too. If you like a hot Barbeque sauce they have one that is no joke. I'll definitely be returning.

_xp29aeGe-Qd-rDjXWV95A.text: Brisket here is fantastic, good variety of sauces, ambiance is exactly what I expect for a good bbq joint.  Will be back next time I am in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vfG5yP8tDIdchmntLyedxw.text: I asked the guy who took our order what was most popular. He gave us a rundown of the menu and boasted that they were the best BBQ restaurant in Vegas. I thought, "that's quite a big claim..." Since my boyfriend and I were Rollin Smoke virgins, we decided to go all in for our first time and ordered the pit special (5 meats + three sides) to get a taste of everything.. WOW I don't think I've really been eating BBQ all my life. My boyfriend stated that the ribs were the best he's ever had. The brisket was SO GOOD it makes me wish that cows weren't methane machines. Pulled pork came in a close third place to all the meats we tried, with the chicken last. Some parts were somewhat dry, and lacked flavor. Sides were delicious too. Sweet, soft, and moist cornbread. Corn nuggets got boring to eat after a few bites. Don't get me started on the Mac n cheese though- I'd like to buy a gallon or two for me, myself, and I and eat myself into cheesy pasta oblivion. Best macaroni and cheese I've ever had. It has been on my mind since I came here last.  I've seriously been missing out. And you are too if you haven't tried Rollin Smoke.  You're right, guy. Best BBQ in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle fries and two sides of mac
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pit meats
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn nuggets, corn bread, &amp; the best Mac n&#39; cheese I&#39;ve ever had

6TO9IAJ8G82dNQ4Tcx66mA.text: Everything was frickin great.  Desert included.  Real highlight though is the beef rib.  Do not leave without trying the beef rib.

93twnUvsRKlKVIbLLKavZA.text: I've ordered from here several times and their food is always good. I've tried three different burgers and so far I haven't been disappointed.   Definitely worth trying if you're looking for something new and delicious.

biFQn6W2zVINPCXl27OF0A.text: This place has the best BBQ in town! Great prices and friendly staff.. And were from Texas so we know good BBQ. will definitely come back!!

vm_KpYt0tFmLvcknKN-Mpw.text: Oh yeah, this place was good. After a failed attempt to return to Gordon Ramsay's Burgr, where I went up each level of the Planet Hollywood parking structure without finding a single spot, (not even a False hope spot like "Yes! Wait there's a Prius. Shit.) I decided to search Yelp for an off strip spot with top notch reviews and ample parking. That's when I stumbled across Rollin' Smoke BBQ and boy I'm glad I did. Although the hot links weren't very spicy (like I prefer) they tasted great with the "Country Girl" mustard based sauce. The brisket was on point and the ribs cooked to perfection as well. They have several sauce varieties, all good, especially the vinegar one ("Alabama vinegar" I think.) The staff was very friendly and our food came out within 10 minutes. I'll definitely be back to this place and wish them continued success.  Try it or Diet Final Word  Oh you better believe it, you need to try...this...place. Solid, solid BBQ without all the hustle and bustle of the strip or the long celebrity chef lines.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 meat, one side plate. Ate till I was super full and still had plenty of left overs.

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wife&#39;s chicken sandwich and loaded mashed potatoes. Chicken was standard but she said the Alabama vinegar &#34;took it to the next level.&#34;

Om2bO6dujD2q93on3H1Amw.text: Mmmmmmm, get ready for some good down home BBQ! Rollin Smoke has this thing figured out. The brisket three way couldn't have been a better tasting of the different brisket choices. The staff was friendly and i totally recommend it for a great casual lunch. Get there early......

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9xqMUleNp8AhGg_2-46obA.text: Came here with 4 of my hungry friends and ordered the BBQ Sampler. It was delicious and satisfied our bbq craving after 4th of July. Even though we eat a lot it was enough to make us full. Best BBQ in Vegas imo

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Sampler for $50. Also comes with some free rolls.

D2kY_AdJgd0S6pl_RItf8A.text: Met up with some local Vegas friends on our last visit out there. This restaurant is hidden, located very close to a strip club, in a dark plaza, windows are tinted, and is missing a bouncer outside. However once you step in, it's like being in Texas again.  You order up at the counter and take a seat. They bring your food to you. The cashier was cool and even know how to say my name correctly. Respect given.   Like any good BBQ joint, they better give you a good bang for your buck. I expect finger licking seasoned grilled meats and a slew of sides. They sure didn't disappoint. They sure know how to rub their meats!  Brisket: Seasoned perfectly. The best brisket in Vegas Spare Ribs: Fall off the bone and flavorful Chicken: Not dry and seasoned very well Mashed potatoes: Buttered and smooth just the way I like it Yams: Sweet and juicy Corn Nuggets: Awesome deep fried corn nuggets. Never had these before  Everything pretty much was on par with great BBQ. Not Austin, TX great, but for anywhere else, it's up there. It's cheap and filling for some good rubbed meat!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket, Ribs, chicken, corn nuggets, yams, mashed potatoes

JaP3Q6-0TwziXiUMgk1HLw.text: Absolutely amazing!!  Hands down the best bbq in Vegas and the best I've had outside of Texas.  This is TRUE bbq, you can tell they don't just slather bbq sauce on the meat and call it barbecued. You can taste the smokiness in the meat and it's unbelievably tender. There were 3 of us and we got the all you can eat so we were able to try a bunch of items on the menu:  chicken, brisket, pulled pork, hot links, spare ribs, baby back ribs, beef ribs, mac n cheese, coleslaw, fried okra, banana pudding, berry cobbler, and a root beer float.  The highlights were definitely the ribs. The spare ribs and baby backs were my FAVORITE things we tried. Spare ribs had a bit more kick and spice, and the baby backs were juicier and fattier (in a delicious, perfect way). The beef rib was also delicious - not to mention the biggest rib I've ever seen - but very rich and filling. The coleslaw was excellent to cut the richness, sweetness, and smokiness of the meal, and the fried okra was simple and perfect. Mac n cheese was also great (I totally judge a bbq place on hthe quality of their mac n cheese... ie Big Ern's at Container Park sucks). Brisket wasn't thrilling, but I admit I like my brisket with a little fat on it and this was quite lean.  The prices are insanely good, cheaper than Famous Daves or Lucilles, and the food is better! We got AYCE but would've been fine sharing the Pit Special, Rib Platter, & adding a couple beef ribs - which is basically exactly what we ordered, except we paid more because we chose AYCE and they added extra to the platter, which we didn't need and had quite a bit leftover. Also the service is awesome, they genuinely care if you're enjoying the food. The entire experience was great!  I can't wait to go back and try other things on the menu, I have my eye on the collard greens, loaded mash potatoes, and "bbq parfait!"

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pit Special and Rib platter, ordered under AYCE so they loaded it up with extra meat!!

Fsz4PZm3OHNgJR1nJms3ag.text: This is good BBQ.  The sauce has a little sweet and a little kick that hits the spot without being overpowering.  This isn't my favorite BBQ place in Las Vegas, but it is definitely in my top 5.  I'll be back.

eFiJ-gRbHND5kCmyFv2bHw.text: Wow, close to 400 reviews and I only heard about this place recently? How did I miss this? But then again, I rarely find myself driving on Highland Drive, which mainly seems to be a business district with strip clubs. Anyway, I'll try to keep it short and sweet.   This place is all about the sides, I absolutely love them! I secretly think they are even better than the meat, LOL! My favorites so far are:  Cheesy Mac N Cheese - very creamy cheese sauce, and they top it off with even more (shredded) cheese! Corn Bread - always hot and fresh! I love how they put a good amount of butter on them and are not dry!  Corn Nuggets - one of the employees suggested that we try this, and I'm glad we did. Creamy corn on the inside. Crispy goodness on the  outside. Great with ketchup, A MUST TRY! Kicken Beans - I don't eat beans (unless they are soybeans), but my husband and friends have said that this was delicious.   The one side I was not crazy about were the waffle fries. They were soggy and cold the one time I had ordered them.   OK, OK, the meats are pretty good too. My husband and I shared The Pit Special and I did like the brisket and pulled pork. Both were juicy, tasty, and cooked perfectly. Their barbecue sauce is good, but a bit tangy. I still say it's all about the sides! :P The employees are very friendly. They walk about asking if you enjoy the food and if you are happy. Drinks, utensils, condiments and to go containers are all self-serve.   Sometimes they can get crazy busy, where the line is out the door. You know what they say, the hole in the wall places are the best! I'm glad we found this spot, I think they have the best barbecue in town!

Lv6QPpBw9-aKqNbYGnUUgQ.text: Vegetarian?  Here's a pickle.  This is the carnivore's domain.  Note:  Everything I know about BBQ, I learned on TV.  I've been to Memphis, Kansas City, and Dallas and never had a lick of the stuff.  Even better, growing up in Hawaii, we boiled our ribs before grilling them.  I'm quite the expert.  But...  The wafting aroma of sweet hickory smoke.  The earthy, mild spice rub that has deeply penetrated the proteins; a moist, beefy rib with tender sinew and rendered fat;  fall off the bone baby backs; "suckably" delicious cartilage of toothsome spareribs, and glistening slices of brisket.  The acrid, bitterness of the smoke ring in strong contrast to the almost sweet meat.   Food porn!  The sauce has a good vinegar kick that helps to cut the one dimensional flavor and cloying, richness that becomes more difficult to take the more you eat and the colder it gets.    Their signature, bigger than any human's mouth, stuff falling out, BBQ sauce on your face "outlaw" burger is good eats.  Brisket, sauteed onions, peppers, fried onion strips, slaw, veg, cheese and a chipolte aioli; what's not to love?  Remaining menu items less successful.  The breaded catfish and shrimp are both overcooked and rubbery.  The smoked meatloaf, excessively smoky and bitter.  Deep fried sides often oily with one exception, the outstanding cream corn nuggets.  Crispy on the outside, rich creamy corn goodness on the inside.  Prices are very reasonable for the quantity.  The $24.99 AYCE a winner; anything on the menu, one price.  The worthy indulgence is not without cost.  Suffice it to say, remember waking up from a drunken stupor after having smoked your first cigar?  All the mouthwash in the world...

pC_zTfarMqBvi-EiTgFIrg.text: Great bartender very accommodating and attentive.  Highly recommend.  Upstairs is the way to go!!!

9qOejgxB97-_Goi4sl7Y-w.text: For my first time trying it the pork was very undercooked, I took my Plate back and they denied the fact that it was and said there's no way it could be and continued to serve other people. Now let me give you some background on me, I'm from Houston Texas. I grew up to BBQ every other day, I'm known for my pork ribs from everybody that knows me so BBQ is a big deal for me. So for me to have someone deny the fact that their food is undercooked and continue to serve other families just for profit let's me know what type of business they run.
