7aa_rTmkjFqVdlxMMvQ_Sw.text: This place is really good!  We got the combo plate and everything taste great!  I'll be coming back for sure!

A-EDsK9xjDKw10Q3hZ8RGQ.text: Best BBQ place I've been to! The brisket, ribs, rib tips, the greens and potatoes. I mean everything here is absolutely yummy! Must try it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket, ribs &amp; pulled pork oh my!

rCAQWns7gE70kVPB2u1aiQ.text: Growing up in Texas I missed a good Barbeque restaurant. A friend recommended me to try the place and man was he right.  Tender meats, loaded with flavor, can't wait to go back

9gu8SZTCj7UcuQH7aMiLJw.text: This place is located very close to our office so I end up eating here more than I would like (3-4 times per month).  The high points of Rolling Smoke are that the BBQ food is consistent, and the quality is good. There is plenty of seating for a group.  The reason this place should be higher rated: 1. Parking is difficult if they are busy at all. 2. They generally only have one person taking orders which result in a long line.  3. The layout makes almost no sense. You are constantly giving way to other customers. 4. There are no appropriately sized lunch portions, which means I am always wasting food and money. 5. Inconsistent service. We go for lunch and sometimes we are in and out in 30 minutes other times its 90 minutes.  6. Never dirty but never feels clean.

LKlIUfrfmmV88C_WhbGFOg.text: By far, one of the best BBQ places I ever had. Traveled here for a trip and stumbled upon this location. In particular, Lizelle was extremely helpful and delightful. Overall, a great and enjoyable experience.

pOtpEHc2QcQ0Ib36jCEOpQ.text: Man I walked my 12 family members more than 4 miles up and down the strip today to come here and if it wasn't "DAM good" I was never going to hear the end of it! These guys were so courteous and sat down with us to explain the whole menu.  Everything  looked exactly like the pictures and tasted like real down home barbecue.    You have to visit this place when you're in Vegas.  Don't be scared to stray off the strip for some real food!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The notorious outlaw burger. Vs. A hungry me is no match!

GzN1d93sy-_vblFHJ_g-Bg.text: A HIDDEN BBQ JOINT IN VEGAS!!! I was told about this place by a friend. Gotta admit I was kind of skeptical. One bite is all it took. I had burnt ends like I've never had. Heaven in every bite. You can get them by the pound!!! In the mood for bbq. Don't miss this place!!

3LClgWIaciTkomM3YROnEw.text: First things first, I have never had the option to buy al you can eat at barbecue spot. It gave me a chance to taste everything under $40

TowEeCEsisA0ezP0UD12Cw.text: Best barbecue in Vegas! My family got the ribs, meatloaf, brisket and hot links... All were amazing! They do run out of items FYI.   Previously got the corn nuggets and they are also delicious.  Service is nice and fast.

G4GHakgs8_OcTU-zRhY7Jg.text: Came in for dinner, cashier was confused about the menu questions, it was my first time. Ordered a combo, was tasty, only complaint Was need more bbq sauces on the counter for customers, also the bbq chicken was not fully cooked, aside from that I will try again.

J_CmAUs0Gi9N5i3DdqD_4g.text: Holy BBQ heaven Batman!! This place is fantastic and exactly what a BBQ joint should be.  We had the club wrap STUFFED with chicken, pork, bacon and fixings; waffle fries, corn fritters (A MUST) and the 3 meat combo of burnt ends, hot links and spare ribs. There was a ton of food and not a single complaint!  Can't wait to come back and try everything else on the menu.

oWQX6xfvFCTgGNUO4f5hyA.text: The Outlaw Burger is the meal cheat days were made for! It's gigantic and completely acceptable to share, weighing a monstrous amount and nearly filling an entire takeout box. Piled high with juicy, flavorful brisket (tastes like Texas!), crispy fried bell pepper and onion strings, cheddar cheese, and chipotle aioli, this thing is packed with big, bold flavors. The red cabbage slaw adds the perfect bit of crunch and acidity, bringing what could be an overwhelming mouthful flying back into foodie heaven.  I'm pretty sure I'm going to have wet dreams about this burger.  Initially we were turned away because they had "just closed" only for the owner to come chasing after us, insistent that we could still be served. Right after our order was placed, a family walked in and were turned away. I'm flattered and grateful that we made it in under the wire, but maybe turn off all of the neon flashy BBQ lights if you're closing so that you don't have to ruin anyone's day!  EDIT: I returned for actual barbecue and found the meat to be poor quality and the portions on the stingy side. Pricing is about on par with other spots, and their sauce is good, but either they've gone downhill or the Outlaw burger is about the best they can do.

yaBMtULult6vs13eIb7CJA.text: So I had this when I just visited back to Vegas. Tried the Baby Back Ribs and the Mac and Cheese. I didn't love it. It was o.k. I really enjoy TC's RIB Crib more.  Nice place inside and friendly staff.

GPAXH6ZVyQuYr0AbkGBI9w.text: Hot damn!! Really good BBQ!! Get in there!! Brisket was too good!! Love that Mac n cheese too!! Off the strip, but sooo fricken good!!! Well worth the trip!!! Going back for more the 2nd night

Y88QCXGRi3rhsJ0p0e2fNA.text: Great off the beaten path place. Clean restaurant, awesome BBQ. The pictures say it all.

1roPO8JlpKfcAFu05Uxlmg.text: I finally got to go to Rollin Smoke BBQ with my son tonight . We live in Las Vegas and have gone to many BBQ places in town and of course I grew up in the Carolinas and lived in Texas too , so I know my BBQ ! Well , it is good but I didn't think it was great as others do . The meat is definately smokey which alot of places here don't seem to do . I got the 3 meat plate and my son got the big burger . The burger was cooked perfectly and was good , but I have to say the Famous Daves Ultimate Brisket Burger is better . Now , the ribs here are more moist and flavorful . I like the pulled pork a little better here too and I like the Southern Girl sauce better than any of the others . The BBQ beans tasted a little old and not good and I love BBQ beans ! The sausage was ok , but again Dave's beats theirs . The corn nuggets were good and I don't know anyone else around here that serves them . It would have been nice to have corn bread in my platter than the one piece of bun underneath that was oily . All in all , I think this is a good place and will probably try again and they also offer a locals discount . The lady at the counter was really friendly which I appreciate since I am also in the service industry it is nice to talk with people who aren't just doing their job and go next in line . I would recommend this place , but not my favorite , but better than a few others I have tried in town .

5UL9vRE2sWEnR19mp8nY6g.text: If you go, get the ribs! The ribs are the best meat offered at RSBBQ. The brisket was tender.  The chicken a little dry.  The on table BBQ sauce had a good flavor but was too watery and didn't stick well to the meat.  Mac & Cheese, Okra were good side to accompany the rib. Go for the ribs!

D3EsgB4UvrkHW_0JBcwPlg.text: Not good for me . Did the all you can eat offer for 24.99. Every one of he style of ribs were dry . The downfall is the tomato flavor the rub/sauce has... Only great item is the fried shrimp. Service was also very friendly, but not even close to good BBQ for me.

zZ1aRLSTD5rz28lVc9sMKQ.text: skip the shrimp, it was a little overcooked, but this is a BBQ place, everything was well priced and the food was great.

WV0CeH_we88rPBCWj6dD3Q.text: Don't expect fancy, just good BBQ at its best. Meat is smoked and not covered with someone's uncles sauce. You need not even put sayce on to get a great flavor treat. Hot links are thr bomb, spicy and in a natural casing. This BBQ is one of not the best I've had.

yohy_hJgWC5_Nt9nGOmfEg.text: Amazing bbq. Was extremely surprised to find a nice bbq place in Vegas so close to home. The ribs and macaroni and cheese are to die for. Highly recommend this place between the good food and the people who run it are very friendly.

NAISzAYCA6Zt9U4z2ZNOFg.text: Ordered a mix of ribs, pulled pork, chicken, and sides for our party. Everything was fantastic. Haven't had BBQ this good since Texas.

yg_PjA0Tr8xk-uQA9qcKRA.text: Rib tips were delicious, staff seemed very dedicated and were die-hard Arkansas fans. It's off the strip and definitely out of the way, but if you want some authentic bbq, I say go for it!

OXF_NB0aBOr-RqgE7udZPQ.text: So far, the best BBQ I've had in town...which is 32 years and counting!  They have something for everyone on their menu.  Owners are very friendly and extremely polite!  I think the location is good because its very centralized in my eyes.  Keep up the great BBQ and friendly atmosphere Guys!!!

DygRiBhHeKXXh6SL4U40cA.text: Great place to eat BBQ.  Wish they had more seating!

ZXoIgVnPeHuuI4riyxmuXA.text: We had a group and a back room was opened so we could all eat together in our own room!  The staff is really friendly and so helpful!  Love this place! Loved the burger! Can't wait to try more!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side room for groups!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fish tank in the group room!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Outlaw Burger!! And free dessert if you check in!!

ng7OFYL7bM5VLVu7qiLmUw.text: It's perfect.  A hole in the wall place located 5 minutes off the strip.  I've been coming to Vegas for years and never even thought of barbeque.  It's what you would expect to find for great food.  Don't run away as you will miss a great find.  Seating is limited so don't be afraid to share a table.  There was a line when we showed up so we had to wait about 15 minutes just to order.  Another 20 minutes for the food to arrive which we thought was long but hey, we had good table conversation.  The food was great.  I had a trio combo of sliced brisket, ribs and hot link.  I really didn't need sauce on any of it as it was great but I love the way sauce tastes.  The table sauce was super but there're some other sauces near the counter that you need to get and fill a little cup.  These are worth exploring.  Although I'm sure there are better place across the nation, this is a great place to feed an angry hangover.

-Z8C1xamXPOlQW0oZnWdqQ.text: My first time here and it will not be the last. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. The brisket sandwich meal was delicious!  I would highly recommend Rollin Smoke Barbeque to everyone.

7X8gFu02BtxCn3jTd20KoA.text: There food is so EXPENSIVE and quite frankly not worth the price.  The sides that come with the combo are 4ounce servings.  I ordered the 5meat/3 sides combo and with tax came up to $30.

ucqNSkVsfHHyxDrwrqmm4w.text: Great food. Great service. Don't forget to buy a shirt and rep their company. Will be going again while I'm here in Vegas

XQe-mpmLpaxh-Rw6plEXdg.text: The food was good for the price. The Mac was good, but everything else was mediocre. The best burger in Las Vegas was good but it was meat loaf, not a burger and for that I am disappointed.

Wc2KowhGYaYnqFxetesaSQ.text: Had the pulled pork and hotlink. The pork was pretty good, as was the hot link.  Better than most places I have been but not the best.  Rollin Smoke BBQ is of the strip so if you are walking as I was expect about a 20 minute jaunt from the Wynn properties.  Their BBQ sauce is good but I would avoid their beans...

-9PoxnwClAsydgXJIg-WZw.text: My mom step dad and my wife and I went there yesterday to try the smoked meatloaf. It was AMAZING!!! BEST thing ever ate in my life. I travel for a living and eat good stuff all over America.... your meatloaf is AWESOME!!! I can't wait to have it again!! Question.... can I buy a whole smoked meatloaf to go? I'd like to take it up to Spokane for my family to try. Oh and one more thing.... my wife isn't much of a red meat person.... She LOVED your meatloaf as well. We all did!!

gCZWb1Ewb2HPne7gojittQ.text: Found this place by yelp and stopped in for dinner with my gf... Cheap prices and amazing food :) highly recommended if your looking for smoked BBQ, I'll def return and recommend this place to others

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio and duo meet combos

RwevmFhFRttBtwxA1n7yPg.text: This is a must-go, must-eat, must-try bbq spot in Vegas. If your'e visiting vegas, it's worth a short 4-5 minute drive from Fashion show mall to taste some of the best bbq i have ever had. We were staying at TI and it was right  across the freeway.   This was the first time I tried beef ribs. It was cooked to prefection. It was tender fall off the bone, and paired perfectly with the zesty bbq sauce. My friends ordered the trio bbq, the hotlink sandwich, and the brisket sandwich. No one was speaking, we were all too consumed eating the food lol. Their curly fries were crispy, mac n cheese was cheesy, and their cobbler was fantastic.  The service was excellent. Food was brought out to our table. We sat on the outside bench, which was convenient for a party of 8. They checked up on us on several occassion to make sure we were happy with the food. The Chief took his time to come out to ask how we like the food. My boyfirend is a bbq fanatic, he had to go shake the hand of the man who made these fantatic food.   They have made  a fan of me. I will definitely go back.

22dk5Wy9tbRTWD2QZAsRJQ.text: My shirt still smells like BBQ, and I wouldn't have it any other way. Seriously, man. This is heaven on earth. And good people. Pay, or not, it's all on the house when it's this good. Like how is it possible to have links that are better than other links? Links! Brisket, the blacker the better. Or not, cuz it's good no matter what. What about ribs that fall apart, not in that food channel fake take-me-I'm-yours way, but in the way that it just gives you a little push back before it lets go and fully causes a charry, unctuous mouth earthquake. I mean, a mouth is a mouth, to quote Ray Donovan's dad, but this is a mouth that's gotten the news.  Smoked meatloaf tomorrow.

b3o7ZBnqY7IB5z67g6QwaQ.text: Barbecue as the gods meant it to be made--that's the only way to describe this place.  This isn't a bbq joint on the main Strip of Vegas.  This is grub you have to hunt for.  Yet I guarantee once you've discovered this place off the map that the tourists have you'll never forget where it is.  People have meals they remember.  People have meal they never forget.  But very rarely do people have meals they have to ask themselves if it really happened.  No food should be allowed to taste this good.  They really shouldn't.  Because all it does is make all the other bbq feel bad, feel ashamed for their inferiority and their audacity to put themselves into the same class of eats as Rollin Smoke.    Everything here is excellent--from their ribs to their sides, from the service to their decor.  It's like walking into everybody's idea of the perfect bbq joint and finding out you never have to leave... and that maybe you never should lest it vanish like the magical culinary paradise it really is.

FzhciNKDwK-mUdsERFyLbg.text: We have eaten here several times.  I have noticed the quality of food dropping lower and lower with each visit.  I will not be returning.  I purchased 2 pounds of pulled pork.  I got 1.25 pounds of meat and the rest was fat. It was discussing and the staff could care less.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What was not fat was burnt. They must have no waste.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork is All fat.

xkNLjCZrMXmN3c_EL3Uyjg.text: The sliced brisket was too dry and the bark didn't have a lot of flavor. The potato salad was cooked perfectly, but the bacon on it was overcooked, ruining the flavor. The short ribs were on the tough side, but not inedible. The Arkansauce was too vinegary and watery. The spicy sauce had no other flavor besides the pepper that was used to make it spicy. It didn't taste like bbq sauce, only like hot sauce. I don't think I'll come here again. Although I have to note that the employees were friendly and very proactive at keeping the place clean.

K-j242wzyo6cKb9tqxgKQQ.text: I had to go there after all the talk on here.  The location is in a umm kinda shady part of town but I went there for the BBQ.  Its a True  BBQ joint. Plastic forks and knives, Styrofoam and paper plates.  The smell of smoke was pretty amazing. I was floating in like this place was the pied piper.  The menu is pretty simple like it should be.   The owner was taking the food order. Its kind of different. You pay first and wait for a runner to bring out your food. The owners are very nice people and really care about their food.  I ordered The Biggin, its a sandwich with pork, brisket, and hot links and it was friggin delicious. There's no easy way to eat this monster. You have to dig in and understand things are gonna get messy.  One boy ordered the catfish po boy. Yes its not BBQ but he loved it and they did make it perfect.  Another ordered the Brisket Dog. I didn't know it was on a sesame seed bun which he was allergic to. They made it over at no charge and put it on a hamburger bun. The sandwich was as big as his head! I was entertained just watching him trying to eat this behemoth! Its a good thing they have rolls of paper towels on the tables because this kid needed a whole roll. He loved it too.   I will definitely be back again!  oh and guys, if you sneak there without your wife or GF, you will be caught because you walk out of this place smelling like smoke!

zjCz0paRjNZtv0by04uL-w.text: Brenda did amazing job greeting my father and I ! She is perfect for the business ! She has a great attitude and is very respectful ! I love this place and the food is amazing ! I eat bbq all the time but rollinsmoke by far is the best !

nvBZ9fvQOykHl2sI0TLJoA.text: Tried Rick's Rollin Smoke at the PAWN PLAZA. 725 Las Vegas Blvd tonight! The BBQ and the service are over the top! I had the duo, burnt ends & pork ribs...the best ever! Side of the Mac&cheese was awesome...and I had to get their BBQ beans to go..great value for the price. Quality and quantity. Hubby had the Big sandwich with a side of Mac&cheese and a craft beer. He loved it. We will be going back!

84PQBUOEWgX2Wz_knR1Sug.text: Absolutely delicious! Well worth the ride, down by the strip. The ribs were cooks to perfection. The sliced meats were falling apart and perfect. Choices of sides, great verify. We will definitely be back, best BBQ in Vegas, hands down!!!

Y1hyHLeIGX_YiSIlaLZ5wQ.text: Good but not great BBQ. A little too much smoke flavor for my taste. Yes, I know smoke is in the name. But it dominated the natural flavor of the meat. The BBQ sauce was good. The flavor was different.  It has a tang to it. The Kicken beans also had a unique taste which was heavy on the bell pepper.   The mac n' cheese had an extremely liquid cheese sauce. My cousin enjoyed it. Me, well, it was acceptable. I prefer more of a casserole consistency in mac n' cheese.  Ribs and brisket were tender. Hot link was dry and over cooked.   The owner and servers were friendly.

AdMqBuOHmWZeZJOEl3EzIQ.text: Service and food is top notch at Rolling Smoke.  Called in an order for pickup, lunchtime on a Saturday.  We ordered a 1.5 racks of ribs, 1 lb. beef brisket, 3 sides of BBQ sauce, sweet potatoes, & beans.   It got busy quick with all the customers lining up, made me glad I had called in our order early.  Our order wasn't quite ready when we arrived at 12pm as they were still packing the food to go, but the guy at the counter was very nice and offered us drinks while we waited!  We were in & out in about 10-15 minutes after I paid, had a drink of sweet tea, and received our order .  It smelt so good during the car ride home, we tried the food right away.  Ribs fell off the bone, beef was tender, and the sides were all super delicious.  We were very pleased with the smoky flavored barbecue goodness which easily fed a family of 6.  Just awesome food, we'll definitely be back for more!

nUCeTkqpmRawcPaBk-IJIQ.text: Ordered today and waited close to an hour for my order. Sat inside and waited for my order while watching people that was in line after me receive their order. After finally waiting too long.....decided to get back in line to see what was taking so long. The worker went to the back to ask and magically they handed my order to her. So clearly my order was already ready but no one brought it out. Bad customer service. Bad experience as my food was no longer hot after the long wait. Very disappointed in customer service.

6hgTpO_K3X_FRNiaDG6b9g.text: When we drove here, we didn't think were in the right spot. You have to keep your eye out for it. A shady location but don't let that stop you. Once you enter the building you will be hooked.  There was A line to get to the order desk. This is always A good sign.  Be prepared to go here with an appetite. The food is a lot, the food is amazing and food is delicious. Get out of the strip to try this fabulous BBQ!

F-1kL0emsLKYVcyCZmXXKg.text: My go to BBQ place in Las Vegas. No one else in in this city even comes close. Everything on the menu is awesome. My personal favorite is the beef rib dinner. No one sells beef ribs. I get it pork is awesome but a brontosaurus size beef rib is so much better. They get very busy especially at lunchtime so be prepared to wait. Totally worth it though!

OnVG7gwfmozRe41r4C_yug.text: Definitely worthy of their many awards. We came by on saturday night and got the 3 meats combo, 1 side of corn bread, 1 side of bacon potato salad and 1 side of corn nuggets. Total came out to be $35.  We got Ribs (2 pieces), tri-tip and pulled pork. Everything was fantastic. The Ribs had a nice layer of smoked on. Tri Tip was nice and tender and the pull pork wasn't drenched in sauce.   Inside seating was hard to come by but we didn't realize there was outside seating until we left the restaurant.   I would definitely check this place out again for the AYCE option.

eDYoHg8k1NfzWN9ifR71cw.text: This place is to die for. First place we went to once we arrived into Vegas. Best decision ever. This is off the strip so parking isn't that crazy. If there's no parking in the front there's street parking also.   Ordered the Outlaw Burger and spudtastic  with chopped brisket. The outlaw burger is huge! Come in with an appetite for this one and has a side of Mac and cheese... So cheesy and saucy. Now that's what I call Mac and cheese!! I wish I ordered just that because that's how fucking good it was. The Spudtastic lived up to its expectations from Yelp reviews. It's like a baked potato on steroids. DELICIOUS. Portions are generous so be prepared!  Next time I'm in Vegas I am going back. Oh man I'm getting hungry thinking about it. This place is a go-to!!

Yj4N6GvliXq4aV1SVE_lAw.text: Nothing much to say but holy cow. This place is good. I will stop eating meat for a year just to eat here again hahah. Amazing bbq. Quick tip I would do all you can eat. The portions already are huge. I did 2 ends and the 2nd round I was sooo full already.

ivPwQHV8c9FuzmF0hbWz4g.text: Met my family there for our brother's bday on his recommendation. It's on highland near a exotic museum and strip clubs. But its a nice place in a small strip mall with other businesses. The other customers and owners were friendly.  Lots of interesting deco on the walls. The real boar's head scared me! The aquarium is original and everybody kept trying to open it. When you see it you'll understand. The food was delicious and I will be back! I had catfish with greens and hushpuppies. An employee came and asked how I liked it. They checked on us a few times. Appreciate that! I bought 3 dinners for $52. Fair for food n service n atmosphere.

DPFhftYYrt4oI-ReKbk3sA.text: I used to love this place. Portions were large and prices reasonable. Went there this eve and was highly disappointed in portion size for the price. Food was still very good. Don't know if they are under new ownership or if they are just trying to increase their margins but I really don't think I will be going back anytime soon. There are plenty of good BBQ places in Vegas that serve bigger portions for the same price.

JQUHn5E-TwtPD3lD4pS3Ng.text: I stopped by here last night as I have been meaning to do so for a while.  The place was loaded with people.  The servers were friendly, the food was good, and it wasn't hard to find.    I came a bit after 6 and it was loaded.  Almost every seat at every picnic table was taken, and it is not a huge place.  There was a line of maybe 7 people in front of me.  I was going to get the all you can eat option, but decided to go was in my best interests since it was so packed.    I had the corn nuggets which were great and the club sandwich which was comprised of many different kinds of meat- perfect for me as I was trying to decide which one I wanted.  The sandwich was pretty good, the bacon in the sandwich made it awesome.    The only reason I give it 4 instead of 5 stars is because I rarely have bbq here in Vegas, and I have no idea if it is the best.  It was a little pricey and the wait was a little long. The food was good though, and some day I'll be back.

Xzq_0SMkeC6ZTZMfLJgwGA.text: I'm literally typing this review as my boyfriend and I pull out of the restaurant.   I wish I could give this place a million stars if I could. My boyfriend and I went in to visit this place with high expectations and it did not disappoint. Cashier girl Lizelle was super sweet and a delight to order from! We ordered the 3 rib platter and the pulled pork sandwich. They have variety of sauces to pick from and really cool cups for your soda.  Chef Will brought out our food for us and it was like heaven! I personally just started eating meat again but the ribs were like nothing I ever had before. My boyfriend being a huge carnivore even agreed!   As we were almost finished eating (not even able to finish half way because it's super filling and huge portions) Chef Will came out to let us try some burnt ends with his special hot sauce! The hot sauce isn't on the counter and he has it in the back. We were so delighted at how sweet and generous he was! Being a flight attendant and food enthusiast I've ate at so many food places but this place is by far one of my favorite places to eat.   It's a must try if your in the area and even if your not I would make the drive here because this place is special. We will definitely be making our way back as much as we can!   Ps. Also this place is has been on TV, magazines and winning multiple awards. Now you have to go try it !!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt ends will literally melt into your mouth

6t8iYlMzIQaEqBZTc-ff9g.text: I am a huge fan of BBQ. Real BBQ, not the garbage you get from chain restaurants.  When my wife asked co workers who have been long time Vegas residents where to get the good BBQ, this was the place frequently mentioned.  Recently we tried this place out, and my brother and nephew went as well.  Everyone was very full and very satisfied when we left.  To find this place is by word of mouth, or you'll have to google it, because it sits a bit behind the Vegas strip in a more industrial area and chances are you would not happen upon it by mistake.  As soon as you drive up, you get that smell. That smoked BBQ smell that makes your mouth instantly water.    The prices are a little up, but worth it for the food that you get. I personally ordered the three meat plate, which I chose to be the ribs, the pulled pork and the sausage.  My wife got the burnt ends for her meat.  All of it was crazy good.  Large portions, juicy meat and just totally full of flavor.  Be warned that while their food is not crazy spicy hot, there is a little kick to it.  The only thing I didn't find worth it was the side orders, I paid like four bucks for a side of coleslaw that was not life changing.   My nephew for the Outlaw Burger, which I'll load a picture off. This thing is every bit as big as it looks in the picture, and the hardest time he had was trying to figure out how to eat it.  He said he loved every bite of it, and has talked about coming back to Vegas from Cali to have another one.    Overall this is some of the best BBQ I've ever had and I liked the squeeze bottles of lots of different flavors of sauces they have all over. If you're in town, you gotta check this place out.

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My three meat plate.  The beans were amazing and the means were ribs, sausage and pulled pork.

Back in Vegas for the 2015 Olympia Pro Powerlifting Competition and I told my group, before we leave we are going to Rollin Smoke so we can eat & I can bring some Q home. This place seems to do everything right. While there, we had the ribs, meatloaf, burger, fries & mac n cheese. For my takeout I got some burnt ends, hotlinks and more meatloaf.  Disappointed in nothing. Amazed by everything.

dLqZ0yu_zvmhsNPgmLRMKg.text: I love when Yelp steers me in the right direction. I am not a BBQ connoisseur or really even a BBQ fan, but I had family in town and we wanted to try some place new.   It was a little difficult to find, but I had driven by Rollin Smoke while I was in the area on a previous occasion so knew generally where it was located. We had initially attempted to go to Peppermill, but the wait was longer than we were willing to eat, so I made the executive decision to try Rollin Smoke. It's in a pretty inconspicuous location, so keep your eyes peeled.   The restaurant was much larger and nicer looking than I had expected. Roomy, with plenty of seating, even booths which I always prefer, and very clean. You order at the podium and they bring your food out to you. Since there was a free dessert with Yelp check-in offer, I took advantage of this and ordered the pulled piggy sandwich with jalapeno coleslaw and peach cobbler. Our food came out quickly and everything smelled and tasted great! The meat was pretty good. I'm no expert, but I enjoyed my pulled pork quite a bit. The coleslaw was spicy and tasted pretty good. The cobbler was great too, but I would ask for no whipped cream next time. My family all love their meals as well. Some of the sides were hit or miss, but some of our favorites were the corn nuggets and coleslaw. The mac n cheese was ok, but I'd have to order it again to see if I like it better next time.   Their menu is quite extensive and they have so many great options that I look forward to exploring on our next visit. Overall, the experience was great and if they were in a more convenient location I could see myself coming here much more often. They have an all you can eat option for $25. I don't think I could handle it, but it seems like a pretty good deal. They also have family packs available for large parties, which is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach cobbler. Free dessert with Yelp check-in.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot link sandwich
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spudtastic

WvDK9SpCU3HLUn0TrDEeoQ.text: Definitely deserve more than 5 stars, but thats the highest you can give on Yelp! If you are looking for the absolute best tasting BBQ and the best service in Las Vegas, look no further than Rollin Smoke Barbecue. We had a team event, so I contacted Karina, catering manager. Many of our employees eat their regularly and love the food. I was more than pleasantly surprised. We had brisket, burnt ends and hot links and it was FABULOUS! We had several orders through the day, and orders were ready, on time, fresh and hot. Portions so large we even were able to enjoy leftovers the next day! The meat was so tender, and Karina even provided large bottles of their sauces so everyone could add flavor as they chose. We will definitely be using their catering again and visiting for lunch! Thanks Karina and team at Rollin Smoke!

cH1AlMiDTWTCn1ib7N2ygA.text: It is close to impossible to find good BBQ, but after seeing the great reviews and mouthwatering pics of Rollin Smoke on Yelp, I had to come here while in vegas. Location is easy to get to, small lot to park in. Having read how full it gets we went shortly after opening at 11 am to find no lines and only a few people dining. By the time we left an hour later, no tables left, line out the door so plan accordingly.  They offer 10% off when you show the coupon on their website! We went with a burger and waffle fries kids meal for my son and he enjoyed it, great waffle fries! I had the 2 slider combo with baked beans and enjoyed both the brisket and the pulled pork. Their sauces are amazing, my favorite was the mama's sweet, so tasty, drowned the meats in there, a soft hawaiian bun, it was too tasty. My husband had the 3 brisket sampler and only enjoyed the chopped one, the sliced was very dry and the burnt ends just soggy fat, so glad I passed on getting just an order of burnt ends. My husband had the mac n cheese and said it was pretty artificial and the baked beans were also just ok. In all, fantastic BBQ, I'll be back for the pulled pork and chopped brisket and their best ever BBQ sauces!

My husband had the brisket and he wasn't so happy about it. He said it was a little dry. Sauces were great

I was able to try there burnt ends, mac and cheese, pulled pork, corn bread, chopped brisket, sweet tea, mashed potatoes, and sausage links. Everything I tried was satisfying. H-oHhUyH-PqEx46GxS8LsA.text: Well I finally got to try this place . I can tell you it's the best in Vegas hands down . It's not so called bbq (aka boiled and grilled) , this is really smoked and tasty bbq . The bark was delicious and the smoke ring was insane . I give this place 5 stars not only on the food, but the top notch service . I got a moment to talk bbq with Dusty, stand up guy and I can tell he has real love and passion for bbq. I would recommend the brisket 3 ways, it's a good eat alone but that sauce puts it on point . I'm in town around 10 times a year and this will be a place I visit every tine, 100% legit !!!

Vd3b6HxYvH9eJgw71o9yag.text: First off I forgot my server's name but she was great, she recommended the ribs which were awesome. Brisket and pulled pork were very good, both were tender and juicy. The different sauces were all very good too.

ZtGWCobesrhHBZOSVx1XVQ.text: Woke up today craving pork ribs and found this place. I love their menu and the food is delicious. Highly recommend!

8eq1Q9xeFfbWNm0grnBNaA.text: **Summary**        - AYCE - They have a $25 AYCE, anything on the menu deal. I'd suggest people doing this so you can try a little of everything.        - Authentic BBQ - Walking in, you can smell this place knows how to BBQ. They have smokers in the back. That's how you know they're the real deal.        - Hole in the Wall - The location is located on Highland Drive. Yep, it's the same seedy highland drive with all the strip joints. **Ordered**        - Pulled Pork - I've had a lot of pulled pork in my day, but nothing as tender and mouth watering as this. It's a must order.        - Brisket - Not like the dry briskets you'll get elsewhere. Their brisket is tender and flavorful.        - Beef Rib, Baby Back - Very meaty. Like I mean, TONS of meat on this bone. However, it's not really fall off the bone.        - Baby Back and Spare Ribs - The flavor of their rub and BBQ sauce is delicious, but the meat wasn't too tender.        - Catfish - Deep fried to perfection, but lacking in spices I'd say.        - Bacon Potato Salad - If you like potato salad, adding sweet sweet bacon to it is a no brainer.        - Corn Bread - Moist and hot out of the oven. You can't go wrong with corn bread.  **Recommendations**        - I'd recommend this place if you like BBQ. The brisket and pulled pork were my favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE Round 1: Beef Rib, Baby Back Rips, Brisket, Bacon Potato Salad, Loaded Mash, &amp; Corn Bread

UC02xWw9P3lWvT6wf7HMLA.text: Great bbq place. The chicken was excellent.  Not a great sit down place but the bbq overcomes everything.  A little pricey but worth it.
