z-fpBI0Pt42sW7Mwn4qTxQ.text: Our neighbor recommended this place and it's definitely the best BBQ YET in Vegas!    The food is excellent and portion is great!  Wish they would open one up in Henderson!

QiFJUQSmvSM1I2z8ZoUeHw.text: BARBEQUE LOVERS TAKE NOTE The ratings on this place did not exaggerate at all.  This barbeque is among the very best I have ever eaten.  Being from the South, I can distinguish True smoked meat from the posers.  Rollin Smoke Barbeque is barbeque at its finest.  The meat has an excellent smoked flavor and the sauce complements it perfectly. The dishes here are unique and do an excellent job highlighting masterful barbequing skills.  I had the Barbeque sundae and highly recommend it.  With layers of mashed potatoes, beans, pulled pork and slaw, it combines all the perfect sides with the 'que in one handy cup.  The side of baked beans iI had were equally up to the task with the just the right amount of sweetness with a nice spicy bite as well.    Well done Rollin Smoke--I will return.

6jDzcyXYg7gbXERFs5KbsQ.text: So Rollin' Smoke has been bookmarked for a good 6 months prior to our visit. Imagine the expectations that build up in 6 months; I already knew what I was going to have.  Pulled Pork Sandwich combo: I was pressured to get hush puppies, which were good for hush puppies (they have a little zing/spice to them from the jalapeno they mix in which made them better than average). As far as the pulled pork, it was some of the best I've had (although fattier than what I've had recently) however the bun it was served on left much to be desired. It was a hoagie type roll with sesame seeds, so the pork was trying to soak through the seem. Thankfully the sandwich didn't last long enough for me to make a huge mess of it.   Meat Duo: brisket and pulled pork. Jason said he's had better brisket, and prefers Memphis (cause he's a square!) but the pulled pork was good.   Check in dessert: Butterfinger Bread Pudding: it was tasty, good texture for a bread pudding- I would probably order a regular bread pudding if they were on special when we come back.  We both really liked the sauces they offer on the table (we tried the spicy and sweet sauces) and the service was friendly. They were definitely happy to have gained our business and made sure we really enjoyed our food.   We'll be back.

mD7xYm7Q8YBZJfIUxkuKHA.text: Best meal we had in Vegas.  Wish we had this back home.  Loved, loved, loved every bite.  Don't let location scare you away.  Police officers were eating there when we left.

eA6T3LnKBur5R6IgZg8uCA.text: Let me tell you, this is not the typical place I take my clients to to celebrate closing on a house but the food is AMAZING and you can't beat it. So glad I found such great Barbeque!

bmND8AxT-SAdUrTdbjiRWw.text: My go-to when I'm in Vegas! Rollin Smoke never disappoints. From the great customer service on down to the most amazing finger licking ribs your mouth has ever consumed. I recommend the brisket with the burnt ends. Thank me later

8EIB6oC3oyS280RZ1gduvA.text: Awesome food! Best bbq I've had in a long time. Highly recommend if you are in Vegas.

nAQJNyz8ZXmOjvIMMA05cA.text: At best, mediocre. I'm not sure of the hype but I was disappointed!! Walking into the place, it seemed promising. It was packed; we had to share a table with another family. The staff was very accommodating and the menu was loaded with bbq delights however the food was lacking. I ordered the brisket beef hotdog and the wife had the bbq chicken sandwich. Both lacked favor and were over priced (imo). I wouldn't go back.

ao2JjSVR8TMAXGoztNVAVw.text: i love rollin smoke.  the rib tips are amazing  my family love the yams,fries,rib tips,and the meatloaf  my mom loves the meatloaf so much. it was really good . the place is really cool. it is covered with arkansas things. it is so creative and good.

boC9K3UO0UJXrOYntK-rTw.text: This place is really good for BBQ food, they also have all kinds of bbq sauce, I tried it out for the 1st time. I really like Beef Brisket, but from what I saw on the menu it looks like the don't have any ? There peach cobbler is amazing! Highly recommend that for sure. But other then that I give this place a 4 stars! Good job!

qtSr3yhGhYXe0VN3rDR9Gg.text: Best place to go in Vegas. Wow it was worth the drive away from the strip. Would highly reccomend you visit. Try the brisket and pulled pork.

E8_4BaTWUL0k1WOnuCzbQQ.text: Fast. Great service. My food didn't seem like anything special. But it was good. Prob would go back

aFsmQPSDHRxXxrxw1hHS-g.text: Just wanted some bbq. Heard about Rollin Smoke Barbeque and decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed. Everything was delicious...rib tips, bbq chicken, ribs, cornbread, greens, potato salad, macaroni and cheese...The lady at the counter was very pleasant and the staff was attentive.  It did not take long for our order to arrive. Will definitely go back, because there were lots of choices that we didn't get to try the first time!

mWfwvmX-8xGkPqbllCm6Bw.text: Our St. Louis ribs were fatty, but had great flavor.  The baby back ribs were very lean and almost tasted like pork loin.  We needed to hit it with a lot of sauce, otherwise they were too dry.  Speaking of the sauce, it was pretty decent, but it's a little spicy for my taste.  I think they should offer a regular in addition to the spicy sauce.  The pulled pork was average at best and was more like chunky pork.  The texture and flavor profile wasn't quite right.  The brisket was fairly bland as well.  Either they had an off night, or their meat supplier let them down.  The service and staff really delivered, however.  They were friendly and helpful.  I had much higher hopes for their BBQ based on the reviews.  Their pie and ice cream rocked.  Overall, a bit of a bummer.  I had hoped for 5 star grub.

UT0XeR1ChuBZunTbiU4xvQ.text: I liked this place overall. Hole in the wall but good. The ribs were so so so good. Barbq sauce was good. Mac n chez was my favorite almost taste like powdered cheese. Peach cobbler was OK. Cole slaw and fries were good

8OK0_NRSnx7P8rgoCw9z-A.text: If in Las Vegas it's a must to try Rollin Smoke. This place is awesome. Been here several times its always been good. Brisket is tender and pork rib tasty and plentiful, Mac n cheese, beans are great! Hope you enjoy it!

Wv_aIJpfyRx8shCC6rgqDg.text: Absolutely amazing! The pulled pork is mouth watering goodness. The brisket is de-lish and the HOT links are extremely hot and yummy. We will definitely be back!!! ****THE BEST BBQ IN VEGAS****

MXn08tBwrxQhQROfW_f0vg.text: Yummmmmmmmmmmmmy!!!!  Coming from the far NW part of town, this is a bit of a drive.. And the dining experience is certainly nothing special- some picnic tables and paper towels.  But the food is amazing and keeps us coming back for more! Definitely a hidden gem in Vegas - great for locals, so shhhhh don't tell the tourists!! ;)

CMPlp9giVQmwqldD3Y8Wlw.text: Really good restaurant. Although the place was a bit empty for being 5 PM, the food was very fresh and well-prepared. I had the piggy wrap and it was very flavorful! I will definitely try one of their meat platters next time that I'm in.

K5hj8mVe4KTVXLr_soj9ZA.text: This place is great.  Its a hidden gem that is busy during lunch time, but worth the wait.  Trio combo is the best deal.  Everything is tasty, jalapeno slaw is delicious!  One recommendation is to not over cook the brisket!   Lately its been dry and chewy...not savory, tender, juicy, fatty, flavorful :(

97m8qHNMPaUltEDDvlkHYg.text: DE-LI-CIOUS!  I'm from the South and I've had a hard time finding GREAT BBQ and sides....no more....Rollin Smoke has great BBQ.    My husband and I had the last serving of the evening of the baked beans as they ran out.  This was by far the best baked beans I've had.  I also had the beef rib which was very tender; my husband delighted in the baby back ribs and goodness they were so good.  Thank you Rollin Smoke for great BBQ!

I1r8O3tsZEEVXrGqAVOf3g.text: The rib tip sandwich is brilliant.  The mac and cheese has just the right amount of kick.

_YvaTsSAFuSOB-OPjizMEQ.text: A bit hard to find, but worth the chase for sure! Great sides and links. Sold out of brisket that's gotta be a good sign.

s7-973NNjfmDkXCkVAPbfA.text: Have been here three times two of the three times my order has been messed up.  Tonight being one of the mess ups in my order I ordered half of slap of spare ribs only got four rids and what I did get was all dried out like eating the bottom of my shoe.  Will go else where next time.

ZoPb7RBZ6ZdrXigqtel73g.text: These guys are from Arkansas and boy do the know their BBQ. You just don't find BBQ like this in this town! Loved the baked beans. Will defiantly be back. I have eaten here many times, and had them cater a party. I love their ribs. I don't know where they find ribs with so much meat on the bones but they are fantastic.

l6sI3PZXZKMHaF-G4FHgWw.text: Best spare ribs I've ever had.  Same for the beans.  The brisket and cornbread were darned good, too.  You can tell the meat is done right, rubbed with spices and cooked low and slow for many hours in a hardwood smoker, not just brushed with liquid smoke and baked in an oven. Chef Tim promised a special sample of the pulled pork next time.  Very friendly staff loves to talk about the food.

cTY7CPXyh_Halt32UNOqog.text: When in Vegas, I always come here from now on. These guys know how to do BBQ like it's nobody's business! It's some of the best food you will eat in all of Vegas and at 1/3 of the price of even fast food on the strip. $10 fills me up and i'm a big dude. Super nice people too. Off the strip and worth it!!!

NM7zRgukbIfkUWu-kAZZ7Q.text: It's always a good sign when you show up at a BBQ place and several smokers are fired up in the parking lot. I found this place on Yelp and wanted to try a new BBQ place on my business trip to Vegas. This place did the trick and then some.  Excellent, friendly service. Pulled pork, brisket and mac and cheese were all very good. Very tender meat with a smoke flavor that was just right -- not overpowering at all. Sauce was slightly vinegary and was definitely peppery, as someone else mentioned, but I like that. Next time, I want to try the hot links and ribs.  And don't skip the banana pudding.  There's plenty of time for the chains. This is the kind of place that I hope both locals and tourists would support.

OCh73YXGkjw-8HveHw8wWA.text: Decided to go back and give it another try. The food was good the first couple times I was there. I walked in about the same time this other fellow did and we stood there waiting for somebody to take our order. This young man came out brought some food for a table so I know he saw us, place is not that big. He went into the back and never came back out. We stood there for awhile and I left. Never and that's a log time will I return.

nFQizFSHtrTBV_uuFLgs4g.text: This was the best BBQ I have ever had! I grew up in the South and my family even owns a BBQ restaurant. The guys that run this place are super friendly and great hosts. I guess they moved to Vegas about a year ago from Arkansas and opened a BBQ joint. It is worth getting off the strip for quality non-chain restaurant food in a low key non-crowded area. Baby-back ribs and mac-n-cheese were bomb! I finished it off with a piece of sweet potato pie, not too sweet and not too big, just perfect.

LaoETYQHprMgc3eq3y-twA.text: Ok I am at Rollin Smoke right now and I can tell you for sure this is one of the best places for bbq in vegas! Oh my goodness its so good! Ordered the beef short ribs (not short at all, almost a lbs of meat), loaded mashed potatoes and mac & cheese. Every single dish is phenomenal and the ribs are something special. The meat literally falls off the bone and is incredibly tender. The bbq sauce is just spicy enough and has perfect flavor. Love the atmosphere, just off the strip a little joint not hard to find. Great place 100% recommended!!!

4XIhCU0r8GdfqN6XFc5SDw.text: Excellent! Can't say enough good stuff about this place. The BBQ sauce is incredible and the Brisket falls apart and is so moist. This is my new favorite place.

WdBH1CmdpcbAdUlQtqFVKw.text: The BEST Bar B Que place in Las Vegas, Hands down!! The meat was so tender and juicy. Pretty much perfect! This is Vegas NOT down SOUTH but this will def compare to some southern Bar B Ques. No I havent ate at 38 bar B Que places (Seeing as its horrible for you and good way to get huge) but out of the few I have in Vegas I will never go back to any except for this one. The Pulled pork was the best I have had in Years. DEFFFFF need to try this place.

kujrD9k1B8KM-DvM_Ttw4w.text: Just got in from visiting Texas so Hubbs and I decided to compare what we ate out there (Texas) to Rollin Smoke BBQ , here in Vegas. Mmmmm. Very good. Had the Duo plate and ordered an  extra side.. had the ribs, brisket greens and yams.. Delicious!!  The BBQ sauce was on the side , in a bottle and had fantastic flavor.. We will be back for sure!! Only thing is the yams were a little too sugary but everything else was delicious!  Buy a shirt while you are here. They are funny!!

kUuGtSGijyjmKrPMBBSJHA.text: Was looking for a burger, found this. This is a new must go-to place every time I return to Vegas.  I wanted to keep eating and come back again but we were heading out of town.  So super yum I can't even explain it.  Odd little space, but not important once you taste the food!  Really wish they had a place in the San Diego area.

yzmlLkDErNmWiz0vqjudrA.text: Sooooo, in Vegas again and decided to throw the dice on dinner.  We ended up at Rollin Smoke BBQ.  Not sure what to expect - but, I was feeling lucky.  Winner, winner!  Disclaimer, I don't eat pork.  So, I cannot speak on the goodness of the ribs and pulled pork.  But, what I can tell you is that the brisket (3 ways) was delicious.  My favorite of the three was the burnt ends.  The right amount of flavor and char.  FYI, they have an all you can eat option for a very resoanable price.  That affords the curious grubber a variety of options.  With that, I also tried the smoked chicken, shrimp, mac & cheese, fried okra, and corn nuggets.  My favorite of the sides: corn nuggets.  All the rest were meh.  Admittedly, I'm  a mac & cheese snob...so, it barely stood a chance.  Lastly the desserts...both the banana pudding and peach cobbler left me underwhelned.  At this point you may be wondering why 4 STARS?  The BBQ was excellent.  The service was outstanding. Lizelle welcomed us to the establishment and helped us to make the hard decision of what to get...  Overall, I would definitely come back.  I also recommend you check them out...

gMtE_PfejCieQTpFR-Qpmw.text: It is dawn good for sure!!!! Good service too!!!! They need multiple locations so more people can enjoy. recommended 5 stars.

xu-VeC5m0oTS1Z9v2JsIzQ.text: Their food was delicious, their staff was fun and personable, the wait was reasonable. The only negative things I have to say is that they seem to have a cramped place of business and they seem to cater to families which means someone like me who finds children irritating would find the atmosphere a little lacking.

HHIm0veO6FI670avT967lw.text: the service & Amazing delicious food is finger licking good!  Thank you for a  wonderful experience. this is what real BBQ food is about. Totally a 5 star review :-)

Gi9fgc2b20yH021n_ssKfw.text: Had the 1/2 rack baby backs. Great flavor and tender meat. There BBQ sauce is a winner. The yams has candied pecans as a topping. Nice touch. This place doesn't have the best location but who cares when the food is this GOOD!

Hnvgm1V-llb3SGXEnjvSng.text: Worst bbq I have ever had. The meat was tough, fatty, and their rub was bland as hell! The only reason I gave them 2 stars instead of 1 was because the mac n cheese I got was fairly decent

YKkBxmKM4Z-e-_xP_yPIuA.text: Purpose of visit: looking for an early lunch after a heavy night of drinking. We received a great recommendation from a family visiting from Hawaii. They had already eaten there twice going there right when they open at 10am. We decided to check it out since they raved about the place. We ordered the sandwich platter and some ribs. Owner made an exception and gave us 1/2 brisket and 1/2 pulled pork. Homemeade BBQ sauce was sweet and tangy, the brisket was moist and very tender. Tasted great with some coleslaw on a pun. Pulled pork was a little dry but tasted fine. The ribs melted off the bone and were extremely flavorful. Perfect place to get some local food at a very good price. Owner was very nice and made sure our experience was good. Definitely a repeat place.

BvKJEADR9Fwa28211_CLAw.text: Best BBQ in Vegas. All of the choices are very good. My favorites are the ribs and brisket. I also love the location. I hope they put more tables outside when it warms up. I gave 4 stars because the sides are much too small. I would rather them up-charge and give you a lot more. You think large when you think BBQ.

3OyqWeog2zZ0IKrMn-RPQg.text: First time in Vegas, but didn't want to eat at typical local tourist-y spots. When I search for food in new locations, I usually search for Mom and Pop shops. This is THE Mom and Pop shop to dine at. The quality was amazing. The succulent beef ribs were cooked to perfection. My only regret was not ordering the buffet option and only being able to visit once. If I ever step foot in Vegas again, this is the spot I'll return to; and not just a single visit either. My suggestion is to with a group, order the buffet, and try everything on the damn menu!

cyelZCxEUKnd-_upXhabhg.text: Not bad, but the wait was fairly long, given the number of people in the restaurant. The brisket simply didn't have the delicious fat cap and smokiness that I associate with the better briskets I've had (see Blue Smoke in NY). That being said, the place was packed at lunch, so they must be doing something right. The barbecue sauce had a nice tang to it, and the caramel cake was a little on the sweet side but still tasty.

yP9cC3Um-iElxugtD7ckmg.text: Made the mistake of showing up right before closing.  Ordered the trio.  The chicken was like beef jerky and dry, I guess from sitting all day.  The brisket was good and the ribs were pretty good.  I drove a long ways to get there and when I got home there was no sauce on the meat.  My friends were pretty let down by that.  Made a special trip to get there which I won't do again.  The best BBQ in Las Vegas?  Not even close.

7MXScgDQe3zTmocrvShzlw.text: Came for the famed Outlaw Burger. Hoped that it would remind me of some burgers from restaurants I grew up with which are now long lost. It didn't.  Food was OK. Service was quite nice. In the end, probably won't be back.

2_bqd1U5iP5d5V-ILmnH-g.text: Good bbq brisket and chicken. The wings were a little disappointing. Good service. Good value.

Pn8kN7E8ricTfP0-RhSTHw.text: OMG...the BBQ sauce is sweet and spicy at the same time but definitely ask for extra. The cup they give you just isn't enough. The banana pudding is homemade and to die for. Go hungry and expect to leave satisfied.

4iobae3BMSNYlpp8PZ1MKw.text: it was my first time here, and everything  was so delicious.  mitchell at the register gave me a military discount,  since i was wearing a veteran tshirt,  and thanked me for my service.  very top knotch. i had the briskey,ribs,amazing corn nuggets,  and a burnt ends. i will be back and will recommend  this place to all my friends.

FLedEGM33cvr6JWyk_hNMA.text: Rollin Smoke Barbeque should definitely be grateful that their food is so damn good. My first experience was great. I had their Outlaw Burger which was delicious! It's definitely one of the best burgers that I've had.   My second visit was crappy. I ordered take out late at night. My fiance was craving sweet tea so I made sure to order that first. No problem the lady said. The sweet tea actually comes with the meals that we placed free of charge. I go to pick up my food and she hands me two cups. I go to pour myself the sweet tea to go but it's empty. I go up to the counter to let the employee know. She apologizes and tells me that she'll get a new one out. I'm waiting for a good 10 minutes, maybe not realizing that it's been 10 minutes because I was on my phone. A male employee walks out from the back and starts cleaning up. I politely ask him if he knows that status of my sweet tea and I inform him that the previous employee said that she would have it brought out. Well apparently, she is now off her shift and he knows nothing about it. He tells me that unfortunately, they're out of sugar and so there's no sweet tea at all until they get a shipment.   Ummm. Seriously? I realize that I'm the last customer there but they were a good hour away from their posted closing time. He apologizes for the inconvenience when in reality, he should have apologized for making up a piss poor lie and telling it to my face.  It's hard to believe that a establishment with that type of food would be out of sugar for it's sweet tea. I actually called the next day and lo and behold they did have sweet tea available. Hmmmm.  Again, they should be grateful that they're food is good.

pcS-M2aBPoxIb-tmikYYfQ.text: Never disappointed. Always awesome food. From the Outlaw Burger to Spudtastic, it's great BBQ.  The brisket is moist, not wet like some places serve it.  They found the right balance of smoke and the meat's flavor.  Plus they offer solid sides and desserts.  If you are a BBQ enthusiast or a casual diner, Rollin Smoke is tops in Vegas.  Take the time to seek it out.

NIB6Oopr2sCFCWJ3PQicrA.text: Do not miss the beef rib, probably the best I've ever tasted.  The brisket may be too lean for some, for me it was perfect.  The only thing I'd steer away from: the spare ribs, go for the baby back instead if you must have ribs.  As everyone else says, the portions are enormous.  By far the best you'll find in this town.  And would measure up pretty good anywhere.  Go here by all means!

OmG_IIeox24V8lyHFx9phQ.text: As soon as you get within a few feet of the building you can just smell it's going to be good. It's a very particular thing - the smoke house style, and this place does it so well. The chicken is deeply penetrated with flavour, but nothing comes close to the brisket. The sandwiches and sliders aren't dressed up, those sweet buns capture every drop of moisture (and believe me, you won't want to waste it). They also come dressed with simplicity; signature sauce and pickles, of course, the star attraction is the meat, and it is epic. Id also recommend trying those cross crossed fries - absolutely loaded with flavour, and the perfect thing to scoop up any escaped meat!

ogBu0zh-Cix4R-DxVMtiJA.text: The service and food was fantastic. I had the duo of brisket and hot link with coleslaw which was delicious! Great tasty BBQ!

x4ekJyi_cqHfaTY1QxDGZw.text: I had been meaning to try Rollin' Smoke for some time and so my husband and I checked it out recently for lunch. As soon as you pull into the parking lot, you can smell the meat and it makes you drool. We decided to share a pulled pork sandwich and the rib platter special that includes baby back ribs, spare ribs and beef rib. We thought the pulled pork sandwich was ok, but honestly it's an unusual pick for us, we both think they need veggies to lighten the sandwich up. But the rib platter was f'ing amazing. HOLY CRAP. This is some quality meat here folks. The meat isn't dripping in sauce so the flavors of the meat shine through. And holy cow, the beef rib is incredible. I had never tried it before but it is literally fall off the bone delicious.   You must check this place out!

A5F0kI233oWY78wx-q89Ow.text: Brought my coworkers here. Some of the best BBQ I've had. Make sure you get the fried onion strings as a side. Sooooo crispy and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The outlaw!!!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The trio!

cSjPlJNp-xb7lr_pmEVF9Q.text: I have never actually been to the restaurant but I had their food at a get together. The ribs were incredibly tender, juicy, and delicious! The beans were awesome and I wanted more but there was no more to be had. We will have to get to the restaurant one day so that we can sample more of their menu items!

LLzeQW2OH46y_5fwNthHrg.text: All sides and meats were amazing with great smoke flavor. If I lived here I would probably eat here once a week maybe twice a week. Highly recommended.

GcwwdJZCmt7WrImdXb1UnA.text: Rollin Smoke BBQ is awesome. Found this place on a Yelp search in Vegas where we were just looking for good BBQ. Great menu, food came out quick, prices reasonable. Love the picnic tables out front & the old throw back setting. Totally dig that it's located under a freeway exit off the beaten path. Keep Rollin !!

dHoLw4pYAAu4J9zjjUcoVw.text: As you enter, the pungent odor of the BBQ smoke greets your nose. Most of the customers seem to be local regulars who come for takeout. A few simple booths and a small dining room, walk up ordering, not fancy in the least but great BBQ. We had the sample platter for 4 plus a rack of St. Louis Ribs, sides of hushpuppies fried okra and greens. The okra was our favorite. The ribs were great, as was the pulled pork. The chicken was good but not outstanding. Give it a try for a totally off the strip authentic experience.

HMMlmnNAMECCueLK0HU4-A.text: I would give it 5 stars but I went back a second time and it wasn't as good as the first but still good the best brisket I ever had the brisket dog was delicious meatloaf good sides were just ok but the star here is a brisket they have an all-you-can-eat from anything on the menu 34.99 what a bargain

rbzQ2RY4Rs0LxAnElRs79w.text: FIRE FIRE FIRE !! Bomb food!! The people working here are so nice they go around and ask if you enjoyed the food. Great atmosphere. Way better than any BBQ in Vegas!!

p1DOXKTAaKk4XpAc3Kq_wg.text: Tonight we visited the Rolling Smoke BBQ on Las Vegas Blvd.. This food was AMAZING! Tried the pulled pork and brisket. Both were full of flavor, tender and juicy.  The BBQ sauce was also delicious! The mac & cheese was a little different, Cajun or spicy - not sure, but so cheesy and good! The bacon potato salad was a highlight of the meal - we loved every last bite! Also, the corn bread was some of the best I have ever had! The staff was very friendly and hospitable. Also, the place looked very clean and well kept! If you love BBQ this is a must go to in Vegas! Look forward to eating here again!

9gQB-ZDaWy5Tdb6ZuXH3vA.text: Wow! This hole in the wall BBQ place in Las Vegas Behind the strip was amazing!  The food and the ribs were excellent! And the staff were super nice and helpful.   There are no frills here, your eating on a picnic table with your hands and as you look around you see everyone totally enjoying their meal.  Values was excellent and I will be back before my plane takes off tomorrow!   Defiantly worth the trip here!

lCRa0c_-ikO4nAZ6p64I4w.text: Holly smokes!! Now that there is some good BBQ. We had the $28 meal that feeds 2 and it was well worth it. My brother lives in North Vegas and he never heard of it before. He said best BBQ in Vegas. Even the employee came to our table and ask if we liked the food. Must try!

_EjKFC4kuz89uU1NJyjAmw.text: Awesome little atmosphere... Food is legit! Small place away from the strip and it almost makes you forget you are in vegas...

7l8m-kpe1P2lPeQjtj3UvA.text: Best BBQ!!! Must go!!! They have all you can eat BBQ. And it's not crappy buffet style.  It's made to order every single time!!! Definitely great to come with friends and family!!   Ordered the beef rib and the meat is falling off the bone. Short ribs too. And their seafood is delicious.

EPCbNIuvZ6C1HCwHFAWRow.text: gotta try the rubs..no fat all meat..hands down the best in vegas! go and check it out!

XeYEc6yexDdqmek8MwRwPQ.text: This is, by far, the best BBQ in Las Vegas.  Here's why: THE BUSINESS MODEL!!!  -great BBQ, including catfish and beef ribs and banana pudding and BBQ nacho fries; choices you don't find at many other BBQ places. -a family of charming characters who treat everyone like they were their best friend. -a menu that overcomes the "combination" curse.  What's that, you say?  A combination curse is a combination plate that isn't exactly what you want, but you order it anyway, because you have no other choice. At RSB, they overcome this curse because all elements of the BBQ universe are available "a la carte".  For example, I didn't want a brain-dead combination with a "carb" side and drink...I wanted nothing but protein. So I ordered, a la carte, a beef rib (gigantic!), a piece of white chicken and a piece of catfish. I dare you to find that "combination" at any other BBQ place in town.  It was sensational!  Oh and I almost forgot, one of the best burgers in town (next to Fat Choy) aptly named the "Outlaw Burger".  You eat The Outlaw Burger, and when you go outside, your car has magically morphed into a tricked-out Harley!!  If you're a local, you're crazy to go anywhere else. If you're a visitor, it's half a mile from the strip, just down the road from the Trump Tower.  Side note:  They should do a reality show at Rollin' Smoke.  If Pawn Stars, and Duck Dynasty, can be successful cable shows, a show set at this place can be blindingly, staggeringly successful!  Kind of a combination between the Diner shows and the Down-Home shows. More pleasure; more heart.

7ZvM0zPLT_woy6_JI1HXEw.text: BEST BBQ in Vegas!!! Everytime we have come to Vegas we make it a point to come to Rolling Smoke! Brisket is always on point, ribs are tender and fall off the bone! Collard greens, and yams on the side are the best! Cornbread is moist and fluffy. Sweet tea is perfect! Service and staff is amazing!! Definately a restaurant you want to visit!

fOC4_3rTshCKKdMlPBw6hA.text: All You Can Eat !! That's where it's at! Delicious food- and the best part is if you don't like it- you can just order some other tasty treat on the menu! The staff is the friendliest in Vegas for sure! Any member of their team will help you out at any moment! The place was packed! 5 stars guys! Keep up the great work!

AjN7orWGTvBGGfLm1iwPVg.text: There are a few times in life when I get a great bbq sandwich . It won't be at this place. Hipsters , if you are going to pay $9.00 for a pork bbq sandwich you need your head examined.  I'll just wait until I'm in Arkansas and pay $4.00 for a truly delicious bbq sandwich. These people claim they are Arkys but they are actually Texans. They don't want any smart people to walk in. Hence the menu and outrageous prices posted on the front door. Shave your stupid beards, stop wanting what you can't get here, and get down to Arkansas.  You'll thank me later.

mtnkGxEhjOLeu36ScvVkRA.text: I am very picky when it comes to bbq outside of my family.  Not only was the BBQ on point (delicious), we had outstanding customer service.  The location is off the beaten path, but there was ample parking and easy to find using our navigation system.  I would consider this spot to be a step up from a whole in the wall kind of place, but it was clean and very good.  Don't take my word, try for yourself and I know you will be pleased.

LwrHJWnDUeEHyqTESfyY1Q.text: I had a Shrimp Poor Boy-it was pretty good but the 5 stars are for the Meat!!!  The sides that I tried were all good too.  We had a Potato Salad and Peach Cobbler.  We stopped in for lunch before going to the airport to fly to San Francisco.  The Meat was so good my husband and son decided to buy 2# of Burnt Ends and Some other kind of meat to hand carry to San Francisco to eat there.  I would definitely go back and have been recommending this place to everyone since we got home.

Uh_kd_Cut_C2ucMidI-znw.text: AMAZING!! I've lived in Las Vegas almost 10 years and just discovered this hidden gem. The food is delicious and the service is amazing. Definitely the only BBQ place to eat in my book!

wGZ-fu_cjoiy4ZFr8UwmSw.text: I'm a Southern girl, raised in TN. So, when I moved to Las Vegas, I just about gave up on finding anything near what we in the South call "BBQ." Other places claim to have BBQ (ahem, Famous Dave's) but they DO NOT. Rollin Smoke is heaven on a spit. They know what they are doing and they do it well. If you are super hungry and want something that will hit the spot, go to Rollin Smoke. These guys are from the Carolinas (sorry, can't remember if it's North or South, apologies), and they do BBQ well. I won't go into whether this is dry rubbed or not because if you are from Las Vegas, you won't even know what I'm talking about anyway. Just go there if you want great BBQ here. You'll love it.   Also, for those folks who complain about Rollin Smoke running out BBQ, I have to remind folks who don't know that real BBQ takes time. Lots of time. Smoking is a dedicated process, and if this restaurant runs out of meat, they run out of meat. They can't magically smoke more in 30 minutes or less. So, get there early so you can get what you want. My kids had the pork sandwich and it was huge and they ate it all. The bacon potato salad is heaven. My husband had the 3 meat Brisket Dog, and loved it. I had the Smoked Meatloaf, and I thought I'd died and gone to heaven. I had plenty of leftovers for my husband and I to share. We saw (and were frightened of) the Outlaw Burger, as it was easily a foot tall. So, again, please note: Bring Your Appetite.   This is a "get in line and order" place, with seating in three different rooms. We loved sitting in the room with the "Tanked" fish tank that used to be their original smoker.

6fYAd19TLyKEPe__GUMbZA.text: Delicious! First place we ate in Las vegas!! Wish I lived closer so I could eat here more often! I had the club wrap. Yummy!!

9kvPec-mQkUsAb6c93bthg.text: Best BBQ ever! I ordered the pulled pork sandwich, mac n cheese, and corn bread. I had to not eat the bread on the sandwich so I could make room for it all. It is amazing!  Definitely a must go to when visiting Vegas...

icetgF-5fDvMmqur6VhM0Q.text: Dined here during a Vegas trip in early May.   We chose to visit because of the good reviews. Shared 'The Pit Special', which was a 5-meat/3-side platter for $28.   Of the meats on the plate, we really enjoyed the spare ribs and the pulled pork.   For sides we chose the Chipotle Coleslaw, Yams, and Bacon Potato Salad.    Of those we enjoyed the Bacon Potato Salad the most.   The other items were all still tasty, but these meats and side were our favorites.   Greatly enjoyed taking our time eating this feast, and trying out the many different kinds of BBQ sauces offered.   I think they had at least six different sauces to slather on the meats.   My favorite was the mustard-based sauce.

huzqae6sqSEDI8Rie3y2Ww.text: Always on the look out for BBQ wherever we go. Saw these folks on tv this morning so here we are. Got the sliced beef po boy, with corn bread and sweet tea. This place is a cool little joint, seems like it would be a great place to come eat and watch the tv. Bbq is cooked well, black pepper crust, and sweet corn bread was amazing. Tea was good, and my whole family enjoyed it. Good place to eat and prices reasonable.

ZKLycEzBPfpzJq-tfRlzHA.text: Rolling Smoke is easily the best BBQ in Vegas! The "Biggin - Dad's Favorite" is the best BBQ sandwich I have ever had. Layers of flavor with hot link, then pulled pork, and then topped with amazing brisket. I slather on the homemade BBQ for an otherworldly eating experience. Get the baked beans, fried okra, and cornnugget sides for that authentic southern BBQ experience.  The family begs me to take them back almost every night - this place is worth the effort to find. AWESOME!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the rib and chicken platter - pure smokey deliciousness!!!

fG_35rglFhzib_klRHSW6w.text: I'm always surprised by what a little restaurant off the beaten path can offer and this place is amazing.  Everything was delicious and the people were very friendly. Definitely coming back.

tq7-tmFfk-edekXZ77hjKQ.text: Probably the best BBQ ive ever had. Savory flavor and just straight up delicious. Servers are very friendly and helpful and inviting. We will be back for sure. Would Highly recommend.

LjNWwJqMLdZeMWJR89rfSQ.text: I was in Vegas this weekend with my family and saw that Rollin Smoke BBQ was highly recommended on r/vegas/.   Upon entering for lunch, we saw that it was pretty busy, though we were only in line for about 5 minutes. We ordered the D's Delicious Sampler ($50) with Bacon Potato Salad and Loaded Mash for the sides.   The service was pretty good. The food came very quickly and we didn't wait long at all (maybe ~10 minutes, give or take a few). We ordered that party pack because it looked like it'd give us a good taste of what Rollin Smoke BBQ had to offer, and it didn't disappoint.   I can't say I'm a expert at eating BBQ (with only Lucille's and Phil's for comparison), but my family and I were very pleased with the St. Louis spare ribs. The meat was very tender and came right off the bone. The sauce, which we got on the sides, were pretty decent. Out of the possible 4, one of the best ones were the Sweet Country Girl and Mama's Sweet D-Licious; they weren't like your run-of-the-mill BBQ sauce. The Spicy sauce and the vinegar were mediocre, so we didn't get too much of those. The sides were very good too, though we never had the chance to finish them.  For a family of 4 (parents and two 18+ men), I was surprised that the $50 party pack filled all of us up, even to where we couldn't finish the sides. And I daresay we had quite an appetite already.   If you're visiting Vegas and you haven't come here, I recommend coming at least once to see what it has to offer!

ixpEpv2Pz7FpjFl1nnSvOA.text: I read about this place in the LV weekly, and after all the rave they gave them, I decided to try it for myself. I've visited rolling smoke a total of three times, and every time I try something different that was just as good, if not better than the last item.  First a warning, as soon as you walk into this place, you will experience an instant uncontrollable flow of saliva. The smell is just AMAZING! Now that you've been warned, lets begin with the menu. My absolute favorite is the rib plate and the brisket. The ribs are tender, full of flavor and just come off the bone with ease. The brisket is equally as delicious, with a good variety of BBQ sauces to complement the already great smoked flavor.   A few tips: The place to me seems a little hidden, so GPS it for easy directions. You WILL come out smelling like smoke. The staff is helpful, so if you are unsure of what to get, just ask for their recommendations.   Bon appetit!

R1T6KLZP1geJ6KMVg7HajA.text: Well from being raised in the south and going to school in Texas I like to think I know a little bit about good BBQ. This place in my opinion has the best BBQ in Vegas! Everything about it reminds me of a down home southern BBQ spot! I usually get the pulled pork sandwich aka the "Pulled Piggy" and every time I get it it's amazing and constant! If your in the mood for some good down home southern BBQ come check this place out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Pulled Piggy&#34; and Mac &amp; Cheese!!

F09Ke0rhBzE2yU098i_foQ.text: "DEATH ROW LAST MEAL" , Had "The Pit Special" 5 meat 3 sides to go. Was watching "Green Mile" while enjoying this AWESOME BBQ meal! I was thinking if ever I was on death row( not that I would be) , this would be my request for my last meal!!! With the Blueberry cobbler ala mode for dessert. But would also need white rice , you know , being the staple dish for Asians. Everything meat is 'qued to perfection. Like John Coffey would say, " the sauce is the boss, Boss." After finishing the meal..." I'm tired, Boss. Dog Tired."   Spare Ribs- Fall off the bone tender. Brisket- juicy. Pulled Pork- chopped to perfection. Chicken- tasty, skin and all. Hot Link- just the right amount of spice. The blueberry cobbler- "Heaven , I'm in Heaven..." The sides, bbq beans- great white rice topper! Corn Nuggets- should have ordered double. Mac & cheese- cheesy and Deeelish!!!   Once a year I just might have to do the All-you-can-Eat for $35 but wouldn't eat for 3 days before going and just drink water. I must agree with all the reviews here... Best BBQ in Las Vegas and the surrounding communities. The Outlaw Burger will be next on my bucket list for lunch. With waffle fries!!!

QnTH6u6W-oJqgSnPOR5cvw.text: Can't say enough how good this food was. I am a native Texan that knows bbq and since I've been in Las Vegas I have been disappointed at bbq locations. This is good! It reminds me of Texas!!!! The people were friendly and outgoing, they came around multiple times to see if we were ok. My girlfriend and I tried this place and took my future in-laws and friends (many of us from Texas) and they loved it too!

r6bnaxAGt44ZD-BntxTySg.text: The drive alone to this joint is fun. A lot of scenery but you if are not paying attention, you will drive right by this place while looking at all of the craziness that is Las Vegas (hookers, cracktivity and strip clubs). Great smokey flavor on the food. The brisket, ribs and chicken are all very good. I honestly believe this is the best BBQ joint in Vegas. My opinion and I'm usually right, once again, my opinion. Customer service is great and food comes out fast. This place stays busy and has outdoor seating. There is always a line to order but the line moves fast.

xyqkLEAUznP6a1jsv-P0tQ.text: Just got the pit special which is a variety of meats. The BBQ is really spectacular. They updated the inside entrance area and it looks so much better. Saw the picture of the BBQ nacho fries and had to try. Was a giant mound of meat, gooey cheese, sour cream, beans, and waffle fries. The entire thing must have weighed 2 pounds. It was quantity over quality because it so lacked flavor. I got half way through and stopped because I was bored.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf meal.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boar statue.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn nuggets.

coM-eMswbaLLgOjvLkvEkw.text: First time here today for lunch and was thrilled to smell the smoke when we got out of our car heading into the restaurant. I ordered the trio with pulled pork,brisket, and chicken with sides of potato salad and Mac and cheese. Hubby had the pit master plate with the same meats but also had ribs. He ordered the coleslaw and hush puppies.  We both agreed the pork was our favorite. Very tender and a little fatty but that just enhances the flavor.   My favorite side was the potato salad. Creamy and flecked with bits of bacon and green onion. Very tasty. Coleslaw was good too. Hushpuppies were very good also with bits of onion inside. The corn bread was sweet and super delicious!  The service was fast and our cashier/food server was friendly.  Will go back and try the baby back ribs next time.

e6e2_6fPVHDfxxoz9_HzRA.text: Totally in love with the Spud-Tastic. A meal for days!  Yummy flavor and meat is perfectly cooked

SLSM9CpCvp_KAPxGGDQOnw.text: Excellent BBQ - We were a party of four and everyone was very pleased with their meal. The only thing that would make this BBQ better is to be able wash it down with a beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fsqz64Us24t8MYH8emaYtA.text: After an extensive search for a BBQ place on here. I decided to go with Rolling Smoke. I was NOT disappointed.  This place is the shit. Straight up good BBQ. Great staff. A no frills setting with bench and park bench seating. Wasn't too hard to find either. The menu offered some great choices.  I went with the half rack baby back ribs, beans and cole slaw. Man the Kicken beans was kicken. So tasty. The cole slaw didn't appeal to me too much. My wife loved it.  The ribs were very tender and tasty.  Adding their BBQ sauce only made it better. We also ordered corn bread. Omg that was da bomb. Buttery and soft. I really can't say enough abt this place. My only regret is that I don't live in Vegas. But hey it's a great reason to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby backs, kicken beans and cole slaw.

s54CqMQnNOdJXrj4AHqFYw.text: Yum! I'm definitely not a BBQ fan, so I'm really glad they have other stuff too. I got the shrimp plate, which comes with hush puppies and a side (ordered the mac & cheese). BF got a 1/2lb of pulled pork and 8oz (smallest side size) of waffle fries. YUM YUM. Everything was really yummy. The pulled pork also comes with toast, too. Our table also ordered the nachos (no longer on the menu, but they still made it for us!) and those were HUGE. Tasty, but I was more than happy with just our own items!  Yummy food, excellent service. Great choice for an off the Strip meal.

kC-Nf72D_MnQuPPZkAluzw.text: I'm so glad I finally gave Rollin Smoke a try and that I didn't go here by myself as I would've driven away. The location isn't that great. It's close to a strip club, adult stores, etc. Tits and BBQ - this is a man's restaurant. The BBQ aroma fills the air inside the restaurant and sticks to your hair and clothes (had to shampoo my hair twice).  The food was amazing!  I'm not the biggest fan of ribs so, for me to like this place is a major deal. We had a meat Trio: brisket, pork and ribs with waffle fries and Mac n cheese. I liked everything we got. The meats were tender, juicy and smokey. I poured some house BBQ sauce on the meats for more flavor. The waffle fries were very crispy and I wanted to order more. The Mac n cheese has a smokey taste to it as well but was runny...still damn good though. The chicken sandwich and a black berry cobbler were ok.  This is not a fast-food restaurant so, expect to wait about 20 minutes or more to get your food. It's worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Pudding
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach Cobbler a la Mode (with Blue Bell ice cream)
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio Sliders (pulled pork and brisket) and Waffle Fries

Jd_t5fMnts1bu-xUblw8bg.text: Great BBQ off the strip. Shared a sampler platter between two people (about 50 bucks, which was meant to feed about 2-4 people). The food was delicious and pretty well made. I, personally didn't enjoy all the sauces they offered, but my partner in crime raves about them. In addition to the good food they offer, their staff are very helpful and friendly. If you eat-in, they may even bring your food to you, which is not something I expect from a BBQ place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2ME2bHuSHN310EnuW61cJw.text: I'm usually just medium on bbq, but I thought Rollin' Smoke was awesome. We split the 5-meat sampler and the meatloaf and everything was really good. But I mostly looooovved the meatloaf! And the fried corn fritter things. Man, those are so good. This was a ton of food. 2 adults and 2 kids ate that night and had leftovers for all of us for another night.  I can't say much else that other reviewers haven't mentioned. It's worth a trip, whether local or tourist.

kYwpH530FQHhxRHlZUtF1w.text: Ate here with family who live in Vegas. This is their favorite go to for BBQ. My goodness this is by far the best BBQ I have ever eaten. I chose the "Duo" and for a side had the loaded mashed potatoes......Yummy! Hubby and I will definitely return when we come back. He enjoyed his meal as well. Nothing bad to say about Rollin Smoke!

5GzMNoIfJ2ve5Vdb0wXaUg.text: Danny set the tone at the counter. This shop is a well oiled machine that has the good stuff. The Mac and cheese was my son's favorite. Got a little more to take home on the way out. I went with the meat trio. Ribs, chicken and hot link. Hot link wasn't very hot and wish I had ordered more pork. Now the chicken...oh yes. As lip smacking good as the ribs were it was the chicken that stole the show for me. I should have opted for all you can eat deal. I could easily eaten two of these plates. Mom went with the pulled pork. Two thumbs up and 5 stars from her. I had to order some peach cobbler a la mode when I ordered extra Mac and cheese. Home run. I am only sorry that we can't come back for a long time. You guys are great!

8rdHcxz6NCO5N3iUqJw3vA.text: Amazing bbq, highly recommend! Lizelle was very nice and gave good recommendations on what to order. I love that she asked where we were from and what brought us in, she really made is feel welcome. I love bbq food and this reminding me of being in the south again!

wQ8wtSI0S0vZt6cqymGGUg.text: Dam good! Nice casual place outside the strip. Lots of accolades from travel channel. We had piggy pulled pork sandwich with corn nuggets. It was delicious and make sure you pay extra for the too damn hot sauce. We also got half the pork baby rack ribs which was delicious and solid. It didn't come with any sides so if you want to balance with some vegeys would be good. Generous portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piggy pulled pork sandwich and half baby back ribs
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yL5f_osl7Z7WjlKjZ7X5LQ.text: Ate here like two weeks ago and I broke out into a terrible allergy attack that same night. By entire body broke out into hives for a couple of days. Don't think I'll ever be back. It was expensive and I probably spent more on trying to get rid of my face from swelling. I've never had an allergic attack like this in my life and almost rarely ever get sick so if it's worth anything hope this saves someone from the terrible experience I had. Don't do it, it wasn't even worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What&#39;s for lunch?

UfvHU37EqUOVc1CQF0ejWQ.text: Fourth or fifth time here and it never disappoints.   I came here today with a buddy and we couldn't decide what to get.   We ended up getting the 5 meat plate that comes with 3 sides.    Amazing meats and the corn nuggets are to die for.   I'll be back next week when I'm back in Vegas.

ORc754co3QuW9bTQYXM9Nw.text: We took an Uber to get from our hotel to this place. We had our taste buds ready for some good BBQ while out in Las Vegas. I totally "judged a book by its cover" when we pulled up. I immediately wanted to go back to the hotel but I gave it a shot anyway and I'm so glad I did! The food was cooked perfectly and seasoned well. While dining, I saw a rep from GrubHub come in to pick up someone's food. The next time I'm in Las Vegas, I'm definitely going to have GrubHub deliver it to me and I will enjoy it poolside with a nice drink! This place has AMAZING food! Definitely a hidden gem in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs &amp; Chicken combo with a side of Mac &amp; cheese with cornbread to share. Yumm!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1 POUND OF BRISKET! #HeavenExists

fZVnocv7re5471U4Uaxmbg.text: I ordered a #2 chicken and brisket at the Foodie Fest today. The brisket is all fat, I count two bite of real meat that's it. The coleslaw is of unknown origin. It's sour and tastes nothing like slaw. The chicken is good but the rest is going in the trash.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All but 2 bites were all fat from brisket. It&#39;s disgusting. Notice the size of the portion, it&#39;s a lot and it&#39;s fat!!!

14NJ3aAUsuDtOcN8-0NsVg.text: From the airport ..I rush to find this spot... Awesome tasty meaaaTTTTTTTTTT

BS_9dWO1hzMlGV0ryk-3Sw.text: The burnt ends were amazing with a side of loaded mash! I have had BBQ in many states and I must say this place is one of the best! Also the peach tea was perfect sweetness!

ibm20qUqLoPjO7vTaXA2WQ.text: Ok so I hate to ding this place one star because almost everything was pretty good. Tip: try not to come during peak hours. This place gets jammed packed and there will be no open tables.  So we had the baby back Ribs and the beef ribs. Both were a little dry but still good. For a full rack of beef ribs I would've expected more than 4 bones though, especially for $35 I believe it was. And the baby backs were $28. And they both did not come with ANY sides. We ordered full racks and they come with nothing but a sliced piece of bread.... we did pay for sides and had their super delicious mac n cheese, beans and bacon potato salad. I think with tip we spent about $80 with 2 iced teas. Not a bad lunch but just a little bit more than what we're used to paying for lunch.

7BzGXvCa77aKiYw5n5oLvA.text: Back again for some more Rollin' Smoke.   Ordered the two meat platter of 3 spare ribs, hot link and side of corn fritter things.   Ribs had the prescribed smoke ring and were fall off the bone tendered. Most importantly they were not overly smokey. A little smoke goes a long way.   Hot link good average link. Not overly impressed but decent. Now the spicy BBQ sauce I put on it was Spicy! Wow!  That batch had kick. Very good.   Lastly, the corn fritters, an interesting take cream corn but fried onto little battered nuggets. You can't stop at one.   RS BBQ rocks. Always leave satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two meat platter. Ribs, link &amp; side of corn fritters.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty goodness awaits

nUbZu08PpDOXE4KRSmCSgA.text: Justina was the best counter service girl ever, she was knowledgeable and helpful!!! The brisket was delicious and she ensured we had 3 different sauces to go! Will come again and ask for Justina!

FVNSER1VcASrLhyclyl_5w.text: Seriously amazing Q.  We shared a pit special for lunch that had 5 meats and one side.  Everything was cooked perfectly! Nothing was dry or over cooked which happens a some BBQ restaurants. The crew working today for lunch were very upbeat and inviting.  Not sure who this Rick character is that has his name on the place, but he has a solid crew working for him!  This was our first visit and will now be a on our must return list!  Thank you for the great experience today!

o0D2coMEY-oYU-epuLNn7Q.text: The food is incredible and the people who work there are so friendly and sweet! I will most definitely be going back to this place every time I come to Vegas! This place is gold!

GrW3jqJkOT91twF9j9RjbA.text: Amazing bbq, some of the best I have ever had, good prices and excellent service! I will definitely come here every time i visit Vegas!

FunctV1w0JwOhdTgwEeBXg.text: Thanks to Cathy's ROTD, I found this place. DAYUM! It was good!

O_JH9XVwpyrmlL0w-6tx9g.text: This bbq place is awesome.  I have to admit pulling up to it in a small shopping center in the middle of nowhere was a little odd, but once you open the door and enter the place, it's a whole different world.  The nicest people ever work here, the guys at the register that take your order are so friendly, the ones that bring out your food to your table and super friendly, nice people come here to eat, and everyone was happy and friendly.  The corn nuggets and yams are the best side dishes ever.  The ribs were good, the chopped brisket was delicious, links are spicy but good, great portions, great side dishes, perfect seating on large tables to accommodate big parties.  I will definitely come back when I visit Vegas again.  I don't always like the crowded restaurants in the casinos, so this place was great on a night that we arrived and were very casual and just wanted a quick bite.  Thanks Rollin Smoke, keep up the awesome work, great service, and yummy food.

MJ5xKNd2I63qGZiK7oiCbw.text: Definitely a great hole in the wall! We tried the all you can eat and it was well worth the $25! The staff was super friendly. Definitely recommend the spare ribs, loaded mash potatoes, and the shrimp.

SDt8cYbYdl8eJXg8Ieh_gQ.text: This place is just amazing and I love the feel because it's not too big it too small. The food taste great and everything feels like a down home Southern BBQ. They don't hold back on anything, it's like being in a butcher shop.......freaking amazing!!!!

NOmaMRwOQzlTuavKI7QjXw.text: Very good BBQ. Some of the best we have had. A few different sauces to choose from. Brenda at the counter was so friendly and made it a great experience. Located in a industrial section of Vegas. Might want to consider take out if you have kids.

GX1vR6kJ3ezpaV7WlgW_yw.text: Wow!  The burnt ends are PERFECT!  Mac and Cheese- Delish!  Great BBQ spot!!!!  On a later trip I tried the meatloaf and banana pudding. They were also awesome.

nCrh3p1rrycR30w4UB3amw.text: About as good as you can get in Las Vegas.  Portions are great, Prices are good and it tastes good too!

uStSDmN6DtIS1uDXFI376Q.text: Very Good BBQ & Service was Excellent!! Only problem that they aren't in California :) So had to bring some home:)

EoPBwhB0usW_e8TnQXvjgg.text: Absolutely amazing food. Friendly atmosphere. We live in town and love this place.  Will definitely be back soon! !

7cpxHhQWDUUdOzPCULaFCg.text: Rollin Smoke is the best Bbq I've ever had! I had it the first time a month ago, and have had it 4 times already. The macaroni and cheese, chicken and peach cobbler is so good! Lizelle pascual is an employee there and has been so friendly and helpful every time I've gone.

pyfkr5aYOGtz1l_fFOy8Mw.text: Was surprised at the high rating. I will say the chicken was excellent. The pork, brisket, and hot links were all average at best. The sides were average too. The man taking orders was nice, but the guys delivering the food were so rude. I can't believe I tipped (you tip when you pay for the food at the beginning).

_q3YKnv_yZoJjkPX-0o0YA.text: BEST BBQ IN VEGAS!!!!! this place is awesome. the food was moist and tender the house sauce was out of this world delicious. I asked if they had a spicy BBQ sauce and the response was " challenge accepted". House sauce + Trinidad Scorpion = happy me. not only was it hot but the flavor was even better than the original sauce.   Bottom line if you are in Vegas and like BBQ or Super Spicy food this is your place!!!

cYu7JtxK26EHa2tuZhwzuQ.text: Had the smoked meatloaf dinner with loaded mashed and greens tonight. It was slap your mama great!!! Defiantly going back for more!!

wABzQBCWZi6L_RJ2hAhP9Q.text: This place is a little off the beaten path, but it's always the hidden gems that deliver the most delicious dishes. There were so many choices on the menu, my head was spinning. So my husband and I decided to go with the pit special so we could try as many meats and sides as possible. I'm just going to say you can't go wrong with any of the BBQ fare. The ribs, brisket, pulled pork, hot links- all amazing! The hot links were nice and spicy and all the other meat was super tender and delectable.  The beans were a great side- thick and chunky with big pieces of pork mixed throughout. Yum yum. The potato salad had crispy pieces of bacon on top which launched it into a new level of awesome-ness. The fried okra was perfectly breaded and fried. No extra salt required. The mac and cheese just seemed like a dud next to all the other sides, so I'd skip that one if possible. As for the dessert- the peach cobbler was too much peach and not enough cobbler. You could tell that they used a canned peach to make it and it was just not doing it for me. The peach cobbler wasn't the best, but maybe i'll try the banana pudding next time.

dq4r29eg_67ql8ElWXu0Eg.text: This place was amazing! It didn't look like much on the outside but we were not disappointed. We had a group of nine and they totally took care of us - we had all the different types of meat and sauces and they came back to check on us and brought us tons of stuff! The chef came and brought us dessert and the banana pudding was so delicious! I would highly recommend this place!

EQZKpToAjirAjNo8h4I24g.text: Great food! The catfish and shrimp was tasty but my only complaint is the mashed potatoes tasted sour

4x5QaXK1FKZCrk6Q5Yh1bg.text: Yummiest BBB ever !! My new favorite. Great food great customer service! Love love love

xZhDF5wCIvuna057xm4xxQ.text: I stopped here on my way home from work, after several coworkers RECOMMENDED I TRY IT.. I got the sandwich platter. You get 2 lbs of meat either one meat or two. I ordered the brisket and the pulled pork. Meal also comes with 2 sides and enough rolls for 4 sandwiches. We ordered the kickin beans and the Mac-n-Cheese. The brisket was not what I expected it was chopped very fine which is good I guess for sandwiches. ( I hope it is not that way in a meal). Pulled pork was excellent and the sauce was good with just right amount of spice. The Beans were a bit too peppery for my tastes but some may enjoy it. Mac-n-Cheese was marginal but not crazy good also heavy use of pepper. Great filling meal, great taste overall. Will go back to try more menu items.

nrhKMHWg0VkepKM5NuIjQA.text: Dammnnnn Good for sure! EVERYTHING is sooo good.  We had the four meat and three side meal my goodness.  The brisket, ribs, pulled pork, and chicken made me want to slap my mama.  The sides were superb as well.. Not yo mama's potato salad and corn nuggets. We will be local frequents from here on out.  I am kicking myself that I just found out about this joint.  A must try for certain.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This iissshhhh was delish... 4 meat sampler

sQZW2n_HNRMVI_wqvnJzgw.text: Second visit, we visit LV often and will return again and again! Amazing food...good service. Thank you!!!

WV0JXBkZt-_ibqH3F0qFRg.text: The BBQ is definitely pretty good here.  Maybe some of the best in town.  Granted I haven't really eaten much BBQ in Vegas. We got the platter that had a little bit of everything, brisket, pulled pork, hot links, ribs, chicken, and the infamous corn nuggets.  All were pretty good.  They even have stuff that most BBQ places don't have, like burgers, collared greens, fries, etc.  Of course, like most BBQ places, it's kind of expensive. Parking is horrible so definitely try to go when it's not too busy

M9xkEb7E7zJZwJnpc-watQ.text: Here's the deal. For a while, I've been searching for authentic BBQ here in the city. Chains restaurants like Dave's and Lucille's are great but missing more of that southern down home feel. Enter Rollin Smoke, located in the shadow of the Las Vegas Strip, this small eatery is does everything right.  We got here around the lunch rush, and had to wait in a small line to order. The host/cashier was Dusty I believe, friendly guy, and he was quick and attentive. Because the staff is well prepared, the food was out within 10 minutes, very quick for a BBQ establishment, and it shows great preparation.  I ordered the Pit Special, and for 20 bucks you get a pick of 4 meats, 3 sides and a drink. That's enough food for 2 meals or to share. I ordered a piece of the catfish on the side, which was very good as well. Catfish is hard to perfect because you have to cook it through but not over cook it. I'm willing to attest that the catfish is about as legit as it gets.  The meat itself was fantastic, the ribs were tender but not greasy. It was nice and smoky with a good texture. Someone on here said the ribs weren't "fall off the bone", which  is correct. That's not to say it's tough, because it's not. Being smoked they way they are, they aren't greasy, they pull off the bone with very little effort. That's better than greasy, mushy "fall off the bone" people talk about when they use that phrase.  The sides were fantastic. The loaded mash was pretty good, not as good as some of the garlic mash I've had, BUT, excellent in it's own right. The mac and cheese was great. I'm kind of a mac and cheese snob, and nothing is as good as my moms homemade, but this was better than most BBQ/Southern restaurants. My one and only complaint was that the food could have been a bit warmer. That's it.   For not much money you can eat like a king. Fast friendly staff, and great food makes this hidden gem a winner in my eyes.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pit special!

zZ3QhR-68oaaQUkZflM2EQ.text: Location is not convenient. Service could be better. The food is good. I've only picked up for take out. I don't like how they charge for sides of BBQ sauce. It's a BBQ place I should be able to get it BBQ sauce for free even if I am picking up for take out. It's free if you eat there. The ribs are good but I've had way better brisket at Billy's BBQ!

w_aW8-ZRa2BAvhBLWDIDJQ.text: About to enjoy my third meal at rolling smoke in 6 days. Thanks you Tarin for helping with the best choices on the menu!

5JbNcLwopPcmfvRaguFP7w.text: "DAMNNNNNN GOOOOOD! DAMNNNNNNN GOOOOOD! DAMMMMMMMMMMMMM GEWD!"  Those three words are the celebratory chants of a Rollin Smoke Barbeque meal. Alright so maybe the chef will encourage you to shout it when you leave, but it takes little convincing, trust me!  My knowledge of barbeque is limited, but I mean I own a Traeger Grill, does that count for anything? No? I didn't think so either... but while my Traeger makes deliciously smoked clean meats it doesn't compare to the smokey glistening glory of RSB. Their ALL YOU CAN EAT BBQ is what makes Vegas or America in general really freaking awesome. I mean sure we're in the top 10 for most obese countries, but hey at least we do it right, RIGHT?   The special is $25 and includes EVERYTHING on the menu, except drinks ($2), you gotta buy that, BUT... its pretty much all you can drink too. Don't pass on the Outlaw Burger,  the beef ribs, or the nachos, but do pass on the pulled pork. Don't wear a belt, its useless, no belt will make look skinny after the massacre. You can of course also just order ala carte.  Take the booth with the pig, it will give you extra encouragement when you savage through his four legged cousins.   CONVENTION PEOPLE... COME HERE!  How was my review? DAMNNNNNNN GEWDDDDDDDDDD right? Thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE BBQ

gHjohh4XPvErNf4LHluCyA.text: If you want some amazing BBQ this is the place.  I came here for lunch after hearing and reading rave reviews.  I came around 11:50 on a Wednesday and it was still busy.  That lets you know that this place is jammin.  Apparently you can call in the order and they'll have it ready when you come get it, (total plus in my book).  It's a little confusing to get to, but that shouldn't stop you at all.    I got the Spudtastic with brisket and a side of Bacon Potato Salad.  Everything was fresh and tasted amazing! This will definitely become a lunch/dinner regular for me.  The line never went down while we were there.  Picnic style seating.  We sat at a table with some other people while waiting for their food and everybody was so nice.  Staff and regulars.  Anybody who says this place is okay, and that  it isn't like "back home" is obviously prejudiced to wherever "back home" is.  This place is awesome and definitely worth coming to!!

TfDKx4mcIh7AXFAFc-465A.text: It's so damn good. It's so damn good. It so damn damn damn good. Wow every dish. Everything I've had so far has been phenomenal and what makes this place even better they take customer service to another level if you order something and you are not one hundred percent please with it they will remove it from your ticket or replace it no questions asked got to love that

IBpwnvpiudIUXWHH6OB_IQ.text: I'm a bbq snob. Meaning that I make better bbq (home made sauce and rubs and queen of the grill and smoker!) myself at home! So when I eat bbq out it has to be damn good.  I LOVE This Place!   Tender. Flavorful. Amazing selection. Everything I ever get here rocks!!! I really want to have a party so I can have them cater it soon!  It's interesting to find, but you must try it. I suggest getting there during early of off hours...because there's always a line when I go!  Great place to bring out of towners to show them our hidden vegas.

KS4QcbUNjdcnDgY5pCqiEg.text: My son found this GREAT BBQ place online.  To my surprise. We had a great family dinner for under 60 dollars.  For $50 we got 1/4 lbs of ribs, 1/4 lb of brisket and 1/4 lb pulled pork as well as 8 rolls and 2 big sides. For the side I strongly recommend the BBQ beans and their amazingly cheesy Mac and cheese. Lets say we got our  money's worth and more.  To burn of the calories we walked across a small parking lot to visit the infamous GOLD AND SILVER PAWN as seen in the hit show PAWN STAR. FYI THIS BBQ PLACE IS ALSO OWNED BY THE SAME OWNER AS THE PAWN SHOP ( RICK) If a trip to Vegas is in your near future... hit up this place and eat like a king for less than  $60.  I WILL DEFINITELY BE GOING TO RICK' S ROLLIN BBQ EVERY TIMES I VISIT VEGAS.  IT'S ONLY FEW MILES AWAY FROM THE FAMOUS VEGAS STRIP. ENJOY!!!

m4oB_leQAAm2FT6p5I7L_A.text: Father's Day was a success! My husband, who has an office in Kansas City always bragged that they had the best BBQ. Well, after having Rolling Smoke, he is convinced that it as good if not better!! Mike was fabulous and everyone enjoyed the food. Thank you for a great find!

yD8vc4pREv-vUpAQBbRpTw.text: The best BBQ I've had in a long time!!! Will definitely recommend to friends that come to Las Vegas! I shared the meal with my sister that came with 5 different kinds of meet (ribs, chicken, brisket, pulled pork, and sausage) and 3 sides (Mac and cheese, yams, and bacon potato salad) and of course added corn and 2 soft drinks. Might come back before I leave for New York City!

BZhD5iiOKa-ISKXwGXQxzg.text: Best BBQ but little pricey!! I live in Anthem which is too far for me.  It will be nice if the owner has a new BBQ restaurant in the Henderson area. Without doubt,  I'll stop going to Famous Dave's for sure..

b206Qy4TyZInSgLPG7P7hg.text: Saturday night in Vegas and we were planning on meeting up with our friends for dinner and some fun. The first place we planned to go to was not getting too many rave reviews. Stephanie S. had the wonderful idea to come here instead for dinner. This place was pretty close to where we were staying on the strip, which made it easy drive for us. Located on the other side of the strip (yes on the seedy side of town) pass a couple of popular strip joints, made a turn thinking did my GPS give me the wrong directions because it's really dark on this street and it looks like it's the industrial area of Vegas. Well you are in the industrial area but it is also a mix of other business as well. Rollin Smoke is in a small shopping center look for a sign that says "Kiesub Center" and you have found it! Did I mention that they are open until 1:30 am every day too?  As we were pulling into the parking lot, I notice two huge bbq smokers outside. Knowing that anything that is put into a smoker is going to be mighty tasty I was ready to order right there in the parking lot!  Walking into this eatery the BBQ smell hits you like a mack truck on the 15. Their menu is large and in charge!   Everything from an all you can eat BBQ for $24.99 (you get anything on their menu, anytime, any day of the week)  $7.99 sandwich's (like the pulled piggy, smoked brisket ECT) $8.99 meals (BBQ nacho fries, various wraps, outlaw burger and many options that are more wonderful to choose from)  Then there are the various plates that they have. Minh and I decided on ordering and splitting The Pit Special:   Four meats (of your choice) and three sides (of your choice) - Brisket, Chicken, two orders of spare ribs. Bacon Potato Salad, Yams, and Corn Nuggets all for $19.99!  They took Minh's name down and we seated our self's in an over sized booth. The owner was there making sure everything was running smoothly. This is a family owned business, which makes it have that charming-family-cozy kind of feeling. As we were waiting for our food and other friends to arrive, I was chatting with Stephanie and watching the small eatery fill up with hungry families, club-goers and other various walks of life wanting some stick to your ribs goodness.   A friendly server brought our food to our table. All I can say is the Pit Special offers a lot of food for your money! There is more than enough to share with another person.   The corn nuggets were the best ever! Fried on the outside (no grease on any of the balls) and yet soft and fluffy in middle. I was popping these in two at a time (sorry babe if you only got a couple). There are addicting!   The bacon potato salad was another favorite, chucks of potatoes various seasonings, mayo and probably mustard piled with bits of delicious bacon.  Swoon!  All the meats were tender (they "rub" their own meats daily) you can taste the quality of the meats they have. Not one piece was dry; we did try their homemade BBQ sauce, which was delightful on the brisket. The chicken and ribs had so much meat on it I got overwhelmed for a second.   This place is a gem in hiding, BBQ in sin city at its best! To the Holland family thank you for making this delicious food for every kind of budget!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lnAt_bUiKwuqghI3JQ0K2Q.text: Well, I was excited to eat here because of the Yelp reviews, and maybe I came on an "off" night, but I wasn't impressed. The beef ribs were charred a lil too hard and not very flavorful - $18.99 for 2 bones, I expected more. The smoked chicken came out cold and again wasn't anything spectacular. The wings are a great size, fried well, and come out hot! The lemon pepper rub, however was not good (and I looove lemon pepper wings). It tasted like someone prepared wings and dumped the seasoning on them with no concern for blending the seasoning in. I sent them back and ordered BBQ wings Togo, fingers crossed they are better. The sliced brisket was good :-). The greens and yams were good. The cornbread was AMAZING! Overall, star was nice, but food was just not what I hoped for :-(.

OGPVKV5xHS-BLPSH_FIyxw.text: Awesome place. Found it thanks to yelp after checking out of our hotel on the strip. Perfect post-Vegas-debauchery food!  Easy to find right off the 15, just a mile from the strip. Parked in front, was immediately greeted by Mike (the owner I think). Super nice guy, helped us choose our menu items and was genuinely appreciative that we came in. Love that.  We sat ourselves at a picnic table and our food came out shortly. Hubs had a trio of sliders and they were huge! I had the pulled piggy sandwich. Portions were big and sides were super seasoned and greasy in a good way. Hangover cure! The brisket and chicken sliders were seriously amazing. Best I've had anywhere. The pulled pork was also very good. Super tender and no fat.   We got a free hot peach cobbler a la mode for checking in on yelp. Heck yes!  Our ONLY suggestion would be better buns and more sauce on the table. Overall, this place is great with amazing service. We'll be back next time we're in Vegas!

5_GNaWqnv2QCR4XOxPdjcA.text: Love this BBQ spot! Stopped by when we were visiting Vegas. Took a quick Lyft from our hotel to get there. Kind of industrial area it was in. Staff were super friendly and attentive! The baked potato salad was amazing! The chopped brisket and pulled pork were spot-on. I had the hot links too which were good! Didn't try the BBQ but will next time. Good prices for nice portion sizes! Liked the eco-friendly cups as well! Keep it up!

By2mMjv5C7-rLaqr8cFQAA.text: This establishment has perfected the art of cooking ribs along with fast friendly service. The parking lot could be a bit larger but for a well earned 4.5 star average review rating one would expect a busy lot. Great place to enjoy good BBQ close to the Strip . It is nice to enter a establishment and see the help smiling .  Keep up the good work .

yryH4W8kZN93h0bQKz2MFA.text: Absolutely some of the best BBQ I have ever had in my life! Great service and we met the owners and they were awesome! The flavors were amazing and from now on will be a must for my trips to Vegas. I got the pulled piggy sandwich which was OMG! My husband got the meatloaf which was unbelievable and then my cousin got the "outlaw" burger which is something you have to see to believe! This burger might make you cry it's so beautiful and delicious!   As a plus they were filming their commercial while we were here and luckily they included us in that lol   Def earned 5 stars from us

bgiTXO8qy5y9Cs61eqndyg.text: This is my favourite barbeque place!  The food is amazing every time no matter what I order, though I usually order their rib platter. I especially love their beef ribs!  They are so flavourful and juicy!  All of their sides are very tasty too!  I really like their baked potato with all the fixings!  Christal helped me and my family out today...she is awesome and so very helpful!  I definitely recommend Rollin Smoke to all of my family, friends, and coworkers!

_2sGRqcPqig2NxC4xQbCYw.text: Best Barbeque ever!  Smoked to perfection and the sides were to die for!  The sauce was so good I had to buy a bottle to bring home along with the rub!  Eat here... you won't be disappointed!

fQqdBsWB_LChTJvhuU3t8w.text: Decided to put together a memorable meal for a bachelor party. So I ordered a "Triple Gut Buster" like the one I saw from television. Not only did it look like a piece of art, but it was delicious. You could taste every  different kind of meat on the sandwich. The staff was excited as no one had actually ordered it before and their enthusiasm showed. They were incredibly helpful and I encourage anyone visiting Sin City to come by and try some of the best BBQ in the west.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nmkiOXtvV9nGh-XyTbPI3w.text: I had not been to Rollin Smoke in a long time and was in the area (sort of) and felt like a little BBQ for lunch.  Dang I missed this place!  It's not far from the strip in distance, yet feels a million miles away.  This hole in the wall restaurant feels like it was transported from some small town down south, not the glitz of Las Vegas (in a good way).  Your olfactory sensors are hit with the heavenly smell of smoked meat even before you cross the threshold (prepare to leave with a new smoke cologne too).    You counter order and pick up your utensils before heading to a table.  You can sit at the picnic tables by the counter, or cross over into the dining room that houses additional tables and a couple TVs.  Tables are equipped with a roll of paper towels and their signature BBQ sauce, which is a little sweeter than traditional Texas sauce, but good.  This trip we got combo plates of Sliced Brisket with Fried Okra and Pulled Pork with Kicken Beans and Jalapeno Coleslaw.  The brisket and pork were perfect.  Both tender and smokey.  The pork had some awesome burnt end pieces that were fantastic.  The fried okra was good.  The Kicken Beans had some heat and pieces of the smoked meats in the sauce.  Definitely a side I would order again!  I did not care for the Jalapeno Coleslaw too much.  It had a bunch of black pepper that overwhelmed the flavor of the dish.  I need to remember to keep this place in the rotation a little more often!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duo choice of meats $13.99- sliced brisket, chicken with a side of mac n cheese. 5/5
