DDc1VMHnwjAbwCM4GjxNgA.text: Best bbq in Vegas (and probably all of Nevada). Their burnt ends are life changing. Our server Christal was super friendly. Recommend RS to every friend that goes to Vegas.

9VaN5_KLxTb2hX4Wi311LA.text: decent, did all u can eat. - burnt tips were very very fat not my idea of burnt tips. pulled pork ok, ribs were good. location is very  very limited for parking n not in the best area - kinda industrial part off the strip, approx. 5 to 10 mins drive after Fashion Mall n Trump hotel. near train tracks as you can hear te train.  sauces are  kept away from tables , most likely to control amount bein used. have to try da rest next time I m there but not like the BBQ in Austin   .

TRHagWcqVQFTPYGv7802nQ.text: This was a great off the path BBQ joint.  I would recommend it to all.  Had a combo meal that they said would feed 2-4. We could have fed 6.  The sauces, the corn bread and the Mac and cheese were awesome.

laLrMzKGTI_SSqGSSs4tDg.text: Friendly service, quick and very tasty. Highlights were the baby backs, brisket and beans. Large portions too.

YK4fAD13GfndxhE7CQjvAA.text: Everything was smoked to perfection. The pork and beef ribs both were deeply savory with a nice balance of texture/smoke. Make sure you get a small sampler plate of whichever meats you don't necessarily have your eye on to get a taste of everything (brisket, sausage, pull pork etc) and try each homemade sauce. The fixins are all on point with a dozen plus options, but of course the corn nuggets are A1 with a pint of mac n cheese.

ZOm3B80UMBjypDVIIE5C9w.text: Love this place and love the people, Lizelle is my favorite!! Everyone here attends to their customers super quick. Food comes out pretty fast and is always cooked perfectly. Everyone at my job is hooked to this spot. I'm Glad they're off the strip as well. Easy drive to get to them

5SezqUweqRDVzhTxZ7idGA.text: The food was excellent. Great smokey flavor, tender and done correctly. I ordered the pulled pork and chopped brisket. My husband is from Kansas City and we frequent the bbq joints back there when visiting. (We live in CA).  I'd say this is probably the closest I have had to KC. I wasnt a big fan of the sauces, but that is just my personal preference. I'll be bringing some home for him- back to CA that's how good it is. The service was outstanding!!! Great job guys:)

OULID6T7OHzPk6xqkk2BFQ.text: The best bbq in Vegas hands down!!! The ribs were fall of the bone, the burnt edges brisket was fantastic as well as the pulled pork. We ordered the pit and got so full we didn't even eat the chicken. Mac n cheese and greens were fire!!! Bbq beans were alright but that's based on taste. Pulled pork was Fanta with MAMA SWEET SAUCE!!! Probably the best bbq I've had next to Texas!!! Highly recommend to ever one! Service was also fantastic and food came out quick!!!

vfaA_VciVB80LPcRod2n1Q.text: Haven't been here since our last visit to Vegas in 2014. This place is still amazing-we had a pit special and some amazing sides.  Staff are incredibly nice, this place is the best, will definitely visit again tomorrow :)  Updated  Just visited again today and had another amazing lunch . Place was packed , but the service was quick and friendly and there was lots of staff cleaning off tables and making sure everything was in good shape. Really good atmosphere there.  We met the owner today and he's a great guy - wish I lived in Vegas so I could enjoy this place every week !

xqg78XvsDpbY4Z9UxgBXnQ.text: Located within the dark shadows of las vegas. The only bright lights in that neighborhood are from the strip clubs, and outside that, complete urban waste land consumed by darkness.  However, the food shines bright! Especially the World Famous Meat Loaf!! Sooo soft that u cant distinguish the meat from the mashed potato.  Just a delicious soft gooeyness that melts in your mouth.  The ribs are good too but I can say that I've had better ribs before.  Quite an experience, from the ambiance of the neighborhood to the melt in your mouth meat loaf.  But proceed with caution, I would have been quite nervous if there weren't the entire Las Vegas Police Department dining with us in the restaurant that day loll

JpuJBYay9AWF3QjlAyk22Q.text: It may be hard to find, but this little gem off the strip is well worth the journey... as long as you don't mind paying $18 per person ($8 for kids meals). The gal at the ordering desk wasn't super pleasant or helpful, but she got the job done. I had the ribs, greens and a soda. What you have to realize is... I don't like ribs! I'm not really even sure why I ordered them. Trying to get past an old issue I guess.  Anyways, it was awesome! Fall off the bone tender. The sauce on the table made it even better. Best greens I have had in Vegas so far for sure! I'll be back the next time I am in the area and hungry.

FJ-ytJj-3foBJKpK9n_n7w.text: Found this gem close to the busy strip and was blown away! Great food, clean location, and friendly staff. Wife and I tried the brisket, ribs, and sausage and were not in the least bit disappointed! Staff was friendly and courteous. Mac and cheese is on point! If you need some good food at a short drive from the strip, do NOT skip this joint!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RxgErVf0rZ-sKAXzZJ_zZA.text: You know a big problem I'm having in Las Vegas is not great but good/ ok barbecue at an inflated price. This was a good place, I did have an issue with my order being mixed up with another patron and a long wait for the correct food but it's got some good ambience and decor and the people seemed to enjoy the place so that's something. I also notice that many places (this one included) don't sauce their meat which is a peeve of mine when it comes to barbecue. But I'm picky.

mvMYjW1E3K-PhcTQGE0gYw.text: Excellent food.  Great service. Definitely will be back when traveling through Las Vegas again

_PFaLdMzCiuG-g8lTVnewA.text: My husband and I came for the first time all the way from Fresno and this place does not disappoint! We got the pit special which had 5 meats and 3 sides. The meats are flavorful and juicy the ribs where AMAZING!!!! Along with the brisket,pulled pork, chicken, and hot link. Also the sides held their own as well with the Mac n cheese being so deliciously cheesy and the bbq beans having a little bit of spicyness to them, the corn bread was so buttery and soft!! My favorite sauce was (sweet south).The staff was amazing Christal Willis was the woman who helped us and she was super sweet! The place is little but it packs big flavor!

qb5m4E_4qxqOudqZnc4BhQ.text: First time here. Came from SF and saw the reviews had to make a stop. The outside wasn't appealing however you walk inside and smell the bbq and it was delicious! Had the brisket sandwich and mamas sweet sauce  so delicious!!! Definitely would come back.

pTc63U9KcY9Y1WKq8cFUiQ.text: A place worth checking out for you bbq lovers! Their BBQ style is like dry style BBQ where you just smother all the diff kinds of BBQ sauce they have to your liking.  Tried the brisket and it was soft and tender and when you just pour on that spicy BBQ sauce it was delicious with a nice kick to it!  I will definitely want to come back to try their ribs since I didn't get the chance to.  Also ordered  their outlaw burger which was one of their famous item on the menu and was voted "Best of Las Vegas" to be honest  burger was disappointing. It looked good and was great for pictures but it was a dry burger and not what I am used to. I guess you were suppose to just lather on the BBQ sauce. The burger was huge though!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw burger

CSEseCoRAf6Xu2NGgVvBig.text: Have enjoyed this place every time we've gone. Brisket is very tender and pork ribs are excellent.

d1UCwZzZkWozQKYEhNgb2w.text: The standard of BBQ. Grab the sampler, It will not disappoint.

NeKRQzY8ElKcLR0dzSp0Yg.text: This is my favorite BBQ restaurant.  I had the three item combo with spare ribs, one beef rib (additional cost), burnt ends (additional cost), and collared greens as a side.  The spare ribs were cooked perfectly, moist tender smokey with just a bit of chew.  The beef rib was big meaty smokey and so soft, I flaked the meat off the bone with just a fork like I was eating cake.  I thought the burnt ends were a little over sauced, though they were pretty good.  The collared greens were cooked just right, and the brisket chunks were a nice touch.  The nice people sitting next to my party had corn nuggets, and let me try one.  They are little balls of cornbread stuffed with actual corn nibblets (really good).  I am already thinking about returning to Vegas just so I can eat here again.

lwLsVYQgus9Lq_s5Rtx4Pg.text: Sensational BBQ. I had the burnt ends and they were amazing. All the sides I tried were delicious too.

bXd4WIkCysD3nGkfU0K8_w.text: I've eaten barbecue in many parts of the country and I do my own on a Big Green Egg. I like good barbecue. We found this place on a recent trip to  Vegas, and I am so glad we did. The aroma as you get out of your car whets the appetite. The joint is not pretentious at all, not glitzy, nor glamorous; it is Vegas, after all. Staff was friendly and welcoming. I had the 3 meat plate, so I could have variety. Brisket, ribs and sausage were all excellent. Chipotle cole slaw was surprisingly good. The others had their shrimp and said it was seasoned and cooked perfectly. This will be one of our go to spots whenever we visit Vegas.

iQMDWktY-RKZcC6my-jfHQ.text: The food here is smokin', rollin', and amazin'! This was the food highlight of my Vegas trip and it was amazingly delicious! The parking lot and surrounding area may look a bit sketchy, but the restaurant itself isn't!  The staff was friendly and we got our food about 10 mins in, not bad!   I got the duo choice of meat with sliced briskets and two spare ribs. The meat was tender, full of flavor, and cooked perfectly. I like sauce on my barbecue and their Arkansas sauce did not disappoint. The sweet bbq sauce was  also great although their spicy sauce was a bit underwhelming. Portions are great and filling, you get your money's worth here.   The sides were just as outstanding. I got a side of mac and cheese and corn nuggets. Best mac and cheese I've had! Not many restaurants meet my expectations for good mac and cheese, but theirs were all the right amounts of cheesy flavor and taste. The corn nuggets were also amazing and rightfully hyped. They were a great combination of crispy on the outside and sweet inside with bits of corn.  If you're a fan of barbecue, you must make a stop here on your next Vegas trip, I certainly will!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliced Briskets and Spare Ribs Sides: Mac &amp; Cheese and Corn Nuggets

WbyrbA4O3nQdC4po1rE7nQ.text: Great spot to grab some tasty bbq. Came in at 11a on a Friday and it was pretty empty, so we had very fast service at the counter and our food was quickly brought to our table. By the time we left, there was a line to the door-- an indication of how loved this place is. They have fast service, so I wouldn't advise anyone to let rush hour stop them from coming in. Location is conveniently located from the freeway, but we accidentally drove by the restaurant on our first try to find the place.  Our family enjoyed: brisket, ribs, pulled pork, hot dog, fries, collard greens, corn nuggets, and the side salad. Everything was absolutely delicious and we will be back!!

1sGDV5d07JqPtG6WGNaNIA.text: Happy to see good BBQ in a city surrounded by such upscale restaurants.   This is a very small, hole in the wall looking bbq joint. Small seating area inside. Parking lot is decent sized.   Call ahead if you want your order ready when you arrive. They charge if you want sauce to go, pretty stupid, who doesn't want sauce on the side. The spicy sauce is good.  They have a 10% off coupon on their website, just show them the coupon online and save some money.  Rib Platter - $24.99 - Comes with 1 beef rib, 2 spare ribs, and 3 baby back ribs. I love when bbq places have combos like this because I love to try everything they offer. Beef rib was huge and had tender flakey meat. Spare rib fell off the bone and was moist. Baby backs were a little dry. Seasoning was peppery with a little hint of sweet. My side was the Corn Nuggets which were like cream corn poppers, so good.  Brisket, fatty, 1lb - $18.99 - Meat melted in your mouth. You can pull it apart with your fingers.   Half Smoked Chicken - $9.99 - Good smoke. Had some good juicy meat but some pieces were dry.  Burnt Ends, 1/2lb - $12.99 -  Disappointing. Not moist or fatty. Very little bark. They do not allow quarter pound orders either.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Smoked Chicken - $9.99
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Rib up close
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket, fatty, 1lb - $18.99

PN5WGKBTfOwrXJwlFXctQA.text: Damn good BBQ @ Rollin Smoke Barbecue! My husband and I split the brisket 3 ways and I was really impressed with how good everything was. My favorite was the burnt ends. The brisket was so tender, the meat just fell apart and melted in your mouth. They also offer several different dipping sauces, all you can eat on the sauce at no extra charge.  I found out the owner is originally from the south which explains why the BBQ is so spot on. He really brought his roots to Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket 3 ways - Delicious!!

d2xKsob_hzGypxRAVVVs2A.text: Had a big party and tried Rollin's BBQ. Everyone loved it! Great food. Good to the last bite. You won't be disappointed.

L7zggyug0R_TWVXS1JDkeQ.text: Extremely disappointed in by Ribs that showed up. I've ordered food this place a few times before and got burnt ends. Those little suckers are my weakness . 5/28/2018 they were sold out which I do get. Pulled pork and cornbread was good. Spare ribs were dried out, and the beef ribs were very small and burnt all the way through. I was told they would be huge. As you can see from the photo they were the size of my bread and non edible. Way to go ! Let me not forget the girl answering the phone was trying to help out as much as she could, but once the food goes out that's it.

EJxXTeMAWY-ggROuNk9uHw.text: Born Texan and I know BBQ so, when I found this place I had to see what was LV working with. I was skeptical about the food but, when I opened the door I smelled BBQ which is somewhat a good sign of any BBQ. Long story short, it was so dam good I had to order more! The ribs are flavorful and fall off the flipping bone. Meaty as hell too! You have to try the chopped beef with the MAMA sauce.   Their CORNBREAD  / YAMs Owns!!  This is a must for anyone who appreciates BBQ and will Mark you keep coming back for more!

3DZJejmEC613mYgU991Z8A.text: I've gone there twice already and I will go back again the next time I'm in Las Vegas. I live in Orange County California and visit a few times through out the year when possible, but I would definitely recommend this to anyone who likes Barbeque food. Best bang for your buck by far.

6FYfC1XkzTaSBUvZHIL4qA.text: The BBQ was good but I was really impressed with the corn nuggets.  They tasted like deep fried corn cakes.  Outside was super crispy, and inside was sweet and moist with little bits of corn kernels.  This item definitely sets this place apart from other BBQ places.  The house made habanero paste sauce was also excellent.    My wife and I ordered the trio meat combo with pulled brisket, 1/4 lb chicken, and hot links.  The brisket was juicy with a nice smoked flavor; chicken was tender and flavorful; and hot links were spicy with a nice snap to them.  I put some Carolina vinegar on the brisket which helped cut down some fat and added a refreshing flavor to the meat.  The house BBQ sauce was tasty although a bit watery so I mixed some of the habanero paste to thicken it up.  They tasted pretty good together.  The sweet BBQ sauce, which tasted like honey mustard, was also pretty good, and went well with the hot links.  Service was friendly.  Chef and some of the staff members walked around greeting people and making sure everyone was doing ok.    Seating is set up in a family style with picnic benches and tables.    This will definitely be one of the stops we make whenever we are in Vegas.  We actually walked over here from The Trump Hotel despite it being in a sketchy area.  It was fine in the day but I probably would be too scared to walk here at night.

jpKLIM-vAVJDKImiP_1NeA.text: This place is amazing! They have great food for great prices! Show up early to beat the line. I would come here every day if i could.

GAEt7TG1pLvdsSevYTRoPw.text: Having grown up in N.C. I'm a big fan of BBQ. Mainly pork sandwiches. I drove by this place twice and even heard about it through the grapevine. Overall, I would give it a B. I'm not comparing NC BBQ to Vegas BBQ, but some of the side items tasted a bit off and the prices were high.  I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with mac and cheese. I should have noticed the word "pulled" pork as it has a different mouth feel than chopped pork. The pork itself was smoky and tender. Long strips of pork inside a hoagie roll. I added coleslaw to the top which was a mistake. The coleslaw (ugh) had chucky bits of cabbage stalk, jalapenos, carrots, corn and I swear I saw bacon in the mix. It wasn't sweet and it wasn't salty; It added nothing to the meal. The mac and cheese on the other hand was delicious. Oddly enough, it tasted like potatoes au gratin I just bought from the store.   Aside from that awful coleslaw experience I would go back but not to order the pulled pork sandwich. The prices are a bit high and I wish tried something that was just amazing! I will have to go back when they aren't charging full prices such as after 5pm. Perhaps, the ribs and brisket are better.

53hinNCHeBx_HocMpUY6vA.text: Daaaaang, so good!!! My husband is from Texas and we have to frequent local BBQ joints when we travel. This is one of THE best we've ever been, topping over many of the so called famous spots in Texas. We had the brisket three ways, along with a side of fried okra and Mac n' cheese. All five stars. This was the first time we had ever been to this spot, but the five star service could also not be ignored. Locals were giving employees hugs, and we must've been asked 3-4 times how we were enjoying our food. Dusty kept bringing people samples of other meats to try. We heard that they have recently teamed up with the Pawn Star guys to open another location. Smart men!! We will be back!!!

z3qiNXIhk_HozJuEcCxSBQ.text: Great place with good customer service. Shout out to Lizelle for helping me make my selection.

4B2Ao-O7fJKxQP-2p_xRTA.text: Heard great things and came here with a few of my friends while in Vegas for a soccer tourney.  The menu looked so appetizing and I finally went with the Trio. I also ordered a peach cobbler.   The pulled pork was amazing!  Best bit of BBQ I've had. The chicken was good. The brisket was kind of fatty. They came out and told me they were out of peach cobbler so I had the berry cobbler instead. If you love cobbler like I do, do NOT order it here!  It is not really cobbler but more like berries poured on top of a cornbread and topped with whip cream.   My overall meal was good, and my friends had more success with their meals so I give it an overall 4 stars

4Xcp1D6ee-j0CdvJEWuJBg.text: Nom, nom, nom!  Rollin Smoke Barbeque is an awesome place to get barbecue in Las Vegas!  Seriously, if you're visiting Vegas or live there, just try it, you'll love it.  They are located in an almost industrial center part of town, and there's not a whole lot of parking, especially when they are busy.  They are right down the street from our go to Tattoo shop, so they are really convenient for us to grab a to go order when someone's tattoo is going to take all day.  They also have two dining areas and seating outside too if you'd rather eat in.   The portions are huge; my boyfriend and I can share one of their two or three meat platters easily.  On this most recent visit we ordered two of the three meat platters.  One for us to share, and one for the two teenage boys to share.  For under $40, all four of us were completely stuffed and we still had leftovers.   For our platter we had ribs, pork and brisket with the bacon potato salad and banana pudding.  The ribs were falling off the bone, the pork was flavorful and juicy and the brisket was really tender.  I grabbed a few extra containers of their sauce, but we didn't need it because the meats were great on their own.  The service is excellent even when they are busy.  I'll be honest, we're heading back to Vegas at the end of the month, and I think Rollin Smoke might be one of the things I'm looking forward to the most!

rhf4UDWDEapJLWlknH5bUQ.text: Got to love Vegas. Still eating our way through town and this place sure doesn't disappoint. Don't be afraid of the surroundings as its in the middle of a bunch of strip clubs.   Great friendly staff and way too much food. Hidden Gem.

loy8WfseXUTL1Uh_PBkgYw.text: Me and a couple of friends were looking to get something to eat. We were debating if we wanted BBQ or Pizza. We had chose this place and boy I am glad we came here for sure. Everything was great, loved the food. My friends and I really enjoyed ourselves being here with no problems, we really got full I will say. The prices are great as well, customer service delightful. I have been to a couple place for BBQ and this place takes it all!!

mheA9kxFOj0jeHzDFcgWDw.text: This place is so delicious!  We got brisket, baby back ribs, pulled pork, and tons of sides. Everything was so flavorful and the sauce was delicious!   I wish they were closer to the southwest, but definitely worth the trip and we will be back!

5FE2vHcl428GSfGRBWWjLw.text: This is by far one of the best BBQ rib place that I've ever tried. I am actually not your typical BBQ and rib type of girl. I think it's messy and not worth the effort.  Unfortunately, my husband loves ribs so we have tried a few; however, this place totally makes up for all the bad ones that I have had to endure.  The seasoning is perfect, fall of the bone kind of meat, and was so tasty.  I honestly think this might be the "phils bbq" of Las Vegas.  The price is decent, and the venue is very home, no frills. Definitely a must try if you are ever vegas.

Like I said it wasn't terrible, but it is nothing to write home about either. Life is too short for average BB-Q. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

7pBaJnPxTVbQ9o0EWI3JAg.text: Highland Dr and Industrial Rd are better known for their close proximity to the Las Vegas glittery night life, where even the least physically attractive individuals can lease the personal attention of barely clothed seductive sirens $20 at a time.  But thanks to Rollin' Smoke Barbeque, this same area will also be known for down to earth, simply delicious BBQ.   On a recent weekday evening, a handful of coworkers decided to meet here post work to try some BBQ that Nelson Q has proudly put his 5 Yelp stars stamp of approval on. In typical fashion, I was the first to arrive.  The parking lot was empty except for 2 cars, all the other businesses were closed, and there was a guy in suits finishing his early dinner.  The restaurant itself is very low key. It housed nothing flashy in terms of decorations, except for a big boar's head mounted on one of the walls. The lobby/ordering counter is in a small room, but the main dining area is in the adjacent room. The seats are comfortable, and there is a TV for you to watch sports or highlights, while you wait for your order.  Most of us opted to try the Outlaw Burger. For $6.99 + tax, this burger is the size of two of my fists stacked on top of each other.  It is packed with a 1 lb patty (60% brisket and 40% ground beef) and cooks down to about 12 oz, served with Rollin' Smoke's homemade tangy BBQ sauce, the usual vegetable fixings and some (lettuce, tomato, fried onions, scallions, and cheese) which not only made it physically big but the flavors complimented each other and resulted in a mean serving of burger that I can easily recommend to anyone not opposed to eating pork and beef.  For $2, you get a drink and choice of one side (bacon potato salad would be a good pick), and make your order a combo.  Currently there is also a Yelp Check-In promotion, where you get a complimentary dessert with your order.  Rollin' Smoke BBQ, now my personal #1 one pound burger in LV.  Decor:  3/5  No frills hole in the wall restaurant. You are here because you want good BBQ, not design ideas for your Texas ranch.  Food:  4/5  Good BBQ made with passion and love.  They serve Blue Belle ice cream too (coworkers said it reminded them of the ice cream in the Philippines. I will take their words for it.)  Value:  4/5  Good for the wallet. I estimate that 65%+ of you will not be able to finish the Outlaw Burger, side + drink.  Location:  5/5  Not far at all if you are visiting the Strip.  The cabbies will probably know it too, if not, it is just down the street from Sapphire.   Parking:  5/5  It is practically all for Rollin' Smoke BBQ customers.  Easily 4 stars!  P.S.  If you stop by during lunch, I heard this is where some of them sirens get their lunch/breakfast before/after work. So I've heard.

w7MiV7Tc2KX3mnMFYep9KQ.text: So my husband and I went to this bbq establishment because he knows I love bbq, and he actually tried this place first with his boss. He claimed it was great and "YES" it is. It is the best I have had here in Vegas. The price is not bad at all either. The establishment is a little small but as usual, the best places are hidden and small somewhere in town. I had a hamburger  that just looked delicious to me in the picture I saw there, so I ordered it but once I got it, boy was that HUGE!!!! The onion strips on the burger were so dang flavorful and crispy just the way I love crunchy onions to be. The meat is just full of greatness and I dare say a piece of heaven. My husband had some ribs and brisket, I had to try the ribs and those as well were not disappointing at all. To top it all off, the couple of employees we had interactions with were very graceful and welcoming. Most of all the place looked clean and did not have a funky smell, the way some places do. I do recommend this bbq Vegas hidden secret to anybody that loves a good bbq meal. :) I will be going there again. :)

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c6Q5JuTtbxspfUKdEZAfFg.text: Years in, thousands and thousands of customers later, Rollin Smoke is STILL maintaining a great restaurant. The recent popularity of American beef in developing nations has caused our prices to skyrocket. Personally, I can't believe I am paying what used to be "steak" prices for brisket (in 2000, brisket was about $1.50 a pound. Now, it's around $3-4 at retail), but that's the reality of the situation. Rollin' Smoke recently had to increase the price of their AYCE option and the rest of the menu should be creeping up soon, but there's nothing they can do.  I never thought I'd pay $53 for a brisket when I cook Q, but welcome to 2015.  I've been a handful of times (every three or four weeks) and perhaps it's talking Q with the owner, perhaps it's because I'm from Arkansas, he remembers my name. I'm not a big customer, but by golly, that's awesome.  They're still doing great meat and great service. This is top of the line barbecue and I have no hesitation to happily recommend it to my friends.

Jo60sO-hwTeUk-uLzan_7g.text: Found this place searching y'all saw that it had tons of great reviews so we came and tried it out for the first time absolutely amazing staff is friendly place is clean food is delicious

do_i8G6oymvdfVGvP7JOKQ.text: Ate twice at SEMA last week, both times were excellent. First was the rib platter, the corn nuggets are to die for, the second visit I ordered a Flinstone Beef Rib, Burnt ends, and the corn nuggets and Bbq Baked beans, all excellent!  The second visit I took about 8 People and they all were raving to the quality. The chart on the wall puts them as nbr2 in the country.  I'd definitely put them in the top ten, however I've eaten great Q in KC, TX, Memphis, the south, & all across the continent. JMO!  Can't wait till next year's SEMA

b_VadMvD95iesv5AU6ruPg.text: The meat was good. I got the five meats with rib tips instead of hot links. For my sides I got Mac and cheese, dirty rice and corn nuggets. The only side that was good was the corn nuggets. The Mac and cheese tasted like it had a chemical after taste and would make me sick if I kept eating it. The dirty rice was hard. Im.mot sure if it was the meat or the rice that was hard but it was gross. Only ate 2 bites of that. The pork, brisket and spare robs were good and the bbq sauce was good as well. It the sides tasted it better I would have gave  5 stars. Maybe I caught them on a bad night.

H84emuUJjN156dNA0JjV5A.text: Got call from leader of asian persuasion pack Terri R about trying someplace new out and ALWAYS stay down for trying new spots in town. More so ones that fellow yelpers rave about. Not sure the last time had some good old fashion ribs. So excited too get down and dirty. Talk about epitome of Hole in the Wall. Industrial Rd not exactly the prettiest road in Vegas but great for gentlemen clubs. Anyway so for second thinking going too one only too pass it and then once did get too Rollin Smoke Barbeque look down the street shocker another one. Once you do get here the smell from the pits literally parked right outside in the parking lot (I have no idea when they start but assume in the morning) and them ribs block out everything. I think Hole in Wall places have so much personality and character ALL its own.   Once get inside the menu is fairly small but they do have chalkboard with their daily specials. You go up too the cashier too order then they bring the food out too you. You sit wherever you like or have room. They have two room adjacent too one another and other room talk about personality on the walls with the art. How can you not love the boars head or pig head looking over the restaurant from one corner? They do still T-shirts that like the logo but next time go get one of kind T-shirt.   I decided too get The Trio plate. What better way too try little of everything or get my meat in. They out of the hot link so got double order of the pork. My sides went with the mac and cheese. I also ordered side of The Kickin Baked Bean. The pork was excellent! I could easily see myself tearing up pull pork sandwich. Guess is one of there more popular items. The ribs were solid little bit different style then the ones more use too but still solid. Wish could tell you about the hot links but save that for another review. The sides the mac and cheese was really good. It not cheesy cheesy but not runny also so had nice balance. The Kickin Baked Beans now that am FAN. I enjoyed the pieces of pork or beef that in it. I really did have nice little kick spice level too them. Even though it small menu fell like lot more thing for me too try.  The prices talk about reasonable priced! Compare too some of the other franchise places this place is a steal. You get so much more personality and one of kind experience. Under $20 you can fill yourself up with any combination and still have enough for desserts. The service is awesome! Small business owners that sense the personnel touch all around. It small place so just make sure you beat the crowd cause the place can fill out quick. If never been Rollin Smoke Barbeque someplace check out or fill like mixing up one night.   Thanks my partners Mel C and Terri R!!! You guys rock!!

xh2PcmToH6WSth-VRTWacQ.text: I like to take into consideration atmosphere, service and quality of food when making a review. Pulling up into an industrial area seemed a bit sketch but upon exiting the vehicle my nostrils were pleasantly filled with the best kind of smoke - Yep the smell of the kind of BBQ that makes your mouth water with expectation.  The service was fast and friendly and everything sampled was melt in your mouth delicious. Had ribs, brisket, hot links, Mac & Cheese, coleslaw & the corn.  Mmmmmmmmm so good and I love that they didn't slather everything in sauce.  NO NEED TO COVER UP OR MASK GREAT FLAVOR!!!

Philes is not in the running for Rollin Smoke. The sides alone are GREAT. They were melt in your mouth pieces of bbq heaven. Great smoky flavor and once again, beyond tender.   Pulled Pork- Excellent flavor, great portion size, nice and smoky. This may be the greatest pulled pork I've ever had.   Sides: Mac N Cheese (Cheesy and delicious), baked beans (best I've ever had), coleslaw (Excellent).   Service: INCREDIBLE! I couldn't believe how fast they got the food out. They were extremely friendly and knowledgeable. I can't say enough about how awesome their customer service was. Top notch!  IN CONCLUSION: This place is a MUST if you are in Las Vegas. It will become my got to place while visiting Vegas. This isn't just a BBQ joint, this is an experience. To get the full experience in sin city, don't even think about skipping out on this place.

LwOicZpOQQLltOzRGBYvRw.text: I love BBQ and try to hit different spots nationwide.  I was in Vegas and wanted to do off-Strip stuff this time around.  We decided to give this place a try given the great reviews.  Location, we are talking about a dark street next to a gentleman's club akin to uber hole in the wall.  Only in Vegas!  So we were greeted at the door by a taxidermed hog and in front of us in line were three police officers... My thoughts-heck yah we were in for something good!  Customer service was top notched.  I ordered the 1/2 rack baby backs ($17.99) and a pound of the brisket ($10.99).  Floored that sides were not included as with typical BBQ spots, which makes the pricing on the expensive side.    Baby backs came out and the color was a rich coffee grind black and just brilliant.  I was expecting some excellent bark.  But, oh Romeo, alas it was not meant to be!   There was no texture to the bark although the meat did fall off the bones.  The dry rub was mehhhh.   The three sauces had a more watery consistency than traditional BBQ sauces, which is absolutely fine.  There were three varieties - mama sweet, house, and BBQ.  The house had a nice balance between sweet and vinegar and was our favorite.  The brisket had what amounted to a peppercorn rub.  They love the peppercorn at this place. Perhaps it was the end of the night, but it came out very dry.   We ended up not eating most of it it, which was a shame.     While dining, we eavesdropped on a conversation.  Apparently this is Rick's (of Pawn Star fame) favorite spot and he and Rollin teamed up to open another spot in Rick's strip center by his pawn shop.   Well, sounds like Rick is rollin in the dough with his Rollin location, which we will check out next time we are in town.  Overall 3.5 stars. Not good enough to round to 4 though considering we've had so much better nationwide.

eFsFAt1HVlzA3NdWwLDxGg.text: The food is good here but I have had better BBQ. I think the star of the show is their dessert. I loved the banana pudding. Ultimately I thought the place was overpriced and seemed very commercialized. They also glorify their standing on Yelp, I am glad I tried it, but next time I am in Vegas I will be on the hunt for another BBQ joint.   Not to mention it's pretty cheesy how the workers ask you to give them a 5 star review on yelp, and even go as far as giving you a post it note with all their names on it. Come on now.

6y0hHbzGDCHq3nPBQLJ2RQ.text: We came here on a Wed looking for a late night restaurant past 11pm, and surprisingly, found a bbq joint on Yelp that was open!  Not a far drive from the strip, we were impressed by the many 4+ star reviews. Like many small bbq restaurants in the South and Midwest, they offered all the regular meats: brisket, sausage or hot links, BBQ Chicken, ribs, and pulled pork.  They offered a good selection of sides as well, and I ordered the 3 meat combo (brisket with 2 orders of pork ribs) with loaded mash as my sides.    The food was decent, but not great unfortunately. The pork was definitely fall of the bone tender, and the brisket was very dry and didn't have a great taste to it. They did offer a good selection of sauces to go along with the meat, but it didn't really help and I was really looking forward to some good bbq.  The problem may have been that it was 11:30pm and the food was being kept warm from earlier in the evening, but I'm still judging it based on what it was served. Maybe I'll come back during the day when the food was freshly cooked and it will be better.

zHWcjGNk_bTHcsFMgg5qsg.text: MUST READ: IF ANYBODY IS IN VEGAS VISITING,STOPPING THROUGH, OR LIVE HERE I STRONGLY SUGGEST EATING HERE !!!   I just got done eating their food & oh must I say this is the best BBQ I've Ever tasted. I chose the Duo choice of 2 meats (2 spare ribs & chicken w side of BBQ Beans) the ribs were very tender & chicken was delicious also. I ordered through grub hub which was such a plus because I didn't feel like getting up but grub huh was fast & Julian who delivered my food was polite. 7QJkUG-UAv8xVhbk2YI_Aw.text: I have been dying to try this place since I moved to town. The meat was everything I imagined. I got the double meat plate with 2 orders of ribs (4 ribs total) and bacon potato salad for the side. So delicious! The meat was so tender and full of flavor. It had a beautiful smoke ring on it and the house sauce was a perfect compliment to the rich, smokey meat.   The reason I gave 3 stars is because of the cashier. He could not crack a smile if his life depended on it. After the person in front of me was done ordering, I gave him a second to finish up until he called us and was ready to take our order. When he did, he acted like we were the stupid ones for not immediately coming up and bombarding him with our order. It was pure attitude from there. He has zero people skills or manners. No, "thank you," "you're welcome," or "enjoy," from him during the transaction. I don't need someone bursting with energy but at least have basic manners.

SSuvQMkMsLApNZB8jV5GjA.text: Wow.   Wow.   Wow.    Beef rib is ridiculously tender, thick and meaty.   Potato salad has a unique flavor, a lighter feel than normal and tasty bacon pieces.   Collard greens go down real easy.  Bbq beans have chunks of beef making it feel and taste like a stew.     This food is so amazing i had to stop in the middle of my lunch and write this review.   Oh--and the bbq sauces.  They have a spicy, a sweet, a vinegar, a mustard-y, and a couple others for good measure.   I drank a cupful of the mama sweet sauce it was so good.    Very easy to make a case for this place being the best i've ever had.

My BF ordered his favorite meatloaf and found it to be dry and not tasting very well.   We also tried the chicken wings which were burned and dry. It felt like the food was not fresh and reheated.  Spent 54.00 for a lunch that we threw away.   Don't buy all the hype!

puJmA9-MWflRmT2agQKgJg.text: Best kept secret. Found out even the locals don't know about this place or are just finding out about it. Had chicken, brisket and a beef rib. All of it was good. Beef melts in your mouth.  Friendly staff with good customer service. Sides (green beans, dirty rice, beans, cornbread) were also very good.  I will go again my next visit to Vegas.

eBMsrYga2jkM1ntwAio7Hg.text: Real good flavors going on here.  Ribs (Spare Ribs) are awesome.   Great cook and great taste....super tender and come of the bone with ease. Brisket is sliced thin....I prefer thicker cuts but the cook is great.  Nice balance in taste and not overly smoked or injected.  I like all brisket.....I just feel that thinner cuts lose some flavor. Hot Links are pretty solid....not a huge hot link fan but these are tasty and have a good depth of flavor for sure.  Sauces are awesome.  House sauce is real dang good but I gravitated more toward the Carolina Vinegar.  Had the Mac n Cheese, too.....super good.  Cheesy with the right amount of savory smack!  I was visiting Vegas but I will definitely be back here for future LV visits....

EyUlkb3ttU-Rmqizcvaoew.text: Memorial day wife had a craving for barbecue so I decided to take her down the Rowlands they were busy I would've the burnt ends she had chicken hotlinks and brisket 1 to 10 scale I'll give it a six I just think it's hard to find a really unique good barbecue I've only known to my entire life and I'm 64 it was good. Peach cobbler too sweet not enough dough. I think the highlight was the greens they were really good tasty greens

81EEb58M-K4mWLpKWE5bUA.text: Pulled pork, brisket burnt ends, smoked chicken wings, corn nuggets, mac and cheese were all to die for.  Beef ribs, hot links, baby back ribs were not my favorite but I am a picky BBQ eater. Overall still very good.  Customer service was great and prices were very reasonable also.

TrRMuhLlPcUg5Bv0XVSiSA.text: Amazing to go back and see my review from 2013, when this place was just getting its start. It is still that good. Juicy, smoky bbq goodness, done to near perfection (if not, perfection). I like the ribs, and the chicken, but the pulled pork, brisket, and other dishes are also worth their salt. The corned bread is some of the best I have tasted. The baked beans, mac and cheese, and veggies are no slouch, either.  I just ordered a platter for a birthday party, and it was scrumptious. Everyone, young and old, enjoyed the food.  The best part is the owner came out and brought the platter to my car. He is that humble. No wonder he is so successful.  God speed!

From pulled pork, brisket, corn nuggets to the baked beans all delicious! First time here and definitely will come back when we visit. A place to definitely visit! Be sure to come hungry!

XdTNMG-bXy-ulbwQ2JKNMg.text: Stepped out my car at the location and I can already smell the smokers.   The staff and atmosphere of the people around us were welcoming, Lizelle was our order taker and she was great. Threw a smile our way and didn't make our first time feel dull.   Depending on the weather you can eat inside or outside your choice, I've decided to eat inside. I've decided to get Trio of meats with one side so did my friend who came with me so we can taste as much as we can. I picked Brisket, Two Spare ribs and 1/4 chicken and I must say everything was delicious. I don't wanna use the "melt in your mouth" term so...everything dissolved and fell off the bone. Waffle fries were a great side as well. Meat quality and smoking was great but the sauces weren't all the amazing honestly(Personal opinion) although its on the side and you can just pick any sauce you want / try or none at all very optional.  I'll definitely be coming back and recommending this place to people.

Bn9qOj69zyDPoP_IEXCAlA.text: Mashed potatoes and smoked meatloaf was delish, as was the pulled pork and burnt ends! This place was definitely worth the Uber ride over! It's in a hole in the wall- but CLEAN- freshly washed tables, no spills, restocked lids, straws, plastic wear, napkins at the tables, and plenty of bbq sauce choices to suit your needs. As soon as you walk in the door your nose is filled with smoke-scented goodness!   The staff was super friendly and made sure we were well taken care of.  DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND GET HERE! We'll be back every time we're in Vegas!

sHQpeKdWu5rNWYgA_7QUOA.text: If you love BBQ, you really need to eat here! If you don't, seriously, you've wasted your entire bbq eatin' life!! THIS IS THE BEST BBQ I'VE EVER HAD! So! If you live in Vegas, are planning a trip to Vegas, or are in Vegas right now as you read this, GO GET THIS BBQ or give up and go Vegan cuz this is PHENOMENAL!! Everything else is just straight up stupid.   I ordered the Pit Special: Brisket, hot link, chicken, pulled pork, beef ribs, plus 3 sides, which were corn nuggets, loaded mashed potatoes and cheesy Mac. Every bite of meat was succulent and perfectly cooked. There's the perfect smoke flavor. Mama Sweet was my favorite sauce with a perfect balance of sweet.   This will be on my itinerary every time I visit Vegas. If I run out of things to see one year, I will still come JUST FOR THIS AWESOME BBQ!

QU1_s6WUU4lCxB69Hre7RA.text: Gross not worth the money. Don't know how they have good reviews wouldn't recommend for anyone to eat here my bbq pork was dry and disgusting.

uuX6qSgUcCJQ1NnjRA26kg.text: Tried to go here on a previous trip but it was Sunday and they were closed. But we remembered for next time, and were glad that we did. Very good BBQ.  We both got the chopped brisket sandwich. I got macaroni and cheese as my side and David got the BBQ beans. The brisket was very, very good. Excellent flavor, generous portion. I liked the variety of sauces, the sweet BBQ sauce in the large dispenser was our favorite. The mac and cheese was good, very creamy, with extra grated cheese on top. David raved about the beans, quite spicy but excellent. We both felt the roll for the sandwich was a lot of bread and didn't add a lot. We might get plates next time but we wish those came with two sides instead of one. Of course we could add a side. The sandwich was served with pickle chips but some chopped onion would have been nice.  People were very friendly. This place is a keeper. I bet we'll visit again on our next trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped brisket sandwich with mac and cheese.

ltqrtyxHM3h1Lgdp1F13NA.text: I was given a gift certificate to check this place out, but already planned to go anyway. I mean, I'm a BQ FANATIC, AND all around southern BBQ snob. You guys almost got perfection out here. I had pulled port sandwich loaded mashed potatoes, and sweet tea. The bun used for the sandwich was meh. But the rest is good. Let's talk about the BBQ sauce. I like the ones you have, but, for some reason the tomato based sauces out here in Nevada taste like ketchup. If you can make it more smokey, then I would up those stars. Lobed seeing the straight up Carolina vinegar sauce. And the gold was on point!

mSxadjwt7uyt2eNdUZTOiw.text: Visiting Vegas this past weekend and my friend and I had a hankering for some BBQ. So glad I found this place, some of the best Que I've had ever. We each got the 2 meat combo with one side. I got the brisket and pulled pork with bbq beans. My friend got the chicken and ribs with loaded mashed potatoes. We each got something different to split up. Glad we did. Everything was cooked to perfection, fall off the bone ribs, brisket nice and moist, mashed potatoes to die for, beans delicious, chickens thighs  just right, pulled pork yummy! Definitely going to be a must stop place whenever I'm in Vegas. Service was excellent as well. Oh, and prices were very reasonable.   Ps...we sat in the main dining area, which was kind of warm, but the have an extra area off the patio with great AC and a pig fish tank.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled Pork and brisket with BBQ beans.

JscWvjBVdI_COm9vipwJ_g.text: Best BBQ in Las Vegas hand down. Huge menu, fair prices and great customer service makes for a cool place to gang out, have a beer and eat some great food.

uRoq85uQ4HgkITdU7Uw5lw.text: Good for Vegas, but not mind-blowing. Notable exception was bacon potatoes salad- yum!

Gy2Fs7vdb-grUTXCatZN1w.text: I have been trying to eat here all week. It was pretty good. The corn nuggets are heaven. The right ranch dressing would make them perfect.  Links are good nice and spicy.  Chicken wings were good nice and big.  The baked beans were spicy spicy. My daughter loved the Mac and cheese wish I had gotten a taste it looked good.

srbDKiIX3geDvDn11jotVg.text: Best BBQ in LV. All I gotta say. We come here every time we're in Vegas. And if you're too scarred of the seedy off-strip  neighborhood, then you don't deserve BBQ this good.

IlnJqvfjgNCl6Ij--pgtSw.text: One of our new favorite haunts. Great BBQ with generous portions. The Pit Special is plenty to split with a friend.

pxUO9UYhTngdU674Y9tXvQ.text: When I ate meat we went here all the time. Food is outstanding, best BBQ in Vegas. You can tell the chief has a passion for the food he makes. If you haven't tried this place yet you may want to. Great food, good price always friendly people working there. If you go and they have the chicken and waffle it is better than Roscos in LA!

6YWCFo9rzAN73UAuKUF3eg.text: Best BBQ in town! Amazing everytime!! The staff is super welcoming whether it's your first time or 100th visit :) Best catfish and hush puppies I've had too.. Stop by!! You won't regret it. TIP: ask for a side of the spicy bbq sauce ;) soooo yummy

eJm2wyOl8PAkWanthrgdTg.text: We loved the food and service. We got there close to closing time and they were nice enough to stay open for us.  We took our friends and they loved it too

LT5alVUB4LIoQ7n3fPNOoA.text: Though I'm not a big fan of the sauces. The food is really good and it's priced right

9V7JZYyGREumtD_XmE9jbA.text: The BBQ was good, but the sides were disappointing.  I had my mind all set on beef ribs, but when I got to the counter to order they were out.  Quick switch to a sandwich and shared some sides with my friends: hush puppies, corn nuggets, beans & corn bread.   The beans were a strong disappointment, perhaps because that is one of my favorite parts of good old fashioned Kansas City barbecue.  Here the beans were a little too firm for my taste and the sauce was thin and not quite as flavorful as I would have liked.  The hush puppies were decent, the corn bread was moist but more in the style of a cake batter with a very small amount of cornmeal added.  The fried corn nuggets were ok. My sandwich was good and the meat was tender, though as others have commented I added quite a bit of BBQ sauce to it. One aspect I didn't care for was the "messiness" in the dining area.  I certainly understand that operating a high volume dining establishment is hard work, especially when the food is messy to eat, but it can be done.  After placing my order and looking for available seating, several of the spots still had used napkins or debris at the tables.  The open spot we chose had plastic utensils on the floor under the seats and the condiment bottles were messy.  I was facing the back station where customers could grab napkins or tea and the white front was covered with scuff marks and such.

P9l5fjDHYaS0lNZNddKLWw.text: This place has awesome ribs. I got the rib platter with 3 different meats. Beef, pork, n brisket. All were tender n flavorful. For my first time here I was quite satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 different meats, beef, pork, and brisket. With beans that has shredded pork and sausage. Very tasty. :-)

ZI_yfE1pk9mgSCgkpGwE7Q.text: Yes, I finally rolled in to Rollin Smoke after the many raving reviews from my Yelp Peeps.  I am super WAY over due for this joint.  I do think I have told at least 15 people about this place since our visit last Saturday.  If that doesnt say how I feel about this place, how about the leftovers that I ate for breakfast the next day.  Yes, I must say this is simply (but not simply stated) the best BBQ I have ever EVER had.  Dont let the location fool you...its part of its finger lickin good charm and you cant beat the smell of pure goodness when you pull into the parking lot.  When we first arrived a couple was leaving voicing that they will be back next year - as they come here every year when they visit Vegas.  I think that says alot too. ...a must have for tourists too?!  We both ordered the sliders-both coming with 3 and you can pick what meat you want.  I had the chicken and the brisket while my man had the chicken, brisket and the hot link sliders.  He said the hot links were his favorite-IF there could even be a favorite.  All of it was totally fab.  For sides we had the waffle fries and the mac and cheese.  The waffle fries were sprinkled with a sweet and salty flavoring that I loved and I'm still craving and wont be satisfied until I have more.  The mac and cheese was super creamy.  I thought it was very good.  Alot of the times mac comes out all dry and coagulated.  Not the case here.  I could literally eat a big bowl of it and call it a day.  ***ehem But I wouldnt recommend it only because there is SO much more important things to savor.  Lets talk about the meat - yes their slogan is that they "rub their meat" and however you take it consider that some good lovin (hehe).  The meat is smokey and savory....meat with FLAVOR!  The sauce was perfect (not too sweet, not too thick)-and Im very picky about sauce.   The portions were so huge.  I'm sure the guy thought I was not sure what I was getting into when I ordered the 3 sliders.  I brought home 1 1/2 that was leftover and like I said I think I must have been dreaming about it all night because I did have to dig into that first thing the next morning.  As I opened the box all I could smell was the smokey heavenly goodness and I knew right then it was going to be a good day.  So yeah on Wednesday I was sat down and asked to not be mad.....hmmm yes my man went there for lunch without me.  And YES damn right I was mad.  LOL  Yes, peeps....it is JUST THAT GOOD.  I cannot wait to go back.  Well heck Ive already checked into the catering menu so I can order for my next party.  If you are looking for a winner.....this is IT.     *side note...they are closed on Sundays.  :(

vsglZHn_4z30uQeU9fYgMA.text: Spareribs were amazing! My boyfriend loved his chipotle rap. Their waffle fries are seasoned super tasty and a side of Mac n cheese was good. But the beef rib was too fatty to enjoy and the free berry cobbler was mush and inedible. We came around 2 on a Saturday afternoon and there was no line and lots of seating. The custom fish tank is super cute!

_IV7KQ7peyNos2Qb1mq1xQ.text: Anything you get here will be amazing! Great service! And very quick! You will leave extremely satisfied!!!

Kjc9v5DJ0serpViIzPQ4gA.text: great service, reasonable prices, and really good food.  I had the dad sandwich and my wife had the potato with pulled pork.  Both had a good smokey flavor.  The sauce was not too sweet.  And had the berry cobbler for dessert.  It was good enough, where I considered having it more than 1 time, in the same vacation!

0-6k9n_xHCYGYRCx23GOTg.text: The BEST BBQ I have had in a very long time!! I don't think I'll buy BBQ from anywhere else going forward! The beef ribs are AMAZING! Juicy, tender, and smokey mmmmmm so good! And locals get 10% off.. Boom!

2bExThIqCGjSYxWaROcPew.text: OK so I went to the electronics store in the same small strip mall with a friend. We decided to try out Rollin smoke. The small Asian gal that took our order did not smile, did not seem friendly, and it was only 11am so not sure why she would be so grumpy so early in the day. I had the catfish po' boy for $12.99. It comes with no sides, with nothing. The sandwich has two pieces of fried catfish, not big and not small, also lettuce, tomato and a yellow mustardy 'tartar sauce'. The fish was mushy, not sure how else to explain it. The lettuce wilty, the tomato over ripe. It also came with sliced onion. The menu does not mention the onion, had it mentioned them, I would have had them removed as I am allergic to onion. Not worth the $13. My friend had the two meat plate for $13.99. He chose the pulled pork and the chopped brisket. His also came with a side so he chose the cheesy mac n cheese. His was all good. Not a lot of meat, not sure it was worth the $13.99 but much closer to being worth the cost than the catfish sandwich was.  So to recap, do NOT get the fried catfish sandwich. Not worth it, and not that good. The onion taste on the wilty lettuce with mustard instead of real tartar sauce on mushy catfish.... the duo meat plate was not bad. And just deal with the grumpy order taker. As you can see from my reviews, I rarely give a 1 star rating... so listen to it. Better to go to the Big B's in Henderson or the John Mull's Road Kill Grill on Thom blvd in northwest Las Vegas.

K1ue28xMn0LmQbbO_kYDdA.text: I've tried all types of BBQ from Texas to Colorado and I gotta say Rollin Smokes does it right. Their portions are definitely not small so come prepared to open the top button on your pants. We had a party of 5, and we had 6 slabs of ribs (huge portions), Mac & cheese, and hot links. I'll definitely will be back when I'm in vegas again.

6a37rCS81miDa1XLpKdfvw.text: This was a great find. When we arrived they welcomed us as if we were family coming over for a southern lunch. The sweet tea is just that. We ordered the rib platter, catfish, peach cobbler with the corn 'out of this world' nuggets, yams, and the fresh picked GREENS. Since we ordered so much food for only 2, we were expecting a huge To Go bag. By the time we finished, we had a half of beef rib left and our dessert. We have plans to go back for the meatloaf.  By the way, this my first Yelp review ever.  They deserve it.  Thank you Mama & Chef Tim.

QykK4IbvoAtMUEzSE7imhA.text: a good place to eat and taste mouth- watering bbq. it was my first time to try it and it was aoooo good! definitwly, will be back

tW8_YsoVjiI-Tdw7G4loPQ.text: Wow! the workers are the nicest people and the food is so good! I tell all my friends about how good the food is.  Thank you for helping to make our holiday menu a tasty success!!! The Best BBQ in Las Vegas!

QxQWYKTziQOZy4xeiEaqZQ.text: We were lured here by the great reviews and found all the dishes and sides to be average and not memorable.  We tried the pulled pork sandwich, the brisket three ways (sliced, chopped, burnt ends), and the outlaw burger.  We also tried the waffle fries, the corn nuggets, onion straws, and potato salad.    Brisket was tough.  Burnt ends were overly soggy.  Pulled pork was decent but not a wow.  Outlaw burger is huge but was dry and overly cooked.    The sides are just ok - with the onion straws being the highlight.     We did enjoy the variety of "arkansauces" that added significant flavor to the meats and are a recommended addition to food.

GjU2lWNZXBpCkebjI2r1jw.text: This was my first time going to this place.  My boss needed a hefty amount of food for a work meeting that started at 11:00 A.M. Mind you this place opens at  10:00 A.M.  He had listed multiple items that he wanted. I've never been there before, so I had no clue where to start, or how much to get.  I was a little nervous that I would some how mess something up.   I was greeted, and helped by the amazing catering manager Karina Litvak. She asked me a few basic questions, and knew exactly what and how much I needed.  She was so helpful, and kind she instantly lifted a weight off of my shoulders.  The kitchen staff was on top of things, and made sure everything was packed nicely.  As far as I know the food was a success!  I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good BBQ place with an awesome staff. Thanks again Karina! You're a gem!

An_stNMTPAjexR69NMbWWw.text: Very delicious food here. We found this place and decided to make it our preferred bbq place. Small place but very big flavor. Everything on the menu is good so you will not be disappointed.

DJmZ18o8bW3v1L6aBnfUew.text: Really great service with fast moving lines and food came in really quick. Ribs were rollin in flavor, the brisket burnt ends were coo and the hot link had a kick. BBQ on point, so I would recommend to anybody  here in Vegas that like BBQ to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They really smokin with the fast service, fast moving lines. Really great BBQ ribs on point

yFKcJLdrF4WG1c1RRHg5gQ.text: This place was superb. Ribs, brisket, sausage all really tasty. I'm from Texas so I usually prefer a dry rub and heavy smoke in my BBQ but good food is good food. The server, Sofia, that assisted me and my party was intuitive and genuinely friendly. I'll be back.

gE0a3tYapajS2U0hTUDdDg.text: I am giving them 4 stars because in my opinion the food is phenomenal.  However, I had to overlook their abysmal delivery history in order to do so.  If you pick up and check your items thoroughly, you will have the pleasure of eating some of the best seasoned BBQ this town has ever offered.  This place has killer brisket (especially good sliced), phenomenal beef ribs and delicious side items that many chain restaurants don't offer.  Their salads are also unique, but ask for extra dressing; the 2 tiny containers they give you are not sufficient.  They cost a little more than average for a lunch, but the flavor and quality is worth every penny.  But be warned!  If you use Grubhub or some other delivery service your order will likely be missing items if they don't inexplicably reject the order outright the first time you attempt it.

0SNjCSSahgsxEK2bt7z1-g.text: This is my new favorite BBQ spot! The most tender, flavorful spare ribs I've ever eaten. They actually smoke the meat and there is evidence of that, since when I walked in, my eyes started watering immidietely (I have sensitive eyes) from the smoke inside the restaurant. However, that did not hinder my expirience since the food is damn good. I will be taking my food to go until some sort of vents are installed. There are two rooms and some seating outside. It looks like a hole in a wall but those tend to have really good food. I only expirienced the first room (when you just walk in) so may be the second room does not get effected by the smoke or has vents, I would not know.  Items tried: Spare ribs, wings, chicken, the outlaw burger, waffle fries, mac n cheese, hush puppies. Favorites: Spare ribs, waffle fries (so good!). The others mentioned were pretty good too. Don't belive me? On the fence? Go try it and write about it!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance

bGnwzoLgFDtUpJSej6Jn2w.text: So Delicious... Food game out fast and was succulent and tender. I ordered the beef ribs and they brought me two HUGE ribs and I ordered a side of mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was the BEST Ive ever had! Like au gratin style with cheddar cheese sprinkled on top. I am definitely coming here again on my next visit and bring some new comers as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ribs with house sauce and mac and cheese :)

UTmafv99tWVo2ynECFNvzQ.text: This is rate as my top favorite Will and Liz have great customer service and welcome us Michiganders great love ! Ultimate potatoes is enough to feed four ppl! Rib tips were so tender the dirty rice is so good! I recommend to stop by here when in Vegas

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Liz and Will was excellent great customer service! The food omg was great. There ultimate potatoes is enough to feed four ppl!

oDUS2FqSKDw6u6BRMvOT-w.text: Oh dauuuum!!! This is too good!!! Hands down 10/10 the meat is soft and the house BBQ is great. I hate eating on the strip so this place is great and the portions are good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pull piggy sandwich was perfect

ckH3uAYAi8YN13ccCrI5mg.text: This is in a dark corner plaza off strip, so it's hard to miss! It's right after the freeway bridge if you're coming from the main strip.   I shared the three meat plate with my boyfriend. It was enough for both of us, and you get 3 meats, 2 sides, 1 drink, and a roll for under $15!  Bacon potato salad was super yummy! :)  Spare ribs were my fave. Fall off the bone, tender, and sauce was great (peppery bbq sauce).   The hot link tasted like any other bbq'd hot link... Nothing special but was delish with the sauce (they cover all their meats with the same sauce I believe..)  Brisket.. My bf liked it.. But this was my least favorite. It was dry and flavorless. :(  I wouldn't recommend doing the ayce unless you can eat A LOT. because one of the meat plates is already pretty filling.

tYJhc3NatVvWRrUmFPNAfw.text: Destination BBQ.  Located in an industrial area well off the Strip, you drive past all the strip clubs wondering whether you made the right call.  Buried in a strip mall, I almost missed it coming from the north.  Really good, no particular style BBQ.  It's rubbed and not sauced.  I had the rib combo, getting baby back, spare, and beef ribs.  All were delish' fall-off-the-bone good; even better with the house BBQ sauce.  Classic potato salad topped with bacon and scallion and mac & cheese were a perfect match.

ywDmly3UkwTxkEdse4GZYw.text: I had the outlaw burger with fries. The fries were ok but the burger was oh so yummy!! It had strips of fried onion, cabbage, lettuce and tomato. Pickles and a banana pepper on top. It was huge!!! I could only finish about a third of it.   Guy at the register warned me the burger would be big. It was a lot more than I had expected.   Also had a plate with brisket and pork. (Not pictured). Also very yummy.  They're open kinda late. Located NEAR desert inn and highland.   On the other part of the place- through a different door- you'll find the hog fish tank that was featured on Tank'd!!! How awesome is that? :)   I'm not usually a fan of BBQ but I'll definitely be coming back here to try other things from their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piggy fish tank!!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The outlaw burger and some waffle fries.. this burger is huge!!

r4vX4R_CWABUjm--M1K4Kw.text: The best barbecue in town. You can taste the passion in the food and I love that - that is what you get out of a local joint that lacks at a Famous Dave's. The people that work there are great and always engage in conversation, they're not just order takers.  The side of cornbread is awesome. Super moist and covered in butter. And the brisket just falls apart. I'm also a fan of hot bbq sauce, but their house sauce is great. I eat here whenever I'm in the area.   The only downfall is the service time. But I understand it's a small place with high demand so I already account for that prior to my arrival. Heard there's a second location downtown -- will be checking it out someday soon!

KrhsyQQVGku_aY3RI5gfIA.text: Note: I'm not a Bbq person I've never really liked the vinager sauce taste. I'd prefer dried rub.  My friends and I were in town and yelped led us here. My friends and got got the family mean for 4 or something like that for $30 something bucks not bad.  We got to try a bit of everything and it was soo good. The sauce wasn't too heavy or thick or vinagery idk how to describe it but it was good. Everything was nice and tender melt in your mouth good! Load mash potato and mac and cheese is to die for!! Everytime we are in own we must eat here.

8QKw0FsQd9FTmiRgNjwuKA.text: great food, good atmosphere. The staff was very friendly lizelle took my order with a smile and made us feel welcome. def a good place in the cuts.

J_UrXV0Io9NeiPFXBT08Kg.text: I have been to the restaurant many times. Also had them Cater multiple office functions. Cant wait to use them again.

gO5qGqikNQQzmsN_LY202A.text: What a great place to eat!!! The owners/chefs are friendly and fantastic. The special for the day was a mountain of food for $5.00. We spent $43.00 for three people today and ended up taking more food home than we ate because the portions are so generous!     I've reviewed my share of smoked BBQ places in my current home town of Jacksonville FL and this is the standard by which I measure. For all of the BBQ restaurants that earned less than 5 stars: This is what you want your food to taste like!

NeELqmsw3GuSOhffELDzTQ.text: First time here, Lizelle recommended the short ribs and man they were really juicy. Will come back and check out what else they got.

2urVrbwW3UMUIhyBjKJtOQ.text: I would have gave them 5stars but the sausage was way greasy, all else was amazing! We tried what is called the pit special which comes with five meats and three sides for $30.30

PE21wTsFjAU1FdbG0vtA3Q.text: Best BBQ I've had so far in Las Vegas! I wanted to try so many things I got the $36 all you can eat and it was definitely worth it! My favorites were the baby back ribs, the corn nuggets, and the hot links. Ohhh the catfish and shrimp were really great too! I was soooo full when I walked out I literally was in a food coma! I know they have multiple locations but this ones definitely worth the drive. I love all the options for sauces too. Only qualm I have was the kool-aid definitely needed more sugar! I'll be back again for sure!

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ribs, meatloaf, shrimp, baked beans and cornbread.

B_wZdT10fSxvIVZMkAfTRw.text: Good food,  here are some notes: Mac'n cheese, awesome Bacon Potatoe salad, awesome Dirty rice, awesome Corn fitter, good but on the sweet side  All meats were good and rich, sliced beef brisket, ribs baby and spare, hot link (not too hot. I'd say mild)  Good stuff all-around!

Urt40GxeMyPJvLponfvvsQ.text: This is my second time coming here. Stopped in last time I was out here for work. One of my buddies showed us this spot. Place is legit. The workers are way cool from taking your order to bringing the order to your table. One of the workers was on the phone resolving a customer complaint/issue and handled it all in stride. You can tell they truly care about the experience and brand.  Wish we would have listened to one of the workers who said if you aren't that hungry go with the half rack (2 ribs) instead of getting the full rack that came with 4 but these ribs are the damn truth. Glad I don't live here because this place would be the death of me. The corn nuggets are a must as well if you come here. The creamy corn that is fried on the outside is killer.  This place is a must every time I am in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Ribs
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

TUmC0FEuTK4u2HNY0ZZveA.text: Best BBQ in the world! Jus sayin! We literally drive from SoCal to eat what my crew calls "eating some smoke." Seriouly gotta try the ribs, the rub, the yams, the mac 'n cheese, sliced tri-tip, greens, all of it. The even have koolaid on tap. Love how the meats are on the slice of white bread to sip up the juice. I like to finish with the cobbler or the banana pudding. This is a family owned BBQ - you'll feel like you've been welcomed in their kitchen. They are so friendly and down home. This family puts love into their food. My hubby and I have been eating here since they first opened. We have watched them expand, and expand their little store... but the quality has never suffered. They told us they still use their seasoned smoker which gives their meat it's unique tasty flavor. They have many hommade sauces too. Love ya Rollin Smoke

_GXp-ajejGMfqDaWOnAkFw.text: Food was awesome and worth going off the strip for.  Pulled pork, burnt ends, Mac and cheese and the corn bread are excellent.  Owner Dusty is the man and I'm happy I checked this place out.  Will be back again.

yttViPGiOY81wLPBSoHYvQ.text: Worth stopping by and finding yourself something to enjoy.  Even as a vegetarian, I could snack on the delicious mac and cheese. The taste was good and I appreciated that they didn't drown the noodles in cheese sauce. The sweet sauce in particular tasted great on it. My husband's brisket and pork were cold, though he was also a fan of the sauce options.

VJ2j8Nn3SJWIqwM0lXK4mA.text: What an amazing bbq joint to stumble out in Vegas! My wife and I ordered the Pit Special because we would be able to sample 5 meats and 3 sides. It was a lot of meat.   Meats:  1. Brisket - you can choose to get it sliced or chopped. I asked for it sliced. The brisket was lean. Having been to enough bbq joints, some will ask if you prefer moist (more marbled) or lean (less fat). At many places, lean ends up tasting too dry but in this case, it was not dry at all. Just moist lean smoky meat! Very delicious! I was very impressed. This was the 2nd best brisket I've ever had. I give the brisket an A.   2. Spare ribs - these ribs weren't the type where the meat just falls off the bone. They were meaty and had great texture and the wonderful smoked bbq flavor. These also get an A.   3. Pulled pork - this was the best pull pork I've ever had. Again, it was just so moist but still maintained great flavor and texture. This gets an A+.  4. Hot links - haven't found many bbq joints do a bad job on hot links and Rollin Smoke hot links were no different. So delicious. Score: A  5. Chicken - the chicken was good but not as great as the rest of the meats. Maybe it just wasn't as good because I had already started getting full. Score: B  Sides:  1. Fried okra - highly recommended 2. Collard greens - these were really special. Most collard greens have ham in them which makes them way too salty or the greens are too soft and soggy. These weren't too salty at all. What made these collard greens so special was in place of ham, they use brisket. I've never had collard greens that had brisket in them so I didn't know what to expect, but these were amazing! A+ 3. Waffle fries - I love potatoes and have nothing negative to write about these. Crispy on the outside sprinkled generously with seasoned salt and the right texture on the inside. A  Service - amazing! My wife and I were so impressed that Dusty, one of the owners was sweeping the floors and wiping down tables while coming around to check up on every patron. Dusty is one of the nicest, most personable person I've met. In talking to him, it was obvious he takes great pride and care in making sure the bbq is world class. He could tell I appreciated great bbq so he offered my wife and I a sample of his burnt tips. Most burnt tips are exactly that - burnt. If something is burnt, it's dry and hard. Not these Rollin Smoke burnt tips. These were simply outrageously awesome - my absolute favorite item on the menu. So moist and carmelized. Highly recommend ordering these! A++++. Yeah, they are THAT good.   Next time we're in Vegas again, we'll be visiting Dusty's, Rollin Smoke! Bravo, Dusty, on a great job! Peeps, this business is worth supporting!

4ZT_f98bEMZv5LTu-2HABA.text: Our trip to vegas was slowly winding down, I hope by now if your a follower that you know how I roll, "if it aint broke, don't bother fixin."  This spot got me since day 1 like 2 years ago. some of the meatiest ribs ive had and sauces for these ribs, spot on!!!  Also had the pulled pork, its all so good you just cant stop eating!   It was late and I was prepared for the worsed, fortunately Dominique and Steve made my experience truly remarkable. I called and asked if I had enough time to get there and order and normally anywhere lets you know they close at 10, here I was told come on down we'll take care of you.   I make it and Steve takes our order, again right before closing employees are trying to get the heck out of there, not Steve, he made recommendations let us know that some things are so good that they just ran out, things are made fresh daily so once theyre out, theyre out....  The cobbler!!!!! aaaahahhhhh so gooooood!!!!  ill be back in a month :)

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great service minutes before closing, thanks Steve and Dominique

4ENc9iYIzNew5Ci2z_lVUA.text: This restaurant is located off the strip area in LV. It was recommended to me by a coworker, he knows I like BBQ and he told me " you have to give this place a try. " The restaurant itself is a hole in a wall type of place . It looks like the place is located in a industrial looking area. The place actually looks kinda beat up. There is parking in front . Inside the restaurant there is plenty of seating. It's park bench seating. The BBQ is very good. The meat is tender and has a lot of flavor. I've stopped by this place a few times and have never been disappointed. The SERVICE is always friendly. This BBQ is worth the trip away from the strip. The BBQ sides are very good as well. Fresh ingredients and very tasty. If you like BBQ and you're in LV it's a good choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a2vqZvYm4MVwE3fT2OHI1Q.text: We are in heaven here our new fave place.  This establishment is extremely clean and employees are usually always cleaning up or asking you if there is anything they can get or help with. Service is excellent!! Very friendly staff everyone!!  Very cool place. Food, wow freaking so bomb delish fabulous extreme a beautiful things.  Family friendly. Los Angeles highly recommends this establishment yum!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gSucUe2XgTth_Oy2Z5g1zA.text: Me and my husband stayed two days in Vegas and I came across this place on yelp and begged him to let us try. We were not disappointed! It was so good! We did the all you can eat and my gosh we were full after the first round but kept going. I got brisket, ribs, and pulled pork with the sweet cornbread and Mac and cheese, and oooooooowweeee it was amazing! That cornbread is like no other. I could eat that by the pound. The pulled pork had great flavor. My husband had the brisket, ribs, and catfish with a side of yams and Mac. He loved the brisket.   Our second round was when we were able to pick whatever you wanted off the menu. I got the brisket dog and some chicken wings and corn bread. My husband got the hot links, shrimp, and catfish. We were so full after it. And everything was amazing. I've never seen a concept like this. This is a keeper. Wish they had this in San Diego. We are definitely making this a must everytime we come back.

EmAwqrsmNAG6VLSiOerbpQ.text: First time here and definitely will return! Ordered the Brisket and chicken with a side of bacon potato salad.  When the Brisket is so good you don't have to add a sauce you know your in the right place! This rivals with some I have ever had, hand down. The chicken was moist and the potato salad was perfect.  On the menu, self-described "Southern comfort food at its very best," based around hand-rubbed meats. Specialties include "Pit Specials," of brisket, pulled pork, chicken, spare ribs and hot links, their "Outlaw Burger," featuring a hamburger mix of brisket, onion and bell pepper and another local favorite, "Smoked Meatloaf." I've already suggested this place to the crews at work.  I'll be back to try the rest of the menu.
