TlrwHM6IwSefFYvTXYT2oA.text: I'm so glad my boyfriend and I came here instead of the other bbq places to get my fix.  Great food and great service!  It's our first time here so we ordered the Pit Special with 5 meats and 3 sides. For the sides got the kickin bbq beans, loaded mash and corn nuggets. All came out delicious, decent portion. Make sure you come here with an empty stomach!   The sauces, phenomenal!   I'm so bummed I forgot the lady's name behind the counter but she was very sweet.  We will definitely come back and recommend this place to friends and family :)

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pit Special  yummy!

ET8X2oRIY4h4w5bGFohGWA.text: Fun, touristy and if you are a fan of the TV show associated with this place, you'll love it. We enjoyed the atmosphere and they honestly have the best spicy BBQ sauce I've ever had in my entire life, I need to find out where to order some!!! Bartenders (especially Ally) was awesome, along with the other little girl. The owner showed up, I didn't know who he was, but others seem to enjoy his company, seemed sincere. Oh yeah, best banana pudding, too.

-x9drmuEOJIPvyuGR6QD4A.text: Legit Q.   It's been said a few thousand times here and it is True.  Sketch neighborhood. Tons of parking.  Smoked meat by the pound or the plate.    Great sides, great help, and about the best BBQ I have had in Vegas, hands down. Pricing is right in line with excellent bbq too.  This trip we had the brisket, the pulled pork, the chicken, and the hot links.  Sides were beans, mac n cheese.  Everything was spot on and fantastic.

fVC8rkBrFMjPo_XGkAsGVA.text: Absolutely amazing. This bbq tasted like to was cooked with love. Like a family member made it. Great sauces too and was excited there was sweet tea.

ao-YKKcPX7j_NHAtQXWpDQ.text: Ok... I would have given them a 2 1/2 stars if that was the option. Location - Easy to find. Customer Service - A PERFECT 5 - the guys at the counter were welcoming.  FOOD - Barbeque? mmmmmh, ok this is where it gets interesting. I admit I am a bit bias.  We are from the South and we've had amazing Barbecue in Dallas, Houston, Atlanta, so we were in comparison mode, not to mention the reviews left us curious. The Ribs were cooked well but it's FLAVORLESS.  I like my Ribs dry so that was perfect but after that?? there's no Taste. It's Bland. The Mac&cheese was too al dente.... needed to be cooked maybe 2 minutes more. The Brisket were cooked perfect but again.. NO TASTE.. the meats are bland. I guess if you haven't tried other BBQ joints, you'll say this is a good spot but we beg to differ. This is what we call FIRST and LAST!

PYasgoo47m2htmUVxQlmpw.text: Wanted to try something new at Las Vegas, I always eat at some buffet or go to hash house a go go. Was watching Strictly Dumpling and he featured this BBQ place and it looked good.  Contemplated on the all you can eat but decided to share the Pit Special with my friend. This was plenty enough food for the two of us especially when you get three sides on top of the meats. We got the loaded mash, Mac and cheese, and the corn bread. Everything was really good, my favorite meat was the brisket it was nice and juicy and the spicy bbq balances it out well.   I also got the banana pudding and the meatloaf to go. Both were really good and I'm sure if I didn't wait 6 hours to eat the meatloaf it would have been stupendous.  Will definitely try to come here again.

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet Corn Bread, Loaded Mash, Cheesy Mac N Cheese

puJjMLVCuMzPYxGXRvdLFg.text: OMG!! That place is delicious!!! I ordered the beef ribs and have to say one of the best ribs I ever had, you definitely should try them. Also I had pulled pork it was good ( I had better before) but they deserve 5 stars! I ordered take away and the food was ready as soon as I got in, loved that!  Definitely recommend!!!!

UGI7UjXRQ5suE39j8g2VaA.text: This food is decent, but when looking at what you get for the price, feel like a rip off. Super small portions  We have to order $40 just to feel comfortable for 2 people and the sides are truly a joke! Tasty food, but I feel like I'm on a diet! If I am eating this type of food I don't want to feel like that!   Good Ribs, chicken and spicy sausage, I just need a bit more for the price!

xpri4my6CCJ6TaPw1jSnpQ.text: I've heard how amazing Rollin' Smoke is since before I stared Yelping! I was super happy when the stars aligned and we got Jessie and her hubby Bill, Dyanna and her man Brent and Joel and I all in one place for dinner. This was also Jessie's and Bill's first time as well as ours.   It was a Saturday night so it was busy. It's the kinda spot you order first and then you find seating. Joel ordered the famous Outlaw burger and I got the Triple meat with brisket, ribs, and hot links my side was potato salad and Joel's side was Mac & cheese. We totally lucked out and scored a large table big enough for all of us. It seemed like we just sat down and our names were called and out came the order. Wow! Joel's burger was huge! Like so big he didn't know how to start on it. He enjoyed it a lot. The Mac & cheese was ok nothing special. I really liked my brisket and hot links. The meat was tasty and tender. I was disappointed that the ribs were tough. Because I expected fall off the bone tender. Not a big fan of Rollin' Smokes sauce either. I prefer a thicker sauce. I did enjoy the potato salad and it reminded me a lot of what I make at home. Joel also used the Yelp check in offer for a free dessert. He choose the banana pudding which he loved.   The atmosphere was bare, but had picnic tables and TVs. The dining area is split into two rooms. Because the turn over is so quick the tables tend to get dirty which is the downside. The staff was friendly, but since they were super busy they might have needed more people.   The food didn't blow me away, but it was good. I want to go back again to try some other things on the menu. Plus, they did have excellent pickles!!! What a fun night! Glad to be able to check Rollin Smoke off my Yelp bookmarks list!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three meats! Brisket, ribs &amp; hot links. Side of potato salad &amp; pickles!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw Burger with Mac &amp; cheese

bGKjWrd45qC3mvA9y4Q-zw.text: Yes Yes Yes, feels like home.  Try the meatloaf, corn, you really cannot go wrong.  The vibe is right, the good is great snd plentiful, loved it!

9lO0x4ajeEhMZ_hgsxaPvQ.text: Wasn't impressed at all. Over priced bbq and apparently enough people keep going back for them to stay in business. Bbq had not much flavor either and forget about asking to get cornbread with your meal like most southern dishes already come with, they will tell you it comes with white bread that costs .25 so they can't substitute it. Lol amazing Save your money and go away from the strip to Road kill grill. Better food and prices!

NhhRVXtRECB10YfBH_BBqA.text: This is the best BBQ in Vegas and quite possibly the best I've ever had.   I ordered 2 Pit Specials to go and just sat and breathed in the delicious smells that envelop the entire business, inside and out. It was heavenly.   The Pit Special consists of 4 meats and 3 sides. We got the brisket, pulled pork, 1/4 chicken and 2 spare ribs with kickin beans, bacon potato salad and onion straws with one order and cole slaw substituting the onion straws on another. I had to go up and place an additional order of corn bread, banana pudding and blueberry cobbler because the longer I stared at the menu, the more I wanted to try.  The portions were generous and each Pit Special fed 2 of us. The meat was awesome! All of it! I loved the chicken and ribs. Juicy, smoky, perfect. The sides were all delicious. The beans were a little too peppery for me but still a great flavor and the cole slaw & bacon potato salad were quickly inhaled. Oh and the BBQ sauce was sweet and also perfect.  We stuffed ourselves.  The staff were friendly, courteous and it was apparent that they loved their jobs. I see no reason to ever go to another BBQ joint in this town. Nothing else compares and I can't wait to try their many other offerings.

0zgLtmymwYxwoEO8GtED4g.text: This is the most dry meat I've ever eaten.  Calling it bbq has to be a mistake.  Everything is just dry.  I'm wondering what the people ate that gave the good reviews. There was no smoke flavor and I swear folks think bacon makes everything better. Well it needs to start out decent to be made better by bacon. Bland potato salad with bacon, still bland potato salad.  The rib tips had to be a day or two old. The beef ribs were way over cooked. And the sauce exploding on my husband's shirt was the icing on the cake.  The 5 stars are for the chef offering to fix the situation and giving us fresh food. The first impression is a lasting impression. But the fact that they were really nice made it better. I may give it another try. I've heard good things about this place.  Maybe we just came on the wrong day.

EEpIMkFX3kl668mWT38raQ.text: I love Barbeque and even though I make my own at home, I am not  snob about and enjoy most barbeque.  Alas, Rollin Smoke did not deliver.    I ordered the 5 meat combo so that I could taste a good sampling.  Food arrived fast but it was clear that most if not all of it had set there in a steam plate for many hours.  Without sauce, all tasted bland and stale.  The sausage link was both dry and others while not try, clearly had that watery taste.  Ribs were decent but just like pulled pork was not edible without the sauce.  I could tell this food could be better if it were fresh but I have to rate what I ate and that was very disappointing.  I had three sides: 1. ColeSlaw.  I love coleslaw to cool my mouth between bites.  This one seemed fresh and nice but had a strong mexican flavor which ruined the experience.  This is a personal judgement of course.  The beans were both a little too spicy and sweet.  Again, I can see others liking it.  Last was waffle fries.  I liked these very much even though they too were not very fresh.  I also had a couple of rolls and these were excellent.  Nice, soft and fresh!  Back to the sauce, it had a magical ability to make the stale meats tasted decent.  Without it I would have walked out with one bite.  It is rather thin, medium spicy and sweet (this was the "American Sauce").  On the atmosphere, the place had a rather unpleasant smell to it.  While visually clean, it made you think it was not.  Anyway, disappointed after spending $36 for dinner for one.

i1vvzADNPTcayrGECK-EbQ.text: Some of the Best BBQ you can get in Vegas.  Neighborhood is a little industrial, but don't let that stop you.

qL9ff0FBuIVhBzO43gbsqg.text: In Vegas and the little one says she wants ribs. Uh oh. But Yelp wins again. After a terrible dinner we needed a winner meal. We had a time finding the place but as soon as we got out of the car we were stoked. A guy passing by asked two old biker cats out front for directions. They gave them then said the guy was at the best rib place in town, he should order. He did. We had a bunch of things. All tremendous. We'll be back.

Qy5mfoyU6G6KW-2zP-TTMg.text: The food here is amazing! For $13.99 you get 2 choices of meat, a side, and some bread. The meat is super tender and has great taste. There isn't a side that isn't good. I especially love the green beans.  The customer service is always awesome. The pit guy was super friendly and chatted with us for a few mins after checking to see how we were doing. The manager even brought my 2 yr old a banana pudding "because he gave him a high five".   This place is just overall awesome and worth the trip off the strip.

Y2ZXqf6a7PHGxK7Hr7tyfA.text: Everything was pretty good but I've definitely had better BBQ. About a 10 minute wait in line with an additional 20 minute wait for the actual food, which is understandable because the place is popular. It's a little expensive for a hole in the wall BBQ joint. It's essentially of the same quality as Dickey's BBQ. I think maybe after they gained popularity from being on TV the quality of their food dipped down.

n8LY8evr98HbDwRTGrehCw.text: Delicious!! Got a bunch of yummy things from them including their hot dog, corn nuggets, greens, ribs, brisket and more! The bbq is made to order so it takes longer, but not quite as long as some places like Lucille's. The greens were good, but not as creamy or good as John Mull's Roadkill grill. They have a bunch of sauces but they are all pretty liquid and didn't seem to have much distinguishing tastes from one to the other. Their prices are decent for be and overall it was extremely delicious and satisfying. Even though John Mull's is further away, I think I prefer their style of bbq (dryer).

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs and brisket. Collard greens. This is how they serve it, in a basket

akFsZz3Tivy0GuRrXV3pag.text: AMAZING!!! So very good! I have eaten bbq all over the country and rate this among some of the best! We got the combo platter and between the two of us we couldn't finish in one setting. They also make a whole ton of sauces for you to try but our fav was the arkansauce. From sweet to spicy they have you covered though, just make sure to order the super hot one at the counter. You can also swap out meats on the combo platter so we opted for burnt ends over the sausages and man oh man what a good choice! The pulled pork was excellent and the ribs just came right off the bone. I have to say I wish they were in NYC!!

dt8sJwUR4sASMuQ5ABCpfA.text: Delicious BBQ. Fresh and tender meats. I bought the five meats plate and loved every bite EXCEPT for the link because it had Anise spices in it (anise is what gives black licorice its flavor and I'm not a fan of black licorice) others enjoyed the link though so maybe it was just me. The sauce is ok but honestly you don't need anything with these meats they are literally smoked to perfection and seasoned proper. The owner chef Tim (if I remember correctly) was very kind and was constantly making sure everyone was taken care of.   My only problem is that I wish this place was bigger and had ac. It's a tough road eating BBQ and sweating in an establishment :/ but honestly the food was so good no one even complained.   In the future when I do come back to Vegas I hope to grab some Rollin' smokes, but next time I'll be ordering to go! :)

NrPvKTLWUx4-pJbufuQGfg.text: First off NICE God fearing people here!! It's like you're going to church and it's one of those churches in the Deep South where the walls are rockin!! After church you get to have Uncle Dusty's bbq!!!! Chicken falls off the bone! Delicious brisket and ribs!! Now let's talk about them collards...Jesus is cooking collards in that kitchen!! Melts in your mouth!! Potato salad perfectly made and served COLD!!!! Mac and cheese was homemade and super tasty...the staff loves where they work and you are transported to a good ol Southern bbq place!! Thank you for a great experience Mr. James who is awesome! And Mr. Dusty for being so sweet and humble...congratulations on a wonderful place!! Keep it real always!! God Bless you all and the devil is not coming in your place because you keep preaching the good news! It was so refreshing to meet you! We have a special place in our hearts for Arkansas...Go Razor Backs!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect menu!! Small and delicious!!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front door :)

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our new friends who were so very sweet and gave us some of their untouched food that they couldn&#39;t take with but didn&#39;t want to throw away!

K6kaRf-F7CBgXD_sBaO2HA.text: I am extremely happy this place lived up to the hype.  I ordered the 3 meat plate with chicken, ribs and brisket and everything was tasty but especially the brisket.  I also loved each of the sauces.  Sitting outside on the picnic table eating great bbq, life doesn't get much better than that.  As a bonus, for the next 12 hours, my burps tasted like brisket!

4D3lkD0lOncBxhgAD2N3wA.text: I don't think I have enough words in my vocabulary to say how delicious this food is!  The portion sizes are HUGE and allow plenty of leftovers (which I'm super happy about--lunch the next day?  Yes, please!). The pulled pork is some of the best I've tasted.  Each bite was extremely tasty and cooked perfectly.  When you pair that with baked beans on a bed of waffle fries and then smother it in cheese, you have a meal like no other!!!  The line was long which tells you the food is amazing, but we got through it pretty quickly and our food came out right away.  If you are looking for great BBQ, RUN to Rollin' Smoke!!!

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Nachos with pulled pork (no sour cream or onion on this one)

K-ecNIUMGzMR5pPEYXFnxQ.text: Went to the new location on Flamingo and 215! What can I say, amazing! My papa Dwight always goes to the one on highland and suggest we meet and the new one! Chicken was awesome and I can will smell the smoke on my fingers! I will definitely being coming back! Thank you guys! Awesome and friendly staff as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

okoO29vnvEeauGGKtWAuHA.text: Great atmosphere and great people working here. But unfortunately at least for me, the barbecue was NOT GOOD. It was extremely salty and over seasoned. The Mac and cheese was eh and the mashed potatoes were ok. I've eaten a lot of great bbq which is maybe why I'm so darn picky. But any experienced bbq'er would say the same thing. I will continue on my quest to find a great bbq spot in Vegas, cause this just "ain't it."

5RoZngKhVYOegHciB76Mjg.text: This is the spot for some good home cooked Barbeque. The service was awesome and Brenda made you feel like you were at home. I highly recommend this place to everyone who comes to Vegas and if you live in Vegas this should be the place you came and get some good BBQ.  Darrick G.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dbv3oSwjHpymGefnSlbcWQ.text: I'm from LA, I met my cousins and niece at this Bbq place! It's the bomb!! Love Josh, very patient with our orders that kept on changing!! Wish they have one in LA! We will be going back!!!!

RqiORtNtxbZRN82uv5rYvg.text: Searching Nearby Me on Yelp landed me here.  I was here on a Saturday night after running the RNR LV 5K.  The place is hidden at night.  It is located on a shady looking street near an overpass.  Get your GPS ready or you will miss it.  The parking is pretty small so you may not be able to find parking but there is also street parking.  There are tables outside in the patio but there are a number of tables inside as well.  You order by lining up on the right and then grabbing a table where the servers will bring you the platters of food.  For the five of us, we got the The Pit Special and the Ribs Platter.  It was more than enough food for us.  The best items in the meals were the sides.  The meats themselves were a bit dry (mainly the ribs) so I focused my eyes on the sides.  Of all the sides, I enjoyed the mac and cheese and the corn nuggets.  A must get when you are there.  Of the meats, even though most were dry, I liked the brisket and the baby-back ribs.  There were a couple types of sauces near the drink counter (honey mustard and a vinegar sauce).  Also on the table was a barbeque-like sauce.  But even with the sauces, the meats were still dry...  Such a bummer but I would still give this place another try.  I noticed the table next to us ordering a huge burger that was stacked like 6 inches high.  Crazy fatty goodness I bet and I wish because that is what I'm going to be grabbing when I come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle fries, mac and cheese, and corn nuggets
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs Platter
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lCXp88s6O_Qaj5ZXES35LQ.text: I love my Ba Ba Barbeque Baby! And after going to the U.H. Warrior Football game.......what better way to end the evening then to eat some Ba Ba Barbeque!!!!  My friend suggested this place called - "Rollin Smoke Barbeque" so we flipped on our GPS and headed to the back roads to a seedy part of town (where there were a lot of strip clubs, bars, & adult book stores).........but then when we finally found this place and walked in............ I was in Ba Ba Barbeque heaven!!!!  The restaurant was really packed, and as we walked to the counter, the friendly clerk took our orders. After you order your food, you find an open table (good luck), and when your food is ready, they will bring your order out to you.  There is a Sauce station within the restaurant where you can get additional BBQ sauce. I want to point out.........try the "Mama Sweet" BBQ sauce! It was bomb @ss good! My friend liked this BBQ sauce so much, I actually saw him put it in a little cup & drink the sauce! That's how much he loved the BBQ sauce!  Before you sit down at your table, you will also have to get your own plastic eating utensils, napkins, as well as your own drinks, as the soda fountain within the restaurant was self serve.  For my meal that night, I ordered the "Trio Choice of Meats" - where I picked the following - Brisket, 1/4 Chicken, & 2 Spare Ribs. ($17.99)  One of my friends also ordered the "Trio Choice of Meats"  - where he picked the Brisket, 2 Spare Ribs, & Hot Links. ($17.99)  And my other friend ordered the "Duo Choice Of 2 Meats" - where he picked the Brisket, & Pulled Pork. ($13.99)  With our meals came with a side, and I ended up taking the corn bread. All of our meals came with collard greens, and the collard greens had some kind of smoked meat mixed inside.  What can I say about the grub?  I totally loved the BBQ Chicken! The chicken meat was all so soft, and the meal literally fell off the bone.......nice smokey flavor too!  The spare ribs was also delicious, and I just loved how the meat came off of the bone so easily! I really loved how soft the BBQ ribs were.......  As for the brisket.........it was just okay for me. Loved the smokey flavor, but I gotta tell you the brisket wasn't very soft. I've had better tasting brisket on Oahu.......from "Verde" in Kaimuki.  Overall a pretty good barbeque joint! No frills..........kinda of place, and they definitely churn out some pretty great barbeque meats!   Be careful of your surroundings when coming here........if I was with my girlfriend, I'd probably pass on this place.........my friend also mentioned to me that if he was here with his wife & kids, he'd probably do the same.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rollin Smoke Barbeque on Yelp!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty cool plastic cups!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio Choice of 3 Meats - 2 Spare Ribs, Brisket, Hot Links with Collard Greens &amp; Pork and Beans. ($17.99)

g7vPzuaZ-PCMN3M59QBz2A.text: We are a very biased family when it comes to BBQ considering this is our family specialty! Our kids will only eat here. Excellent customer service every time! Always delicious food!  We ordered ahead this time for pick up- the young lady was just as courteous over the phone as in person!  Continue to serve QUALITY FOOD with QUALITY CUSTOMER SERVICE!  Thank you for always giving us delicious food while we're out here!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love it!

wrjV8jWzCY7yhWqShh-zhA.text: Rollin smoke is as close to southern smoke as you will get west of the Colorado River.  Let's get to the good stuff  Meats  Spare Ribs: The highlight of the meal. If you're evenly in love with spare ribs as much as you are with baby back ribs, then I suggest to just go with these. Teeeender *TJ Detweiler voice* added with the taste of the meat will make you laugh at your visits to Bludso's or Phil's. 4.5/5  Baby Ribs: I want my baby back baby back baby back..these were less impressionable, maybe because I had them second? But don't get me wrong they were still very good! Fall off the bone and tasty but your stomach will tell you it was only a fair investment and you should of "spared" it some space. 4/5  Hot Links: The perfect meat side for my rib meal, yes I get meats as a side to my meat. The taste wasn't as "hot" as you would think, then again my mom raised me with a molcajete. Tasty to dip in your favorite sauce. 4/5  Sauces..Ask them for a sample tasting of them before you make a decision of such high importance  Sides   Corn Bread: My relationship with corn bread has always been 50/50. I approve of this one. Soft at the bite, taste home made, the style of it was made to be had with this meal. 4/5  BBQ Beans: These are my babies when it comes to BBQ meals, there was a hint of flavor that elevated it past average but nothing that I'd recommend in bold if you're not such a fan of beans to begin with. 3.7/5  Waffle Fries: The side I dipped in the least. Missing a good seasoning, lacked a crisp taste. 2/5  Potato Salad: In a league of it's own. Someone was a side hog with this one but the 2 spoons of it were very good. Hard to break down the flavor but Javier approved. 4.25/5  Dessert:  Banana Pudding: I'm so sad I was too full to indulge in this the way my inner child would have liked. But this swirled me back to my cubbie days when I thought snack packs were the bomb. The nilla cookies added to this only makes it sound that much better, right? And that's because it is. 4.5/5  Woah, looks like I guinea pigged it for you.  This all was not a bad price either, considering Vegas is Vegas. It was $40 something, The only downward arrow is that the sides are uber small, meaning it's a portion for one. Order 2 of the ones you think you may like the most if you're meal sharing.       Service:  This was a to go order. It was ready in the said time, they sent me off with sample tastings of their sauces, their customer service enthusiasm was meh. I'd say they're their BBQ beans equivalent in this department. 3.7/5  My Final Say  We all know somewhere in Kansas City or Austin there lays an establishment that is probably better than Rollin Smoke, but regionally speaking, I have not met a close competitor to this place in the West. Let that serve as my 5 star justification.   I recommend coming here, unless you're a part of Hank Hill's blood line, I am sure you will be satisfied with your meal here.  To Whom It May Concern  I apologize for lack of pictures, I turned into Joey Chestnut one bite in and forgot to take more.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The main event

C_hhcgGUwe4Y_H9JwgKZcA.text: Been driving next to this place for the past 6 years an had no idea it even existed!   Very cool place!  Highly recommended if you're into BBQ!  Tasty food and the flavors were wonderful!   While we were there they actually shot part of a Food Network TV show so that was exciting and fun!  * The owner was extremely nice and welcoming!  * Great staff and very friendly! * Yummy food!  * Lots of character to the place! Inside you definitely don't feel like you're in Vegas.   I had the chicken BBQ sandwich.  I had the brisket BBQ sandwich.  Waffle fries.  And also a sample that the owner gave us from the left overs of shooting the scene for food network.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shooting a scene for food network
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shooting a scene for food network
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XSGkXxGndYGjZ_Ijpv8w6A.text: I can honestly say this was one of the best meals I've ever experienced, barbecue or otherwise. I ordered the rib plate, which was supposed to be 3 baby backs, 2 spares and a giant beef rib. I don't know if I got lucky or not, but I got 4 back backs, 3 spares and the beef. They were all delicious.   The beef rib was the highlight, as it had a brilliant salty crust that packed in the flavor. The baby backs had a brilliant smoke ring and were tender but not falling off the bone. The spare ribs brought up the rear, but they were still quite good.   And the cornbread... word to the wise: Get. The. Cornbread.  Overall this was a great experience and I'd be back in a heartbeat.

5llo6Z0fH4dEOd9QeOCTGg.text: This is by far THE best BBQ. Big portions, great flavor. Tons of room for activities ;) we WILL be back.

tiXKzXURtWMRfBTuhK1HLQ.text: Always one of my go to spot bbq joint. The beef ribs is always on point and never disappoints!!

1u3acF2OqjzxZLWkbTnDmQ.text: The food is delicious the customer service is even more delicious after screwing up my order they bent over backwards to make it right therefore they get an atta boy/ girl from me. Thank you again and I will send my friends

sUS9iriMf0yb3NX5hKN9GQ.text: This was my second visit. My wife and I were finishing up a weekend in Vegas when we stopped in before the long trip home to CA. We split the three meat combo with Burnt Ends, Pulled Pork and, Baby back ribs. We also got the dirty rice and cornbread for sides. Where to begin? The counter person was super friendly and helpful. The food was EXCELLENT. Ribs were  fall off the bone tender, the pork had the perfect amount of smoky flavor and, the burnt ends...Among the best I've ever had. Every time we're in Vegas we'll be eating this BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three Meat Combo (Burnt Ends, Baby back ribs, Pulled Pork) with cornbread and dirty rice.

nTj6oAxTj5fpJYFL7UdeeQ.text: If you're looking for a BBQ place to eat that is comparable to the south, this is the place. There is not another place in Vegas that comes close.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

feajz6h7-wD94ieR8eT3aA.text: By far the best BBQ in the valley, the brisket is moist and delicious and the green beans are to die for. Keep up the great job.

a-Nzit0UJfiFqqnzzAbv9Q.text: This place lives up to its 5 star rating.  The food was not only excellent flavor,but huge portions for pretty cheap.   So glad we tried it, and we will definitely go back. I had the 5 meat platter just to be able to try everything. The side were great, wouldn't change it at all. Just be in the lookout its a bit hard to find.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Order station

s6TMV6b8xbhe8hV2ap3Rwg.text: OK so me & my husband were in las Vegas and saw that this place had some really good barbeque reviews. We decided to go and try it. We have to say that everything was great. The hot llink, pull pork, ribs, chicken and brisket we had corn nuggets loaded mashed  and barbecue beans. Everything was good I also wanted to say that the girl in the front was amazing and helped us out with the menu. We will be back when we come back to Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KkLZZiUMUdU3UT47hYYnOA.text: OMG I followed the scent of smoked flesh all the way from the airport. My rental guided me down the strip and turned left at TRUMP Hotel and crossed under freeway till I land in the industrial dump of parking lot. But when you want the best BBQ who cares about its surroundings.   Now I had this place on my radar for sometime and finally manned up and went. BBQ so damn good make you wanna slap your own face. I'd say the best BBQ on the West Coast and defiantly in Vegas. I've had BBQ all over the country however the  BBQ meatloaf is flipping sensational. In all my barbecue eating sessions I had never encountered BBQ meatloaf and it didn't fail my tastebuds. Meatloaf set on mash potatoes and sauce plus a stack of shredded deep fried onions for crunch and scallions for extra flavor.  I've been back and had the ribs which are nice and meaty with perfect smoke rings. No sauce needed on them cause there amazing and very tasty. Also the hot links hold there own with a nice kick to them and condiments of Mac Cheese made your meal. It's a perfect side dish here cause it's not creamy or watery but cooked just like mom makes.   I've got a wish list of items to order so I'll be making pit stop soon. FRANK gives a double thumbs up for Rollin Smoke BBQ, so put this on your list of culinary needs to consume.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Da Meatloaf is killer
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage baby
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1JqFsmXw1jcyD7D2b5YT0A.text: Here for a convention and on my lunch break . I asked Taxi guy Guy good BBQ place Taxi Guy  recommended  Rolling Smoke BBQ . If you in the Las Vegas area from out of town try this place yummy BBQ . You will not be disappointed . Young lady at counter very nice and friendly .

C0Y4N2C-J3ZAguTZ3tFamw.text: Pulled pork and the ribs were amazing.  Corn fritters too!  Definitely give this place a shot if you're in town.

olDqCz22hafmJh5Xi89fKg.text: So freaking good!! My husband has been on the search for a great bbq beef rib for three years lol! We are from San Francisco, and we have a ton of great restaurants, but this takes the cake! He got the all you can eat and tried everything on the menu! Two orders of the beef ribs! I had to roll him back to our hotel after! I had the brisket chopped, and chicken (white meat) it was so moist and juicy you'd think it was dark!!! Everything was perfect including the staff!!! Will definitely visit again when we come back to Vegas!

UE3YSyhtY6iPcJ_t84zsFA.text: Came in for a family gathering and the food was great. However I must rave about the amazing green beans, I know a little weird but they are amazing.  Very simple with so much flavor. Clean environment including ding the bathrooms.

hP09UiB4ZiLVx4mvIqOAMg.text: Outlaw burger didn't stand a chance. Place is freaking good.

VtBSz2cP3pr82Pd2WOd9Iw.text: By far the best BBQ I have had in a long time!!! Everything we ordered was phenomenal! Definitely go give this okace a try!

oKJE3YfkAMmG2xEx3_AiUQ.text: Being a Texas native, I'm pretty discriminatory when it comes to my BBQ! Rollin' Smoke is probably the best BBQ I've had outside of the big "BBQ hubs" e.g. Memphis, Texas, the Carolinas. It's a relatively small establishment that definitely pulls a crowd most evenings and on the weekends you may stand in line for a bit but the food is entirely worth it.

QNeSA-f7h0kGHxDK9yhMkg.text: Arrive early, because they run out of meat selection early in the evening. Also, space inside is pretty limited. But everything I've tried, every time I've come, has been outstanding! Mouthwatering, juicy, succulent, and flavorful.

TpwfjL-q0oSpji3ywYmSFA.text: I'm not sure how many 5-star reviews I give, but if I could give 6, Rollin Smoke Barbecue would get them.  We came early on a weekday, and before we had finished our meal there was a line out the door.  We sampled several items, including the pulled pork, cole slaw, banana pudding, and ribs.  All were wonderful, but the hot dog with absolutely everything and the kitchen sink piled on top was a winner.  I don't even like hot dogs that much, but this was among the best things I ate in 2014.  The restaurant is in a run down commercial neighborhood and your eating on benches (inside or out), but if you're a foodie, this is a must.

OroTJauEIsUom105mcrAew.text: This place is really good and authentic.  Gives you tons of food!!!  Meatloaf is awesome!!!  Try it.  Desert is not worth much, but we got it for free.

Caz8hWuEk-1Q_Hit0ehfCA.text: With the apparent demise of Hogs Heaven and Top Notch Bbq, there is no controversy about which BBQ is best. Rollin smoke has the tender smoked goods. The sauce is excellent and the menu is innovative and original. Make sure you get corn nuggets, there is nothing like them.

UfWr9RPMrY1_0wjNlo56ZA.text: This was pretty good barbecue. The service was top notch. I had the all you could eat so I could sample. I had the catfish, ribs, chicken, and shrimp. Sides were Mac and cheese, and beans.  Catfish could have used some more seasoning. Rib meat fell off of the bone. Chicken was good, but skin was a little tough Shrimp was delicious. I have had better beans. But I was surprised by the Mac and cheese. It was very tasty.

JxnyxpO6ICimFfpfbB8zrw.text: Amazing smoked meatloaf w/ mashed potatoes & onion straws! Definitely a must go to BBQ joint when in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked meatloaf on top of mashed potatoes topped off w/ onion straws &amp; side of bread &amp; cornbread (yumm).

I1UcgBeFFbTmHPmHtz8XFA.text: This is the best bbq I've had since TEXAS!!! They are amazing. They even know how to properly cook okra! I wish the place was bigger, but its great!!!!  Their prices are great (please don't raise them) and the food is awesome!

zBst9mdvMwXbYXgouHOSXA.text: It is not often that I give a BBQ restaurant five stars. I found the food to be very, very good. If this place was in KC or some other BBQ city, I'm not sure that I would give it five stars...Maybe I would. The meat (ribs, chicken, brisket, & pulled pork) was succulent, mouthwatering, flavorful, tender...I could go on and on. You get the picture. The sides (beans, mac & cheese, greens) were cooked perfectly with a southern flare. The sweet tea was oh so yummy. I didn't have a dessert, but I will next time. The service was fast and with a smile. The only thing that bothered me was the place was very smokey (the smell). It was a good thing, but it lingered in my clothes after I left. To most people, I think that is a good thing. To me, it's just one of those things that I perseverate on. LOL...I can't wait to go back.

UQAdUHAZFaucT04-6zBilg.text: Two associates and I tried this BBQ joint because of all the good reviews posted here.  I guess I should have tried the beef ribs because the brisket I had was overcooked, dry and tough, the pulled pork wasn't tender enough, and you can't order baby back ribs with the combos, only St. Louis.  I had a couple of those and they were OK, just extra fatty.  Overall, I was disappointed because I'm a BBQ aficionado due to my multiple trips to Texas every year.    I like BBQ so much I bought a Texas-style smoker with a side firebox and spent a few years perfecting my 'Q smoking skills.  I can do a brisket and pulled pork that are miles ahead of what we got here and my baby backs are killer.  I don't know, maybe it was too late in the day, we got there about 7 PM and despite what it says in the listing, they close at 8 on weekdays.  The pit master, who seems to be a very nice guy and is very friendly, brought a bunch of briskets in that had just come out of the smoker and maybe we got the tail end of the last batch.  Even if that was the case however; what we got shouldn't have been served in my opinion, it was that bad.

jYyL5djXucK_pIOaSKtQ3A.text: One of the best BBQ joints for food. They need to work on cleaning the place. Chairs are cloth and filthy. Tables are family style so you have to be ok eating with new friends. And they need to send someone out regularly to wipe them down. We had combo ribs plate $17.99 with Mac and cheese side, also a trio meat with 2 x's brisket and spare ribs $14.00 with beans. Ordered a Full slab of Baby backs to go $28.00 It said that every plate came with a dinner roll and a drink. They didn't put the roll on. I questioned the guys delivering  the food they said "no" it doesnt. I re read the board and ask the girl at the register she says "yes". When they deliver the rolls the explanation is that there is a menu change coming. OK I get that. Use a piece of tape and cover the roll if your not giving it out anymore. Here's my advice. You charge alot for the food don't be short sighted. The roll is pennies on each plate. I and many others ( long line behind and in front of me) do not mind paying prices if the food is good. Give something away on the plate (roll). One of the guys tried to sell me that the slice of bread that my food was on was the roll? Look down the road at longevity and you will see if you penny pick people no matter how good the food is we won't come back.  I again will say some of the best BBQ I have had hands down but they have some kinks to work out.

Tf9k9opkL1Ke33Lwqmq-tw.text: Best bbq in Las Vegas! The following were delicious: burnt ends, brisket, ribs, hot links, and meatloaf !!! The peach cobbler was amazing too!

pY0taUMtuH0E5EBlB18XVQ.text: The good: fall of the none delicious BBQ , nice flavor, great spice if u enjoy spice , Mac and cheese is cheesy goodness , chicken is juicy and so flavorful ,and  ribs are the best in town beats buzz hands down .                                                         The Bad: Sauce is way too spicy for kids , Mac and cheese is too spicy ,and  brisket was alright nothing to write about. Ordering is confusing and wasn't sure if u seat yourself or wait to be seated , small location , and not a fan of the location                   Tips: if u don't like spicy food u will not enjoy this , limited items for kids to consume , and they are closed Sunday

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket sandwich , Mac and cheese, and beans
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 meats platter

ktB3Ee4_7XbB4k-pg1Gy7w.text: I'm a very picky eater when it comes to me liking food. Rollin Smoke BBQ is an awesome place to eat. It's not doused in BBQ cause I like to dip...so it's just right. Gotta bring my hunney cause there are few places that he can go to and I'm sure he'll love this place.

97gJs2_COR_sNBWgd_DZ1A.text: Can't say anything more than I absolutely love this place. I recommend all my guests to it when they are looking for great barbecue. The definition of finger licking good.

G4cNKNQuteRWAUxHqKONjA.text: Eh another daylong upset stomach after baby back ribs? Overcooked and a small place where you wonder if they're smoking the meat with the cooks' pot smoke... Skip it and eat a salad! After 12 hours I'm still feeling the pig running up and down my intestines! However if you're in the mood to see some adult entertainment there's plenty of strip clubs in the area and even some strippers coming in to eat! I'll take the breasts no dressing!

fiimus-UmQCT5hkfTMjGeg.text: Top notch bbq! The pulled pork sandwiches are delicious. They used to park on valley view and russell and we frequently visted them at least once a week. The ribs were good as well, but I can dig in like I want in a shirt and tie.  I gotta visit again!

zyfVmlNcn7q78QQ-XdHcvQ.text: Good for what you get. Prices went up on everything so the Value isnt as good as it use to be. It was incredible and the food quality is the same, but I think the concept before was awesome with the lower prices

Gd_GDVm-QeOpVkpY7YNxBA.text: This place really great... we eat here once a week... we bring our family from cali here and they love them. People are very friendly and nice.

Q3M3i37KM2EMXtQ012_qjA.text: Not better rating from my 7/7/15 review...in fact, it should be 1 star, but one person in our party of three thought is was good.  First and foremost the interior was super HOT!  I don't know how people were even sitting in there eating.  We sat outside.  Between us, we had two Trio and one Duo Plates plus drinks = $63.75.  Little pricey for what you get.  There are other BBQ locations that will give you two sides, corn, and muffin with a combo plate like these.  Rollin only give you one side.  Everything else costs extra.  The Trios were both cold.  Yes the meats were cold to slightly warm.  The one side however was steaming hot.  The taste was again just so so.  One in our party is from AR, and he said other BBQ spots in Vegas are better.  Well I agree again.  There will be no 3 strikes and your out here for me, as I will NOT be back nor recommend.

vCkqBxiWTDWMXCRitav7cg.text: Ali and Mark were awesome bartenders at the upstairs bar. Can eat there too!  Killer place above the street to catch the sunset, and happy hour.

sak1JQK6Y4yohEoDavqGaQ.text: Great menu selection of smoked meats and side items. There was also a good variety of sauces to try. Personal favorites were the brisket with the arkansauce and country girl sauces. Mac and cheese on the side was a good compliment. Prices were comparable to most bbq restaurants and cheaper than what you will find at restaurants on the strip.

GxiU76SBuS6IRKp5yYBZdQ.text: Look, I'm Texan.  I've grown up around barbecue.  And I've found that the West Coast didn't have much in the way of barbecue when I was living in SoCal (correct me if I'm wrong, I take suggestions).  And while I like Lucille's here, that's more Cajun than the stuff I grew up with.  On a whim, we found this place.  It's in the middle of nowhere, in an area you probably wouldn't venture to, in a tiny shopping center that you wouldn't notice.  But you'll notice that smell when you step out of the car.  And I mean BAM!  Once that scent hit my nose, I had to know more.  Also, not Texas based, I will graciously concede that Arkansas knows their stuff, and this place knows their stuff.  The staff is nice, and one look at them told me these people weren't anything but legit.  I liked the cook immediately.  We ordered a rib combo plate, and let the dining begin.  It was so good.  Nice and spicy, meat falling off the bone, a big squirt bottle of sauce on the table, I ate and ate and ate, and then I got kind of woozy, and asked for a "to go".  I moaned all the way home.  Partly because I was full, yes, but partly because this place hit the sweet spot of barbecue goodness.  I went for my leftovers, and shredded bones like a barbarian.  I regret nothing.  Will I go back?  Absolutely.  Small, subtle, out of the way, but so worth it when it came to dining options, friendly people, fast service, and quality of food.  They have something called a "BBQ Sundae".  That sounds intriguing, and I wish to know more.

bwZdCWP_ZA2TCjEYJGfnJQ.text: Fantastic BBQ. Not my typical style, but the best example I've seen of a thin sweet sauce. Great ribs, happy kids.

7SNKu-Rux71mmf3d4Yztzg.text: So good can't explain it you just need to come in and taste for yourself. Ribs fall of bone fries and good. Totally will come in again when in town.

1UmPpaUsYtybv3E7DjjTIQ.text: This place is AMAZING! It's a short uber ride off the strip but well worth it. Definitely a small hometown type feel to the place.

7SX0mNma9nNSfb9pba9sFg.text: Went to check out Rollin Smoke on Saturday around 7.  The line was out the door!  My husband got in line while I went in search for a table. They have picnic tables in the area you order, a dining room connected, and then a completely separate room with some more picnic tables. Oh a few tables outside too. So I found a table in the dining room, which I shared with some people I didn't know, but none of us minded.  We ordered brisket, pork, and chicken. For our sides we got waffle fries and loaded mash. Everything was delicious. Pork was so tender and juicy. Brisket was tender and was cooked perfectly. I didn't eat the chicken but my husband said it was really good. Everything had wonderful flavor. I like that they didn't drench it in BBQ sauce. There is sauce on all the tables so you can drench it if you want. The brisket came on a really soft piece of white bread. The sides were hot and delicious.  We also ordered the peach cobbler a la mode and it was ok. I would say it was my least favorite thing. It just didn't stand out to me, but it wasn't bad. I just didn't love.  We Really enjoyed eating here and are definitely coming back!  The staff was very nice. They all had smiles on their faces even though they were slammed

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Completely separate dining room with picnic tables
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket, pork, chicken, waffle fries, loaded mash, and peach cobbler a la mode!!

QGpVcn-R2WLtyLPqK6Malw.text: truly amazing !The brisket  Awesome!  Hush puppies, Corn balls .Tasty.Yams are the best  I ever had , the Mac and cheese is to die for.The cole slaw wasn't too good but  everything else was so good it did t matter will definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V5HH_FTWL0QAk-sSBQFYRQ.text: My buddy convinced me to try this place for lunch today and we made the trip to see what the buzz was all about.  Usually a high rating place on Yelp can be suggestive, but the reviews truly do not lie.   Southern True cooked Mesquite BBQ is what this place is all about and when we got there they had a line a mike long going outside.  That can only suggest one thing: the food is excellent.  I was fortunate enough to be able to try the ribs, brisket, and corn taters.  All were very delicious and food came out very fast.  My only little quirk was the menu was too far away from the register to place your order and there was only one register for the long line.  Seating was very limited and the location is an off the wall spot, but that's kind of it's hidden gem.  I loved the fact I left the joint smelling like Mesquite BBQ and that smell is very delightful.  When I got back to my office, everyone asked me where I went, because they could smell the BBQ smell.  Go see for yourself and you won't be disappointed.

C0pGKPFIe5jG6a3E7GZATA.text: Being the owner of two Big Green Eggs, I usually make these meats at home, but seeing it is summer here (enough said), it is really nice to be able to go out for this instead of doing it myself all day.   Hubby had the outlaw burger and I shared my meat plate with him. We also had sides of mac and cheese, yams and corn nuggets.  First off, hubby loved his burger.  I had one bite and it was good, but too much like meatloaf for me both in taste and texture.  I like that they smoked the burger. We do that at home as well and there is nothing better.  Next visit hubby is getting the meatloaf he said. Something about loaded mashed potatoes.......yum.  I really enjoyed the brisket, it was moist and had just the right amount of smoke infused into it.  Some of it was cut too thick for my liking and as such, didn't have that tug and pull apart you expect, but thankfully, it wasn't served drenched in sauce, that is a no-no in my book.    The pulled pork was good, but not great. It lacked that smoky flavor but it was very moist.  I have the same problem making this at home. It is difficult to get that smoke all the way into the deepest part of the meat.  Their BBQ sauce was very nice, not too sweet or just tasting like spiced-up ketchup. The two together were nice and next time on a sandwich it is.  The chicken was also good, but my favorite for flavor was the homemade sausage. It was nice and smokey and had a great kick at the end.  I would like the grind a bit finer though.  The sides were all tasty.  You could taste the cheese in the mac and cheese and it was not greasy at all. The yams were nice and chunky and sweet but not too sweet. The corn nuggets were perfect, nice and crunchy on the outside, tender and sweet on the inside. H&J on Eastern, take some lessons from this place on how to cook these.   We shared a banana pudding for dessert and it was creamy good, but I would have liked to see some banana slices in it. The vanilla wafers were nice and soaked with pudding goodness.  I am not sure how we had room to eat it all, but we did.  We took plenty of meat home for leftovers.    Will we be back? Yes, of course.  This is by far the best BBQ we have had in Las Vegas so far.  Just wish they were closer to home.

BkZeS7SlXhCZynXVWu9Rfw.text: The best ribs in town!!! All the food is so good. Have to stop here every time I'm near.

74XWUQgPYWfNRzm5BuKOvw.text: This place is Great it's been featured on multiple tv shows.... And for good reason ... They have an all u can't eat option that is worth the money and way better than a buffet ... The beef rib had a great flavor and was way meatier than I've ever seen b4...the meatloaf was my other favorite it is triple smoked and u can definitely taste it... It came on mashed potatoes with home made French onions on top ... Besides the food the customer service was fantastic ... Our waiters name was Mitch he made our expierience fun and made sure we tried all the best items... He also told us how some of it was done but made sure not to give up the secret recipes of spices used to do it ... I will defiantly return again!!!!!

sNwbBK1rYXKk3hl0D9yK4A.text: When you see a big ole pickup side by side a just off the lot Mercedes in the parking lot of a way off the strip business/industrial section of town with one restaurant in sight, you know that's a good place to eat!  It's a humble and simple setup when you walk through the doors but the flavors roam about the air which play a prelude to bounty in which you're about to partake. The wall sized menu is easy to follow and offers a whole lot to choose from. This being my first visit, I had to take a while before deciding but everyone does that it seems. The line gets long and for good reason. If you get there after 11:15, expect to standing outside those doors leading in. There's ample seating on a sunny day or dry evening. The weather is perfect for both for now. All tables have unlimited napkins, ketchup and BBQ sauce. The people are very friendly and check in on you every 30 minutes or so to make sure you're enjoying your food. Indoors is splint into two eating areas. One is the room you come into to order with picnic benches set up and various displays all around the room including the giant sized menu. The other has a couple of flat screens going with a game or two on broadcast.  The food was savory and very tasty! We had a hot dog, the Duo which is a two meat order and a Trio a three meat order consisting of brisket, pork ribs and hot links. Other choices we could have had were a 14 chicken and pork. Our sides were waffle fries and mashed potatoes. The hot dog was meaty with good chew and snap when you bit in. The fries rounded out the intake quite nicely, not too oily and plentiful. The hot links are sneaky spicy as they invade your palette bite after bite. So good! The brisket was tender and cut right. I needed extra sauce because that's what I like. The ribs were killer! Lots of meat on those bones, tender but held good form after the bite. Those were sucked dry. The mashed potatoes garnished with fresh bacon bits and melted cheese were thick, rich and flavorful. I could eat that all day! Unlimited drinks and BBQ sauce are always a plus.   What's my bottom line? I have a saying about restaurants: You get one shot at the title; if you succeed, you'll get more shots at the championship! So yeah, I'm coming back! There's so much still to try and this initial visit definitely left a strong, positive impression. Great prices, championship quality BBQ. My actual rating is a 4.7 stars...
