28oVU2yrL9j8hNZHVOCfDA.text: Everything was awesome.. ribs tender, chicken breast tender, sides pretty good.. but warning..DO NOT EAT THE PEACH COBBLER... if u are used to southern style peach cobbler this is not what u want... BUT everything else  was awesome....!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!###

vLGdVqHmJo0CrhPOlY8zcA.text: Absolutely perfect.   Authentic smoked food that is tender and tasty.   The pulled pork and brisket literally is as soft as it can be.  The rib tips have an amazing firm texture and flavor.   Go hogs!

k60pZ1Tiqh1ZlrkfNANREg.text: So, my comrade here is in a meat coma, so I need to speak for him. When I heard about the location, I knew right away this was a foodie joint and I was more than right! We ordered the brisket three ways with coleslaw and the meatloaf...unbelievable! Amazing! One of a kind! Whosever mother created this is a lucky person! The meat was infused full of flavor, tender, everything you'd expect and more.  The meatloaf was more amazing than you can imagine, there are no words. Highly recommended!

wY8Yr-ictFmcagLVNE5l8Q.text: Wow. Just wow. Succulent, smokey, melt in your mouth meat. Everything is so flavorful and savory. There's really nothing to complain about here. Prices are very reasonable, food came out quick, and the staff was very helpful telling you what's good. Definitely a new can't-miss stop for future Vegas trips.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

auYqco-o2Mq7HZL83YRVHA.text: The bbq ribs are amazing. Tender, falls off the bone, and packed full of meat! And they're fast. And the corn bread is delicious. You also get souvenir cups when you order a drink. Probably the best ribs I've ever had.

ZxPD_Nr7rztHBDABNeYxSw.text: Best BBQ in Vegas! Burnt ends are a MUST HAVE!!! Service by everyone is stellar. Pulled pork and chopped brisket is also great. A must stop whenever I go to LV

DOEqc7pheNQ3Zv0xXV9iTA.text: I am not a big bbq person but this place is delicious. The portions are great for the price. The staff is friendly and the place is clean. I had the meatloaf and man it was amazing. The Mac and cheese, bbq beans and mashed potatoes are very good. Everything was delicious and we had a great dining experience. It is a must have.

MBnm2sZBQp8n3LKGayge3A.text: As soon as I entered the place, it smelled like home! This is the real deal. I'm a southern barbecue connoisseur, raised on Deep South barbecue and refined by years of living in Nashville, which excels in perfect barbecue.   So, at a new barbecue place, I'll always test the pulled pork sandwich.  The True southern test is if the sandwich comes with coleslaw on top of the pork in the sandwich. This place didn't do this! But, upon request, they did add it - but a star is removed for not making this standard. People can't experience a real pulled pork sandwich w/o coleslaw on top.   Overall, the pulled pork has a great smoky flavor with the required tenderness and no stringiness. Some 'ends' were included - the charred, chewy ends, which is exactly right. The coleslaw was also excellent, as was the standard sauce.  I also had a side of potato salad. I'll admit that there are many types of potato salad, none of which can compare to my mother's, but this potato salad was really, really good.    Next visit requires a taste of the ribs. I hear they are excellent.    You can't go wrong here, if you're looking for authentic southern barbecue.

CKEPmHWTGpjWHWzs23odPw.text: I wanted to go to this place after seeing it on BBQ Crawl. My wife and I were heading to Vegas with my daughter and her boyfriend, so we decided to have dinner there. We had the smoked meatloaf, the rib tips, and the burnt ends. Everything we tried was amazing and the staff was incredible. They were super friendly and were very fast in getting the food out.  Being a BBQ enthusiast myself, I wanted to takes look at the smokers. I met the owner's mother and she showed me around. She was very sweet and personable.  We are definitely going back before we head out of town.  If you are in Vegas, I highly recommend going to Rollin' Smoke BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked meatloaf
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt ends.....simply amazing. These guys can do great BBQ

Lz_66eTo149v4ZlWqSSKXA.text: We happen to be in the area and decided to try this place. Wow it was outstanding the catfish po boy was delicious! Husband thoroughly enjoy the PoBoy brisket. I will definitely be back and recommend it to everyone!

9YQIc_5dT9eNcrzToKaubg.text: Visiting Las Vegas.  As a True yelper.  I got on to search for my daily craving.  Barbecue it was.  My friends who live here tagged along with me of course.    The chopped brisket is to die for.  So moist, tender and flavorful.  Amazing mac and cheese. The corn nuggets were good.  My two friends loved their meal.  One not liking their potato salad with bacon.  I sampled it and wasn't a fan either.    Sweeeeeet Tea was on point.  Didn't need to add sugar.   My friends that live here have now found their barbecue spot.  THANKS TO ME!  Wink   It's a cute and cozy spot hidden in a somewhat shopping center.  All of the staff were very welcoming and polite always engaging in a friendly convo.   I will visit in my future Vegas trips.   STAY YUMMY!  I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped beef and shredded pork.  Wasn&#39;t a fan of the park.  A little too dry for my liking. Chopped beef was amazing!

bP1dmVss1HqQXO7YTXlvsA.text: Ate here with a group of 12, after a conference.  We ordered the platter for 12-16.  Came with chicken, brisket, sausage, shredded beef and ribs.  Tried the beans, mac and corn nuggets. Food was amazing.  We had enough food leftover to feed probably another eight people.  This is going to be a new must-visit for my Vegas trips.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ie-Au0nltmGnaS3T0cTHBQ.text: Wow, this place was great. Was it the best bbq ever? That might be a tough sell. Is it really really good? For sure.   We wanted to branch out for a new lunch spot--something that wasn't on the strip or in our hotel. I Yelped "lunch" and Rollin Smoke was one of the first places to pop up. So me, my girlfriend and my sister piled into an Uber and set out for some bbq.   The menu can be a bit overwhelming with all of the different meats and combinations. I wanted to sample a little bit of it all, so I opted for the 5 meat platter: pulled pork; brisket; hot link; chicken; spare ribs. Everything was really good and unlike some other Yelpers, my chicken was fall-off-the-bone tender. I love seeing that tasty smoke ring on the ribs and the meat melted in my mouth. The sauce selection was great and I really like that they allow you to sauce the meat yourself. Nothing worse than bad bbq being covered up by an abundance of sauce.   With the 5 meat platter you are given a choice of 3 sides...I opted for the baked beans; collards and mac and cheese. All were very good and the bits of pork found in the collards added flavor and were a nice touch. The mac and cheese was gooey and had that homemade feel.   Also, the service was great. The employees at the counter were helpful and it seemed like every few minutes a staff member would come into the room we were dining in to make sure everybody was enjoying their food. We were fortunate to not have a line when we came here but while dining, the place quickly filled up.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket Sandwich was really tasty.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 Meat Combo: brisket; pulled pork; ribs; hot link and chicken. Really good!

oljyGE6mC58hynv55pK2WQ.text: Things are really looking up for Rollin' Smoke Barbecue...from being one of the first 15 reviewers, that number has jumped into the triple digits and increases everyday. After a few write-ups in local publications to recently receiving National recognition as one of the top 25 BBQ spots in the country, that is quite an achievement from John, Dusty, Tim, and Mayra and they have single handedly put Las Vegas, Nevada on the Barbecue map!  We dropped by for some True Southern Q before going to see Pin-Up at The Stratosphere. Right away, Dusty suggests the Smoked Meatloaf which has become one of their regular items on their updated and expanded menu of deliciousness. We also got the Seafood Platter with Fried Catfish, Fried Shrimp, Hush Puppies and Fried Okra which they were out of, so one of the cooks suggested the Corn Fritters, and those did not disappoint! Seasoned well and the sweet creaminess of the corn was very tasty!  This huge slab of meaty goodness arrives on top a bed of loaded mashed potatoes, and sweet crispy onions with a sweet BBQ sauce and is one of  the tastiest renditions of an American classic that I've come across! The seafood platter is served with lemon, hot sauce, and tartar sauce was equally delicious. The Shrimp had a crisp outside while still keeping that plump, juicy interior, The Catfish was nice, crisp and flaky, and I'm no hush puppy expert but I thought those were just okay.  If you're still in search of some killer barbecue, you may want to bookmark Rollin' Smoke, it may just become one of your  favorite spots! ALOHA!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Combo Platter
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf up close
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Meatloaf Platter

HWu5dTNcewcKmCFLSsX14g.text: As a southerner, finding good BBQ is something we take seriously. Rollin Smoke did not disappoint.   It's off the strip so we took a short Lyft trip over and it was well worth it.   I had the two meat platter with pulled pork, sliced brisket and corn nuggets. Both meats were delicious - the brisket was cooked perfectly. The corn nuggets were also great. If you haven't had  them before - try them!

8Qi3D2Lw0LnIghcHCeatgg.text: Wow this place has some great Bbq, always busy but worth the wait. Friendly staff , very clean establishmen will definitely return.

WwYDOXcgYvNMidf9K19mSw.text: Let me just start off by saying that I grew up in Virginia and I'm kind of a BBQ snob. With that being said, the food here just did not do it for me. I REALLY wanted to love it. Since moving to Vegas I wanted to find a good BBQ place and just haven't found it.  My boyfriend and I got the 3 meat platter. Beef brisket, burnt ends and pork. My boyfriend said he really didn't care for the beef brisket. The burnt ends were over seasoned. The pork was just a huge clump of plain pork which I had to add a decent amount of sauce to. Sides: mashed potatoes and corn bites. I'll be honest...I swear the mashed potatoes were those Betty crocker bagged dry potatoes with stuff added. It was weird. They tasted flavorful but fake. The corn bites were decent hot but once at room temp they were blah.  We spent about $25 on this meal which is a little expensive. We did get a lot of meat but it just overall was not great.   Sad to say, I'm still on the hunt for a decent BBQ place out here.

VuI1g3Crjjsaxs9Mb_41-A.text: Rollin Smoke is the real deal. Some of the best barbeque you will find for hundreds of miles. Service is always good there, and the meat is supremely good. Everything here is divine but I particularly love the generous beef ribs. If you are on a restrictive diet, like paleo or whole30, try the brisket which has a simple salt and pepper rub. Get out here and continue to support this excellent local business.

MaDFXNT_guPtL5Zfq2f2mg.text: You know it's good when locals are lined up out the door!  We went with 8 people and shared the platters. So much food and the staff were all ridiculously nice. We will definitely be back - excited to find a hidden secret off the strip!

lOqkDkPhjqFxcKer943gjg.text: This place never disappoint. This time around I got the Spudtastic, which is a baked potato with a choice of meat on top of it. I couldn't decide so I choice half pulled pork and brisket, which the staff confirmed was the bestseller. Also, spudtastic is top with cheese, sour cream and green onion. Yummm!  They have everything from pulled pork, brisket, ribs, and chicken. The sides are great! It's fairly priced. The ambience is very relax and it makes you feel at home. The staffs are great and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spudtastic. Yummm!

3HXph76vGePJLaPYW3tYxA.text: I do a mean BBQ myself, mixing my own rubs and sauces, so I go to BBQ restaurants for the sides.  In this case, Rolling Smoke hit both the sides AND the meats. I got Burnt Ends and hot links, since I rarely get to cook brisket anymore. Both hit the spot!!  I also got the Bacon Potato salad. Real bacon, plenty of it, and the Cole slaw is a must-try.  Very good menu, great staff, and fast service.On my list for a return visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jessica is SO helpful, and will give it right back to you! Keep smilin&#39;

tHa6rxir1WxaKOiGQYsgsg.text: Over hyped. The food is medicare, overpriced, over rated. If your first time experiencing bbq is this place, you'll like it. However, If you have actually had real quality bbq from real southern places, you will find this place BLEH.   The pulled pork - flavorless without sauce, bland burnt ends - overly fatty, dry, chunks, potent smoke flavor macaroni and cheese - over cooked pasta, cheese sauce?, bland coleslaw - disgusting, not one redeeming thing about it. brisket - good baked beans - good

ZGc6xWXvA8mP4iwCswnZDA.text: Hands down best BBQ in Vegas  The location is sketch for sure, but that's what makes it such a good hole in the wall.  I've tried several different things, but the smoked meatloaf is my favorite! So amazing and very flavorful!

qsVCF5OmQ3c18BDNoJKOlA.text: Who would've ever expected legit Southern BBQ a 5 minute drive from the strip? The owner must be from Arkansas since the place is covered in Razorbacks stuff. This place would be right at home back in the South. The ribs were smoked just right and were excellent but weren't fall off the bone tender. The chopped brisket was lean and tender with a little bit of a peppery flavor. I was happy to see they have fried okra and it was just right. The beans were tasty as well and have a peppery flavor that's kinda unique and i haven't seen that before. The tea is the real thing and goes perfectly with a BBQ meal. Portions are HUGE and I was barely able to finish my meal. I'll be back here and it's a must try for BBQ fans in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pig smoker aquarium
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket, ribs, fried okra, and BBQ beans
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t miss the sign

Q346OSFFbnt7ZKaj35CWFQ.text: I'm from out of town and this place will be my first stop when I return to Vegas!  The house bbq sauce Arkansause was to die for!

LSkhrhWWcSkBvxHtbV7UJg.text: I'm pretty stingy with my 5-star ratings but this place wins all five.  Was craving BBQ this evening and fired up Yelp.  Proximity search brought this place to the top of the list and I headed over.  From the outside, the place looks like a real hole in the wall, which it is...this place has soul.  Before you even walk through the doors, the aroma of smoked meats sets forth the salivary glands into full production.  I ordered the Trio plate with pulled pork, spare ribs and brisket with a side of hush puppies.  For the money, the volume of food is a very good value.  I managed to eat about 3/4 of the plate and the leftovers easily comprised a separate meal.   The flavor of the meat was delicious and the sauce complemented the meal perfectly.  Even the hush puppies had a nice underlying spice to them that was quite addicting.  Something as simple as properly seasoning hush puppies tells me there is attention to detail here.   Good food can get you four stars but its the staff that pushed it to five for me.  They were incredibly friendly and upbeat.  You can tell when a place is well-run by just listening to how they interact with each other.  It was clear that this staff really cares about what they do and have a passion for their craft.  Thanks for a great meal!

zDFGjD5xnDWYT4zBpt4c5g.text: Tried this place after a search or barbecue in Vegas, still looking for a great spot.  So gave it a try and got the Biggin' sandwich which is a combo of their brisket, pulled pork and hot link all on the same bun.  The bun, is great. Soft and soppy.  The meat, 2 out of 3 were outstanding.  The hot links are great and made in house.  The pulled pork was as good as I've had in Vegas. Didn't care as much for the brisket.  I didn't hate it and it was tender, but it just didn't hold up flavor wise to the other meats.    Their Mac n cheese side was solid as was their peach cobbler.  Def gonna come back and work on some more menu items. So far this is the best BBQ in town.

5dT95HGf9wlI8kZUJzLJAg.text: Food comes out FAST.  Also reasonably priced for the mind-blowing quality. New favorite BBQ joint!

FK1ItDQfk2rALkAYAjcH8A.text: Best barbeque I have ever had. Great flavor with the pulled pork and the brisket, ate more than I should have at lunch, which allowed me to skip dinner. Good waffle fries. Not a place for the diet conscious as your stomach will take over.

nqpVl19tMU7qcChnKRc-tg.text: Until Rollin Smoke opened up, the barbeque  in Las Vegas was HORRIBLE!  The guys at Rollin Smoke know their BARBEQUE !!!  Everything on the menu is fantastic!!  More specifically, the pulled pork, the brisket and the meatloaf.  This is the only place in Vegas to get GREAT barbeque; and to make things even better, they are Razorback fans!!  If you're in Vegas and you're lookin for some great food; stop by Rollin Smoke!!  Woo Pig Soooie!!!!

9Np9lqbvc_Yo8WIdmB6vTw.text: We were in Vegas April 2013 and did a random Yelp search for some BBQ.  This place had high marks and they weren't too far off the strip.  I even feel badly about the low rating that I am leaving, because so many others were so good.  But this is our truth...  We walked into the place and the smell of smoke was potent and we were really eager to try a little of everything.  We ordered a sampler and because we "checked in" there we got a free dessert.  The meal was a HUGE disappointment!  What a shame.  We have strong roots in the south and this did not do it any justice.    The chicken was flavorless.  The ribs had smokey flavor, but was borderline jerky!  The pulled pork was sub-par.  The sides were also a disaster.  The beans were hard and way too spicy, just underdeveloped flavor.  The mac and cheese was a mushy blob of fake-tasting cheese, just not good!  The bread they served was hard and cold.  I would have paid them extra NOT to bring the so called dessert to the table.  That was the poorest excuse for peach cobbler.  Marie Calender's from the local grocery store would have been way better.  The banana pudding was baby food grade, and gritty, just not right!    Maybe we went at the wrong time of day (dinner time on a Tuesday night)?  Perhaps it would have been better at lunch time or on a Friday/Saturday night?  Maybe, if we're desperate, we might try again on a more popular night?    I think the guys are trying hard, because the service was pretty good and hospitable (hence the 1 star).  For us, the service was the only bright spot.  We left a lot of the food picked over and with our pockets $30 lighter.  The waiter came over to the table with a big smile and said "Ain't it good?"  We just didn't have the heart to break it down for him.  It is terrible when you pay for food and it doesn't meet your expectations and you leave hungry...what a waste of time and money :-(

gRf6wtfBj2SPWCBtFXiNog.text: Ok this place is off the hook! Ate there last Tuesday April 15th, had the Outlaw burger and Mac and cheese, the wife had the brisket, chicken and pork baby backs. These guys know how to smoke meat, the bark is awesome and the smoke ring is perfect! The Outlaw burger is EPIC, it's made with their smoked brisket and is about 6" tall when served, good luck getting this in your mouth. The wife's ribs were cooked perfectly to competition standards and man what a flavor.   We had to go back for round 2 and hit the place up on Saturday April 19th. This time I got the smoked meat loaf and a hot link, the wife got 3 types of ribs, the pork, the baby back and the beef rib. The meat loaf was the best I have ever had, smoked meat loaf is the the only way to make meat loaf, I can't wait to try it in my smoker! The wife's pork ribs were perfect again, but wait the beef rib is the bell ringer! This thing is actually prime rib on a stick (rib) it's about 3" thick and done perfectly, the smoke ring, bark and flavor are the radical, this is smoked prime rib at its finest. My only dig would be the hot link wasn't cooked enough (luke warm), but the flavor was great. We will be back, every time we are in Vegas, I can't wait!!  On another note you'll be safe at this place, every cop in town eats there. 3 squad cars were in the parking lot when we pulled up and then 3 more showed up when we were eating. I don't know who was covering the streets of Vegas, but they were all eating well! I had to have the tee shirt, way to go Rollin smoke!

RovW1Nh7P3-b1sNcu-AzBA.text: Killer food! Corn nuggets, sliced brisket and spare ribs were outstanding! The workers are extremely friendly and personable. We gave this place 10 out of 10! This will be our place to go when we come back to visit!

B1QS6779EV3kjfL6YSvk_Q.text: We just ate there again, one thing that has to be found in a good restaurant IMHO is consistency, there is no point in having a place that on one night can serve a great meal and the next night it sucks.  Well Rollin Smoke keeps delivering fantastic BBQ, end of story, I cannot recommend this place enough.

jsrvibe4heLDy2GEwANaew.text: Theeeeee Besssssst BBQ Everrrrr. You gotta try the loaded nachos. It's like half a pound of waffle fries, topped with your choice of meat, (I always get pulled pork), chile beans, nacho cheese, sour cream, BBQ sauce, and green onions. OMG delicious. $14 a pop, but can fill 2 people easily.

xakmTlDXYPGMSpet-d28nQ.text: Can't wait to come back here. My family and I had damn near the whole menu and EVERYTHING is delicious!! Incredibly friendly staff, too!

gpG6YpVChaMc-s88jRrlQA.text: If you like bbq go no further! ! Real smoke.  Girl did the Chicken and pulled pork,  loaded mashed.  I did ayce only $24.95 & when they say anything off the menu they were not joking.  First round 2 beef ribs super tender just enough cooking tender juicy sweet,  baby back ribs. Beans out of bounds,  steak beans with black pepper,  cayenne spicy good. Mac cheese meah. 2nd round brisket and baby backs so yummy tender brisket smoke rings all with pickles and white bread. Red onion straws and needed cool off had Dessert blue bell ice cream Hershey chocolate syrup. Seriously don't bother going anywhere else. Hard part I'm 300 miles from home in OC. Tell Dusty pit boss Michael the foodie from OC sent you.

9cm7G3enh03rcrHYp8Kb7A.text: I tried it at th GA Foodie fest and was not impressed. The smoke flavor i tasted was weird. The brisket was dry! Disappointing!

ZAVY0ftCeNpj81la-SuWew.text: I love this little spot. Everything about this place is good. The brisket and the smoked chicken are my favorite. Their homemade barbecue sauce is smoky and delicious. Their sides are also really good as well. Let me tell you something very important.. ALWAYS GET THE CORN NUGGETS. They are the most addicting thing ever. It's like fried creamed corn balls. Best balls you ever put in your mouth. Support this local business! They know how to make some delicious food.

r9Um9UX1X6r8VLPPVsHD9w.text: The corn nuggets are worth the trip alone. We had the Rib platter with corn nuggets and a Duo with Beef Brisket, 2 Spare ribs and fried okra. This was enough food for 3 or 4 people. Another Las Vegas gem!! The beef rib was like something from The Flintstones size wise. My favorite was the baby backs. Don't miss out on this place.

X1LAc-m1qQJmi_2nTZrozA.text: This place has some great BBQ. Their sides are pretty good as well. We normally get a platter to share and it's more than enough food for 2 people.

XoWpSHY3YzuNEb0XGKUv7g.text: So let me start by saying this is a tough lil spot to find.  If you are not familiar with Las Vegas u will get lost.  There is usually a line to wait in to order your food from a guy sitting at a podium like a judge in court.  The prices are very high.  I ordered a half rack of St. Louis ribs, a half rack of Baby back ribs, Half pound of burnt ends, and a soda.  This came with two sides so i chose mac n cheese and coleslaw.  I paid $50.  WTF...?    The ribs were awesome but the burnt ends were almost all fat and not burnt.  The mac  n cheese was something like what u get at a bad diner.  Coleslaw...meh.  Soda was great.  lol  I assume a probably wont be back as its a pain to get there and costly.  I can eat at other rib places and get more bang for my buck IMO.

bX8oTU4Swy4mvvEpGyxY4Q.text: Wow! Wow! Wow!! The best, most authentic BBQ I have ever tasted! We went as a group of four and each of us ordered something different.  We wanted a variety of meats and sides.  The meats were so tender and delicious and bursting with a flavor.  They have a great selection of "sides" but the Mac-n-cheese was my favorite.  Not overly cheesy -- just perfect!  And then came dessert!  Absolutely amazing!  We tried the peach cobbler, berry cobbler and their famous banana pudding!  Oh my goodness! The banana pudding was the best I've ever tasted! Rollin Smoke BBQ takes the time to perfect ever aspect of their menu.  You will not be disappointed.  We can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat trio with Mac-n-cheese.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spudtastic with pulled pork!

b7sllMadnA0D4TZdLLhi5g.text: Went here for the 2nd time earlier this week. It's in an industrial area, a little off the beaten path. There was virtually no lighting in the parking lot, I wondered if it was open. The number of cars in the parking lot suggested it was and there was an Open sign with some other flashing signage so I went in.  You order at a podium like desk. I had a Lehigh Valley IronPigs hat on, displaying a pig, and the order taker took a liking to it. I went with the brisket sandwich combo and ordered cole slaw (not the jalepeno cole slaw this time) as my side.  Quite promptly my sandwich was delivered by one of the staff. Overflowing with tasty shredded brisket. The cole slaw was a nice compliment. I left stuffed.  The place has a casual atmosphere, couples, buddies, and families.  I'm glad I found this place and will definitely be back.

IF4WD1xPATmMyzwxB3iSNQ.text: Allow me to begin with " ummmmmhmmmm, that bbq is so good it will make your shoes fall off!"  Or something like that from my time in the deep south.  I've decided to try one item at a time, starting with pulled pork. I ordered for carry out, and had to stand around until my "table" was up for service.  There does not seem to be a distinguishing of take away orders vs table service, so expect to wait.  The only area in which to do so is a service station and I had to keep moving about.  The pulled pork was worth the travel and wait time.  The meat is tender but holds together.  It has an intense smoke flavor and mild flavorful sauce.  I'm thrilled to have ordered 1lb so I can pig out and still have some to share.  Go here.

KjGCu4y0aWThTAAMV09OYg.text: Great food, you want awesome BBQ in Vegas this the place to go, off the strip a couple blocks but well worth it, The staff is friendly and they have plenty of room to sit on the inside and outside of the place

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 Rib platter, so good

bMJz2sDpfLMZZDeijywrOQ.text: Right off the bat when you walk in, Bam it hits you! The Aroma of smoked meat somewhere in the back..I've been hearing about this place for awhile and well since I live in Henderson it's kinda far but I had a chance this time and I was in for a treat...              I wasn't sure what to order.... oh wait yeah I was, Beef Ribs but I wanted like a combo so I got the babyback/ St. Louis/  Beef Rib combo with a side of bacon potato salad all for about $24 bucks. Holy smokes it was worth every penny. This was one of the best char and flavor. The meat was hot juicy exactly what I was looking for...      Now on to the Beef Rib..I believe that you are not a BBQ place if you don't cook Beef Ribs, that's my opinion anyway. So I'm thinking let's go cause right at this moment for me Phil's BBQ Beef Rib was the bar for me and whelp no longer. I have a new bar and it's no longer in San Diego. Rolling Smoke you killed it! I mean the best. I'm gonna have dreams about this! I pray if I may that you open in Henderson..I'm fan and will continue to come back as long as you have Beef Ribs..Thanks Guys you rock \m/

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib combo

AR5ZYNkbIM3A6vBglQcjsw.text: Great BBQ very close to the main strip, but not the strip and not common among the tourists.  Well priced.  Definitely a good choice.  They say they are  ranked 10th in the US.

ovqQCKPOKlkOcZgD0hKF2g.text: yeah buddy' dam good' wish i had some right now'

4DsmQ0blHxYPknDMecAO3g.text: Friendly staff, but meat was bland.  There were four of us.  Together (4 of us), we ordered a slab, fries, 3 meat, corn bread, and beans. Had better ribs.  Cornbread was the best!

w9zVni5vL9H3VBjosRzWVw.text: Ok, so this is about as good as barbeque is going to get in Vegas.  That being said it doesn't quite compare with the likes of Oklahoma Joe's in KC and a few places in Texas, etc.    I really enjoyed this place.  It felt like a barbeque joint should feel.  It had the picnic tables, it had the great hog's head, it even had a line going out the door, which is a good sign.   I took advantage of the all you can eat, so that I could sample a little bit of everything.  The catfish was divine.  The meat was excellent and so was the sauce.    If you get a craving for bbq in Vegas, this is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Any place that has a big hog head with a hat in it, is ok with me.

9oDRmCsmXA4ZBbFsBx5iIg.text: The husband and I come to Vegas at least once if not more times a year. We are foodies and have had amazing meals here at 5 star lux restaurants. Last time we were in Vegas we wanted to try something different: "cheaper" eats, just to shake it up. It was fun and we ended up at Rolling Smoke as a result.  Now, here is the thing: this place gave me the best "bite" of food I've ever had in all of Vegas. Tied with $500 chef tasting menu meals at Andre's. I kid you not. The "world famous beef rib" was that amazing. It reminded me of the Flintstones brontosaurus chops it was so big. Husband and I split it and it was so good I was tempted to fork fight him for it. It was lucious.  I don't actually remember anything much else. The sides, the other meats (we got a 3 meat platter and upgraded for 6 bucks to a beef rib with it per Yelp recommendations) and the service were just a bit above average, I recall. There was something I vaguely recall about a charge for sauce or something that was irritating but beyond that all I recall was that rib and my mouth waters just thinking about it. So I am rating the rib 5 stars and the rest about 3.5 and that brings us to 4.   We're going back in February so I'll update again after.

Jlh5nVeU9gkAK8TZgEeIjQ.text: All too often we go out for some 'cue only to find that their sauces have gluten-containing ingredients (like malt vinegar, non-GF Worcestershire or soy sauce). Thank you Rollin Smoke for filling that gap! Their sauces are gluten free and the pit master / staff there will guide you through which sides are gluten free too.  Located in an industrial-ish area, yet close to Arts District, Rollin Smoke offers some really nice meats. We always opt for the Rib Platter Special with an extra Beef Rib. Oh my gollys, that beef rib.  Can't describe it without salivating so much!  Now on our last trip there, the pork spare ribs were on the dry side. Nothing that a dousing of sauce could fix, but hopefully they make it better next time.  PS If you're a local, just drive here rather than their location at the Pawn Plaza. Much better experience.

Hcx6nkqfi4PnhSNNEI6mtQ.text: Heard a lot of good things, definitely lived up to it!! Everything very fresh and tender!! Even the Sauces are pretty good! Bit of a drive off the strip but not far at all!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket,Pulled Pork, &amp;Greens!! Very tender and flavorful!! So good!!

KmxvwE0-tAoKsxr0Us0tEw.text: Love this place. Kinda pricey but flavor is spot on!! Large portions. Great meal when we are in town!

bT1DVsrNknRdl9hy7g061A.text: Y'all want some good BBQ. Come on in!  I love that they serve beef ribs and I mean these are like Flintstones size ribs. Speaking of Flintstones they also have these huge smoked turkey legs.  My favorite is definitely their smoked meatloaf topped with BBQ sauce and fried onion strings over some rib sticking (no pun intended) mash potatoes. And  if that were not enough a side of their corn fritters dusted with magic.    Not in the mood for meatloaf, try their famous "Outlaw Burger" and try to finish this in one sitting...waffle fries too!  Don't forget to sip some of their wonderful sweet tea and save room for one of their delicious desserts like their banana pudding.    The food and service just don't disappoint!!!!

1g5AjhqYOz3sdmncIKFdhg.text: Restaurant is nice and the wait time isn't too bad. Lizelle was very nice, as well as the other staff who said hi to me within 20 seconds of me walking through the door.  And most importantly the food is amazing! I don't live in Las Vegas but I visit here often. I'll have to make sure I visit Rollin Smoke BBQ again!

YJ-PgqsVwa7EXVI_q3zF7A.text: First time to this place it was very friendly and good food. I ordered brisket sandwich and my husband order the piggy sandwich and his was a little dry. Mine was juicy. We will definitely be back upon our next trip.

dw15x3OiP8UQkZL4AC4EvQ.text: Great food! Go for the pit special and sub in burnt ends you won't be disappointed!  All meat was tender and flavorful. The loaded mash and Mac n cheese were fabulous!  If you are looking for a great B-B-Q place this is it!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LDg9wH3FEV1e_8TrrCHALA.text: Beef Ribs. Beef Ribs. Beef Ribs. Those succulent, fall off the bone BBQ marinated goodness. There's seriously no reason not to get the beef ribs. This is exactly what they are known for and each bite will remind you of why they are given such high grandeur. Of course you should get some sides! Maybe a piece of cornbread and some good mac & cheese and don't forget to wash it down with some really good sweet tea.   This place is a gem you wouldn't have known Vegas would have but trust me, you'll enjoy every bite and glimmer.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn bread, sweet potatoes, and jalapeño coleslaw
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A Rack of beef ribs

EfHDJsz-pjQejux0qZ1ZRg.text: Stumbled across this place by accident while visiting LV. All the other places we wanted to go to were closed so we headed here instead and am so glad we did! It was close to closing time by the time we got to this place but it was still packed! Ordered the pit special with 5 different meats and 3 sides. They were out of mac and cheese by then but that wasn't a huge issue and we couldn't really blame them being so close to closing. We just got another side instead. Had to take the food to go since they were just about closed but everything was amazing. Great flavors and the meats were smoked perfectly and tender. Sides were awesome as well. There was so much food left we had the rest for breakfast in the morning. Me and boyfriend have returned every time we're in LV. For the two of us, we just share the 3 meat plate ($17.99/2=$8.99/person) and that's plenty of food for us. You seriously get a lot of food. Staff members are also great. Always happy to serve you and always cheerful and very helpful. Plenty of seating and everything you need for your meal is always stocked on the side table so you never have to wait to ask the staff for anything. Absolutely love this place!

fwsQUXiOyrAGJ8JeqJMJMw.text: Favorite BBQ spot here in town!  They're tucked away in a not-very-pedestrian-friendly area, so if you're staying on the Strip, I suggest taking a cab --- or getting it delivered via Postmates! Either way, GET IT IN YOUR STOMACH.  They have several different combo options available, with a wide variety of delicious side dishes to choose from. I always choose from their smaller combo options (usually their pulled pork sandwich with mac & cheese or beans) because, well, to be quite honest, even then, there is SO MUCH FOOD.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Took the boy here. His first time! ;) Spudtastic (w/ pork) + onion strings for me, the &#34;Outlaw&#34; burger + mac &amp; cheese from him.

xgRSeqIETENyfhYQCYPFCw.text: I grew up in TX and now live in Cheyenne, WY (military). I MISS great BBQ. We took a weekend trip to Vegas and found this place tucked away in a corner. Fantastic BBQ!! I had the 3 meat plate (sliced brisket, pulled pork & pie ribs) w/coleslaw and mac n cheese. Loved every bite. My husband had the 3 brisket plate and some beef ribs as well. Man... I took a couple bites of his plate and DAMN. Everything hit the spot. They have multiple choices on awesome sauces as well. Something for everyone. Definitely check this place out.

UcIBlw_969RMWCnxGz5iCg.text: Tried BBQ in Las Vegas... Really Really Good.. Tried two combo... i will revisit this place when i visit Las Vegas again...

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IkZXjF8bcuDg6U0EDrPSwg.text: By far the best BBQ in Vegas. A must every time I visit. Need to have the burnt ends.

2Y8ep7UcEqp-6ZIefZZNtw.text: I consider myself a BBQ snob and in most cases I rather just take the time and smoke my own.  The family and I have been I vegas for a week and were craving some BBQ so when I saw all the reviews I was like ok let give it a run..  Simple menu we ordered the special 5 cuts of meat and 3 sides we subed the pork ribs for beef,  bacon potato salad, beans and corn fritters all amazing they took a lil long on our fries so they gave us a free peach cobbler.   Thank you, Ricky, Telly, Antonio, Alex, Lizelle, Christal great BBQ keep up the good work Go Razorbacks! Great way to feed the whole family and not spend an arm and a leg.  See you next time we are in Vegas... Gerry0625

A6wuyr13-IWX0-D-XWX1qg.text: A FOR EFFORT. Went back today for their great brisket sandwich; and was glad to see a more generous portion. But now they've dis-improved the taste with a powerful amount of peppercorn rub. Strike one.

D_ZTs7DmbNU7L9szns9qvw.text: They banked way too hard on the idea that their signature sauces are good and forgot to give their meat any attention. My food was terribly greasy and when their options for sauce did not impress me after trying all of them, I attempted to eat the meat with out sauce and it was truly gross. My husband who is not a picky eater in the slightest felt the same way and he tried their sampler plate. We both threw away a majority of our food.

IcbZeA2vyUOKL1If_REtzA.text: Ok, so in planning our trip to Vegas, what do foodies do, look for food of course. My friend has been wanting "delicious" smoked bbq for a long time and so I did as anyone would, researched and found Rollin Smoke Barbeque! The reviews were pretty much all 5 star so out of the choices, they got bumped up to #1  We arrived in Vegas, checked in, unpacked as much as we wanted and then off to get that yummy bbq.  The location is nothing much to draw you in but once inside, it's ok. There are benches, a counter with all the things you'll need, plastic ware, plates, to go containers, bags, napkins, sauces, etc and the counter where you order.  The staff and service are wonderful BUT the food is definitely not a 5, I'm so sorry to say.  All of the meat, ribs, brisket, pulled pork and chicken were in desperate need of SEASONING and the potato salad and corn bread needed something too, the waffle fries were good though and likely bc they were seasoned   I give the service a 5 but not the food and why I can only give a 3. I've actually had so much better and would've been truly upset if I'd traveled this far only for the bbq.  I'd still say to those reading, give it a try because we all have our own level of good so while my friend and I are critical, others will like it!  Enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_AQ2tZmyvaRgNZW43ERnpQ.text: This bbq Joint is downtown Vegas but is more of a "smoked bbq" as opposed to what u may think of. I'm glad for two major things:(1) They've got. @ 6 different sauces from vinegar to Carolina mustard to hot. (2) They've got several unique "sides." Corn nuggets and dirty rice w/scallions. Overall a good variety and I'd go back.

pq74b05_FETEV6zjlc1mNA.text: The ribs,chicken,brisket,pull pork were so tender. The hot links were horrible due to casing of the link was tough. The yams excellent. Mac and cheese bland in taste. The corn nuggets were cook hard and bland tasting. I love the pit special is a good price for the quantity. The quality should have been better

qs1QfRjMPmifh8pZ4ttUag.text: I arrived about 30 minutes before closing! I know that because the order taker was explaining to the person in front of me how she was ready to go! I ordered the 3 rib plate. The beef ribs were pretty but not as tender as I like them. The other ribs were basic! The best part was the beans. They were simple with meat.. just how I like them.

UyYbwoh_ZxRR5PAk6k6PXA.text: Great service. Excellent food that was ordered for take out. Everything was ready when I arrived and still very hot. Amazing koolaid lol

gqo-93RpXbF-EYBs-VoCCQ.text: I love finding hidden local joints because it's not crowded and not at all pricy for the size of the dish . My boyfriend and i decided to come here when we read all the reviews on yelp. I am here to say that the reviews are pretty accurate. We ordered the sampler just because it's not easy to choose just one. We were able to substitute one of the meats out for a beef rib for an extra $6.  Our sampler came with tri tip, brisket, pork ribs, and sausage links (substituted it for a beef rib). The order of a sample also came with your choice of 3 sides. The sides we chose were the corn nuggets, waffle fries, and corn bread.   The sides were my favorite!!! If you like sweet creamy corn encased in crispy fried goodness, then you'll like this. I would definitely come back. They also have an ayce option which is a crazy idea to me since my boyfriend and I barely made a dent in our generously portioned sampler.  But hey, if you can eat, you might like this option.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SAmpler  yay

SXTS_3kgsKGlLzxXT0JELA.text: Everything about this place is amazing. The staff were so helpful and welcoming. That really meant a lot to us, because just two days ago my poor family suffered racist taunts right on the strip! But we didn't have to be worried here. The staff and customers were people of all ethnicities who were kind and decent. Definitely a place locals go, seems like we were the only tourists there.   And the food! Look at the deliciousness I captured on camera! I adore burnt ends and scarfed a whole pound of them myself. Honestly if you're hungry get 2 pounds. 1 is good if you've a good appetite and plan on eating other stuff. Like the special my family ordered! Can't remember what they chose, but I remember that the sides were loaded mashed potatoes (so good!), baked beans (also delicious) and coleslaw (don't get this, it's sour and kinda flavorless). My mom also ordered a beautiful salad. You don't expect a bbq joint to have great salads, but they did!   It's nothing fancy inside, and it's very much a little hole in the wall. As most people know, that's where the best food is, so don't be a snob and let the food speak for itself. It's better and cheaper than other bbq places in our hometown of Los Angeles. It's not on the strip, but it's only maybe a 10-15 minute drive away. Go, you'll be full and satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mom with the special they ordered.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A pound of burnt ends! So delicious.

tMiFWHXtxOF7rg357NBt-w.text: This place is THE place in Vegas for good melt-in-your-mouth spare ribs. Plus, the Mac n cheese is great as is the brisket. Pictures to follow but we already started eating.

w7bPES7qHv5ASZA3WTRw0A.text: If you're look for good bbq don't start here!! First off we get to order our food and the girl had already an attitude with taking our order I heard her say they didn't have chicken on the bone only pulled! So we already starting off bad, I make another choice of brisket and a hot link and Mac n cheese as my side. Got our food and the brisket was dry and no flavor what so ever their bbq sauce tasted like watered down ketchup and the hot link was okay but no bbq sauce to enjoy my food the Mac n cheese had pieces of pepper in it, it tasted like frozen velvita Mac n cheese! I could have went to Famous Dave's and probably would had been more satisfied. I don't recommend this place if you're looking for some good ol bbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped brisket n Hot Links

c8LliFbt0ilcqMIIdO6syg.text: What an incredible place! Off the strip..... easy to find, really clean and you can tell family owned. The food is AMAZING, Smokey just like the name made with love and delicious! The sauce options are perfect for this high quality BBQ. I would make the drive to Vegas every week for this place! Have to come check it out

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DHqxLT3Ql7sObp-lRskU4Q.text: Local place and southern bbq. Real smoke and coming all the way from Florida and seeing claims of authentic bbq had me suspicious but they nailed it.  Burnt ends  Chopped brisket both on point   Spare ribs were great  Chicken wasn't over cooked   Waffle fries were seasoned, hot, and good.   The sauces The spicy means spicy. Not over the top hot but don't, I repeat don't dunk your food in it or you will pay.   The Mac and cheese also a solid choice.   Glad Yelp is alive and well bc we would have never found this place without them.   Featured on the travel channel and just a great hole in the wall place to eat. Bring and empty stomach tho!!

kLuyQeCbUFKVlaVI2wsLwA.text: Very good BBQ!   I eat my BBQ dry, preferring the flavor of the smokey meat to the sweet &/or tang of BBQ sauce. My wife and I shared 4 meats all of which were good. The best was the sliced brisket, which was plenty lean and rubbed with a peppery rub. Fantastic!   We also had the chopped brisket, pulled pork and spare ribs. All were good as were the side dishes. The mac & cheese was best of those.  Portion size is plentiful making this a good value too.  We will definitely be back.

99Cww4XwiRCix2-m0bzjaA.text: The food unfortunately was not anything I've expected. I'm a New Yorker... and this is the first time 3k+ reviews have failed me! NOT SOUL FOOD NOT GOOD BBQ

oqvCgmd0IXvqhbvOtBkVdg.text: Last night i,went to the original rollen smoke bbq on highland in vegas don't let the area or appearance scare you away you will be sorry if you don't go in once in we ordered the all ccan eat 35 dollar meal anything thing on the menu from appetizer to.desert you have 1 hour to.eat we eat brisket, that melted in your mouth ,Bert ends also melted awway,baby back ribs thafell of the bone,,spire ribs.so flaverfull hot.links great leader with thacomes.any side you.want we had mac chesse creamy goodness ,baked beangreat smoky taste collargreens cooked with brisket excellent, yams perfect we went 3 rounds and,were stuffed wanted to.keep,going,but couldn't so lasbut not least we had desert hot yum,y cobbler ,root beer float , and banana pudding ,the employees were warm and helpful inside was clean service excellent try all there bbq saucesthey have 6 kinds so all over all if.there was.a 6 STAR THEY WOULD HAVE IT go.get your feed bag on you won't be sorry till next time big kev

5ZnZ_aGZtbYSZUtkwhxLZQ.text: Wow wow wow!!! This is some bomd ass down home bbq right here!!! Thank you Vegas for having this place!!!!!!! Cant wait to go back! The meat is very well seasoned, the sides are all on point and the bbq sauce has a good tang!

-y7v5gHTM11AjoGTKju5IA.text: This was my second time here and this is where you want to go if you want the best Barbeque. The first time I tried the smoked meatloaf and this time I had the Outlaw burger. That burger was AWESOME! I mashed it down as good as I could and it ate surprisingly well ! This was an experience I'll never forget! I also met one of the owners, didn't get his name but I could tell I would get along with him really well. Really cool southern boy like me! My wife had the tips and loved them. Can't wait to try other things on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g2T2a7uBeJxvOhwJucvCzA.text: I'm told that good BBQ doesn't need sauce...and that may be True but that doesn't mean you shouldn't when the sauce is just that good!  Wifey got smoked meatloaf (never tasted anything like that before, amazing), I got chopped brisket sandwich (it didnt NEED sauce, I just couldnt help myself) and my kiddo got a chicken sandwich.     I sampled all of the sauces and all of them were good but SNAP!  that country girl sauce was the best sauce I've ever tasted and it sent my sandwich to the moon.  Only "meh" was my side salad, it was average but that's my bad, what was I thinking ordering a salad at a BBQ joint?!?!?   Get there early, the crowds kick in quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked meatloaf, oh my!!!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped brisket sandwich....you want this I promise.

nHFxN0E9jgFojc6JSE9qJg.text: This place is amazing!!!!  Any chance we make it down towards the strip this is where we go. The duo with pulled pork and two ribs is where it's at. Any of their sides are worth the money. Ordered the corn nuggets and had a mound of them on my plate. Enough for the whole family. The corn bread tastes like pound cake and anywhere in Vegas that has real sweet tea will get my vote.  Miss being in the south and this place makes me feel like I'm at home.

WQVW0z43YTY9KCRRaFDYeA.text: First visit tonight and holy hell it was good...if you need me, I'll be passed out in the sofa.

irtV5eY3sHGkBu64M-QFBw.text: The barbecue was great but the side dishes need to bigger for Catering, like beans n Mac cheese.

n83-UwPssP6bB4EqI82How.text: Rollin smoke has the very best bbq!! Have ordered samplers a couple times and this place is consistently delicious. Everything is cooked perfectly and does not disappoint!

6QG_oHIUpz1OD6oyx7sOoA.text: This place is outstanding!! I consider myself choosy when buying ribs away from home because I have come to prefer what I usually cook. Man, this place has a great menu and well-prepared ribs. They ribs were just what you want from wood-cooking. Tasty and tender. I will be visiting this place every time I go to Vegas!

dgLSCHvZLJI20-w6WXLg6A.text: Came here for the beef ribs..DAMN GOOD! Bring your appetite cause they have generous portions. Definitely will come back. Its worth the visit!

q1nSk0_g_73ylQ5MPVG1cA.text: Okay so here we go the BBQ needed more flavor the top part where the smoke was was okay but when you get into the rib it had no flavor the brisket was the same way I'm a chicken was the same way really lacked flavor when you bit into it the rib tips however had a lot of flavor also good was the corn nuggets and the banana pudding the peach cobbler didn't float my boat now let's get onto the hamburger it had a lot of flavor is very moist and I would order it again but that's only if I go back I'm still looking for the best barbecue in Las Vegas and Dave's barbeque still is the best in my opinion years ago they had a gates barbecue in town but it closed down because the owners son like to gamble which is a shame because that was the best barbecue in Las Vegas they're also famous in Kansas City and still have a store there all in all not the best barbecue in Vegas I'm going to keep searching

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

igZdDogXvSqN_V5Jr5xZdQ.text: Two words: freakin' awesome. If you love BBQ this is a must. A little out of the way but worth the drive/cab ride. You will not find such awesomeness on the strip...and super reasonable prices. Their burger was amazing-it was actually smoked! Their banana pudding was simply perfect. I have never had a better one and I'm a bit of a banana pudding addict. Just go- you will be so happy you did!

PNWpZgMrM82SOuqC3DhR3Q.text: Rollin Smoke BBQ catered my daughters 21st birthday party and delivered it to us at the Cosmo!! They were really nice and professional and easy to communicate with. They handled my huge order with ease.  We had brisket, beef ribs, baby backs, spare ribs, sausage, burnt ends, and chicken!! Everything was excellent. The brisket and burnt ends were devine!! The beef ribs were huge and tender as everyone loved the selection of meats that were put out. And then there were the sides. We had a pan of the bacon potato salad, a pan of the jalepeno cole slaw, a pan of the kickin beans, a pan of greens, a house salad as well as some candied yams. Just let me say that there was nothing left after the party as people went back for seconds and thirds! They will even do speacial orders on items not on the menu! I highly reccomend Rollin Smoke as the best BBQ In Vegas!!

nW2MRbouCxRQE6YzpCIgCQ.text: I'm not one of those guys who will pretend to be an expert on Barbecue.  I'm not going to get into the debate of Texas vs. Carolina vs. Arkansas vs. wherever.  You've seen those charity ads with the tagline "Hunger knows no borders?"  Well, as far as I'm concerned, good BBQ knows no state lines.  If you insist upon knowing however, an Arkansas flag hanging inside provides a clue as to their roots.  As others have remarked, this place is located off the beaten track, and easy to miss.  Even with the GPS bleating at me and the smell of the smokers wafting through my windows, I blew by it and had to circle back.  The shopping center it is located in is a bit down-at-heel, but not dangerous.  Walk through the door and there is a podium at the back of the room with an "Order Here" sign.  It may be unattended, but there is a hotel desk-bell to help you get their attention.    There is a nice selection of dishes, sandwiches, platters, and combos, so you should be able to find something however small or large your appetite.    The BBQ is excellent.  Thoroughly smoked flavor; not dried out.  They provide sauce, but it really doesn't need it.  All in all, a great find, and worth the visit.

FJjlis0g0RZtAIIyld54LQ.text: The only TRUE BBQ available in Las Vegas. I have eaten BBQ (True, smoked BBQ) all over TX and Kansas City and have tried all kinds of places here in LV but this IS legit!! Excellent dry rub and smoked to perfection. The brisket and baby backs are my favorite. The baby backs are melty tender in the middle and nice and jerky like on the ends.  The brisket is comparable to Rudy's and Blacks BBQ in TX - some of the best I've had. SUPER nice folks and a family run business. Location kinda sucks but it just adds to the True BBQ ambiance. (Ha Ha!)

RdFK3ZqDQaTXDvbWh6CvaQ.text: The food was ok at best and a bit pricey.  The location of the restaurant is in industrial area off the strip and small.  Even though the restaurant is small there is plenty of room to sit comfortably.  The staff was ok but the food does take a while be brought out.  The restaurant has an offer on Yelp for a free desert if you check in.... make sure you let them know prior to finishing your order if not they will not honor it.  I told the gentleman at the register just as he gave me my total and another guy who was standing behind him said I should have told them earlier.  He made no attempt to honor the offer he just waited for my payment.

zKlLmWuOKy_54HGsIWpUXQ.text: Great food! It's a small place and doesn't look like much outside. I actually drove past it the first time. Once I found it I was glad I did. Possibly the best ribs I have ever had. The wife's pulled piggy sandwich was great too!

v0IPTYi4zhaxbMIjXTOmgQ.text: If you like smokey awesomeness then this place is for you.  The best spare ribs I've  had in ages.   The sauce is very tasty with just the right amount of kick.  We had dinner there tonight and it was great.  The owners are very friendly and accommodating.  There is nothing fancy or pretensions about this place -- just solid BBQ at reasonable prices and a quick 15 min walk back to the strip.

lhGhd8Km74ktQ-SL1w9K3w.text: Had the all you can eat special.  Plenty of good barbecue and no limit on the food.  Includes the side dishes, desserts and drinks.  The employees are all friendly and go out of their way to help in any way.  The dining area appeared to be clean and employees were quick to clean up any mess.  We will return for more of their excellent food.

EhGn5aCUnea58kcs2zNgNQ.text: A MUST go to!! The portions are HUGE, prices are dirt cheap!! Have tried several different menu items there, ALL A+!! The chocolate thunder dessert with almond crust is impeccable! Every item smoked there on the property . Have never had any better here in Las Vegas. It is a well kept secret that many others need to discover. One visit and you are hooked to return!

xPmgtgLz7ggT9W0yDFljFw.text: I am finally have a chance to write this review about this AMAZING BBQ place!!!  At first my boyfriend and I were looking for steak, we have these weekend staycations we stay at the hotels because we like room service in bed! We headed down stairs to the steak house and decided last minute how YUMMY BBQ would be!  So I YELP'd BBQ and a few places came up, one being Rollin Smoke and most others smack in the middle of the busy Saturday night strip time (no thanks)...  We drove about the mile yelp said, and yes it was a super dark street not a lot of cars around... and I started getting that "I think I've seen this Law and Order episode" about the couple that goes to the dimly light bbq place and is never seen again.  So we drive past and I say to my BF "you know it is normally these off the beat path ones that are AWESOME!!! And you can't ignore the 3 GIANT smokers in the parking lot!!  So I say let's go!"  When we got in the place was quite nicely decorated and very clean, you can smell the food which made my tummy start screaming "FEED ME" The 2 gentlemen running the BBQ place were as kind as can be!  We each to get the ribs and chicken combo with side of coleslaw & BBQ beans. The prices were great over there and they have a bunch of things to choose from which was great!! SInce the place was not packed we got to sit in the room with the TV and they even let us watch what we wanted.  Our food came out and we were shocked to see they there was enough to feed a small village in just one order!  I don't even know the best way to describe this smoked deliciousness of ribs and chicken that hit my belly! Oh it was heaven, the chicken fell off the bone when I picked it up and the ribs were so tender! And I got the flashback of a few minutes earlier of the chef saying "he was from the (arkansas or Alabama) and he took much pride in his smoked bbq." NOW if ALL bbq places would care that much!!!   They must start cooking their meats early early to get them with that much flavor.  In my life I only profess & save my undying love for very special things, so far only my doctor and a sushi place from LA have made it on this list, but I know I am adding "Rollin Smoke" to it now!!!  I had my leftovers for breakfast and my grandmother had some of my chicken left, she commented it was the best she had ever had!! (and that was cold leftovers)!!!     I know it might seem sketchy when you drive up but DON'T be a fool and pass it by just for that!!! This BBQ is some serious HEAVEN!!!!

RySPCBkPARVfBiqFUH7T5g.text: Got dang! Brisket on point ! Beef ribs..... My husband is from Georgia and these are the best he's ever tasted!!! The mac n cheese is ridiculous and the potato salad.....ohhhhh girl!

JSQF6e61UFt4NFJFsQybfQ.text: Probably the best BBQ joint in Vegas. The location is right off of the strip so it's not far to get to from any side of town. The service was speedy, the food was amazing and the service was great. I'd like to point out that the woman Brenda who works there was very inviting and professional. She welcomed my party with a smile and a friendly hello to make us feel at home. Definitely recommend you eating here.

fldNZNVX6_PHihCfiWyDyQ.text: Some of the best ribs and Banana pudding that I have ever had. All of the employees are very kind especially Brenda. Highly recommend it!

lupi1Dm3xuZih6QK6bXETQ.text: So, we didnt actually visit this location but they catered a friends party over the weekend. The beef and ribs were out of this world. mac and cheese was great. potato salad good. Get yourself some...best bbq in vegas!

rDwNp8W3ZWmUkt1nO6eDXg.text: Quick service, excellent customer service! Baby back ribs very Smokey flavor and fell off the bone. Bacon potato salad good.   I recommend this for BBQ

YsacncGAgsBmcVsloUAq-g.text: After a two year hiatus, I decided to give Rollin' Smoke another try last weekend, and I am so happy I did! They've made major improvements and now this is going to be back on my dining rotation.   I came to eat on a Saturday afternoon and was shocked that there wasn't the usual line out the door. The two employees at the registers were very fast at taking orders and moved everyone through quickly. I was most impressed. The lovely woman who helped us was so friendly and eager to please. None of our special requests were denied, and she was absolutely delightful to deal with. I wanted all white meat on my combo plate, no problem. She answered all of my food questions cheerfully and correctly. I was most impressed.   The dining area had been changed since my last visit, with far more tables and open spaces. Everything was a picnic table, so if you have a bad back, be warned.   I had the combo plate with chopped brisket and white meat chicken, with the collard greens as my side and an unsweetened iced tea. I was so happy to see that they now have Splenda as a sweetener choice! The iced tea was fresh brewed Lipton, very tasty. I drank so much tea. Hubby had burnt ends and fried pickles.  Our lunches came out extremely fast, which was a change from the past. It was almost as quick as fast food! I was pleased with the portion sizes too, and my meat was fresh, well-seasoned, and moist and tender. The collard greens had brisket in them instead of traditional pork, and the flavor was actually exciting. It was delicious! The fried pickles were good too, not too greasy with a crispy batter. They're made with pickle chips not spears, which keeps the breading on through every bite.   The signature sauces are still free too, so be sure to try them all. I drowned my bbq in the tasty Carolina Vinegar sauce (reminds me of my childhood).   I was so happy with my meal here and I'm so glad they've fixed the problems and issues from the past. The restaurant was also spotlessly clean, and the employees seemed genuinely eager to please and help. I felt like a valued customer too, and that's the most important element of customer service.

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried pickles.

nYfToaKJebw7tRGz1v1NqQ.text: Let me be honest, if you're from the south, you know BBQ and this place will probably be average for you. But if you grew up in the west, this place is as good as it gets...and that's NOT a bad thing.   They have delicious brisket with tons of sauces to satisfy anyone. Surprisingly the corn nuggets were effing delicious! Highly recommend it.   I also had the chicken breast which was juicy and flavorful.   I don't remember exactly what it said on the menu, but I believe there is an all you can eat for about $35. It includes anything on the menu. So if you want to put your liver in check and fill yourself with delicious meat goodness, this is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Outlaw&#34; Burger

kOS4jQt9wqLJLQnqAZOdOw.text: I marked his restaurant as a place to visit during my family trip to Vegas and it was all that we expected! The staff was super friendly and very helpful/patient with us newbies. The cashier didnt hesitate to explain the meals and suggest the ones that would give us the most bang for out buck.  The restaurant is arranged with an indoor picnic feel with 3 rooms of picnic table style seating. There are about 2-3 tables in each room. After you order your food and select a table they will bring the food out to you. They have a couple of soda machines in the dining areas that are self serve.   The food was amazing!!! We tried the ribs, chicken, shrimp, catfish,  waffle fries, baked beans, cornbread, and mac & cheese. My hubby ordered seconds of the mac & cheese and he rarely does that! I would define reccomend this place if your in Vegas!!

5xxN4FBBjPvA_hXTMGoS-w.text: Rollin Smoke redefined what American BBQ is all about. We came to this place because the famous YouTuber Strictly Dumpling reviewed this place. He had nothing but high praises for this place. If you are ever in Vegas, do yourself a favor and treat your tired taste buds to this AMAZING place.  We tried their brisket, ribs, pulled pork, hot links, and meat loaf. I've tried American BBQ all over the country, and this place REALLY blew me away. All the meats were extremely tender, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. Paired with sweet tangy BBQ sauce, the meats come to full life. This is by far, the best BBQ I've ever had. We also tried 3 sides: the green beans, mac and cheese, and waffle fries. All were also really impressive, but my favorite was the green beans. It added a nice crunch and starchiness to the meal. Make sure you come SUPER hungry because the restaurant will FEED you. You will want to eat until you get a big food baby!  Skip the food on the Strip. The real treasure is only minutes away :)

_1pDfzpmJATc3Ggwh27rIQ.text: 3.5 stars  Got the Rib platter, 1 beef rib, 3 baby back ribs and 2 St Louis ribs ($24.99) and then added an extra beef rib for $6 and a 1/2 pound of sliced brisket for $10.99.  The beef rib looked like it was going to be the favorite, but it was the pork ribs that were the best, they were the most tender and fall off the bone.  The beef ribs were not as tender as they looked.  The brisket was nice and smoky but i think i like them to be more succulent and juicy, but I'm not usually a fan of brisket so take it with a grain of salt.  There were many sauces to choose from, personally i think the "Boss Sauce" was easily the favorite.  I like hot sauces but the 2 different hot BBQ sauces were too vinegary for my liking.  All the meats had a very nice smoky flavor to them, i just wish the brisket and beef ribs were more tender.  For my side i had the dirty rice, which i thought was good but nothing exceptional.  They do have an All you can eat option for $35 which i think is way better than any buffet deal on the strip as long as you only want BBQ and not seafood.  I might explore this option next time as it includes EVERYTHING on the menu.

It was getting close to closing so I will  definitely try again in future.

4vhjU9DNTTnrIO5Vxa_HTg.text: Rollin Smoke is really really great BBQ. The portions are large and the flavor is awesome. We got the meat trio with pork (x2) and brisket and 1lb of burnt ends. The meat was flavorful even without sauce, but don't worry, Rollin Smoke has you covered with a full selection of various sauces. If you like it enough, you can buy bottles of their "Arkansauce" to take home!  The only piece of feedback I have is to let customers know that the meat by the pound comes with sauce already on it. My bf and I are keto and we didn't know the burnt ends already came with bbq sauce on them. Probably something they should state on the menu. Otherwise, it was good quality bbq!

PgTXHgNI75GNUDb3NeMYRQ.text: Looking for some bbq in vegas?  This is the spot to hit up.  This is a off the strip bbq spot in a strip mall that has parking. Outside they have their bbq trailers so you know they are serious about their bbq.   Their menu takes a while to take in to decide what you want to get. I recommend looking it over before hand otherwise you'll end up ordering one of the combo platters like I did that Has a little bit of everything. They do have a AYCE option for the BBQ items which is unheard of for bbq.   The combo platter I got had: Pulled pork: good smoke, great flavor I liked it with the spicy bbq sauce Brisket: nice and juicy good portion sizes with good flavor. This tasted best with the vinegar sauce Hot links: love these, had great taste and the spice was on the back end.  Spare ribs: these were a little dry but easily fixed with the sweet bbq sauce.  Chicken: juicy with good seasoning. Didn't need any sauces.  For sides I got: Corn bread: more like corn cake, these were so moist and tasted so good could have eaten these for dessert Mac&cheese: cheesey goodness with some hints of jalapeno for heat Baked beans: good taste and flavor  Overall you'll be happy you stopped by.  Make sure you check out the fish tank before you leave.

s9m2zo6mTJH4J1OjrBJm4A.text: Just gimme the Sauce!   Yummo! Let me tell you!   From the first step inside I knew we were in good company for some tasty BBQ. I loved the theme and all the Arkansas Razorback decor! I really felt immersed in the southern culture and couldn't wait to get eating!   The service was decent, the gentleman that took our order was a little short and impersonable- not that he was rude, but as a first timer I expected a different level of service when inquiring about what they are known for and what's the best on the menu. I figured because this place is located just off the strip that was the reason he was probably burnt out from visitors seeking all the hype from this place.   Overall, the food was great! Portions were decent I expected more from the sides (We ordered-Mac and Cheese and Boudin links) but they did the job. Heck, where can I go anywhere near Las Vegas and find Boudin on the menu, so I'll be happy it's here to begin with!   The Beef Ribs were large and in charge! I enjoyed slathering the amazing sauces over them and coupling it with the sliced bread and pickle that come with it.  Brisket. brisket. Brisket.  Just get the Brisket or Brisket Sandwich and Thank. Me. Later!   If you are ready for a BBQ adventure with some crazy good sauces look no further- Rolling Smoke does it well.

4Di9z4YVMV2KETsHuT4AnQ.text: This place is worth it! Trust me!! We were craving some good BBQ and came across this place. When we went in we had no idea what to order but the cashier was really good at giving us suggestions. We went with the Pit Special. It came with 5 meats and 3 sides for 27.99. Good deal for 2 people. Everything tasted amazing!! Definitely loves the pulled pork and the ribs. Those were my favorite. They also had sauces for dipping. My favorite was the Mama's Sweet D'licious. We also got drinks that came in cute souvenir plastic cups. We'll definitely be coming back to this place. Great food. Great atmosphere. And must I add that the food came out super fast! We were barely waiting 5 minutes then bam! Love this place! 5 stars for sure

ps1mbFkkl_QDRvb6kMUwcA.text: Ventured off the strip and happily enjoyed some soulful BBQ.    The pork ribs were on point!  Juicy with a seasoned perfectly with their homemade rub (in fact I bought a jar for home). On the other hand, while all the meats (chopped brisket, hot links, pulled pork, and chicken - ordered the D-plater) were also flavorful with the rub, they were slightly dry and not as juicy as the ribs.    I enjoyed all the variety of the homemade BBQ sauces made with freshly grounded black pepper.  Nice zest and spiciness.    The sides: greens, Mac n cheese and dirty rice were very enjoyable too.  All were perfectly seasoned, fresh ingredients and well balanced flavors.    Now, I must warn you against the peach cobbler.  Yes, not good at all.  How the heck could they hook up the savory and fall short with desserts? We also had the banana pudding and that was good.  I think my expectations were too high post the meal.   All the staff were very attentive and kind, even though you order at counter and they just call out your name and bring to your table.  On a couple of occasion, while walking by staff asked how are things.  Don't always get that for full service restaurants.  It's obviously a culture of respecting and appreciating their customers.    While  on dessert, the meals and service were   .

k9dBBuYGr-QPz6XWYmJJJg.text: I went to Rollin Smoke Barbeque for an easy Sunday lunch with my husband, my brother, and my brother's girlfriend. We'd spent all weekend eating decadent, expensive meals on the Strip, and it was nice to get something homey and cheap in a lower-case strip mall. My brother had a car, so it wasn't hard to get to, and parking was a cinch.  We walked in around one and there was a short line to order. Service was friendly and quick, and there were plenty of open tables. The place was casual and pleasant, cheerfully decorated with a lively, comfortable atmosphere.  The food was pretty delicious for the most part. The four of split the Pit Special and an order of the baby back ribs. The Pit Special came with five meats and three sides, and we either supplemented with an extra side, or the ribs came with a side too, I don't remember. In any case, we had six meats and four sides with bread and pickles to boot. This was a lot of food for a very reasonable amount of money.  The $27.99 Pit Special came with brisket, pulled pork, a 1/4 chicken, two spare ribs, and a hot link. The brisket was excellent, perfectly fork-tender with a crusty rub. The spare ribs were on point, as were the juicy chicken and the flavorful hot link. The pulled pork was just okay, but surprisingly, the weak link here was the half-rack of baby back ribs. The ribs were actually bad, tough and dry. I wonder if it was a freak batch, as the other meats were so good. We helped ourselves to the variety of sauces--there were five of them, I think, including a nice spicy one and a golden mustard sauce.  The sides were great. I enjoyed the corn nuggets, which were deep-fried, golden chunks of sweet corn and crispy breading. The loaded mash looked and tasted unhealthy in a very good way, piled with cheese and bacon bits, with a tiny sprinkle of green onion. The mac n' cheese was solid, as were the garlicky green beans.  I'd recommend Rollin Smoke Barbeque if you're looking for a break from Strip prices, especially if you have a car and want a belly full of meat. I guess the baby backs aren't a sure thing, but spread your bets with a Pit Special and you should make out pretty well.

5-WdvD-q63izLWJLIJhUnA.text: My husband loves this place.  He's been talking about it ever since we ate here last month.  He wanted to go and pick up food to celebrate Father's Day.  He's completely hooked.    I really enjoyed my food too.  I had ribs and the loaded mashed potatoes. I definitely recommend the loaded mash. I would honestly go back just to eat that.    My husband had a selection of meats.  He loves hush puppies so we opted for an order of these instead of me getting some cornbread. I have issues with some of the seasoning commonly used for this snack. I didn't like them because of my personal tastes.  They were made crispy on the outside and moist on the inside.   They have fun drink choices like Kool-Aid.  I haven't had this sugary abomination for at least 25 years.  I thought the words and taste would never cross my fancy lips again but I was so wrong.  As soon as I saw it, I wanted it.  It's liquid, food colored, sweetness on ice. There was other stuff too like Country Time lemonade.  It's self-serve so you can make crazy combinations like I did.  Choose your poison to compliment the delicious foods.    We've only visited once but I'm sure hubby will day we are going back again soon.

s3vO0V3y90bKcY0dQ_sbBg.text: Wow this place was amazing! It's up there with the top bbq places in Vegas! I had the smoked meatloaf and the flavor was delicious. My brother had the outlaw burger and he said it was the best burger he has ever had and it was huge! And my boyfriend had the rib platter. The beef rib was huge and they were fall off the bone. Can't wait to go back and try different things!
