ta8UMVEdKELgTZ1ek0bYUA.text: Love this spot! Right in the middle of town and they have some killer BBQ! Definitely get the meat loaf. It has pulled pork and brisket and it's unbelievable. Big Mike and the team will take care of you!

zf1VBIOfoeFUBbu039ofCg.text: Great! Don't judge the outside by the treasure inside! Delicious smoked barbecue! Potato salad is awesome, reminds me of my Mother-n-laws! Great arrive too

p_AOyvCYzc49SAq-AgqHzw.text: The BBQ was good.  Seating was limited but overall the atmosphere was a good family friendly location.

oBHQRBjyMFiXIOD9MQJBCw.text: I am a first timer.  Oh what a first time!  I had the rib platter.  I was slightly taken aback when asked if I would like an extra beef rib for 6$. I thought to myself 6 bucks for a rib? I don't think so.  When my order came the beef rib was definitely the largest item on the plate.  When I tasted the rib I was speechless, this meat was more tender than any pork rib I have ever had.  The flavor was unbelievable.  I devoured the rib and was almost full when I finished it.  I forced myself to sample the other ribs, the dirty rice (which was wonderful by itself) and the corn fritters. Although it was a little strange ordering at the counter the wait staff was available most of the time. The food was great, the beef rib is second to none and I will definitely be coming back.

vFPm-Jzbu972jwfh-f65kg.text: This is by far the best barbecue restaurant in town. The banana pudding, mac & cheese, and corn buffered  were  amazing sides.

9leiJEUfWltDwJssOwwTpg.text: Hands down this is the best BBQ in Las Vegas.  It may take a bit of effort to find the spot, but it is so worth it.  Simple stated, the BEEF RIB.  You can get the combo plate with all different types of ribs, but the BEEF RIB will be something you can't forget.  Truly amazing BBQ smokey flavor that falls right off the bone.    The restaurant itself is just plane benches, so don't be expecting anything fancy (most good BBQ joints aren't).  This is certainly a BBQ joint.  If you want good food, good flavor, good value (even if it is a bit on the higher side for lunch fare), this is certainly a treat.

gg6KZyZWG6cBWN8X1qjfmA.text: Awesome BBQ! Reasonable prices! Nice employees! The location isn't great, but most great BBQ places aren't in great locations, you gotta want it! I loved the food here and will go back next time I'm in Vegas!

P4Yab6Z9R4a_SMVC-nFnvA.text: This is definitely one of the best barbeque places I've been in. The food was awesome and the staff were very welcoming.

8WVrWIoshF8I1B2N0VIGlw.text: Frequently thrown into conversations about the best BBQ in Vegas Rollin Smoke is certainly better than most, but is it actually good BBQ? I tried to write this view avoiding all hints of BBQ snobbery but that is just impossible for me- the snob is too strong. So you may want to take my comments with a grain of salt- for the average American RSB is probably perfectly acceptable BBQ. Having lived in the south and spent a lot of time in Texas and KC it wasn't all that I hoped it would be, but it was still probably the best in Vegas (probably need to due a more detailed head to head vs Road Kill)   If you are from the south or KC you will prob find RSB to be pretty mediocre. If, however, you are a Las Vegas local who doesn't get to travel to BBQ hotspots frequently then it is a lifeline. Its all a matter of perspective really. There is nothing wrong with RSB, the food is pretty good. It would not, however, stay in business in large scale BBQ cities.  I got the buffet so I could try everything. My favorite BBQ, or really any, food is beef rib so I ordered one of those right off the bat. The beef rib was a little dry, something several people had warned me about in advance, but smothered with sauce it was pretty decent. Not life changing, but definitely good and considering how few places in LV even serve beef rib its probably the go to for that.   Pulled Pork- this was better than the beef rib. Not dry, pretty flavorful, went well with the sauce. They showed the pig the respect it deserves  Pork rib- def better than the beef rib here. Seemed like it had been smoked for a good amount of time and wasn't way over done to the point where the bones fall apart or anything  Brisket- meh. The brisket I got had very little fat and so very little flavor and was somewhat dry. I like big thick slices of brisket, these were very thin and not very tall, so I'm guessing they weren't cut off a complete brisket.   Chicken- this was actually pretty good. I don't normally order chicken at BBQ places because its chicken and pig is usually available but since it was all you can eat I gave it a whirl. Would eat again  Mac and Cheese- this seemed like it had some potential but was served pretty cold.  It was in fact Cheezy  Baked Beans- these were great, would eat again and in large quantity.   Corn nuggets- fried corn, hard to go wrong, could eat about 3 lbs of these in one sitting.

r2B1XaMyojMZ9dX3QXNW0w.text: 2 words OVERPRICED & OVERRATED! OMG where should I start? When you pull up it smells great and it looks busy which can be a good thing if the food is great. WRONG! Lol I'm guessing this is supposed to be gourmet BBQ? IDK but the food was almost gross. Brisket reminded me of Spam, ribs didn't really have a taste, and the mac & cheese must've been made with sour cream because it was a little too creamy with a weird taste. The kickn beans were bland and undercooked. The hot links I'm guessing Hoffy or Bar S? Yuck. And guess wat? I decided to go all out and order desert. Peach cobbler! Ugh more like bland peach cake!  The prices are high with small portions and meals only come with 1 side! Where they do that at? Let's not even talk about the area this is located in. This was a total fail! Guess I'll just stick with my usual BBQ place and not venture out again.

FQlGavrRPrjBwYhqC97O3Q.text: This place has some of the best BBQ I have ever tasted. Different sauces that make you wanna take some of them home lol. When I come back to Vegas this will be on my radar first

Kh0VcNqUZFIPThcVNlYi1Q.text: Best barbque in Las Vegas!  Had the rib tips and it was the best I've had. It was soft and boneless. Each taste had a kiss of smoke taste with the sweet and tangy BBQ house sauce. Love it. The sweet tea was not too sweet, perfect. The only BBQ place in town to eat. Open until 130am on fri sat NICE!  Had the Peach Cobbler today. Wow.  It was sweet with peach and warm like a hug from an old friend you have not seen in a long time.  I'm not a cobbler fan, but this made me a believer and I'd order it again!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good gawd! Peach cobbler the best I ever had!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked rib tips.  Amazing!

8q-mvUquVviTU9ZviIFGdA.text: Little pricey and sucks they are closed on Sunday... But still hands down the best BBQ joint I have found in Vegas! Damn the beef ribs are fire! This place is worth giving a try.

6Pz4zy5tKLFiT7qYH5IhtA.text: Great BBQ. Sauces are insane, spicy was my favorite with Carolina vinegar coming in a close 2nd and Danny was a great host. You gotta try this place.

w0pKADoEgTNDSHM1JMvWBg.text: Mmmmmgood smoking beef ribs on the 4th of July. Sauces like mama sweet, Arkansas,spicy ,sweet potatoes, Mac greens  so.... Much to handle. Tasty, delicious . I'm ready lets eat.

yw6L6Vz3jCaiw0JRc9_23w.text: I got the burger and it was petty dang tasty! It is one of the best burgers I've had.  I got a pork rib a la cart and it too was delicious. No BBQ sauce needed...that's when you know you chewing on a good rib.

yFokzKUi12yyBHJW00R-wQ.text: Aaaaammmmmaaaazzzzzballs!!!! All I can say is num nums the best in town! The beef rib is all you will need but if you do need more burnt ends are super delicious and they have corn nuggets whhhat I said corn nuggets deep fried cream corn. :D

FkUuZ10xcgRHuuEGsK8YcQ.text: Went in to just get a drink and the customer service was so amazing from karina that i just had to stay and eat, thatnk you karina for being the shining example of stunning customer service

oCZTFzI_87f_-qWwRbSBFw.text: I've been here multiple times and will continue to be a loyal customer. The food is incredible (beef ribs and burnt ends are my favorite) and so is the service/staff. Danny took our order today and, as always, had excellent customer service.

5Q4Y0YILfIzGNVE46CV5VA.text: Excellent bbq by really nice people. We had a mixture of sandwiches. Pulled pork, brisket, hot link, and pulled chicken. Great waffle fries and greens. Enjoyable first visit. Great bbq flavors and good sauce. What more could you ask for.

fe55t2ZtfIjv1R1KHPyL-w.text: 3.5 stars. It's well worth getting off the strip to get BBQ here. Is it up there with the best BBQ I've had (lockhart's)?  No, but it's still darn good and great value for being near the strip. It scratches the BBQ itch every time!

ZYWXeltbmZViEWB4-nfbTQ.text: Man talk about finger licking good! Their BBQ is awesome! I had beef ribs and my lovely girlfriend had the smoked meatloaf. The desserts was delicious. I suggest bringing an extra shirt, if you are like me then you get carried away and might get a little messy. I'd have to say it's the best BBQ spot in town! Thanks Rollin Smoke for outstanding BBQ!!

cL2FJ85w-joF7RNVD2bJBg.text: How about a pick up line fellas? Standing in the order line for 10 minutes just to pick up some food ain't good.

2chAO7ID4rDWUDFLvJ2m4w.text: Ok, for you out of towners. This place is located in the industrial district part of town. In some ways it reminds me of having BBq in the Midwest. The decore is very, very simple.  When you enter i was greeted with a large menu on the wall, and a gentle men standing at a tall podium, I felt as if I was ordering from Bbq god, later found out that I was!! The food here was awesome I ordered a Trio: brisket perfect smoke and great seasoning. Pulled pork flavor was spot on yet a little dry, nothing a little sauce didn't fix.  Ribs were the best I have had in LV. A friend of mine had the outlaw burger and I tried a small bite.  Perfect balance of flavor, my only suggestion is to not over mix the ground meat, also mix the meat when it is really cold. The texture of the burger was off for a med/mid rare burger, really dense as if the meat was over worked, it was like meatloaf. Other then that, its worth the wait. This will now be the only place I will go for Bbq for a while.  GREAT JOB, R&S!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw burger!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio: brisket, rib, pork
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Store Front!

zW32lK0pZuTuKYk8-IN9gw.text: $24.99 All-U-Can-Eat...need I say more!? Tasty bbq and sides galore. Customer service to match their great eats. I love finding gems like RSBBQ - definitely need to be in the know to find this joint!

JKxdMHzNVWH_oBAdEWSDrg.text: We went here as a group of 7 from NY. The food was fabulous. We had a variety of different things for dinner. Service was quick and as ordered. We complimented the chef and were welcomed into the back to see the smokers and kitchen. I would definitely, definitely go again.

n8jO0zzNDFf7JldPqQibdg.text: The Best BBQ on the West Coast.. I cant tell  you how much this reminds be of HOME.. Make sure you talk to the staff they are amazing... I even met the Owner and he is a Cool Guy. Best BBQ Ever.. Order this late night and take it to the Rhino or take it home.. But order For your entire Family.. So GOOOD

zRf928UWUqI1lzwJLGZ1fg.text: This is one of the best BBQ spots I've had the pleasure to eat at. Don't pass this place up if you're in the mood for some real southern eats.  It's located under a freeway overpass, in a tiny strip mall and easy to miss. The staff is real friendly and likes to chat with everyone. I ordered the Tri-Tip sandwitch and it was amazing.

CpKj8wgKVndafCXo34rqTg.text: Had the half slab of beef ribs.  BBQ sauce is excellent with the meat falling off the bone.  Also had the side of kicking beans - spicy but good.   Most definitely recommend while visiting Vegas.  Looks like a local spot.   They also got an all you can eat plan for 24.99 where you can get anything on the menu.

jnIgCAP9FHGyRyU3tBypJw.text: I lived in North Carolina for 12 years, so I'm picky about my barbeque. When I heard about Rollin Smoke, I knew I had to give it a try.  The food here went above and beyond what I ever could have expected from BBQ in Vegas. The location is off the beaten path, but once you find it you truly feel like you've found a hidden gem.   I'm not usually big on okra, but the fried okra here was perhaps the best I've ever had. And like I said, I lived in the South for 12 years.  This is a great place to grab a low-price, good quality meal in Vegas. If you're a tourist, like I am, and you have a rental car, it's well worth the trip for a tasty meal at an awesome price.

23EYsRiVpwvbiBgkNDCvfQ.text: I have heard nothing but great reviews of this place. So, I had to try it. To my surprise, I was not at all excited about this place. Never had a pulled pork sandwich so dry that I had to actually drink 4 large cups of water just to get it down. That was even after I added there BBQ sauce to try to moisten the sandwich. I guess they left a little to long in the smoker, or maybe it was the left over that sat out with out being covered so it dried out. Who knows. Maybe next time when I come in, it will be better.

U_M_px01H0VqMCc-f7KmHA.text: First time there - fantastic!  Highly  recommended. Had  ribs and corn nuggets -fantastic!  Had sweet tea - fantastic!  Got a free banana pudding for free-fantastic! Go there-fantastic!

dmW4cOvBQGO8_EEk8AvXHA.text: Top notch bbq at a great price. I would say the bbq is a little better than the sides. Not bad sides but not the best I have had. I tried the greens and jalapeno coleslaw. Coleslaw was a little dry. For meat it was the brisket, pork and 2 ribs.

5edgvd9Um3LTlR1Y6qZGTA.text: Smokin'!!! The genuine customer service from entrance to exit was unbelievable for such a tiny joint. The ribs were so uniquely flavorful and fell right off the bone. The brisket yum! Chicken tasty! I even attacked the "Outlaw" burger which was quite a delicious feat but, overwhelmed with onion rings. The sides (collard greens, potato salad, Mac 'n' cheese, etc.) were a bit salty for me; they needed to break up the intense grease and salt throughout the main dishes to even the palate.

WY7abHIt-En6kNQDY3KpKw.text: Absolutely lives up to the hype! Just delicious. The biggin dad's favorite is the way to go

_mATm8GAzgbHB0oMIrqRJA.text: I've had the privilege of enjoying real southern BBQ down south, South Carolina, Georgia, New Orleans...I've tasted authentic. Rollin' Smoke offers what I consider the most authentic BBQ in Las Vegas by a long shot. There aren't any competitors even worth mentioning to compare. 1) Atmosphere: it's a rather small property that's divided into a few section, one where you place your orders/grab your drinks, utensils etc/some seating available, and two other sections offering seating as well. Regardless of how you're eating (take-out, dining in, a la carte, all-you-can-eat), there is one line for all. You can sit wherever you'd like while you wait for your food to be delivered including outdoors.  2) Service: Everyone on staff is super friendly and very helpful. It was our first time there and we didn't feel rushed while we took a minute in line getting an explanation of how the menu works. Food was delivered timely and correctly.  3) Food: I'll start with saying my ribs literally fell off the bone when I picked up my first bite. Now... All-you-can-eat is $24.95 and includes anything on the menu. Pace yourself! You can always come back for more. We grabbed a bit of each meat and were very pleased with every type- ribs, brisket, chicken, catfish (very fresh, lightly crunchy and not fishy-tasting). Everything was exceptional, including our sides of Mac and cheese, cole slaw and hush puppies. Oh the hush puppies! So yummy! Dessert was awesome. Next time we'll have to try our berry cobbler a la mode.   Looking forward to coming back next time. Thanks guys!

pENlriL_QxdPL7V7U_l35g.text: Holy mother of God this place is fantastic. The moment I stepped in to this place from the smell alone I was expecting gold and I was not disappointed. I ordered the Outlaw Burger and is was huge, and delicious. The brisket was tender and smoky and the burger was moist and perfectly cooked.   Others ordered the pork and I got a sample. It was melt in your mouth good, savory with just a little sweet. This is one of the best BBQ places I've ever been. If you're in Vegas, to hell with Gordon Ramsay, Wolfgang Puck, and those other celebrity chefs on the Strip, and get thee hence to Rollin Smoke.

Z1SwMrWxpluWTqll0qSw6Q.text: This is one of those places you go when you just say F--- it diet, im going hog wild! Really decadent food, a great occasional treat

8rd9633sOn1_WR6tzWJsXg.text: let me start by saying that there isnt really any good bbq places that ive tried here in vegas. But rollin smoke is something else.  this place is awesome.  ive had the outlaw burger and it was great i give it a 9.  ive had the trio plate. which consists of 3 meats of your choice a side a roll and a drink.  i ordered the pulled pork,  brisket, and ribs.  with a side of mac n cheese. the meats were juicy amd tender great with. their house bbq sauce.  this place is a go to if you are looking for great bbq at good prices.

2oRyaF6sekkUAx_j8ZJlPg.text: Beef short ribs. Yea buddy. Not super flavorful but a very nice cut of meat. The quality of meat + reasonable portions + affordable = can not go wrong. Be prepared to have a hard time finding a place to sit if you go for lunch.

Fhm179GMCAXDBHlkG9hNMQ.text: Amazing family owned BBQ joint. It's clear the recipes are a family tradition and everything is made fresh. The meats are tender and flavorful and the sauces are top notch. The sides are so good you'll keep eating even when you're full. The service was phenomenal. Everyone working there is very friendly.

5PLEeT32u543ghtmSntckw.text: I had been looking forward to this place after seeing it air on the Food Network, I was surprised at the location to be honest with you. Rollin Smoke is situated in an older industrial commercial area behind the strip, it is easy to get to but can be a bit confusing if you're not from here. It smelled great of course and the place was smaller than I thought, there were people lined up along the wall to place their orders. I ordered the half rack of baby back ribs, 1 pound of brisket and a quart of the BBQ beans to go. The food was good, the ribs were a bit dry but still moist and the brisket was chopped? I was actually expecting sliced brisket but I guess you have to ask for it sliced. I wasn't amazed but it was good and I will be back for more. The Kicken beans were awesome though, a bit of heat with pulled pork. One thing I did not like was that I had to pay for extra sauce because there was no to go containers for the sauce and the sauce in the dispenser is for those that are dining in only and I was told that I would have to buy extra. The other was that it felt a bit crowded in there especially the main room where there were people eating at the tables while having people waiting for their food hovering over them just seemed a bit uncomfortable for me and that's why I chose it to go. There was no space in the other room because it was packed and the only other option was outdoor seating and that was way out of the question in 106 degree weather.

KuEmjGq08aYZJRGjYwjtFQ.text: Had the catfish po boy with waffle fries and a drink for $18 and some change. They definitely shouldn't call it a po boy cus it's misleading. The catfish is thin and frail with no crunch to it at all. The  bread is a hoagie bun which is too thick of a bread for a po boy. The frail fish sits on top of a bed of romaine lettuce and diced tomatoes. The taste wasn't bad but with the excessive bread and frail non-crispy fish I definitely won't get it again. And my fries were cold and stale like they were fried last night. Def not worth the $18 I spent.

YgyVWZB6iPR0wE332Jzn8g.text: I have tried this place 2x so far...  The first time was about 9 months ago..  I thought it was just good a place that i dont mind going to...On that occasion i ordered a half rack of ribs, mac and cheese, mashed and 2 beef ribs..  I thought it was good..  I went here recently with a friend of mine.. This time I ordered the meatloaf.. It was absolutely the best meatloaf i have ever had EVER... Cheesecake factory has a version of this but it does not even compare to this... It sat on top of a bed of mashed potatoes with this bbq gravy,, topped with onion straws..  I believe they smoke the meatloaf... Whatever they do,, I am a big fan... It was one of those meals that you will remember..  My friend got the outlaw burger,, He really liked it and it was impressive when it was brought out...  It looked like a mess to eat,, but looked good..  The desserts are decent but this meatloaf was slap your mother good...  Hope this Yelps  11/232014 It was about 11pm,,, i was really craving bbq,,  I remembered that Roling Smoke was open late... I ordered the rib combo... Lets just say dont come here for a late night meal,, at least this night...  All 3 meats were bone dry,, i asked for extra sauce,, but it wasnt  in my order,,, the sides were good,, but the berry cobbler,, seemed old... I have to admit it was after 11 but wow what a disappointment... I had to remove a star,,   I will try them when i think the meats would be freshest... Remember based on my experience,, I will not eat here again after 7 pm on a weekend...

CZT-UO9DnvmV519fB7EU7A.text: While driving around my girlfriend and I were looking for a place to eat prior to departing Vegas. She came across this place on Yelp. I'm always down for some good BBQ as she is too so we gave it a go!! As I also looked at the pictures and the comments on Yelp my expectations of this place grew. We pulled Into the parking lot and could smell the aroma of the wood and meat cooking, very promising. We ordered the three way brisket, BBQ nacho fries with pulled pork, and the rack of St Louis spare ribs. The St Louis spare ribs we such a disappointment. They were over smoked and tasted as if the meat had went bad. The brisket was good not great but good and the BBQ nachos were ok as well. But I'm writing this only because I was highly disappointed in the St Louis spare ribs, also I did not find any of their BBQ sauce to my liking!!! Since I did not like the ribs and we had left overs; we brought them home for our kids to try, the 14 year old said, " Your ribs are better!" The 9 year old spit hers out!!!!!   I would say try it out and make your own opinion!!!

7eweq9L16r4EDbbQYxBiwg.text: Like a pimp, Rollin Smoke BBQ is whoring out their entire menu for $24.99. That's right....You ever walk into a BBQ joint and want to try everything on the menu? Well here you can. I wish I would have noticed that before I ordered. Just the $28 rack of baby backs would have made it worth my while to do the all you can eat. Smoked Meatloaf sounds awesome, and the burgers looked great too. You can bet I will be back to try them on my next Vegas trip. Truth be told, I should most likely give this place 4 stars, just based on what I ate. The pulled pork was kind of a let down for me. Not much sauce mixed in with it, I found it kind of flavorless, and not smokey at all. However the sauce on the table added a much needed zing and saved it - 3 stars. The brisket was better and had a nice smoke ring to it as well as a dry rub. It was sliced in thick slices how I prefer it - 4 stars yelp.com/biz_photos/roll... The baby back ribs were the best of the three meats that I tried. They had a nice bark to it, but still fell off the bone. There were plenty of meat on these ribs and it was clear they were slowly smoked and had a great hickory flavor to them. Ribs are always the main test of BBQ for me and these baby backs clearly passed the test and are darn good - 4.5 stars yelp.com/biz_photos/roll... For the sides we tried the bacon potato salad, the kicken beans, the mac 'n cheese, and some sliced pickles. The pickles were very good and had a nice vinegary flavor to them. It's clear they will stand out well on any of their sandwiches. Tasted exactly like the large dill pickles you get at Disney, in case you need that for a reference. The kicken' beans, lived up to their name and had some spice to them along with a good peppery flavor. There were some shards of brisket added in for some smokey flavor. I personally prefer sweeter southern baked beans, but for some reason those are hard to get outside of the south. Bacon potato salad, could have had more bacon in it as I couldn't really find any in there. I still enjoyed it and it had a texture of a smashed potato salad. The clear star of the show was the mac 'n cheese. Some of the best I've had, it's very cheesy and creamy. I don't see myself ever coming here without getting a bowl of it. yelp.com/biz_photos/roll... Although we were plenty stuffed, I noticed a free dessert with check in. All the desserts sounded great, but we went with the banana pudding. No matter how full you get, for some reason, you can always manage a little banana pudding. It just kind of slides down. Rather than vanilla wafers it was more of a swirl of vanilla crust in the pudding. It was ok, but I think I would try another dessert next time - 3.5 stars. yelp.com/biz_photos/roll... I love the vibe of this place, it's clear these are men living their dream. The toys they have to play with in the parking lot are impressive, all kinds of mobile smokers and dressed up cars and trucks with their logo painted all over it. It's like the bat cave of BBQ. Holy Smoke Batman....To the Rollin' Smokemobile Robin! And just like that they are on the move to provide smokey BBQ goodness wherever hungry folk most need them. Also make sure you visit their party room and you will find a fun pig shaped fish tank that looks like a BBQ smoker. Look inside and rather than coral you have all kinds of smoked meats for the fish to swim with. Hit the button and smoke even comes out of the top of the tank. Apparently this tank was featured on Animal Planet's show - Tanked. yelp.com/biz_photos/roll... yelp.com/biz_photos/roll...
