Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork, sliced brisket, and bacon potato salad.

zEND6_Xkr5Z_EfVp4c2cCA.text: Yummm!! I can see why this place is so busy , best bbq I've had in vegas. I got the pulled piggy sandwich,  with the bacon potato salad. The pork just melts in your mouth!  It comes on a sesame seed bun which is alright , but delicious nonetheless.  My hubby got 1/2 rack of baby back ribs with cheesy mac and waffle fries. He hasn't said a word since he started eating ;) I tried it and let me tell you the ribs are smoked to perfection.  The mac and cheese is delightfully balanced , and the waffle fries are crispy and not too greasy.  Two thumbs up! Oh and we got it for around $37.00

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 rack of baby back ribs with cheesy mac and waffle fries
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled piggy sandwich with bacon potato salad

WxmWAoZDxgRsmg7AifdG9A.text: Oh man. Rollin Smoke catered an event at work and almost everyone I spoke with loved the food. Ribs were tender, mac n cheese was solid, baked beans were seasoned perfectly, potato salad was a tad too mayonnaise-y, and the cornbread was moist, sweet and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Sundae. Interesting concept, but poured it all out to eat separately. Good deal, though.

JN-BViOZFfPz5pHZXbNr2A.text: The place smells so good and it's full of mouth watering food. The $20 pit mix is enough for 2 and comes with 3 slides. I highly recommend the corn bread and Mac & cheese for sides, & the brisket, ribs, & chicken for meats. My friend had the peach cobbler that looked delicious so try a little dessert too lol

ezz5TX7Vash6XSYhlLdUhg.text: Best BBQ in Las Vegas. Great mac and cheese. Each meat item is outstanding. Wasn't a fan of the Brat Dog thing, but otherwise, everything on the menu is mouthwatering.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket dog, fried okra and Mac and cheese

403dSt-eN3ouGvEd04a2jw.text: Best BBQ in Vegas out of the seven or eight places I've tried. Amazing whole in the wall kind of place, but with plenty of seating. They could probably fill up a restaurant the size of Olive Garden if they wanted to. Food is amazing. Had the brisket sandwich with fried onion straws. Pretty sure I could live off that the rest of my life breakfast lunch and dinner! Yummy! Hubby had the outlaw burger. He's a big dude and couldn't eat it all. Might wanna bring a friend to take on that brisket burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kIRkACoj3aBjTNarjNh3TA.text: If you like Burgers don't skip the outlaw!  The staff is very friendly, and I will be stopping by every time I roll through Vegas.  Do not skip this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw demolished

2LGGzcK17lzTA3EjB1ZI9w.text: Simply the best in Vegas, Your taste buds will thank you. In our two week visit to Vegas we dined here several times. The meats melt in your mouth; the waffle chips are crunchy and tasty. The serving sizes are generous. Tried catfish for the first time I loved it. The service is exceptional from all staff. Met the owners who are friendly and courteous. Seriously when your thinking BBQ don't go past Rollin Smoke Barbeque you will not regret it. Will definitely be going back on my next visit to Vegas.

Mq_l6GdByfAhe172LprgWg.text: I love BBQ like no other food on earth.   Juicy,  smoky,  tender meats and comforting sides are my heaven on earth. I just haven't been able to find anywhere in Vegas that can compete with Texas.  I mean you can get great BBQ at a gas station in Texas. Well thanks to Rolling Smoke BBQ, I've found a little bit of smoky heaven right in Vegas. The meats and sides are wonderful. Nothing fancey or pretentious,  just great food. The portions are large and I think they even have an all you can eat option. there isn't much going on as far as decor.  Just Picnic tables. This is straight out of the Texas BBQ hand book,

s6peWgVmb9rOx_9Kd3quOw.text: Do not hire for catering events.... as the food was not bad the service was and is terrible.   I was not only over charge more than the agreed amount contract. . But also the additional labor request was a waste of money... they did not have the Staff bus anything as agreed.  Via email amd text message. We were prepared to hire bus staff from another vendor but they stated they had to have their own team bus the tables and serve.   They didn't do anything.  Now they are not responding to any of the items we have in writing and i will have to bring in our lawyer.   Not worth the headache. And if you saw the mess they call an invoice you would understand why they do not have any kind of business skill other than cooking.  I would suggest using any other BBQ company in town to not have to deal with this chef and his lack of business  One more thing.. if you do use them be sure to check the math .. as I had to correct it for them during this process

7cN_zxCp-UTWzWkxJm2tRg.text: PERFECTION! Friend was in town and we craved BBQ. Got it via Uber Eats and when he came to visit a couple weeks later, we were craving it again! Ribs, greens, cornbread and Mac n cheese were to die for! Must try other things but I was beyond satisfied with my first choices!

3mr2JPzDZVOf3SXmNcH21g.text: We got take out and the sauces are awesome!  We'll be back soon, the brisket is pretty freakin good!!  Definitely recommend!!!!

J1G0zky4CZ3u0OLngsjGVg.text: $25 all you can eat! Must get: popcorn shrimp, pulled pork, brisket, ribs, bacon potato salad, mac n cheese, mashed potato, corn bread and banana pudding!!

T5lZi24ZJDapemedO26PUg.text: I eat BBQ all over the U.S. during my travels. This was excellent!  Hand rubbed with great flavor. Not as spicy as Texas BBQ, but way better than the St. Louis and other sweet sauces.  The hush puppies were deep fried to a golden brown. The Jalapeno, cornbread and spices inside were the perfect blend of sweet, spicy and texture.   I had the Trio of Brisket, BBQ spare ribs and pulled pork. All were melt in your mouth tender with the flavor profile you expect and desire for good BBQ.   We will definitely be back!!!

6jOS0rBDScdoBmY5W_R_6Q.text: Chef Tim was amazing as our wedding cater. We loved the food we served at our reception as did our guests. He went above and beyond to help us out since our service was on a Sunday outside. They were more than willing to work with us for our budget as our $$ was shrinking away we worked with them to revamp what we were serving keeping it still as delicious as ever.

M5DCxoOJItAllQsMh6HI7g.text: Ok, so the food here is OUT OF THIS WORLD! Like, knock you on your a** good. You will want to slip into a food coma afterwards. The location is sketchy. In a bad area of you ask me, but if you take a moment to pretend that you aren't surrounded by a buffet of run down strip clubs the food is honestly worth the risk of possibly getting mugged. Seriously.

G40ZqIV7BD6oaKSAnu4j6w.text: I'm going to have to drop my 4 star rating to a 2.5. based on my last experience. I understand about the beef shortage in TX so I understand why rolling smoke raised their prices.  I always get the AYCE option, and one of their employees remembers me because I always order it.  What I don't understand is why rolling smoke is sending out a quarter of the portions that they used to with each order of food. Before, I would order a meatloaf and get a FULL order( 2 nice slices) of meatloaf. Not a little crumpled portion from the end. Before I would order a of beef ribs and get 2 in an order, not one. This last visit, not only did the order taker miss a few of the items initially ordered, but they NEVER(even in previous visits) ask if you want to order more. You have to compete with the people in line and it creates and awkward situation. All portions sent out were not even close to what I used to get and sadly, I was bringing in people for thier first visit. How are you going to justify an order of wings and only give 2 wings in an order?  The 4 meat platter came with 2 tiny strips of brisket and the wrong sides.   You guys gotta find a better system for the AYCE. Maybe a flag on the table so your staff knows who is spending  twice the amount of money than the average guest and could show them a little more attention. Also accuracy in order taking is important too. I didn't mind the mistakes and poor service before, because there was value in what you were serving.  Now Higher price/way smaller portions/no server/difficulty in ordering at $35 a person plus 20% tip?  Ouch. That's disappointing. You can't raise prices and give your guests way less. That's a no no.  Please fix this.

k9Q2ISBFcMrMhdnCwU1t1w.text: Taking this place for what it is, a good ole southern bbq joint, it's definitely worth the 5 stars. Great variety, and every meat we tried was delicious, cooked well (meaning good, not well-done) and not drenched in sauce (but you can do that yourself if that's how you like it). I recommend the brisket and the beef rib personally.

oMBm4PVI7P6k0ZHE8A3bWg.text: Hands down the best BBQ I have ever had!! I did the all you can eat so I could try a little bit of everything. They don't give you a "little" of anything!! The beef rib was the star of the show!! In my experiences with BBQ, the beef rib is kinda the red headed stepchild, not here! I highly recommend this place! Off the beaten path, just the way I like it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BidbFY7M_wFraeQAenfubw.text: Omg good. The prices can seem high, but you're getting so much amazing food that it's worth  the wallet-ache.  I ordered a buffet style spread of all different meats and sides and everything I tasted was awesome! Make it a point to try the corn nuggets. It sounds crazy, but tastes like heaven!

WYQ7XxkBsTrM0SmRQnX7rg.text: Everything here is amazing. The outlaw burger!!!!! I need to say it again the outlaw burger.!!.....  as good as a burger gets.  Everything about it is mouthwatering / orgasmic burger..... the wings with medium sauce will have u licking ur fingers. The Brisket The Hot links. The ribs. Everything is amazing . Just go and eat do it now. Highly highly recommended. ...

v2l15cqqaN3wkFWi7-AXVw.text: Damn good food!  You must try this hidden gem for your bbq fix. Perfectly located by Strip Clubs galore, so you can go before and/or after you get your freak on!

mL5a9zkP383w8JenYMc-Xg.text: One of the best BBQ joints we've been to in Vegas. Rollin Smoke is located in the backstreets (Highland Drive) behind the strip & is conveniently located on a strip club alley. We've been there twice already ordering to-go & every visit has been worthwhile. The employees are friendly, the service is fast, & the chef even jumps out to get in on the cashiering action. The prices are totally reasonable & the flavor of the BBQ overall will keep us coming back for more. I ordered the half slab of BBQ chicken & my guy ordered the Pit Special with  4 different types of meat including the Brisket, spare ribs, hot links, & pulled pork. The side order of yams is a go-to!!

n3WLn_0UazUHYk3N3Y8kyQ.text: simply great! If you drive there with your windows down you can smell the goodness of the smokers from a block away. once I walked in my mouth started to water. Everything I have eaten there has been great. If you love BBQ this is the place to eat.

tnOHaSA97Crp7lcqryRjeA.text: The food was good, flavor was on point. Staff was nice. Atmosphere was down home. Service was fast. The price as opposed to the portions was off tho. I felt like it was a bit over priced for the amount of food you receive. But overall not a bad dining experience.

GixRKgySJDjTBKmtRNyptw.text: This is one of the, nope, the best bbq joint ever. We had the outlaw burger which was sick, perfect blend of taste and crunch from the onions. No need to request medium rare as the burgers smoked to perfection. The biggin dads favorite had a mix of 3 meats that taste like they were bred in the same farm. I cant say how happy we are with the food and service. The hot sauce made my buddy tear up, tasty stuff. I feel like I can make a mess of myself,  wear a bib made of paper napkins and feel proud doing it. Free refills on the drinks and quality friendly staff make this place a obvious no 1 choice for bbq. Gordon ramsey abd his 20dollar burger can rot compared to a gem like this. one of the best burgers I ever tasted. The staff is so wholesome and authentically country with the way they carry themselves and the food, by mere presence they made me think they are co owners with the pride they have for their food. I didnt detect any of the fake kindness you often see at regular food joints. The owners should be proud of themselves and their staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empty plates happy faces

E5aW81jcqK883F5kzjGiIQ.text: It's been difficult for me to find a decent BBQ spot in Las Vegas...this place comes close, but it was just ok for me. I have been here a few times and they are always packed. I like the sauce and the service is decent.

fag8cpRm6C9narTAXc8DzA.text: Way back when this was the only place to go for great bbq. Unfortunately it seems success has gone to their heads. For yhe 2nd time in a row they forgot to put items i had ordered in the bags. At 70 bucks a pop per trip feeding me and my kids, I would expect a bit more quality control on their part especially when its not even busy. I called to complain and all they could tell me is "we left a note by the register, come get them when you come in next and u wont be charged". SO SORRY ITS MY FAULT YOU FORGOT MY ITEMS I PAID FOR! Im done with this place. For those hankerin for bbq try it once you wont be disappointed, but as a repeat customer thats all you ever will be....disappointed.

bfrPWIOisz6yvzCwkfnRrg.text: Holy crap this place is good. Get the meatloaf! Get everything.

_6tYnlcQXX486F_MFKA1lg.text: BBQ in the desert done right. Rollin Smoke kills it with properly smoked goods. Try the smoked meatloaf....it'll change your life!

zYzFYR0Sy8JQOdEmfSErXg.text: Full ratings because not only was the food awesome, but the owner gave my dog beef bones and offered to get him water as well. He was really personable and checked in on us frequently. Go here. Go here. Go here.

eM9PqfYhqeEMt6FhhCH7bw.text: Average...not as great as I expected. Portion were small for the price. Their sauce taste like regular bbq sauce...was expecting a bit of a kick to it. Overall, it was alright.

0az8QRx6uZ8aTFmlRXZc-Q.text: Hidden Vegas treasure! The food was awesomesauce! If you want bbq this is definitely the place to go!

4Jo4sFcGPJ1qiFoSOHPb8Q.text: Found this place on accident last year and thought I'd bring my friends from California. We all enjoyed the food! Again...be back soon

QuvXO8-nX0wx5jxncg-B1w.text: On side of freeway, off beaten track, little more than hole in wall, good food joint.  Meat really tender.  I like a tad bit more seasoning on my que, but tenderness made up for lack of seasoning.  Loved potato salad and corn bread.  Beef rib was huge.  Bbq sauce was okay.  Menu was a little overloaded, confusing but just order some meat and you will be good!

1KKD8jaj8HnQsgVnsqo05g.text: Went with my brother for a Saturday lunch and WOW!  That was my first visit but he has been there often.  We shared the "Outlaw" burger, beans and coleslaw.  The "Outlaw" is just massive!  And oh, so delicious!  I've lived in Las Vegas 52 years but hadn't been in that area for a decade or better.  But you can bet I'll be back - we have friends visiting from England in May and by then I will have several tested suggestions for them!!

XvcB-sAtSCFXufoTKO0jvw.text: Very classy location in the heart of the kinky sex district. All you can eat used to be a decent value, but ever since they raised the price by 20% it's no longer worth it. If the sushi places can offer all you can eat for $25, why is a barbecue place charging $10 more? Last I checked sushi-quality fish is a little pricier than beef brisket.

1-4nfOxd9pfeFQpXHKSZVg.text: I eat a lot of BBQ... I thought the portions were excellent along with prices... I really try to eat a variety of things before I make an informed decision.... I had every thing on the menu... The taste of all the smoked meat was nothing short of excellent... And sides are excellent too. Especially the beans and cole slaw.... It was lip smacking and finger licking good... Kudos for bringing some excellent BBQ to Vegas

h0Xsi9rUh1BK3MHR9_HoxQ.text: Made our way off the strip to this gem based on a friends recommendation- so stoked I did!!! Incredible everything, do yourself a favor and go here. Love it!!!

nZ5tYkB5G-GGe0vrZGuwFg.text: Excellent bbq!  Must have the spare ribs and corn nuggets, but everything was awesome!!! Service was great too.

InipHOt8zQeADXsmS7iffg.text: Brisket was amazing, ordered the party pack got some of everything and it was all really good, then the ribs came. The baby back ribs were great. Thanks for the great service also.

Qn_nvwnXSRAgA6c4fx7Zhw.text: I've had Arthur Bryant's bbq in KC, I've had LC's bbq (also in KC near the stadiums), I've had Sonny's BBQ (a chain pit-bbq in the SE US), I've had Brad's BBQ in Alabama, I've had Abe's BBQ in Clarksdale, MS at the Crossroads.  And now I've had Rollin Smoke BBQ in Vegas, and it compares with Arthur Bryant.  It is excellent bbq and I will visit again!  I've had their meatloaf (amazing--made with brisket) and the brisket.

TgMtks9qW1nW6NbG8bUREQ.text: I'm not happy being a nay-sayer, but neither hubby or I enjoyed Rollin Smoke.  We were feeling a yen for BBQ after seeing Lyle Lovett & His Big Band over at the Smith Center, so I Yelp-ed Barbecue and the rave reviews for Rollin Smoke made our choice easy.  We arrived a little after 10pm and were told that they were out of meatloaf, yams, cornish hen, burnt ends, and beef ribs.  Since they advertise that they're open until midnight, I thought this was rather extensive a list of food to be out of.  We ordered a combo plate of brisket, chicken, hot links, pulled pork and pork ribs, along with sides of cole slaw, corn bread and corn fritters.  Hubby had the brisket and chicken, neither of which filled him up... kinda small portions of both.  My ribs were tough - not fall off of the bone tender at all.  The pulled pork and links were both OK, not anything special.  The highlight, in my opinion, was the corn bread.  I'd go back for more of that... it almost tasted like it had a coating of honey butter, which was delish.  Hence, the 2 stars.

oyF-PIo4tsXiMpqcaUe7Ww.text: well I saw the yelp reviews and decided to try it out the food overall was ok it came out very quick the bbq sauce was not as good could have been better but service was great I will come back and try some other things.

SDtP4LCGPi59VTwBL--DWg.text: Holy expensive!  We got like 4 bites of briquette for around $12, not worth my time or money, at that price for that small amount, I expect the best I've ever tasted and this was NOT it.

t6RAl1RgtPylEvhomogBlw.text: I am a fan of the ribs, chicken and corn nuggets. The BBQ is very tender and flavorful. I really wanted to like the macaroni & cheese but it didn't really have any color, flavor or real cheesiness to it.

M1-j7bS5OPVv0KBCvCqEmw.text: The place is SOOO GOOD ..... Little slow ... But it's due to how AWESOME THE FOOD IS .... One issue - sweet tea SUCKS !! Make your home made .... Please

vkEnZr8J7PZ93bdbxaYzOQ.text: IT AIN'T LOVE BUT IT AIN'T BAD!  First the disclaimer: I am from Texas and believe as fervently as any fanatic that the world's finest BBQ is produced in Central Texas and the sauce should always be served on the side. That said, I am not in Central Texas now and Rollin Smoke is real BBQ for sure.  I have eaten here three times and was satisfied every time, The pork shoulder is mighty fine, brisket real good too, however the ribs have been a little dry both times I ordered them. Maybe I just played unlucky and ordered them at the wrong time. I like their sauce quite a lot, it's tart, not too thick and spicy enough that one is not tempted to overdo it.  I called at 8:40 PM last night, although they were closed Chef Tim was gracious enough to let me pick up 2 lbs, of sliced brisket after hours. The brisket was excellent, juicy with a very dark crust and just enough fat. Had just received a selection of sauces from Franklin BBQ in Austin,TX; favorite of Texas cult BBQ and uber hip Austinites, wanted to do a taste test immediately.  I cannot believe that I drove by this place for 6 months before I stopped, such is the sad state of BBQ (and Mexican Food) in Las Vegas. I expect to be disappointed so I postpone it as long as possible. My advice is don't wait another day, go now.

Z6rnqKT6igeDrsdJuW2Skw.text: First off, when you get here you wonder if you are the right place. It looks like a hole in the wall from the outside and it isn't in the safest of places (late at night). But once you walk in, you are greeting with a delicous smell of BBQ and walls of True Razorback fans! The inside is completely different the outside. This place is True BBQ. Everything was fantastic and the owner is really, really nice. We all got something different and there wasn't one back thing. I got the beef ribs which were literally fall off the bone. We also got the smoked meatloaf and pulled piggy sandwich. The piggy sandwich was very tender and moist but the star of the meals really was the meatloaf. I don't like meatloaf but I liked this one. It isn't your traditional meatloaf, it is smoked and BBQ. So very good. The portions are huge as well! You really don't need too many sides if any but if you do get some, the greens are good, yams and mac n cheese are good! I bet the rest are as well. I highly recommend going here! Yum!

uTed2t1AFydNs6IaV7FXOw.text: I was in Vegas a few weeks ago and my friend Julie. Took me hear to try the food since I love BBQ. I must say the food was to die for. The staff and service was great. I've tried a few places in Vegas but this place is the Best by far! If your in Vegas I highly reccomend it!!

kAjXgN_DXAyjGaBDSybMnQ.text: Amazing BBQ!! My boyfriend and I discovered Rollin Smoke about a year ago and have been loyal ever since. There mac and cheese is OMG delishhhh! My boyfriend loves to get the "Outlaw Burger" one of his favorites.

bXRLe_sPSWqbNRbm-nt9jQ.text: Burger was awesome.. can't wait to go back and try the brisket

pRtWWRROp0JVDjc4rWvbAQ.text: Super busy line went quick food was fast. Sides are great gonna go back and try more side. Beans and mac&cheese down

aCpKKx_ZWuX0q1U_1VnZzA.text: We found this place last year & absolutely love it! We're halfway through our trip this year and have made our 2nd trip here already! We decided to try John Mull's Road Kill Grill yesterday & were disappointed that we wasted our time. Rollin Smoke is hands down so much better!

QI5vgXhtc31nsChKuWiRwQ.text: Just yum.  I wasn't in the mood for BBQ when I got here, but after sampling my boyfriend's plate, I changed my mind!  Service was pretty good, but seating can be a bit difficult to get at times.  Thankfully people go in and outta this joint relatively quick.  Will be back here again!

3kz37z1rWXKPI2ubV40SSA.text: Had to kiss the cook, this bbq was so good!  Honestly the best I've had.  The meat so tender and moist with the perfect, delicate smokiness that only comes with hours of loving atten-tion.  Get the combo platterWe loved the sweet bbq sauce and Mac n cheese, but they have choices for all tastes. Enjoy!

Zebx4uSQF12xno8klPGm8g.text: Its the BEST DAM BBQ in all of Las Vegas. Fresh tasty amazing!!! Service with a smile overtime! its worth the wait all day every day!!

7t-h6arzxvE-5dfXKANAvQ.text: Cutest little hole in the wall BBQ place. Went with a couple friends and we all ordered something different to try each other's dishes and were not disappointed. All the meats were moist and smoked to perfection, sauces were full of flavor, and the best pickles I've had in a long time! Server were extremely friendly and treated you like family when you walked through the doors. If you're into a home-y, country atmosphere, this is the place to be!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free root beer float with Yelp check in offer
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked brisket sandwich

JW3lBUVcekHt-YolDF3guw.text: Fantastic. Definitely will be back. We split the outlaw burger and were more than fed.  Spicy sauce has legit heat. Can't wait to come back to try more. great food, fair prices and wonderful people.

PE-VmHiytWx-Vgf0EtU7EQ.text: 4.8 stars  went ahead and rounded it to 5   On a previous trip to Las Vegas, we drove past Rollin Smoke BBQ, and they had the smokers going but we want to give another place a try... that place was Memphis BBQ.  You can read my review about Memphis BBQ...  hind sight is 20/20 ... and oh how I wish we would have stopped at Rollin Smoke first.  Live and learn!   The place smells great when you walk in the door... the guys, there were really nice and welcomed us in...  The menu is diverse...   I had the three meat plate...  brisket, ribs, and pulled pork.   Brisket was really good... Ribs were even better... and the Pulled Pork was KILLER!   Portions were generous... flavors were fantastic!  The potato salad had some spice to it and so did the pickles.   My wife had two meats, pulled pork and brisket... she raved about both.  She is a huge brisket fan, and she said it reminded her of being in Texas.  She loved it!   I think the guys there have a handle on the BBQ side of things... it's great! Where I think, they could use some help is in the dessert's area... they were just alright.  I wasn't there to have dessert... so not a big deal... but... it's the only weak link about the place which stood out to me.  Dial that in... it's a 5+ star place.   Well worth a visit if you want fantastic BBQ!

YTl6o69VRlQK3OKC80lLmw.text: The food here is tasty! Service is super quick which is a plus. It's not the best BBQ place I've been to. I would give this place a 3.6-3.7. I think the side dishes and chicken could be improved a bit. Nonetheless, I did enjoy my meal!

zSPwkDwFRYYIb4X6COklEA.text: Great value for what you get.  Compared to other barbecues I've been to, it isn't quite up there with the best, but it's not bad either.  If you are in vegas and in the mood for loads of greasy, fatty hangover food for cheap, this is the place!

4extyAf51vovWNNMAQA2wg.text: I currently live in Dallas, so BBQ is everywhere, good and bad. I didn't think I'd be hitting up a BBQ place in Vegas on my last trip out, but we saw the reviews and were nearby (I had to at least go see the cat show at the Riviera), so we squeezed in. The layout of the restaurant was a little disorienting upon entry, given the vast light/dark difference from outside to inside. They have a huge menu on the wall, or printed menus you can take and look at. Order at the counter/cash register/stand thing. They have lots of specials/combos where you get a fountain drink (self serve, with refills), a side, and a main (sandwich, wrap, salad, or just meat by the 'slab'). I was feeling obese that day, so I got a salad with pulled chicken, the cole slaw, and a cornbread. All three things were amazing. My companions had half a smoked chicken which was just ridiculously juicy and smokey. The rest of the crew got brisket sandwiches (pile of brisket on a hotdog/small hoagie bun), mac n' cheese, and beans. The mac n' cheese wasn't met with much enthusiasm given the runniness of the cheese sauce and the firmness or thickness of the type of noodle used. The beans were described as 'kickin' by both the owner and the one at my table eating them, so I imagine that was a good thing. Overall, I will definitely be back here for more BBQ when I'm in Vegas. The food was just too good to not go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket sandwich with beans
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled chicken salad

pOSLWForRTsK3ixD9i9VBg.text: The pulled pork and chicken were bland but definitely Go for the spare ribs, brisket, kickin beans, hot link, price, and portion size. This place is delicious, great place off the strip, local hangout, and crowded. Go during off hours so you beat the crowds. If you stay at Trump Hotel, you can walk over there easily.

Qd1_G2TVj_EXLiJrhJkD0A.text: I've had this place bookmarked forever and finally had a chance to go a short while ago. It's got a "dive bar" feel thanks to it's location and the old, weathered building it's in. But, that just seems to solidify their reputation as the town's best barbecue. No legitimate barbecue place could occupy a clean,modern building, right? For my first visit I had to try the rib platter ($22.99). With fall-off-the-bone tender baby back ribs with a good crust/bark and smokey flavor, thick and meaty spare ribs, and a massive, charred and fatty beef rib, this was a great option to try multiple proteins. For a side, I went with the mac 'n cheese. Made from elbow pasta and sitting in a thick, creamy cheese sauce topped with cheddar, it only served as a speed bump in my road to devouring the barbecue. I'll agree with many others in saying this is the city's best 'cue, at least from what I've tried so far. Locals get a 10% discount.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib platter ($22.99) - 3 babybacks, 2 St. Louis spare ribs, 1 beef rib, side of mac and cheese
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib platter ($22.99) - 3 babybacks, 2 St. Louis spare ribs, 1 beef rib, side of mac and cheese
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib platter ($22.99) - 3 babybacks, 2 St. Louis spare ribs, 1 beef rib, side of mac and cheese

7JfZ_NCAJzhLGqXO3zvWXg.text: I have bookmarked this joint a while back and finally managed to swing by today.  I was heading toward Spring Mountain through the south off ramp from the I-15 flyway to get my pho sesh when I realized that Rollin' Smoke was right off Highland Drive.  I don't know about y'all, but there is only one thing I do in this industrial area at involves poles and minimal clothing, so yeah....great place to put a BBQ establishment!  I decided to go with something not too heavy, not knowing that a light meal here is equivalent to a light meal in Hawaii...no such things as smeediums here.  The sandwiches offer a check in discount to include some dessert as well.  I ended up saving mine after being more than satisfied following my meal.  I opted for the Outlaw, for those that know, you know.  It comes with a brisket burger, deep fried onion crisps, there very own BBQ sauce, cheddar cheese on a lightly toasted bun and topped with some pickles and peppers.  Additionally, I made it a meal and added fried okra on the side.    The meal came out rather quickly, considering that there were other patrons that were there before me, but have not yet gotten their dishes...and when their dishes did come out, it wasn't anything huge or extravagant.  So note to self, burgers and sandwiches come with the quickness.  However, there is something about burgers that in now way humanly possible can fit into anyone's mouth, no matter how much you smash it down by hand.  I had to cut the bad boy into 4's in order to get it down without getting cited for indecency.  Kinda like getting a salad from a place that serves it on the smallest petrie dish ever constructed...I never seemed to ever get the logic in that.  But seriously, I'd rather complain about my meal being way over sized versus being a meal for an action figure.    One thing I noticed though, they do not ask how you would like your burger, meaning that it comes standard as what looked to be medium rare plus, but not quite well.  It was moist and flavorful, but started to toughen up towards the end when it cooled off.  The Okra was on point and the BBQ is a nice compliment.    The decor is like most BBQ joints that is accustomed to getting thrashed following a nice serving, evidenced by the whole paper towel rolls at each table.  There is no sense getting all done up if you are there to get dirty.  Yet, there was three flat screens playing three different ESPN channels, always a good sign.  The place appears to stick to it's Arkansas roots and has the Razorback Fight Song posted on the wall in the extended dining room.  What rubbed me the wrong way was that I dropped a few bucks in the tip bucket right in front of the waiter, and he did not even acknowledge it.  That was disturbing since I actually clean up after myself pretty well.  I almost felt like sticking my hand back in the bucket like I was fishing for catfish, but oh well, I may be making too big a deal about it.   I definitely want to come back to try the ribs and other offerings, so if its BBQ you want, this is the place to be.

oWy2F5WvPqC7ikdRQCLuyQ.text: Beef (short rib) ribs where so tender and succulent! Even my wife who typically doesn't care much for BBQ really loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ribs and coleslaw.

e6L1kaJawHRpfOi-8E6Ucg.text: Love this barbecue. It's a small little shack that serves great barbecue.  I haven't had much barbecue out here and was skeptical of how good barbecue could be, but yes, there is good barbecue in Las Vegas.  I've only been twice and both times I got their duo plate.  With these plates you get the option to choose from: Brisket, hot links, spare ribs, 1/4 chicken, and pork.  I got the brisket and hot link.  The brisket is very juicy and you can see the beautiful smoke ring around the edge of the meat.   The hot link has a nice snap to it and is definitely one of my favourite parts of the meal.   Along with the meat you get an option of a side and I've gotten the mac n cheese and the potato salad.  The mac n cheese was alright, nothing too special, but I do love their potato salad. It's creamy and the potatoes are still firm. It's a nice refreshing taste when eaten with the rest of the meal.  Definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a quick lunch or just in the mood for some barbecue!

bXFdV2RHqeSofn1lpxHfXA.text: Amazing. I typically hate BBQ because the sauce makes my tongue raw. This place did not use tons of sauce on the meat itself and had amazing flavors. They had tons of options for sauce to use on your own. The sides were out of this world. We did a sampler platter and all meat choices were fantastic!!!

-omSGGqbIglIjXTfTrkKVA.text: Second time here. Last year 5 stars this year beef ribs fatty but tasty. Sauces not filled, couldn't get anyone's attention as cashier/order taker had a long line.

Vga0pWnzTzEzy2NUr3SrVg.text: This place is awesome sauce, and, even better, the sauce is awesome (all right, I'll stop now).  Went to Rollin Smoke recently to see what all the buzz was about. Got the all you can eat special for $35. Worth every penny. If you want to know what to get, here's what you should get:  Burnt ends (incredible) Beef ribs (amazing) St. Louis pork spare ribs (delectable)  I went three rounds and, no joke, thought I was going to throw up on the way home. That's how much barbecue I ate. In my everyday life I try to abide by the principle of "moderation in all things." Rollin Smoke makes moderation impossible. Why are you still reading this? Go get some barbecue!

T6WflVuRhtSe1McURYUmDw.text: This place has the best beef ribs in town. Beef ribs are hard to find so when you find some as great as these, you just have to write a review about them. Fantastic!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ribs were incredible! They really found the perfect method to cook it to perfection!!

UWoKNyY-vT5xszq6l9zrzQ.text: Maybe I had too high of expectation.  Meat was very tender but not much of flavor.  It didn't seems to have the smoke flavor but it felt like it was steamed.  I lived in Texas for 31 years and sure do know how the BBQ should taste like.

eOCp5lIDU6AdpqURS3mqtQ.text: I am a rib lover. Been here 2 x and NOT coming back. Both times, most of my ribs were so blackened and over-burnt that I couldn't eat them; in-other-words carcinogenic crusty charcoal jerky. Too much fat, fat, fat and little flavor to the meat. Very disappointing when I got home with my 2nd try and takeout at this place.

aW-1v1NLi9HM4NCvRjrLgg.text: I have seen Rollin Smoke on several Food/ Travel Channel specials, and have been anticipating my trip in since I planned a trip to Vegas several months ago. We stopped in about 11:30 and though it was fairly busy it wasn't hard to get a table and we didn't wait in line or for our food very long.  The parking however is very sparse so we had to park on the street across the way a bit.  I have to say that the main takeaway that I got from Rollin Smoke is that Salt Lake City (where I live) has some very underrated BBQ places. For what has been stated as one of the best BBQ places in the country I honestly have enjoyed certain items at places here in UT even better.  That out of the way we were very please with the food and clearly their technique is flawless. The smoke rings were perfect and they did have hands down the best ribs in every way that I have ever had. One thing I did not notice on the board is that if you don't ask for it specifically they default to chopping up their brisket, and though it was quite tasty I would have preferred my brisket to be sliced, and I am surprised (since I've never seen it that way before) that chopped rather than sliced is their default.  They also had the best mustard based BBQ sauce I've ever had which they call "Sweet Country Girl", and their other sauces are quite tasty too but I typically prefer a thicker Texas style sauce (didn't effect my review, just a note) to their Louisiana/ Alabama style thin vinegar sauces.  I Ordered a 3 meat plate: Ribs, Pork, Brisket and a side of their potato salad. The portions were good but not generous, and as mentioned above the ribs were awesome, brisket was tasty but would have liked to have tasted it sliced, and the pork was good but not exceptional. Everything did have a very nice smoky flavor and a perfect crust, and I ate almost everything mostly dry, but added dashes here and there on my fork.  My wife ordered their big baked potato (cant remember what they call it) which was just huge and loaded with all sorts of goodness and brisket on top. It was very delicious and I think that they smoke rather than bake the potato but I could be wrong.  They take your order at the counter then bring it out to you when its ready. The service was okay but nothing great and they weren't particularly friendly at the counter, but they guy who brought out our food was pretty nice.  I will certainly eat here again, but at this point cant say that it is my overall favorite BBQ place. Their prices are actually pretty good for Vegas, and I think they give a discount to locals (which is a bit annoying).

BoYGZDGdnSqWJudCptgA9w.text: This place is awesome!!! Like seriously! The food is bomb and everyone was very friendly and helpful without even asking. I felt very welcomed and comfortable. One group had a special request and the cook came off the grill to make sure everything turned out great. #CustomerService Get The Pit Special.

u86wAcTqx2Fp0QdRaTEq2Q.text: This place I seen television I'm so glad I did happen to be in Vegas for a concert and decided to give rollin smoke a try what a great choice the stuffed potato I had was great the brisket just so flavorful and the BBQ sauce which was on the table some of the best I've ever had could of been spicer for me but still awesome my woman had the three plate meal with ribs pulled pork n chicken her side mac n cheese mac n cheese so cheesy yum her ribs fall off the bone tasty she even enjoyed the BBQ sauce on table n she doesn't do sauce not that the food needed sauce I'm just a saucy kind of guy lol service was fast n friendly you usually can tell food is good when line out the door lol place is small but clean YES I would definitely go back and will next time I'm up thank you Rollin Smoke for the hospitality and great food

Qre-5jmHEj6eRiXig3t5eA.text: My fellow lunch buddies and I were craving barbeque last week, but couldn't find seem to find a good spot. On our quest for barbeque, we found Rollin Smoke Barbeque. OMG this place is amazing and a hidden gem. Definitely off the beaten path, but well worth the drive. I had the Pulled Piggy Sandwich with Onion Rings and their Peach Cobbler. Their pulled pork was amazing. The meat was so soft & tender. Definitely going to recommend to anyone that's craving barbeque.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled piggy with onion rings
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled piggy with waffle fries

rDblgZl8j-lR0cQUXap-ug.text: Absolutely the BEST BBQ ANYWHERE  period!!!! You can taste the time and care put into the meats and sides. A must stop whenever we're in Vegas.

zQhaAA07azesqWobcxuHgg.text: Hands down, the best barbecue I've ever had. As their motto speaks "we rub our meat" and you can tell by the amount of flavor it in. The meat was moist and yet had a nice crust. I loved the vinegar based sauce that went well with the wonderfully cooked meats.   My husband had. The three rib combo, and the meat was tender. Not exactly falling off the bone, but came off the bone cleanly, which I prefer.   The portions were ample and I would definitely return.

tThNDfsFrXjVfw77TZVRxA.text: Hadn't had good barbecue in a while and this place definitely hit the spot, they were very friendly and knowledgeable about the food, they also make an amazing bbq meatloaf and the rib tips were delicious as well! Great place

8Pk3k-qoCN9CwpTOx8UcuQ.text: Best BBQ I've had since leaving the south. Was stationed in Louisiana a few years ago and since leaving have been looking for a place that does BBQ like I had there. This place delivers and then some. The pork was amazing. My picky 7 yr old loved her chicken.  Being a big guy I'm used to being able to"put a hurting" on some BBQ, but even I tapped out. Great portions and very friendly staff. Definitely going back before we leve Vegas.

rklHqGHaPAF5FwAIY778bg.text: Sweet. Fancy. Moses.  This place is amazing. I normally don't have a huge craving for BBQ, but maybe that's just because this town isn't especially known for it's fantastic BBQ. Rollin Smoke definitely changed that part of me. Since I first went there (about 3 weeks ago) I've been back 2 more times with a bunch of different people based on craving for that sweet magical BBQ they serve up. I feel like the more I eat there, the more wizard-like powers I will gain via BBQ sauce. Maybe I'm confusing that with my constant yearning for naps.  It is insanely delicious BBQ. Everything I've had there has been phenomenal. The pork, the chicken, and the burger...which I was unaware was insanely massive. I would recommend having the rest of your day planned for napping if you choose to eat the Outlaw Burger. It is tasty, but it is freaking enormous. It's got to weight a pound in your hands...It's a challenge to eat, but it's so good.  The sides are really great too. I keep trying new ones every time I go because they have a pretty significant list of options, so it's nice to switch it up and not be disappointed ever.  I really loved this place, and I really like the location. I know it's not the most convenient place on the planet, but getting there is easy, and it's kind of buried. Like a little local treasure. Places like these keep me exploring this city for more delicious dishes.  If I had any complaints about this place the only one would be that it can leave you smelling very smokey after you leave for quite some time. Not the worst problem if you're trying to get eaten by bears who like tasty things, but if you're going to a meeting with a new client or something immediately after, I might consider going in with a 'BBQ outfit' if that's even a thing.  It's tasty. Go eat it.

HxpmG6ZTBbnTBS2yCufPog.text: Went here 2 weeks ago for dinner. I saw that this place got rave reviews on here and other sites and, honestly, I don't understand the hype. The location was a bit sketchy being literally under two freeway overpasses. I ordered brisket, chicken, with a side of mac & cheese and bread. The chicken and the mac & cheese were ok but the brisket was downright bland, even with a little bit of glaze on it. I'd be willing to give this place a second and possibly order different, but as far as first impressions go, I was not impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese, Brisket, Chicken, and Bread

NR9JIeLs2HPJFDKHEVvNIQ.text: The ribs and pulled pork are terrific. I ordered the corn bread and loaded mashed potatoes, absolutely delicious. I ha e been here twice and each time the staff is friendly and very helpful. Definitly the best BBG in Vegas Don't miss this spot while in Vegas

pR7IQdLNlxfdSu2tNnKVdg.text: The MAC N CHEESE!! Best BBQ in Las Vegas without a doubt, great service and the beef ribs melt in your mouth! It's a must.

jUOwzmoRo24ZS8FgFhQQxg.text: Awesome BBQ. Hard to find but well worth it.  A bit of a dive but that's how I roll.  Beef brisket and beans to kill for.

pSj0ciDOb3srTH0OYR7CFw.text: On a visit to Las Vegas, come upon this restaurant. For those that want authentic barbeque is is the stop  Food was delicious, and the meat was smoked to perfection.  This was definitely a highlight of the trip. I will definitely come back and will recommend to the friend that travel this way. Both thumbs way way up!!

0KuijYp3HTHz11d2gcNbKg.text: Tried Rollin Smoke tonight on friend's recommendation.  It was okay.  The sauce was good (on the thin side as you'd expect for this style) with just a hint of sweet.   I had the duo plate with brisket, hot link and jalapeno coleslaw.  The brisket was good, flavor and smoke wise.  The hot link was the worst I've ever had, it had so much connective tissue that I couldn't chew it and ended up looking like the clown with the never ending scarf being pulled out of my mouth (eeewwww, and not attractive, right???),  The coleslaw was fairly flavorless; as I would eat it the heat would gradually build but nothing other than that.  Husband had the pit special; brisket, pulled pork, spare ribs, hot link, hush puppies, mac & cheese, and collard greens.  He agreed with my assessment on the brisket and the hot link.  He liked the hush puppies but felt the mac & cheese and the collard greens were WAY over cooked and lacking flavor.  Sister had the pulled piggy with hush puppies.  She said the pork was moist, tender, and had a good flavor.  She liked the hush puppies but they were a touch spicy for her.  It was worth a try but I can't say that we'll be back.

bosUBns5z25wjBfM-Fye2Q.text: Why are there only excellent reviews here's??????    You folks have absolutely no tastebuds at all....The worst rib tips ever.all bone, all fat all gristle.too expensive. 3rd. Time around been ripped off...HOWEVER  the nicest staff in the world.. Wondering if all these 5 stars are fake posters ????????    Good employees ......bad bbq

AcHIKfGVhUqKqrgLLTBZzQ.text: Great smoke house. Had the beef ribs and sampled the pork. These guys get it. Tender with a lot of smoke flavor.

rUmMwJzzkc3twR1yKEowPA.text: I really just don't get the hype quite honestly. Maybe it was because I didn't have the barbecue, I had the seafood platter but even when I tried my friends' barbecues, it was just "okay." Nothing to fall in that hefty, hefty line for or stand for 10-15 minutes waiting for a seat in their very small seating areas! Maybe for a True Barbecue connoisseur this would be a great fit - but it was so-so in my eyes!

NEBR87D7wg_cqh9QXsJkmg.text: OMG.  Stop reading this review and get yourself there before they close.  Awesome, awesome barbeque.  Ordered the 5 meat platter and seafood combo - gone in 5 minutes.  Yeah really.  Why are you still reading.......

k5_cvGnzSsBPas6vWeHXpg.text: My son is a local and read many articles on this las vegas "find". word is out that rollin' smoke  has authentic,serious,very tasty BBQ. You will definitely need your GPS to find this place but it is well worth the search. I sense most folks get their orders to go here although they have a decent sized dining area. pretty spartan no frills establishment. my wife enjoyed her catfish po boy...with hush puppies and cole slaw. my son and I each had the meat sampler.....spare ribs,brisket and chicken got our highest grades. Help aren't really friendly but they get your food out without much of a wait. prices are extremely reasonable and as I said..,.the food is very good. close your eyes and you'll swear you are in KC or Memphis.

F44dmKRFMZzrV-QChuXXYg.text: I was referred here by a friend and wow was I surprised.  Not the place I would expect good simple BBQ.  The brisket was tender and the pulled pork with the jalapeno coleslaw was fantastic.  I will be back.

CBEdmS6N7NzgOPT5uESuCg.text: Were do I start everything was great. Greens and yams were on fire. Even the banana pudding omg. They bring the food to you. The place looks like a whole in the wall but don't let the looks fool you. This is the place in vegas for ribs. I didn't eat the ribs but everybody else did ...lots of meat

-7tYs-JH-059VKmacJmVCw.text: Amazing. The sides may even out perform the meats. The corn bread was just pure butter. Waffle fries and fried onions were fantastic. Ribs smoked perfectly. Just go try it

Vj-EFwAQFMhLyUsXY3aM3w.text: Saw the yelp reviews and gave it a shot. What a great BBQ place. This is your classic, no frills BBQ joint. The menus are on the wall, you order at a tall podium and the staff brings the food to the table.  We got there early on a Wednesday and there was no line. While we were there the line grew out the door.  The fried okra was freshly made and tasty. The jalapeno coleslaw was very good, a nice take on a classic side item. I had the rib combo, which I wound up making two meals from. Others in our group had the sliders which were very good as well.

K3g36Yy59wpJdCalwbtmCQ.text: by far the best bbq I've had in vegas but that's not saying much.  I tried the brisket (a little dry), pulled pork (a pleasant surprise), and spare ribs (very nice).  they were out of my favorite (hot links).  sides included beans (I asked for pinto but got baked.  they were ok), greens (nice heat but I like collards and mustard and I don't think they used either), mashed potatoes (very good), and mac & cheese (same as everywhere else). corn bread was good.  nice portion sizes.

rE7c_S4Nc0HIsaAHmyjoUw.text: Yummy!!  Called a few hours before we ordered to ask questions. Gentleman was very nice and answered all of my questions. Ribs are awesome!!!  Also ordered a BBQ sampler. Omg!!!  Everything is awesome!!  Corn nuggets are corn fritters if you are southern lol. They are bite size and awesome!  Baked beans and chipotle coleslaw are also amazing!!!  Just so you know, spicy sauce is very spicy!  I love spice, but I mixed mine with the house sauce, which is also amazing!!  Loaded mashed potatoes include bacon, green onion, bell pepper and cheese. If you want great BBQ, you must check this place out!!!

XnxtX7YmC4r5M5Xuv9le5g.text: Awesome BBQ! Can have it mild or crazy insane hot. The sides are good and the yams are off the hook. Best yams I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We had all the meets and I was satisfied. The briskets were a little dry but the rest especially the sauce made up for it.

xG-YhepY13CABDduvrxshA.text: Ok by FAR the best BBQ I have ever had! Soooooo good! We got the pulled piggy sandwich, hot links, and the BBQ nacho fries all to share. All of it was delicious!! My favorite was the BBQ nacho fries. You HAVE to try them!! So good I can't even explain it! I'm so full I need someone to roll me the rest of the way home :)

gNNO7Rf7IpLwMDLkuZVAgA.text: Amazing BBQ. Definitely do not over look this place when you are in Vegas! Friendly, helpful staff and simply amazing food. Portions are big and worth the price. Got the meatloaf and it was perfection, other got ribs and a wrap and all was immensely enjoyed!

aieCbhpCj2xc6TNmLqqPFQ.text: Had a chance to stop at the Rolling Smoke BBQ in Las Vegas. It is located in an industrial part of town in an older strip mall. Once you get inside, the friendly staff, the great service, and the great food make it well worth the trip. As I only like pulled pork, I was pleasantly surprised by the pulled pork sandwich. It was moist and flavorful and very lean. The sides were also very good. The Chef came out of the kitchen to make sure everyone liked their food. If you are looking for good barbecue make this a stop  on your visit to Las Vegas.

Pb94g0_mQAqMkREgKTyL_g.text: Oh man I love me some BBQ, I always order me some ribs and this place is pretty damn good. I had to try a bit of everything so I got the basket with chicken, ribs, hot links and brisket with sides of onion strings, Mac n cheese and bacon potato salad. And for dessert, carmel cake! Hands down delicious! Haven't tried anything in comparison within Vegas.

R9pJDWbgn7hklniKa0tCKQ.text: Southern BBQ goodness in the middle of the dessert!   This tiny restaurant hiding off the strip is a piece of tummy heaven. The taste reminds me of the Deep South. The sauce is spicy and flavorful, the meats are cooked well, and the sides are all good. The only problem is that my stomach isn't big enough to keep eating.   Definitely going to stop by again before we leave town.

DDlg4urGmcsDNgI8-QLdFA.text: The food was good but service was questionable. Found a hair in my hot dog and the manager asked me what should he do and lied about not having someone with long hair. I ordered dessert and a worker with long hair brought my dessert out. The manager offered $5 in cash on my $60 bill. Never coming back

8bc21ee7y0TVh4cM2hJSUQ.text: I love Yelp... I found this hidden jewel because of Yelp.  It is tucked away. I love BBQ.  This place was outstanding. The food is authentic and very tasty. I had the Biggin sandwich which had brisket, pulled pork and sausage for $8.99.  The sandwich was large and sooo good.  It was full of meat.  The meat is very smokey and tender.  I was very surprised about the size of the sandwich for the price.

mFXGP_uyisXKxI3gUo_R5A.text: AWESOME!!!! We went multiple times during the  off/slow season in Vegas. Lunch time is always packed. The food is great - greatest BBQ ever - not an exaggeration. The first time I went there, this guy named Mike took our order and got our food. No-nonsense kind of guy - he recommended  the right food for us and it was delicious. You can tell they care - everything is smoked slowly so it's soft and flavorful. There is a review down there about their bread being soggy - who fuckin' cares! It was probably placed there to soak up the excess grease. Grow a pair and eat the meat.

-rSjpXmZZ7wnn2IymZS_6g.text: BBQ was ok. I wanted to try some BBQ when i was in Vegas. I checked yelp and came here. I got the pit special chicken hot link 2 ribs and brisket. On the side I got greens mashed potatoes and fries. It was done pretty quick. about 10 minutes. The ribs were pretty good. The hot link was spicy but not hot. Same goes for almost every thing else but the ribs fries brisket. I'm guessing they cook it earlier and warm it up I am not sure. I am pretty sure it was not fresh. Fries where just ok. Greens the same. Mashed potatoes where a little better. If i were to go back i would definitely probably just get ribs or a brisket or chicken sandwich. Sides taste like something on the strip. Over priced and over rated. The BBQ I would try again. Also there Ice tea wasn't that great either.

X9RQmxCxEzYWV8RKBmM8ig.text: Good Food! Was out in Vegas for friends bday and decided to go there and eat instead of eating out of casino or on strip. Maybe 10 minutes away from "Rio" and its the real deal on BBQ. Friendly and fast service. Clean tables as well. I will be back whenever I am in the town!

RtJiz6BbYoJbK-xsTGHYTw.text: We actually cater from Rollin smoke for our office and it is delicious. Some of the best beef ribs I've ever had! The beef brisket is moist, tender, and great. And a BBQ joint has to have great sides and rolling smoke doesn't dissapoint.

UDKn57_a4bC2fDG0NjfTwA.text: Honestly, not even close to the best BBQ I've had. Nothing specifically wrong with this place. Good mac and cheese. But just not great.

IthVNGyC8qt2qwrhj61ypw.text: By far the best BBQ in Vegas. I love getting the duo plate of Pork and Hot Links and the either the Corn Nuggets or the Mac N Cheese. Simply amazing food at a great price. If you're local pull out your ID and ask for the local's discount!

JG0cBjEym3H5h4MbTqBlLA.text: These guys are awesome, family owned, friendly and amazing food!

t6VPB_RqQ0mImP47Rx1H6g.text: The food steals the show in this restaurant.   Due to the popularity with the locals, the establishment is under strain to keep up.  Food: 10/10 - This is where this establishment shines.  True barbeque.  The brisket and ribs have smoke rings in the meat and the building smells great when you walk in.   Great value!   You get a lot of food for not a lot of money.    Served on white bread just like BBQ should be!    Service: 7/10 - The kitchen really cares about what they are serving.  However the ordering process is under strain to keep up with the largely local patrons who visit.  The line frequently stretches out the door and with one person taking orders the wait can be longer than it takes to eat the food.    The person taking the  orders is friendly and trying hard to keep up but the management needs to improve the infrastructure.  The podium itself is very simplistic and the whole setup is not build to handle a crowd.  Decor: 5/10 - They have a fish tank featured on the tv show "Tanked" but it is in sad shape.  The restaurant is worn out and a bit unorganized comprising of 3 disjointed eating areas.   The eating areas look like they were expanded to meet demand but in an adhoc manner.  Cleanliness: 7/10 -  The area to get your sodas is sub par.  Poor lighting and hidden for first time visitors.   There were no major areas of uncleanliness but the restaurant was not beaming with cleanliness either.   Some improvement is needed.  Parking: 6/10 - Parking can be tight.  Small shared lot.   Note: You are in strip club central in this area.  Restrooms: N/A - Didn't visit.  Overall: 9.5/10 - Don't bother with BBQ on the strip.  This is a local gem if you can go at off peak times or don't mind waiting for your food.    The food is what brings the locals here and for good reason.   The problems that this establishment faces are good problems to have.  Namely, they are growing fast and are in a phase where they should be planning their next phase of development.  They are in need of a re-haul on the building itself to bring the eating area into one cohesive place with a modern order taking setup.  If they can overcome these obstacles there's no end in sight to the good things that lie ahead at Rollin' Smoke BBQ.

sCVZ3TVaPSU_aZ9MDAQAJQ.text: had really high expectation for this place , but unfurtunately it wasn't what i was looking for . too little flavor for my taste

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. rib platter 17.99 $
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. baby back plate  17.99 $

h1elTv7vI8XlS08X-36n6Q.text: Not really impressed. Lots of good reviews, but not a good place to sit down and eat. Food wasn't that great. There are many other great BBQ places in town.

rfySHhviQcVE5OzoTiDhEA.text: Did I just die and go to BBQ heaven?! This place is AMAZEBALLS! As soon as you open the door you are hit with the most intense fragance of BBQ that will have you salivating! We went overboard and got almost every side they had to offer!! Those Corn nuggets..... OMG!!!! YOU HAVE TO TRY THEM! I had the chopped brisket and pulled pork with corn nuggets and hush puppies. My husband had sliced brisket and pulled pork with mac and cheese and loaded mashed potatoes. My daughter had the chicken wings and fries.The meat was cooked to perfection and moist. I haven't even gotten to the BBQ sauce, which I could almost see myself drinking from the bottle.This place is BBQ perfection! THE BEST BEST BBQ I have ever had!!! Its about a 35 min drive here for us, but totally worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped brisket and pulled pork meals with corn nuggets, hash brown Mac n cheese and loaded mash potatoes

JjvMjSgVTh-YcEC5Tw0F1w.text: My top 3 bbq place. Away from strip, fast turn over, workers with good attitude. Definitely place to hit up and try at least once.

Zh5mFpqODEPyOmhhQOnA1A.text: Don't judge this place by the outside.  Their food is yummy and plenty of it.  We had ribs, brisket, pork, potatoes, string onions, salad with chipotle dressing, and it was all good. The place was packed, not a lot of parking.  It's a family friendly small location with southern BBQ that is awesome!  The staff are great, service is quick and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front part of the restaurant... After you walk in. Order your food under the menu. Find a table...about 15. Enjoy...
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spudastic with brisket filling beans, sour cream, cheese.  Tasty!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio meal - brisket, pork, short rib, side of string onions and a drink.

J0JrARb3UEaXSYGbGzn33w.text: My work got their food catered in. It...was...amazing! I kept their business card for later. SOOO good, like..wow. If you are in the mood for some BBQ and comfort food side dishes make a B line to this place.

3u5yZHooR3xL81YLQ7bTgw.text: I really wanted to like this place! Im just too hard to please, that is the problem. I had a pulled pork sandwich that was piled high. The meat was very tender but not much flavor without tons of bbq sauce. My hubby said the babyback ribs were not bad and the mac n cheese wasn't that good either. I ordered the catfish and shrimp sampler and was highly disappointed, lack of flavor to the max! Shrimp is my favorite and I left 4 on the plate and I didn't eat the rest of the catfish either. The waffle fries are bomb and my friend said the collards were delicious. The banana pudding was not good at all. It was the consistency of baby food, not creamy at all and only 2 nilla wafers for decorations. Sorry Rollin Smoke, I was rooting for you but I will not return!

IPuOrPPBMd7wJ9LCjU6PzA.text: This is True southern BBQ and absolutely delicious. Certain items can be a little pricey but overall it is all worth it and you will leave full and happy.

p9q3AIF7PsEDQO1ZbKMIxw.text: I'm not a bbq lover at all but I did enjoy the burnt end brisket.  My husband is a major bbq person coming from Houston TX so I had to ask him to get a True honest review.   He rated it a 6 out of 5 stars.   Definitely 100% better than Daves.  We called in our order.   Luckily we did because by the time we got there, they ran out of almost everything. .. and this was at 5:00 pm.  The sauce they give I believe is adequate for the amount we ordered.   Just in case,  we ordered more but ended up not needing to use it.   My hubby is also a big time spicy eater so we ordered a side of their spicyest sauce and he said it was hella spicy.  I loved the collard greens as the side.  Like I said,  I'm not a bbq person but this place earns the best I've tried.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork, ribs, burnt ends brisket,  corn nuggets
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt end brisket,   links, ribs.

r5TZveb-UQJFOi81zbubeA.text: This restaurant is a small hidden gem..staff is great and the food is phenomenal!!!!..it's how BBQ should be done!

wxBySxI_4bv8iTdGSxNAgw.text: right next door to Trump - and some Damn good BBQ!  Service was quick and friendly.  You come here for the food and not the ambiance, but the place looks nice - it's just in a weird, but safe location

tFj6ODCSoN63lhYMVbS0rQ.text: My girlfriend & I came here. Very crowded. No seating.  We ordered an Outlaw burger & waffle fries to share.  Outlaw burger was about 9 inches high. Huge burger.  Taste wasn't all that though. Wasn't bad but wasn't amazing.  Waffle fries were fine.. Good not bad.  If I do come back here, I will try the brisket or chicken instead.

yTDOFhDuWVTpLAKUfiBT1g.text: Food was great. Especially the corn bread and corn nuggets. They also have the cutest expo runner that looks like he's in middle school so tip him well! We did

nfbSE5cBI7AsWzW-XxIpgw.text: I woke up at 3 in the morning with their Rib Tips still on my mind.. I'm looking forward too my second trip back here... I was very satisfied. .
