Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I just had to take this pic..
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duo platter brisket and ribs with waffle fries...

-ns-6iW67g-WxHEtnBUYbA.text: Food was great. Had the Trio Meat Plate with chicken,ribs,burnt ends brisket, and corn nuggets. Ordered catfish, potatoe salad, and peach cobbler Togo.   Shout out to Christine and the rest of the crew for just great customer service.   Note... Could here the kitchen crew doing cheers in the back!!!

M9X6RO4nc9oHboapKOsbdA.text: This is an AMAZING mostly locals spot! The food is SO GOOD. One of my favorites!  BE WARNED!!!- They close at 8PM on weeknights!! Which is like a late lunch by LV standards! YES, 8PM. :-( Discovered this sadly when I brought a group of 10 people there and we arrived at 8:05PM to the door being locked in our faces. Before we even left, saw another large party arrive to be disappointed by locked doors as well.  Be there BEFORE 8PM!!!  On the positive side, the food is SO FANTASTIC, they don't feel they need to stay open past 8PM, except on the weekends. Go early, be happy, it is worth the trip off the strip!

DrLiz-PtycPAHrljbepAPg.text: Great bar-b-que and good prices! Lines are always out the door, but the service is quick and friendly. I always the combo plates, so I can try a little everything. They also have an all you can eat menu, but I've never ordered it. The combo plates are large enough.

j0UD9wiAskZZd_7bVY5K6w.text: While on a trip to Vegas for work, my co-worker and I decided to grab some BBQ for dinner. Was hungry and ready to eat after a long day of work, Rollin Smoke is now up at the top of my list for BBQ. I had the trio combo with chopped brisket, pulled pork, and 2 spare ribs with a Mac and cheese side. The brisket was a bit too much pepper for me, but the house sauces were a great compliment to balance it out. The ribs were good too, nice smoky taste and not overpowering. I ended up throwing some of the brisket in the Mac and cheese to offset the amount of cheese and tang up the straight forward Mac and cheese side I had.   Overall the meats are enough to attract any BBQ lover a few blocks away from the strip. Will be back and be trying some of the other sides, but the meatloaf platter was calling my name and plan on that the next time.

x1IBoagSoDxcPyzGcBJvRQ.text: Back again, we come to Vegas every time we can & there is a few places that we always make it a point to go by, this is certainly one of them. It is busy like good places are but they work hard to get food to you . If you want good BBQ while in Vegas there is not a a more legit place here. The only place that we war twice while we were in town.

2kRY1maStUFvYVusrGztFg.text: This place is all its cracked up to be! We looked up best BBQ in Vegas and after some debate/argument we agreed to eat here. Rolling up you might want to turn around, but dont! This place is the real deal! The inside is not that fancy, but who cares right as long as the food is legit. I would pride myslef as a BBQ snob and this joint hit all the marks. I walked up ordered the 3 meat combo with pulled pork, tri tip and ribs. Couldn't decide on the sides so just ordered some extras like okra, cole slaw, waffle fries and potato salad and boy was that a mistake afterwards. I needed to be wheeled out! This has to be one of the best BBQ joints I have been to outside the rib cook off in Reno and this place has every right to stand off to any National Rib Champion. What sealed the deal for me was the owner and his customer service. This guy was hustling all over the restaurant checking on tables making sure everyone had what they needed. They missed a side off our order and I offered to pay for it and he refused. At another table someone asked how good something was on the menu he brought them out a sample! This doesn't happen in most places today or the level of customer service.  Then to top it off we meet this nice family while we are eating and they talk us into sampling their banana pudding desert. At first I was like no way I to full then my daughters almost refused to leave before trying so I gave in. This thing put me over the edge but wow was it good! similar to ice cream pudding only fills the cracks when your full...well worth trying or taking some home. This is a must when your in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch killed...
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of heaven gates maybe lol!

zKmGBt7MNWwQqg6jM0XWNQ.text: When you think BBQ what do you think of? Famous Daves? Lucilles? Memphis bbq? I was confused for many years thinking that these three were the best of Las Vegas in terms of BBQ, guys listen closely.  ROLLIN SMOKE, BEST BBQ IN VEGAS!!!  Location: Its funny when i tell people where this place is located since its in that desolate strip on highland near the Spearmint Rhino. Initially people are turned off, "you're taking me where?"  "Han take me back"  but once they have the food they go, "omg... Han pleaseeee take me back here"  Service: Service here is great.  They try their best to get the customers orders as fast as they can despite being busy during the peak hours of the day.  Another big plus about this place is that the chef will come out when he has time to ask his customers how the food is and a brief history of the restaurant.  Nothing like the person who makes the food to really care about what the customers think, bravo!  Food:  You really can't find anything bad to choose from but i'd avoid the brisket (a bit dry when i had it last time i was here)  Their famous outlaw burger is literally the size of your head.... like a mondo burger (good burger reference).  So juicy and literally will leave you so full, you won't be able to eat till tomorrow.  BBQ: BEEF RIBS!!! that is all.  Literally picked it up and the whole piece fell off.  St louis ribs are also very delicious and juicy.  Meat is so succulent and the juices that exude out of the meat is parallel to wringing a wet sponge.  I might just pass out from describing how good the ribs are.  Overall. Just go here!

OQQ5YUCR9vLdXlO1uztKAw.text: Saw these guys at the foodie fest and service sucked! I asked the guy if he had ribs and he says "I don't know I don't want to piss off the cook by asking".???? Wth is that? You have a customer (one that bought a rack of ribs no less) that didn't ask how much but do you have. And then we walked away with 3 containers of food and didn't have any bags??! So then we get to the end of the line and cups had no lids! The kid workin the end of the line had no clue what was going on and left the lid on the beans open so flies were swarming around. It's sad that I've wanted to try these guys for some time and this experience will sadly deter me back to Dickeys BBQ. Sorry. Some people will pay more for service and I'm one of those people.

zFDJ3Cy83UXO29P4llxJvw.text: THE BEST BBQ I've had yet in Vegas, and I am a BBQ SNOB!  I'd say go straight for the golden goose and get the beef rib.  It may seem pricey, it may seem like the quantity of beef ribs seem nominal, but these beasts are  HUGE, and you taste the love put into making them, I guarantee you!   Another complaint I have with most BBQ places is that they've just defaulted to doing a BBQ sauce so ridiculously sweet, you might as well just drown your ribs in maple syrup like it's a pancake.  But Rollin' Smoke specializes in my favorite--the vinegar-based savory sauce, which just launches this most tender of beef ribs into orbit on your tastebuds!

IHx55DOBTjAFXkZYGzeJ_A.text: This place has by far the best BBQ! The customer service was excellent and Mama was the best! Try the meat loaf!!!

5vPBv1foXQVKEuAG8UMUyg.text: Came here on a rainy friday afternoon with Doriee, at 1pm, hoping to run into the Travel Channel filming crew. We did, but apparently filming started at 11 instead of the posted time of noon (oh well). We met up with Roger, as well as invited one other friend.   Location, actually not as hard to find as i had thought. Though i had "scouted" the place a few days prior, still wasn't hard as some may have said. Coming from Fashion Show or Mel Tourne, taking a right onto industrial, then left at the light, then right again, and you are pretty much there !   Restaurant is a little small but lots of seating. Parking wise, decent amount. Unless there was some specific thing going, should be parking avail.   Upon entry, first thing you see is their huge menu on the wall. Since Doriee was on break and didn't want to eat too much, we decided to share. And being "marketed" the beef rib so much by Roger (steak on a stick is what he calls it), we opted to get the Rib Platter Special. Comes with one side and a drink. For the side, we got the corn nuggets ! Or rather Doriee "excitedly" shouted corn nuggets XD ! Since she was on her lunch break (1 hour time, but work was close by), we hoped it wouldn't take long. Upon ordering, we were told about 25 minutes.   Rib Platter Special - $17.99 - 3 Baby Back Ribs, 2 Spare Ribs, and 1 Beef Rib - Ordered with a side of Corn Nuggets.   To our surprise, it came in about 20 minutes or less. Good on timing !! :D  Pretty big platter. Was definitely a good sharing size between the two of us. Corn nuggets were piled on the side. To our surprise (again), the corn nuggets were pretty good. Corn gave it a nice sweetness and it was nice and crispy ! The sauce it comes with is like a mix between thousand island and like the sauce from Raising Canes. Sweet, little tangy.   Now the main entree. Ribs. The so-called "steak on a stick" was a beef rib that had a lot of meat on it, as well as a pretty thick layer of fat. The meat was not how i imagined it to be. Yes, as the restaurant name suggests, smokey, definitely a lot of smokey flavor (lasted the rest of the day lol!) but the meat broke off like it was stewed meat? I'm not sure if its because beef ribs weren't one of my favorite type of rib or its been too long since i had a beef rib but it was quite disappointing. Flavor was decent but meat texture wise, a little different. Both the baby back ribs and spare ribs were, yet again, smokey, but to our disappointment again, it was quite dry. Would have preferred it to be a little more seasoned/marinated to give it a nice flavor instead the meat but the dryness of the meat kind of made it saddening. Tried to help it with the bbq sauce on the table, but didn't really help.   The BBQ sauce was a very thin sauce, so if you were to put in on anything, it almost rolls right off. Flavor wise, sweet, tangy, spicy. Not bad but not my favorite either.   The following two items were ordered by Roger and another friend but im just putting what i SEE :P   The Outlaw Burger - $8.99 - Brisket, Onion, Bell Pepper, Onion Strings, Red Cabbage Slaw, Lettuce, Tomato, Cheddar Cheese, and Chipotle Aioli  HUGE burger. The burger is, i believed a confirmed 1lb patty with tons of stuff stacked on top. Roger tried to press it down to make it smaller to eat, but to no avail. That burger was DENSE ! Not too much of a burger person but looked pretty good ! Maybe could try, if it was split with someone half n half..   Brisket Dog - $8.99 - 1/4 Lb Beef Hot Dog, Brisket, Smothered in Cheese and Onion Strings  I didn't even notice the hot dog in it until after my friend bit into it. Similar to the burger, ingredient filled/stacked. I was actually surprised my friend ate it fairly cleanly without everything falling out and onto the plate.   Desserts !!!  Southern Peach Cobbler & Country Black Berry Cobber - sweet and flavorful. sauce was very thin and runny. kind of hard to eat (especially if you were sharing. would prefer the sauce to be a little thicker. still pretty good !   Mama's Banana Pudding - imagine a bread pudding but instead of bread, its vanilla wafers... with slices of banana and pudding. Yummy dessert :P   Reese's PB Cup Bread Pudding - soaking in a RUM sauce, the dense but flavorful bread pudding is like hell on a plate. bread pudding usually is already pretty flavorful from it absorbing the heavy cream but in this case, it is a PEANUT BUTTER CUP bread pudding... rich peanut butter taste with a nice rum sauce glaze on top. Prob my fav on the 4 desserts listed.   Overall. good place. though the ribs were a bit disappointing. Everything else was pretty good. Would like to try other things, like their brisket and such

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw Burger - brisket, onion, bell pepper, onion strings, red cabbage slaw, lettuce, tomato, Cheddar cheese, &amp; chipotle aioli
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib platter special - 3 baby backs, 2 spare ribs, and 1 beef rib

_HO_swdHoeaERIttm5A7yA.text: I love BBQ so when I was working behind this place last week I was in heaven  very fair prices for the food. Corn bread is delicious, all the food I tried hit the spot so don't hesitate go there now lol you will love it

lDKCAdapmiE2XStfrDhR8A.text: Service was super friendly and fast, but I am perplexed at the high average rating.    We got to try several items on the menu w/ the $25 AYCE deal and pretty much found everything to be just ok.  The pork and brisket were on the dry side and the ribs did not fall off the bone.  The meatloaf, onion strings and outlaw burger were tasty.  The best thing we had were the corn nuggets - fried creamy goodness!  Mac and cheese and loaded mash were ok.  Desserts had so much potential but didn't deliver.  Their sundae was ice cream with a little choco sauce on top, nothing else.  Banana pudding and peach cobbler were meh.  If you do go, don't have too high of expectations based on Yelp.

QCSyUZkS2APKIEd4KuEYCg.text: I was really looking forward to trying this spot, I had it in my bookmarks forever! But unfortunately my mind wasn't quite as blown as I had expected. Perhaps I didn't do enough yelp researching to make an educated order. I got the pulled pork and hotlinks with mac and cheese and the corn fritters. The pulled pork and corn fritters were really good, and I love there bbq sauce, but I really didn't care for the hot links or mac n cheese. I do want to go back and try some of the more recommended items.   To end on a high note, their customer service and hospitality was awesome! This place is kind of located in a sketchy area so I have to admit I was a little intimidated walking in for the first time, but everyone was super welcoming and friendly.

OX7TpKUoaeYSeU70HT1q8A.text: I have to say their BBQ is finger licking good. Hands down so far the best in town. I have also catered with them. The first time I catered they messed up my order. However, after speaking to the manager knowing I already picked up order and live 30minutes away, they did the right thing. They made things right. So keeping this short...food is so far been great and customer service has been great too. Gotta try if you haven't! Definitely, the place to go for BBQ!

r71a1R8uh2BkOJ3cHUXW8Q.text: The bbq spare ribs were the highlight for me. I tried the chicken, brisket, and pork and while they were decent, the ribs were fall off the bone moist deliciousness. I would come here again for the ribs alone.   There is a Parking lot outside the restaurant but there's a limited number of spots as the lunch crowd rolls in.

RMLOEpA2o-BtSqjoB0HbEw.text: if i tell you pure yumminess omg the bomb.com. i'll be back again real soon. I can just say i left the happiest woman coming from L.A. BBQ and not having any besides home cooked since 2007, i couldn't be happier. I would tell anyone to visit this place when and if you have a BBQ craving or want. I had the beef ribs, baby back ribs, the chicken, the hot links, mac n cheese, potato salad, and brisket and ill be back for it all!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ribs... Hot links... Burnt ends... Sorry I ate some before I could get the picture lol... Just pure BBQ yumminess!!!

0e_euIK5Y44I15AX3m8tdA.text: Burnt ends, get those. I sampled 4 sides (coleslaw, beans, mac n cheese, loaded mashed) and all were exceptional. Portions are generous, so price is worth it. Sweet tea was nostalgic. I can't properly eat BBQ without it. If you have even an appreciation for good BBQ, you should eat here. Even if you don't like BBQ, you should eat here.  I worked up an appetite shooting zombies at Adventure Combat Ops, the "pick two" was plenty to satiate.

ia4eWepcgul7hRZA8QpWvQ.text: Well this confirmed I should have rounded down instead of up after last time.  I think this place probably has its good days and not as good days.  Today was a down day and the 1st time was a better day.  I was at a 3.5 after the 1st time and gave it a 4, today it earned it's three.    Had the rib combo 3 baby back,  2 spare, 1 beef. The beef rib came out sauced,  I didn't expect that as it didn't last time.  I sent it back and asked for one without sauce. When I got the plate back it was the same rib with sauce rubbed off. This was highly irritating. Wonder what else was done to my food while it was sent back.  I don't dare to let my mind wonder that road.  I should have been served a new rib that had never been sauced.  Not one that was wiped off. Sigh, urg, I seem to be more upset about this the more I think about it. The beef rib was good this time not as good as the 1st time.  The baby backs were better than the spare but both were underdone as neither pulled away from the bone easy and were kinda tough, even though they had good flavor. Definitely not as good as the 1st time.   The 1st time I also had the brisket which was above average but not great.  Also had pulled pork that was pretty good.    All the meats here do have varying degrees of a Smokey taste,  as well varying degrees of smoke rings.  So they are cooking these meats with the right methods.    For sides I have enjoyed the corn nuggets and fritters both times, but I am not sure if these are not just prepackaged items instead of homemade.   Last but not least the desserts. I had the berry cobbler today.  I would definitely stay away from this item as it wasn't very good.  Ordering the peach cobbler and banana pudding seem like your safest and tastiest bets for dessert.   In summary if this was my 1st time it would be my last time. Still can't believe I didn't get a fresh rib instead they just wiped it off. If this would have been my 1st time they would have been 2 stars based just on that fact alone. Not sure if I will stop back in here or not.  On a good day they are the best in the area. (Really no good bbq in Vegas, so thats not saying much (though I have one that just popped on my radar that I need to try), ). On a bad day well it is just okay.   Your milage may vary.

Vt_AWuEPuk7CnR1TQgc9xQ.text: Was in the area, had some time to kill, so, decided to have an early lunch. Since early, was not busy, was able to order quickly and get my food fast. Friendly service.  Ordered the burnt ends. Nice flavor on the rub they used. Executed well. Really liked them. Sides, on the other hand, were dissapointing. The coleslaw was ok, expected something more, what with being advertised as chipotle. BBQ beans were a HUGE disappointment. Nice level of sweetness (not too), but the meat they put into it was pulverized, had a consistency of almost like ground beef. The beans came across as a poorly executed chili.  So, been here, done that. Not going to make a special visit in the future. If in the area again, will maybe try some other combination: maybe caught them on an off day.

y0w2S7hVrHASWFl6iB4LMA.text: It was good really good you have to get sauces for the ribs and service is good but you gotta get here early

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rzbYEsu-0P95wS1g1Rrkig.text: Had it last night, meat was very Delicious and the staff was very friendly..headed back again tonight for dinner!

l5OMiq0JLYyQH7La3fNTew.text: Great bbq spot near the Las Vegas strip!!!

o_KEOo_B3NWbMsGXfMQbYg.text: Probobly one of the best beef ribs I have ever had.  It's a bit of an up charge on a combo plate but WELL worth it!  Every piece of meat that left you the plate and entered my mouth was utterly amazing...so moist, juicy, tender, and flavorful.  I had the trio plate with brisket, beef rib, and spare ribs...along with the chipotle coleslaw, which also was quite good.  This place is legit!

g8YRgBOnsqum15D7jT-cYA.text: The food is excellent here. Very friendly staff, no matter how crowded it gets. Cristal took my order and she was super friendly. Best Barbecue in Vegas!!!

chehnK0Z9ljTWxUA9DJ0gA.text: Real southern bbq is hard to come by when you head west, but these guys deliver. The meat was a little bland but there was a wide variety of sauces, and we enjoyed trying all of them. The prices were a little high. It almost cost $30 for two people to eat lunch with two entrees, one side, and no drinks. I'd go back if I was back in Vegas and needing a taste of home.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g7PLNiylKqWwIO-KihXXnQ.text: Whenever we're craving ribs , this is our FAVORITE place to go. I've always loved coming here but today the girl at the register was so nice and helpful (her name is LIZELLE) made us feel so welcomed that we will only be coming to this location from now on in hopes that she always helps us Thank you LIZELLE for taking such great care of us !!

9DxFBS_2uGa9L60QxLpC2Q.text: Good bbq. Great menu and everything is good on it. Never had a bad meal or experience here. Would recommend.

YaXGIilEnQKbNz7RjRQhuA.text: Great authentic BBQ!   Good service and large portions.   As someone who smokes about 200 lbs. of pork/beef a year in my own custom smoker, this was a pleasant surprise during our visit to Las Vegas!  Thanks Christal!

r3m5wogTpOrVp9ka_sKbyw.text: This place is good but not to good.  The brisket was good but not tender enough, I had to put sauce on which is a no no.  Everything was very good just not Texas good.  They did have an awesome pig head

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-fGIkhu7eFUsszqS6PfIUw.text: Who knew I could find good BBQ in Las Vegas? Yelpers. That's who. When you first walk in, the atmosphere is basic and unassuming. Great for consuming BBQ. We shared the "Biggin" sandwich which has pulled pork, chopped brisket, and a hot link on it with a side of mac and cheese. The sandwich was very good, but the hot link was very spicy so be prepared for that. The mac and cheese was meh. We also shared a rib tip platter with bacon potato salad. This was good also. Overall, I would return but need to try more options before giving 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib tips platter with bacon potato salad
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Biggin&#34; sandwich with pulled pork, chopped brisket, and a hot link

Kl6XD3GQBjKkr-_-EjBvRQ.text: One of my favorite places in Vegas to eat.  The burnt ends are killer!  This place never disappoints.  The only downside is that it gets packed quickly so plan accordingly.  Still giving them 5 stars because the food is always delicious and the staff is friendly.

Ju5jIRPO1c3YE4WAbwABFw.text: First time in. Justina very helpful explaining the menu options. We got the Chicken Salad, Hot Link and Brisket. All amazing!

wUqM3eo33eH7AYe736xS7A.text: In Vegas for 4th of July and definitely had to have some BBQ.  Yelped BBQ spots and ran across Rollin Smoke and I tell you they did not disappoint.  I ordered the Duo and hade the brisket, 2 ribs with loaded mashed potatoes and collard greens.   The ribs were tender and smoked to perfection.  The brisket was delicious and very tender.  The loaded mashed potatoes were yummy and the collard greens were a pleasant surprise.  I don't like most people's collard greens and I have to say they were the best I have ever had at a restaurant.  They had a smokey flavor from the brisket that they were cooked with.   I will definitely stop by again on our next trip.

6dJ34hbfXiXuPWEiV8z7OQ.text: I stopped here while visiting from out of state. I ordered The Biggin and it exceeded my expectations. Being someone that makes my own bbq I always look for a smoker, if there's no smoker then it's liquid smoke and that's not good bbq.  This place is legit and seriously one of the best bbq places I've been to. I'd come to Vegas just for this. It's easy to get to by taking the bus & a short walk.  The sauces range from Country Girl (Mustard based), Sweet, Carolina Vinegar, & Arkansauce. The meat didn't need any sauce, but I tried all 4 on fries and they are top notch.

GTl14YAPHc4zterqCXJazw.text: Hands down the best BBQ you will find in Las Vegas. It's tucked away in a seedy part of town but thats the classic markings of a great food spot. I usually get their combo plate with brisket, chicken, and their fried okra. If I'm feeling ambitious I'll get some mac and cheese on the side too. I love their different options for BBQ sauce and how the meat tastes so good by itself that you only need the smallest amount to amp it up a bit. They also offer an all you can eat, but I can barely make it through a combo platter so I don't think I'll ever order it. However, if you have a big appetite I would highly recommend the AYCE.

qzXOy1N04yOFq-ga-sV47A.text: I was watching some guy in a business suit bathing his food in BBQ sauce and was thinking "you're putting a little bit too much of that sauce there buddy". It wasn't until my food came out and I had a bite without the sauce that I understood exactly why I should do the same as the business suit guy. Their barbecue sauce is really good. I wish I could bathe in that sauce. Not really that would be gross but you understand the sentiment. 5 stars for that sauce.  They have $7.99 or $8.99 deals and even offer all you can eat barbecue. I ordered the $7.99 trio sliders and got chicken, brisket, and pork. It was so tasty. Presentation is aesthetically pleasing meaning the food is good looking. I do mind that the meat was colder than usual at room temperature or even a little colder. Food should come out piping hot so that once the customer decides to dig in, the food will still be extremely warm and fresh. 3 stars for the food.  The people working there are super cool. We were asked how our food was tasting too many times by 3 different workers. 5 stars for the service.  Setup of the restaurant is weird. The ordering counter is inside one of the dining rooms so the line wraps around the dining tables so if you sit on those dining tables it'd be awkward. There's a connecting room with dining tables and me and my 2 friends avoided sitting on those dining tables by the line so that we sat at a table meant for 2. 2 on the bench and 1 on the chair, 2 shared one end of the table. There are outdoor dining in the front but no one wants to sit in the 100 degree Las Vegas summer weather. It wasn't until we were about to leave that I saw a separate dining table accessible from the outdoor dining on the left side of the restaurant. There could be signs inside the main dining area pointing out that there's that other separate dining room.. Or maybe I'm just oblivious? 2 stars for the restaurant setup.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio sliders
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WXoe9nTOfnpc7jV5ksbNzA.text: Rollin Smoke Barbeque is the epitome of what a BBQ joint should be. My roommate and I came here to satisfy our BBQ fix, and were actually really impressed.   When we first arrived, it was busy and no one was at the counter for a while. However, the wait was well worth it because Rollin Smoke Barbeque beats out all the chain BBQ places in Vegas.  Inside, there are two dining rooms with one of the rooms being where you order. The rooms fill up quickly when it's busy so if you want to dine-in, try finding a seat first. There are also a few wooden picnic tables outside for outdoor seating.  As for the food, I ordered the trio choice plate with a side of fried okra and an a la carte order of cornbread.  The trio choice plate was your pick of 3 meats (out of: brisket, pork, 1/4 chicken, 2 spare ribs, or a hot link). Everything about my order was on point. The pork was soft and succulent, with a tenderness that made it practically melt in your mouth. The brisket was probably the highlight of the trio platter. Whenever I go to BBQ places, they usually end up burning some of the brisket, but it was perfect here. Savor these tender cuts of meat because it's THAT good. As for the chicken, it was a little on the pink side, but the parts I did eat had a smokey BBQ flavor. (Don't be afraid to literally drench your food in the BBQ sauce they have on the table!) The fried okra were little bite-sized pieces of heaven. The cornbread wasn't dry like most places; it had a good texture with the classic, sweet cornbread taste.  The parking lot to this place is on the small side and it can get awkward getting into if you're not alert, but who would've thought that this little treasure would be in the midst of all the plumbing and electrical buildings nearby.   Rollin Smoke is a meatlover's dream. If you want BBQ done right, you should definitely go here.

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. close-up.

l2rUYWbXcLdjd9bYH_Nk3A.text: Loved it!! We had the outlaw burger which was excellent and the smoked meatloaf which was great. Surprised that the meatloaf was spicy but good. Definitely coming back.

QQtqx9ebNu7gfLdKBTJfQA.text: We came from LA and came across this place on Yelp because my husband loves BBQ. In my honest opinion it was ok I think I was expecting way more because of the reviews I read. It wasn't busy at all the day we went the employees here were great the food just wasn't what I was expected. This was my opinion which might not be yours so stop by and be your own judge.

W-jV1g3AuiwkOZdrO9wtdA.text: Love this place!! One of the best bbq spots in town, & it's such a hidden gem. If you're visiting town it's definitely a spot you need to stop by! It's not too far from the strip.

qQCUCssUgX-BaDQ3EwI4Xg.text: I've been to Rollin Smoke Barbeque several times and it has always been AWESOME BBQ!  I went there today after walking 2 miles in 99 heat and arrived about 1:30pm.  I ordered my usual of RIB SAMPLER PLATER with the EXTRA BEEF RIB for the extra $6.00.  The Rib Sampler comes with 3 Spare Ribs, 3 Small Baby Back Ribs, and 1 Beef Rib (plus the extra Beef Rib), a slice of white bread, 2 pickle chips and 1 side.  I got their Bacon Potato Salad. My review:  It wasn't their best, maybe it was because I got there post lunch rush.  The pork ribs were well past done.  They were FALL OFF THE BONE.  Ok, folks, even though FALL OFF THE BONE is touted as it being the "BEST", in Barbecue Judging Circles, FALL OFF THE BONE means it is OVERDONE.  When you take a bite, there should be some bite and the meat should come off with just a little resistance and should not leave a clean shiny bone behind.  If you take a bite and the whole bone slips out it is overdone.  But my score 0-9 on the ribs today 6.  The Beef ribs, they on the other hand were overdone to the point that there were portions that were dry and tough and again, they even put them in the tray in pieces because they fell apart.  Not, so good, score: 4. I thought the potato salad was one of my favorites, but this time, for my liking it had too much mustard, the potatoes were a little firm and the sauce was watery and staring to separate.   Now for my biggest complaint, seems that there is a trend in BBQ places that they are making the sauces real thin.  I'm not sure if they are cutting corners and costs and putting more water in the sauce to stretch it out, but when you put it on your rib and it runs off like water, it isn't a good thing.  Again, maybe this was just a one off for this visit, I'll try it again, mainly to try the BEEF RIB as not all places have them.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The RIb Sampler platter with the optional 1 extra Beef Rib and Potato Salad.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One Bite and it all came off the bone... Overdone, but again, that is to be expected in a commercial place sometimes.

xH1iPVzzIb3qxZVWyg3jew.text: First off, The food here was extremely dry with no bbq sauce AT ALL! And on the notes section I had provided specific instructions and still no attention to detail. What's the point of even requesting anything in the notes section since they don't even care or do what you ask? Waste of time and energy. And it's not cheap. Every order is between $50-$80. More than a normal plate at Lucille's BBQ. If only this place would get better management and employees that pay attention to detail, I wouldn't mind paying the high prices for this dry meat provided I get a side of bbq sauce. This is just saddening that the employees and management don't care. Last time I'll be ordering from here.

bYSJyK86A_3skYwTLbtl7w.text: Thank you Justina for the service!! We love this place and will definitely bring friends here whenever we are in LV! My friend enjoys the all you can eat. Thanks for recommending the "Burnt Ends" its the best thing I've ever had.

bAV_Bt2koTCsdacaZ_5-9w.text: One of my favorite BBQ spot in town. The meats are tender and full of flavor. No sauce needed. The portions are great. Employee very friendly. I'm really impressed, 5 stars without any doubt :)

kzWVdCPGym3cGyUF4WMLnQ.text: My boyfriend had been wanting to try this place since last year when he was in Vegas with his friends, but it didn't happen till recently when we were there for a little getaway. I don't eat pork because I am allergic, but he said it was delicious   I tried their chicken and the meat was very tender and well cooked. From the sides we tried the corn tots which were yummy  sweet and crispy, the chili beans were good too but they had too much pepper corn and you could taste it, and corn bread was very soft and buttery it almost dissolved in your mouth . Overall I'd give it a 4.5. The could make the beans with less peppercorn to my personal taste. But we will definitely return when we come back to Vegas!

l1OJ-IIu0MqBtKBioJtG5g.text: Reasoning for the 4 star is that we truly have a favorite in New Orleans! This place was good, although I cannot say it was great. I got the ribs and brisket (sliced)as well as we ordered the beans, coleslaw, corn fritters and yams as sides to have a good sampling. Although they were all good they were far from great. There was plenty of seating and it's off the beating path from the strip approx 20 minute walk. After all I would not miss an opportunity to come here if your in town. At least you can try it for yourself.
