bdoKu1JAmhLJ2fZphhknhQ.text: going to splurge or cheat your diet??? rollin smoke barbeque is the best place to do it and be satisfying and guilt free...service is great! staff is very helpful and have a wonderful ability to suggest and pair food with choice of spirit,wine,beer.. can always count on the steaks omg to be perfectly cooked to prefrence and succulently juicy! every chance my family and i get we treat ourselves to a special dinner at rollin smoke barbeque.. my husband and son smash their mouth watering desserts mainly the homemade cheesecake.. to die for!! literally!! go on you know you want to go try it.. go ahead you will not regret!!

ilINYZlzu5eYLce9ebqhbg.text: They unquestionably have some of the best BBQ I've ever had. So, if that's all you care about, read no further.   However, on Wednesday I ordered a five meat platter for my wife & I for our thanksgiving, along with a half chicken. The total was around $45.  I was asked if I wanted some sauce with my order...  Well, yeah, of course I do: 'I'll take a little of each," I said.   Not only did RS charge me extra for the three sauces, they were half full. I was able to use them on my pulled pork & chopped brisket. However, my chicken, hot links & ribs went without -- essentially wasted.  Now, not only did RS charge me for sauce without telling me, NONE of the three small containers were complimentary. They gave me zero sauce on a $45 order. An order I intended to use for my Thanksgiving meal. That's a 1/4 chicken, a 1/2 chicken, pulled pork, brisket, and hot links with zero sauce included.   Unfortunately, with no sauce, I scrapped those plans and went to Bachanal at Caesars.  I have one issue and one issue only with RS: they do not seem to genuinely care about their customers. They do great business, they are always busy and they clearly take that for granted. Their prices are already astronomically high, but to not include sauce (and when you do, you charge without telling, and still come up short) is just bad business. It goes beyond just being 'cheap'; it's a slap in the face.  Rollin Smoke is certainly making money. They've raised their prices by at least 15% in two years . Yet, they're too cheap, or they care too little, to complete their meals.   It's unfortunate because it doesn't need to be so difficult. Sometimes, it's the little things that make all the difference.   EDIT: 4/29/17 -- still haven't been back. I was at the Great American Foodie Fest at Sunset Station last night & just shook my head walking by the RS stand.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauces were half full. Only able to use on pork &amp; brisket, other meats were left dry. Charged me for three small sauces despite $40

sqITKRTCjJ26ltr55nnclg.text: Yeah. I love it.  Why?   Good food, good prices and they have one of the gnarliest burgers I have ever seen.  Additionally, the food tastes excellent too.  The burger is little excessive on the onion strings but I'll take it anyway.  It's definitely bursting with flavor.  So this place has been on my radar ever since I saw the pictures of the Outlaw Burger.  Since I love burgers, I had to make it here when I was in the area.  Luckily, I finally had that chance.  So with no hesitation, I walked in, stepped up to the counter and proudly, enthusiastically and anxiously as hell, ordered the Outlaw Burger...with a side of loaded mashed potatoes and cornbread.  After only a few minutes (maybe 10 at the most but probably considerably less) the server delivered my order.  The Outlaw Burger is a monster!  The thing is probably about a foot tall, mostly onion strings but the actual meat and cheese portion of the burger is delicious.  The only downside is that halfway through the thing was falling apart and I pretty much had to eat it like a salad.  I'm not going to complain though because the thing was delicious.  The loaded mashed potatoes were a worthy addition to the meal and really hit the spot.  The sweet cornbread wasn't too bad but I probably would have ordered the corn nuggets or whatever they were called next time given the amount and since I've had sweeter, tastier cornbread before from my local grocer (in Rollin' Smoke's defense, I've yet to find better cornbread outside this particular grocer).  Service was good, the food arrived quickly and it hit the spot for sure.  For an off the beaten path little BBQ joint, this place has it going on.  I'm already thinking about eating here again, the only thing keeping me is a few hundred miles...at least for now.    I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw Burger and a side of Loaded Mashed Potatoes.  I&#39;m a fan.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They call this Outlaw a burger but it&#39;s really in a class of its own.

xEmwafXCfsD0BUs4fQLoqA.text: If you're in town and want as close as you can get Texas style True Smoked BBQ, come here.  I travel to Vegas for work from Fort Worth, TX and always enjoy stopping by for a bite to eat and enjoy a little of home while here.

ssWV-t0wGfNZz-K_v4_c2Q.text: I was on my way to Shake Shack (Nelson Q. of Las Vegas put it in my head) when I asked Tim C. of LA,  "Shake Shack" or "White Castle"? He texted back,  "Neither. .."  At the same time, William of LA messaged that he hadn't had a chance to go to Rolling Smoke Barbeque...ah...how to decide?   Shall I explore for William?  Why not?   My GPS took me down some road that I have never heard of or been on. It seemed like I was in an industrial area.  I saw a sign with the name of the restaurant clumped up with other businesses. I pulled in the driveway. There were two police cars already parked there.  I messaged William about the location. He said there are strip clubs in the area.  "Thanks!", I messaged back.  A little worried, I walked in anyway.   The place was about half full and I stood in line to order. The cashier, Dave, was very friendly and helpful. I decided to get the Platter which had 3 baby back ribs, 2 St. Louis spare ribs, and one beef rib.  Then I had to select a side dish. I figured that I knew what Mac and cheese was about, so I got the Corn Nuggets.  Yes, I didn't know what that was either. ..  Dave said that it's Sweet Corn,  breaded, and deep fried. Intriguing!  Let's try it!  Then, Dave give me a cup. I asked if this meal came with a free drink because I noticed that the drinks are $3 with refills.  No... I got a complimentary beverage!  Yay! Thanks Dave!  The soda dispenser is self service! !  I guess I was supposed to sit down and have the meal brought to me.  The other room had a table occupied by police officers. I sat in the corner, under the television. Another option was outside seating, but it was dark and cold. I left my jacket in the car, prepared to battle some ribs. ..  The Beef Rib was on the top. I couldn't stop eating it. The moist meat fell off the bone. It was like smokey, soft, stew meat. The charred "koge" fat layer on the top was scrumptious! I wanted to give equal attention to the baby back ribs and the St. Louis spare ribs, but I couldn't let go of that Beef Rib. It was that good!  Later, I realized that I ate everything without sauce. There were containers on the counter, but I was so mesmerized that I stayed in my seat. I got up for a soda refill and a take out container & package which are self service along with utensils.  I wasn't able to finish everything in one sitting,  so I brought it to my hotel room and had a perfect midnight snack! The only thing that might turn some customers off would be a cockroach. I saw one crawling across the wall at the entrance of the restaurant. However, I'm not going to let this get in my way of a BBQ meal.  I would go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Souvenir cup...free refills!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Platter Special: 3 baby back ribs, 2 St. Louis spare ribs, and a Beef rib. Side of Corn Nuggets
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

xexmXr8b_tInugUTtlQnzw.text: Sad to say that this place has gone "corporate" and this is no longer a must go destination when in Vegas.  I get it, as this is a business and we all need to make your money but...  Gone is the mom and pop feel and the prices have increased accordingly and no longer a screaming bargain.  Some examples: they charge $3 for drinks, I could barely finish my meal before but now can so quite comfortably (but still is filling), I was never asked how my food was and when ordering, I was not given any suggestions or descriptions on their menu choices.  Ordered the meat trio $17.99:  Baby back ribs are not no longer fall off the bone and a bit dry.  The BBQ chicken is soft and tender but the smoky flavor and seasoning didn't sink into the meat.  The beef brisket is still pretty good but was chopped too much.  If you don't mind driving and for really good BBQ for dirt cheap prices, I suggest John Mull's in North Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio combo for $17.99

RgqeSBpfAEbNzHxPOLpTJQ.text: I've had Rollin Smoke on my bookmarks for over two years. Finally got to roll on over! Had to roll myself out, too.  We had the pulled piggy sandwich plate and the brisket three ways. We had the mac n cheese and the corn nuggets for our sides. The food was FANTASTIC. -Pulled piggy sandwich was perfectly smoky and had comparably less fat to other establishments I've been to that have served pulled pork sandwiches. -Chopped brisket: juicy due to being a bit fattier than my preference, but served like it's supposed to -Burnt ends: my personal favorite Sliced brisket: perfectly tender and ready to pull apart -Corn nuggets: YES PLEASE. I'd eat these all day long if calories didn't count.  Two things I would change about Rollin Smoke if I could: the location (super small parking lot) and the seating arrangements. Unfortunately we came on a really cold day and the seating area is rather sparse. This resulted in the doors opening and closing a lot, so our food got cold pretty quickly.  Verdict: I do NOT plan on waiting another two years to return, so you shouldn't either.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eER-Xn4CKBAEODxA9d1nzw.text: We were looking for a BBQ restaurant close to us. We dropped in and are so glad we did. We got a mixed meat platter with 3 delicious sides. All of the meats were so tender and tasty, the sauces were delicious and just added to the flavor. We had some really tasty potato salad, and the best fried okra! We ordered some peach cobbler, warm with s scoop of ice cream and it was delicious too! This was the best BBQ we've had in a very long time! Who knew you could find authentic Southern BBQ in Las Vegas!

mZriplBQev0In7KNEvwXmg.text: This was my first time ordering. The delivery was very fast and the young lady was as pleasant as apple pie. When I took my first bite I became a pig. I couldn't stop!!! When I called I sensed REAL down home Southern hospitality. The price is right also. What else can I say? YUM YUM! This will be my regular place to eat. Thank you.

FnYy5igF4p7_8CNYOs566A.text: This place is off the charts! Highly recommend a stop here-no matter how long the drive. Loved it so much-bought an extra Slav of ribs to gnaw on during football Sunday. Best part-no mess and not stuck in front of the Q all day!

N8LtGw_asyg4VbTxTsM3VQ.text: I saw this place on tv so I had some time on a Tuesday afternoon while I was in town for work! Holy crap... Awesome! Small homey location! The service is great... Everyone is super friendly the food came out fast and they didn't run out of anything! Sooo good ! I will definitely be coming back with friends in tow next time! I love it ... I never really think of Arkansas as BBQ state but damn is it good ! I loved all the meat particularly the baby back ribs and brisket but I found myself using the meat as a vessel to all their awesome BBQ sauces to my mouth lol! All of them were good !

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot cobbler... Cold ice cream !! Yes!

eEx-LkTdUie7kg2HIMyaSQ.text: This is by far the best BBQ ever!  We all had something different and everything was outstanding.  Tough decision but I got the meatloaf that was on the travel channel. Amazing!!  My son had the three meats and everything was amazing.   Super friendly staff. Oh, the macaroni and cheese was the best I ever had.  I told them I will be waiting anxiously when they open one in Chicago.    Don't mind the location or the ambience. Just great BBQ!  I made my son bring this home for me On the plane. They pkg to go!!!

JsgI-F1z1pZ1pOBU1apq3A.text: I hate this place!!!! It's the best BBQ in town and I can't stay away! It's almost life changing. The brisket burnt ends are a must have, so delicious. I love the spicy BBQ sauce and the sweet Carolina girl. Really good sauces and really good meat. The corn nuggets are amazing, like creamed corn that's been deep fried. The Chipotle coleslaw is ok, not amazing but not bad. You can't go wrong with this place that's all I know.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket 3 ways with corn nugs and coleslaw.

owwVs8jhmiabKNLIsfnwBA.text: My brush with fame in Sin City continues.  I dined---more accurately, binged---here where that famous guy who reviews diners, drive-in's, and dives dined.  Guy Fieri?  No.  Rod U. ("DA MAN!").  I liked the spare ribs best in "The Pit Special"---a carnivore's love fest of brisket, pulled pork, a 1/4 chicken, spare ribs, and hot links + 3 sides for $27.99.  Expensive, but not too bad if you split it with someone or even a couple of someone's.  With "Loaded Mash", collard greens, and chipotle coleslaw as our sides, my fellow field researcher and I ate our fill and still had quite a bit of leftover's.  That monster could easily feed 3 hungry hombre's.  Or my wife and daughter for a week.  I'd go again.  I just love me some good 'que now and again.  I'd be a bit more discreet in ordering though.  I think I could be satisfied with just the "Outlaw" burger or a half rack of the "St. Louis Spare Ribs".  I don't need the extra calories anymore.  That AYCE "Anything On The Menu  Any Day, Any Time" is now $34.99.  For others, the feeding frenzy continues.

F_m6JUz43l4HIZiIHjnMuw.text: Location: located off the strip and in a very shady area. Very hard to find even w/ GPS.  Ambiance: typical smokehouse feel  Service: the cashier was friendly, not a lot of service, it's like a fast food/ take out.   Went at 2:30pm on a Wednesday, there were still walk-in traffic but no line.  Food: order the platter of Brisket/ Chicken/ Pull Pork/ Sausage/ Rib and 2 sides of Mac n Cheese and Corn Nuggets w/ Sweet Tea.  Chicken was very moist and juicy w/ a hint of smoke. very good. Pull Pork was also very good Sausage goes well w/ the bread they serve, also very good. Rib: wasn't try, right amount of sweet but didn't like the raw green onion they sprinkle on top. they can take that out for all i care, but it was also very delicious. Brisket: totally chopped up and shredded into pull pork sizes. very peppery and flavorful but never had brisket like that before...  Both sides were solid and very good.   For the price, all that for $30 was reasonable for me as it was shared and we had plenty of leftovers.  Was very good for restaurant quality BBQ. Would def. come back and will crave whenever I'm in town.

A_r_xvGqnaPRW-8LEvfvLQ.text: The only Sushi burrito place I've been to worth going to. I'll stop every time I'm in vegas.

aJy22aZvI5S3cBNq2TDUUg.text: This is the REAL deal! Being from Kansas, I know a few things about BBQ. So do these fine folks from Arkansas. This is the best Q I've found in Vegas, without qualification. Do yourself a favor and just GO and taste what REAL BBQ tastes like. The burnt ends, brisket and pulled pork are all spectacular! Beans, yummy! The sausage is just fantastic! You might have to wait in line, but it's totally worth it.

3YnPJkk2wIRFDPsmXNZ0Eg.text: First time here and I loved it!! Everything was delicious. They serve you so much, you will for sure get full. I recommend you go on an empty stomach lol Best BBQ in Las Vegas hands down.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pit Special

3PJVoZtTpwLSXfzwBevSYw.text: First time here. Big fan of "real" BBQ. Asked the worker what she recommended, she told me the meatloaf sandwich. Im at a BBQ establishment not a subway or mcdonalds. I ended up ordering the brisket and ribs with a couple of sides. Mac n cheese was good, but both meats were dry as hell. I regret not ordering the damn sandwich. Horrible bbq. Never going here again.

L1vEic4ya4T-0o0DziHmLA.text: First time in Vegas!!! I'm a big BBQ fan too so I was looking for a spot. Came to Rollin Smoke BBQ And was shocked lol. They got some amazing BBQ in Las Vegas! Who'da thought? Justina suggested the Mac and Cheese and she was spot on! That shit was so damn good lol.

Rfu8E7qx5Vv8FHPtiqfdpg.text: I wanted to like this place. Came very highly recommended, but fell very short! I think I'm being generous with 3 stars. Would not recommend or go back.   More details coming, but Barbie's review is dead on. Bland, not tender. Owner or dude in front was nice. Employee was last with a simple question.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WpmimbI0u0-0edchHOTpAA.text: Really had much higher expectations after reading reviews. Maybe one of better BBQ in Vegas, but certainly not outside of Vegas.

79a6IBQaWitVTa2r6S-dXg.text: Best southern bq I've had out of the south. Great sauces . The staff were very friendly & welcoming .we ordered ,brisket pulled pork, hot links & ribs. All very tasty. We also ordered cornbread banana pudding .so tasty we took more to go! Only dish we didn't care for was the coleslaw . We didn't like the flavour . This is not the type of place that you dress up for or make reservations . It's very casual

eJTlHXqUju-FW11-7zl16Q.text: Wow the best BBQ ever. This is the place to go when you are very hungry. I actually shared the 5 meats plate and it was more than enough. It came with hot links, chicken, pork ribs, pulled pork, and brisket. The sides we got were corn nuggets, corn bread, and chipotle slaw. Everything is amazing especially the corn nuggets. I personally liked the mama sauce on my pulled pork. Great food and definitely coming back when in Vegas again.

ZXcyI8agQ_m_MctF7fpwKQ.text: AMAZING!!! We tried the chicken sandwich which was all chicken breast and deliciously moist! With corn nuggets....WOW!! A must try!!  The pork spareribs were also very good. Great smoky flavor and super tender as well. Variety of sauces available so we tried several. The green beans were garlicky as well as peppered. Next time we're trying the mac n cheese tho. Mamas banana bread pudding was also very good however we were so full were taking it home to hopefully enjoy later. The cashier was really nice and the inside was much bigger than it looks from the outside. Overall a great experience and we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork spareribs and green beans
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich and corn nuggets

EPRuMiUguoSStJ2SM5jUOA.text: When I'm craving barbecue, Rollin Smoke is the place to go! We've met friends here and taken our out of town guests here. They even give locals a 10% discount which is a plus in my book. There is an overflow area to provide additional seating which is almost always being utilized due to how busy they usually are. We try to order something new every time we come, but we always order the Burnt Ends, and the creamed corn nuggets. The reason for only giving them 4 stars is because they don't offer fresh brewed Iced Tea. They have the fountain type that tastes terrible. Just my opinion, but I just feel like a barbecue restaurant should take the additional steps to brew the iced tea in house.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt ends, loaded mashed potatoes and corn nuggets

qiGxK_OOmqPfYQelXQ9QiA.text: WOW! This place is amazing! I've been to vegas so many times wo even knowing about this place! SO glad I was introduced bc it is seriously one of the BEST bbq I've ever had in my life! Such a RANDOM location, but the definition of a whole in the wall restaurant. Tried the pulled pork sliders, waffle fries & baby back ribs...YUM! The bbq sauce has SUCH flavor & the meat tastes so smoky & DELICIOUS! Do yourself a favor & eat here!  Will be visiting EVERY time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork sliders, waffle fries &amp; baby back ribs

txdR-F_UPdUOs6Pcnd53iQ.text: This is the place to eat when you're in Vegas! The BBQ is bomb and the service is great! Sophia the cashier was so nice. The food is five stars but her customer service puts this place way beyond 5 stars!

GMno72hRlmPGGEBgQDKLHg.text: My husband & I were in Vegas for work. On TV was the Food Network and they were talking about this place. They showed their special meatloaf and once I saw it, I knew we had to try it. I get tired of the same places on the strip so we wanted to go outside the box. When we drive up I was super excited because it looked kinda dumpy. To me, if it gets good reviews but looks like a hole in the wall, it HAS to be good! When we got there the guy taking our order was super nice and helpful. I ordered the meatloaf and my husband had the "All you can eat" for $34.99. The meatloaf was unbelievably delicious. Everything we tried was yummy. Since then, every time we go to Vegas we make a stop there. We also tell all our friends to go and they agree that the food is awesome!

P2P59vFpysPWkPOkVMtGMw.text: Food was just ok chicken was undercooked bbq sauce was thin and to spicy I will not be be returning

5xSuygX8s9p0CGBOuinjJA.text: We went for our first time for lunch on a busy Friday afternoon. I had the brisket sandwich and my boyfriend and the three meat meal with three sides. Everything was amazing. The corn nuggets were my favorite side and all the meat was cooked to perfection.  The reason for the 4 stars was that it took quite some time to get our food. I know they were busy but it took about 45 minutes after we ordered to get our food. I am sure we will be back.

KncJ_ucvq49MR8txRfO7fA.text: Great food, fast service, Fantastic, friendly and happy, people working here. Small place but I think that's what makes it the best. You go in order and pay for your food, and find a seat and they call your name and bring it to your table. This place is highly recommended by me as a first timer. I say to the owner of this business the food is great but the staff make the experience amazing. O yea, the chef was a very nice guy.

a3_bv7gMldFkPOwN5UVb_g.text: A pleasant surprise upon accidentally running into this unassuming BBQ joint. These two brothers from Razorback country deliver a unique BBQ style. This is not Texas BBQ. This is a unique style found in these young business owner's local spin of ribs, chicken and even their signature Mac n Cheese. Although a bit removed from the Strip , this Chop Shop is rollin' right along to a bright future with their very low overhead and loyal following.

7RUiN2uznFoto9X4L6e-zg.text: My sweetie took me here after discovering it on his own a year ago. Loved it. My favorites were the chicken and the ribs. Greens tasty too. Big portions with a roll of paper towels on each table.

v6h5XJ0tSASI_U6Vg5CYTQ.text: Awesome BBQ! The best meal in Vegas thus far! Excellent sides like the bacon potato salad, beans and collard greens!

fj5TCOxrFwNUiZjkzj4rlg.text: Rollen smoke was worth the drive. We had a party of 11 and all were satisfied.  The prices were great. The food really good. My ribs so tender and tasty. The chicken moist and flavorful.  Tritip great!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

687RzkuAPMKHiG0uiBjK6w.text: Best BBQ ever! Yum! Better than anything we have in San Luis County in Cali!!! Kids loved the cornbread and the coleslaw was perfect chipotle spicy! Ribs were amazing, piggy was fabulous and brisket was tender and perfect! Loved the variety of BBQ sauces - Arkansas was my favorite!

mnZbVJMyM-8FpGvdPB_PaQ.text: Updating on the baby back ribs which we didn't try last time. Based on baby back ribs we've had most other places, these were not from baby piggies. These ribs come in at close to 3 pounds per rack! (two of us shared a rack and it was plenty... and we have big appetites) They are from huge HAWGS and are tender, delicious, loaded with meat, and did not have much residual fat. They are cooked nearly perfectly to a slight dryness. Use their BBQ sauce if you like. I had forgotten how much I enjoyed their sauce... one of the best ever.  Next visit will be for their Brisket Dog and the Outlaw Burger. If you didn't read my first review, let me say again that the Bacon Potato Salad and Corn Nuggets are also very good.

HqQQemViNv3BReNlkfSFkA.text: All I can say is ditto to all the other 5 star reviews. Went for the bar b que only, had my own sides at home. Wow! Ribs tender, moist, smoky heaven. Chicken, well, wish I could have this everyday and twice on Sundays Next time am getting something else, not sure what, but from what I saw others eating I don't think I will be disappointed with anything.  My only complaint is that I couldn't find the street address listed on their website. It may have been that I was trying to read in the car, but actual street address or "turn on this street to get here " , I just couldn't find it. The little Google map helped, but we still got a little turned around. Hey, I'm old, it happens.   Just...go there, eat, be happy!

jtMiwxL4BAXVokwyltrnNA.text: This food rocks, the best barbecue I've EVER had. Service was really nice, they were totally swamped, line up out the door. Fast service, line moves quickly.

xI-iWDb-Q2IiAVon1J19iw.text: Perfect BBQ!  Great local color and amazing food. Their sauce was great.  The chicken was great and the burger was world class, piled with crispy onion rings to a height is around 6-7".

8TXqYg5QICnzPQdqUMIzYw.text: Very disappointed.  I dont know who is so impressed with their BBQ or the place.  These 5 star people must be smoking crack or dont know good BBQ.  I was SHOCKED at all the great reviews.  Is someone buying the Yelp reviews here?  Its seems insane they have so many 5 stars from people who claim to have traveled to good BBQ?  - BBQ was a little dry, seasoning ok.  2 out of 5 if you've had great BBQ and traveled the world. - WAAAAYYYYYYY over priced for portions and quality.  Did I mention WAY over priced.  $33 for a lousy small helping of ribs.   - Outlaw Burger?  Should be outlawed.  Horribly tiny and meat is awful.  Tastes like they put filler all in it of some time.  So gross meat I spit out one bite.  I dont know where that big burger they have on the Yelp photos is but thats not.  Bait and switch you ask me. - Only one BBQ sauce on the table - and liquidy weak. - We had 3 ketchup bottles completely empty.  Very old employee came round and just shrugged when we complained like "owell." - Fake pretentious BBQ poise with a couple lame pickles and bad white bread ends. - No air in main eatery, side eatery for parties has air.  Who wants to eat in a muggy bbq joint in Vegas. - Bathroom, borderline poor.  The toilet seat had been pulled off so I guess if you where a woman or someone you just had to squat. - Super loud inside so noisy you cant talk or hear yourself think. - To top it off in a real dumpy part of town with crappy parking.  - Really comes off as some tourist trap judging by the price vs. quality.  Albeit the people where nice.

nJd-c2qu3h2SWPXqy44Y6Q.text: Awesome food, best barbecue in town hands down, with that it can be a little wait because of the line of people they have but hey thats a good sign. Love this place.

7TDRtt3bCZB8-SHvjCiqsw.text: Ate lunch here during my stay in Vegas and was the best meal of my 9 day trip.  Little whole in the wall but delicious and reasonably priced food.  Authentic barbeque.  Packed to the rafters as the food is so fantastic it is understandably busy.  LOVED IT!!!  If I'm ever back in Vegas I will be back!!!

tyQDduK0wq1AXkQ44bwGkg.text: Just had some really excellent BBQ here, the brisket was so tender and flavorful and the beef rib was enormous. Also had the hot link, which was good but not anything special and same with the mac and cheese but the greens were very tasty. This place gets high marks and I would definitely come back.

Tzj19G2os6g3KskVwTXKTA.text: I want to love it because its local and close to home.  Been three times and never thought anything was wonderful.  Their baked sweet potato was watery and mushy.  They shouldn't steam them in plastic wrap.

_XceDio8hNQ1P_8em61YhQ.text: I found the Dirty Rice to be flavorful but dry and crumbly. Beef ribs were dry, fatty and over charred. Used to be good but now wondering if their primary concern is customer or currency.

3cMM5B8iAmd0ETs7ZXhZ8Q.text: Simply the best!!!  I have had a lot off the menu and have not been disappointed. Anyone and everyone that I know is craving BBQ, I bring them here! Oh and my kids love their stickers!

3ECqq0ZjU37K5zq75e78kg.text: I haven't had BBQ this good in years.  We did take out and set the food on the counter to start serving up. We never got to the table! We were all surrounding the kitchen island chowing down.  Yum Yum.  The beans are to die for. They must put in the brisket scraps into it, I was pulling chunks of meat out of them, along with the tasty brisket fat.

RhRzo0uPDru1xwtol7Y3Dw.text: AMAZING BBQ!  I know they've expanded and have a couple locations now, but this is a great gem on Highland, just off the Strip.  Phenomenal food.

Vcf2eUYuJG6RfBUr8PGgBg.text: We ordered the Rib platter. It came with baby backs, spareribs and one beef rib. We added a hotlink and Mac n Cheese. The pork ribs are the best we had in Vegas so far. The beef rib was not as tasty but tender. Mac n Cheese was standard. The hotlink was sliced up and not whole which I've never had like that before. It was so dried up and not edible. The bbq sauce was a bit runny but it all depends on your taste. Staff was friendly and I do recommend coming here for their pork ribs!

50e1LjiOg1JXenObUiBHaw.text: Good BBQ! If you're visiting and like BBQ, you need to stop here! The meat is done to perfection! Tender, juicy, never dry. The BBQ sauce.... well so many to choose from! This place is a little pricy! However, it's worth it.

CGDWfnjwj6GJmhao-NGUWA.text: Out of towners looking for bbq hit the jackpot!  Fun atmosphere, friendly service, and delicious food - fresh, flavorful and plenty of it!!  The sauces are amazing, like nothing weve had before!!  We'll definitely be back the next time were in LV!!

N3l_nWUgCgUAKwk-nZtmMQ.text: in town for a few nights and staying at a friend's house about 20 mins from the strip. Was looking for some food for me and a friend and all there was in the neighborhood was pizzarias/Italian food or Asian inspired food of some kind. Stumbled across this place on Yelp and thought, this could be a good idea! About 10 minutes away and tucked inside a run down smaller plaza building, the line was to the door. Two people working the cash registers, but once we sat down our food took less than 5 minutes to arrive to our table. This place is LEGIT. Sadly, they were all out of brisket, so I ended up getting the pork, but I was NOT disappointed. The Arkansas BBQ Sauce was killer. Real smoky with a little spice too. I would definitely come here again and again!

V6_SVAFWLDtm63CV813Ugg.text: Heard about Rollin Smoke on one of the news stations, so when in the area we decided to try it.  It was not too bad, enjoyed the sauces.  The chicken was dry and the brisket was excellent.  We enjoyed the sides very much, had Okra for the first time and it was very tasty.  I do feel the sides were a bit pricey, but all bbq seems to be over priced.

EZ7jY1p4yqajeL_IWCFaug.text: I had the AYCE and was glad I did! The pulled pork, brisket, and baby back ribs!!!! Mac and Cheese, yams, and collard greens so damn good!!!! I'm originally from the southeast region of the US where BBQ is a staple. This is a great place to eat if you are in Vegas and want a good meal. The staff were friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s Dam Good!

wivbyObtls5MYr9bzvZ2WA.text: Don't judge this place by its location!!! This little hole in the wall place is AMAZING!!! The fried corn and burnt ends are a MUST! We try to make it a point to visit here every time we are in Vegas!! Whenever someone tells us they are going to Vegas we tell them they MUST try this place!!!

RBJaH69OrslWyKY7RDzSbw.text: Hmph. So I had quite a disappointing experience here, so I'm giving a lower star.   Here's what I had:    Out law burger- 5 star.  Meat is juicy and flavor is so rich and yummy. Share one with someone.    The pit Special (4 meats and 3 sides for $20) - brisket, pulled pork, 2 spare ribs, and since the hot links were out i subbed it with baby back ribs for extra cost.    Brisket was SOOOOOOOOO good. It was shredded up and looks just like the pulled pork to the point that my bf and I were trying to figure out which was which from our photo.  I didn't like the pulled pork (lacked flavor and was dry) and the spare ribs were okay.      Sides:  Hush puppies (meh), Corn nuggests (THE DEALIO IS HERE), and kickin beans (yes!)    My bf thought this place was so legit, we went back 2 days later. I asked at the front where you order SHOWING the photo of my original Pit Special plate and asked him which meat was brisket and which one was pulled pork. We wanted to get it right, because one was substantially better tasting than the other. And, it was confusing, since they looked exactly the same shredded up together. He told me that the one that I had liked was brisket.    SO, I order the brisket.  What do I get?  Sliced meat. It didn't look like anything from the photo i had shown or what I had eaten 2 days prior.  Not only did it look different, but It wasn't as juicy and didn't have the same texture.    I found out from the server that the brisket comes in two styles (shredded or sliced). It would have been nice for the guy that took the order to specify it for me if that's the case.  AND, I don't know how he can get it wrong after seeing a photo.     Not to mention, I ordered corn nuggets (cuz that's why i came back 2 days later) and when the server arrived at our table with our food, that was when I found out that they were out of corn nuggets. I had paid additional money for this side. So, I ask this guy how long it'll take to make them (because I was willing to wait for it) and the waiter told me "several days."      My friend went there 2 hours later, and told me there were plenty corn nuggets. WTH dude. I woulda seriously waited 2 hours for my corn nuggets. Or come back in 2 hours for it. But I was told several days, and I was leaving the next day.     When you're a vegas native and can access a restaurant any day, probably these things don't matter. But, when you're a visitor, a foodie, and you pick a restaurant out of all the choices available, it's disappointing when you don't get what you ordered.     Next time I go, I shall ask for SHREDDED BRISKET. It's SHREDDED BRISKET versus a BRISKET, y'all!

k0Z5glr83wl8ByJvjSKHgw.text: We pickup parts next door to Rollin Smoke BBQ so this is a very convient place for us to eat. They also have sweet tea which helps on a hot summer day. Try the chicken sandwich with Mac n cheese. It cannot be beat

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QZofIxpkx4D0cut-KFzdbQ.text: Wow wow wow this is amazing they use a lot of pepper in the cooking the brisket has this amazing pepper crust and so do the ribs. We have tried a lot of BBQ places and they may nail the BBQ but they always fail on he sides..... This place nails the sides and the BBQ recommend this place to anyone going to Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Husband loved the rib tips
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket mmmmmm
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing sides

E7KtIab2FyLX4CBJSrXN8Q.text: We had to make a stop at this place since it had such excellent reviews. We weren't disappointed at all!! I'm very picky about BBQ since I can usually make it just as good at home. My husband had the beef ribs which were very meaty and delicious, I had the loaded baked potato with brisket which was equally delightful. The only complaint I had was that my husband asked 2 different employees for different sauces so he could try them and was left hanging, he finally got up and got them for himself. Overall though very good food and would return when I'm back in Vegas!

A2-9tc3eTk84GeeE3hbDSg.text: The food is AMAZING! Portions are huge! Highly recommend! The corn nuggets are a must. We had a party of six people and no one was disappointed.

bq5yt7x1RkzCGzintDMFTA.text: I WENT HOG WILD!!!! Tim the Chef OMG he cooks the best greens ever. These people are so kind and the place is so clean. I had the best time eating catfish & greens. I did taste my husband's dish he had pull pork. I also took pictures of the food and Chef Tim also posed for my profile picture. I give them ten stars I think this is the best BBQ in Vegas thus far. I will return ASAP.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana pudding its box made not home made :(
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pull pork
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greens

FRlyF9XuFbHchYzu8SE1Hg.text: Chewy rib tips as they call em, dry chicken, corn bread is almost like a cake batter from a box where is the corn meal? Lol ummm coleslaw has a Hispanic twist to it not good mix for BBQ.... won't return oh yams had like watered down brown sugar and were canned? Lol weirdest BBQ place.... have had far better! Just another Vegas place you see on tv built up for nada.... we had asked for banana pudding but didn't get it checked receipt and it wasn't on there maybe they saved us a few dollars on another bad item the only item that was ok was something we never heard of or had before imagine that um corn nuggets? Lol

_jtzh9qIAQFagiJo5dKWVg.text: Went back a few weeks ago since my relatives had seen it on TV and wanted to try it out.  So I took them there.  First, the taste of the BBQ has really improved since our first trip.  This time it was nicely smoked with just the right amount of spice and flavor.  Meats well done and cooked well.  I wasn't that fond of the pulled pork, which seemed too salty but the other meats, ribs, beef and links were A OK.  But, this time the food was cold.  Not freezer cold, but it tasted like it had been sitting out on the counter way too long and was medium to medium minus warm.    If they could get the quality improved this place would rock in my view, but until then, I'll stay away until someone else I know wants to head over to Rolling Smoke.

FGvIM8Cr_dgQxpEjJ_XDJw.text: *Thumbs up* If you're craving for moderately-priced BBQ in and around the Strip, then Rollin Smoke should do the trick. It's a hole-in-the-wall, underneath the highway, tucked in a tiny strip mall near Spearmint Rhino -- uh, yeah so you should have no trouble finding the place.   I had the 2-item combo, with the brisket and spare ribs. I also ordered an extra beef short rib. The only thing memorable was that giant beef rib. Tender, juicy, succulent and slightly sweet meat that came cleanly off the bone.  *Thumbs down* The brisket was slightly dry, and the spare ribs were bland. It desperately needed some of their house made BBQ sauce, which is super peppery.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tangy and very peppery BBQ sauce. Lots of coarsely ground black pepper that look huge.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2-item combo, brisket and spare ribs, side of bacon potato salad. Beef short rib was the best thing.

VP3rvoSCQtzivUVvW8VtjA.text: Amazing bbq! We have eaten some good bbq and this place it at the top of our list. The hostess was great with our kids and very attentive. We definitely will be coming back when we pass through vegas.

Ml2tc6ESmDQqkg1AsgASng.text: This place is the best I've found out here in Las Vegas. Ive alway love going to Famous Daves, but once we found this place we haven't been back, ( i couldn't even remember the name of the place we used to go to, i had to ask m wife) We ALWAYS come here now. One liner i give it from a movie, "It'll make you slap yo mama."

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PPibEEgD4HCsPdbCL4iYCg.text: This is THE BEST BBQ I have ever had. They are a fantastic client of mine through ADP and I was delighted to help them while they opened their new location! It has been fantastic getting to know the owners. Don't miss out on the amazing food they offer. Check out their new location off of South Grand Canyon! YUMMM

voaC9fdACbGrOeJjv1eXJA.text: Thank you to all the Yelpers who gave this place a good review!  We went on the weekend and it was Great! Great food, great specials and most importantly Greatfriendly customer service! We are most def coming back here the next time we are in Vegas!!!

m73COJ4z08PodKrjnlJItg.text: Let me just say two words "Corn Nuggets". Darn tasty and I'm sure good or you since they are deep fried nuggets of cream corn heaven. This is my maybe 10th time here. My favorite is the pork and the hot links plus the corn nuggets of course. The service is always fast and friendly. The place is always CLEAN and I've never had a bad or even a mediocre meal here yet. Interesting neighborhood but well worth the trip for the food.

CeR2IuzaqYeLD1BG538hOw.text: The food was 5 stars. I'm docking  2 stars for the rude useless lady working the counter. She was tatooed everywhere and is probably somewhat racist. I walked up the counter and heres how the converation went.  Me: how much food is the half pound of brisket, is it enough for one person? lady: its a half pound me: ohh..okay. not sure what the difference is between sliced brisket vs chopped brisket, is it (gets cut off) lady: one is sliced, one is chopped  at this point, i figured shes only going to regurgitate any questions because they may be too complex for her, she wasn't very friendly, crappy customer service, didnt smile, reminded me of the elementary cafeteria lunch lady  of course then i see white patrons walking in and shes very enthusiastic and smiley with alll of them and actually answering their questions  (i'm an asian male)  the younger girl walking around was really nice and checked in to see how we were doing, the older cashier lady shouldn't be here.

pl5dp3w0R9zDLsCjWQJfuQ.text: My son is a sophomore at UNLV and suggested going to Rollin Smoke the next time we were in town and having read in the Las Vegas Review Journal they had been crowned the best BBQ in Vegas was enough to convince me to try it. I was not disappointed at all. I shared the five meat platter with my son. Chicken, smoked polish sausage, brisket, pork rib, pulled pork, and three sides for $27. The greens were beyond passable for being from the south.  I left full and it didn't dent my wallet like many places in Las Vegas can. The topper is the service though. David took my order and got each of our names and shook all of our hands.  Southern Soul Food and hospitality all wrapped into one. A must eat in Las Vegas just don't expect the neon and glitz. The food is the show.

z9YZVKSrpu507wcalMsSlg.text: Everytime I come here, I'm treated well and this time was no exception. The food comes out hot and taste so good, consistently there food comes out tasting great! And now that they have upgraded their resturant! If you haven't been here you are doing something wrong with your life!

PmMuam1y5v2yNDSvEdjJpQ.text: Best BBQ in Vegas. Best prices for BBQ I've seen. Best damn BBQ I've ever had. The workers are really awesome too. Split a 3 meat plate with a beautiful girl (just buy an extra coke) and you'll both be full and content and hopefully you get laid because she owes you now.

0G5tLHQE1KyNiU75QK3Pfw.text: Loved this place....was welcomed and the food was AMAZING! !  My favorite was the meatloaf!

Qgr5OsbRgHgM2ZnPvxkFfQ.text: Completely shorted us on the Food!!! We decided to order Rollin Smoke BBQ for our holiday Christmas party. We ordered the BBQ sandwich pack, as illustrated on the website we were suppose to receive 1 pound of brisket, 1 pound of pork, and 1 pound of hot links. As a concierge service at one of the hotels on the strip we have access to a scale. So when we opened the box and it did not look like enough to feed 10-12 people we weighed the box. 1 pound in total for the weight of meat. When we tried to contact them no one answered and when we returned to store front we were greeted by Big Mike who did not care at all. We have frequently recommended customers to this business during NFR or when a guest is craving bbq. These recommendations will stop.

-Gs75-4xR2bE8Bfmjpmiiw.text: I had a chance to stop by this, coming off the Strip. I just thought it was OK only because I have had so much better. The hot links and brisket were good. The spareribs had some kind of weird greasy coating on them. I couldn't figure out what it was but it was like a layer of butter but I think it was just fat. The macaroni wasn't bad and at least was cheesy. I didn't care for the person who took my order. Since it was my first time, I didn't order fast enough. So while she was waiting (and it wasn't that long), she annoyingly was tapping her fingers loud enough as a hint to me to hurry up. I almost was going to tell her to stop tapping her fingers. I don't see myself going back there.

CfCxCJxIICmEyPvsgbg0_A.text: Best BBQ in Vegas hands down coming from a Texas boy. worth the drive to the seedy part of town. the smoked meat will make you forget about where you are. GO HAWGS!!!!!

2y_dbj6eJj0JAVOrh3N58A.text: I had the pulled piggy and it was very dry. It did go down better with dipped bbq sauce. My brother had the huge outlaw burger and the meat came out perfectly juicy. Pricing was very good, you get a lot of food for the price. Three stars for the hit and miss based on my experience.

687V4dndEpeUkS67ATM0cA.text: Got The Pit Special for the two of us to share. More than enough for the two of us and a bunch of meat leftover. Brisket was my favorite. He liked the pork ribs. Ordered corn nuggets on the side...so delicious! We would definitely come back.

n5N3G_UhiCI4w328vx70iw.text: Great food super delicious, got the buffet only thing i didn't really like was mac ncheese but everything else was super good. Wanted to go back but they close on Sunday's

6W6SDNXq3RpvBBLYHtXk1g.text: Came here with the wife and a buddy in town from England.  He was craving BBQ since you can't get anything good over the pond.  I had the brisket and it was pretty good.  The greens were excellent and so were the mashed potatoes were also good.  Wife had pulled pork and said it was better than any other place in town (except mine).  She enjoyed the good bark on it.  Buddy had a four meat platter and loved all of it.  The quarter chicken had really good flavor.  The BBQ sauce on the table was just so so.  Would rather come here than Dave's or Memphis BBQ.

WqI5lirGCn53mE00-txAvw.text: Tasty BBQ and sides, reasonable prices. seems like honest home cookin'. Would like a little more heat, but won't dock them for it.

S4xmLfGjOEgk-GWTtATTGA.text: Was so so chopped brisket sandwich very fatty. Too much money for amount of food.  Wouldn't recommend

hjDbCB9Xm4_FGQAWr2g2xA.text: Very good barbecue place. I had the outlaw burger and it is one of my top three burgers I have ever had! Have recommended this place to the numerous friends visiting Vegas!

Gdo1tF3EPaDCeoL6NAjdSA.text: Have been here numerous times and tried most of the menu. Brisket is my bf's favorite!  I usually get the pulled piggy sandwich. This place is so delicious. Plus it's a small business so love helping support locals versus big chain resteraunts. You have to try this place or you're missing out.

6d0jT3vAf6SFdMA6Za0hiA.text: Great food!!  Laid back atmosphere awesome service ! Will def go back and will recommend to locals and visitors !

mhSOfVb5YuvUQNm1uEmU4A.text: WE WILL BE BACK- so much on the menu to try.  Between the three of us we had a good variety and everyone was happy, happy, happy.  Little bit of a wait to get the food, but the tables outside were a perfect place to catch up with an old friend while we waited.

CndCey1yJ_EjlBW7UwJ6gw.text: This BBQ joint is defiantly a legit spot that needs to be checked out. I came here with 3 other people and we ordered 3 plates for 4 of us to share and it was plenty. We even had to box almost half of it Togo. Hands down the best thing was the corn nuggets.  Everything was cooked perfectly and they had a sauce table for you to choose which types of BBQ sauces you wanted to drown your food in. I honestly liked every single sauce they had.

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AydxOsYsMdDMVTVAxpkS1g.text: Without GPS you'll have difficulty finding this hole in the wall---because it's in an industrial area set back in a small strip mall industrial site....but with a very big parking lot for all you bbq fans.....plenty of seating inside for the hot Las Vegas summer dining season, as well as picnic benches outside, in front of the store.......  Order combination plates with sides, order smoked meats a la carte, as well as all types of sandwich combinations and their gut busting meatloaf and burgers  ....it is bewildering trying to order because you're hungry and there are sooooo.. ....many mouth-watering choices, eh?  We ordered the Pit Special (5 meat combo and three sides) for the two of us to share....And it was all good....the brisket sliced thick with a touch of smoked fat and crusty pepper-smoky bark...yum...heaven....those two big spareribs smoked to perfection, tender, smoky juicy, fatty pieces smoked and rendered into caramelized candy.......and sausage served sliced and not hidden by some gloppy sweet n sour bbq sauce---next time I'll order a sausage sandwich.........  ....And hiding under the bbq spareribs......the treasure-----a mound of pulled pork in all its smoky goodness--dipped in bbq sauce, you eat it, followed by a spoonful of potato salad (spicy delicious) and their unique bbq beans--yum to that, of course......delicious corn bread --next time I'll bring a quart of ice cold milk and order three big slices of cornbread to eat.....And yes there was a bbq chicken thigh and drumstick....it was good, but chicken is chicken to me and not real bbq---but I ate all of it except for half the chicken thigh--I was too gut busting full  ...it missed the fifth star for only one reason NO country Texas-Arkansas-Louisiana "rock" music  playing in the background---ESPN TV Sports doesn't rock me; especially with no ice cold beer  available....next time I'll order a couple of big combo takeaways---i'm only 25 minutes from Rollin Smoke.... .....and cold, very cold beer   and a few select guests will be waiting for me and the bbq!!!

xe3ObV9jt7EbKBisXFNzAQ.text: Great authentic bbq..must go and try if you haven't...good food and friendly staff...only bad part is it's far from where I live

Fhkz8syP7A5pIMhbd6SXWA.text: My family and i ordered dinner on Postmates last night. We had the Pit Special with 5 meats, it was delicious! Man, i haven't had ribs that good in a looooong time. I was sitting next to my mom when i took the first bite, she said "Please don't slap me..." LOL! All the meats were good. For sides we had collard greens, bacon potato salad and corn nuggets. Also an extra side of fried okra, everything was seasoned well. You definitely got yourself a new customer!

S8ZchL8Tu10lP7AmX60EHQ.text: Must stop if your in Las Vegas. I would definitely come by every time I'm Vegas. I ordered Outlaw Burger and Corn Nuggets and it was so amazing especially corn nuggets. Outlaw was the biggest burger I had in my life and it was delicious. My friends ordered ribs and chickens...and they loved it.

9vTZT7JvP6mAqlfELj6YFw.text: Best brisket in town  Best burnt ends in town  Hands down  What else can I say? On another note  The line gets long, the parking is limited, food takes about 20 mins, But who cares ! It's well worth the wait

sfc1mWmYgav3sh5lZ7DC3Q.text: I consider myself a foodie, not just because I like to eat food and visit hunger satisfying restaurants, but also because I like to watch food television shows.  One television show on The Travel Channel is called Food Paradise, which featured the Best BBQ in America.  Rollin Smoke Barbeque in Las Vegas was one of the top ten restaurants featured on Food Paradise and I can personally attest that it lived up to its billing.  4.5 stars all day.  Rollin Smoke is located in an industrial part of Las Vegas not too far from the Strip and with the Trump Hotel overlooking this barbeque star of a restaurant.  There's really nothing else on the corner where Rollin Smoke sits except the restaurant itself.  Even having a late lunch/early dinner around 3:30pm didn't mean we escaped the popularity of this restaurant.  The parking is limited, so be prepared to park on the street or anywhere you can to get your mouth on this delicious BBQ.  Due to its popularity, it's great that Rollin Smoke can accommodate a good sized crowd.  It's a little confusing to figure where to start your order, but you'll have to stand in line, place your order, and then take your seat on the many picnic benched spread throughout three seating areas.  Rollin Smoke is owned by a family from Arkansas, which was obvious with many homages to the Arkansas Razorbacks throughout the decor complete with a Razorback hog head.  You can easily see that Rollin Smoke is award winning with trophies and framed positive reviews about the BBQ here.  I deducted half a star because it took some time for us to get our food, but it's also understandable because of the amount of people who flock to this BBQ mecca.  I ordered the Trio Choice Smoking Plate, which comes with your choice of three meats, a side, and a slice of bread.  I chose the brisket, 2 spare ribs, hot links, and a side of collard greens with brisket.  Everything was finger licking good.  Loved the spare ribs and hot links.  They were cooked right, hearty, and the meat was scrumptious.  I wanted more than the 2 ribs I got with my plate.  Make sure to try all of the sauces they have to douse your meat.  My fave two sauces were the spicy and House Arkansauce.  Their collard greens with brisket were the best I've ever eaten.  The greens were tender, juicy, and with the brisket, just pushed it over the top.  Last, but not least, Rollin Smoke's sweet tea was really good.  You don't have to be a foodie or watch food television shows to appreciate the outstanding BBQ Rollin Smoke has to offer.  If you love delicious food and want to leave a restaurant satisfied, then Rollin Smoke is a must eat, must visit location.

FK9NVJhHzaguGaEDIvvr-w.text: Back behind all the lights and noise of the Vegas Strip is the Arkansas BBQ Rollin Smoke BBQ hole in the wall restaurant. It can get crowded, there's only about 15 tables and no reservations. But food is worth coming here for. Lizelle gave us the locals discount. Staff is super friendly. I had the 3 meat platter- brisket, ribs, ribs so delicious, tender and melt in your mouth- add your favorite BBQ sauce- I love the Arkansas sauce. This will definitely not be our last visit. They opened a 2nd location up by Summerlin but this is where it all started.

69caznMbX70fHPLLhk-hiQ.text: This place is accurately rated at 4.5 stars.  Gave these guys a try when my family and I were staying at the Trump.  It was close by and we wanted something to take out after spending 5 hours in the car driving from LA.  I have to say that I'm pretty finicky about BBQ because my wife is from Texas and I have sampled most of the best of the best there.  Rollin Smoke does well to hold it's own.  We ordered a pit special so we could try a little bit of everything.  All the meats were fantastic, although I preferred my brisket sliced as opposed to chopped.  The sides were pretty good and I did enjoy a drizzle of the spicy bbq sauce with each bite of meat.    Best of all, I thought that there prices were pretty reasonable for what you got.  I think we spent about $40 for three people and we had leftovers.  I would definitely eat here again on another trip.

C18sgNIrorAPpJnRcRwaKw.text: My fiance and I used Rollin Smoke for catering our wedding reception (11/2017). We had a very unconventional reception venue (Battlefield Las Vegas) but were very impressed with the presentation and food quality they were able to deliver. Everything was delicious and we were excited to have leftovers! It's hard to pick a favorite side dish but I'm partial to the corn nuggets! The BBQ also pleased the meat-lovers in our group. Even talking to the catering organizer prior to the event was such a relief. She made planning easy and was always very pleasant on the phone addressing any of our needs. I should give myself one star since I fail to remember the catering organizer and server's name. They were both excellent and we are grateful with having both their help in making our casual reception go smoothly. Thank you!

6FLeXFvJcLkvXHURdjtdAQ.text: This is my #1 spot for BBQ. I really like the sauces they provide. I ordered the pit special with 5 meats, and substituting chicken with beef ribs. The chopped meat one was dry-that's probably the brisket. The rest was moist. My fav is the beef ribs. The sides are good. For those who tried Phil's BBQ in San Diego and didnt like it, give this place a try.

ua7TvDeJZxiEK5idn9NxaQ.text: Holy smokes that's good stuff. You don't even need a knife for the brisket.  Christal took good care of us at the register and the orders were out pretty fast. They also have a very clean dining room that doesn't seem super smoky so you won't smell smoky all day. Reminds me of the great BBQ I used to get when I lived in TX. Great job.

tMiXcrIlSdkbANTBwBIKPg.text: Some of the best bbq I have ever had and I am from the south. Burnt ends, brisket burger, awesome. To stuffed to try dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the best bbq ever. Beef brisket literally falls apart, burnt end are delish and the hamburger/brisket sandwich is to die for.

vBMc0OjvD4IytlM2kZFJHw.text: Sooooooo delicious!! We ordered the trio with burnt ends ($3 upcharge), hot links, and ribs. The burnt ends was definitely my favorite, the hot links really does have a nice spicy kick to it, and the ribs were falling-off-the bone tender.   For our side, we ordered the corn nuggets. MUST TRY!! Will not regret!   Will definite come back to this place when in Vegas again!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot links, ribs, burnt ends, and corn nuggets. YUMMMMMS!

FkK5UOkZ-FEGRZ_KiPT7WQ.text: This place is bomb. Brisket 3 ways was killer. Excellent sauces. Even if you're a purist. I didn't get full, I got tired and eventually couldn't put anymore food into my mouth. I got emotional driving away while playing it all back in my mind how tender that brisket was.   Definitely on my short list when I come in town for conventions.

vVYFPFc4YXpHnnshgAc4pQ.text: The best BBQ  in the city hands-down!  Other barbecue restaurants try to keep up but they always fall short from not having burnt ends to not having cornbread or something as simple as not having fresh brewed homemade sweet tea. They try to cut corners by having generic fountain sweet tea. And that's why Rollin Smoke is always in the lead when it comes to barbecue in Las Vegas. The must try here are the Burnt Ends they are delicious. Second I would recommend the ribs and third would be the brisket. If you like spicy then try the Hot Link. Everything on the menu is good so be sure to try a few different things. I give this place five stars and

0U395_QWbTvoja1Zj7wXTg.text: customer service was good. the food was good. the sauce was excellent!       upon entry, the place was packed! Two outta of three off their dining areas were maxed out! immediately we assumed this was gonna be worth the wait! I noticed on the menu the a la carte by the pound option! Ithis indicated the place provided and was willing to provide any menu option substitute!        The pulled pork is juicy, tender and savory! Will return  for a pound of other meats!        The sauce is delicious! And bottles of it are available to take home!

vd_P1vlI2ykdSFrc8aE6Jw.text: Our first time here and I couldn't be anymore satisfied by the food and awesome service. Kanoa was our server who was good at what she does. Told her it was our first time and she quickly offered us a menu which I like as a part of customer service. We came a perfect time to order because it got busy which is always a great thing & seeing that got me more excited as to knowing something(s) is good here and I wasn't wrong. We both ordered the Duo choice of 2 meats. Brisket and Spare Ribs which was amazingly good. Make sure to get the sweet country girl sauce for you meats, especially the Brisket. Will defiant be back and totally recommend this place for bbq meats. Thank you again!!!

48bcEhhFprI7pugPNhhpHw.text: This place has pretty damn good food. I can't express how much the food has so much flavor and I love all the options they have. Let's start with the fact they have all the their drinks outside. They even have Sweet Tea, which is dangerous, because it's all you can drink every visit! Yup I am number one fan of sweet tea...  I like the fact that the menu is pretty easy to understand, but with all the yummy options I alway struggle on what to order, and when I finally decide what I want I usually always want something else. The good thing is when you go in a group or your family, you can sample everyone else's platter or sandwich!  So it's alway a win win win! This particular visit I got the Pull Pork, and it was amazing, I love how moist and soft the texture was.  I definitely love the sauces you can Squeeze on them to amplify the flavor. But the thing I LOVE the most about coming to this restaurant is the customer service, everyone is so sweet and helpful.  The last visit an associate by the name of Antonio, was super helpful and nice. I love the fact that he went out of his way to make sure everything was okay for me and my family, even when my son was having a moment because his food was touching the meat, Antonio went out of his way to grab him some Mac and cheese on the side without even asking us if that would help the situation, Antonio definitely made our visit a pleasant one!  High Five to Antonio for going out of his way to make me and my family's visit an awesome one!  We will definitely be back again and hopefully Antonio will be there to help make our experience awesome again!   Due to the moment my son was having I didn't have time to take pictures, but I will definitely be back again, and I will grab some shots of how amazing the food looks

J8otnIsK4q1fTY9_diX6Hw.text: Not entirely sure what Arkansas-style BBQ is actually, but it does taste pretty damn good. Best items: pork, brisket, chicken. Ribs were a little tough in my opinion...wondering if it should be falling off the bone? Anyways, everything was very tasty and well-done. Favorite sides were the beans and slaw.  Looks like people just park on the street underneath the overpass when the parking lot fills up.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pit special?

tm6cUWSA4BM8zddok_2q0Q.text: Very, very good BBQ for an affordable price. We ordered the 5 meat platter which was more than enough for 2 people. Subbed chicken for burnt ends, which were fantastic. The corn nuggets were great as a side without feeling too heavy. Value-wise, I was more than satisfied as BBQ can typically get pretty expensive. Definitely planning to come back next time we're in Vegas.

zEZTlB5v87eYJ9Ttb8bDDQ.text: Tried this place based on their reviews. Although not a total loss, I must be a bit harsher than the other raters on yelp apparently.   The Good-  I love that this place is in a small little strip mall that is off the strip. Its Decorated nicely. I didn't catch the ladies name that took our order but her customer service was top notch! The prices for the food were where they should be with the exception of desert. Their BBQ sauce is to die for. The portions were good sized also. The sweat tea was on point.   The Bad-   We ordered burnt ends. Our expectation was that they would be somewhat burnt. They weren't. The first order was pretty fatty and not really burnt at all. We sent them back. What came back was a tad bit better. Ultimately they were just too fatty. I know that you will get fat with burnt ends but typically it is balanced by the burnt more chewy part of the meat. Unfortunately they didn't meet our expectation. We ordered a side of loaded mashed potatoes to go along with the meal. I feel like they were instant with a possible potato mashed up in them. They weren't terrible but they certainly weren't great. The only other comment I have is that she should find another place for the drink station and condiment stand. It is in the main room that also houses the checkout which makes it very congested when trying to get something to drink, utensils, or leaving the restaurant.   Over all I gave it 3 stars which I thought was fair. I would give it a whirl once more time but would try some other meat entree.

JA1QEZLQdtyYXLgGL86owA.text: This is my favorite local bbq spot. Great food fair prices and friendly staff. I really enjoy the summerlin spot for lunch at least 2 times a week.

OjLs9lQ52R0xWLwkZvgFuA.text: WHEN IN VEGAS, EAT AT ROLLIN SMOKE!.   Holly cow this has to be the best damn MEATLOAF I have eaten at a BBQ place. Its called the SMOKED MEAT LOAF  it has ground pork and beef and I believe smoked brisket. It sits on a bed of mashed potatoes and topped with fried onions.   Its was a perfect combination of flavors on every bite. You had chunks of different type of meats with the creaminess of the mash and the saltiness of the onions. I also got the mac and cheese(YUM!)  As for the BBQ, it being two boys from ARKANSA that opened up the place the bbq isn't your typical thick sauce type. It's more of a  RUNNY consistency FULL of flavor.   The drinks are self serve and so are the sauces TRY THEM ALL!.   Customer service. GREAT. I don't rate on CS but do provide it in order for you to know what you're getting yourself into.  CAN'T WAIT TO VISIT MY SISTER TO GO BACK AND TRY SOMETHING ELSE IN THE MENU.

l8H9loDd52f6W9spoAMXQw.text: Rolling smoke bbq had to be one of the best spots I've eaten at since I've been on Keto. I recommend trying the collard greens with brisket and the rib tips

A162E4bCdZUYNeaeHzra0g.text: Why are you so good to me RSB? That was phenomenal food. I may need to move to LV now. Back to Seattle I go :( baked beans, green beans, brisket and ribs are my recommendations

JK3EllnwAcX-F1IAWUpJgw.text: The cornbread is beyond delicious!! Ribs are to die for! Absolutely delicious, the food was out very fast and very fresh! Highly recommend checking this place out of your visiting Vegas you won't be disappointed! Sincerely your neighborhood thottie

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AuZt33ph0Pd-LtDCcdVZvg.text: Ooooh my goodness this is the best BBQ I have ever had. When you first get out of the car you nose is accosted with this amazing smoker scent, I was already mouth watering before we got inside.   The menu has a lot going on but Lizelle was awesome in helping me to narrow down between my various choices. I ended up getting the trio with pulled pork, ribs and burnt ends. The burnt ends are an upgrade but they are very clear to tell you that when you order and they were definitely worth it. You know the BBQ is good when you don't even need the sauce cause the meat has so much flavor and is so juicy on it's own. Big big big big fan.   Went for a drink as well and it came in a souvenir cup so that was a nice surprise.   The cornbread is almost like sheet cake and it is so damn good, the mac and cheese is cheesy goodness and I can't wait to bring my Mac and Cheese loving man back to try it.  Ended the meal with banana pudding and well I am already planning my trip back.   I mean when we walked out the door and smelled the smoker again and it still smelled appetizing that's a good sign.   My leftovers reheated really nicely as well!   I love this place and cannot stop talking about it.

04gJb3lgnMXDkieY5G0w3g.text: Yep, it's that good. I did the all you can eat and told them to give me very small portions so I could try everything. Every item was a different degree of good. An excellent wood smoke permeates all meats. I have found it very hard to find a beef rib outside of the South, let alone an excellent one. The sides were straight up and very enjoyable, as were the desserts. I'm not a big baby back rib guy, so I was surprised at how much i loved the dry rub ribs here. Perfect. The staff was very friendly and the prices are great. Can't really say anything bad about this place.

6KOFFyj-QXA50VOej1be-Q.text: Best BBQ in Las Vegas. Truly a hidden gem. The location is a bit sketchy. But the food is amazing. Definitely worth a trip off the strip. Lyfy cost $10 roundtrip from the Venetian. Will Definitely return.
