U5N9qVBFVy1IWQOOhTG6Mw.text: This place has the best BBQ !!!  Lizelle and Sofia were the BEST- they gave us excellent service and recommended the pit special which had 5 meats and 3 sides for $27.99 .... brisket, links, chicken,ribs and pulled pork !!!  So good and more than we could eat at one meal.  Definitely coming back again  As usual we weren't disappointed. Christal gave us great service with a smile! We ordered the brisket sandwich and chicken sandwich with waffle fries and loaded mashed potatoes to eat there. So good! We also ordered the trio plate of brisket, hot links and subbed in some rib tips to take home. Stop in and check them out you won't regret it

c-xrvU-HlUKsuOEnUuykAQ.text: First place we stopped when we hit Vegas! Kamia helped us and was super sweet and patient helping us with our choices. AND!!! Even though the BBQ Sundae is not on the menu anymore, the owner said he'd make it for me specially!  Sooooo happy!!! What a great place... I'd highly recommend it to anyone in town. Yummmmm!

r8omirV_4PTn08tJG-tj7Q.text: Absolutely delicious BBQ, exceptionally friendly staff!   I've lived in Vegas for about 9 months now and people have often mentioned that I need to try this spot. SO glad I finally did. Visually, it's no beauty and it's not on the most beautiful street in town. HOWEVER, they're putting out some of the best BBQ you've ever tasted.   I went with the burnt ends brisket, hot links, and waffle fries. For dessert I got peach cobbler a la mode.   The guy at the checkout counter (Dave) was unbelievably nice. Even though the line was long he took the time to give me suggestions specific to what I like and what id ordered. So matched the best sides with my meats. The wife went with brisket chopped and yams. Everything was GREAT.   The sweet tea is housed in Nestea containers so I thought it was going to be the syrup mixed with water. But I watched them pouring brewed sweet tea into the top. Impressed!   The dessert was good but I would say that in the future I won't get the ice cream inside on top. I think it may have taken away from the deliciousness of the cobbler.   Regardless, I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt ends brisket, hot links, waffle fries, sweet tea. Nommmmm!!!

Nl0uaKBIsgHl6qSbQtPRQQ.text: OMG what a great place to enjoy good quality meat. We went there after a long walk up and down the strip. I was starving so I decided to order the "outlaw" burger while my companion went for a pulled pork "sandwich". The sandwich turned out to be a burger with lots of pork, home made sauce and coleslaw. My burger was a gigantic tower with a heavy meat patty, lettuce, tomatoe, pickles and onion rings. It was impossible to eat it without taking it apart. The meat was fantastic and all the ingredients were wisely chosen and harmonized well. It is the best and farmost the cheapest burger I got so far.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MTRxqW5pVlUhAVPcCmXWGA.text: The BEST Meatloaf!!! The mashed potatoes and cornbread that come with aren't bad either ;)

OATqiDHZD_CfU_tIpAD9_Q.text: This is a quaint little hole in the wall. The food was delicious, the service friendly. I truly enjoyed the brisket and and pork ribs.

dbZPJeITEel582w5Q0tBnQ.text: Stopped here during our Hog Car Tour. The food was amazing!   We had a sample of beans, deep fried creamed corn (which was sooooo good), spicy sausage, and the best ever meatloaf/mashed potatoes. The sausage is spicy and delish.  If you don't like spicy, the sausage may not be for you.  I ate my mothers : ) We had the pleasure of meeting the chef and owner, both of whom were friendly, cheerful, and very accommodating of our group on the tour. The chef and owner gave us a tour of the facilities, which were clean. The few tables outside were full of hungry and satisfied customers. Very glad this was one our stops on the tour!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lpzJSM55cX8-oOPkmHlFXw.text: By far the BEST Barbeque in Vegas! Everything tastes absolutely wonderful and you can tell the quality and time it take to make all that great good. The service is fast, even if there is a line, it's 100% worth it. And of course I ordered too much food, and I had plenty of leftovers to eat in the morning. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

tc_cnhiog4mgMuYSepP6gQ.text: The best rub we've tried! They understand gluten free as well, which is AMAZING for a BBQ place. Portions are generous. Smiles are had by many. Sauces are diverse. Menu is vast. Ribs are the most tender I have had in years.

I7KZ3UzDQfDWMJoU3AYIhA.text: 2 stars only because the food is bomb... customer service needs some work or maybe they were just having an off day today.  I call in an order for pick up at 5:20pm. The lady says it will be ready in 15 minutes. I get there at 5:45pm so the food should be ready. I stand in line to pay. After I pay, I stand next to the register and wait for my food to come out.  As I'm standing there about 15 minutes, the people who ordered after i paid start getting their food.   I ask a girl working there, "why are people who ordered after me getting their food before me when I called in my order over half an hour ago?"  She asked for my name, then went in the back and comes back out with my bag like it was just sitting there the whole fricken time!!!   Then she says, "it's because you didn't tell anyone."  WTF are you talking about, I paid the F'n cashier for my damn food without talking to him!!!??? He knows what I paid for, that it was a pick up order, and what I was standing there for.  What a joke...

Og9nEzysS0UyJ3MzBntT5A.text: Pretty damn tasty bbq.  Came here with 5 friends and we were hungry for some good bbq. We ordered 3 lbs of brisket, 1.5 slabs of spare ribs, a slab of beef ribs, and some sides of potato salad, mac n cheese, onion strings, and corn balls.    We ordered all the meats dry and with sauce on the side and also asked for their spicy bbq sauce.  The test for good bbq is how their meat tastes without sauce.  This place definitely passed the test  I'm not usually a fan of bbq sauce anyway, but this place definitely does not need sauce.  The rub they use on their meats were delicious.  The beef rib was so nice and fatty and it basically melts in your mouth.  The flavor of the spare ribs were good too.  However, the meat on spare ribs should easily fall of the bone, and these did not.    The sides were ok.  I liked the bacon potato salad.  I wasn't a fan of the other stuff. Although my friends really liked the corn ball things.   Definitely worth a shot, but it can be busy.  Some of the other reviews said it was hard to get a seat.  I can definitely see that happening on the weekends during peak hours.  We went on a monday at 6pm.  There was a line for the food, but we didn't have any problem finding a table.  However, as we were there, the place filled up and the line got much longer.

g_FJW1dvPXaURz06bYRkDA.text: I look forward to coming to Vegas from LA since this is the best place to get BBQ that's not in San Diego (Phil's), NorCal (Hot City BBQ) or Texas (Hunter Bros H3 BBQ and Smokehouse). Price excellent, stick to the sausage and pulled pork, brisket is only ok. Sides are also excellent, especially the onion rings.

1AGXAQ1SwV2TPWPYTROoRA.text: Well, I have tried most things they have here. Good ribs, brisket and the burgers are unlike any burger I have had. I am a fan of smoked and/or grilled burgers, but fried not at all..like  Mcdonalds, Wendy's, In-N-Out... RS burgers are big and soft and smoked. If you are a burger fanatic, you should at least try it. But, what I think about when I think of this place is the beef ribs. One rib is a whole meal, they are so big. The beef rib is tender, tasty and totally trimmed of excess fat and gristle. This is the must-try from this place. Beef ribs. Amazing and I want to know how they do that (I'm a cook)! The only issue is finding the place, so head south on Highland from Sahara for about a mile, then you will see it tucked into a little strip-mall. The wait is not short, which is why I only give it 4 stars.

FYILKneec_o_1KnX4FyJDg.text: Definitely way too much hype for this place. I went once and it was OK. Will not return.   I had the pulled pork sandwich and, unfortunately, had small chunks of bone in it. Nothing huge, but come on...that's not supposed to happen. The meat is tasteless and you are forced to douse with sauce to get any meaningful flavor.   Also, the prices are pretty steep. You get the pulled pork sandwich for just under $10 (not a problem), but then you must pay an extra $4 for combo/drink (problem)! So, lunch for one person is nearly $15! Too much for BBQ.  Good proximity to the strip, though. However, the area can be sketchy at night.  Once you've had authentic Texas BBQ, it's tough to meet that standard again and this place doesn't even come close.

TILQaKtpUgjnn6RlpG_PQg.text: So I am very glad that I went to this establishment.  It is definitely off the strip which was nice in itself.  The option for the all you can eat is a little dubious.  There is a one hour time limit and it starts once you pay for your meal.  My other issue that I have is that when I paid for the meal, the cashier told us to either come up to the register and they would take another order OR we could order it with one of the food runners.  Well when I tried to use the food runner option, I was told to go to the register.  Ask when my friend tried to buy a hat, the cashier said that he could try it on but would have to go to the office at a later time.  My friend then asked one of the runners about the hat and was informed that he would have to get back in line and wouldn't have to go to the office.  The people were not on the same page.  But I digress.  Now the food was freaking delicious.  The brisket was juicy and tender.  The dirty rice and corn nibblets were awesome.  I think the price of 34.99 was worth it. Just be transparent and on the same page.

CVtbmV8kCuFzyn1HPByLWQ.text: Truly a hidden gem here in vegas. Great ribs, great brisket and even greater service. Had a hearty meal with our friends yesterday. Another place for me to take any out-of-towners to!

4JqDG-Uc3SmvpswvS8ZknQ.text: YES! Sooooo good! And the sauce...AMAZING!!!!! Be aware that parking is limited in the mid-day since the lot is small. The staff is friendly, the place is clean, the ribs...just order enough so you can have leftovers to take home!

kvNiKoArw0qOETvjbCTRFw.text: The food was delicious and the staff was fantastic. My husband and I ordered the "Pit Special" to share, which included 5 types of meat (pulled pork, chicken, brisket, hot links and 2 ribs) and your choice of 3 sides for $27.99. It was plenty of food and we loved getting to try each of the meats. The brisket was Hands down the best. For our sides, we ordered the dirty rice, loaded mashed potatoes, and corn bread. We LOVED every single side. The chick at the register (Brenda) was so warm with all her "hey honey's" and "of course baby". Then the girl who served us (Lizelle?) was so incredibly helpful and sweet, offering to help us take our selfie... And grabbing us extra utensils so we didn't have to get up from the table. I mean... The food, the service... We scored on this trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charming BBQ joint hidden under freeways

H1Q_JtyLjdvS3DyNhbQGXg.text: The smell right when you come in is amazing. Everyone was super nice, and the food was great. Meat fell off the bone and the loaded mashed potatoes were amazing. My husband go the outlaw burger and he said it was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zOQDwkMulnFp3h02KhdJRQ.text: This I now my favorite bbq spot ever! I'm coming here every time I come to Vegas. Please make one in Cali. The collard greens are as good as my moms! Burnt tips are too good. I don't even like leaving reviews usually but had to

Vk3_RcAwy_AfwBmFM48veQ.text: Great Barbeque I'm from North Carolina the best barbecue found in Las Vegas it's exactly like the pulled pork from back east and also have all kinds of fun BBQ sauces. Not much of a dining area but it's different than most typical restaurants UC only bad thing is not open at night.

Iluofc5QVknsduLmoNiO0g.text: Had a brisket sandwich. It's somewhat shredded, and absolutely delicious. The BBQ chicken was very good too. But the Biggin looked fantastic; a link, brisket and pulled pork sandwich. And you have to try the Jalapeno cole slaw!

pa9UXrlwRcJNth3962hfkw.text: I signed up for yelp just to leave a review for this place. I was invited here by a friend, and had no idea what to expect. First glance was that it seemed small and without a huge sign I almost missed it. Then I saw the menu and saw the prices and I fealt it was pricey compared to some places I've ate. I asked my friend what was good and he said try the smoked meatloaf. I'm not a huge meatloaf fan but ordered it anyway and I'm glad I did. It was amazing!! We were checked up on by whom I assume was the owner (mom) and her son. Super friendly, super good food, good portion sizes, just simply delicious! My hats off to the staff, I'll make the trip again for some more!!

8sGOTAtgFkMpLFR3dzurFQ.text: The best beef Barbecue ribs. Staff is super helpful. Ask for Brenda. Also very good wings, and rib tips.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IBAA2fgxIHdIbGLGgfPhtw.text: Best bbq I've had in town. When family visits from out of town, I bring them here. Had everything on the menu and am fully satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Took the wife to get the catfish meal for her birthday. I got the sliders (brisket, chicken, pork). Everything was excellent!!!

eoY46A18YWvs5S-9YAUjZg.text: The best BBQ in Vegas for sure. It's tucked away on an off street, like a hidden gem. The meats are smoked and very flavorful; the sides were ok nothing spectacularl. Portions are generous and very filling. You probably won't find a place with real smoked BBQ in Vegas like here. The staff was helpful and very friendly. I will be back!

1_-b8kaOJDao4gcmnNBytA.text: We had Rollin Smoke cater one of our events at work and usually Lucille's takes the cake but man, for BBQ in Las Vegas, Rollin Smoke might've surpassed my "go to" spot.  Loved the pulled pork and delicious sides like the mac n cheese and cole slaw.  Great staff as well.

Rh6xJtGaV3epxQlR7wi2hw.text: This place is near where the strippers and the Fashion Show mall is in a very unlikely location for a restaurant to be. But boy is it packed. They serve BBQ of all types. We ordered the combo BBQ to sample their BBQ and also a pulled pork sandwich. It was a large burger. Underneath all that meat was a sausage. Everything was cooked just right. The meat was juicy and came right off the bone.  The place was packed for 2pm on a Saturday, clearly pass its lunch hour but there was a steady stream of customers. If you want hole in the wall, this is the place. Everything about the place tells you these people didn't come from LA or NYC. They came from what, Arkansas? There's a boar's head on the wall to greet you and keep you company when you wait in line.  The menu items are simple. We got mac and cheese, yams, and fried okra. You get a side if you order a soft drink. How can you eat BBQ without a Coke? You just can't, so the side was an added compliment.  There is only 1 restroom though so I suggest you do your business become you come or else it might be a wait. Out of the 3 different styles of BBQ, I'd say they hit it on the head for each one. There is bbq sauce on the table if you like but I found that the ribs were nicely done and I didn't need anymore sauce.  Sauce wise, I think Lucille's might just be a tad better but not by much. I like them to cook their meat as good as this place. Is it always pefect? Nope. The first time that I came here, the baby backs were a little dry but this time everything was cooked right.  I could not finish my meal and took the rest home. If you have trouble locating this place it's across Shetakis distribution and below the Sahara bridge I believe.

qs8aW3y5pFPf1ephY2jVjw.text: It was ok, wouldn't break my neck to go again. For the money I spent on this I probably could've store bought and enjoyed it more.

2RCYIupSzesEZH2MVXdd4Q.text: Had the brisket done three ways. I thought I couldn't be more impressed here after coming here a couple of times before. I was wrong. This was a special and they were right. Special is the word. I couldn't stop eating. If they have this get it. If not get the brisket done however they have it that day, you will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket three ways. Awesome

WZdfgzBU2LXZC9EM1jjR2g.text: We were in the area and found this place on Yelp. It is an industrial area but very close to Fashion Show Mall. There is not a lot of seating but we got in before noon so we were fine. The owner is from Arkansas but the BBQ wasn't True Arkansas. Why? The meat didn't have the smoky flavor that Arkansas BBQ has. My wife liked it because it didn't have the heavy smoke flavor so it is a matter of taste. The BBQ sauce was as good as I've ever tasted, similar to #2 at the Whole Hog (for you Arkansas transplants). We saw some really good looking stuff as we shamelessly looked at everyone else's food. They had a huge hamburger piled high that looked amazing. Check out the pictures as someone must have posted one of this thing. Bottom line, it was very good. My wife may have given it 5 stars but I rated a 4 because I missed the smoky flavor. We will definitely be back and recommend this place.

QM2lPpmKXFZUMgm6RwCnIQ.text: Went tonite with my open carry group to try it for the first time, I was not disappointed!  Thanks Rollin Smoke for supporting the 2nd Amendment.  It is a bit out of the way but worth the trek into industrial Vegas. The building is in a little strip of stores and it is old, but clean and in good shape. The store is decked out in Arkansas Razorback memorabilia and they have a "Tanked" fish tank made out of an old smoker. Super cool! The brisket was oh so flavorful! The selection of sauces was perfect. Don't kid yourself the "spicy" is plenty spicy and ma's sweet is to die for! I'll be dragging the girlie back to this place, quick fast and in a hurry!!!!!

2baOD2ZqSRCSp6ZtYxnh7g.text: This Has To Be My ALL Time Favorite Bbq Spot. I Usually Come For The Pulled Piggy (Pork) Sandwich But Tonight I Tried The Ribs With Mac n Cheese And Corn Bread And I Must Say Im So Full Im Damn Near Gonna Explode. The Meat Was So Tender It Just Fell Off The Bone And After You Smother It In One Of There Many Bbq Sauce Choices (My Fav Is The Mama Sweet) Mixed With The Rub And Smoke Taste Its Perfection. Mitch Was A Awesome Host And Gave Us A Amazing Step By Step Experience We Even Gotta Walk Thru Tutorial Of The Kitchen And Met The Cooks. Mitch Deserves A Raise Hes My Favorite Employee There. If Your In The Vegas Area I HIGHLY Recomend Stopping By For Lunch Or Dinner I Know Ill Be Back

CDLlvjLPdDaYthuB9T5IMA.text: Amazing!!!! Point blank period. Amazing smoked flavors quality rubbed meats and amazing bbq sauces. Will be back over and over

K7Uphxh24vDyzDu8U41qpA.text: Friend and I split the The Pit Special with 4 meats (brisket, pulled pork, spare ribs, and hot links) and 3 sides (hush puppies, fries, and greens).  The meats were tender and flavorful, but the BBQ does get heavy after a while.  Very friendly service, and food come in generous portions.  The $20 Pit Special was very difficult for 1 person to finish alone, have some leftover for 2 people to make next day's sandwich, but great for 3 to share!  Don't forget to check in for free dessert offer! :)

SVZUgcN8nhZeOrigZFPNGQ.text: LOVE this place!!!!  The ribs are great and don't forget to get the corn nuggets as your side. I had the burnt ends yesterday and they were super tender and full of some serious flavor!    The whole crew that works there is awesome and Lizelle always takes care of us when we come in. Makes it feel like home.  If you haven't tried this place yet you are missing out.

iW9uB1eTo-Td2Bi6uzd02Q.text: I tell everyone looking for a great BBQ here in Vegas that Rollin Smoke is the best in town! Maybe the best in the region.   Starting with an option of all you can eat for just under $25 dollars (all day everyday, everything on the menu) and a large amount delicious sides, YOU CANT GO WRONG!   *THE OUTLAW BURGER is the greatest burger. (beef patty with brisket, onions, bell pepper, onion strings, red cabbage, slaw, lettuce, tomato and cheddar.)

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño cole slaw!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE OUTLAW BURGER!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE GREATEST BURGER IN ALL THE LAND, THE OUTLAW!!

V29PlvZK_y0EI_ZkM73dLA.text: LIP SMACKING BARBEQUE NOURISHED FROM THE GODS THEMSELVES.  Seriously this place precedes itself. Just so you can understand the level that Rollin Smoke is on they were awarded for top 20 best bbq restaurants in america from localeats AND best burger in vegas seven. Yeah...they're pretty epic.  It's pretty easy to miss this place, they're near the cross streets highland and desert inn, inside a signless plaza. Just look for a grill outside and you'll be fine. The vibe of the place is very relaxed mixed with decorations of tshirts, a pig, awards, and a mural. A big plus in my book is the amount of seating they have, from the times I went I never had to fight for a table.   Customer service? Always on point. They strive for it. Anything wrong with what you're eating? They'll fix it. They always have a guy walking around asking people if they're doing fine.   If you're coming here for the first time you should definitely try the rib tips, and outlaw burger. It takes a while for the outlaw burger to cook, nonetheless it's worth the wait. Let me start off with the rib tips. You can order 1/2 pound or a pound, if you're eating with a group of people, just share a pound it'll be more than enough. Their rib tips are mouthwatering!!! Cooked to perfection. And when you get those fatty pieces in your mouth you can taste the definition of a good bbq. The outlaw burger is just as satisfying. Let me just list the ingredients in the burger it has; brisket, onions, bell pepper, onion strings, red cabbage, slaw, lettuce, tomato, cheddar cheese, and chipotle ailoi. Yeah, all that in a burger. You know that one question? What do you want to eat before you die? This might be the answer.  Tip: There's no shame in getting your hands dirty and pigging out. Dam son just eat that bbq! And you can order to-go over the phone!

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
