_uh2fceCS0thCYd36cgVPg.text: Everything was DELICIOUS - ribs, brisket, potato salad - SO good - loaded mashed potatoes, chipotle coleslaw, corn bread and to top it off, peach and Berry cobbler! We arrived just at closing time but sweet Lizette and Antonio let us order and we were not disappointed. Our party of five loved every bite and are planning a return visit for lunch.

XdiVaSbxBRldcJFv2KD86w.text: This is a gem! Best BBQ in Vegas. I ordered the salad with Brisket. Good greens melt in your mouth brisket. Low Carb heaven!  Very tasty  I will be coming back.

uy-T-C1IfgvSH6Qqwqe_Wg.text: We tried the burnt ends, corn nuggets and potato salad. We really enjoyed the corn nuggets and potato salad, but I didn't really care for the burnt ends. They were not crispy at all. My boyfriend liked them, but agreed they didn't taste like burnt ends. The sides were so good that I'd come again and try another meat.

l4ZEXxHVfbN3MFhDdAdI7Q.text: If you're looking for good BBQ in Vegas, Rollin Smoke is where you're going to find it!  Located in a small plaza on Highland, Rollin Smoke is a fairly small restaurant and gets crazy busy at times. When you walk in, there's a large menu on the wall and after you place your order, you can go sit down and they'll bring the food to you. The menu is somewhat large and features classics like pulled pork sandwiches and meat combo plates. They've also got some not-so-usual options like the gigantic Outlaw Burger, Chicken 'n Waffles and even an all you can eat option.   I usually order a two meat combo with brisket and hot link. Most places seem to serve a packaged hot link and just toss it in sauce. While I have no idea whether there's is or not, it's one of the better ones I've had. The sausage is flavorful with a great snap and they don't douse it in sauce. Since I'm a fan of spicy food, I like that there's has a little kick to it as well. And there's a reason I can't stay away from the brisket either. It's extremely tender, flavor is great and it's not overly smoky. Again, even though I really like their sauce, they don't douse the meat in it which is a huge plus. You have to try the sauce though, it's slightly sweet but has a mild heat...really tasty.  If you're into dessert, they have a few options there too. We've used the Yelp check-in for a free mini dessert a few times and always get the peach cobbler. My wife is a peach cobbler fanatic and this is her favorite in town. I've heard good things about the banana pudding though and I'll be getting that next time.  This a solid 4.5 stars for me and only because I've had inconsistent plate sizes. One time I got a combo plate that had so much meat I couldn't finish it, but then the two other times we've went, I finished mine and starting picking off the wifeys. Not a huge deal but it's a bit irritating. Either way, Rollin Smoke serves some of the best BBQ in town and at much better prices then most of them too. Top it off with friendly service and you got a must try spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Take the kids to see the fish tank!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle Fries
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 Meat Combo w/ Ribs &amp; Hot Link

9LW1r2dUupVHBY0QXXJNsA.text: Huge fan of this place, but not of its beef brisket sandwich.  Not sure why they have opted to serve chopped beef brisket instead of sliced. The chopped variety has way too much in the way of questionable ingredients like grizzle and fat, even some bones.  Their barbecue is so good that it's hard to understand why they have opted not to serve sliced brisket sandwich. This would be a huge improvement and worth at least one more star.  UPDATE: Decided to head back to Rollin Smoke for some BBQ on a weeknight.  Got there around 8:10 pm on a Thursday night and they were CLOSED!   CLOSED? at 8 pm?  WTH?  This is VEGAS, not Arkansas.  Dang hillbillies.   One star demotion for lack of awareness of their market.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. not-so-impressive (chopped) brisket sandwich

m2p-xfDNra4Mv7DZ4X552g.text: You can smell this place all the way from the street. Best barbeque I've ever had. Being from Texas and an expert smoker myself, this says a lot. This guy puts a lot of effort and thought into his cooking. He's not just a pit master, he's a chef. Amazing food!  I had a brisket sandwich, one beef rib and bacon potato salad. Most tender and smoky beef ribs and brisket ever. The sandwich bun was served on a really soft sesame seed hoagie bun and was typed with green onions. No extra sauce necessary. Just the right amount of flavor and nothing overpowering. Lover every bite! No wonder the walls are covered with awards.

CwlXKNQbz3STf9IE_ufIRg.text: This was the best BBQ I have ever had in my life. I have lived in TX and driven cross country trying BBQ because it is one of my favorites. Hands down, THE BEST. You won't be sorry.

FMvdAPR-Vl8SYVI8NsLMKA.text: This place rocked my socks. It's so good and has an authentic southern feel. Their ribs & chicken are so bomb! Try the jalapeno coleslaw. It'll leave you on your ass!! It's so good and hot.  The wait varies but it's worth it. Kinda lowkey spot too from a tourist point of view ^_^

joBmucu9HXWup9qrmUctgw.text: oh my   We got the pit special, outlaw burger, Mac and cheese, kickin beans, loaded mash, onion strings, catfish, and corn fritters! you can just taste the smokiness from the BBQ! so much flavor.   I loved the kickin beans, it has brisket and has a perfect sweet and spicy kick!   the catfish is cooked perfectly and is a must, it comes with two sauces, but is also good on it's own.   the best thing was the corn fritters, OH MY GOD. I don't think a gallon of this would be enough  sweet corn and cheese deep fried nuggets. I could eat this all day. if I had to order one thing only it would be this.   a place can have the most amazing food but the last star can only be earned by amazing customer service. thank you to MIKE for helping us out! you can tell this place truly cares about their customers leaving satisfied. if I could give an extra star just for how amazing the service is alone I would. will definitely come back!!  hands down the best bbq I have ever had! it was only appropriate to sit next to the piggy at our table since that's what I felt like while I was eating. oh and I don't know why there's two $$ signs, the prices are so cheap! definitely bang for your buck!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. outlaw burger, catfish, and a meal of our feast!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. corn fritters!

bCS9z9pl6_0i2Y1MNdMIyA.text: I'm surprised by the high star ratings. The food wasn't that great. The meat was dry and the BBQ sauce tastes like any other place. I tried the catfish and the meat was so thin that I only tasted the batter.   1 star for the friendly service but the food gets zero.

O6qN3LDy4l4pJWB5V-77GA.text: Shout to Danny! He took care of us along with the rest of the staff. Food came quick and it taste delicious. We also forgot our wallet there but when we got back Danny had it which was a life saver because I had to leave back to California.

YBchR5kdsAcGuAxiiZtrNg.text: I'm not sure if I was expecting too much, but I wasn't too impressed.  My friends and I ordered the rib platter and the pit special to share, while some of my friends ordered the meatloaf and the outlaw burger. The ribs were a little dry and lacked the flavor I was expecting. I added more of their sauce, but still didn't like it too much. The pork and beans were slightly undercooked and too peppery for my taste.   The corn nuggets on the other hand were probably the highlight of my food. They were fried pieces of goodness. :) so addictive. I think I ate a million pieces.   To be fair, also, the outlaw burger and the meatloaf were thoroughly enjoyed the rest of my party so maybe that's more of the way to go.

hN7ok4xmuQZ12xTbH_KWnA.text: Yummy! Absolutely delicious BBQ, expect a wait because it's always packed at lunch time, but well worth the wait!

tQkwD9m7JegdOnqBjCQJUA.text: We moved here to Las Vegas from Ft Hood/Killeen, Texas last year and by far this is "THE BEST" BBQ restaurant. Thank god we only live a couple blocks from this place, were always here ordering to go plates and going down the menu list to try them all :-)

VJdTiLfioG6EXXPsi_1_iQ.text: The restaurant is in a very odd industrial area near auto shops, strip clubs and warehouses, and is probably the only one in the area. You walk in to a haphazard restaurant with not much of a front counter, but instead a confusing podium to order at with no one standing there most of the time. The menu is on a wall kind of near this podium, so you better know what you want before you walk over to order. There are a handful of two, four and large top tables between the two awkwardly cramped rooms of this place, sparsely decorated with a few down lights and some reclaimed wood on the walls. You can tell it was thrown together cheaply, but it seems to fit with the homegrown feel of backyard BBQ. The great smell of smoke fills the space the whole time you sit there, and never really fades away while you're there or from your clothes when you leave.  The menu features pretty much all the standards you would expect from a BBQ joint, but as I said I was suckered into ordering their Outlaw Burger: brisket, onion, bell pepper, onion strings, red cabbage slaw, lettuce, tomato, cheddar cheese and chipotle aioli. I'm skeptical of any BBQ place that can't get sweet tea right, so I was nervous about this thing given the somewhat flavorless tea I sat with while waiting for my burger to arrive. And what came out was just too big to enjoy; the patty alone is a thick mass of meat that's possibly a bit overcooked just because of its size and how long it has to cook. The bun was far too small and thin to hold up to this mess, even with a decent helping of lettuce at the bottom to create a buffer from any sauce. Probably the best flavor in this whole thing were the onion rings, which tasted far better on their own than in the burger where they got lost in the myriad of flavors. The huge glob of cheese had good flavor, but like most other things in this burger there was just a bit too much of it. As for the aioli, slaw and other items, I couldn't really tell you much because I didn't notice them enough. I think if this were your typical 1/4 or 1/3 pound burger it would probably be pretty good, still a far cry from the best burger in Vegas as they've claimed, but maybe in the upper half. But like my recent complaints about a huge burger in San Diego, this is just too much to properly enjoy.  Something extremely puzzling and disappointing for me was the complete lack of fries with my burger. Looking at their menu online now, apparently the $8.99 "smoking deal" for the Outlaw Burger is a deal for just the burger, you have to read the small print at the bottom where it says to add $3 for a side and drink. I wish the guy that took my order would have said something as I spent $2 for just my iced tea expecting the fries that were in the picture with my burger. What burger doesn't get ordered with fries?! I guess maybe one of this size, as I surely wouldn't have been able to finish it if I ate anything else, but fries are almost always a necessity. For $11.88 I certainly got a lot of food, but I don't know if it was worth the cost or stomach bomb. I have a feeling that you should stick to the True BBQ that this place is known for, and not their "best burger". I know I'll be back to test this theory.

lSoT867CsHWX8-eBwMJoBg.text: How does one put into words the experience of tasting great BBQ?  Rollin Smoke that's how.  Went here tonight with my father and this place far exceeded our expectations.  I thought it was so unique this place offers "all you can eat" for anything and everything on the menu.  I was personally on a mission to devour some St. Louis style BBQ ribs, greens and some "kickin beans" and.........well I can say this: "If these are not served in heaven, then I shall not go"  absolutely remarkable and hands down the very best BBQ in Vegas.  Don't let the "hole in the wall" location fool you, it will be one of the best BBQ experiences of your life.  The owner is very pleasant and takes a great deal of pride in what they serve.  Service was great and food was even better.   THIS IS A MUST VISIT!

l1w-3zoEvRXPlwcVNne6fg.text: update 6/19 we have continued to visit and have seen the owners making changes to ensure everyone's satisfied. Back to perfect rating for my fave Q. Rolling smoke has been my favorite BBQ in town for over a year, love the brisket, giant beef ribs, and sides.  $24.99 all u can eat dine in special seems like good value. My issue is as it's gotten more popular the wait for ordering and food is tough, especially if I'm with my children. I don't see the owners in anymore and it's not as friendly. My last visit half my to go order was missing (after waiting over 30 min) and the employee made a joke that it was my fault because I initially didn't respond when my name was called (knew my order wasn't one bag).  I would have preferred apology for trying to send me on my way with half of a $40 order! Despite loving the food I'm hesitant to go unless during slow time

poAd8qEsLw29IKnf3Pz6fg.text: Incredible BBQ!!! A must have when in Las Vegas. Pulled pork nachos were delicious. Will be returning time and time again!

8RapRUeskwpKIaULqbQ3SA.text: pure bbq heaven! love them, fast services.. super nice! the best bbq in vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow! Bf is 6&#39;4&#34; guy! Can&#39;t finish! Great whole in the wall!! $36 for all!

b6WNQVOAlkmfKn_ODxyh_g.text: On the way back from Zion we stopped at Rollin Smoke BBQ, it was easy to get to off the freeway and soooo good! The beef ribs were incredible, like one dreams about. Good portion size and a nice low key atmosphere with a couple of different seating areas. Will be back!

c9olz4t-KEJL2qVnTxQTUA.text: This is my second time here in 2 days.  It was so good, I had to do it again.  Brisket is amazing.  They gave me a tour of the back and had the privilege of seeing the smokers and watch them putting the rubs on.  Top notch!!!

huSMCxh1Gz9Y0WzVFHeCKA.text: Usually when I'm rollin' and smokin' somethin'...it ain't food. This place is worth rollin' into cause the food is smokin' good. The dudes that runs this place are extremely personable-servin' some heapin' helpings of hospitality along with their scrumptious offerings. Most everything I have had here is excellent. The highlight, as mentioned before is the Outlaw Burger, that thing hits the bull's-eye! I am especially fond of their jalapeno slaw, a wonderful kick to that stuff. The potato salad is not one of my faves, a little too bland for me, but that said, it still has this delightful subtle flavor that I can see lots of folks digging, and honestly I would order it again. Great bark on the meats. The sauce at the tables...should you feel the need...offers a complex mix of flavors with a welcomed spicy kick. Most of the sides are prepared in house. One employee told me the fried okra is frozen, but I (and one of my friends) seriously thought it tasted fresh. They must have found a great supplier. This interior is not divey at all, though for some, the location is. Fresh brewed regular and sweet tea. Two separate dining areas with 2 different vibes. Holy smoke, Rollin' Smoke ain't no joke, I felt high driving home and didn't even toke.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yep, pretty much sums it up in a grammatically incorrect sort of way ;-)
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The other dining area.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two separate dining areas with 2 different feels.

HI4osxe-k2j-LUPcR-wpCA.text: Hidden gem in Las Vegas. Walked in and immediately knew I was gonna love this place. Got the pit special with brisket, pulled pork and spare ribs. Great flavor with a slight hint of a spicy kick. Sides were awesome too, tried the corn nuggets, mac n cheese and fried onion strings, Delicious, Definitely wanna try their All You Can Eat $24.99 Deal. Servers were friendly, food came out quickly and loved the atmosphere, Cant wait to go back and bring people visiting from outta town.

G_a-irEvNB31NuQp-CJvvA.text: Hands down the best BBQ I have had since living in the south. The portions are huge and the prices are very reasonable. It's not far from the strip but better than anything I have had all week. Bummed I found this place on my last day in Vegas, I will definitely be coming here on my next trip and thinking about it until then! The staff is also great, really nice and down to earth! Do yourself a favor and stop in!

e0ReInJpDjWXa8NsDh_V8g.text: I have only eaten her once but I was impressed. When I first pulled up I was hesitant but after I walked in I no longer felt that. The staff was super nice and the food was very good. I will defiantly return.

dl3ujVvml1Qj3dbQPKQLOw.text: I normally dont like beef ribs becuase they are tough, but these were the best ive ever had

gPWT8zGLHUawi79RcrZGfA.text: So good. Too legit to quit. I got brisket, pulled pork, cornbread, and corn nuggets. All of it was awesome

G-fJWY9Emgxmpt6bGo7ZQg.text: Met Big Mike who gave great recommendations for our groups food! You must the beef rib and brisket burger. The beans and fried okra  for a side were on point and you can't go wrong with any of the food here.  Bring everyone and the price won't kill ya!  A must have in Vegas.

-ukx8vltyiXaQaoglONkfQ.text: Maaaaaannnn let me tell you, you can't go wrong here!  Everything was Awesome!  I had the beef ribs and they were so tender, no knife or teeth needed!  Only negative is the banana pudding, just pudding and a few cookies!  Will definitely be back when I come to Vegas!

uzs0mC_YaRZbYDJI2V76bg.text: Stopped here after a concert... They were out of everything we wanted to try, we were left ordering hot dogs. The food was super greasy. Tried drying the fries with napkins due to them being soaked in oil. We had to just throw them away. The hush puppies were actually really good. I don't think we will be going back.

3OFrCJaIcdjosG2avkzKNw.text: Been going to Rollin for two years, and the food is great.   They added several servers and they are just down right rude!  The first meal we had we ordered a to-go bag and it was missing the pulled pork. I figured it was an oversight and we would go again.   The next day we tried to call in a large order but the phone went straight to voice mail so it took a while to get our food and when questioned how much longer, they made rude comments to us.  We have received good service in the past but the owner was working during that visit and this time he was out doing a BBQ competition. No matter how good the food is, I'll take my business somewhere else where I'll be treated as a customer.   Spent $190 on my two visits combined.  Resolution:  Train your help, food runners, to not to be rude to the customers!!

6LwoXj8kWhIhPYrAd8HTIA.text: BBQ and sauces are good!  Their front cashier person seems very knowledgeable about the menu and offered suggestions.  I drove from the other side of town to get here and it was worth the drive. Definitely coming back again to try out their larger than life burger.

QQSzTl3yhw9Xc8fCAb0krw.text: The best buffet in Vegas is not on the strip. The best buffet in vegas lies a bit off the strip at Rollin Smoke Barbeque.  The BBQ buffet at Rollin Smokes is only a mere $18.95 for all you can eat meat AND sides: St Louis Ribs (Cooked perfectly and ultra meaty) Pulled Pork (Oh so tender) Barbeque Chicken (Juicaaaay) Sausage (smoked to perfection)  There was more, but in Vegas nothing is ever a certainty. The walnut candied yams were my favorite sides, and the others are all worth a bite or 50. BBQ in Vegas has arrived and it most definitely is not on the strip.

acfkhPpfsRl09uO_I_AVxg.text: Friendly accomodating staff, large menu selection and very good bbq. A must visit for the bbq fan.  Excellent customer service.  Very easy to find. We had pulled pork and briscuit.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork sandwich with cole slaw

fcegEC3Sy-E-pvMmhsvAxw.text: Amazing REAL BBQ.   Ribs had a great rub and not drowned in icky sweet sauce.  Sauce was tangy and on the side as I requested.  They were still very tender and tasty.  I got the spareribs after asking their preference and was glad I did.  I also got a lb of brisket and it was so tender, juicy and the meat flavor shined!   To die for.  I had a side of baked beans and while they were good, they were not the best beans I have had but were pretty darn good.  I think they had pulled pork in them  and alot of it! I had called my order in (after searching yelp) and they were very helpful in recommendations over phone.  When I got there, everyone was friendly.   They offered me a free drink while I waited.  My order was ready in about 2 mins.  They thanked me.  I didn't get a lot of nice service like this in Vegas so it was great to have nice people.  Location is odd and you wouldn't stumble on it.  Go and enjoy real BBQ.  You will not get food like this on the strip.  They do "eat in" also, on nice picnic tables and I loved their drink glasses (nice sturdy to go cup).  I can't give them enough praise.   I WILL BE BACK NEXT TIME IN VEGAS!!

H6GUG7wZOeyOCnh44CetRQ.text: I like it. Menu is limited, but that seems the course for all barbecue joints.  Definitely family owned and operated, and food and service is always consistent. If there is a wait, handle it, it is worth it. The brisket is great, meatloaf reminds me of being a kid, and the Outlaw burger will take you out. Kid's menu is a bit steep so we usually work with a full menu item and split. Just solid, non-chain food style barbecue that satisfies.

aJ_NLDb3l7LksdjLjUoSpQ.text: The best BBQ in Vegas!!! Hands down to great BBQ and great service... We arrived and greeted right away... One of staff giving piggy stickers to our kids!!! So nice so kid friendly place... Ordered our meal, the BBQ was melt in your mouth goodness !!! Mac&cheese was bomb!!! The portions are big portions worth your money!!! Will definitely a place in Vegas to come back too... Thanks

36Dbio0lGWTup2356Z110g.text: Bookmarked this one.  I dont want to forget it.  Not that I could.  Exceptional pulled pork. Lots of smoke.    Try the corn nuggets.

Y8FaAPM9oi5Kx4g4eGDCsQ.text: The best bar-b-q in Vegas. Nice smoked meats and delicious sauces. Came here with the family and was impressed with the quality of the food. The location is hidden away a few blocks from the strip. The parking is limited, so get there before lunch time.

F65-VHbtnp2s-lKCy5-GPg.text: I have been here twice and still love it. I got beef ribs and my bf got brisket 3 ways. It was awesome!!!! One of the best bbq place in las vegas.

zJDyaRdo_R8pCovBMu7q8A.text: The best bbq in the nation. Better than Rudys, better than the shed, better than Texas pride, better than all others. I tipped the chef $100 because it was well deserved. God bless the hand that makes this amazingness.

3UrBS10mA6HcbspEakbV1A.text: Went there for the first time last night. Coming from a local that's tried a few amazing BBQ restaurants in town, this is definitely #1. The owner dusty was awesome and came around talking to all his customers. I will be returning!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib special + Mac n cheese, corn nuggets, banana pudding, pulled pork and beef brisket. All amazing choices!

0HfQEfh9ZdeYRFxbuMsd0A.text: Like other folks here have said, I claim to be NO expert on barbecue except to profess that I freaking LOVE it and have had the privilege to eat it all over SoCal and throughout our travels across the US.   I still have many, many places to visit and look forward to many more eatin' adventures but here's the down low on this joint and Dusty, the front man for the place.   We were in Vegas to celebrate our 10 yr wedding anniversary and my husband wanted to surprise me with a visit to a great barbecue place so he did his research and away we went. Below are my humble observations, take them with a grain of salt, add in what everyone else wrote and you are in for a treat.  1. Yes, it's in the hood/industrial type area, sprinkled with strip joints and such, but get over it, the rent is probably cheaper than hell and there are always customers around.   2. Dusty, a young dude to greeted us at the door, is one of the owners and what a hell of a front man he is. Uber friendly, knowledgeable, helpful and filled with positive energy, he treated us like old friends and even if the q had turned out to be shitty, we would've come back just for the customer service...thankfully it was not.  3. Small joint, not a huge menu but concise, to the point and the prices are so freaking good! Most of the barbecue places we've ever been to, charge an arm and a leg for a decent sized plate...here? 3 big, meaty pork ribs, 2 sides, a roll, $11.00 bucks and well worth every penny.  4. The bacon potato salad, jalapeno, corn coleslaw and banana pudding were absolutely legit and awesome!!  5. The best part? My BEEF SHORTRIBS!! So tender, so meaty, with just enough smoky bark on the outside, I sucked those bones like a flipping piranha...OMG!!  All in all, 5 stars all around and if I could give more, I would. If you visit and love the place, then please write even a quick review. They deserve as much business as they can handle and I hope they are there for a very, very long time...Good luck Dusty and thank you again for the most awesome beef ribs I've had in a long time.

U78FUzDjSKFMJlzOfkFyRg.text: Best BBQ ever!!!  Burnt ends to die for!!!  Doesn't matter what you get just go

_b8C_V6VAufQZLFBm22oYA.text: Rollin Smoke looks like a hole in the wall located behind  the strip but it is truly a hidden gem. It is a little pricy but the food is good. The pulled piggy sandwich is my FAVORITE thing to order here you can make it a combo where you get your choice of a side and a drink. It comes with these sweet pickles that I love to bite into every now and then. I usually order mine with a side of cheesy mac and an extra side of sweet corn bread. I end up leaving here super stuffed every time, but well worth it! I love experimenting with the sauces trying to see which one is the best, so far I think Mommas Sweet D-licious sauce is the best along with their mustard sauce. There is seating inside and outside for those who want to take a breath of fresh air. The cashier guy was beyond nice and gave us the best customer service while we were there. These guys are one of the best in town, my boyfriend and I keep coming back.

SiyCD7xrcIoA6PQ04HwLDQ.text: I love great bbq and this place certainly lived up to expectations.  I had the pulled pork sandwich which comes out on a hoagie roll that made it easy to eat and to add in copious amounts of pork.  There is something special about meat that is just so tender that taking a bite is more about flavor than actual chewing, I left not only satisfied but with thoughts about when I could next return.   There are many options for sides from waffle fries, mac n' cheese, potato salad, and a baked potato.  I only tried the waffle fries which was provided in enough of a portion for adequate sharing but also were great to soak up more of that delicious tangy bbq sauce.    This is a bbq place that requires several visits since you'll be wanting to come back and try what everyone else had in full quantities.

htNztfXckD3p52xr2-J9aA.text: Hit the place again last week. Still superb. Not up to Lockhart, TX or Shelby, NC standards, but for Nevada the best you are going to find. Any place that offers collards as a side is to be respected. This trip it seemed like all of Asia decided to join us for lunch. They were all digging in and pigging out with the rest of the crowd, so welcome, tourists! Enjoy what BBQ is supposed to taste like!

VOAcBJEslNFR_5M4QnqngQ.text: I ended up here in an entrapment sort of situation that is a long story....but, man was I super glad.  I'm from Kentucky(Go, Big Blue!) and I"ve not had barbeque this good since....I lived there. The decor is just kitchy enough to add to the authenticity without being corny.  You place your order at the counter and then food is brought to you, so we didn't really have a waiter, but everyone was nice and I wasn't without anything that I needed. If you check in on Yelp you get a free dessert. I got Banana Pudding cause duh...and it did not disappoint. I would give 4 stars but my booth had a hole/gargantuan dip in it so it was kind of like sitting on a porta potty. Get the other booth though and you will be set.

IMtyXldXfdqZ2KGyqkrB1A.text: ---Rant---  Great place when you are starving for meat!!!  Generally I stick with Tri-Tip, Chicken and/or Brisket when trying a new place.  These guys did NOT disappoint!  Meat was tasty, flavorful and juicy (not overly greasy, just juicy).  The Chicken was cooked perfectly and unusually soft (in a good way), same with the beef.   The cornbread is excellent...tastes like it has a lot of butter, which is pretty damn good IMHO~  The seating sucks though; I had to have ma boy buy my grub while I went and sat in an open booth. There was a huge crowd of folks waiting to order (you order first, pay then go sit.  They bring you your food).  I kinda got some disappointed looks from the crowd as I apparently was the only one smart/clever enough to go grab seats while your buddies are ordering for you?! haha  Side Note 1 - Don't ask the staff if they have any to-go containers...they will look at you like a total dumbass as containers are plainly visible at the counter, next to the soda and utensils hahaha (the dude just rolled his eyes and pointed, I in turn looked a damn fool~ hahahaha)  Side Note 2 - This is on a side street that has about 4-5 strip clubs. The street itself is dark and looks like the kind of area you could get mugged, raped, etc.  So go with a nice sized group of people if you're gonna go at night, and bring tazers or mace~  ---Overall---  Service: A.  We got our food pretty quick~  Food: A. Great food if you're looking for a heavy meat fix!!!  Atmosphere: C.  If I wasn't worried about getting ass-raped, I would probably visit more often.

wDMjjSGmJFuu05dsHplDVw.text: 1/2 lb burnt ends - 95% fat - $13.00 hot link - very bland  will not be back to this business!

lWh09lTTJH2przuqc7iTmQ.text: The outlaw burger is incredible. Their brisket is also very good. The atmosphere is about like most barbecue restaurants. Prices are reasonable and the staff is friendly. The food take awhile to arrive, but thats barbecue. I'll be back.

nlBSOllG0a-Z7aLUzwQ2Pw.text: This place was exceptional.  I am very picky about my BBQ and this place did not disappoint.  The brisket was outstanding, the chicken was moist and flavorful, the pulled pork was really good and the ribs were good.  The only meat I wasn't crazy about was the link sausage....way too peppery. You should absolutely try the corn fritters... they are yummy!!

4rSgPQARqE2PD2oDINxkLA.text: So I decided to quit my job, and as a "victory" lap, I came directly to Rollin Smoke to get my mind off my troubles.  I asked for the trio meal, with brisket, pork and baby back ribs, but they refused me.  They said they could add the baby backs to the duo meal for an extra $6.  Not wanting to get off the "high" of quitting my job, I relented.  This time I asked for no greens and they obliged.  When the meal came, the food was cold. (It was about 7:30pm; they close at 8:30.)  I tried not to let it get me down.  The $6 baby backs amounted to exactly two (2) bones.  And I'm not even quite sure I got the baby backs, because they were meaty and chewy (and cold), resembling St. Louis ribs (which I could have gotten at a discount).  Anyway, that's not my biggest complaint.  This time, for some reason, I found the BBQ sauce to be very spicy.  I don't recall it being spicy the first time around (otherwise, I would have marked it down).  So for those of you keeping count -- I recommend the brisket and the pork but NOT the "baby back ribs" -- and also, come here during lunch, when the food is presumably fresher and hotter.  Aside from that, I think I'm done here.  Not that I can afford to eat anymore, now that I'm an unemployed bum.  Merry Christmas.  I'm going to kill myself.

zNkvSB-OopwJtGWPuFUERg.text: Best BBQ in Vegas.  Don't worry about the neighborhood, definitively worth the trip.  The brisket is out of this world. They also have great sides.  My favorite though is the smoked chicken. Definitely worth this visit.

lWSEOw5pgy_rs3fR_3wgWg.text: Rollin Smoke BBQ = TOP NOTCH! This is definitely an amazing hidden secret of Las Vegas. Very friendly and inviting staff, perfect amount of choices on the menu and perfect portions!!! As far as the food... if you haven't pulled into the parking lot yet, you better hurry on up to eat some of the BEST BBQ! Burnt ends = delicious, ribs = juicy, Arkansauce = exploding with flavor! Service is wonderful. Antonio was a great help and friendly! Thanks Antonio!

5whbVMF4Svq1b7LBc80wlw.text: I'm giving this a 4 because my hubby loved this place. I would give it a 3. I'm a bit pickier with meat so I wasn't too impressed. I've had better in San Diego and NY believe it or not. We ordered the BBQ fries with pulled pork and the smoked meatloaf. The fries were good although the pork didn't really seem to have much flavor. The meatloaf was weird it wasn't your typical meatloaf. It was a lot of pork and fat, I did manage to find some lean pieces and the flavor was good. The Mac and cheese was pretty good but the star of the show were the corn nuggets. They were so sweet and crunchy I would go back just for those!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq nachos with pulled pork
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Meatloaf

tSOOluCZb_q_GV3bNfmk4w.text: given the hype, i was a bit disappointed.  nowhere near the best bbq i've ever had but for the price point and diverse menu it's not a bad choice if bbq is what you crave. could have been that we went late afternoon on a monday and the turnover isn't as high as peak times.  we got the pit special.  i found all the meats to be average at best and quite a few tasted re-heated.  the baby back ribs were not enjoyable for me. the bbq sauce was nice - found myself adding a lot to the meat to help the flavor.  the sides were excellent - we got: bacon potato salad, jalapeno cole slaw, and mac n cheese.  the cole slaw went well with a fork full of pulled pork (which wasn't all that good on it's own).  banana pudding was terrible, i threw it out. i can make it better myself and i'm no chef.  although i feel like we didn't really pig out to our normal extent, i was disgustingly full for the rest of the night.  felt like it expanded in my belly for hours to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pit special with Mac n cheese, cole slaw, and potato salad

K2jrLHA1IbR_DLhOavetzw.text: The food was good. I wasn't a fan of the seating area. It was awkward that the line at lunch time went around the tables of people sitting down eating. The group I was in sat in the other room which is outside the restaurant area and in another room. 4 stars for the food and 2 stars for the seating.

FcdDLM5PEsHeRGeHtcIbKQ.text: Super good! Cute spot, no frills. The ribs were delish! Ordered the Mac n cheese, fried okra and hush puppies. All really good!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

teQtC6XulJpQK5oZwi69ww.text: There aren't many BBQ joints in Vegas.  But I wasn't impressed.  Maybe because it was near closing time but they were out of green beans and Mac N Cheese and to make up for it they gave us extra helpings of onion rings.  Nothing was fresh.  The onion rings had been sitting around so they were oil drenched.  The cornbread was dry and pasty.  The baby back ribs were also very dry which made it taste like jerky.  I got a 1/2 pound of the burnt tip brisket and this item was also drenched in oil.  All this resulted in some sleep depriving acid reflux and searching for some antiacid medication   Look I don't really care but when you're paying 34$ just for the two meat items and the total bill coming to over 50$!  This place just wasn't worth it.  I thought with more than 2000 reviews I shouldn't have run into problems like this.  Is was highly dissatisfied and disappointed!  If I could cuss in this review I would!

MQki7XIGXHw2KxnYCkyGuw.text: As far as BBQ goes, Rollin Smoke is decent.  The menu is quite large and there are a lot of interesting items to choose from, including waffle fry nachos.  The burger is pretty mediocre (though it claims to be the best), but the rest on the menu is pretty good. My biggest gripe is the price.  It's as much to eat here as it is at a nice sit down restaurant. For a small shack that serves BBQ at picnic tables, it's a bit pricey. It certainly isn't the best BBQ I've ever had.  That being said, good BBQ in Vegas is virtually non-existent, and Rollin Smoke's existence is appreciated.  It's definitely worth a visit to see if it's your style of BBQ.

_eLPHGWrRhkE_AKwW8hM6w.text: Awesome. I came to LV from San Diego for fun and got hungry.  I am spoiled because I life close to the world famous Phil's BBQ in San Diego. This place is heads up with them. This is the best compliment I can give to a BBQ place.   We had the all you can eat, and everything was awesome, but the Beef Ribs have been world excellence!

IPfELVOYxNgQBTeQsB486A.text: Overall good experience.  I had the slider trio with a side of jalapeno coleslaw. Was expecting the slaw to knock my socks off but was anything to write home about. Pulled pork wasn't my favorite texture seemed more like pork roast. But the hot link was fantastic! Very spicy!  I was very disappointed with the country berry cobbler, lacked sweetness entirely. The place packed & decor and atmosphere were real homey. Liked the personal touches with their murals. We'll definitely go back. Looking forward to trying the smoked meatloaf.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slider trio. piggy, hot link, brisket. Side of jalapeno coleslaw
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z1KpEMr32ymBTXGC9PB62w.text: Pretty darn great barbeque. Don't be afraid of the line. It goes fast and it is worth it. Brisket, a little dry, but tasty. Ribs, beef and pork juicy and yummy. Sauce is not overbearing.

WgoUB5H-KpPyZ8j_u7zKgg.text: They said it was the best and they delivered.... New favorite BBQ! The burnt ends will melt in your mouth and the Mac and  cheese is super creamy with lots of flavor. Will be back again and again..

wVV-WxSUbxKfhbun_dX7wg.text: This is the BEST BBQ in town!. Very convenient from the Strip. Great service, always have pleasant staff.  The food is delicious, Try the Meatloaf or outlaw Bigger if you want a flavor adventure, but EVERYTHING IS GOOD! Chef Tim is AWESOME!

X3y8M9Yebea6TUPOdxB6PQ.text: An easier location is right across the parking lot from the Gold and Silver Pawn Shop, and this location is open on Sunday.  The BBQ was very good -- we had the brisket.  It was the sides that were surprising.  They were very good!  Potato salad with crumbled bacon bits and fresh chopped chives?  Yum!

58O5R2EJJyNbG6m4EQR2kg.text: OMG! Went to Rollin Smoke before the Clint Black concert.  Was easy to find due to friendly Yelper's directions.  The sexy smell of BBQ immediately welcomes you when you walk in the door.  Our order taker (sorry didn't get his name) determined the best combo when we told him what we wanted.  The corn bread was to unbelievably moist and delicious.  We would have ordered more for dessert with Blue Bell ice cream if we hadn't been so stuffed.  The beef ribs were huge and melted into smokey heaven in your mouth.  The brisket was plastic fork tender and moist.  You have to get corn nuggets - spicy fried creamed corned!  We were supposed to share but I ate more than my share!   They must be world famous as a large van of Aussies (in for Red Flag) filled up the place and took their orders to go!   The place has a lot of seating...can't wait to plan a lunch adventure for my co-workers!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ridiculously addicting corn nuggets and the best beef ribs ever!

4SQgylGJjwYwKobY8aIYWw.text: I was assisted by Lizelle and she was an excellent consultant while assisting me with my order. I ended up going with the rib platter, which was absolutely AMAZING. I'd recommend it to anyone visiting the area and needs some classic BBQ in their lives.

UPdbo7I3gKRvtD40trrjLQ.text: Good bbq with good sides, easy to order online delivery through one of the food delivery services, with a nice key lime dessert.

7J-cm54hrsMuCoDDRGbqEg.text: Better than expected. The food was great and tasty. A little out if the way but well worth the trip. I will definitely will come back again.

dBmjV0eXcliR9JDbBXtmPQ.text: This is the best BBQ I have had since Pappys Smoke house in St. Louis. If you come  to Vegas and you don't check this place out you got cheated.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The family getting ready to enjoy some great BBQ

jfdVFWa_JXXD3msSQyOj_Q.text: We ordered brisket, hot links, pulled pork, kickin beans, jalapeno coleslaw, fried okra, & cornbread. Every single thing I ate was delicious. The brisket & pulled pork basically melt in your mouth. The hot links were the perfect amount of spicy. The jalapeno coleslaw had was a great mix of spicy sweet. I enjoyed every last bite and I could go on for days about the corn bread. I can't remember the last time, if ever, I've had such delicious mouth watering moist cornbread. Stop reading this & just go...go now!!

O116FCxjidM6x6f6TNwPeQ.text: The food is excellent.  I recommend the spare ribs.  They are tender and juicy.    We sampled most of the meat dishes.  Everything is good here.  The BBQ sauce is spicy and you will want to dip all of the food in to it.  The desserts are also excellent.  Try the peach cobbler!  You can't go wrong.

x01H6DX-q_qTalkXb90q5g.text: BEST RIBS EVER!!!!!  We are from Texas and my hubby is a BBQ/Smoking fool, but even HE thought these ribs were exceptionally good!!!!  Everything else was excellent, but the ribs....TO DIE FOR!!!!!  Can't wait to visit next week again!!!!!

fbZR9QkrmnH_7YyfhdZLng.text: This is the best bbq in Vegas! We have tried several places and nothing can compare. Everything on the menu is so delicious you wanna come back the next day for more.

YjLXF7rWoZdhKB5LGFBuEQ.text: Just stopped by and had the Trio plate with some St. Louis and Babyback ribs to sample as well.... OMG... It was tender and delicious and you could taste just enough of the nice smoke. Brisket had beautiful smoke ring in it, the pulled pork and hot link were incredible and the ribs were great. While my friend enjoyed the babybacks more, I am a little torn as the meaty St. Louis ribs I got were incredible. Tough choice, i think the best to do is get both like I did. Haven't had the bbq chicken yet, but I will be back to try some and I will be sure to sing your praise to people looking for good bbq. I think halfway through my meal I realized i had stopped using my fork long ago and was fingers covered with delicious bbq sauce and goodness. Keep up what you are doing and I will be sure to be back!

PUKr4COybWK0Hm-R95nHbA.text: awesome spot for Real BBQ , met these guys when they first started a few years back, these guys are good businessmen but the food really sells itself, unlike most mainstream places out here this stuff it's the real deal n they take alot of pride in there cooking, always busy in there but it doesn't take too long to get your order even still, beef ribs , corn nuggets, bbq sundae!, yams!

s7btqRp2L-SmiXAtP6j7mA.text: This is an amazing BBQ joint! We discovered this place as a referral when we visited the guys from the show Tanked. We haven't been disappointed yet. We usually order the 3 meat and seafood combo. Definitely order the yams, they are very delicious!!!

TUz-teG0MrHWdVb6ZE0wWg.text: Some of the best BBQ on planet earth. The ribs, brisket, chicken, pulled pork, as well as the baked beans and potato salad were fantastic. Do not miss this joint when visiting Las Vegas.

7ncJBiuqR5ezVK-Hp02POg.text: Amazing food, great prices! Loaction is a little industrial but acceptable.  Can't wait o go back - the brisket is awesome!!!

HIS6bnEOxp3INuK63FDgGA.text: This place was number one on my list of places while in Vegas. I saw the BBQ meatloaf on the travel channel and it was a must try! Glad I did, the flavor exuded through the meatloaf, taste buds were in heaven. The ribs were tender and full of flavor, excellent sides, and the banana pudding topped off the meal. If you love BBQ, you cannot go wrong here. Will be back again before leaving Vegas!!!!

CZMn7zJSjD2K9NY6DFLshA.text: Excellent meat choices. I think this place is the best bbq place in Vegas. Reason why I give it a 4/5 is because they raised the price for the all you can eat deal. It is a bit on the expensive side.

5mcG1agGTOA_Dn4mbzLmhA.text: Went here with my father today and the barbecue was so tender and juicy. We shared the $19.99 deal where you can pick 4 different meats and 3 different sides! It was a great value and we had a lot of leftovers. Definitely recommend the brisket as a meat. It was very tender. For sides, the beans were great as well. The fried onions were very crispy and flavorful, but I couldn't eat that many as it is fried. Super delicious!

SDnjSS1-MIjOttdewjkceA.text: 3 stars A-ok. The location kinda creeped me out being in the shady gentlemans club part of town. The ambience was pretty down to earth. and The food was all right. It wasnt the best bbq I have ever had but its far from the worst. The only real complaint I have is that I smelled of smoke after eating. I guess its True to the name rolling smoke. Good but not great.

3P0gun7ydFq4dbV3uddd9g.text: The food is good but needs more choices of bbq sauce. The one they have on the table is ok.  The brisket on the sandwich was chopped - would have been better if it was sliced.  The inside setup of the restaurant is a little bit awkward. The fountain drinks are in a closet. The person taking your order in behind a huge podium - you can barely see them.  The bathroom is well....... sad. The bathroom is nearly like a gas station's - useful but don't touch anything.  The paper towel dispenser fell off the wall, but nobody put a roll of towels on the counter so you can dry your hands off. They have rolls of towels on every table - just not in the bathroom.  Looks like the owner spent way more money on the mural in the 2nd dining area than in the rest of the place.

Ph3GjBnwQEgHBws89nTxDA.text: Great food, great prices, great service and a casual dining atmosphere. I would have to say it's the best BBQ in Vegas.

u1zf1WotjVQLvFOGrks7uA.text: This place is LEGIT! It does BBQ for real and conveniently located off the Strip. Pulled pork sandwich and rib plate was yummy. Don't expect the glam scene//// but will get great customer service and the food.

oOEDOodg7rDzfJTpKumk1A.text: After friends told me this is the best year they've had out here in Vegas I had to give it a shot and I will say that it is a very worthy spot if you're looking for quality barbecue the flavors and portions are solid. Not the best I have ever had and I have traveled cross-country and had Memphis Kansas City Texas and North Carolina, but this Q is worthy of a revisit so is worthy of four stars

aDmbo1D5W5PRH0RYnrTmvA.text: My boss was coming into town and I know he likes BBQ so I turned to Yelp and found this place!  We arrived at the restaurant at around 1:30pm on a Thursday afternoon.  It was crowded, but we managed to find a table in the back.  I can certainly see how popular this place could get on the weekends or evenings!  We both ordered the Trio special and had pulled pork, ribs and burnt edge brisket.  The pork was very good and the ribs were delicious!  The burnt edges were a bit fatty for both of us, but the sauce on the tables was very tasty indeed!  I had the waffle fries and a side of mac and cheese - both very tasty.  Service was fantastic and everyone who worked there was friendly and accommodating to our questions about the menu.  I will definitely be returning with the family now that I've found this place!  Boss enjoyed it as well and will probably return next time he's back in town.  Definitely a word-of-mouth place as you won't pass by this place unless you do business on Industrial/Highland!

gIY9iBLTMW36J0GIe-DrrA.text: Fabulous BBQ.  Before this joint, the best BBQ I have had was a tie between a place in Raleigh, NC and the shack on Corpus Christi Naval Air Station in TX.  Very authentic, not too smokey but just right.  The beans were nothing short of incredible.  Next time I will be trying the jalapeno cole slaw.  I certainly hope business is good for them because it is downright impossible to find reasonably priced, authentic bbq in Vegas.  Good advertising having the smokers in the parking lot or else I would never have known it was there.   Only suggestion I would make would be to add more sides such as collards, etc.

0hQAD2-TTZuGMLv07mOSmg.text: place was just ok.  not cheap. people were nice and friendly.  ribs just ok. beans were the best i have ever had.  not good enough to go back again.

kY6mMqEGNS2QaVI_Z15tDg.text: All that needs to be said is...  BEST PLACE FOR BBQ IN LAS VEGAS! HANDS DOWN!!  The beef rib is blow your mind, amazing!   I try to come here as often as I can, anytime I have a hankering for BBQ! Plus, you know it's a good sign when you can see the Smoker out front and when you open your car door, you get a whiff of them smoking some meats!  DON'T GO ANYWHERE ELSE FOR BBQ OR IT WILL BE A MISTAKE!

bYemTFfqVERGs40PIwrWgQ.text: I never eat beef ribs but boy this place makes them so delicious! ! I'm currently eating our leftovers cold and it's still good!  Definitely coming back.

vQF9jPyt8wCpq9hwtY0r3A.text: Best bbq I've ever had. And I've had a shit ton of bbq. I don't really do sides but the links and brisket were out of this world. I'd skip the chicken, it was kinda dry.

OrW4XH-P6BdzIGQvnSH8RA.text: Was recommended to come here by a local while on vacation with my bf. I ordered the 2-meat combination with one side. I chose the ribs and quarter white meat chicken with loaded mashed potatoes. My bf ordered a brisket po boy sandwich with seasoned fries. The ribs were tender and good but, didn't have a lot of meat on them and only got 2 ribs. However, I wasn't feeling the bbq sauce very good. The breast of the chicken was dry so, I didn't eat it. The mashed potatoes weren't really creamy and reminded me of KFC's mashed potatoes with cheese, bacon, and green onions added. My bf's sandwich had about 3 slivers of brisket on a big bun, with a ton of lettuce and done pickles. He said he liked it but, expected more meat on the sandwich. I agree,  the portions are pretty small and knew I'd be hungry later. I'd come back but, only for the ribs to-go. My bf would probably order the brisket by the pound. Service was just ok, nothing special.

q8dgKSX2H6hHPu62k1DjBg.text: Great food for great prices!! We're from Los Angeles and were looking around for some good bbq before our hotel check-in time and found this little place behind the strip on here. It had great reviews so we decided to try it out. My husband ordered a 4 meat plate with 3 side for just $19.99! I've been to places that charge at least double (sometimes triple) for all that food. It's meant to feed 2 people or one very hungry person, like in my husband's case. I had a brisket sandwich for $7.99. I usually like bbq sauce to be sweet and tangy, and their sauce has a little kick of spice. I loved it!  Everything was delicious & we will definitely be back soon... maybe for a couple of sandwiches for the drive home!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great prices!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket sandwich and 4 meat plate with 3 sides! Wow!

w1ST3meWmKNAkK32Nwx8nw.text: This place is awesome! The food was unbelievably great! I had the Outlaw Burger and I must say that was undeniably the best hamburger I have ever had. Everyone that visits Vegas has tendency to stick to the big places on the strip but it is well worth your time to explore what else Vegas has to offer. You must try Rollin Smoke! You will not be disappointed.

9L5CVJNb7UhD7Bj5hLb9fQ.text: The best BBQ spot in Vegas! Too bad it is only one location.    Got a full rack of beef ribs for delivery.  I could taste smokiness through the sauce and meat was tender.  Normally I prefer my beef ribs woth dry rub and no sauce but I didnt order that way since it is my first time and I fear it too be too dry (been burned by other BBQ joints this way) but i would imagine it wouldve been great and will order this way next time.    This place is a gem and highly recommended.

2yzx_MXqgiWZKZ1S6ZPFwg.text: I love this place! The main reason is because as they've grown you can see it in the improvements of their restaurant. It won't be much longer before they are hiring Front of the House staff to man the tables!   The food is good, The staff is nice. I like that they are getting their name out there and a local business being successful.   On this trip I had the chicken, which is always good in flavor and spare rib, in the duo smokin plate. The spare rib was tender and tasty. I got the jalapeno coleslaw...it's so good! The BF got the Brisket Dog, omg! If I wasn't eating right, I'd devour that whole thing without a second thought! It was so good, anything with nacho cheese is good! The BF got the potato salad, which was basic but the bacon of course added a yummy touch!   We love this place! We wish it much success and don't forget your free dessert with your Yelp check in.

mE_dQmuUrzxdqPObeS9JTA.text: How have I never been here before? Foods great and large portioned. They have Togo boxes, sauces, everything you need at a separate counter. The kid who brings the food out to you is a nice touch as well!

c7jZLJwX5T2G2KSLgIoA4Q.text: There's really so much delicious food thats affordable off the strip!  Luckily a friend of ours rented a car for our vegas weekend so we all came here for some delicious BBQ!  The place was pretty packed when we got there but they were quick to take orders and expedite the line. You order first then find your seat so be ready!   Everyone in my group was so hungry that we didn't even entertain the thought of sharing (which we really should have) and we all ordered separately.  I opted for the chicken wings with the sweet corn pups and a side of catfish. One of my friends got the meatloaf and others got the ribs and brisket sampler deals.  OMG SOOO MUCH FOOD!!! I loved the sweet corn pup things an the catfish was sooo good. Battered just right with alot of catfish meat. My wings were pretty tasty. I went for the mild sauce as its blazing hot in vegas already and I didn't want to suffer by eating hot and spicy buffalo wings. I really wanted to though ;(  Oh they also have sweet tea! Yes... I love bbq and this place does it right. Next time my friends and I will definitely go for the family meals and will split it lol!

aUNFOcjqwvscx9Mn4BsCEQ.text: Mmmmm. sooooo goooooood!  Every chance I get I sneak away here on my lunch break from work. The meat is so tender and flavorful. I must say I use a gallon of their delicious barbecue sauce on my pulled piggy sandwich. Sorry not sorry. When I get back to work everyone is so jealous when they smell how amazing I smell from all that smoked barbecue goodness.  Prices are great and you get a whole lot of delicious food. Sides are pretty delectable too. I typically go with the corn bread though, it comes with two big squares.  I leave this place so happy, full and smelling of smoked meat but it's so worth it!  Not to mention the staff are super friendly and will remember you since you'll become a regular here.

21xy5dV-8kFz0wjPwJmuMg.text: Stopped in earlier tonight and had the "world famous" beef ribs as recommended by Matt. I couldn't have been happier with the food & service! Will be back soon.

vDy-pk8tmRcOgYB9ILjk0Q.text: Wow - simply the best meal I had in Vegas last week.   Much better than the very high priced restaurants on the strip.  I had the baby back ribs, and a colleauge had the 4 meat plate with chicken, hot link, brisket and ribs.    My baby backs were better than any I have had - ever.   Great smoke flavor, tender, and simply delicious.      I'm looking forward to my next trip to Vegas and visit to Rollin Smoke.  Wooooooo  Pig Sooooooie

VXzIBEmPMpcmvEbOIqSYoA.text: Was in Vegas for three days and found a great place to eat Bar-B-Q. I had the Ribs my wife had the pulled pork.  I've had a lot of good ribs before but this was a taste pleasing experience.  The room was clean and best of all it had the game on.  Are server was very nice and helpful which made it pleasant.  (Antonio) He not only recommended some of the sides to get next time,but brought me a sample.  He helped us to the car with are leftovers and helped me with my son (he's in a wheelchair) get in.  We will definitely return.

K_sAyjb0aed7D1L0GMZz6Q.text: WOW! So Great  My son and I went there for late lunch. I ordered the Biggie Dad, (brisket, pork, and hot link) on a bun with pickles, mac n cheese. My son got same. We really 3 enjoyed it. We back and order one to go, and the Guy ask me if I was local, said Yes! He ask me since I had on my Danica Patrick shirt if I like Nascar, said yes. He gave 4 free tickets to the truck race this weekend. How cool is that! A great place to return back too.

XNyfntd6aP7eRXScw210DA.text: These guys have the best BBQ in LV. The chopped Brisket and the Beef Ribs are the highlights and are must tries. The customer service is top notch and they have a locals discount (every little bit helps).   Only drawback is they are closed on Sundays! LOL

N-C2QTMqPDTOTMHYOpiQsQ.text: I don't know how I've never had this BBQ or even heard of it, really.  But some BBQ showed up for a catered work lunch and boy was it good.  Now I'm going to have to make a trip to the restaurant to see what it's all about.  I think the best BBQ I had in Vegas  before Rollin Smoke was Famous Dave's, and Famous Dave's sucks.  Glad to know there's good BBQ in Vegas!

-eAOPVzwKJdRlQv8RbvkpQ.text: No line when we arrived, but busy. We were able to find a seat. I was surprised how small it is.  I ordered the beef ribs, and we got the waffle fries and corn nuggets. My DH ordered the spare ribs, and tot the beans with his ribs.  The service was excellent. Very nice people. The food came rather quickly. It was generous portions. Too much for 2 people.  I was only able to finish one rib, it was flavorful and had a lot of meat on it. The waffle fries were crispy, the star for me was the corn nuggets. So addicting.  My husband enjoyed his ribs, the meat fell off the bone. He said the beans were a little sweet.  All in all we had a good meal.

4BvupUlD4rQeL3fo7jLk7Q.text: Amazing bbq!! Huge portions but very reasonable prices and a lot of options. The brisket was definitely the best followed by pulled pork. My group went with the 4 meat, 3 side sampler and it was plenty to share. Probably five people could eat off this plate! Everyone working there was super friendly and the environment was great! Will definitely be back when in the mood for good bbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xms2Lx0_ilI7HrcgIGHjww.text: I tried Rollin smoke on a whim and I'm very glad I did! I had the three sliders combo; two pulled pork and one brisket. For a side, potato salad with smoked bacon. It was very tasty and filling. The only reason I didn't give five stars was because some of the pulled pork was a bit dry; it was easily remedied with copious use of house BBQ sauce!

PPO9gig-pIK8MWcyvNmUlA.text: Tried this place the last time in Vegas. I have to stop by again to validate that the FOOD IS AS GOOD as any review on here. I know BBQ..and they got BBQ. Stomach could not handle eating anything more. Thats why i have to go back and try the rest of the menu. This is where I will have my breakfast when I land. Don't overdress....the smoke is in the air literally and you will smell like BBQ.

mVw8ENpV11S7v5Fqj_3W7w.text: This place is reminiscent of a bbq place back in L.A.. Unfortunately, that place now sucks, and this place is the new old place.

ERA4SuOyu8y8WK5mPkRyvg.text: Best BBQ I've had!! So glad we found this place. Pork, spare ribs, corn bread, green beans, Mac n cheese, and baked beans were fabulous.. Full of flavor!! I think it's awesome they give locals a discount too!  I will definitely return very soon.

AFAdcmQY6NRykKzmY02ZvA.text: Went on friend's recommendation. Had better. Meats were fatty and had MUCH better barbecue sauce around town. Needs some work:-(

RIq98F8_FkbaXuBypnqpuQ.text: Was in Vegas for fury on ice. We wanted bbq after the game so I yelped bbq places in Vegas. This little gem of a place had such great reviews we had to try it. We get there and the line is to the door. Lucky for us most of the customers were taking their meals to go. That's always a good sign as this is a favorite of locals. We found sitting outside before we knew it out food was in front of us. The food is great there were about 8 of us so it seems we tried about everything. I didn't taste a thing that wasn't good. Our new go to place when visiting or passing through Vegas.

nuewADAkLz6c0CS_x5AMkA.text: I don't write reviews much unless something is worth sharing or a place needs more reviews. In this case, I just HAVE to rave about this place even if it has more than enough reviews. The stars it dawns are definitely earned. If you love meat or Southern food, you can't go wrong here. I've had my fair share of meat experience and Rollin Smoke BBQ is high on that list.   The Food: "Pit Special" - $20 + tax You receive 4 meats of your choice and 4 sides plus a drink. Portions are pretty big although I'm on the smaller side (4'10, 90lb) so an average build will definitely not leave hungry. I got the brisket, spare ribs, hot link, pork, potato salad, corn nuggets, Mac n cheese, and lastly corn bread. The meat was delicious, some bits were dry but nothing too bad, mostly moist and falling off the bone. Cooked well with a little pink in the brisket and ribs, subtle smoky flavor, and had a slice of bread to cushion the goodies. The corn nuggets remind of corn muffins I've had growing up in the Philippines (corns bits, crunchy bread) so I loved them but it might be a hit or miss for others. The corn bread is TO DIE FOR. Soft, moist, amazing flavor. Boyfriend had to promise me that we'd take some home when we leave Vegas back to LA - it's just that good. Can't vouch for the other two sides since I was too full to try them and I don't want to review it non-fresh. 5/5  Atmosphere: Spacious considering the location. Has outdoor seating and a private party room to the side. Couple flatscreens to entertain you. Steel tables - easy to clean and sanitize. No napkins, just a huge roll of paper towel since you're bound to get down and dirty. Interesting mural of people on the wall and mascot merch scattered around. All in all, eating there was good. 3/5  Customer Service: You order and pay at the front then seat yourself. Cashier was nice enough, not super welcoming but helped me out with recommendations and they were all hits :) Although she did accidentally charge me extra on the 4th side (put as separate from the Pit Special) coming out to $25 instead, no biggie if it's not a repeat mistake. I only saw 3 staff on the floor: main cashier and the other two switching off delivering food and checking up on customers. The one guy was very nice and welcoming! 4/5   Definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pit Special is definitely a good way to sample their menu!

VpOq2RoPJiCAf1PhoLJEVg.text: We just enjoyed a great dinner. The brisket was prefect. The pork was delicious. The yams and macaroni and cheese were tasty. We will definitely be back!

srWcyRYsiWePYe6ui4lf5w.text: The most tasty BBQ ribs in Las Vegas have no rival fair priced as well other location is kind of hidden it doesn't matter it's worth the drive

fwUitPtmArPTja0zMTylSQ.text: This is seriously the best BBQ in Vegas by far.  I've never been disappointed in their food.  The brisket is amazing.  The yams are the best I've ever had in my life.  I'm addicted!

y2Ns5anUve6uhZ4eGRwdcQ.text: Honestly I should have stayed closer to home and went to Famous Dave's. I wanted to be impressed with Rollin' Smoke and unfortunately I wasn't. Cool logo, but customer service and food was sub par. We were greeted (I take that back, the order lady, Sophia) just glared at us when we stepped up to order. No hi or hello, it was like we were annoying her. She treated everyone like this so I didn't feel singled out. We got our food, brisket sandwich and pulled piggy sandwich. I felt like the meat could only be saved by drowning it in sauce. Mac and Cheese and Cornbread was good, but I wanted great BBQ and it came up short. The restaurant is a weird layout too. If it's a cold day sit in the inner portion of the restaurant. The area by the order counter is by the door which never closes. Even the employees won't shut it when they go in and out, so it can get cold while you are eating. There are better BBQ joints in town...I suggest trying another place.

Vr67fcYYJMbJV3j1sywWjg.text: This place is unbelievable. It is not in the best area but the food is always on point. You never don't get a good meal here. My pork was fantastic the bread and meet were perfect. I would suggest to anyone and the service is great. They also just won the national champ for bbq. This place will fill your crave.

7eKAFgjSxtVIClYTsCs6Ow.text: A rare 5 star review (check my rating distribution). For me to give 5 stars, the place has to be so good that I cannot wait to come back........my first visit, and I'm a.ready planning the next trip! I got the sliced brisket and pulled pork......both were so flavorful that they didn't really need any sauce, but I used just a slight splatter. The brisket had a beautiful smoke ring, and the pork was perfectly tender. The loaded mash was really good as well.....tons of great favors. My wife doesn't like meat, so she got the catfish po boy, and loved it. Then she tried some of my pulled pork, and loved it even more! She now wants to come back and get the pork! Thank you Rollin Smoke, you have brought my wife over to the dark side, and we can now enjoy BBQ together! One last thing, everyone there is super friendly, and even the pit master came out to see how we were enjoying our food. It is evident to me that everyone there really takes pride in serving a superior product! I'll be back, even though it is in a "medium scary" neighborhood!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked meatloaf....nothing like no other meatloaf you&#39;ve ever had, totally different

rGNCiyqtGUfmLSoAvt2JIQ.text: Rolling in deliciousness!   As a local, I have found it difficult to track down the best bbq in Las Vegas, but after walking into Rollin Smoke I was assured I had come to the right place. The intoxicating smell of authentic bbq smokiness gave my sense of smell a run for its money and my hope was that my taste buds would follow along in happiness. I was so pleasantly surprised as the ribs, pulled pork, brisket and chicken arrived at our table. We ordered the four meat, three side combo to be able to try a little bit of everything. The sides we picked included the jalapeno cole slaw, bbq beans, mac and cheese and an extra side of dirty Vegas rice and cornbread. You know you've come to the right spot when everything you try is finished with an mmmm sound, a smile and a look of agreeable satisfaction to the person you are dining with. Just to describe a few, the brisket had an intense flavorful smoke on it you could see and was tender and delicious. The ribs were perfectly large and full of rich meat with a sweet intense spice rub. The jalapeno cole slaw was crunchy, a little spicy and had just enough dressing without drowning it. The mac and cheese was the perfect cheese sauce to noodle ratio with noodles cooked just right without drying out the dish. The cornbread was cooked perfectly,  sweet and salty with a warm layer of melted butter on the bottom that made it a little more guilty of being just so good. We look forward to going back and letting our friends know this is where they can find the best bbq in town. Thanks for bringing great bbq to Vegas!

RXycLUhmU2YwD45S0JwayQ.text: Don't let the the outside and the neighborhood deceive you.  As soon you open the doors,  it's like being transported in to a Devine BBQ place.  The smell,  the people,  the food it's what's all about.  This is damn good BBQ.

zXH-wR2fEBpQUpJz3QgAIQ.text: Double check your bank accounts because they will add more to the tip after you hand them in the merchant copy.

sY_S4JHM9AHkp0mohXNd4Q.text: First time we went and it is was great, this time we showed up fifteen minutes before closing, who would have thought any place is closed before 10 in Vegas lol but it was 7.45 and they were. FYI to management, MULTIPLE taxi loads full of people had to be turned away while we were sitting outside so you are missing out on business with those crazy early hours. We were told nothing fried could be ordered as the deep fryers were off. Look, if you're open to 8, have all the food til 8. Jeez. So, the ribs we spent $30 on were so dry and old, we felt slighted. Friendly staff but really, that's not enough. I can say for sure that was our second and last trip there. There's way too many places that want business to deal with old and dried out food we had to dump in the trash. Passing on this place permanently and I work with many tourists on the strip daily and always recommended this place but never again.

9xRKSoZUtcLtTmL7Y8d_Yg.text: Best BBQ       Meat Trio Rocks!!!                          Brisket Dog !!                                                 by Far off the hook , who ever has not being at this place does NOT know Vegas. Any thing that you order is FINGER LICKING awesome.   Keep doing a great job guys .

jnZR5ym_eRJlR05IhASceA.text: Just went and picked up a Big Mans from Rollin Smoke to have everyone in my office here in Henderson try it. Lets just say that everyone LOVE'S it. I had told everyone here in the office about it a while back but everyone lives out here in Henderson and never goes on the other side of town. From the time I walked in the door the smell of great BBQ filled up the offices. Everyone came out of their office to the front room and gasp of how much food and how great it smelt. I will always give John Holland and the guys at Rollin Smoke a 5 star. For a guy from AR he sure does know his stuff. I would also Like to say that Chief Yancey can make a MEAN melt. SOOOOO GOOD..  Love this pleace and Love the guys there.

yEth7OLc-SsU-CmthhVnMg.text: This place is really good BBQ, I hate fat and gristle so I stay away from some of the meats; I got the hotlink sandwich, the baked beans, and loaded mashed potatoes. It was all very good. The location has something to be desired. During the day I felt fine; I have a feeling at night the safe factor goes way down. Two, what I assumed to be, strippers were here when we got lunch and one of them out right propositioned my boss. After a good laugh we all sat down and ate our meal. Everyone was full and pleased. It seems this place gets more business by the day. During the lunch hour they ran out of seats and the line can build up quickly.

w0Wgzm7oGxqdEFEWhNSVgA.text: I am currently pregnant and as everybody knows it's not easy to please a pregnant lady.  I had the smoked meatloaf and it was DELICIOUS! you do leave smelling like smoke but it's worth it. not too pricey. We even took the leftovers home and i had enough for for three others meals. I'd def. recommend it!

6Ts5C0nA2bQJUJhSmpEOZQ.text: Best ribs I've ever had in my life. Meat fell apart perfectly from the bone, they weren't stingy with portions and it was perfectly sinful, making our vacation in sin city even more memorable.

OwetuwX_ezai2ilrXlDzNw.text: Bomb.com thanks it was the best bbq ever. I will be back. All the way from the 206. You have to come eat here. Service was a 10 for sure

zuR342a9piAvn7JL4D0Vew.text: Aren't expectations a bitch sometimes?  With over 700 reviews and a 4.5 star average, as well as numerous esteemed Yelpers referring to Rollin Smoke Barbecue as the "best bbq in town" I had fairly high expectations for my first visit. Sadly, I was not blown away.  Allison S., Dyanna L. and I met up at Rollin Smoke with our men for dinner on a recent Saturday evening. From the parking lot the place smelled amazing, so we quickly got in line to order. Rollin Smoke is a order-first-then-seat-yourself kind of establishment which I have no problem with. I do wish the tables were wiped down more regularly though, as the one we were at was rather dirty.   Our food was ready very quickly. My husband and I both got the 2 meat plate; brisket and chicken for him, ribs and pork for me. Each came with a side (green salad for him, loaded mashed potatoes for me) as well as a 'roll' which is really just a slice of bread.   For me, good bbq means good ribs, and ribs will always be what I judge BBQ on.  This is where Rollin Smoke fell flat. The ribs were tough, not the fall-off-the-bone that I expected (and read about in other reviews). The flavor was ok, certainly not amazing. The pork was better, my husband's brisket was good, and Allison let me try some of her hot link which was excellent.   Perhaps it was just an off evening for Rollin Smoke? I will certainly go back and try the ribs again, but for the time being I can not give Rollin Smoke more than an A-OK rating.  NOTE: The price for All-You-Can-Eat has gone up to $34.99. Website is not updated as of 1/5/15.

zvCXYYjQNdF-s57rb7EAfA.text: Pork and brisket were awesome, ribs were a little dry but everything else was great. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo with ribs pork and brisket!

U-BQdcCjy0Cr5zw13jVcvw.text: This place is in the cut. But the food here is great!! Don't get discouraged by its location. It's worth it!! People said it's a hole in the wall. I disagree it's just the location. The Brisket here is BOMB.

yOkFYWvvMBj0YrDSPz--sQ.text: The beef brisket was delicious & very filling - I couldn't even finish it!  The beef ribs were HUGE and fell off the bone. Try the Mac & cheese if you like pepper - but it's good.  The owners are 2 brothers from Arkansas who really take pride in their southern BBQ food. It's not far off the strip and they have 3 big smokers right in front.  You have to keep your eye out for it or you might drive by - like we did!    Definitely give them a try - it will be worth it.

Only disappointment is as this place has become more popular the prices have gone up and the portions has gotten smaller.  Hubby always gets meat trio.  You used to get 3 sides with it and now you only get 1 for the same price as before.   A must while in Vegas........I just hope the popularity doesn't diminish the quality over time.

UuuWWULPFDMZMdhakQBOKg.text: I'm sure this review won't make much of a difference HOWEVER...This BBQ restaurant has to be the biggest joke!! They never get orders right, they let people take orders who are slow, bag the food and forget items every single time! The food is mediocre and over priced! I would advise you to go somewhere else to get BBQ...except Las Vegas doesn't have any other places that are non commercial franchises, except Famous Daves, so I would advise you to go there instead! I will never give them my money ever again! You shouldn't either! If I could give them zero stars, I would!

pkdBPSwE6uLUXS92E4AqhA.text: There were 10 of us in our group for lunch. Everyone loved their meals with no complaints! Service was really good. Stand in line to order and it is quickly delivered to your table. Very rustic decor. We will return!

A2eUd-IcSjvV7o7fM7Bqjg.text: Is it overreaching to say that Rollin' Smoke is the best barbeque in Vegas? I am not sure why it has taken me so long to visit. I just know that I will be coming around more often. If I could, I would have eaten more. My eyes were hoping for dessert, but my stomach said no way.  I got the rib plater and it was amazing. It comes with a monster of a beef rib, three baby backs, and two spareribs. For $17.99, you get a side and a drink with it. I got the kickin' beans and added the jalapeno coleslaw for $2 more. BBQ beans are often too sweet for me. Here, too. The coleslaw though is delicious. The perfect balance of creamy and spicy. The baby backs were my least favorite of the bunch. Mine were somewhat dry. I needed to smother them in their housemade BBQ sauce. Usually beef ribs can be tough, but I pulled the whole thing off the bone and inhaled. It was huge and contained so much meat.   They have a $34.99 AYCE option for anything on the menu, but I felt like I was about to die after half of my plate.

OObWha5gNgYnV3c_9NxEiA.text: Great BBQ in Vegas!  I'd give it 5 stars if they still had Beef Ribs on their lunch menu as opposed to being Ala cart!  Great place and great brisket!

8AMu3Y-kKCUgLAvREb05nA.text: The place to be if you have a barbecue hankering.  I do mean because they cover everything.  I have BBQ ribs, baby BBQ ribs, pulled pork brisket it is a meat lovers delight. The prices are quite reasonable the portions are huge. Service is quick and the atmosphere is average but the food more than makes up for it.  I must say upon finding the location you will feel like you dropped out of Vegas (dark surrounding) but the building  itself is lit nucely. If you're a True barbecue lover I highly recommend that you stop by and give this place a try you will not be disappointed.
