NqxQgcd_B53eVAJHWeUOBw.text: Must try! I have been coming to this location for over a year. The food is always consistent and tasty. My last visit I came with family on a Saturday night and was surprised that it wasnt busy. This was the first time I tried the meatloaf. Man oh man its so fire! The meat is super soft and smoky flavor is amazing. The bed of mashed potatoes it sits on are super creamy and seasoned so good. Its topped with the best crispy fried onions. The stuffed potato is huge and stuffed with meat but is a great starter for two. All of the sides are pretty good too! The green beans are my fave as they are mixed with parm cheese- Yum! The sweet tea is nice and sweet and perfect compliment to the meal.  The banana is fantastic as well. You can tell its made daily because the bananas are not brown and the pudding is just the right sweetness. One of the best BBQ joints in town!

oCp8-nm6CnQOtGoXDBFS2g.text: Ordered food for delivery. I have never been a huge fan of BBQ, but this place changed my tune. The meat was absolutely delicious. Hefty portions for a reasonable price considering both the quantity and quality provided. Don't fear ordering past your limits, as the meat makes for excellent leftovers.  This will absolutely be a go-to spot anytime I am in Las Vegas. Without hesitation the best BBQ I have ever had, and easily one of the best meals I've had in Vegas, including the high-end establishments.

NOuAPwbkwT3x_zyG7mI5qg.text: Brisket has a great Central Texas flavor.  Sides were good. Hot links are traditional.

dqQPe8ts_yotvemzCx4Ktw.text: WOW! Found this place on Yelp when I was researching for my Vegas Vacation and NEEDED to try it...please check out their pictures if you are still indecisive!  Full rack of ribs consists of 4 very LARGE ribs! Yes, they are fatty but honestly, fatty bbq is the best especially when you have that charred layer. The meat was moist and pretty much fall of the bone....so good. My husband said they were probably the best beef ribs he's ever had and I agree. Where do they sell ribs this big in stores??  Burnt end sandwich was BOMB! Also very fatty but still delicious. The shrimp po' boy was also very good.   Don't forget to order a side of corn nuggets especially if you've never had them before.

uCs4O4SDczO6rd38EkhbQg.text: Doesn't live up to the Hype.   I grew up on BBQ and I've traveled the U.S. and BBQ is a go-to. This place is basically glorified rib-crib.   It's okay. I did not get sick and I got the amount of food promised but nothing was wow and leftovers stayed in the fridge for days.

LVM3brWqTRvFFt71jGtF7g.text: Wow that's some seriously fine meat!  No, I'm not talking about all those strip clubs in the vicinity, I mean lip-smacking delish Southern-style BBQ at Rollin Smoke BBQ!  And by smoke, I don't mean the big dispensary that recently opened up nearby either!  I had some relatives flew in for the SEMA car show and they texted us to meet up for lunch.  They picked Rollin Smoke due to the sheer number of Yelp Reviews (2000+) and 4.5-star average!  I am no BBQ connoisseur; however I really liked the food we ordered.  The pit special came with 5 meats including spare ribs (which my wife loved),  pulled pork, chopped brisket, smoky sausage and skin-on, bone-in chicken with very juicy meat.  I liked how everything was seasoned and lightly sauced if at all.  After all, they have lots of options for sauces for you, ranging from sweet, vinegary, tangy, to downright hot and spicy!  The other excellent aspect are the sides.  The Collard Greens were perfect - just bitter enough, while the yams were sweet.  The surprise dish and everyone's favorite were these sweet corn fritters that was a hybrid between a tater tot and cream corn.  The sliders trio was also okay- it comes with your choice of meat.  Franky, its probably better to stick to getting more ribs or other items ala carte.   Definitely worth getting an Uber ride down here for a group pig-out lunch!

5BGxgRfHYLIAJ15jLmghVw.text: Yummy!!! The Pit Special came with a ton of food enough for 2 people for sure with some leftover. The collard greens were amazing so were the beans brisket spareribs neck everything was just downright good. The employees were very nice and efficient.

AK5xUCOje34VwqY0-yI8Hg.text: Yum Yum Yum. It really scratches any BBQ itch you might have. Lots of bold flavors, lots of meat. I had a Beef Rib, Brisket and Burnt Ends. I wish the ends weren't so fatty. I love the fat just it was a bit much. Beans were perfect. Love that slice of bread underneath that soaks up all that BBQ :) Overall a treat to have a place like this in Las Vegas. They are serious about BBQ!

T9etLbdMPMjElkYT2Q_Lzw.text: Excellent Food, and service!  If there is a problem, kinda like in Jamaica..."no problem...if there is, they solve it.  Food is great,y favorite is the whole wings...they were fresh, great taste.  Cajun rice was a little salty, but the wonderful lady, gave me my option to replace, which I did.  Try the friend corn bites, amazingly good!

JOlfw0KnZgbglhxF8HrwyQ.text: Great food. Not a huge fan of the sauces, but the sweet one was enjoyable. Both my Uber's asked how I knew about this place and they said it's one of the best and more affordable BBQ places in Vegas. Took off one star because the cashier looked like he didn't want to help anyone or seemed annoyed when questions were asked. Other workers were nice.

8Tx33W37z8el4FBADE1ptw.text: Amazing barbecue. The sauces were incredible but totally unnecessary because the meat was seasoned perfectly. I think I found my new favorite restaurant in Las Vegas!  The Arkansauce sauce blew my mind and the staff was really helpful and awesome.   Seriously, the reviews about this place are True! Get off the strip and get some good food!

frZXZCwKXZWzWiZ9Cx6H8g.text: Got the three brisket combo, was some of the best bbq I have had! Sliced, chopped, and burnt ends. The chopped brisket was my favorite. Corn bread was excellent as well. One of the few places I found sweet tea during my stay as well!

X04fl8JxhoStlZftxn5VNQ.text: This place was so good! I got the pulled piggy sandwich with loaded mash and my husband got the burnt ends sandwich (which disappeared before I was able to take a photo of it). Highly recommend for quick good meal and friendly staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled Piggy Sandwich Combo

GuoLKzQIEab11dLzRJWt3w.text: Typical smokehouse...very good and tasty but nothing extraordinary. My favourite was the brisket 3 ways. It wasn't cheap...it turned out to be approx 23usd per person. Just note, the seats were quite uncomfortable.

O8FrJmUTLDFEbETnTE6AIw.text: Oh Wow! I'm very impressed with this place from their pit sampler to their outlaw burger, this place has it all! It has everything you would think a smoke house BBQ place should have and more! My pit sampler had 5 meats to try and included Smoked Brisket, Smoked Ribs, Smoked Chicken (thigh & drum), Smoked Pulled Pork, and who can forget the Smoked Sausage Links. Their Outlaw Burger was featured in one of the travel channel's TV Show as well as the Food Network's TV show and lastly was on many different YouTube Channel Show's. All these shows had one thing in common and that was it put me on the Hunt for Rolling Smoke Barbeque and to try as many different items as I could! The Outlaw burger was not a let down not by any means. You could tell the burger meat itself was blended with brisket and ground sirloin, and the put into the smoker to cook to perfection before serving it! As for their 3 sides that comes with my Pit Sampler I choose their famous Cheesy Mac N Cheese, Loaded Mashed Potato's, and their Corn Nuggets. I also order in addition some of their moisten Corn Bread, some of their Waffle Fries with a special rub on them (Amazing), and lastly 2 8oz tubs of their House BBQ Sauce and Spicy House BBQ Sauce. Which all made this meal one of the best meals I have ever had, and I'm not just talking for BBQ meals only. I am talking about one of the meals ever that I got to partake in, hands down!! If you're in Las Vegas and near the strip then I highly recommend this place if you wanna have some of the best food in Las Vegas, and as well as in the Entire USA. Then I highly recommend this place to anyone who reads this review. Don't let the area deceive you either because by the looks of where this place is located. It makes you really hold True to "You can't always judge a book by its cover"!

svDU1vPaQ8P8YDsDlhk0TQ.text: First time I've dared to wander back in, since their starring on Dirty Dining...3 of us order duo combo...and three drink coolers (yeti styled)...waited for ever...like I counted 13 patrons after us got fed before us kinda wait...dude finally brings out our orders, says sorry that took so long...then drops a pile of fat disguised as brisket in front of me...also, as a bonus, charges us for the drinks after buying drink coolers...the left is the pile of peppered fat...right is the kibble that represents a portion of brisket...

pnEqgeZAOZrAilIDmDV2rg.text: The outlaw burger is basically meatloaf on a bun but it has good flavor. It just didn't hold up that well when you try to eat it like a burger. The side of fries came out cold. This was the second time that my side item came out cold.

jlE-oU4eIGY5Z3eUWnRT3g.text: This is the best bbq joint ever. If your in Vegas you have to check this place out. Food is amazing and the employees take in their job and food seriously. Employees are so nice. I will keep coming back

eTHb64wT8EWzgyqQ_QHU7g.text: Best BBQ I've found in Vegas so far.  My husband and I love it here, and will drive well out of our way to swing by here when the mood hits.

JTYogUVYR7JY_9ymoX8TtA.text: Do not pass this by.  I had the three meat combo. The chicken was delicious, the ribs amazing and tender, and the pulled pork was DAM GOOD!!!

QcgzJfSdgeIGvaCVFNKgqA.text: Most incredible BBQ place ever!!!! The hospitality is amazing. Didn't realize that they were closed on a Sunday so me and 3 friends were waiting outside for an uber and the owner brought us out some ribs to have since we were so bummed to find out that they were closed!! Nicest guys ever. And best BBQ I've ever tasted, and I'm from the south!! Highly highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great BBQ from great people. Thank you!!

8rN3o5Q_8xGl8Jn4s5ofwg.text: The food was awesome and the service even better. The owner practically held our hands through the ordering process as we had a big group with kids. He kept checking on us every 15 minutes or so too.  This place lives up to its high rating.  I'm from the south and am a tough critic of BBQ, but Rollin' Smoke BBQ is worth the hike off the strip.

omFqZkGPjGdVWUWGMDnOJA.text: If you like authentic BBQ this is your place!  We were greeted at the door by a very helpful server.  He gave us recommendations.  Everything we ordered was great. We shared the trio meat, hush puppies, Mac and cheese, a berry cobbler and 2 drinks all for under $25.   Yummy.  The restroom was clean and even had seat liners. It is an industrial location but don't be intimidated.

ieIcZtJUCSo1kdE3YhtMzQ.text: My wife and I just moved back to Vegas and discovered Rollin Smoke last night.  We are stoked that Vegas has a real BBQ joint.  It made me want to cry...  My wife gave it the Texas approval too.

4YuWKLofXUE250qzeLBeJQ.text: SOOO Delicious!! Visiting Vegas from San Diego and I'll be back for sure. Brisket is delicious and the corn nuggets so good. Definitely check it out! Friendly staff as well.

6R8b1nTlk9yMEwhPl_BWgg.text: Glad to have stopped by this barbecue place, right off the freeway! Our grouped really liked all the items we got, from their outlaw burgers to assorted platters of ribs, brisket, and corn tots. Friendly and efficient service as well; we were well taken care of. No complaints!

-VnXpDTzrrHoH9mFIzvcBQ.text: This is probably one of the best bbq place to eat in the world. Got the rib platter and outlaw burger. They didn't lie when they said that the outlaw burger was the best in Las Vegas. It dam good!!! Must eat when you are in town!!!

1encw35JP75mFt_t3txJ9A.text: I finally tried this place and really liked it. The food is really good but it's in a weird location.

SeFa_hu6H-6nVrG-rbiQHw.text: You don't have to venture to K.C., Texas or North Carolina for 1st class BBQ. There's real deal smokin' Q right off the Strip in Las Vegas, NV. Rollin Smoke serves up a plethora of great ribs, pulled pork, brisket, chicken, hot links, burgers and much more. The Outlaw Burger is an award winner and the links are amazing. I'm a rib fanatic and love the St. Louis spareribs. They go light on the sauce and let the ribs speak for themselves. Beef ribs are huge, tender and delicious. They are also very proud of their smoked meatloaf. My girlfriend's 94 year old little Texas mama loved her catfish which was cooked perfectly. Many delicious sides. I recommend the corn nuggets. Loved them! Our host who also owns the place, Dusty, could not have been more accommodating or hospitable. I don't live in Las Vegas but whenever I am anywhere near the area I make sure to stop at Rollin Smoke. I've never been disappointed. Great BBQ right off the Las Vegas Strip! Who woulda' thunk it?

qxWxvFSTf0LA1tIXiARgyw.text: Amazing!!! Even though I spent most of my life in Texas, this is some of the best BBQ I've ever had! Loved the corn nuggets & green beans too! My boyfriend and I were STUFFED for less than 30 dollars! Can't beat it!

ThHCUo1LIOqpO7E9SlzyLA.text: Ok. Second & third trip here has verified Rolling Smoke as the best BBQ "Joint" in Vegas for my money. Links are far and away my favorite. Their ribs, brisket, & potato salad are very close seconds. The service is friendly and the price is very fair. The sometime long wait is to be expected when you have food and the associated reputation that goes with it this good. A must for bbq lovers and non cooks

Ww6zbLs5VraZfo89PCeQZw.text: We googled best BBQ in Vegas and this place popped up...THANK GOD IT DID! AUH-MAZING FOOD!! You will not be disappointed!! "Its Dam Good"!!! Buy a t-shirt too!

wdAbdYucVXE19yNI_b_n3g.text: Best in Las Vegas! Worth finding! The large Rib platter is for the very hungry and the Half Rack of Beef Ribs makes a great Lunch.

Xxw6pi2ekkX-597wLMwp8A.text: Disappointed!! All hype no substance. I am sorry to say i was veryyy disappointed with my fist experience at  this place. I am big foodie so I opted for the "all you can eat" option to try different things. I ordered Beef ribs first which were pretty average. Then I ordered baby ribs & to my utter shock I got 2 pieces of ribs as hard as a rock. It seems as if there lying on the side for hours & someone just reheated them. Totally tasteless & not chewable. I don't know if they offer/prepare different food for "all you can" customers. Trust me, I am not new to reviews & am a well traveled person (been to 34 countries so far) & I ALWAYS give benefit of doubt to any restaurant as anyday can be a bad day for them (as its for us). That's why I try more than 1 thing on multiple days before crossing out any restaurant. But my first experience here was so bad that i don't feel like going there again. To all the fans of this place.. sorry folks.. Don't agree!!

HYKPq0VnzaIWkDivbr4iQg.text: I wanted to like this place, I really did. We ordered one of the combo things for $35 and it was a lot of food! I was stoked to try it but when I found a pubic hair in our Mac and cheese I just couldn't. I didn't have the heart to say anything but it really ruined it. So gross.

Q6mb2RLRT3bYlvL-2SGkKw.text: I go to Texas at least once a year and always make it a point to eat some really good bbq because I could never find anything as good in Vegas....until now.

_Z3upsVnLZ2RfrpD6zDYCw.text: Deleted my original review, as I think the fact that I wasn't very hungry swayed my opinion that this place was just okay. The next day, after working up an appetite, my leftovers tasted AMAZING. The collards greens are next level. The only thing that failed to impress was the loaded mash which tasted a bit bland, but everything else was phenomenal. I will definitely be back for more !

CZB7TYYlF3FKDOTGa_aFsA.text: Everything is OVER SPICED on the hot side . Even all the sides . I dont want my frys or baked beans to be too hot (spicy)

lmquwan9jptnNZA2CuA9WA.text: This was the first time we went to here. Our son has been many times. We had four separate orders from our family, two of us gave tips and two orders didn't....all orders were "to go".  The tipped orders were out on time (place was packed) Pulled pork - great Brisket- mostly fat Corn nuggets- 15-20 pieces and great  Meatloaf- great Outlaw burger- great  The other two non-tipped orders: Came out late Missing items  Peach cobbler was awful (peaches in syrup from can) Corn nuggets- 5 pieces  All in all very unprofessional

y5JA0MeQCjKVGOphbH6rcg.text: We had heard many positive comments about this barbeque restaurant, but stuff kept happening, like getting seriously ill, other pressing plans, or it was Sunday and we couldn't go because the business was closed.  I didn't give up hope, however, amd finally got here.  Rollin Smoke lives up to its already outstanding reputation.  If this is your first time and you're not sure what to order, no problem, you can do what we did and order a combination platter.  We had the barbecue rib platter and it was hard to day which we preferred- the burnt ends, the St. Louis ribs  or the baby back ribs. Everything was juicy and prone to falling off the bone.  The barbequed baked beans had a little more heat to them than I would have liked, but were still very good as was the bacon potato salad.  The service was very warm and friendly; the food was fixed and was ready in no time.  We are looking forward to going back soon!

7ctRPHiEKKxCmBNgn_o6AA.text: Spent half a week on the strip trying all the buffets and fancy restaurants, none of them had meat as good as here. Service is so friendly, even bringing out a sample of the corn nuggets for us to try (get them!!!) and made us feel very welcome upon entering this hole in the wall.  The boy and I split the trio. We chose the brisket (chopped per the hostess's recommendation), ribs (fall off the bone ofc), and pulled pork (so much juicy tenderness!). Got their bbq beans (so good ugh) and potato salad (HIGHLY recommend) as sides. Having trouble eating it all, portion is so big!  They also have all their bbq sauces available for you to squirt on your meat (huehuehue) and you should try all of them. Mama's sweet was our favorite.   This will be one of those restaurants that I will need to visit everytime I'm in the area.

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our trio of brisket, ribs, pulled pork, bbq beans, potato salad, and complimentary corn nuggets :3 ($31 including tax/tip)

zJeXtrTQPhh5_o7UorZRJg.text: Far and away the best BBQ in town with excellent service to boot!  Lizelle kindly suggested we go with the Pit Special, and I kind of love her for it!  It was the perfect sampling of the best of what they have to offer (as far as meats) and pairs perfectly with their any & all of the yummy sides they offer!  We went with the bacon potato salad, baked beans and mac & cheese, because...duh.  Everything was superb!  The atmosphere was fun with what looked like to be a bridal party and a couple of families enjoying the soccer match (go Messi!).  It was quite possibly the perfect Saturday lunch spot!

p7s8mvYy_1Jxivv1Kk6GYw.text: Order ahead!! I ordered the brisket 3 with a side of loaded mashed potatoes. AMAZING! So juicy and flavorful. Long, long lines so I highly suggest you call your order ahead to avoid the lines. Wish the portions were bigger but other than that, amazing!

Po2-CRL17e4PGlEknoeofg.text: BBQ excellence!  Don't let the location or the exterior dissuade you from entering this hidden gem, you will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket (sliced), pulled pork and ribs with cheesy mac &amp; cheese.

MqqrCgFML-_2EJ_77HFJhg.text: Pros:  Nice staff Clean tables  Decent portions Variety of sauces Delishious waffle fries Fast service, even when busy  Cons:  Food was warm, not hot Hot link lacked flavor Sliced Brisket was rubbery Combo included a soda......no substitutions Brisket Sandwich was so fatty and lacked flavor   I don't think we will be back....since it's equal distance for me to drive here or go to Boulder City.

wIX2RTNwghPz0hqG_sny8A.text: Love love love this BBQ spot. My boyfriend and I stop here every-time we come to Vegas - which has become quite a reoccurring thing. It's only 5 minutes off the strip. Kind of a random location because it's surrounded by warehouses... But that doesn't really matter. The inside decor kind of gives me the creeps- they have a mural of people at a BBQ.... idk you have to see it to understand. But the food and the people there are just awesome. My boyfriend and I can usually share a entree and be pretty full. But we aren't the heaviest eaters. We order the pulled pork sandwich and drench it in their house vinegar and house BBQ sauces (they have a variety to choose from). The entrees come with sides. I can't have BBQ without mac and cheese. Theirs is alright... nothing too special. I think what makes this place -is just really good authentic, and well made BBQ.  Recommend.

45yAm65Lzi0L67G2OxZOvg.text: Delish! Ordered 5 meat plate with potato salad, baked beans, and corn bread for sides. Loved it all!

7LdQ2QLQqYdQmRCWsi_lGg.text: Ive been using Yelp daily for over a year now but don't really do reviews, but after my meal from yesterday i felt I had to. I've had "Rollin Smoke BBQ" a couple times in the past and it has always been super tender and delicious except for yesterday. I was extremely disappointed with the quality of the food. The baby back ribs & brisket were EXTREMELY dry, almost like Jerky. The chicken was dry too, but I've never had their chicken before, so I wouldn't know what to expect.  I almost didn't believe the meat was from "Rollin Smoke BBQ" but it was. Their flavor was really good like usual but it was the driest BBQ I've ever had. It was not tender at all! My favorite part of the meal was the Mac N Cheese and Cornbread.  Oh, and they also forgot to include my "Kick'n BBQ Beans".       "Of course they refunded me the price of the beans". I'm really disappointed with the restaurant.

I told them that their portions are just too big. No one can finish that much food. They said "better too much than not enough". The burnt ends were out of this world. Meatloaf ***** five stars. sLMIVGbbMEFxnzDt17iKuQ.text: This place is amazing! It looks like a hole-in-the-wall restaurant from the outside, but it is the best BBQ I've ever had. I've eaten at authentic BBQ places in Texas, and this edged them out.  I got the three-way brisket which was awesome. Plus, all their BBQ and sauces are gluten-free, which is a requirement for me (I have celiac).   Highly recommended!

WSBP-Bv6Ytgw9vsRWFUlGQ.text: I love this BBQ brisket !! Baked beans r good !! I'm been coming 4 years now !! I use my party!! my Condo pool party ordered !! My friends go lunch !! We love love !! Owner are super nice !! Best smorky taste !!

STc1qbqqymWH-6wuMbZ1tw.text: We were referred here by Acrylic Tank Manufacturing (Tanked) as not only a local place to see one of their tanks, but as one of the best places for BBQ in Vegas, and especially I should try the Meatloaf.   The restaurant is way off the beaten path, on strip club alley, in a dank industrial part of town, under a freeway overpass. I was impressed with the overfull parking lot and the line out the door, thinking this must be some good stuff.   The place seemed kind of run down, and the Aquarium was really disappointing. I guess it lets you know how much they care about their place. After all, who pays thousands, or tens of thousands for a custom aquarium, then replaces the amazing fish with feeder goldfish, the tank was dirty and the special features didn't function.   Back to the restaurant though, so I order, and while ordering my wife wanted some sauce to go, and the menu has prices for cup, pint, quart, gallon or whatever. I ordered a pint of house and a pint of Carolina. We ordered to eat there and paid the $50 for the 2 of us. We went and sat down, about 20 minutes later I went looking for our food, that never came, and found a girl, food runner, whatever, with our food boxed up to-go in a bag wandering around looking for us... Confusing since I ordered for dine in...  Took the bag to my wife and we opened it to start eating, and there were in addition to the 2 Styrofoam clamshells with our food, like 16 little tiny 2oz sauce ramekins. Not the glass Mason jars in the case.   I thought the meatloaf was borderline just ok, It pretty much just crumbled apart, had to use the mashed potatoes as a binder to keep the bits of meat on the fork. I make better meatloaf myself, in fact I smoke better food in general than they do. My wife had the Pulled Pork, she "enjoyed" it, but didn't finish it  As a BBQ connoisseur, having enjoyed BBQ in Texas and several other states, I would have to say this does not even come close to ranking as good BBQ.   Life is short, so I would not likely return.

Gkq0pv8mvrMkkLB-lysq8Q.text: Delishus!  Southern BBQ in the middlenof Las Vegas.  Pulled pork,  Tri tip,  chicken,  catfish,  brisketts,  Short ribs,  all with so varying sweet and hot sauces.  Delicious to the bone.   Dripping off literally.  Sweet corn bread,  mac and cheese to die for,  greens,  sweet potatoe,  dirty rice, beenz,  peppery cole slaw are some of the tasty side dishes.

G0vxRJSqFOqNCitIhs417A.text: Service was great and food was delicious. I got the $28 plate which I split with my fiance. It contained bbq chicken, pulled pork, brisket, spare ribs and includes 3 sides. Bacon baked potatoe, baked beans which was not too sweet and meaty, and my favorite the cornbread. I will recommend for delicious bbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O2CPH88ThpnrvwT2iFKVIA.text: I've had this place cater my work's Las Vegas location before, but since my office is in Los Angeles, I never actually got to try it.  Our Las Vegas crew raved about it though.  Finally, when I made it out to Vegas for the millionth time we decided to swing by for some finger lickin' BBQ.  It's located quite a ways off the strip, just down the street from Spearmint Rhino, in an industrial looking area.  It's a pretty small place, but it's got some BIG flavors.   I got the 3 meat plate, since I felt like I had to stuff my face the first time to make sure I tried all the good stuff.  I picked the brisket (which is chopped unless you ask otherwise), chicken, and ribs.  For my side, I had the macaroni and cheese.  The boyfriend had the Big Hawg (pulled pork sandwich).  We didn't realize that they'd put an entire pig's worth of pulled pork in that sandwich, but we're not complaining.  The pulled pork was very tender and juicy, and the sandwich was stuffed with a whole pig, coleslaw and some delicious bbq sauce.  My 3 meats were pretty good as well, the chopped brisket had nice crispy pieces and nice juicy/tender pieces.  It was a good balance.  The chicken wasn't anything stellar, but it was good.  I really enjoyed the ribs though.  I'm not a huge rib eater because I don't really like to get my hands dirty, but these ribs fell right off the bone.  I'm totally down with that.  I'd skip the mac and cheese and go for the dirty rice (if you're brave enough) next time.  I had a few bites of my friends' rice, and I fell in love and then became insanely jealous.    The staff here is super friendly and attentive.  They'd come out and check on you every now and then to make sure that you have everything you need.  The place is clean, but seating is limited.  We got there at just about 11AM, and it was empty, but moments later it filled up quick.  They also have several different BBQ sauces out for you to try as well.  I liked the spicy one, it went well with the brisket.  I may have to add Rollin' Smoke to my list of places that I must visit when I come to Vegas.  That list is getting long, and it's getting difficult to get through the list each time.  Damn you Vegas for having such good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp po boy
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio of ribs, chicken, and brisket
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The big hawg

zY8j5B6uY4EQ7BdotyyvdA.text: My first time in Vegas and I was looking for some good bbq. Well this place rivals some of the best spots in Dallas TX. We had the 5 meat sampler and famed Outlaw burger and both were incredible.   I have experienced some joints that do a couple of meats well but fall short on others, this place is knocking it out of the park. Brisket was juicy, pork was tender, sausage had great flavor, and chicken was smoked just right. The ribs tasted fantastic but we're not as juicy as I like, again this was the sampler so I think a slab will be juicier.  Sides of Mac n cheese, hush puppies & bacon mashed potatoes were also delicious. With drinks total came to $45 for a family of 5. They do have 10% coupon on the website. Do not leave Vegas before trying Rollin Smoke!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 meat sampler &amp; Outlaw Burger.

NRjJ51Z3YngRuUWDQsJvug.text: Best damn BBQ i have tasted!  I ordered the outlaw which would fill a normal human but with my appetite i also ordered the pit special and shared it with my girlfriend!   I'll start with the burger. Humongous burger I had to take on the onion straws just squeeze that bad burger in my mouth! Burger topped with theirs meatloaf which was moist.   The meat platter was like heavenly everything was fall of the bone I ordered pull pork, spare ribs and double brisket! Everything was cooked to perfection!  They have an excellent bbq sauce which the meat doesn't need but the sauce is damn tasty!  Definitely coming back... Gotta try me some of that dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pit platter 4- meats and 3 sides meats are pulled pork brisket and spare ribs! So good!  Sides I suggest get corn fritters!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw burger not for the faint at heart !

H4PMsWKNj0IyhVTKAdrISw.text: Delicious! Loved the corn nuggets! The Pulled Piggy sandwich was delicious and filling. The meat was tender and you could taste the smoke! The Mac and cheese was good n'cheesy! My friend had the smoked meatloaf and it was good too. Couldn't taste the smokey flavor in it though. My friend said the beans were spicy and had quite the kick! Everything was delicious, the staff was wonderful, and good quality/value! Will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked meatloaf with bread and beans
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled Piggy Sandwich with Mac-n-cheese and corn nuggets! Delicious!

XIyRN1BSGBf1aESPrK1Rcg.text: I've ate here several times and just wanted to recommend something you might not have tried before. The smoked meatloaf is fabulous. You won't be sorry. You might be able to feed 2. This place has the best smoked flavor and bbq sauce in town. I want to just give them props for being consistent and giving us a locals discount on top of great bbq!!

q3TzGJKu8_bE7HzehJkp8A.text: Great Prices and portions of food. Excellent quality of food the best indicator was law enforcement was eating there. The beef brisket- chopped, sliced, and burnt ends were tender, well seasoned, and moist. Good seasoned waffle fries, green beans were crisp and fresh.

BiDg2baKVO4lXnhRaLIi6g.text: This place is amazing. Came here with the fam and we were surprised by how small the place was, but once the food came...OMG. Best BBQ ever!! I'd post a picture of the food, but after the first bite, there was nothing left. I just could not stop eating. Amazing! Truly!

I had the catfish dinner the first time the second time and the third time that is my favorite dish  everyone that works there is friendly willing to help with anything even when they're busy. GrRWR5CNN03_w3u2EahqYg.text: Th worst service I have ever received first off I asked for ni side I was informed they had to charge me for it any way.......I asked if I could trade for a drink (same price as a side) they said no ( because of inventory) although everything was rang up separately.  So I ask for no side even if they had to charge me for it and they said that would be fine. When I get my plate it has a side......bad part is there food is decent.....however I will never go again or recommend this place to anyone!!!!!!

ZXxp5qnC_J365PWr9Xc2Bg.text: This place was pretty awesome. My husband and I came here for Labor Day for some good bbq, and they definitely served to please. We usually go to Famous Dave's for bbq, but wanted to try something different. My husband saw the great reviews on here, so we went for it. Small seated area, but nice enough to enjoy yourself. The staff is pleasant and very welcoming. I really enjoyed them. The prices are reasonable and the food is delicious. We ordered rib tips, the loaded mash potatoes, Mac& cheese along with two half rack ribs. It really hit the spot! But beware, they top everything with chives. So if you don't like that onion taste, make sure to remove them when ordering. Otherwise, you should really enjoy yourself
