Iu_A0vNeP-IaGUCrnqbKag.text: This place is amazing!!! The food is delicious! Everything is so flavorful! It was mine and my boyfriend's first time trying it and we weren't disappointed at all! We shared "The Pit Special", which I would highly recommend for first timers cause you can try a bit of everything. It was so worth! The sides (OMG) it was sooooo good! We got the Mac and cheese, loaded mash potatoes, and collard green! When I say they made that with love, they made that WITH LOVEEEEE. I'm super picky with my collard greens too because I'm from the south and I know how REAL collard greens are supposed to be made and these were exactly what I was hoping for! If you haven't tried this place, you HAVE TO!

Xn5iLN1v3eLW0e0VPuz1bQ.text: This is my second time here and the food is just as good as the first time. Had the rib combo this time and the ribs were delicious. The beef rib was as big as a small roast and tasty. I thought the St Louis ribs were my fav, great flavor and texture.  Note: the sauces are very good. A word of warning though, they keep the "damn hot" sauce behind the counter, use with caution, it Damn hot!   This is one of my favorite BBQ joints. I recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib combo, too much to finish.

_xoLYMafxczwzDbY8cDYUQ.text: Phenomenal!   Decided to be "locals"on our recent trip to Vegas.  Excellent food and huge portions.  The big combo platter was moor than enough to share.

gYjxgkYFoXUgAW85yxd2ZQ.text: This is the best bbq spot I've found. The food is so good and the service is awesome. Devada was my cashier and she gave excellent customer service. This is my go to spot for good food!

LGTbC05oVfIAcOzhCm_Yuw.text: Omg!  YES! Exactly how I had dreamt about it would be.  Lovely lovely meat with great sides. The meat was brisket in three ways, and we had the beans, corn and coleslaw, all shared.  I will dream about this meal and long for it until next year when going back to Las Vegas.   In Vegas?  What are you waiting for...GO!

-EpO7ZirY24mK9VpkJ5Juw.text: Fabulous BBQ Links and Brisket at such reasonable prices. Great food, quick service. Loved it.

Hv6cLM3u-QPQADe0-P-MpA.text: This place is totally outstanding. They have amazing barbecue and all sorts of forms. Their coleslaw taste phenomenal And with a little bit of a kick. Got the food really fast. Will go to this place again.

In3NGHNKJpkFwHfzgXVX-Q.text: Easily one of the best BBQ joints I've ever had the pleasure to pig out at. Granted, I've never eaten at any smokehouse below the Mason-Dixon line (shame on me), I can easily say a trip to Vegas would be incomplete without stopping by Rollin Smoke.  The place itself is off the beaten path and very unassuming on the inside. You'll need to venture outside of the Strip to get here, and if you're walking from your hotel, you might just come across a tumbleweed. But if you do make the wise decision of coming out here, your mouth will thank you for it.  Everything I tried was pure barbecue heaven. And I did order a lot -- smoked sausage, pork ribs, beef ribs, pulled pork, and brisket. The brisket is at the same level as the stuff they serve at Fette Sau in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, and that's saying a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Ribs with Brisket
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle Fries (a bit soft/soggy and oily, instead of crispy)
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pit Special

X0OOOfe0ZLtrHTU758-IqQ.text: This new spot is one of the few good bbq places in town. We got the AYCE on our first visit to try everything - the beef ribs are definitely the best, the most tender and packed with the most smoky flavors. Baby backs are also quite good so I might get them again.   Note to self: avoid the dry brisket next time and not a fan of the Memphis ribs.  But I also got to sneaked a peek at the burgers the staff was serving to the other table and they're GIGANTIC. I doubt anyone would be able to keep the burger intact while devouring it... but they look hell of delicious!

pRZskL9DwK2FpMydJweQtw.text: Excellent BBQ, tucked away in an industrial-ish neighborhood.  I wanted BBQ. Yelp led me to Rollin Smoke. We drove there. Upon arrival, I was somewhat skeptical, because this place is in a somewhat sketchy area. Surrounded by strip clubs, warehouses, and a few rundown places, it doesn't really look like the place you'd take your family. But when I got past that initial impression and walked inside, I knew I was in a good place.  The location is pretty small. There is seating out in front and two rooms of seating inside. Most of it is communal in style--just picnic-style tables with attached benches. The place is permeated with the smell of smoking meat. What a great smell! There are a number of good options on the menu.  As I do pretty much without fail at a BBQ joint that is new to me, I got a sample plate with some brisket and chicken. The combo comes with a few pieces of brisket, 1/4 of a chicken (a leg and a thigh), a piece of Texas toast, a couple of pickles, and a side. I got the green beans side (despite normally going for the BBQ beans) and ate that first. I was pretty impressed with just the green beans. They were fresh and crisp and were seasoned to perfection. Then I worked my way into the chicken. It was seasoned perfectly as well and cooked just right. It was nice and tender and delicious. I often skip the skin on chicken, but this was great stuff, and I ate it all. Finally, the star, the brisket. Brisket is the standard by which I measure any BBQ joint. This is excellent brisket. It's sliced to the right thickness. It's nice and tender and falls apart with just a little work with the fork. And it's delicious. With or without any added sauce, this stuff rocks!  Speaking of sauces, there are a few options. I went with the Arkansas version, which turned out to be pretty darn good. When I first squeezed some out of the bottle, I feared that it was too liquidy, but the consistency was great when put straight onto the brisket itself.  My friend got a brisket salad, and I ended up finishing it for her. It too was delicious. I'm not really a fan of romaine-based salads, but the greens and tomatoes were all fresh, the peppers were spicy, and the brisket was delicious on the salad as well.  There are a few options that are intriguing to me for when I visit in the future with a healthy appetite. The $35 all-you-can eat option is a rarity among BBQ joints. And the picture of the burger on the wall made the burger look like quite the challenge.  This is great BBQ, not just for Vegas, but in general.

Kg0H0rKzViFVSN2YmvlI4w.text: When we walked in the atmosphere reminded me of a good ol BBQ joint! Being originally from Kansas City we have high standards. The food was killer. The roll the pulled pork was on was amazing and the sides were as great as the BBQ. We ended up taking a pint of the sauce home with us! New favorite restaurant in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge portions that won&#39;t disappoint!

NPW3S8up1X1SRAreLuwE0g.text: Looking for southern style meals in Vegas? This is the place for you. When we go to Vegas it's always a large group so when we end up at Rollin we order their party packs. We always add corn bread and the burnt ends (so good). If it's your first time you have to order the outlaw burger for picture purposes...you'll won't regret it. Before ordering don't forget to go on there site and pull up the 10% discount on the promo section.

tf4cgbMTo2pvsTta7k0ZZA.text: This is what I think of when I look for BBQ.  I have been trying all the places in Vegas I can find.   The owners are from Arkansas.  So, if you like Arkansas BBQ, Louisiana, or Texas BBQ you will be in heaven.  They have beef ribs that are juicy and delicious.  Smoked 19 hours.  They have a rub on them and then you add BBQ sauce. The Pork ribs, chicken are very good too.  Haven't been able to find any food to complain about.  I get a little quiet when I am there enjoying the food so much.  People have complained about cost to portion, but the portions are big enough for my husband to be stuffed and full most of the day.  Cost wise, it seemed reasonable for good quality BBQ to me and I will be back frequently.  I tried the catfish and it has a crunchy cornmeal coating with and no weird after flavor you sometimes get with catfish.   I have had it twice now since it is so good.  Once in a basket and once as a poor boy sandwich.   Love it.  I can't decide which is my favorite the beef ribs or the catfish.  The sides I have tried are:  mac and cheese -flavor is good, but I prefer a baked thick cheese sauce over this one. Hush puppies: pretty tasty Corn fritters:  tasty, the corn is inside a breading.   Being from Virginia I have some expectations that probably aren't normal or liked by many others.  I felt these were good, but a little blander than I like.   I enjoy the corn tucked into a spicy hush puppy myself  Haven't had space for any desserts yet, but I will have to get some to go next time.  I am usually going somewhere else after.  They also will cook up a whole pig for parties.  Price varies depending on market price so call them.  Very cool.  Can't wait to eat there again.   Also if you go early enough in the day they have a cool electrical store called Kiesub next door.   If you are tech oriented you will enjoy it.

J8Cq8NvqE_O107OqIIZDOA.text: The other reviews have covered it pretty well. What's really great here is not just wonderful smoked food, but the awesome prices. Get the Pitmaster Special combo, and you'll get 4 meats and 3 sides, with your choice from the 3 breads they make -- all for $20. There is enough food there for 3 adults, or eat some and take some home. Such a deal!  And there is no charge for extra plates.   The owners run the place, and are always present. They are very friendly, and love to meet new patrons. We loved the meal and the staff so much, we came here a second time during our week in Las Vegas just to try more foods. We loved everything we tried. If they take a liking to you, they just might tell you about some items in the kitchen that are not on the menu. Ask about the bread pudding and sweet potato pie!  What would give it 5 stars?  Esoteric things only. This business has not been in its current location for long. Hopefully they will continue to improve the seating and decor as they go along.   Dusty, if you are reading this, Hello from California. We'll be back!

Anv4fuL82Jk_E7xrjA4gCw.text: I've never had a bad experience at Rollin' Smoke. We order food for the office on occasion. When we do, for some reason there aren't many people missing from the meeting when they know we are providing BBQ. If you haven't been, I suggest you make it a priority.

WJm-pyHYBkyUhfHitlTQyQ.text: Yum yum yum. This was the best BBQ I've had. My husband had the beef ribs. They were enormous, I had no idea you could get super sized beef ribs like that. I tried a small bite and you can taste the smoked flavor. I had the pork ribs and they were falling off the bone delicious. I also had the jalapeno coleslaw. There was a little spice but not too much it was just right.   Defiantly a hidden gem. Great service and very fast. We are hooked.

JA-iTQuDGoPIsZ7244Y2AQ.text: Great little spot. Did the brisket three ways (chopped, sliced, and burnt ends). Everything was good but the burnt ends were amazing.

D0aWFxexE9TjP7W78ewjWA.text: We are from Utah and saw this place off YouTube, it did not disappoint at all, in Utah our BBQ is bad but ettable, but after eating here we refuse to eat BBQ in Utah anymore. It's so good we are about to come back and make a trip around this place as our main attraction. Everything we tried was top notch I hope they keep up the quality and not skimp on ingredients in the future so it can always be this good! Thank you!

9rNN6maDl8rbELsWl-WIRQ.text: Well this was my first time.  I will make it short and sweet and to the point.  Yum yum yum.  It was all good.  I had the beef rib and it was super tender and juicy.  I had the pulled piggy and it was the best darn pulled piggy I ever had.  I had the burnt ends and that was not my favorite and I will probably not order it again but he sides made up for that.  Beans had a little kick!  The coleslaw was super unique and delicious and last but not least the little corn nuggets were tasty.  I ended my meal with the berry cobbler it was alright best.  I swallowed it all down with some sweet tea mixed with regular tea it was perfect.  I am coming back for sure to try lots more!  Mmmmmm....  Service was good.  The staff was so nice and everyone said hi and seemed to care if they messed up to make it right as soon as possible.

4clrPh7F9cla6dnL0ZEfIg.text: I found this BBQ place through Yelp.  Location: We went at night, not a well lit parking lot or lit sign, we were near a lot of strip clubs, but the lot was full, so we decided to peek inside.  Service: You get in a line, order and pay, and hope to find a seat. The wait was an hour to get our food. People who ordered after us got served before us, which was maddening. The staff brings your food, but that is all.   Food: Big portions! Had that good BBQ flavor and they had 2 different sauces you could use.   Overall: Staff could be a little friendlier and more helpful with ordering, maybe implement a seating system, and invest in some signage for the street that is lit for when its dark.

9iDrtKeIWmuzJOXzfWRuhw.text: Phenomenal BBQ!!! Saw this place on an episode of food paradise, and had it bookmarked for the last 6 months. I was worried that after seeing this spot on TV and reading all the great reviews that maybe I had set the bar to high. Turns out Rollin smoke BBQ is the bar! Being somewhat of a BBQ connoisseur I can't say enough good things about this place. Brisket was moist smokey and tender, pulled pork was juicy nice and smokey, and the beef ribs fell off the bone! As for my side I had the potato salad which is very much like a loaded bake potato salad with cheese, chives, and bacon. Service from cashier and mgr was also very friendly and efficient. Everytime I come to Vegas I will be stopping in. Keep it up rolling smoke, you guys are awesome!

9LClCn6N6pTX0tsIVu3G2A.text: This places BBQ is amazing! Every time I visit the people are easy to talk, and the food is delicious. Even if you're not a huge BBQ kind of person like me, you have other great choices. The corn nuggets are a must try! I personally get the baked potato, super tasty and fills you up quick. The atmosphere feels like an outside picnic without being outside. They have outside tables if you do like being outside! I definitely recommend this place if you just want some fresh tasting BBQ in your mouth. The reason I give it a four star is only because they never refilled the ice machine. Even after being told 4 different times that there isn't any ice. I know that the drinks are already a good cold temperature, but I like my drinks with ice. Work on that and I'll definitely make it a 5 star.

8netTvnASbpfBDzopyBHlg.text: I could not express enough how much my family and I enjoyed their BBQ . We had ribs, brisket and pulled pork and it was the best I have ever had. Not to mention the customer service was superior to any I have received in a long time. They are busy but every member of the staff was full of passion and great energy.

V3LAXuiy0e_yGmRJVJq1Dg.text: This is by far one of my favorite places in all of Las Vegas. As a southern boy out in the west I am so very very happy that Rollin Smoke exists. You can't find BBQ this good even in Arkansas. Believe me I have tried! Hush puppies done right is something that I never though I would find outside of my own kitchen this far west but when I need a fix and don't feel like frying up a batch, Rollin Smoke is there for me! If you have a hankerin' for some fine BBQ then head on down and git yer grub on.

ZgRCoyi-Ym3cUVDLKbTIvg.text: Food was Amazing! Sides, delicious! I'm a huge foodie and never think twice about what I pay especially when it's good. Not only was it reasonable, $30 for 2 of us to eat, but the service, unforgettable. Loved the little man behind the counter. He makes it worth coming back aside from the scrumptious food.

7HnPx_rusb3_V025Q7Ppcw.text: I ordered a pulled pork sandwich and loaded mashed potatoes. The sandwich was tasty but smaller than expected for the price. It was also served on what looked to be a hot dog bun instead of a roll/hamburger bun, strange. The mashed potatoes were okay but not great. Customer service was friendly and quick even though there was a big line.

g6SZoYokgDRYdvJ7ccw47Q.text: Was pleasantly surprised.  Servings were large and much more than expected.  Everyone was super friendly.  Very clean dining area.  Food was very good but we like a stronger smoke flavor, everything was very tender.  Would definitely come back and would recommend.

uuUMVlms582sLxXZ9Lr9kg.text: Every time I go to this place, the food is great and so is the service.  I've been there about 12 times. Today was the first time they got something wrong.  They fixed it right away and handled it very professionally. We told them we'd still come back because we come there all the time and we've never had any problems.  Our family loves this place.

imEppwABtaiL0CEyjSAC5A.text: We used to come here all the time but with the ridiculous price increases, it's not worth it anymore. The bbq is good, but not $50 for lunch for two people good. And I even skipped the $3 fountain drink.

iyYcsDCgSyf1qiASb_pwBg.text: Have been coming since it opened. Seems since they got the good reviews and "best of Las vegas" they have gotten greedy. The changes to the menu now it's 3 bucks if you want a drink. 3.50 for sides if your meal doesn't have a side. They raised the prices for the tourist but for locals it's 10% off if you show a Nevada ID. Food is still good but for two now it's about 50 dollars.  Will be looking for the next best BBQ in Vegas.

228cPUUXa7pgbKa7YFq6wA.text: Great BBQ spot, food is excellent. Portions were smaller then expected but very good.

WSVpsqrIkgedo-ZHlrfR_Q.text: Still searching for that "BEST" bbq joint. I think i've come to the conclusion im just not a big BBQ guy. For what it is though, Rollin Smoke BBQ was good

SUVoT_3kGjZZoD2g1Gh-pA.text: The best catfish I've ever had. The service is awesome. They've created a family environment that's unique. People were talking to each other like we were all guests at someone's house. Mamas banana pudding tasted just like my grandmothers.

AJAVZ4k5aAInQMDxU1dCGw.text: What I look for in a good barbecue is moist and tender meat with a strong smoke aroma and a spicy rub. Looking at the good reviews for this place, my group and I decided to come to this place.  The place itself is small so try not to come during the rush for lunch because you won't find a place to sit.  What really did like right off the bat here is that they have a large smoker you can see by the side of the building as you walk in, and you can smell the smoke already! My group ordered a combination platter called The Pit and it came with spare ribs, brisket, sausage and pulled pork.  We also shared the outlaw burger, which eventually stole the show. The sausage had a mild smokey flavor but it was a little dry. Everything else was very moist and tender and had a good smokey flavor.  The pulled pork and brisket were very tender and flavorful and didn't need any sauce.  The ribs were a little tough to eat off the bone I   I thought, and I didn't get any extra spiciness from the rub. And when I tried to kick it up a noth by adding their bbq sauce, It didnt work.  Their bbq sauce is very bland.  It has no spiciness or tang or zing.  Just mildy dressed up tomatoe sauce. The best thing I tasted there was the OUTLAW BURGER.  The baddass big flavor patty, the onion strings, and the tangy mayo were awesome together.  My advice is to come for the Outlaw burge, pulled pork, and the brisket!

QFawaTFky_d-hXRDvU4cWQ.text: Ordered the Spareribs. Not impressed. They were tough. Flavor was fine but definitely have had better ribs. Place felt a little dirty.  Sat in a booth and the upholstery definitely appeared nasty.  Need to either replace the upholstery with vinyl or something that doesn't show the dirt.  If I never go back, I won't miss it.

eUqxdwHY3Dd10Ce832SlQA.text: By far the best barbeque in Las Vegas. Don't waste your time going to the over priced BBQ chain restaurants, they cannot come close to what Rollin Smoke is rolling out. Cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. This place makes my stomach and taste buds happy.

lWBLS6PuRnMGq-tpY2ZnGA.text: The meatloaf is perfection! The brisket is just right and the customer service is top notch. It's a must visit when in Vegas. Sketchy neighborhood but worth the trip. Clean and attractive interior.

q9vjMksj-M6f7V18ZfxY7Q.text: The real deal!  Great ribs.  The beef and pork fall off the bone.  The sauce is added to the ribs just before serving.  You have to look in order to find this joint which is hidden away in an industrial area.  You need to go there!

PFG3wI-Tg9rGgyf0h8KfEg.text: We came here for the first time today. They were packed!  We ordered the meatloaf, two meat plate ( brisket and chicken) , and a piggy fry. They accidentally brought us an extra plate of brisket instead of the fries. As soon as we said something the fries were next on the line. The kitchen manager came right out apologized , gave us the brisket and brought out the fries within seconds, he was very friendly.   I thought that was great service. Being born and raised in Las Vegas I have a much higher expectation of service than most others. Anyway the kitchen manager came back out one more time. Offered us free desert , he said " even if you say no I'm bringing it out."  So we asked for the berry cobbler. He returned with his home made banana pudding along with an order of cobbler. The banana pudding was absolutely amazing ! The cobbler was a wine based and was excellent ! Overall the service and the food was wonderful. My father is still raving about his meatloaf and my mother says her chicken was great. I would recommend this place to anyone !

dnXKqVx7z5UgN-M_uIsVzQ.text: Well I have a lot to say !!! I would give 10 stars if I could !!! First off the guy behind the counter (Dave I believe) was soooo friendly and soooo helpful as this was our first time there. We told him we were there for my daughters birthday (which is important later in this review).. Anway we ordered the trio and my daughter didn't want the chicken, so he replaced that with another rib ..(you can switch anything around , and depending what you get there may be a upcharge which is not bad. Now I had the brisket trio...OMG... burnt ends, sliced and chopped.. Plus I asked for a beef rib as well. The beef rib is gigantic..looked like a bone from the flintstones...so damn good..it was tender and just so damn good. My fiance had the outlaw burger... OMG..Huge and delicious. Those onion straws are also the best I ever had.. Now after our meal, next thing we knew the cooks and Kathy (love her) came to our table and sang happy birthday to my daughter and brought a little dessert out for her.. How great was that..The staff are all so friendly and the service was speedy and all I can say is we can't wait to go back !!!!

432CWUU9QQH84GX3SCKUYg.text: Good as it gets BBQ with excellent sides - served by friendly staff who get it out to you promptly. Ambiance is only cause for concern, but who cares when the food is so good! Odds are you will become a regular customer!

Od3ztdItQcWXjG_7OKOgnw.text: You won't find a better BBQ place anywhere near this gem! Great, tasty food for a good price! The staff is friendly and knows what they are doing when it comes to BBQ! Stopping here whenever I'm in Vegas for sure!

OyM_l4fw7lkStdmiNRJrJg.text: Solid BBQ in Las Vegas! I'm from the South so my expectations are high but Rolling Smokes delivers a solid meal and excellent service. I am especially partial to their pulled pork.

tpTLhiT5cBmD8y6uV8ObrA.text: Awesome, Fast service even though they are always busy. Got a free desert for making an appointment with Yelp, liked that . All food is great, tried almost everything at one time or another, nothing bad ever.

yCtz4fEn1SWriyBaq1R-mA.text: This was the first visit to Rollin Smoke for my wife and I following a word of mouth recommendation from a couple we met while in line at our hotel check in and we weren't disappointed. I had the trio plate with chicken, brisket and hot links, my wife had brisket and ribs - everything was great with good smoke and rub flavour.  My wife didn't have sauce on hers and in her opinion it wasn't required. I found the sauce delicious but be forewarned, it has some heat to it. The onion rings and corn nuggets were awesome sides, I wish we could have tried some more of them. We most definitely will return on our next visit and will be recommending Rollin Smoke to our friends travelling to the area.

PPFmHuB9-gxIfbhmDYjFrg.text: This is my new favorite BBQ place in the Springs! I went there a couple weeks ago, and it was delicious!! My group ordered the rib combo plate, so we got ribs, chicken and brisket. All of the meats were so well-cooked. You can also ask for the meats "naked," which meant they only had a BBQ rub but no sauce, and then you can add your own sauce from the selection of BBQ sauces at the table. We did this because I was not sure which sauces would be spicy. The sides were pretty good as well, but the portions on those were somewhat small. We were also really impressed with their selection of beer on tap! They had a list beers, all from Colorado microbreweries, and we got to try some beers we hadn't heard of. Also, we were all super impressed with the friendly and helpful service we received. It was so fun!! This is definitely the place I recommend if you are looking for great BBQ in the Springs.

pA0rC70tZHVRq58dQpk-jQ.text: My husband and I ate there for lunch today. We have been sick since. I am up now 12 hours later with extreme stomach distress and the symptoms that come with it!!! I can see that another yelp user left a review stating that she got sick two days ago after eating the same thing I ordered (pulled pork). Avoid. The food is not worth being this sick :(

XyJZKZaEi8f3ymLxVRzkvA.text: FINALLY...Vegas has a homestyle BBQ joint to call its own and be proud of!  Awesome food and very reasonable prices.  Try the rib tips if your on a tight budget. Best BBQ in Vegas!!  Give it a try.

Mt6QYx2ggyX_KR3SW5Nq9g.text: One of the better bbqs in LV. Love the hot links and the smokeyness of the meats. Mac & cheese is delicious. Place can get very crowded and busy.

pzuP8LrzwwSKayIyTKErIw.text: We tried Rollin smoke on a recommendation from a friend, this was going to be our Thanksgiving in Vegas, we loved it. We had sliced brisket, burnt ends and rib tips all were fantastic for sides we chose loaded mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. Friendly staff and near the strip, easy to find. Treat yourself and get some!

rIiUQo7x51YkSHakOB2Sqw.text: Tried them at the "pigs for kids" charity bbq festival... im from K.C. so i know good bbq, and these were Great ribs, ..the chipotle slaw, and beans were also yummy.. the owners were very personable and friendly ..cant wait to go into the restaurant and try everything!!

-Hj2gBmLPN9QKXc9254sBQ.text: The smoked chicken was delicious. Great service and Lizelle made some good recommendations for sides.

eRTa4McMy9wWWm2Yz5NXog.text: The food was awesome and the place was packed!!! Our sons had the Outlaw Burger and they said it was the best they've had. My husband and I had The Pit Special and Smoked Meatloaf and it was delightful. This place is a definite . We also had the Kicken' Beans, Collard Greens and Dirty Rice

ZJt3dtXjxzgeXwSD_8oOZA.text: The pork spare ribs are amazing. Meaty, well-seasoned, great smoke ring, and the flavor was unbelievable. The brisket was quite good and the pulled pork was tender and flavorful. The baked beans and greens were outstanding!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The door
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash Tag Hank!!

wSRnNatQ9lNrllQQp7rRbQ.text: My honey brought me here for my birthday. I actually liked it. The food is really good but the area not so good. The side were great. I give it 4 stars because I did not care so much for the ribs. The brisket is excellent that made up for it. Very nice service. Friendly.

FDamcNXgCN6Bh3PgQtQy0g.text: Best BBQ I've ever had!! I'm from San Diego and was searching on Yelp for over 30 minutes, trying to find a good restaurant. My husband and I are foodies and love a good meal, weather it's fine dining or a hole in the wall. I hate paying for a meal that I could've made myself so it was hard to find a restaurant that was worth trying. The food here blew my mind. I ordered the duo plate where I could pick two meats and a side. I picked ribs and pork with a side of fried corn balls. My husband ordered the brisket meatloaf which came with onion rings on top and mashed potatoes. Every single food item, down to the pickles, was absolutely amazing. We didn't leave a single crumb on our plate. We also had the banana pudding that one of the chefs so nicely gave us on the house, just to be nice. He told us that there are several chefs, each one specializing in their own meat. How cool is that? No wonder it was all good. My husband hasn't stopped talking about our meal so we're going back tonight for more, I want to try the peach cobbler! Shout out to Matt at the register for helping us decide what to order. All the employees were so nice and friendly. The atmosphere is relaxed and fun. When we pulled up, our Uber driver wished us luck. It's kind of in the middle of nowhere and looks sketchy but it's really not. If you pull up and think of leaving, give it a shot. It's the best BBQ you'll ever have.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 orders of baby back ribs, pulled pork, beef brisket, Mac and cheese, corn nuggets.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duo plates came with a side. I picked short ribs and pulled pork. That&#39;s less than half the corn balls.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket meatloaf with fried onion rings and mashed potatoes.

NPyqoQSGtfpLVP1AIepD9A.text: hard place to find if you don't have a gps, but once you do, it is bbq heaven. meat is tender, juicy, and the right amount of smoke. They have plenty of sides to choose from too.

aDZ6k1YQRYbKEmw6l5W0YA.text: Not sure how I have not reviewed Rollin as I 've been here at least 5-6 times.   On my first visit I had the brisket sandwich and the rib combo which comes with their spareribs, baby back ribs, and beef ribs.  I'm a Texas BBQ snob and although I cant get my Texan BBQ fix, Rollin Smoke is about the best you'll get in Vegas and they do their beef ribs perfect.....falls off the bone, tender, juicy, and so delicious you'll be in a meat coma.    Speaking of meat coma, I was talked into getting their AYCE the last 2 times for $25. This is the best value because you can literally get EVERYTHING on the menu but their portions for regular items are huge.   For AYCE, i typically get alot of beef ribs, get some brisket, and catfish.  Their catfish is perfectly fried with a nice crust and I squeeze a little lemon on it and pour a little hot sauce and i devour every bite of it.  Their desserts, cobblers are great too.  AND this place is open till 1:30 on fri/sats.  Also good for groups - came with a group of 10-12 people and they sat us all easy.  This place is a locals gem and i often see tourists finding their way here.  Def one of Vegas's best!

awXZVuPV5TFEqjkGnUM7LQ.text: After trying most of the bbq restaurants around town, including the chain bbq places, Rollin Smoke BBQ is the real deal! SIMPLY THE BEST BBQ IN TOWN, the sides and the seafood are great too!!! Do yourself a favor, and treat yourself!!! Bring your family, bring your friends, hell, bring everyone!!! I guarantee you will love it!!! (I posted some of my food pictures here, so check it out!)

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get close to this shrimp perfection... It&#39;s like gold!!! Try this at Rollin Smoke bbq NOW!!!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfectly seasoned, perfectly fried shrimp!!!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfectly crispy bbq chicken wings!!!

X4zqxcZZis1Vep7cnBXibw.text: The only reason I'm giving this place a four star is because there is no bar. The food is really good and it's a nice causal restaurant. It's a good place for a family meal.

ltCqNKcZfwKJ512aOYPlQg.text: Have you ever tasted pure Heaven before?  You will when you sink your teeth into the succulent, juicy, out-of-this world BBQ at Rollin Smoke!  The meat is prepared immediately after you order on their grills which are on-site.  You will get exactly what you ordered prepared EXACTLY how you want it!  The staff is very quick and responsive to your needs and the menu has extraordinary options in terms of BBQ preparation.  You can get an amazing assortment of meats from brisket, ribs, chicken, pulled pork, hot links, and yummy sides like beans, mac & cheese, and cole slaw.  Plus there's an 'All-You-Can-Eat' option for $25.00...wow...if your stomach can handle it., I highly recommend taking it on!  ANYTHING AND EVERYTHING on the menu for only $25 bucks!  I recently decided to take it on by getting the brisket, the baby back ribs, the chicken, and hot links, along with sides of baked beans and mac & cheese...I think I really did see God at one point!  This is not just some BBQ Joint where they'll throw any random meat in a bag onto a grill...this is BBQ made from the heart and the soul delivered fresh and hot to your mouth.  There is no more to say other than, if you truly want a taste of BBQ from the Gods...Rollin Smoke is the place to go!

mv54BbOZSAHTGQC4cgFgcg.text: We go here every time we are here from California! Absolutely the best BBQ and the "All you can eat" option is the way to go! Other than the food being fantastic, James M makes the experience so much better! He is the reason we ALWAYS pick RollinSmoke Barbeque! He is a shining star and an excellent representation of your company and humanity as a whole.

3un3rG3ndfN6PE_Nr2ydmA.text: Pretty good! I'm not a big fan of beef ribs but these are meaty and tender.  Sides were cold but tender ribs made up for it. Mac and cheese not the best. Yams on point and greens good but they were stingy and they were cold. Container was half full. New spot just a hop skip and jump from my place and they deliver too!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Catfish and shrimp basket and 3 rib combo. Greens mac and cheese and yams. Mmm nom!

Syt71JW3GbjH1juwCaAhHg.text: I heard about this place on one of those dive restaurant shows, and it was delicious bbq. And yes the outside looks pretty rough, but the staff was excellent and the food was amazing. I did the brisket and the corn nuggets. I will be back again!!!

QMlPYLHB2Vm-KchN_9k5FQ.text: Great BBQ. Brisket was great. Corn nuggets were great. Spare Ribs we're great. Everything was great!  All the sauce options are interesting. Try the Carolina Vinegar.

Y5KIq5dzh0Z1rUON9VueAQ.text: Came back and I think it was even better than before. We had the combo with ribs and brisket and the meatloaf (again). Sides were Mac n cheese, mashed potatoes with the meatloaf and bacon potato salad. The combo came with this melt in your mouth honey cornbread. Seriously the best BBQ I've ever had (don't tell my hubby).

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana pudding is delish!

H2cFx9-AdmGtF5A9hcjPJg.text: Rollin Smoke does not disappoint.  It was the first stop upon arriving in town.  Amazing brisket, pulled pork, potatoes, mac & cheese, and yams.  Everyone in the party enjoyed the food and kept telling me they were coming back!

YqIj6wlN3Wd5p1tV5oJ8RA.text: This place delights a southern girl's heart! When you are raised on awesome BBQ in the Arkansas, Oklahoma, Texas area, you get spoiled. Not only is Rollin' Smoke a taste of home, it's a taste of heaven!   Must tries: The meatloaf, the hamburger, the rib tip, and the corn nuggets!

PcapBHT7NwyNQDFsIOGslA.text: This place is the best BBQ I have ever had, and I have had a lot of great bbq. I ordered the outlaw burger because of reviews I had read. This thing is HUGE. It's definitely something you need to cut. The flavor was amazing, the burger was cooked just right, and I loved the onion straws. My husband got the brisket dog, he loved it too and like mine it was also very large. They stock the tables with bbq sauce that is also AMAZING. I will say that the place is pretty small and seating can be hard to come by because of the popularity of this place. It is worth the wait though! The sides are al a cart. The hush puppies were interesting with peppers inside. It added a nice spice to the puppies but they would have been much better if they served them with butter. The Mac and cheese was great as well, I believe this is one of their most popular sides based on reviews. My husband got the coleslaw, I wasn't a huge fan of this, not sure what they put on it. All together I love this place and we plan to keep going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The enormous outlaw burger

M_sjPw2T8SiN6uR1pdb-ow.text: Friday night... fridge has left overs but doesn't sound that great after over a 9 hour day of work... Pho? nah... Burger again?.. ehhh.. Ohh yes BBQ!           ohh my goodness. The carnivore bug.. bit my neck; visions of falling off the bone goodness, sauces, and messy fingers! I just had to try out Rollin Smoke Barbecue!     Located behind fashion show mall, near all the "adult" stores.. a little shack... other people drive up ; 3 guys and a girl in another vehicle pull up and order before us in line.. Too bad these male law students can't pay for the girl.. she ordered last.. I was like " Why are they not pitching in for a lady to eat at a BBQ!?"  i guess they are all on "friend status" only.....     Special of the Day: Beef tips, with two sides and a drink for $13.00.. I got the LAST order. the gentleman i ordered from, w/ braids/dreads(dirty blond) was so nice and had the best hospitality.. it was so refreshing.       I want to try some chicken and pig.. so the Half Chicken and Half Spare Ribs was in order... Mention a Check-in on Yelp and they will gladly honor a free dessert.. I asked" What's the best to get?"  the Braided gentleman in his accent.. "the Banana one".. i said "let's go for it!"     At last the food arrived and it easily feeds for 6. but my bf and I could finish these trays of food in two sitting!  wow, THe food here is just so different.. Smoky and not too sweet but the beef tip and ribs had a special zing... not too spicy. i just say .. ZING" is the word and i liked it!  We chowed down.. even the loaded potato salad and chipotle Cole slaw was a nice accompaniment to the hearty meat.   Dessert! ohh my goodness real ripe banana and the pudding with the vanilla wafers and spray of whipped cream! i want one right now ! soo indulgent that i almost had a big "O" ..no i didn't but it made me think .. How much time did they really make this banana goodness in a cup?. was it just jello instant banana pudding and i'm just having a taste bud trip?   So... is it worth going to the Rollin? Yes! Go.and make sure to utilize the roll of paper towels on the table and don't get upset that your clothes smell like a Smoky BBQ plate!

9eWSy5EzYfIMLKWk44nNVw.text: This place was kind of hard to find. We got the Pit, which is all five of their meats, bacon potato salad, corn nuggets, and waffle fries. Their service is very friendly. Probably the best in Las Vegas. The meats have great flavor and is juicy. If you're a corn lover, you MUST absolutely get the corn nuggets. It's fantastic. This place is a MUST when you're in Vegas.

ESQc-XyzQzHu_7p2jlQPMw.text: The sauce, I literally contemplated drinking it straight from the bottle, but every time I looked around people were watching. Its not that thick, disgustingly sweet sauce, its thin, perfect spice level, slightly sweet with vinegar notes. Perfection.  Now the meat, had the 5 meats and 3 sides. Brisket is on point, ribs smokey deelish, chicken, cant go wrong with chicken, and the pulled pork? Yum! Hotlinks had a nice peppery smokiness to them too.   Sides: we had several and shared. Mac n cheese is pretty decent. Baked beans, tasty, but Ive had better. Cole slaw was unique and had a nice smokey flavor without the chipotle heat as suggested in the name. Potato salad was meh, typical potato salad with bacon crumbled on top. Now, the star of the sides show- those little corn nuggets. There is something magical in them. Not sure if they sprinkle opiates in them(kidding), cause they are seriously addicting. If you get one side, make it these magical little corn bombs that explode in your mouth. There are no words.  Now for service- amazing!! Everyone was super friendly and on point! I was impressed. You dont get service like this anymore! We will definitely be back :)

74JX4ARkwmxjzY3cB3_pZQ.text: Can you say best BBQ in Las Vegas??  My husband is from Atlanta and is very particular about his BBQ.  We have eaten here a couple times, and have been very impressed every time!  The only complaint I had was the first time we went, the baked potato for our "Spudtastic" was way over cooked to the point of being inedible.  But I can say everything else is just amazing.  This last time we went, my mother and I split the "Outlaw" burger.  Probably the biggest burger we've ever eaten!!  It was humongous!!  Pork ribs are good, hot links are great, pulled pork is amazing, but the beef ribs are to die for!  Nice and charred on the outside and just deliciously tender with a hint of fattiness to it.  Absolutely delicious.

nr4cUCb_KRiGWEVUk5R_Aw.text: I was cravin bbq after driving by Memphis BBQ on the way home. We were going to head there, but after checking out the reviews on  Yelp I decided to try Rollin Smoke BBQ! Some of the best bbq I've had in a while that wasn't from a chain (Famous Dave's - which I 'm not knocking as I've had great food there as well). I would go out of my way for TC Rib Crib so I'm glad I found a place closer to home.   This place is a little hard to get to but so glad we found it. I got the three meat platter with spare two spare ribs, pulled pork, and the FATTY part of the brisket with sides of cheesy mac and yams. The ribs were meaty and tender. Nice char on the meat, great smoky flavor! The pulled pork was tender as well. Great pork flavor. The fatty part of the brisket was killer! Nice burnt fat pieces with succulent strips of beefy goodness. They also threw in regular pieces of brisket which I didn't care for but took it home anyway. I don't care who makes it, I've never cared for brisket as I've always thought  it's a dry piece of meat. It was great cold the next day. The mac n cheese was creamy  enough, but even the extra cheese on top didn't make it "cheesy" enough. The yams were excellent. Lots of brown sugar cinammony goodness! The portions are large and come with a piece of Texas toast under the meats so it soaked up all the pork juices and was an extra added treat! My friend enjoyed his chicken and spare rib plate with jalapeno cole slaw and fried okra. There BBQ sauce is very good! Not too sweet, peppery and flavorul!      I take away a star because of the brisket and mac n cheese. I would have to try other things before upgrading to a 5. Great, friendly service and good food! I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three meats fatty brisket, pork, spare ribs and cheesy mac and yams!

mih5jOiy7e21hC4HIno0vw.text: Very good food. Friendly service and was very quick.  Highly recommend the pulled pork and waffle fries.

yQK85xjS_14ScaOU3R1X7A.text: Really enjoyed the food here, the pulled pork sandwich was awesome, along with there Mac and cheese and bbq beans. The pulled pork was perfect, not to salty or bland,plenty of flavor.The staff were very pleasant to talk to, the grill masters were super nice also. I will be coming back for sure! Don't miss out, hands down best bbq in LV!

zwrb27SqApLixE-hJ_yceA.text: This place takes pride to a whole 'nother level. You wouldn't believe how fantastic the service is until you experience it yourself. The man himself, David, is a genius with comfort food. I suppose their location is meant to be sort of hidden, almost like you were to try and find it on your way to Arkansas. DO NOT miss out on the banana pudding or the yams!!

WfUTvsTCN81v5NptcOB4zA.text: Great food. A must if you visit las vegas. The briskets is killer. Go for the fun atmosphere and great food.

QNoqldX4YoSKB7D4TP5eVA.text: Today was my third time having Rollin Smoke and some how every visit, my expectations have been exceeded.   Today, I brought my family to show them the food I've been bringing up so many times. I order the outlaw burger with my sister and my mom gets some pulled pork. The owner comes out and sits at our table and apologizes to me saying they just ran out of an ingredient of the outlaw but asks if it's okay if he "hooks me up." Knowing there's nothing on the menu that could let me down I'm completely okay with it. He comes back with extra sides and twice the food I was originally receiving. Everything was amazing. From the food to the customer service. I'd go in depth of how good everything he brought out was was but it would make this review too long to get through. Long story short; This remains my favorite local BBQ joint and it'll be yours too.

KnlXiVaopd52uhfqF4t9Bg.text: Brisket sandwich lacked any smokey flavor at all. Very disappointed. Over priced for the lack of quality.

ZsO-dJWfVXuV3HG1sYlUCg.text: Good ol' southern style smoked meat!  All the owners are friendly and not afraid to come out of the kitchen to say hello and see how we were doing.  If you're looking for some good smoked meat...this is your place!

qaPfq48-yb2CEDDrVP5ppg.text: It may not be near our neighborhood but it's worth the drive. In my hungry gals opinion it's the best BBQ we've found in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Southern peach cobble.

hPd8Re-hshlafb48myJvmw.text: Me and my bf favorite BBQ spot. We came here once a month or once every other month. A couple of things changed since we first came here. Definitely longer line but they still keep the great food quality and customer service as before. We got rolling smoke catered at our house party in December n everyone loved it. I highly recommend this place to everyone.

W99Bfcnp4rULiFrXW4qnuA.text: Pit Master and part owner "Dusty" is amazing! I called before Hand to make sure I could eat there with my gluten allergies and he assured me everything but the bread is gluten free! I ate there with no issues and the bbq was AMAZING! I'm from the south and for bbq to impress me is a hard feat! Dusty and the gang at Rollin Smoke are at the top of the class!

ckDKRPnKqon6Cj5JjLcX5w.text: Great food as always!  Excellent portions with prices to match.  My fav is the pulled pork sandwich and the potato salad.  Tried the blackberry cobbler tonight and it's awesome!  Thank you for giving us an incredible option for barbecue.

sGA5ByV4zuCuJRSHCRaBHA.text: OMG!!! Sooo good. The bbq was amazing. Service wasn great. Can not wait to go back.

_tE6Y-viwHtso-bZNxfpnw.text: Okay, so my son and I went to RS last Friday night. He got the Biggin' and I got the 4 Rib plate. And that where things got crazy..........  It's been 5 days and I am still struggling to figure out where to go with this review. Some of what happened was 5 stars and more. Some of what happened was 1 star and less. So I will keep it simple; my son's Biggin' was incredible! My 4 rib combo was okay. I would have liked more flavor, both smoke flavor and seasoning flavor. The service was a mix of being both incredibly entertaining and incredibly bad.  Bottom line; although our visit didn't go as well as i would have hoped, when all was said and done they did their best to make things right. It's a great little "mom and pop" Q joint that is feeling the blessing/curse of yelp and LV weekly notoriety. I have no doubt they will pull through and I have no doubt I will be back.

Xq-5MUUwcAsjklZ4hMSVSg.text: Amazing BBQ and left me feeling great after. I got to sample a bit of everything as they were wrapping up after a festival. The BBQ chicken and pulled pork are my favorite. And I will get more corn nuggets and fried okra next time. The owner has a lot of energy and can really raise the stoke level for BBQ. It's great. I'll definitely stop by next time I'm in town.

L9VLOnN_tRt_nUzvcjHsLw.text: The food is good, no question. I'm not giving more stars because of other problems.  I ordered the trio, requesting ribs, pulled pork, and brisket.  Instead of brisket they gave me chicken.  My ticket said brisket, so someone in the back screwed up. Also, instead of a roll, the gave me a slice of bread. That would have been fine, except that they put it UNDER the meats...  Anyway, the food I had was very good--spare ribs, pulled pork, chicken, and kickin beans.  One more thing--when you enter, the place smells like it's on fire...but in a good way.

FzqmSzEs-_87qKI-vFCZBQ.text: This place is amazing! I can't get enough! Everyone is super nice, and the food is phenomenal!

1zZ5hPuDbF4hp-la6D5A9A.text: This review is on the food only because we took it togo.  I read all of the review and it seemed like a good bar b que restaurant.  We ordered the brisket, ribs, hot links, peach cobbler and the banana pudding.  I do not believe they gave the banana pudding the name of grandma's banana pudding, this didn't taste like any grandmas pudding I ever tasted (it was awful).  Everything we ordered was awful. If we stayed at the restaurant we would have sent everything back and got our money back.  We  ate a few bites and threw the rest of it in the trash.  This was a waste of my money since I spend about fifty dollars on the horrible food.

1q9VKPshGWi_QOjFFX6YwA.text: 3 stars because appeasing to the masses, sometimes, comes at the cost of dullness. Smoked meats are fantastic, but without a uniqueness in choice of woods ( Bleh - traditional mesquite and hickory  :-P ) or without some real body of unique seasonings,,, what have ya got?  If flavor WAS there,, I didn't taste it, and I ate slowly. I had the pulled pork and brisket. Both of these should be oozing with flavor.. I had to lightly sauce every bite to enjoy it. However, the brisket was cooked perfectly, pork a little over but no biggie..the table-side sauce is excellent which got me thinking... Maybe that was their intention? To leave it bland and let the customers sauce it to their liking? In Vegas... No balls no blue chips.

Y49lr3K5PKenPBRVyfyBoQ.text: The food was soooo good. The meat was tender and the sides were delicious.  I ordered the brisket and rib combo and it did not disappoint.  Staff was friendly, attentive,  and courteous.

VX-6inFLqy78yjb06M593Q.text: My husband just came home with this for lunch and now I want to go back for dinner!   Tonite!   AMAZING BBQ!  Everything we got was tender, smoky, and delicious!  He got a combo platter with brisket, hot links, beef ribs, chicken and 3 sides.  The fried okra is a must-try.  The potato salad was meh--hubby liked it a lot, I did not.  And the bbq beans were outstanding.  They definitely have a kick to them.   The ribs were SO tender!  Falling off the bone.  Brisket so very tender.  Hot links hot ;).  Chicken yummy.  They serve sauce on the side, but you don't need it because all of the meats are jam-packed full of flavor.   Husband told me to make sure and mention Dusty, the pit master.  He was very friendly and made excellent recommendations.  I can't wait to go back!

-GdkoZlQIXG94tC6PjDODQ.text: I have personally been here twice.....my husband and his friend more than that and every time he is anywhere near the place! It is bar none the best barbeque I have EVER HAD!!! The cook, the staff, everyone super friendly and everything I've eaten is to die for!!!

Pj_7nRMLwwGULMj69bBIAA.text: I'm from Houston Texas the barbecue capital and although I will not tell you that these folks in Las Vegas are as good as Houston Texas for barbecue and even if they were I would not admit it I will tell you it's pretty darn good and pretty darn close and I would come back here again and again so let that be your hands if you're going to go to Las Vegas and you're going to want barbecue you're going to want to stop here

UX5QRMm-fMLZuJBo2CQ0_Q.text: Without a doubt, great bbq.  Looks like a dive, but the chickrn, brisket and pulled pork were awesome.   Only regret is this place isn't closer to home.

dyGIXA77cuVq5yXxGj2O7g.text: Food was 4/5 star range but the seating and environment was a 2 at best.

xzOiNFfTSpaJI63H0LNo4Q.text: Best BBQ in Las Vegas, hands down!  The food, especially the peach cobbler is always spot on! The only thing that could possibly make it better is more seating.

DVXk_9xDPFubkLEdWLqH9Q.text: I give this place a 0 on a scale of 1-10; 10 being the highest. Worst customer service. This place argued with me and wasn't welcoming at all. Although, the food might have been good enough for its pricing, I surely did not have a good expeirence.

FB3EpbJYIz8xa2JLKOOXVA.text: We ate here for the first time after hearing how great it was.I can't wait to go back.We ordered the 4 meat 3 side plate for $19.95.Great way to sample the food.Practically licked my fingers after we ate, it was that tasty.You must be patient as there is a line to order usually.All of the food we ate tasted fresh though.Great ribs and meats Worth a try and you will want more.

jq6jmelTOnM5XaXPktrTeQ.text: Yum, friendly, cheap. low key joint a bit off the strip (need wheels to get there).

J9pEBucuYwHRKhNKuRqibQ.text: Love the ribs beef ribs chicken and coleslaw but the best thing was the mac & cheese. Would go back there again next time I'm in Vegas. Don't judge it by the outside inside is where the action is and the food is well worth the price. Really close to the strip and Worth the drive.

XpUadfc1MAJw81J8YZumwA.text: So glad we found this place. This will be the new go to joint for sure when we come to vegas. Love the fact that it's off strip. Had the brisket with waffle fries, side of loaded and mac and cheese. Everything was great and not overtop in sauce, flavor or size.

LCrFSYSGvq2kLkESDyuMrA.text: I have been here a few times. I have tried everything. Good food but not worth the hype. Great staff but the bbq is just ok. The banana pudding is great but the cobbler barely has any fruit in it. If you want some bbq a good place to go but not a place worth going out of your way for.

8dEHf91OeeSVDmy1qfr64w.text: Incredible pulled pork 1 block off the Vegas Strip. Bacon potato salad and jalapeno slaw.

bq2xjkNhaJcMDrQSejJuBA.text: Why are you still wasting your time looking for over priced food on the strip. Quick head over to Rollin smoke barbeque and enjoy the best BBQ in Vegas.  I had brisket and pull pork only 10.99. You can't find that on the strip.

eTjw9iogM0ZK5J_xiKTgcg.text: We waited 20 minutes  only to find out they closed at 8pm... no one in sight to let us know . Doors should be locked!  When someone  finally  came out from the back we asked to at least take some cornbread  to go... the guy said no.. was not willing to go over and  beyond !.. working in this industry  that is the key to having customers  return!... need to rethink about closing  at 8... its VEGAS !

jCWWbqLgQb4_et13_sMh4Q.text: Smoked meatloaf and pork ribs!  Amazing combo. The "damn hot" sauce was just right.   Will try beef ribs next visit. Small place with picnic tables out front.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G8JNpPVoeJ4s74uDYQrDdA.text: Had the smoked ribs, chicken, and sliced sausage link with corn nuggets, hush puppies and peach cobbler,   Ribs  were perfectly flavored, smoked and tender.   Their sides and desserts aren't anything to get excited about. Peach cobbler was sweet with chunks of bread. Banana pudding was no good. It was just pudding with hard cookies and no bananas.   The only knock is CONSISTENCY. I went back the next day and the ribs were far from the first time. Still flavored pretty good . But not as tender. Bummer!  Still give them a 5 for my first experience there. Yesterday I thought I had finally tasted the best BBQ of my life.

cvdwXW6WVmNtydpwVaNNCw.text: Large menu, seems consistently busy and a BBQ buffet to purge on!  We both ordered the all you can eat ($25 pp) which is good value! Round 1: ribs, 2 orders of hot links, pulled pork, 2 orders of brisket with the jalapeno cole slaw, kicken beans, mashed potato casserole and potato salad.  REVIEW: meat was all tasty except for pulled pork was incredibly dry. Took a lot of extra bbq sauce to enjoy. The hot links are sure tasty with just the right amount of spice. We LOVED the kicken beans that were slightly sweet and savory -- Mmmm! The jalapeno cole slaw is unique and one to at least give a try.   Round 2: chicken, 2 rib ends, ribs (again) and sides of fried okra, corn nuggets and onion straws. The chicken was juicy but came smothered in sauce which I don't care for. Rib ends were crunchy and had True smoke flavor. The corn nuggets are AMAZING with a sweet inside and perfectly crisp outside. The fries okra came with a side of sauce that complemented it well (sort of a Raising Cane's creamier sauce). The onion straws were average but tasted good.  Luckily for them the 2nd round is smaller (less wastage). We left smelling like smoke and were super stuffed. We are not sure if we will give it another shot or not but we can say that we have been there.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat buffet! Pulled pork, hot links, brisket and kicken beans, jalapeño cole slaw, potato salad and loaded mashed potatoes

1rAMK_GWYtEf09MU0di9FA.text: Best BBQ in town. That brisket burger is the business but everything is GOOD AF! The cobbler is delicious and all the sides are too.

jkNxJNTEeeof01ZV4prYrA.text: I was craving barbecue while in Vegas and my good friend told me to come here. I ordered the Pit Special and got the brisket, chicken, pulled pork, and ribs with baked beans, mac and cheese, and fried onion strings as my sides.   All we're delicious however I would probably get the hot links instead of the chicken next time. It satisfied my barbecue craving and the price was definitely reasonable. The staff was friendly as well and the wait wasn't too bad considering the line was out the door around 11am.   I'll definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried onion strings, baked beans, mac and cheese and the Pit Special

8653fKrdv-6PMSSnqqtSmg.text: Adding my unqualified 5 stars to a great bbq joint with a 4 1/2 star average based on nearly 1600 reviews is probably an unnecessary form of piling on.  To the extent it may add a little sizzle to the bbq fire, I've judged a lot of KCBS sanctioned bbq contests over the years, and I can state without hesitation that this is terrific bbq.  5 star all the way.  I had the pleasure of meeting Chef Will while I was there, and told him I thought he was definitely an expert bbq chef, and that his work rivaled the best of the best bbq places in the country.  Interestingly, one of my favorite dishes from Chef Will was the beef ribs, something that is never part of a genuine bbq competition.  The beef ribs were amazingly tender, with just the right amount of beefy, smokey flavor, and exactly the appropriate texture for easy biting and enjoying.  My son and I chose to take advantage of RS's amazing bargain - $35 for any amount of any items on the menu.  What a great way to sample everything.  We arrived at RS before its 10 am opening, and we were not the first in line.  This place has definitely been discovered, yet it deserves all of the new reviews it receives.  The ribs are perfectly cooked, the brisket is tender, juicy, and has just the right amount of smoke and meat flavor, the sides and desserts are absolutely terrific.  And yes, the corn nuggets are in a class by themselves.  Wow, are they special and addictive.  If that recipe ever gets out, it could be the beginning of world peace.  Even Brenda, behind the counter, was as helpful and nice as could be.  She made us feel right at home, helped us with our choices, explained the system for ordering and receiving the delicious dishes, and generally conveyed an honest, feel-good vibe.  I highly recommend Rollin Smoke for BBQ that should be on anyone's list of the top BBQ restaurants in the country.

1pvbPlQUbB_w7Q-YGf0Lcg.text: Certainly a " hole in the wall", no frills place for outstanding BBQ.  Fast friendly service, excellent selection of meats, sides, and sauces.  Will absolutely visit the next time I'm in Las Vegas.

mndjvEfx6MBP6VblgXdZQw.text: When pulling into the parking lot you can smell so much smokey goodness in the air it immediately tempts your taste buds. I had my dog with & he couldn't stop sniffing the air. The place itself looks pretty dumpy but don't let that distract you because the food is wonderful. I've ordered the pound of pulled pork to go a few times to make sandwiches at home (didn't want the whole meal deal). Always good but they give you a small amount of bbq so if you like a lot you need to order more. Also, there is always a piece of bread on the bottom which I decline because if you plan on not eating right away it ends up stuck to the meat. It is still my favorite bbq spot in Vegas. Other places just don't seem to have that wonderful smokiness to the meat that Rollin Smoke does so well.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pound of pork

DW25TjfM-chdfTCqgJ6iKw.text: I met up with a few Yelpers on the day that Travel Channel's Food Paradise was filming here. We were too late for our 15 seconds of fame, but the film crew was still there and it was neat watching them work. It was also not as crowded as I had expected, so it was quick to order and many tables available. The food took a bit longer to come out, but I believe that's standard.  I ordered the "Duo Choice of Two Meats" Smokin Plate with Hot Link and 2 Spare Ribs (other meat choices are brisket, pork, or 1/4 chicken), Waffle Fries (there are 16 choices of Smokin Sides), and a drink for $10.99. The sausage or hot link was really tasty and they're not messing around with the heat! If you can't handle spicy food, watch out. I enjoyed the ribs as well, especially with their BBQ sauce. I definitely could've eaten more! I liked their offerings of sweetened and unsweetened iced tea as I mixed the two and had a nice balance.  We tried a couple cobblers, banana pudding, and the special Reese's PB bread pudding. The cobblers were all right and the banana pudding was decent. The bread pudding was off the hook though! Really good!  I think one of the best parts of their menu is the AYCE option for $24.99. It's offered all day, every day and has no restrictions (except no sharing or to-go, obviously). It's a ridiculous deal for meat! If I can get a few people together, I think that it would be a cool option to order all the types of meat and sides for everyone.

ngDuMzJ1gGjF0Btq0GXcLA.text: Horrible customer service, food wasn't fresh and they completely forgot about one of our meals. I'll definitely avoid this place from now on.

YWQFUYpQFvR0VQGbeEsA5g.text: As a visitor going off strip is usually only done based on reputation, including the advice of locals and sites such as Yelp. I am happy to report that Rollin Smoke more than lived up to it's great reputation.  We arrived a little early (11:30am) for lunch, which was fortunate given that we just got ahead of the locals and the lunch rush. We ordered 4 different selections off the expansive menu and were all heartily pleased. Great brisket and pulled pork, amazing flavour, delicious sides. It is not fancy, mostly banquet seating but let's face it, BBQ is about taste, quality and selection.  For visitors without rental cars it is only a short taxi ride from the strip.  If you want a great BBQ experience at a reasonable price, Rollin Smoke is for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall menu
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secondary eating area
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_e92W9QtcXhAivRnXo7PeA.text: Spectacular barbecue. We made a special visit for a birthday  and found the burnt ends to be much more moist than any other we've found. The pulled pork was roughly pulled, with crunchy bits as well as perfect strands. The chicken was smoked beautifully. Beans (baked) were spicy, beans (string) were crunchy, corn nuggets naturally sweet and addictive, cornbread flavourful and cakey. Arkansauce was bright and runny. Friendly crew, clean and comfy.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday barbecue at Rollin&#39; Smoke LV NV

f6RoOMjsXV_U8Uxsa1TLBA.text: This place definitely lives up to the hype. With that being said, it is a little pricey for the amount of food you get. I most certainly would recommend trying this place if you are in Vegas as it's not to far from the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The burger that made them famous! Delicious but a little pricey for the amount of food you get. Still a must try.

gi6qKv5cW3nfiKLb3Fa22A.text: Wow!!! What great meat. Even better were their sides. Loaded mashed potatoes were great. This is no frills, off the strip, great food. Portions are huge though. May want to see food come out before you accidentally order too much.

wpknVlUSsjebPreq_N_Zow.text: I'm from TEXAS and to come to Vegas and find DAM GOOD Bbq was a shock I really doubted this place at first but boy let me tell you. They got something magical over there. My whole group of six was iffy but.....THE RIBS THE MAC & CHEESE THE CORN NUGGETS But wait that GOT DAMN MEATLOAF  Should run for President.

cUeZdfWX3Lfcw9GWeOXRhQ.text: OMG legit!  Went here tonight with a coworker from Texas, so she knows good BBQ and this was good!  Can't wait to go back before I head back home!  We tried the plate with all five meats plus sides. The baked beans were amazing!

nR6SE-lhR-O-8A1oNKI8fQ.text: I've tried to bake beans yams green beans corn nuggets the spareribs the hotlink the baby back to the brisket and everything was delicious so far haven't had anything there I didn't like

LsvkFM_3JNv0pw0bEgqI6w.text: Hands down the best I've had in Vegas!! Skip Lucilles and come here if you want good authentic BBQ!!!

1ukEG6T6_v751XX_fgMFTg.text: One of the best BBQ ever,you know its good when the bone just slips out the meat..we had the Rib Platter Special with the extra beef rib and it was enough for us to get full with some leftover..worth the money,must go to restaurant when you're in Vegas!

JZy_bOm9IzjGAoKLdG1ZCA.text: Go in, walk up to the counter, order from their mouth watering menu and then take a seat and wait for your food! (Take-out was also popular). I had the chopped brisket and the pulled pork and both were the best I have had since I moved away from the south 7 years ago. The beans were delish also. Staff was really nice, especially the woman who came out from the kitchen with all the food.

PpABZBhRr01QP1gTP2e6bw.text: Food was ok.  Had pulled pork and brisket.  Pork was real fatty.  Kids had the ribs.  Wife had the chicken.  Place gets pretty busy.  Crowded seating area during those times and tough parking.  Be careful you don't get your car towed.

TvqQXgMdo1dHModPYA56VA.text: Seriously such good bbq for such a great price! The chef Will is the best chef ever and I'm telling the you, cute girl Lizelle is just as sweet as she looks if you know what I'm saying! The staff is so friendly they made me care to remember their names, very welcoming. Definitely coming back and telling everyone !

YT7Qb7Bk8lABlsan65KbAA.text: Believe the hype. I tried Rollin smoke on 8/5/14 and it was phenomenal. The meats are fresh and juicy, especially the pulled pork, but my favorite are the sides! The corn nuggets and bacon potato salad are to die for. The yams and kickin beans are also great. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Yelp said they closed at 8:00 but they were still accepting guests at 8:30 despite the open sign being turned off. They do not turn away their guests which I thought was interesting. I can't wait to go back!!

RgRlqY_YK4cNbCJgbfJOVQ.text: Their beef rib isnt as good as the Brontosaurus Rib I get at Mighty Quinn's but their burnt ends,spicy links and peach cobbler were all very good. I would come back here to eat those items again.

m30wAzggr4_nGkhB_AGTqA.text: What a great find! Imagine a Dickey's-style BBQ joint but local/downhome. Great pricing for the LARGE portions of amazing food you get. Love the hush puppies - they have a kick. The spudtastic was crazy good. Ignore the strange placement of this establishment and GO!

u-nnFeniu8xiRT6hYGCvrQ.text: Omg! I'm a barbecue addict I've had great ones in California Arizona and Chicago but this place is on another level!!! I got the brisket and links and then they have the nerve to sale catfish!!! Had to get the seafood platter too!!! Service was impeccable!! If you're in Vegas this is a must stop ask for Matt the best in the west!!!

2ZQLTboa8FVkHEy8ckK5xA.text: Just went to this place today...since quite a few ppl said it's the BOMB thought we'd try it... we ordered 2 duo plates: ribs/chkn w/collard greens & brisket/pork w/maccheese ...not sure if our expectations are too high but, we're totally disappointed. Portions are way better than Dickeys BBQ but the sides/meat are cold/bland. The sauce us good though... btw doesn't taste/or looked like it came right of the grill either should have taken a picture before we tossed them... and, we called our orders in 15-20 minutes early... still had to wait extra 15 minutes when we got there... just not "THE BOMB" BBQ that everyone has been telling us. We spent $23+ for the 2 combo plates. Southern Pines North Carolina Dickeys BBQ has been the best for us. Sorry for the negative review but I had to tell the truth. I'm sure you'll find my review with the rest of NOT so good reviews.

ch-U4NLAmJHLF_9ejcr0xw.text: This is a great place to go for a BBQ I will go back for sure.They are very welcoming Dusty was a great help Thanks for a great dinner

L3BIrzAQaKssq01oD2ZM8w.text: Bbq was okay..not True Texas bbq that I'm used to..what really hurt my visit was how loud and small the areas are.  As a disabled vet I have hearing and anxiety issues.  If you also have any issues with small spaces or loud noises, it will literally send you into a panic attack .  I would recommend making the 3 small rooms a big room so the noise doesn't bounce off so bad and echo. Also to make the space larger so it is not so overwhelming feeling.

HK1_TB-zIfznM4saiAtVWQ.text: This has been my favorite barbecue place since I found it through a friend, not long after they opened. I was coming here weekly for a long time. Get the trio platter with brisket, chicken and hot link. Best sides are the kickin' beans and the jalapeno coleslaw.

_kkGkEbcJDYtMM0mg3wBCw.text: I am a beef Ribs lover since I don't eat pork.... I have tried many many over the years and this is the best by far I have found......will be back for sure....

KEMtvEtX9BKckWxEAt4Xhw.text: Best BBQ in Vegas. And The Crew at Rolling Smoke are just like Their Meat...Genuinely Good  We Don't Normally Have Food at Hogs and Heifers, But When We Do, We Call Rolling Smoke

kqCcLpa_-xxIp5o3otK38A.text: The best BBQ I have ever had. The smell when you walk up to the place is amazing, the staff is super friendly its just all around a great place to eat.

zSuPklHQcrJu15qeghxU8A.text: The Beef Ribs were cooked (smoked) perfect, easily the best Ive ever had (and Ive had my share)..Tender and mouth watering would be the best description. Met the owner and one of his son's, they were the type of people you would invite to sit at your dinner table and talk BBQ with, just nice folks. My wife had the smoked meat loaf and it was awesome also..The BEST BBQ in Las Vegas hands down

7BQGszkldSAk0AQO6ICjzw.text: Mac n cheese awsome but i didnt really like the bbq im sorry ive eaten at better places .i think famous daves its better .you people put to much pepper in your foods not good .besides that place is clean

dctfR2rpi7bR4jjapWVqEQ.text: It was good, but i've had better. I was really looking forward to trying it since i heard about it on the travel and food network. The burger is massive but too many onions, and the brisket was dry and wasn't very tender. I was looking for that fall part goodness in your mouth bbq and well the only place that is good that i've had to far is Lucille's BBQ.  Oh well, another place to calk up....

RofjAm_4ChQfnKJmIac5tg.text: Great BBQ. Burger has great seasoning (garlic I think) and the brisket is great. Can't go wrong here, other than eating too much.

b0DIeJLmRsk-sZLSLE5g_A.text: Did I go to the wrong place? Did I go on the wrong day? Did I order the wrong thing?  I was so excited to try this place. With stellar reviews and a line out the door, it had to be the bomb, right? Unfortunately, I really wanted to love this place but I just didn't. Based on reviews, I went early to avoid the lunch rush. Luckily, there was no line yet. Staff was very nice and kept checking on me while I was waiting on my colleagues. Didn't have to wait too long for our food and by that time ,sure enough, the line was out the door. I had the slider trio with pork, brisket and hot links. The pork and hot links were good, but nothing that different or special. The BBQ sauce was decent. I was completely disappointed with the brisket. It has so much fat in it that I didn't eat about half of it. Now mind you, I like leaner cuts of meat and I know some people like the fat, but this was just way too much. Those at the table also got the bacon potato salad, the waffle fries and the corn nuggets. All were just ok - nothing great.   If I'm in the neighborhood, I'll give it another try, but I won't go out of my way - it just wasn't worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slider trio - pork, brisket &amp; hot links

NY880NgkNh5ROGAlmRzWpg.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  I have not had anything at this place that I do not love!! I wish I could figure out how they make the Corn Nuggets. I would live off these things!!

bFFSBI02sJx0pBbi2EU4DA.text: This is a real hidden treat off the strip. When you walk in, you order at a podium then sit either inside or out at big picnic tables. The food is brought out to you fast and is delicious. We ordered the Outlaw Burger, the beef ribs and sides of greens and cornbread. The burger (which is HUGE)  is made of brisket and is topped with cabbage slaw, fried onion strings, chipotle aioli, lettuce and tomato and was perfectly cooked. The beef ribs come with two bones and are Flintstone size. They have the perfect amount of char and completely fall off the bone. The greens are cooked with brisket instead of bacon or ham and are well worth adding on as a side if not included with your meal choice. The cornbread was a little sweet for our taste but certainly good. Prices are very reasonable. As new residents of Las Vegas, we will definitely be back.

E06UEwuWaeM8LtHt0CD_Kg.text: Delicious, excellent quality, fast, friendly! Loved it!  Try the pulled pork nacho fries and corn nuggets.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork nacho fries! Mmmmm!

NQaBrlumRB98JR0HGFfglg.text: We decided to go off-strip to get food and I am glad we did. I've had BBQ in Texas and Memphis (for example) and I think this place was up there with my favorites. It is well worth the short drive from the strip. I really liked the beef brisket. I ordered a 3 meat combo in order to sample different meats.

nUakwQTu7qP7mL3kokgJDg.text: Really REALLY great bbq spot. Mac n cheese were good brisket is a must try. And their corn nuggets are also up there. Granted this location is in Vegas it  definitely knows how to take me back to Little Rock, Arkansas with their sauces and meals. Antonio was very kind enough to explain what was liked by regulars and was very courteous with being patient for us to order.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

40bH2T3-tKb9PnzZkH0m3Q.text: I was in Vegas over the weekend for the husband's birthday. We found this place on one of our last trips and my husband put it on his must revisit list. When we went the 1st time we ended up getting an order of rib tips to share since we had an itinerary of places to try off the strip. The rib tips came out so tender and juicy. We got to try all of the sauces i loved the vinegar and peppers where my husband liked the mustard based sauce.  My husband noticed that they has an all you can eat option that featured everything on the menu. So that is what he wanted to do the next time we came to town.  The all you can eat is 35.99 which is very comparable to some of the buffets on the strip but the quality is so much better, for the AYCE you start with 3 meats and 2 sides, you have a hour time limit, you skip the line to order more, and you can pretty much get anything on the menu including desserts. Come hungry, they give you full size portions with every order.  My husband who can eat more then most people got full after the 2nd order but insisted on getting a few more things so he could say he tried all the meats on the menu.  My favorite are the burnt ends they are so worth it, (you usually have to pay more for them for most meals but they are included in the AYCE). The hubby loved the St. Louis ribs and the smoked meatloaf, but everything we had was pretty amazing.   We will be back just might not do the AYCE again.

04zK_ut7pxzJB2Ar4VpOyw.text: Great BBQ joint! There's a wait during the lunch rush, but it's worth it. Staff is nice, and facilities are clean. Plenty of places to sit inside and out. The parking lot is tight, so you may have to park across the street. The brisket and po'boys are phenomenal and I recommend the  hush puppies. Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rollin&#39; Smoke

hAWhb24SaLCD9C1exX4vaQ.text: Having worked right next door - this was my bi-weekly treat to a job well done.   The food is fantastic - just have to try it. Everything is done good ol' barbeque perfection.   Try everything. You won't be disappointed.
