1CbTJLcUhyVfl7vDyW0MMg.text: Been here two years ago and went back a few times over the past weeks, still loving it! Quality   and taste is just always very good! Get one of those combi meals, a taste of everything would be my suggestion. My favorites are the ribs, waffle fries, pulled pork and the fried onions, I just had to order a portion extra. The crew is always so friendly and patient in our case, as we could not decide on what to have :-)  This is a must go location!

QJG3uO2aTkgv4MhC7R5YjA.text: We drive in from San Bernardino and it was worth the drive.  The cashier Justina provided us with Excellent Customer service and the food was hot and deliciousness.  My son want to move to Las Vegas now because you guys was so deliciousness.

Q65wg7bg2WjMqGpHdFcmmA.text: I didn't really know what Arkansas BBQ was prior to coming here. Now, I'm a fan!   We started with Brenda who was working the counter. She was both friendly and patient with us as we explored the menu. We got ribs and pulled pork and brisket and burnt ends. Add in some greens, cornbread, and mac and cheese and we were ready for a feast!  All of the BBQ was well prepared and the sides were tasty. A nice gentleman came out to check on us as we ate and was pleased we were having a great time scarfing down the food!  Get off the strip for gosh sake, get a car or Uber or taxi or hitchhike or whatever you have to do, and come to Rollin Smoke!

KIZzBAxeIzUsgwknhsol3g.text: Thanks to yelp for leading us here. It's not in the greatest part of town, but the food is great. The ambiance says barbecue all over. Their menu is awesome lots of options. Huge portions, and super affordable. The staff is very professional and accommodating. They all have smiles and serve with a good attitude. Thank you Sofia, Tarin, and Lizelle. We had a great experience and the owner was a great guy with a wonderful attitude for hospitality. You can tell he's very passionate about what he does and takes pride in what his business represents. Go here you won't be disappointed. If you get the outlaw burger be prepared to be amazed at the size of this burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H5F4NMkxnQUjr7bx8wTXAA.text: A great place for Barbeque. It is in the industrial area of town; so it is a little out of the way, but worth the trip. The pulled pork and ribs were my favorite. While the brisket was good, it lacked a wow factor that I was hoping for. The sauce was pretty runny, but good otherwise.

K2ThskawnWIhA7juPrq_MA.text: This place is so awesome. Stopped by here after my brother recommended that we give it a try. Everyone loved it. Their food was very good and the location was clean. I will definitely be returning if I am in the area.

UDQnpt_yEZLKpDbNplADhg.text: Busy BBQ joint in a small area not to far from the strip.  The BBQ wasn't awlful but it wasn't out of this world either.  Let's say it's not a place I would wait an hour in line for, and we know we've all done that for some really good BBQ.  Anyway, decided on the rib special for $24.99 which came with 2 St. Louis ribs, 3 babybacks and I beef rib plus one side which we got waffle fries. We also added another beef rib for $6.  And for all those who really like BBQ, they also have AYCE anyday, anytime for $34.99.    The highlight of the dish was the beef rib.  The meat was fall off the bone super tender.  It tasted like what I expected from a beef rib, but it was lacking a rub or a bbq sauce that would have blown me away.  It was still good though just not great. The St. Louis ribs and babybacks were mediocre and but still tasty.  But based on just what we ordered I would have to say, I have definitely tried better BBQ but the place is worth giving a try.  The menu is huge, so even if your not craving BBQ, you can order other stuff like meatloaf or fried chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs, ribs, ribs.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Special for $24.99, with extra beef rib. Drinks not included.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside

cFr9ehQ5CBYi0JTndsFFBw.text: Oh My  Heavens!!  Do not let the location scare you. It's kind of industrial and out of the way, but you've got to get here for this incredible food, clean location, terrific customer service and fast preparation. We've already decided we're coming back here next time we're in Vegas.  Rollin Smoke BBQ is amazing! My sister and I shared the Trio plate of chicken and 2 portions of spare ribs. The chicken was moist and flavorful and the ribs fell off the bone and didn't need additional sauce (although I tried their sauces and liked them all)! We chose the Collard Greens as our 'included' side dish and they were delish!! We also ordered a side of the corn nuggets (creamed corn deep fried and a Must Have!). My dad had the scrumptious meatloaf plate that included tasty mashed potatoes, a huge piece of meatloaf that was full of flavor and fresh, handmade crispy fried onions smothering the meat along with a roll.  Chef Tim came out to check on the guests and I told him we were from Southern California and could not get over how delicious his food was. He asked if we ordered the Cornbread and we said we'd heard it was great but hadn't ordered it. He brought us each a piece and I can say that it was the best cornbread I have ever had. He said "cake flour"... "that's all I'm saying".  I told Chef Tim that my father loved the fried onions (which were, by then, gone) and that he was going to make a sandwich tomorrow out of his leftover meatloaf. Tim took the plate to box it up and when we got it back, there were 2 pieces of bread (to make a sandwich) and a huge pile of fried onions, in addition to my dad's leftovers! LIke I said, GREAT customer service!!  Then Chef Tim asked us and a few other folks if we wanted a tour, so we got to go back and see & smell the hickory wood and gorgeous meats in the smokers.  GO HERE!! You will be soooo happy you went!

xlJurkYrvonQxTDSno6bVw.text: We stopped here based on some Yelp reviews. They proved to be right. We were lucky the GPS brought us to the original location. It has the hole in the wall look and feel but the food was good. I'm sure it cost less than the locations on the strip too!

hKc_ciCze6lFFGo1Jx0f6Q.text: Been here many times....and every time the are great!!  The pulled pork is my fave with the loaded mashed potatoes.

uYkSw2PPNuE60oFUBTzHng.text: I always think I will get my money's worth when I go to an all you eat so naturally when I was given the choice I chose all you can eat over all la carte. I shouldn't have done that because the portions are BIG! and you are not allowed to order more unless you finish your plate! The food was delicious but there was a lot!   I started with the ribs that were easy to come off the bone and had a nice sauce to it. I loved the breaded catfish because the tarter sauce had a nice lemony taste to it. Bacon potato salad which also had a bit of chives sprinkled on the top. I like my potato salad chunky and not too creamy so it was perfect!   The dessert was a hit and miss the black berry cobbler looked murky but I tried it and I wasn't too impressed. It tasted a little sour for me.  I liked that banana pudding better.    Some advice is to buy a la carte if you know that you can't eat a lot. I felt uncomfortable after the meal because I over ate. If I was to do it all over again I would get the catfish especially , potato salad and the banana pudding. Those were my standouts out of everything I ate.   I liked that there wasn't really a wait and we were served right away! The service was wonderful ! They kept  checking on us to see if we needed anything which was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BVlL73TYO9TPuN0RvSyY5A.text: Came across this restaurant on here on Yelp & I begged my boyfriend to bring me here so he did! First let me start by saying the devor atmosphere & over all customer service is awesome even though the bigger dining room is warmer than the air conditioned dining area. I took several pictures because I was excited about finally being there. We ordered our food which came up to $40.00 a bit pricey but we thought we were going to enjoy it & we thought for sure we'd get a bigger portion at least some to take home but we were wrong and very dissapointed First of all I expected our food to be hot off the grill which it wasn't which tells me they didn't bring our food out right away. The taste of the food was average to me but to my boyfriend the "Food Critic" forget it!  There was so much fat on the ribs I ordered that I had to keep spitting chunks out into my napkin, the bacon potatoes salad was very disappointing to me as it had no flavor what's so ever. My boyfriend was so dissatisfied & disgusted he didn't even finish his plate which is rare because he's a big guy & a food lover like myself.... Will we go back? Never....what a shame I give this place 2 stars because they give a free souvenir cup for your beverage & I liked the decor but over all very dissatisfied

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gFptasU672GDZY1eM3aVTg.text: Great service! The cashier gave us an extra drink for free when my boyfriend and I stopped by. Our friends ordered after my boyfriend and I, and got their food before us. A worker noticed we were still waiting for our food for a while and asked for our names so he could check up on our food. He said the Outlaw burger takes a bit more time to cook and put together. Soon after he gave us our food and some stickers too.  I had the bbq nacho fries. They were loaded with brisket, sour cream and cheese. My boyfriend had the outlaw burger. You definitely get your money's worth with that one. We also got mac and cheese for a side. Kind of a small portion but still really yummy. You might as well make it a combo for $3 to add a drink and side. A drink is $2 and a side is $2.50 so might as well make it a combo to get more bang for your buck!  Only complaint is that they need to expand! They've got so many people coming through that we had to stand and wait for a bit til people left so that we could sit and eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XbNXdLT89HVLM7gv4LTjyw.text: Food was very good. A slow getting some of food and a high chair. Food was very good. Chicken and wrap were a bit spicy. Mac & cheese was amazing... Corn nuggets are worth coming here for nothing else!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The big hogs and corn nuggets
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket was very tender
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wrap

rhDymIm8Mpad2I4iIwVebA.text: The place is decent!  A little difficult to get there.. Over bridges, under bridges.. But well worth it. I would definitely consider this a hidden gem. Tried the catfish, pulled pork, chopped brisket, and hot link. I wasn't terribly crazy about the hot link, and the brisket was a little underwhelming, I would probably try it sliced next time. The food came out fast, and hot. And the service was top notch!  Always asking if we were good. We will definitely give this another go.

id4zOUU2GCJcd_tL8yMnNQ.text: I don't know what happened to this place. This was the first time I have ever eaten RSB and been let down.  Ordered Duo plate with 1 side and bread plus a drink. Opted for the short ribs and brisket with cheesy mac and cheese as the side.  - The meat lacked any flavor and was completely missing that "Wow" factor we experienced on  each previous visits. Plus the meat was actually lukewarm, like it had been sitting out for a bit.  The short ribs were still good, but the brisket was very disappointing.  - Plus it seems like the portion sizes have gotten smaller. We both looked at our plates and said at the same time, "That's it?". Hmmmm. - Personal pet peeve of mine: Dropped 4 singles into the toke jar and never even received an acknowledgement. I work for tips and thank EVERYBODY who tokes. It is just rude not to.  I really hope I just caught them on an off day, but now I am going to start exploring other options when craving good BBQ. This was just a very underwhelming experience.  2 stars.  I have experienced better.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duo combo $13.99

i8uutXUFMtJJfzyeTwGYUg.text: I found this place through YELP recommendation. THANK YOU YELP! The food was exactly what i wanted when in the mood for some good BBQ style. The location is not the best and is pretty hidden but as soon as you walk into the establishment you get that southern style feel. They have several choices so we opted to go for the 5 meat pot special that comes with 3 sides. The sides we got were the Mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, and there corn nuggets. Every single thing was mouth watering and filled with flavor. The CORN NUGGETS are a MUST try. There was so much food we couldn't finish it all. I loved the taste and ambiance and will definitely be back with more people!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE PIT The Pit Special 5 Meats 3 Sides

_B4f0PGqM0sgdFtNRXWeOA.text: The restaurant is very nice and clean. The people are very nice and willing to help explain the menu. The house arkansuace is delicious. Enjoyed the brisket and the ribs and the mac n cheese. My family is from the south so it was nice to be to able to enjoy some good bbq.

6lNfyFXvuADufJ8rvQ4jNw.text: For the restaurant locations, whether the original location (Highland), first off, before you even get out of you vehicle, you start smelling the smoke from the smokers, for the Flamingo location, you are in for a treat.  As for the food, the smoke ring around the pulled pork was thick, and a dark pink color made my mouth water.  The melt in your mouth texture was second only to the flavor which was great.  Although the pork did not need BBQ sauce, I enjoyed the flavor of dipping it into the spicy BBQ sauce.  The beef ribs, or as I call them, the ribs from the Flintstones, are HUGE, tender, and flavorful.  I could go on about the Brisket, Meatloaf (made with the Brisket), etc, but by now you should already be in your car driving to one of the locations and I wouldn't want you reading this and driving at the same time.  As for the catering (Catfish Cory), seeing as the smokers were attached to the truck that catered it, you couldn't get a fresher meal.  Literally, off the smoker onto your plate.  The quality of the BBQ in Las Vegas is unmatched.

M2Tuowj6112NG0evrqgiYA.text: My party came on a Saturday night and surprisingly it wasn't too busy. They have two rooms with long tables, perfect for large parties. The prices here are pretty good too!   We ordered a few things to try, but my favorites were the burnt ends and St. Louis ribs. The St. Louis ribs are dry rubbed and the sweet and spicy sauce was perfect for dipping. My bf liked the vinegar sauce but it wasn't really my thing. We got the brisket three ways but ended up ordering more of the burnt ends because they were really good!   For our sides, we got the waffle fries, corn nuggets, corn bread, mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. I loved all the sides but the corn nuggets were really good! I've never had something like it before, but it's basically creamed corned that's deep fried into nuggets.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot links and St. Louis ribs with corn nuggets
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket three ways
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana pudding

viP40yabfhFGE4F26EYQSA.text: Best BBQ! My boyfriend is from Kansas City and I often went to KC. This is better than Kansas City!!!! The value you get with the price is so worth it. The meat is so fresh and tender...and the sauce is to die for!! Cashier was so nice and had good recommendations. Definitely going to come here every time I am in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R2LMrurJcK8BCzm7gbOcMw.text: Omg! This place is a hidden gem nothing out of the ordinary looks almost like a farm on the inside but the bbq is the best I've ever had! Best meal i had while in vegas and thats saying a lot. They are open late too which makes it extra convenient the prices are good and the food is excellent stop by and you wont regret it!

ePPyCJ4vFNNcMgyfNw3oxA.text: Awesome place. Got the tip from an Uber driver while transiting the airport to the hotel and went there a few days later to escape the expensive strip. Was not disappointed! meat that falls of the bone. Fresh and juicy and large portions. Only small drawback is that they don't sell beer, but there's a lot of that everywhere else in Vegas.

k0542vRX5TrLL6F8gHIS6w.text: The BBQ is legit! The hot links, the brisket, the ribs, everything there is good and it keeps me coming back. If you haven't been there you should try it because it's dope!

TR8ba3hlzyHYgLLADlZ9sQ.text: We've hired Rollin Smoke to cater several events over the last three years, and we have not been the slightest disappointed.  Everyone raves about the food.  Karina makes the ordering process super easy, her quantity recommendations are spot-on, and she confirms everything so there is nothing to worry about on the day of the event.  Ricky and Ezekial were onsite attendees at our last event, and they were fantastic - arrived on time, were smiling, knowledgeable, helpful and ready to go the minute the arrived.

Y-bdFHK9c8g_IrSNdzaOAA.text: Holy Cow...forget the strip and the gourmet burgers, this is the real deal! For $14 you get the biggest burger in town, juicy and delicious. Also, try the beef ribs, two feeds a big guy quite well, four feeds a small family! No beer at this place so byob. Finally, I gave this place a 5-star based on value and flavor, however, the burger is excellent without the deep fried onions on it. In fact, it's too big, it's scary just looking at it. Overall, take a jaunt off the strip and visit this place, in my traveled opinion, I would say that they have no rivals west of the Mississippi.  Of course,  this is just my opinion. :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rGSH8YNQiKCnDAtc5rnbdg.text: My previous review of a measly little 4 stars was not sitting right with me.   I have to make it right.    I have been back on several occasions.  I always received great service from ordering to receiving my food. Aside from the fact it's not located in the best of areas, the parking lot is always packed.  Can you blame them? Not at all.  When you want some of the best BBQ, you will make it to Rollin Smoke for a taste of their smoky and tender feast.     Of course there is the monstrous Outlaw Burger.  Have you seen the pics? It's large and in charge.  By the end you're probably using utensils to gobble up the tasty meat but it's definitely worth it.  I would definitely suggest sharing.    My other favorite is their meatloaf.  You're probably thinking 'C'mon... Meatloaf?' Oh yeah.  It's combination of smoky meats baked, placed on loaded mash and topped with sauce and onion straws.  It's mouth watering fantastic.    I have yet to find something here I didn't like.  When I try other BBQ places around the city, none compare to the great Rollin Smoke!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ wrap with pulled pork. Not on the menu anymore but they will make it.  Yum!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Meatloaf- so great!

lVkhzhFPVIXvuxn8Q72fPQ.text: Great place.  Had pulled pork sandwich with mac n cheese. Husband had trio of meats...pulled pork, brisket, ribs. Finished with peach cobbler. Love this place.  Only draw back is hard to park.

AAJAsygGntHsPwMqMbrAtw.text: Best bbq spot in Page. Everytime I got to AZ, I'm stopping by at this place. Gorgeous food and awesome staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mix platter

6ILnV3bBIAf5m8XUiQOdTw.text: This bbq is good. The price is right. I like picking my order up versus postmates. Great

GrYqkVMlFnh83W3uShA1VA.text: Really good bbq. The burnt ends are the best. Would definitely go here again. The corn bread was super moist and costumer service was really well.

nkOahyjT1PDRwKl9webE7w.text: Another first yet again.  This place is very down to earth. It's not a sit-in-waiter-take-your-order-and-serve kind of place.  As you enter, you place your order as how you would in a fast food joint.  You get you own fountain drink, take the plastic spoons & forks, and plates. They bring your food to your table and you dig in! The food is very superb! THE BARBEQ OF BARBECUES and we are not disappointed.  We ordered the Pit special (5 different meats) plus three sides (your choice). The barbecue flavor is amazing and this place doesn't under deliver. In fact, I think they over deliver!!! Yummy food!!!  The other patrons in this place are all very friendly too. Attitudes are all very kind and positive.  A very well recommended place for locals and visitors alike to visit and I guarantee that you will be liking the barbecue sauce off of your fingers in no time, just like we did!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pit special with sides: Sweet cornbread, Mac N Cheese, &amp; Collard greens.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KAyiHasOXPaU7FB_es2CHg.text: Simply the best ! I have been a loyal Customer since the first Week they opened ! If you complain about This place you complain About everything ! Burnt Ends And beef brisket And beef Ribs are unmatched In Vegas ! Dusty and the family Do it right ! Great food great service  Without strip prices !

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B7RlNBEYXeEudy3vwCWb3A.text: Wait, what? How is this ranked so highly? It's a mystery beyond me other than there must not be other half way decent options in a 50 mile radius..  Loaded potato was a complete let down. First off you're gonna tell me that gross form of bright orange "liquid cheese" is better than actual grated cheddar? Nope. Then there's the skin - if you are a person who actually enjoys a crispy potato skin DO NOT - there is so much salt on the exterior it makes your tongue go a little numb. The brisket was maybe the sweet flavor that I got every few bites, but it's hard to tell b/c the minuscule crumbles they call brisket.  The hubs ordered the 2 meat plate so I did get a fantastic bite of the pork but that could be b/c everything else was a total let down. The waffle fries were also the way to go, as the mac & cheese must be made with the same liquid as already mentioned.  Lastly the canned peach cobbler was a joke, coming in at $7 for dried biscuit-ish bread in a swamp of overly sweet something.. and off brand ice cream.  There are way too many other places in Vegas to waste your time and money here.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;m not sure how $7 was just charged for this..

K8MXIgT5C-mblAA4i3fnQQ.text: Great food, the smell is breathtaking and the people are very nice! If you come to Vegas you must eat here if you love BBQ!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NwKQFsO9mhITqf9ve0HJeg.text: Amazing barbecue the flavor everything is delicious and super friendly highly recommend it, however the location is too small.

M2LIy3AKZX8uzqij3-vuvw.text: This review is based on one visit only and the smoked brisket sandwich that I ordered. After reading all the rave reviews I was really disappointed. The brisket in the sandwich was very finely chopped instead of being sliced and it contained too much fat and gristle. I tried to doctor it up with their BBQ sauce but I didn't much care for the sauce which I assume is made in house.  With all the favorable reviews, I have to believe that all of Rollin' Smoke's menu items just can't be as bad as that brisket. So I may give them another try to sample some of their other items. And I'll bring some of my own BBQ sauce with me. If I do, I'll update this review.

RRDHpqQM3nqmIzWLtm97Gw.text: I've had BBQ all over the Bay Area and in the South but this was the best I've ever had.  We had ribs, pulled pork, chicken and brisket.  I couldn't believe how moist everything was.  I didn't use the sauce because is was absolutely not needed.  Its a new "must stop" on our Vegas trips.

IbPoPGwAF_tAs4l2FRgepQ.text: I've heard great things about this BBQ place so I decided to go try it on Fourth of July with some friends. We got there around 12:30pm, and surprisingly it wasn't as busy as we thought it would be. This place is a order and sit down place. My sister and I wanted to share one of the plates. We chose the three meats: pork, brisket, and 2 spare ribs with mashed potatoes and beans on the side. The service is excellent; they greet you, call you by your name and make sure you are taken care of. I believe it's family own if I'm not mistaken. Our food came out pretty quick and we didn't have to wait that long at all. The food was delicious and the meats are perfect! Don't forget to get some sauces on the side (spicy and mama's sweet sauce). The plates here are definitely shareable (if you want to share). You could also order to-go and catering as well. I will certainly be back next time or order to-go for a party!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Choice of 3 meats: brisker, pork, 2 spare ribs and sides to go along: beans and mashed potatoes.

GqxL4RJJdEKyBCKhmQlgIg.text: Wow the staff was super friendly and everything was super good the food was the best BBQ I've ever had I would totally give it 10 stars if possible anytime were back in Vegas this place is a must

_uRCGwSmDr0f-bIDrjaW8A.text: Went to Vegas for the weekend with some friends and wanted some good BBQ so my friend found this place. My bf and I shared The Pit Special Trio platter.. just the right amount of food w/ a little bit of everything, it was really good! The staff was very friendly. We even got a tour of the kitchen! There's even a really cool fish tank made out of a grill in their party room if you're into that sort of thing..

ZQJr5SC2nNOtEQhUbhAOag.text: We were looking for a BBQ JOINT because it was just one of those days. I got the Brisket, pork ribs, BBQ chicken and bacon potato salad plate! Boy that was very fulfilling and tasty.. My other half got the pulled pork sand which and that was yummy as well. After we finished our meal I went ahead and tried the "banana pudding" it put me into a coma it was so good lol! By far one of the best BBQ Houses in Vegas... Must try if you have one of those days were you just want some old fashion ribs and meat :)

PJanRJ6zonqfvEmlBwJ0cw.text: Had the three meat combo with ribs, links, and chicken.  Ribs were on point and cooked perfectly!  Chicken was tender although a bit over-seasoned for my taste and the links although flavorful were dense.  The sauces were good not great and the beans that I had as a side were so-so.  Would've expected much better for $25 but I'll give them an a-ok for the ribs and the great service.  They need wet-ones though!

vJp2fwIgahxXOzXdei19oA.text: Baby back ribs, slab, pulled pork, all smoked to perfection. The beef ribs were a little dry.   I like very saucey BBQ meats and this isn't what they serve. Their sauce is thin, not over-powering. If you like good, dry rubs or just good meat, eat here.   So many options to pick from! I wanted to try the wings, brisket, bacon potato salad, burger, onion rings...  It may be worth it to starve yourself for a day to get all you can eat for $25.   Really cool vibe! Picnic benches indoors, simple podium to order from, really enjoyed it!

DT79UJ3YALSN-Y34rL6xgA.text: Good food and atmosphere. Felt a little fast foodish. Brisket a little dry. Great sauces. Overall I would say this is the 2nd beat bbq in Las Vegas.

p5552-HXQ4yPlMfRkEHjaw.text: Hidden gem in vegas! This is the original spot on industrial road and it never disappoints. Great service, great staff & DELICIOUS BBQ!!  So good!! We are frequent customers.

Nbr-K4knTwIbobxXmuNIiw.text: Plain and Simple.....Best Ribs in Vegas! N'ough said! Pulled pork is juicy.  Peach cobbler is my favorite and don't forget to order a side if Blue Bell Vanilla ice cream.  This place really smoking hot.   We live in Henderson but we don't mind the drive.

BYtxd3W-FRpzbI8BXTViTQ.text: I finally tried Rollin Smoke Barbeque and let me tell you Pit Boss you are doing a DAM fine job!  If you notice the way I spell Dam and youve ate here youll understand.  The barbeque itself is 5 stars as is the service hands down.  Reason for 4 stars not 5 is the price for the amount of food they give you.  I paid 30.00 for the "pit special" that i split with my wife and was still hungry.  I should of ate hers and i probably would have been just fine and told her, "well honey you did say you wanted to stick to your diet right?" jk.  All in all ill be back eventually with more money and order more food and evenrually die of a heart attack.  My wishes after that are to be stuffed then put outside as the Rollin Smoke Mascot.  Thank you RS! Uncle R

TcuTrNwgYqFhmuRnKMe2ZQ.text: Went here with my wife and 3 young boys.  We all loved it.  It's off the strip but only a short distance.  Well worth the trip if you normally can't get good BBQ.  Our family is used to California grilling/BBQ.  I had the meat trio with spare ribs, pulled pork and sliced brisket.  Ribs tasty, easy off the bone and juicy.  Pork was flavorful with good texture.  Brisket had good flavor but was tougher chew then expected.  Could leave the brisket on the Q another hour.  To be clear I would eat the brisket again and be happy.    This was family friendly with a great crew who take pride in their product.  All sauces were great.  They had a strong vinegar taste.

ULJf7PCAi3kEkJRELdawfg.text: Let the picture speak for itself. A brisket, sausage, and rib sandwich with a side fried okra. Yummy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biggin Dad&#39;s favorite with fried okra

a96VF1bE6Qit2V-hrQpKFA.text: Man this place is insanely good. I hope it stays a hidden gem. Their beef ribs are super moist, juicy and falls right off the bone. Brisket, smoked chicken and catfish are just amazing. I brought my father in law here, who is from the south, and he said this is the best southern food he's had since he left decades ago. Definitely my go to spot a least once a week.   Dusty is also the man.

GUVpBOd-snCeCDqLg1o25A.text: Excellent beef ribs!!! some of the best outside of Austin, TX.   We got there about 30 minutes before they closed so I was worried that they may have run out of ribs but lucky for me they didn't. The ribs were on point, they were tender, full of flavor and when the meat came off the bone, the bone was smoking,  so they were fresh and not just warmed.   The brisket was Ok, a little dry but had flavor.   We got the corn nuggets which were nice and crisp on the outside and awesome on the inside. One of the best side dishes I've had.  The mac and cheese was awesome too, with shredded cheese on top to add more gooey-ness to the mix.  The peach cobbler was fantastic also.  Their bbq sauce was good and if you ask them for spicy sauce then they'll give you their hot sauce and their 'too damn hot' bbq sauce.

REJEkigu701r8mpkwtKGiQ.text: AMAZING!!!! Best. Barbeque. Ever. Where to begin...corn nuggets! Yum! Smoked meatloaf! Awesome! Place is really hidden in a weird part of town and my wife was worried about going in, but she was glad she did. She's in LOVE with this place. Ribs, brisket, and sausage was great. Pork was a bit dry, but that didn't bother us at all. Ended up with to-go boxes for the hotel. Will definitely return next time we're in Las Vegas!

FN4mH6FkNmH4d0yaUyGKtg.text: After hearing the hype for the past couple years and seeing this place featured on TV, I was really excited to come sample some delicious Q, especially since the line to eat at Caesar's buffet was 7 hours long. The Q here isn't sauced and tends to run a little on the drier side, relying primarily on dry rub and smoke for flavor, but they have a variety of sauces to moisturize your meat. We ordered a little of everything, here's the breakdown:  Spareribs: probably one of the better meats here, it's a little dry but with solid rub seasoning, decently flavorful. Pulled pork: my favorite meat option, probably because it was the right balance of smoke and natural pork flavor, appropriately tender. Baby back ribs: too dry, more than a bit of a letdown. Smoked chicken: we got white meat, so the dry theme continues. My lady friend said it basically had no flavor, I didn't think it was actually fairly decent. Brisket: could be more tender, and not nearly as seasoned as the other meats. Hot links: essentially smoky and spicy kielbasa, not bad but nothing earth shattering Burger: this may have been the highlight between me and my lady friend, they use a combo of smoked brisket with ground beef to make the patty so the burger has a depth of flavor that you wouldn't otherwise typically expect. It's practically impossible to eat without a knife and fork given the mountain of onion strings on top, but that's not really a serious complaint. Mac and cheese: nothing special, a little on the watery side, needs some seasoning. Corn nuggets: these things are like crack, I could eat these all day. Not nearly as creamy in the center as ones I've had in the past, but the sweetness and textured crispiness are on point. Corn bread: I want to say the bottom is soaked in a light honey syrup, fairly moist, I'd consider it a win.  We walked out with nearly 2/3rds of our food as leftovers, which is probably better for my health but a bit of a disappointment since it means I didn't try to gorge myself to exploding. I don't know if this is the best that Vegas has to offer for Q, but I'll probably hold off on coming back here unless my friends really feel the need to satisfy their smoked meat cravings the next time we're in town.

i6Rb5klivaWghn2xm_baIw.text: I am so happy. I keep sitting here with my brisket sandwich and saying how happy I am. Yum!!! Spicy sauce is the best!!!

qDt7-qQhnll-fWq1I1X5Uw.text: I love Bar B Que! I love ROLLN SMOKE!!!!  I at there today and I cannot wait until I am able to go back. Maybe tomorrow.  The trio plate was great! fantastic! tasty! awesome! the ribs were so tender. the links were amazing. great flavor. not too hot and not too mild. the brisket was a huge mound on the plate. for the price it was a huge plate of food!  I can't imagine being able to do the all u can eat, butI am eager to try it. they even brew their own sweet tea! add a little lemonade and you are set.  Get there!

3wbr77gPc0wHq8JT8B8IgQ.text: I don't know what happened but I had a totally different experience at Rollin Smoke then everyone else seems to have had.  We ordered rib tips, links, mac n cheese, mashed potatoes, potato salad, coleslaw, peach cobbler and caramel cake all to go.  It took over 45 min for our order to be ready.  I would think the sides and desserts are already prepared and just need to scooped in a container.  So the wait was for links and rib tips?  The smokers were not on when we were there so we weren't waiting for meat.    Customer service could have been friendlier.  They customer in front of me asked what sides they had and the guy taking orders just hit the menu where the sides were listed.  I wanted a link and sides but was told I had to get the hotlink sandwich.  I asked "So I can't just get a link?"  He said no not really.  When I pressed the issue he said I can get a 2 item combo and just get all hotlink.  I ordered that but why not just sell a link for $3 or $4 bucks?  After 40 min of waiting and seeing people order after me get their food I asked how long it would be and was told very gruffly that they are "very busy".  They were busy but I ordered before the lunch rush started.  I was also sitting in the booth next to the register so I could hear the orders and knew who was picking up phone orders, etc.  Also during the 45 min I waited at least 5 people told him the coke was out.  It was still out when I left.    Ok.  On to the most important part the food.  Cause really, I will wait for hours and put up with bad service for some awesome BBQ.    Sweet Tea- Not good.  I actually switched to soda and I rarely drink soda.    Rib tips- Hubby thought they were ok.  I'm not a big beef rib person but thought they were ok also.  `  Links- No way that was 2 portions of links from my 2 meat combo.  It wasn't even 1 small link total.  But that is ok since they were so dried out it looked like they were days old.  I have never seen meat that dry in my entire life.  I'm being generous to say they looked like they were sliced the day before and left in the warmer overnight.    Mac n cheese- very bland, noodles overcooked, could have used salt or real cheese.    Mashed Potatoes-  Instant.  Yes they use instant potatoes.  All the other stuff there is good.  If they would use real potatoes it would probably be amazing.    Potato Salad- This was the best out of all the sides.  It was ok but wouldn't order it again.    Coleslaw- Ok.    Peach cobbler- Cold.  Who serves cold peach cobbler?  Again ok.  Not great.    Caramel Cake- Yellow cake topped with caramel syrup, like the kind you buy for sundaes.  This was actually not bad.  I might even try it at home.    All the sides seemed just a little spice away from being good.  Maybe I went on an off day.  I don't know.  After reading everyone's reviews I was so excited to come here and had high hopes for what I thought was going be my new favorite BBQ place.  I was heartbroken at how bad it was.  At some point I will try again cause these 5 stars reviews have to mean something.  But I'm gonna need my yelpers to go with me cause hubby isn't having it.

gLUnxo-EGKbUEPNia6otvA.text: The food was delicious and the environment was so friendly! The cashier was very nice and explained everything I needed to know for my first time. Such a great experience and their servings are huge!  It was very loud and crowded in there but that could be expected from the environment and it being so popular. Definitely recommend if you're in the mood for great BBQ.  I also loved seeing their custom tank from the show Tanked!

5nhu_VK5fJMmIb-UPR2wWg.text: I work close by and we always go here for lunch. If you want a good pulled pork sandwich, this is your spot. But my favorite is the corn hush puppy nougat things, I don't know what the are called. The best. Also love the collard greens!  Service is also great! Highly recommend this place!

qllx0fnvvLMTSM6nXCXYXA.text: OMG...I travel lots and ashamed to say I am a foodie...Sorry the ribs and corn nuggets are better hear than Vegas. Danny thank u for GREAT suggestions..brisket ends/tips soooo good. First time here n not my last. I will tell others.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hidden great place!!!

qUEl7vFCiyH-ROIDywceqQ.text: Fantastic little hole in the wall BBQ joint ! 5 stars does not do this place justice, I have been dying to try this place for months now I bookmarked it when I knew we were coming to Vegas I will definitely make this a pit stop every time we come into town. We had the bacon potato salad with Mac n cheese & the biggin sandwich. The meat was so flavorful and just melted in your mouth, with just the right amount of seasonings. We got our food in a timely manner, you definitely won't be disappointed with whatever you choose

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach cobbler w/blue bell ice cream
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The biggin w/mac n cheese &amp; bacon potato salad

0jg56P3AQZSY9uZGYLf5RQ.text: Las Vegas... A city with over 2 thousand restaurants but I can't stop coming here.  The best BBQ I've ever had.  I've tried all of the different meats they have and they are all excellent.  If I had to pick some favorites they would be the brisket, burnt ends, and the pork but you really can't go wrong.  Check this place out and you won't be sorry.

Iz-fWwdLDycoOc9_JtG3Zg.text: Five Stars. Nuff said  Everything these guys grill is straight fiyah. This is a must eat place while you're in Vegas.

_-r1BA-_qGJEd1a0v29y9g.text: We went here on a Friday night late and had a hard time finding the place. It's in a small strip mall, near a bunch of strip clubs and we were a little nervous. Once we got in, we were greeted by one of the owners and we were very pleased.   We both ordered the Duo. The brisket was fantastic. Tender, moist and very flavorful. The ribs were fall off the bone good. They definitely take pride in what they serve. The Mac n cheese was great and well. Went perfect with the meal.   You order at the counter and they deliver your meal to you. We talked to the young man quite a bit and it sounds like they have had quite a nice little success. This is a hidden gem in Vegas. Not to be missed!!

dB5Xb2frERZSXJfoTuWCBA.text: Hungry after hanging at Velveteen Rabbit, a bunch of Yelpers headed over to Rollin Smoke (sorry I got a very patient Tom F lost: but in my defense, there are lots of tittie bars in that area!) Even as a sometime vegetarian/full time pescetarian, the smell from the car park smokers was intoxicating.   One could say the air was moist with flavors...Huh?!?! Ya had to be there. They do have moist towelettes which I grabbed (forgetting the crew I was with) for post feast clean up.   They were out of greens and the fish and okra were deep fried (will try another day) so I opted for the yams, jalapeno slaw and baked beans: the latter has some type of meat in it, tried my best to pick it out, but veggies be aware. They also had Smoked Tabasco on the table = went right into my moist jalapeno slaw! Love hot sauce :))   Service was very friendly and checked on us frequently - even one of the owners! The unsweetened fresh brewed tea was delicious. Nibbled a piece of corn bread and all of the carnivores loved their bones, pulled pork, smoked meatloaf etc...Misti gave the Southern gal stamp of approval to the okra.   Still offering dessert with Yelp check in and the banana pudding looked old school divine, and moist!  Can't wait to come back and try more options and bring carnivore friends. I'm sure they will appreciate the moist delicious meat! There may not be "Sex in the Champagne Room" next door, but there's terrific down-home eats till 1:30AM on weekends, guaranteed!!!  Yelp 100 Challenge  Ed. Note: the word "moist" was used in this review many times because one should never share phobias/words that creep you out etc with Yelpers and expect to remain unscathed (in a good natured way :)))

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cole slaw, yams &amp; baked beans
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

4Kgdtllq9dd2tZwEzeK04g.text: I know I know. I'm like the last one to eat here. It's been on my list for a long time and I finally made it down here to see what the hype is all about and I can honestly say the hype is real. I mean you can smell the smoke all throughout the restaurant and all the way outside. We came on a Friday night and it wasn't packed but there were people coming and going the entire time. Me and the boyfriend decided to share a 4 meat combo with three sides which is a really good deal for 19.99. You can sample almost all the meats the have to offer. Almost not all. We chose hot links, pulled pork, spare ribs and brisket. Choosing sides I couldn't decide so quick and they were more than happy to let me sample both the fried okra and the corn nuggets. Easy winner there the corn nuggets are so fricking delicious! Sweet cream corn inside fried crispy with almost a beer batter exterior. The BOMB! We seated ourselves and the food came out not too much longer after. My favorite has to be the ribs. Fall apart tender and just the right amount of smoke. The brisket could have been more tender and the pulled pork was lacking in smoky flavor but still very good. I'm not a fan of hot links but these were pretty good. The greens were delicious and tender and the mac and cheese was very creamy. I prefer a less creamy mac and cheese but it was still good. My favorite were those corn nuggets. I could eat those all day but I don't think that would be a good idea. I asked for some chipotle dipping sauce and it was the perfect condiment. Sweet corn nuggets with a spicy smoky dipping sauce. I guess we were still hungry because. My boyfriend ordered more pulled pork and ribs with greens of course since I had the Mac and cheese. Service was great they called us by name the entire time and were super nice. The food is legit I just wish they had a better location.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Round 2. More ribs and pulled pork.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 sides that come with the 4 meat combo. Mac and cheese, greens, corn nuggets. Those corn nuggets are the BOMB!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 meat 3 sides combo. Sides on another photo. Spare ribs, pulled pork, brisket,hot link.

Qs6LlJBjbQ5PSqzBHDm1jQ.text: Only the best comes from this place it is an institution btw my friend said it was there spiciest bbq sauce ever

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Magnificent

N3OrA-ny7U3_bokgOV8D_Q.text: Sadly I must update my rating based on my most recent visit on 8/14/15. A mere 5 weeks ago I posted a rave review on this business and its food; however, I must take a step back today from my initial review, but not because the food isn't any less than great.  I can understand the rapid success of a business making ownership proud of their product, but the immense price increases noted on the new menu (3rd increase in just a few months that I am aware of) are quite staggering to say the least! On 7/9/15 I ordered a 3 meat plate w/one side and drink for $13; yesterday, that same 3 meat meal "deal" came w/one side for $17.99, AN INCREASE OF 5 BUCKS and NO DRINK???? Not a single person in line when I ordered and still a 10 minute wait for my smaller 2 meat plate order (only due to new  price increase).   Similar price increases across the board on most all menu items; has success spoiled RSB so much that it has decided to cash in now at the expense of the customers who helped them get there or is this just another case of ownership killing the goose that lays the golden eggs?  Great barbecue; YES. Worth the wait and $$$; sadly, not for me anymore.

GPvjfnnbXl6itPZCmgrW2A.text: Wow this place is amazing, I'm so glad I tried it out. The meatloaf was great, pulled pork great, ribs great, and my bro loved the burger. Prices are fair, they don't skimp on the portions, I will most definitely be paying them a visit when I'm back in town.

L0qz39M4OtcOFWSSvXvmaw.text: Favorite barbecue spot anywhere,  we just happen to come to Vegas a lot so it's a win win. I've had the 'all you can eat' which is literally everything on the menu!  You better be hungry.  Owners are always there cooking and bringing southern hospitality to the desert.

-UZrypa4VqDdxJ00gMmdEA.text: I too qualify as a bbq expert by way of living in Texas for 10 years And this food is legit all these positive reviews are absolutely correct  Driving across town is worth every mile   We got Ds sampler and it was everything and more   Brisket (chopped)- is a must, smoked to perfection   Pulled pork- BEST I EVER HAD  Hot links- are seriously hot extremely spicy                   if you don't enjoy heat, don't try it  Ribs- are good and hold to their high standards  Sides are very very important to making or breaking           bbq joints  Hush puppies- BEST I EVER HAD  Loaded mash potatoes- must have  Cornbread- order it   Their rolls are potato rolls very good   Im not getting in the way of the all these high reviews "Rolling" in And I'm not blowing "Smoke" about this place  ALL BBQ LOVERS  DONT HESITATE  GO GO GO

E9H_aIDoqnhb80tBHFCwrA.text: I love Rollin Smoke! After spending half a year in Texas, my standards for barbeque have gone up quite a few notches. I didn't expect to find a place that would be on par with good 'ol Texas, but Rollin Smoke definitely takes the award for best barbeque in Las Vegas.   One of the best things about this place is the staff. Everyone that works there is super friendly, and loves having a conversation with you while they're taking your order. It creates an ambience that really makes you feel at home, which a lot of Vegas restaurants are lacking in.   You have many different options to choose from including AYCE but honestly, you'd have to come extremely hungry to manage that one. My go to is the three meat combo, which gives you any three meats of your choice, bread, and a side. It's good for those who like a little variety, but also want a little extra to take home. I usually stick with burnt ends a.k.a the only way to eat brisket, ribs, and whatever else I'm feeling that day. They put a little bit of sauce on it for you, but there's also bottles of barbeque sauce at the table so you can go as crazy as you'd like.   If you're in town and looking for some great barbeque, definitely give Rollin Smoke a try. You won't be disappointed.

Owpp1APcG9UcbyMbZ8mOaA.text: This little Dive has got it going on!  This BBQ joint is in a undesirable location,  it's  small, with a back woods feel to it And I LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS PLACE! The food and the southern welcome to Rollin smoke is most memorable! Highly recommend you get some of this ! ....ya like now!  P.S. we tried  the ribs, collard greens, hot links, brisket and corn nuggets! Nom Nom!

fRM69IobXtjTcAeTYyiB6g.text: I don't know if I liked Rollin Smoke BBQ because I had a couple of beers before dining here.  And, I don't know if I liked it because of the people I was dining with.  Again, I don't know if I liked Rollin Smoke BBQ because sitting next to me was Christie O. who doesn't eat pork.  And, trying to tempt her into turning to the "Darkside" was my goal - no success though.  But, what I do know, is that I liked Rollin Smoke BBQ.   I had a couple of pork ribs, bacon potato salad, white bread and a diet soda.  The sauce wasn't overwhelming or overpowering.  So, the pork came through.  BACON POTATO SALAD... that won me over.  Anything with bacon is so much better.    The service was awesome as well.  The girl behind the counter was smiling the whole time she was taking our orders.  The food was delivered with that same smile.  Does it get any better than that.  I think not.  And, to be open late, to boot? Come on... awesome!  So, I don't care what the reason is, that I like Rollin Smoke BBQ.  I like it and I'll definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork ribs / bacon potato salad... soooooo good!

QcVg7IfWSWQJarIF5KBLpQ.text: Found this place to be very expensive for the amount food that we got. We order a rack of beef ribs it was &24.99 and it was 4 half ribs.  We also ordered the meal that said 2 to 4 people for $35.00 and was 2 small sides and 4 small biscuits and all the meat was in one styrofoam tray and didn't even come close to feeding 4 people. So $64.00 dollars was a good meal for 2.

8f20DagAvTFNamHg9B80Sg.text: This is a proclamation and one that is long overdue:  after living in Las Vegas for 10 years I can now happily endorse a real-deal BBQ joint:  ROLLIN SMOKE BARBECUE!!!  As you may already know about me, I am a first-rate barbecue snob ...the kind of guy who is first to correct anybody who confuses grilling with barbecuing.  That is not a concern here.  We're talking about brisket and pork that is smoked for 18 hours -- baby back, pork *and* beef ribs -- wickedly good sides (like jalapeno coleslaw and corn nuggets) -- even some unique sandwiches.  It's in an odd part of town, off of Highland and under the Desert Inn overpass (yes, surrounded by strip clubs & warehouses) but somehow the location just seems to work.   Make no mistake:  this is the absolute best barbecue that you will find in Las Vegas.  Period.   If you like legit barbecue then you need to judge this place for yourself.    You're welcome.

an5TypPN87JIeviJfZT9Rg.text: OK it's a little off-beat for a location, off of Highland in an industrial mega-plex area, strip bars and mechanics shops vie for attention.  You can't miss the big smokers out front though, sitting in the parking lot like beasts of barbecue.   You go inside and like a magical mirror, the place is so much bigger in than out, with a side room and front room with tables and chairs to hang out in.  NOW, the amazing part, the part that astounds is the BBQ!  I don't believe I have ever had better BBQ sauce...EVER.  The brisket wasn't tender but delicious, the hot link was extraordinary and the beans had chunks of beef that were staggering.  Everyone in our group (there were 9 of us) shut right up and dug in (although keeping the 5th star away for now was the somewhat unorganized service).  If you love BBQ, there is NONE better in Vegas, or maybe even in the great state of Nevada.  Heck, I would put it up against the little smoke houses in my wife's hometown of Nashville!  Truly superb food and the banana pudding at the end was heaven itself.  If you are into "fancy" you don't know BBQ anyway so this aint for you.  IF YOU WANT the best tasting BBQ in town though, this is the place for you!   GET SOME!!!

h55LZexQ3wl--Zk8XFdHlA.text: wow finally great barbeque in Las VEgas....

lUgGwTg8MDg71UcaMw9NnQ.text: Have been there a few times and I will keep coming back. I have tried the ribs, beef brisket, links and they are all great. I love the yams....not to sweet but with a hint of brown sugar and pecans...awesome.It is a hidden treasure...try it you will love it.

T-1dGFKG9Gj1o70ZCUYhcA.text: The all you can eat is not all you can eat! The ordering system sucks. Waited over 30 minutes for them to give my food to another table.

5qutJrr7BBUBN2cnZwsV9A.text: Can't say anything bad about this place. Got the rib platter. They were out of baby backs so it was mostly spare ribs with 1 beef rib. Couldn't finish it all because that is a lot of meat and fat for 1 meal. The side I chose was the greens. Bad choice for me because they were too spicy for my pallet and I couldn't eat them. But they were probably perfect, it is just me. Corn bread was very good too.

JIddbMSshR1KOo5GooGtGQ.text: Delicious.  Went here after reading the reviews and since I am always on the lookout for good bbq in vegas.  Now, some people might say there is better bbq in KC or Texas, etc.  Well, I am rating it based on the fact that it is objectively very good, and definitely the best I have had in Las Vegas.  I got the "biggun'" sandwich, which had pulled pork, brisket and hot link.  The hot link was delicious and did not have the overly greasy and oily nature of a standard hotlink, which are often like kielbasas.  The meat was very good as was the sauce.  I had a couple pieces of brisket that were a little overcooked, but overall it was excellent.  I also had some of their st Louis ribs, which were tasty.  Flavorful, tender and fall off the bone, although a little fatty...but that is what you generally get with st Louis ribs.  Fried okra and greens were very good as well, and they had a ton of other sides.  Unfortunately they were out of the cobbler and pudding, so I did not get to try those despite all the claims of excellence. Now, they location and decor are not exactly phenomenal, but I suppose it is what they could afford starting out.  It is close to the strip also which is good if you are in that area.  Overall, super friendly and very delicious, but definitely expensive for BBQ.  Best bbq I have had in vegas though.

TSDf-hLkVGwHU-Q-jU-lTA.text: Best Bar-B-Que around. I typically go with brisket, but the shredded pork is very tasty.  The meat portions are good for the price. Managed to come here twice during a short stay in Vegas.

nEeOiTdkEL3WkTF5zJ9T1A.text: Great AUTHENTIC BBQ. Reminds us of what we would get while living in La. We look forward to coming back to this place!

3ka2DBQtvuz7bl4I057utg.text: The food was decent and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  We went there around 9:30 on a Friday night.  The meat was dried out.   I would recommend going earlier when the food is fresh and it would probably live up to the high ratings others left.

0HFOQHWw6_cNA6p912yMbA.text: little disappointed. couldnt tell pork and brisket apart.. chicken was overcooked. cobbler and potato salad were excellent. would give a second chance

nLJ38DfNgrr47TDFGZITfw.text: Amazing food! Incredible service! Stop reading this and go there now, you won't be sorry.   Las Vegas did not have Barbeque until Rolling Smoke opened, thank God they are here.  Everything about this place is GREAT!  I could go on for paragraphs about the food.  We ordered some of everything,  even the catfish.   Brisket - AMAZING (not fatty,  cooked perfect),  Pulled Pork - OUT OF THIS WORLD, Spare Ribs - MOUTH WATERING, Chicken- VERY GOOD (it may have been touch dry but I couldn't tell because I covered it in their delicious sauce), Catfish - one of the best I have had,  light crispy and flavored perfect a  definite surprise for a BBQ joint.  There is basically no dish on the menu that you can go wrong with, even the sides were great.  Now about the service:  I was worried when we pulled up;  the place is small and there was literally a line out the door (Saturday night dinner).  Remarkably,  the line was so quick we barely waited - I don't know how they did it but it was perfect.  We got amazing personal service and it was quick (figure that one out).  If the food is amazing,  then the service is AMAZING x10!  After we placed out order our waiter,  a younger guy with blonde dread lock type hair, delivered it to our table.  The place was packed,  I had been watching the waiter and he never stood still  or stopped moving,  it was BUSY but he took the time to tell us about each dish and came back 3 times to see if we liked everything. Not only did he come by the but the Chef came over to each table to welcome the customers,  tell them about the dishes and make sure they liked everything.  We even had one more guy from the kitchen come over and check on us.  It was amazing service,  you just don't get service like that in Vegas anymore.  You can see everyone obviously loves their job and loves that restaurant - the attitude a made the place fun and enjoyable to a whole different level.  I can't say enough good things about our waiter,  he was 5 star service and just a nice guy- we would probably go back for him alone but the food is the shining star of this place.  The only regret I have is that I forgot to buy Barbeque sauce to take home,  good excuse to go back this week :)

F9XiqJVzMqTf_8Jr71HCxg.text: This place is amazing. Definitely the best BBQ place in Vegas. It's a little out of the way, but definitely worth making the trip down there. The food is awesome and the staff is really nice too! And the prices are really decent for the portions they serve. The outlaw burger and the beef ribs are a definite must try. I would definitely go there again if I'm ever craving for some good BBQ!

o9onbC8TQkgLl60i7XzGvw.text: Bomb!!  Definitely must try everything we tried was fantastic the Mac n cheese, ribs, chicken,pulled pork brisket and peach cobbler!! It so hit the spot!! We will definitely be back and let are friends and family know about this place!!

hrKeDdYyXl57HKfQubijWA.text: I like this place but the service is slow and food was not bad. The table we sat in was sticky and the general cleanliness of the place was sub-par in my opinion. Maybe I was expecting too much based on the other reviews but I can't give this place high marks. I'll try it again in the near future and see if I come to a different conclution next time.

B2tcla2qd5RXSazegOBGSw.text: Went to Rollin Smoke a couple of days ago. FINALLY I find a bbq place in Vegas that I can eat at!!!!!!!! This place is great, but I did take off a star for no table service, they just bring out your order. Now back to the important part--THE BBQ. Outstanding  covers it quite well. I got the Trio, the brisket, the thinner slices were juicy and smoky, the one thick slice was a little tough and dryer, not sure why. Ribs were meaty and good with the bbq sauce applied, which was a little thin for my taste, but flavorful. The sauce brought out more flavor, but flavor dropped off alot with no sauce, but still good though. And finally the hot link, I think WOW covers it. A lot of flavor, right amount of heat and perfect snap. As for the sides, beans were great, potato salad just OK, could have cooked potatoes a few minutes longer, were just under crunchy, but flavor was good. Overall absolutely will go back, but Famous Daves ribs are still better, not sure why, will have to try both again and report back.

z2TQcNwEjujlD66ke9fLIQ.text: The best BBQ in Vegas! Had the best BBQ pork sandwich, best hot Link, best fries, and best corn bread I've ever had in Vegas. Very good quality ingredients, expertly cooked, and reasonably priced. Im a regular Texas visitor too, and this still beats any BBQ I've found in SE Texas!!

faFKN-1TQiPXv6YxBBmMWg.text: Went there on January 20, 2015.  Been to Vegas many, many times.  We stay on the strip and pretty much always eat in the many restaurants/hotels on it. A few months before this trip saw Rollin Smoke on TV on one of the many food shows. I "adore", appreciate, and seek out authentic BBQ joints. The real stuff is not easy to find. Well this is it! The place is a dive and small. There were 3 of us and finding a table, even though they were busy with diners and take out orders, was easy. The various sides we had were good. The proof though is in the meats and it did not disappoint. The pulled pork, chicken, spare ribs, brisket and beef ribs were outstanding. They do not overload their rub with salt like way too many other places do. That potentially does not only tend to dry out the meat, but it overwhelms the flavor of it. Here it's perfect balance. Most BBQ places do not offer beef ribs. If you've never had one it's a must. These are not the beef ribs you might see in your grocery store's meat case. Those hardly have any meat on them before cooking, let alone after. These are short ribs. Yes, these you find in your grocery, but they are cut into short pieces for slow cooking and braising. I have never seen them in the case in full rack. I have a home smoker and I get them from my grocer and ask for the pack that they then get out of the cooler for me. These contain the full four rib rack.  "Short" has to do with where it comes from on the cow, not the length. But because we always see them cut up, its easy to make that connection.  Matter of fact, while not quite Fred Flinstone's bronto ribs that tips his car over, they're the closest thing to it.  They are 8" - 10" long and loaded with meat. While a slab of spare ribs stay in a smoker for about 4 hours, beef ribs have so much meat they are in there for 8+ hours. So next time in Vegas, take a cab or your rental car and go here.  We try to get to Vegas once or twice a year and now this will be added as one of our "must" eating places on every trip.  From Rollin Smoke to Caesar's Bacchanal buffet!

-uG4TnBv0_q9Ej3j2PvdNw.text: A rare value in Vegas.  Great food, we enjoyed the super platter with melt in your mouth ribs, brisket, pork, and awesome chicken with ample sides and the spicy Arkansas style BBQ sauce.  But what made this place stand out was the excellent, friendly and personalized service from one of the owners, who recommended items for our group, made substitutions to accommodate us, and stopped by to chat and check in on us throughout our visit.  A great experience overall -- and we even had enough leftovers for 10 of us to eat lunch the next day!

bJpLeMkF13Lbek9gjQ363A.text: Better than expected.  Good smoke flavor.  Tried spare ribs, baby backs, brisket and hot links along with corn nuggets.   Will be back.

vHOzxdSyV7KBgCqOfkc1bA.text: So Rollin Smoke BLEW UP. These days you are lingering around people finishing dinner in hopes of snagging their seat when they get up. Is it still great BBQ, yes. Has the huge rush of people made them slack just a little, yes. The last 2 visits just weren't that amazing food that I experienced the 5 times prior. I love the meatloaf. The catfish is hit or miss. It's been bomb many times, then soggy on one occasion. And I am not 100% sure of this, but I swear they HAD beef hot links and now I think its pork? Both are decent links, I just prefer the beef. No biggie. The sauce, well it always has been and still is, an all around GREAT sauce.  I am happy for the success of these guys. But I miss when it has been just the family back there cooking, making sure every meal was perfect. The service is still pretty good. They really seem to handle the stress of a crazy, busy, demanding BBQ joint really well. I have never had bad service, EVER.  A couple tips, get the beef ribs if you want ribs, they are huge and great.  Even though the AYCE price is not $35, if you can handle all that meat, GO FOR IT! Still a great deal. Get one of each side, because they are all good. I am a big fan of the loaded potatoes and jalapeno slaw.  I just read they are partnering with Gold & Silver Pawn to open a second location. I look forward for what's to come.

I0YQwqMZFQhYZCGWp1YvVQ.text: Killer spot in the seedy underbelly of Vegas.  A super Yelp find for delicious bbq with their own parking lot.  We rented a house a mile away and needed some sustinence without the need to venture into one of the big hotels.  This place hit the spot.  Good meats, cheap eats.

VXHCJ3Nhfr77I2mhVhb9uQ.text: This is what smoked meat should aspire to. The combo plate and two side had brisket, pulled pork, & hot link. It was all served a top a slice of bread as it should be. The pork was tender with no hard ends. It had plenty of moisture but not heavy rendered fat. The smoke flavor was good but not overwhelming. The brisket had good smoke penetration and the pink ring didn't overpower the flavor. Just the right smoke. Finally the hot link was hot enough without canceling out the flavors.   Overall well played. Worth the wait. The sauce on the table had flavor with just a little heat. The location has zero parking and the dinning area is challenging.   I still love this and would rate it up with the like if the Salt Lick in Driftwood TX. A must visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib tips.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket pulled pork hot link hush puppies and Mac and cheese

bIVtV4E-MCnn8QxFQQeFIg.text: What can I say, I like barbecue... With that said, I like this place a lot.  Great menu with lots of options.    It's our first time and already were planning on our next trip (probably on our next day off).  The location is quite hidden, but thanks to Siri we found it with no problem.  The restaurant is small but there are outside seating/dining area.  There is a big menu, which we needed a minute to read.  But don't sweat, there's something for everyone.   Long story short, come to this place hungry.  If you're looking for a salad, please stay away.  Some whiney guy was complaining about how he couldn't order a salad his way.  Seriously, if you're worried about eating a salad at a barbecue place, you have bigger issues than just a salad homie.    I gave minus points for the lack of space in the restaurant, but it's not a deal breaker.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. His and Her platter.

58k4O6v1IEozZrzDQ8w7jQ.text: Some of the best bbq I've had in a long time. Well worth the price. Sauces are great too. I ate in at the restaurant, I didn't even finish my meal when I ordered another meal To go. Meat is tender and juicy not over seasoned. I'll be placing an order for catering for my next party.   Oh and that cornbread was perfect. Super Buttery and crispy.

gVTPMvGh0n6jWge6N0N0dw.text: One of the best BBQ I have had in a long time. Great food great service. We had the rib platter special wow it was amazing.

NSnOsXA6JsS6OqlNg8LX6w.text: The best place far or near the west coast for BBQ. BBQ is cooked just right. Tender to touch, smoked just right, seasoned very well and just off the strip.

ZhAwOOT_uUfReoFa75FKYA.text: Guess whose back ? back again  Biggies back to see My rolling smoke friends ! Always a great experience  Meat loaf to die for !  What up Dusty !!!!!!

TmGS91so-aLJMn-VnzZWgA.text: Friendly service, awesome meat, and solid sides are all I ask in a BBQ restaurant and this place has it all!  Greens and mac and cheese were good and chopped brisket was fine...  The burnt ends and beef ribs were really top notch, and that's coming from someone who has been to some of the best BBQ joints in the country and smokes meat himself.  I'll be back every time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extreme burnt end closeup
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt ends, 1/4 chicken, greens, Mac and cheese

fqajOMvKRS5xOuNSqMCr6w.text: Their corn nuggets should be a new food group because I think I could live off of those creamy fried bits of goodness that taste less like they're from sin city and more like they came from heaven.  Burnt ends, sliced brisket and rib tips were all tender and flavorful. Having sampled BBQ from all over the country, this joint definitely holds its own and offers up some delicious and authentic BBQ.

Lf-m6Fu4Q8L9v_PEOHo5bg.text: My husband was craving for BBQ meats so we found this place on Yelp. We ordered the trio meats (chicken, pork, and ribs) with corn nugget, loaded mashed potato and a side salad (BBQ vinegrette dressing). You order your food and then find a seat. My husband ate most of the meat and rated it a 3.5-4 stars. The meats were tasty with variety of different dipping sauces you can choose from; the only negative was the dark chicken meat was a little dry. The corn nuggets were different as we have never had them before. You expect it to be salty but because of the corn it is sweet. The mashed potato was good if you like yours smooth and not chunky. We tried the sweet tea based on several reviews. It was super sweet and tasted like the Asian grass jelly drinks. We were expecting it to be a cold Canadian ice tea but with the adjustments we made it was good. My husband had to add ice and 1/3 cup water just to make it the right amount of sweetness and temperature as we wanted a cold drink. It's a little out of the way in the middle of nowhere, but if you are craving for some meat it's worth a visit for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio choice of meat with chicken, ribs, pork with corn Nuggets, loaded mashed potato and side salad (BBQ vinegrette dressing). Tastes great!

-5dd5XW00ficoakFPtfpbQ.text: I first had Bbq for here several years ago at a catered event. The food was delicious.  Recently I placed a take out order. The guy on. The phone was very pleasant but he forgot to add a few things to my order. I wasn't charged so it wasnt a big deal.   hey are always out of the beef ribs. I've heard they are delicious. Hopefully one day I'll get to try them.   Bbw chicken. It's not a whole chicken. It's 8 separate pieces. Very tasty and moist.   They were also out of the baked potato the night we ordered   Brisket.  I ordered 2 lbs to make up for the lack of beef ribs. The brisket was dry and had a very bad after taste that made it taste like old meat that had been. I tried to mask it with the delicious sauce but I couldn't. It wasn't the smoke flavor. It just tasted like old meat that should have been thrown out.  The brisket has a very light smoke ring. Little to no bark. It was definitely not winning any awards.   The sides were all ok. Nothing is ever crave but decent.   I asked them for a variety of sauces but they only included one type.   I'd go back but only because I'm still want to try the ribs.   The brisket was one of the worst I've ever had.  (Two pounds ended up in the trash). The chicken was good but over priced in my opinion.

YYw6GoH-Tv1r5n809ffCfw.text: I ordered Rolling Smoke Catering for our Christmas party at work and it did not disappoint! Everyone raves about the rib tips and brisket. They were very helpful in helping me order enough vs. the lovely budget our company provided.

AII4r3CLqQxRmfEyBNH3Yw.text: Now less be honest down right dirty dank BBQ is tough to find in Vegas. But this place has cured my babay back bluezz, and thank you baby jesus for it! This is where its at. We ordered the brisket pulled, ribs, and baked beans with a side of corn bread. Often times with BBQ the meat can be cold or be tough because it has been sitting for a while; this was not the case. It was absolutely finger lickin' delicious.  The ribs are incredible don't  waste your time beating around the bush go for the gold and this ribs are it. I recommend the Sweet Carolina BBQ Sauce, it was my favorite. The corn bread is light like and angel cake texture almost, its surprisingly scrumptious it really soaks ups the other foods well. I'm thrilled to finally have found  my local BBQ in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket pulled and ribs to die for with corn bread and beans

9CzZSOsts3m2mf4rPTipow.text: This place is pretty good and definitely provides decent value for being so close to the strip. The barbecue is fine, the brisket, pulled pork, ribs and links are all decent. The meet is well Cooked and has good flavor. The sauce they give you is fine too.  The real star however is the outlaw burger. This thing is a True monstrosity. With all the meats, onion rings and veggies I am not sure if you're even supposed to be able to put the whole thing in your mouth. But it's very good and enormous. And only nine dollars! Sweeet.  The sides were a mixed bag. Kicking beans were good, hush puppies were terrible. Oh well! Not a bad spot and seems to be popular but the line still moves fast.

x1VEzZaQ_-0bDK6aTMcong.text: Looking for something better than all the franchised spots, stop your search. Rolling Smokehouse is the bomb. Large servings, fair prices, great food. I ordered the 3 meat plate with beans and cornbread. All were outstanding but the beans even more so. My wife got the catfish plate...taste like my grandmas! Seasoned so well, fried to a crispy golden brown! Can't wait until my next trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Getting my food coma on at Rolling BBQ in Vegas

ItHcpmQDrOXD0bgBx01hDA.text: This is one of the best barbecue joints in Las Vegas and the prices are reasonable. Having been eating at Rollin Smoke for several years now, they've experienced massive growth. The restaurant was featured on a television show named Tanked recently. Tanked is a show about building custom aquariums for people and businesses, and the one they did for Rollin Smoke is full of exotic fish and is in their newly expanded room.  The outlaw burger is a must try if you're just visiting from another city. It's basically a meatloaf type burger with onion rings on top, and tastes just amazing.   For those of you that have already had the outlaw burger, I suggest getting the multiple meat platter with some sides. I like to get ribs, brisket, and chicken.  I would have given this place five stars last year, but this year it's four stars because they are always busy now, the lions are getting longer, and the portions seem to be getting smaller. They also changed their sweet potato side recipe, and I like the first version of this not the new one.  Regardless, I'm still going to continue to come back because there is no barbecue place like it anywhere near this part of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spare ribs and 1/4 chicken

4IQ2ZGvSCVUq84T4JROldg.text: As far as both bbq and burgers go, I was blown away by this place. When we arrived, the lunch rush was in full swing. I was kinda bored waiting in line for ten minutes, but after seeing others eating the food as I waited, I knew the wait would be worth it. One thing in particular caught my eye. I spotted it from across the room and knew we were meant for each other.  I ordered the outlaw burger, which was both inexpensive and amazing. This was easily one of the biggest burgers I have ever eaten. It has beef and brisket, onion straws, slaw and more on it. It towers over lesser burgers with a majestic stature that ensures you will be in mind blowing pain after eating this thing all in one sitting, which I of course did. The burger came with tasty waffle fries for around $9.  I so wish this place opened by me in NC, although if it did, I'd be 500lbs. I will return when I hit up Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw burger.....EAT IT NOW

72V8uNj7OnzZDTBX7Vc8XQ.text: Anything less than 5 stars is BS. This is in my top 3 of all time BBQ joints. Burnt ends... On friggen point! The biggun, simply epic as are the individual components that make it up which are the hit links the pulled pork and my favorite, the brisket. Waffle fries are as good as they get. Add some corn nuggets and you are in high cholesterol heaven. Staff is cool, courteous and helpful. The location is  a bit sketchy late at night if you're not familiar with the area. Its fine though, nothing to worry about.
