Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QbSemrRSJBxfFnlu_Dligw.text: Decent BBQ. This place has a large menu that should meet any carnivore's craving. Ribs, Brisket, Fish, Chicken, and even more...   We went late, around 11pm, on a Saturday night. I got the 3 Meat Trio and choose: Ribs, Brisket, and Chicken. Brisket and Chicken were very flavorful, but the Ribs were more fat than meat.   They have a few BBQ sauces to choose from, but I typically prefer my BBQ without sauce, to savor the authentic smoked flavor, which this place does deliver on. I tried once of the sauces, but it was nothing to write home about. Side were just okay. Had the Beans and Mac and Cheese. Beans were better than the latter. Mac and Cheese was kinda cold and really didn't have the flavor I wanted. Plus I don't know why the shredded it added. See pics others have taken.  It's definitely worth a stop if you're in Vegas. Check it out and Happy Eating!

q1pThzOWhaoaD_8R59Kfzw.text: Wow! Coming here from Texas I thought nothing could beat it. I was wrong! Amazing food and extravagant sauce.

VyHhdwFe-0ECsqeejOSQcw.text: I traveled from Seattle and picked this place from Yelp. It was GREAT!!! I had pulled pork and hot links with mac cheese. They have many kind of bbq sauces you can try. Staff was friendly and helpful.   You order from the counter and seek for a seat. They will call your name then enjoy it!  I'd recommend this place to anyone

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8SrX16fLfgHjzdNpHuoWLA.text: We were in Vegas for the weekend and wanted something outside the casino buffets & fast food places.     It is a hidden gem! But worth the find. I ordered the wings (by the way are the full wing!) I ordered 10 like a piggy, I could only eat 4! With side of greens which were delish.  My BF had the 3 choice meat of ribs, brisket & links... all were cooked to perfection. The sides are separate; potato bacon salad & cornbread was on point!  They have 3 sauces, the house Arkansas is my favorite... I was thinking of taking the bottle lol. The service is good, they come around and ask if your doing ok or need anything.  This place is definitely on my list when in Vegas!

UkIzhUpLDxK_xJgq-nWjhQ.text: 3 stars. That's about it. Yelp voted it the best bbq in Vegas, and if it is the best bbq in Vegas, then that's sad. This place is maybe slightly above average. That's about it.

tmxQ6aKA_joi4Tjc1Ud3Nw.text: We saw this establishment featured on the Travel Channel and visited in September.   Great customer service and hands down the BEST BBQ I've ever had.  Worth the drive off the strip.

Qx34SxGN9Gy5vTuyvftBIQ.text: Friendly service from Devada started off the night. Really good bbq, good ambiance and a clean place. I will be back.

z0SriJUYI647S0sXJQIHnA.text: Everyone was really nice.  I have the one girl the benefit of the doubt because she seemed new,  or maybe a little slow, but I'm not a harsh yelper, so I didn't really take any stars off for the service. The cool factor made up for any mistakes.  But the ribs were dry.  I mean dry.  Babyback ribs from Costco should fall off the bone.  These were dry and tough.  The flavor was there,  but dude.  The pulled pork was good,  and I liked the Mac and cheese.  But you can't f up ribs at a bbq place and keep my 5 star rating.  Sorry.

sNr4mOxCC7zs7ZA4Dssnng.text: Totally found this place by accident.  After a long day at a conference, I asked Siri for a barbecue restaurant near my location in Las Vegas.  This just happened to be the first one suggested, so we drove to it, about 1 1/2 miles away.  We turned onto Highland and thought this wasn't the nicest neighborhood in town, but saw that Rollin' Smoke was a little hole in the wall in a small strip center.  After getting out of the car, we immediately caught a whiff of the smoky goodness we were about to experience...always a good sign.  We looked at the menu and decided to go in anyway...so glad we did!  The baby back ribs I had were tender, smoky and flavorful.  A little extra house BBQ sauce made it even better, even though they are good when eaten dry too.  The only negative was that the thin membrane on the bottom of the bone wasn't pulled off...although it's a time-consuming process, it could have allowed additional smoke to the bottom of the meat, too.  My colleagues shared a sampler platter and thought it was some of the best BBQ they've had...and remarked that the baked beans were THE best they've ever had.  I can't disagree, comparing it only to SmoQue (Chicago) BBQ's brisket beans.  Awesome.  Anyway, this was definitely a welcome surprise, finding this place without reading reviews or being referred beforehand.  Worth the visit.

q6rTsLBnbZG2NYdvY7zlTQ.text: As an out of towner I was really excited about this place. Someone told me that their food was delicious. Hmmm it was ok. The fish was fried a little too hard, and it wasn't seasoned that great. Everyone that dined with me stated that their food was not hot, but only room temperature. The prices were ok. The presentation of the food was nice. The bar bbq sauces were delicious. Would I recommend? Not based on this experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZR-h_3iAqStoO7pE3er3gw.text: The best thing about my visit to Las Vegas has to be this BBQ spot. I really didn't think much about it, until I stepped inside and smelled how bomb the food was and looked. Since this was my first time here, I was having a hard time deciding on what to order. Thanks to my dude Antonio, he helped me figure out what to get and to make the most out my experience. I definitely know what I am getting next time I am out here. Thanks Antonio for helping me out! I can definitely say I will be ordering the burnt ends again, with some dirty rice!

L6vgpZr1JzPwbEHghTqumQ.text: Thank you Yelp. Found this place because of you.  If you like BBQ, you'll really like this place.  Food is delicious and there are options to select from. Really like Brisket, so tender and full of flavor. So.... if you don't mind getting off the strip go to this place. It'll be worth it.

y_q_DoXfZcF_C9imHYwZzQ.text: Finally a great BBQ place in Vegas.  I've been to quite a few, but so far this is the best I've found out here.  They actually have Burnt Ends, which has been surprisingly hard to find, and the flavor is excellent.  I only wish they had more locations so I don't have to drive as far when I get the urge for BBQ. Hopefully they'll open some in Summerlin and the NW area soon.  Until then it's worth the extra drive.

VrnxIR94xql4vGeXjgRbKA.text: Great atmosphere and I like the view of the outside patio and the bar tenders are super nice

OqXPVZXVtlGfnnrewQzcyw.text: The best way to describe Rolling Smoke is that if you have never had BBQ in the South, you will most likely enjoy Rolling Smoke, but if you have actually had BBQ in the South, you will be disappointed. Rolling Smoke's BBQ is not bad per se, but it just does not compare to the real thing. The flavor and execution are just not here, and the prices are just not in line with what is being served.

avp49mdezSbGQtKj3WgPyw.text: I came to this place because I saw it on Ginormous food and this restaurant definitely met my expectations! I had the brisket, pulled pork, their chicken and links and all their meats were extremely delicious!  I had their spudtastic baked potato and it was delicious and huge. I would 10/10 recommend.  The best part of the restaurant is that they had like 5 different types of BBQ sauce. They were all really good especially the sweet country girl! This place was so great that I will be coming to this restaurant every time I come to Las Vegas!

Sjc7QiC4tD-p8LvmCjXK5g.text: Despite being practically located under a freeway overpass and literally right next to a strip club this place is a hidden gem. I compare all bbq to Oklahoma Joe's back in kansas city. This was the best I've had in quite some time but doesn't quite reach the pinnacle that is Oklahoma joes.  We ordered the smoked meatloaf-very good but VERY smokey. It was like it was cooked over a campfire. Also tried the outlaw burger- this was amazing. Too big to realistically eat in one bite so just take the onion strings off and eat those as a side.  You must order the corn nuggets, they are the best I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked meatloaf- good but a bit too smokey
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw burger, you can see the corn nuggets hiding behind the tower of onion strings.

Unha2PLFJlM9Qvn50rZFXA.text: That was the best big for a great price. So much food on a large plate but I ate it all.

P7nmZqdsIVDbOpL89tDMgw.text: Went to this place back in February first time I had been there. The female at the counter was very helpful and suggested we try the 5 or 6 different meats platter.  it was delicious and a great price. Best BBQ in Vegas

bVbVUKaOcp7X3YGzmspbZg.text: The Brisket was so good and the BBQ perfect.  Manager even came over and asked how we were doing.  It's the little things.  Hole in the wall joint but great food!

dKtbHiiSoSYkrOlaztst5Q.text: This is the best cue in town. Not even close. Friendly staff. Phenomenal food. Amazing sides. Exactly what you want from a barbecue place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Babybacks, brisket, pulled pork, waffle fries, corn nuggets, happiness

bfzqC4J1v8ghjDf2T1a8YA.text: I recommend anyone coming to Vegas to always consider trying spots off the strip because you'll always find hidden gems like this one. The best bbq west of the Mississippi hands down! The brisket is tender and the baby back ribs have a ton of meat & fall right off the bone. I recommend the kicken beans and the loaded mash potatoes for sides. The catfish here is very good and melts in your mouth! Place is actually known for their meatloaf and their outlaw burger. The staff is very courteous, friendly and hard working. They put a lot of love in the food that's for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. baby back ribs, brisket &amp; Mac n Cheese

fcJ36HmnKC9CLLi-Chu-lA.text: Gotta give it to em ... they know how to BBQ. This place is absolutely delicious. They've gotten much bigger recently an prices have gone up a little bit but it's well worth it. I love the catfish and the pulled pork

4GIa0-ori339xOuKAXXa2Q.text: BBQ doesn't get much better than this out West. This has become a must have every time we go to Vegas. The food is on point never takes too long to get. Great selections and REAL sweet tea.

W66B0CxcblE3y7gn_HKgxQ.text: Food is great!  Portions great for the money!  Definitely a place to go if you want good food off the strip.

1VTYw73MzfMQ44sGt4B05g.text: This is the best Barbeque I've had in Las Vegas. Its a small place off the beaten path, near to, but not on the busy strip. There are a couple tables outside and a handful of tables inside...but, be warned, open seats and tables are at a premium at times as this place gets packed because they are just THAT good! I ate there for dinner yesterday and woke up craving their food...agh! The beef bones were out of this world flavorful and tender...the meat just fell off the bones. I wanted to try the bacon potato salad and they were out of it so I tried macaroni and cheese and yams...these are now my favorite sides. They brought us an order of potato salad after they made a new batch, but I liked the yams and macaroni and cheese the best. The owners and staff are very welcoming and friendly and stop by the tables to get feedback from their diners...when they spoke to us, they informed us that they are opening a second location that will include a bar. Of all the many places I've had the pleasure of eating BBQ this makes my list of my top three favorites...the other two are in (1) San Diego and (2) Winnipeg, Manitoba. Give this place a shot...I'm so glad I did!

GcG6t_vrhp4M0rbBTY8Weg.text: Was there fri July 18 and wow was the food amazing , had three meat platter and was blown away by the pulled pork , ribs. But the show stopper was the brisket. The flavour was like nothing I have ever had before. When in back I vegas will defiantly be back.

kZNKHEjuE8MP4lKGj2uoJQ.text: We had the BBQ sampler, it was just amazing! The brisket just melts in your mouth, the sausage is slightly spicy and with a great flavor, the pulled pork is also delicious, and the sides we got were all great! (coleslaw, beans, mac n' cheese and potato salad).  We came on Friday night and got an excellent service from Matt and Dan and chefs Justin and Lou.  Thank you! You are the best :D

C1EmEdwoz-P5RPyAFe6aMA.text: If I could give 10 stars I would. This place makes me sad for one reason... we don't have a place like this in LA. Not only is the food EXCELLENT, but the owner and everyone there is so friendly! You can really taste the pride and attention they give to make your meal.

HwtY2T7Wws3mNWj33kzJLw.text: Honestly was expecting better for the way everyone raves about it. Service was fine, ambiance is cool and casual, but the food was just blah to me. I had a pulled pork sandwich with waffle fries, it was nothing special. And the bbq sauce is another bummer.

3Kt8PdTj_eGBgJoZtVdIRw.text: Essy, fast, cheap just good all around. Always a go to spot. Norkslky we get the 27.99 5 kear special. Cant go wrong n it feeds up to 4 people.

dHG0i8kEqROyHMAyx5jgTA.text: Pulled pork sandy was great, love the pickels. Next time Ill order slaw instead if beans.

p2B1kl6Vu4iTG8Hc-ph_Dw.text: Rolling Smoke BBQ is the best in the Vegas area. I know BBQ, I grew up in Texas, worked when I was in college at a BBQ joint, have spent many a meal eating it, and have had vacations planned around parts of this country just to eat it!  In the past, baby back ribs, brisket, and hot links or sausage was the best for me. I'm still partial to ribs, but love a good smoked brisket. This place has some of the best in Las Vegas. They leave just enough fat to keep it moist, you pick it up and it falls apart! It's got a good smoke ring and blackened skin to make your mouth water.   Just about everything on the menu makes my mouth water. We usually order by the pound and get a side or two, yes between my husband and myself, we can put it away. But we do have some left overs. We like eating here often but because we can order by the pound, we can watch carbs as well.   Very causal, gets extremely busy especially at peak hours. Friendly staff. Good BBQ!

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8P7I9cOsO9bo1Yl3aUp6KQ.text: Great place with great BBQ close to the strip! Food came out fast and we had zero complaints. Will definitely come back here next time we are in Vegas.

ZEjjX6RuoT_g7oYm--r5Bw.text: The food here is hands down the best BBQ I have ever experienced!  NO exaggeration at all... my dad is one of the best barbecuers I know and this place is just phenomenal. The burnt ends just melt in your mouth and the brisket I had was so tender and flavorful it's literally heaven on a fork... AND to top it off, the food only took 4 mins to come to our table after being ordered. The owners here have something really special going on and I commend them on their service and bbq skills !

q1etGfClvIfUsrDUnfxY5w.text: Not much more can be said about this place that hasn't already been said. But here goes. Drink a bunch of water prior to your visit the stretch your stomach out.  Hours in advance of course. Then come here for the All you can eat deal only $35 plus tax. You can mix and match, but you only get 1 hour.  You can have as many sides as you want. Portions are smaller but that's so you can try everything.   The sauces I tried were good. I went for their spicy and homemade Arkansauce. Mac n cheese was nothing special and came out Luke warm at best. The cheddar cheese sprinkled over the top hardly melted. Waffle fries were good and a generous portion.   Enjoy!

_0RHTSK4JDXrJnjZm2YvwQ.text: We ordered the 5 meat Pit special. Was absolutely amazing! By far the best BBQ I have ever had!! Anyone going or in Vegas has got to go try this place out! FYI it's bring your own beer.

mURlxDG9cxiKNAWkS-pLAQ.text: I travel a bit and always prefer to eat at the local joints  and using Yelp I have had great results... This place is another 100% winner.  Devada was the lady that waited on us and she was awesome! She made helpful recommendations that proved to be spot on for first timers like us.  We tried the 5 meat pit special and shared it between the two of us, it was plenty and it was delicious!  The corn bread, BBQ beans and collard greens were just as tasty as the meat-fest. The sweet tea was fresh brewed and perfect. Sometimes sweet tea can be overly sweet but this was spot on.  Don't let the location fool you, friendly people and fantastic BBQ.   Grab a cab and get out of the casino, you won't regret it if you like great BBQ. Highly recommend and will return the next time I am in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Vx6cu6np0tggOSdRiS6u_g.text: Very good food! Super small joint hidden and must know what you're looking for or you'll pass it. Amazing sauces! There are like 5 different ones. Tri tip was the best!! Max and cheese was on point as well. Very small joint so gets packed fast. Not a lot of spots to sit at so take it to go!

6DCx9m_EJ0ro0xVBZWgbEw.text: I know I'm on the late train about Rollin Smoke, but WOW this is amazing BBQ!   I especially like the brisket. It's so tender and tasty (loved the peppered crust). Also the corn fritters, burnt ends and coleslaw are a must try. Basically everything is delicious. That's a huge compliment coming from a picky eater. My only complaint is that there isn't one on my side of town. But I've searched high & low for some good bbq so it's worth the drive.

09ni58iIK0PcScU-QQh5VQ.text: This place is definitely a hole in the wall but I'm so happy we found this place on yelp! Our uber driver was even laughing when she dropped us off since it was such a plain looking place tucked away from the strip!   The food:  --we ordered the 5 combo sampler but my two favorite was: the chicken & the ribs !! The chicken was so moist & flavorful! The ribs were so fatty and melts in your mouth! --mac & cheese -- yum!!! -potato salad was okay  The 5 combo platter was too much for two people but the bf really wanted to try it ! I would recommend for about 3 people !   It turned out to be about 30 bucks for the whole meal which is a steal for quality meat!! Definitely worth visiting!

7ADLDkFh_MQ26xeyhmH8xg.text: Me and my two golf buddies took our 4th golfing buddy's word that this bbq was better than Mabel's at the Palm where others in our golfing group decided to try.   He was absolutely correct. Awesome bbq is hard to come by but you will find it here. We had their famous beef ribs, pork spare ribs and burnt ends along with corn bread, collard greens and Mac n Cheese. Can you say food coma?  It was all excellent.      The service was great too. Brenda was extremely helpful and pleasant. I would recommend this to anyone in need of serious bbq.   All you need to see is the long line on a Tuesday night to know it's "seriously good bbq ".

pcuzz8Nj68DQtI2m-M2uDA.text: The best Ribs!  Excellent Customer Service!!  Totally the bomb!! The Kool-Aide on fountain was a fantastic treat too!  Very clean, friendly, and authentic!  Best meal I had in a week stay!!

eJoTAhMpyRCg-5YdoRmBjw.text: This place was great. Right off the strip this place had amazing BBQ and a huge Cowboy Burger. I would definitely recommend taking a trip off the strip and giving this place a try. The staff are very friendly and the service was great. I enjoyed everything I ate there. Also there was plenty of seating so you could get out of the Vegas heat and enjoy a great meal.

52x5qXvuWZMqHbJ3qXV3aw.text: WOW is all I can say. I like to think of myself as a sort of BBQ addict, and have a few favorites around the US. After my visit to Rollin Smoke today I can say that is my new nationwide favorite. My wife had the two meat platter (chicken & burnt ends) which she loved (and she's picky). The meat was tender and not dry and very flavorful. I had the huge pork sandwich and a side of collard greens. Unbelievable flavor, nice toasted bun, good Smokey flavored pulled pork. The sauces are also good, there are 4 to choose from anywhere from hot to mild and a Carolina vinegar style. If you are in town and like BBQ, believe me, you won't be disappointed. Dustin (one of the owners) is also a cool, down to earth guy who we spoke with. Really friendly place with great food. Try it out.

1wll1NuizY2AUMlg-9skdg.text: Non fatty, great flavor, wonderful service. We shared a meal and were still full. I'll be back.   Oh, although we walked in the neighborhood.. you probably should not.

1j6pzJcL5KRWNitpryZSOg.text: I have had BBQ every where in the US, this is the best.  I give very few 5 stars and this place could easily be a 10 star.  I had 3 meat with baked beans and corn nuggets.  The brisket was the tenderest and the most flavorful. The sausage was not to spicy and the pulled pork was perfectly moist.   The baked beans had their own flavor, not just beans with sauce poured on top.  The corn nuggets were the sweet in the meal.  Excellent! Husband had brisket 3 ways.  He is a BBQ snob and he too agreed that this was the best Q.   Being the best is hard work and this place kicks butt!  Good job!

QFTX8hUsmvq3M06kSTejXQ.text: A little pricey but it doesn't take much to fill your belly.  All of the food is outstanding & puts AR BBQ on a well deserved map.  It's become a regular stop when in Vegas.

QmxDAF8i-hcYpbY222_lqA.text: Greatest thing to the south located in the west - Authentic- I stand  by it - bet you a pay check hands down they are real -  consistent and have desert - PC my lord lol - and they are open unlike other places  but anyway great price - many sauces  - great service and people up front who know the menu - thank god even through the phone - This is it folks if your in Vegas - hooked customer quality consonantly and worth every buck and more !!!!!!!!!

lh97mgOF13SPFBs8fnaBIQ.text: Wow. Thanks yelpers. I love Southern BBQ, and this place hit the spot. Don't let the industrial location next to a strip club, and the small parking area deter you. Price, portion, and taste is all on point for this business.  My hubby ordered a special of ribs and sweet potato pie for $20. His meal was okay, but mine?! Mine was fantastic! I paid an extra $3 for the burnt brisket tips by recommendation of the cashier, and she wasn't kidding. It was smoky, tender, and a bit spicy from the peppercorn crust. Since mine was a two item combo, I also got the pulled pork- not too salty, tender shreds of pork. Served with one slice of white bread and a side. I got the chipotle coleslaw since I wanted some greens with my heavy meal.   Order at the front, pay, find a table and self serve utensils and drinks. Easy, easy, easy!    This place is on the definite return list when we are back in town.

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ms4BusW0wksoPKOuenByoQ.text: Was in town recently, for a few days.  The shitty casino food was getting to us.   So we decided to get a delivery order and settled on RSB.   Top 3 BBQ in my life and I am a judgemental prick.  I eat vegetables because I was told I have too.  But I refrigerated all of the left over food, including the green beans and drove it hundreds of miles home.  I bought green beans for the first time in my aged life, because I want to see if I can come close.

fwgXDX356d77kEiIRkqtWw.text: Great BBQ with a fun, "Southern" atmosphere.  Only downsides:  the facility not able to meet demands of customers.  Not entirely business' fault, as they have as many tables and benches crammed in as possible.  Other issue was the leaking cups.  We were told manufacturer defect, and they did replace the first leaky cup, but my replacement leaked worse. Stuck a napkin under as a coaster and called it a day.  Too bad I won't be able to reuse the cup.  On to the positives!!  The food was well prepared, very flavorful, and in great portions.  I chose the 2 meat combo (Brisket and Hot Link) with the potato salad.  The brisket was incredibly well prepared and very tender.  Got Link was cooked AND cut to perfection.  Sauces were bursting with flavor that enhanced the taste of the meats.  The service from cashiers were very nice and intimate too.  Each transaction was unique where the cashiers would create small talk to show appreciation and make the customer feel special.  For example, my friend before me, the cashier would talk about living in Las Vegas (he was born and raised).  Then, when I came up, he talked to me about my heritage and how it was applicable to him as well (based on my last name).  It was incredibly calming to know each customer is treated with respect and dignity.  Bravo!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_zjaqqGOY2N8qpxQuTVIDw.text: One of the best things a BBQ joint can do is have great side dishes, and Rollin Smoke does just that! I absolutely loved the Corn Nuggets! It's creamed corn in a fried ball. It's hard to appreciate until you try them. Everyone at my table loved them. They are so addicting. They also have a long list of other options including their own take on Mac N Cheese, mashed potatoes, baked beans, etc.  As far as the meat goes, I wasn't very impressed. All the BBQ I try is compared to Kansas City BBQ because that's the best I've ever had, and it just doesn't measure up here. However it's plausible that their claim, "Best bbq in Las Vegas" is True because it was a decent place that proudly displays awards they have won for their bbq.  I ordered The Outlaw Burger. It was insanely large. Basically it's a side order of onion straws on a burger. The taste of the meat was off otherwise I would have loved everything about this entree. I was only able to eat half of it before getting too full to continue.   If you're craving BBQ, this place will do the trick. Go check it out.

YXyqT2LlgT9_7idtqtdd9w.text: We drove by this place on the way to a meeting and just had to stop. This BBQ is awesome!!! I had Brisket three ways and it is all great but the Burnt Ends are some of the best I have ever had!!! Sure am glad we stopped!

qDM7c2jxzbxNYrWNjqZIpQ.text: Me and my family went there for my nephews birthday and the baby back ribs were fantastic,almost falling off the bones and the barbecue sauce itself was finger licking good. Highly recommendable.

YX75iJZz1ksLjBoMlmZT6Q.text: Researched and decided to try this place while in town on vacation. Glad we did! Nice little whole in the wall atmosphere with food that comes through on flavor! Had the beef ribs with the beans and mac 'n' cheese. The beans have a little kick and plenty of meat as well. M 'n' C was not dripping in cheese sauce (thankfully). Pasta prepared perfectly and the right amount of cheese. The ribs....the ribs!! They come with this dark char bark but not burnt. The bark has as much flavor as any ribs I've had before. The meat inside is tender and slides right of the bone! Spoke to one of owners. He told me how he tries to get just the right combo of the deep bark and tender middle. How he can't believe that his passion led to owning his own business in Vegas. This a must try if you're in town! Only draw back is it seems like seating can become limited during rush hours, unless you don't mind  community seating. Still an amazing find!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rollin Smoke BBQ on Highland.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ribs tender to the bone!

UiVQ_2Hu4T0CrZ0_s4d0WA.text: This place is worth the drive. Best tasting pulled pork and beef brisket sandwiches I've tasted! The sides were all excellent as well!  The service was friendly and efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket Dog Sandwich
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket 3 Ways
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled Piggy Sandwich Combo

fjo7gpInZwbOzcBhNjpeNQ.text: I moved out to Las Vegas a few months ago, and nothing has inspired me to write a review until now.   I did a cross country roadtrip where I was able to sample BBQ from some of the best southern BBQ joints I could find -- and Rollin Smoke BBQ is amazing! Not as good as Texan bbq, but this is just as close to the Lone Star state it'll get! WAYYYYYYYYY better than Famous Dave's. Oh boy, do I hate Famous Daves -- such an insult to BBQ.  Atmosphere -- super laid back, picnic table, and family style. Very casual dining.   Boyfriend and I shared a 4 meat platter, we had: RIBS, BRISKET, CHICKEN, and PULLED PORK. We went a bit crazy with the sides because we wanted to try everything -- loaded mashed potatoes, hush puppies, mac and cheese, cole slaw, onion rings, and waffle fries.  Everything was so good! My favorite was the pulled pork, it was seasoned really well and so tender. Close second -- the bbq chicken. SUPER JUICY! The brisket was melt in your mouth, a bit over seasoned for me. Ribs were okay, not the best I've had ever, but were good.   All sides taste home made. My favorite were the hush puppies, mac and cheese (SO CREAMY), and loaded mashed potatoes.   I kept seeing people order the Outlaw burger. ONLY SMOKES! It's humungus! Definitely trying that next time I come back!   All in all -- bf and I are super excited to have a bbq joint we love and can bring family/friends to! We will definitely be coming around whenever we are near the strip. Definitely a must try if you are in the area!

A6M7S4J5l95usQdsuhEDAw.text: I love this place!! I always bring a lot of business to this place. I refer a lot of visitors in the convention business to order from here on lunch break. I have arranged a deal during the BlackHat (a convention at Mandalay Bay) to treat the crew to a very good lunch from here and the crew loves it as well as the client. So, this place has helped me better my business relations based off of happiness from good food.

K2XLL9OhSNEy-sBhzI-jlA.text: The BBQ is really delicious here. When we got here two days ago the line only had a couple people in it around 5. By the time we got our food is was almost out the door. The wait isn't bad at all. It's a order, sit and then they will call your name and bring it to you kinda place.   I'd say try the Mac and cheese, greens and yams bc that's what I had for sides. Cornbread is also yummy, not too sweet. Pull prom and chicken are my favorite meats.   I'll be coming back here next year when I'm in town next year.

ObZBaF4_OKpmLVBd91Ar9g.text: WOW!!!  Our office had them cater lunch for us today and this is how BBQ should be!  The meat on both the chicken wing I grabbed (and yes it was nice and meaty!) and the rib ripped right off the bone!  The flavor was outstanding as well!!  Chopped brisket was awesome as well!!  The bacon potato salad (because everything is better with bacon!!!) was the best potato salad ever!!  Beans had a nice kick...YUM!!  And the cornbread was perfect not dry at all!!  Wish they had a west side location!!  Will have to make the drive though...the food will totally be worth it!!!

-uJJtjJSEWvFA3G3cBFbTg.text: First things first, this place does look like it's in a sketchy part of town but let me tell you, when you walk in you get greeted by a delicious smell of barbecue. There is a line but it moves really fast. The man that took my order was really friendly and fun. I ordered the BBQ Nacho Fries with pulled pork and my boyfriend got the Out Law Burger. My nacho fries were soooo good, omg the best thing I have eaten in a while I highly recommend them, my boyfriends burger was so talk and stacked I don't know how he was able to take a bite out of it. It's cool when they take you your order because they yell out your name and where your from, everyone working there is super friendly the atmosphere is great. I would definitely come back to this place next time I'm in Vegas and would tell anyone going to Vegas to go try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Out Law burger
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ nacho fries with pulled park
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They have cute stickers and cups

I4KgRLbEo_J3Y-OXLVQlKw.text: Rollin' Smoke really does deserve the praise they receive here.  Authentic southern BBQ and a first rate menu of sides.  I like their pulled pork and Brisket best.  The ribs are good but I don't think they're exceptional.  Even though I can't impress people with the awesome credential of being from Kansas City or Texas, I still recommend Rollin' Smoke if you like great BBQ and sides served in a genuine dive (next to a strip club and almost under an overpass).

Pe7vs1A2_CmUqQOFp6h1FA.text: I love this place, it's my favorite BBQ joint in Las Vegas. As soon as you walk in the door, look around and the smells hit your nostrils, you know this place is legit. Everything I've ever had here was great, but my go-to is the pulled port sandwich with hush puppies and sweet tea. If you like spicy food, be sure to ask for a side of their Hot Damn (or is it Damn Hot -- I can never remember) sauce, which is a very spicy version of their house made BBQ sauce. It's awesome. My mouth is watering just thinking about Rollin Smoke.   They are soon to be opening a second location in the Pawn Star's new container park, just a few blocks above the north end of The Strip.

g76dOK1CuU9ngmN5_0Di8A.text: Heard about this place in Vegas Seven, and had to try it. I'm so glad I did!  I went with my boyfriend and he got the pulled pork sandwich with the bacon potato salad. I got the 2 plate combo with brisket and pulled pork, and yams as the side. We got a free dessert for checking in and got the banana pudding. It was awesome!   Everything was delicious! Best BBQ I've had in Vegas. Service is great too. We talked to the chef for a little while we ate and he was really friendly. We'll be back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum! Beef brisket and pulled pork! And a side of delicious yams.

eiikELtFvbn2JcfI8BjmLQ.text: Awesome, awesome, awesome. Food is super dankk. CHEF TIM is doing it right in the kitchen! Brisket (tender, juicy, with a little of that spicy sauce they have with MamaSweetSauce!) sandwich super smacked, ordered extra on the cornbread, Mac n cheese (pepperThat:) yum, and the loaded mashtatoes were goooood tooo.....   s/o to Ms Brenda for being awesome too..... bbq done deliciously. Quietly located, but I like that. Try it.

XYQrkbJv7_udTbBRHJX6Dg.text: Real BBQ real close when you're in Vegas.  We got the smoker plate that was around $30.... Well, two of those actually and had plenty left over for the next day.

NkSnNV0UtNkiFF5PF9A9nA.text: I like that Rollin Smoke renovated the dining room.  It makes it a lot more welcoming.  However, I still believe its too small cause I almost always have to wait for a seat.    The food here is amazing.  The service is great. I appreciate that the food is made to order.  Its a True BBQ joint, so the ribs and brisket have been cooking for hours when you get there, and the rib meat falls off the bones.  I have never had a bad meal here.

omAH2IR9p4_VOUPoQrNsJQ.text: They should call this place Holly Smokes BBQ! Best BBQ is Vegas, hands down. Fast, quality, comfort, yum, DAMMMM!! These are all words that came to mind while I stuffed my face. Tried everything I could...catfish, shrimp, hushpuppies, meatloaf, loaded mash, brisket, ribs, and Mac N' cheese. Topped it off with a little sweet potato pie AND banana pudding. Love the community table concept. Love that it feels like eating at home with family. A little crowded at times, but for the most part it's pretty quiet because people are too busy shoveling the smoked goodness in. Will be back as soon as this food coma subsides.

IN69JfNCLpPpEHZ1zyh5Hg.text: Only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because it can go for a renovation. However the food is definitely 5 stars, I've had so much bbq that I simply can't tolerate the mediocre stuff. Rollin smoke has it down, ribs were tender and had good flavor, as did the brisket. BBQ sauce is a HUGE deal to me, and theirs was just right, not too spicy, sweet, or acidic. Sides were perfect, I couldn't decide so I had greens, mac n cheese, beans and hush puppies. Everything was excellent, I really did appreciate the atmosphere, the fact that they pretty much just give you your food reminded me of the southern bbq culture. BBQ is not a fancy upscale experience where your given limited napkins, its fun and loose, they definitely have that down. I'll definitely make this a go to spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Doesn&#39;t get any better when you just wanna pig out!

7K5KCtGreLsKZ-IAlLk9Ww.text: After spending the day walking the strip, we went off the beaten path for some good old bbq.  We were not disappointed.   We are not from Vegas and can't enjoy it like the locals do.  But I would certainly choose this place  over an over priced Gordon Ramsey any day.   Very friendly staff.  Will certainly be back next time we are in town  Chris M. Orange County,  CA

455I_6HaQA2f9OpbfqUGmg.text: Best barbeque in Vegas, as far as I'm concerned! You'll see plenty of awards and accolades on their walls inside the (decidedly small) dining area, and you'll soon realize why they've earned them. It may be hard to find, but this place is worth the journey.  The most important thing I'd recommend is to go there on an odd day, like a tuesday or wednesday night, because on their busier peak periods the food isn't as fresh, I think they may just make huge batches of the common items and put them under heat lamps. If you go there for lunch you're guaranteed the freshest meats. And wow, are they worth it.  The meats are tender and flavorful, from the ribs that are soft and juicy, to the crisp snap of their spicy sausage. Their sides are to die for, particularly the loaded mashed potatoes and the baked beans. And you absolutely have to save room for dessert, their homemade banana pudding is a gift from the cosmos. It's simply unbelieveable. I'd recommend getting one of their multiple meat platters and sharing it, to get the full spectrum of what's on offer here.

-tyBxdnrskigjrwFM7vbYA.text: This "restaurant" is a joke. I get there. We stand in line. It takes this idiot cashier literally 15 minutes to take two peoples orders and then it's our turn to order. So we order the first item, it takes the guy literally a minute to find it on the computer. (Now the 15 minute wait made sense). We try to order baby back ribs. They are out. How do you run out of baby back ribs at 6 pm on a Thursday? Sorry. A little mean but this place was one of my worst experiences at a restaurant.

gpi2cQFte8zjMJ8QfbzjKg.text: Great BBQ place. You know it'll be good when there's a big line at 4PM.  Pretty small dining area so tables can be difficult to et; by its ok to share with others; and there's also an outside seating area.  We tried the spare ribs, baby back ribs, chopped brisket, 1/4 chicken, mac and cheese and yams. All were fantastic. Although the next time I will definitely try the pork and hot links to confirm everything on the menu is great. One side note is that the baby back ribs were better and had more meat than the spare ribs. I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese, yams, baby back ribs, spare ribs, 1/4 chicken, and chopped brisket.

06cFOz3RbnJ-bkivRjptjw.text: Finding a authentic homemade bbq place can be tough if you don't live in a southern state. Luckily this is my second find of great bbq. We arrived during the lunch rush. They had a line but it moved pretty quickly and we were able to snag some seats to enjoy our selections. The Woman that took our order was friendly and patient while we decided what to get. Before we got our food my husband made the comment well we found our bbq place closer to home. I told him how does he know we have not tried the food yet. He laughed at me and said the line is out the door you don't get a line like that with just okay food. A waiter brought out our food he was friendly. Our food was fresh and hot, the hotlinks has this snap when you bite them that your looking for when you bite into one of them. The ribs were perfectly seasoned and fell off the bone, the only complaint were they were a tad bit greasy. The chicken was cooked just right and had a nice smoked taste when you bit into it. The okra was hot and fresh and the chipolte dip was great! The brisket was great I always do a roll test where if i can roll it and it does not break apart it's cooked to my liking, they have hands down one of the best briskets i've had. The mac-n-cheese was the disappointment, it was thick and just didn't taste like mac-n-cheese that you would expect with bbq food. I will be back I see why they have the line they have.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket ribs and hotlink with mac n cheese
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chickrn robs and hotlink with okra

FkpaY6tArLiFQ7JWINuQSA.text: Flew in just about 11 and had a couple of hours to kill before heading off to Fort Irwin. Did the tourist thing by visiting the Pawn Stars shop, then Yelped someplace for lunch. Husband really goes for BBQ, and this place had 4.5 stars. Must say that 4.5 stars is perfect. (Wish Yelp allowed half stars.)  I had the club wrap, and husband had the pulled piggy sandwich and onion rings. The wrap and sandwich were great, but the onion rings were the best we've had anywhere. (Yes, I snitched some from husband.)  Ordering was easy, and food came in about 7 minutes after that. Staff was friendly. Yes, it's a hole in the wall, but SO much better than visiting a chain restaurant when we're traveling. The atmosphere was fun.  Will definitely try it again when in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled piggy sandwich and onion rings - yum!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Club wrap - huge &amp; tasty.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Atmosphere.2

KCCrDtijeMCthxfb_G_kQA.text: Big time awesome BBQ. Been all over and this is some of the best in the US. I would highly recommend the brisket and burgers. Just awesome. Huge portions

1AVe21aLnCGXe2EQNaAlKw.text: I really wanted to like this place because friends of mine who have gone love the food. Maybe I went on an off day but I felt the meats were dry and lacked flavor. It wasn't like I only tried one item...our group had ordered a mixture of ribs, brisket, chicken, pulled pork sandwich, wings, corn nuggets, hush puppies and potato salad. Nothing really stood out. I am willing to give it a second try but maybe this time I'll go during the day instead of an hour before closing. Aside from the food, the people and service were great.

l4pOanrue_uwtNmqwnIcoA.text: AMAZING! nondescript place we found by accident and they had SUCH friendly staff, cheap enormous piles of amazeballs food, and felt nothing like the artificial touristy stuff on the strip.

t9wsZeUc0esnTQc5pbQVOw.text: Best Mac n cheese I've ever had! Corn bread was nice and fluffy! Brisket burnt ends were way too fatty for my liking, had a couple of cuts of meat that were mostly all fat. Over all good. Place was packed and busy with Togo order. Will come back if ever in area again.

4FrVcQVz_2k4znNZwYHUfg.text: WOW! The food is amazing....best item by far is their beef ribs and their sauce is oh so delicious. For some reason I was thinking that they closed at 10pm. I just now realized they close at 8pm, which was the time we arrived at the spot. Not once did any of the workers mention this to us, they are so friendly and welcoming. I must've took forever to figure out what I wanted to order too - now I feel so bad for being a douchebag customer LOL. I even ordered it to go then we ended up eating there instead....and still, not one mention about their closing time. Thank you guys for allowing us to savor your wonderful product way past closing...kudos forrealz! On top of all this, hubby asked me to order another rib piece to go - and boy did we luck out. They happily took our order and sent us off with two pieces instead of one. WINNIN! Beef ribs = easy 10+ Cheesy mac n cheese = 10 Rib tips = 8 Peach cobbler = 9 Customer Service = 10+  Likelihood to return = you betcha!  If you're a first timer, don't let the location sway you...you will sorrily miss out!

KnuXpiMoZKccKURX05fokg.text: Hands down ... best barbecue I've had so far!  Lucille's and Famous Dave's are delicious but do not even come close to this place.  You won't find the "dining experience" here that you would find at those other places which have that certain 'manufactured' feel.  I'm in no ways putting Lucille's or Dave's down because they are still good.  However, Rollin Smoke gives you plenty of delicious food at a very reasonable price.  Oh my gosh, the brisket was so full of flavor.  My friend shared one of his beef ribs with me and I just cannot desribe how heavenly it felt sinking my teeth into it. haha.  My only regret was feeling like crap after a sleepless night and with a hangover ... after all it is Vegas LOL.  I really wanted to come here again on my last Vegas trip but too bad I was sick.    I came here solely based on awesome Yelp reviews.

I-WukIdcrRtSvhqtzTo3PQ.text: Dude!, this's a hole in the wall place that will make you cough of you have any kind of lung issues. Aside from that, you are in for a real treat with their Outlaw burger. It is a big beast. I ate that thing like a teenage v***** And the ribs are to die for.

U_UngAD5za9-t0voiub0nA.text: The best Ribs in town!  Everyone there is helpful and the service is good. My only complaint was the last time I was there my order was incorrect. The food was still great, and after a phone call they did apologize for the mistake.  I would still say "GO THERE" you will not be disappointed.

SBCL5b8V01_72ma56ztVoA.text: By far the best BBQ in Vegas!!!. Not a big fan of the Green Onions garnish. Kinda of makes it look a too gourmet "ish"... Otherwise great stuff! Love the sauce!!

47a307D2PILO3JNDFynBMQ.text: My new bbq place to go to. Best bbq spot in the valley!

JcQ62Ny2_tjehqn9sqzhXw.text: Chef Seddy has the best burnt ends ever!!! Love the sweet Bbq sauce! Had to get dessert...The peach cobbler was good, too! Everything my group ordered was delicious!

vPlt-oh6UEczt8VrF8tuEA.text: This place is tucked away but not far off the strip. I have been here twice with my boyfriend and it has never disappointed. Cute clean place, very welcoming and great service. We have had the shrimp Po boy, the three meet special and their mom's meatloaf. God bless it all but the one dish that made us almost cry was the meatloaf. AMAZING!!!! Taste and texture co mingled like 2 swans on a lake. The flavors opened up beautifully. All the sides have been fantastic especially the corn nuggets & bacon potato salad This is one LA girl who cant wait to go back.  Try hard to save room for dessert.... Oh and....I like pig butts & I cannot lie!!!

BQ_SX-yf-i0IE5w76XqXog.text: Good food, prices are bit expensive considering the location is right next to strip clubs, in a kind of seedy area.   And I don't understand having a menu where you run out of portions of it before half the day is up?  If you can't keep your food in stock, make more?  Outside of that, it was alright (aside from the massive amount of smoke that seeps into the restaurant area, making you smell like a chimney sweep from the turn of the century).  Have a lot of friends that love the place, but for me, once was enough.

OhSngshrspW74mBTMhqKgQ.text: best bbq I've had up here. not as good as the south, but def wasn't disappointed. the sides are really good, and the pulled pork was good

MgNVR6FOskdv7HqcIaXrzg.text: Place in hole in the wall. Not fancy as bbq shouldnt be.  Im picky about my BBQ. This place had it down. Ribs were best thing i thought. Tender and smoked. Beautifull color and all around good flavor. Chopped brisket and pulled pork alot of places can do pork.   I would say they would need to work on. I like a variety of sauces, they didnt have much. Spicey , sweet or vinigar. Bathrooms...place to wash after eating good bbq. 1 small single room. Also it gets busy and tables are hard to come by.   I would definitly get it again. Especially to go!

slmRXRdWNg5TESo-w58gsQ.text: Could not go to Las Vegas without eating at Rollin Smoking Barbecue. Staff very courteous and friendly, as usual. Thanks guys!!!

HSC_qzCqVnErsmE_27_AZQ.text: Word is out on this place. It is packed so dont bother going during rush hour or it is a 2 hour lunch easy! Food is awesome and priced reasonably. The ribs are some of the best in town. The outlaw burger will break any toilet in town.

rnb90lcDmZPCqljDccFHBw.text: BEST BBQ I've had in Vegas!!! Hugh portions and traditional atmosphere.  Try the outlaw brisket burger, you won't be disappointed.

F43O9lQ-PXmSKaDEqmDeNg.text: I've been hearing so much about this place, so when I was craving bbq I wanted to try it. Great menu, great prices, and friendly staff. The meat was seasoned well and tender. I ordered ribs and hot link and my boyfriend ordered brisket, chicken, and hot link. For side dishes we ordered mac and cheese, greens, and loaded mash potatoes. The loaded mash was really good, the greens and mac were mediocre... kind of generic tasting. I will go back though, and try new sides. The spudtastic looks delicious :)

nqwo8JbB9X5G-mfAV_wmtA.text: Back here again!  If you guys are into bbq and are in Vegas, check it out.  Great service and awesome brisket and ribs.  Always friendly staff is awesome and the prices are more than reasonable!  Missed the owner this trip.  She's normally there all the time cleaning up and speaking to all her guests.

BewfzFpc75M9WIkE2UYS0Q.text: Please note that the platters may be a little on the pricey side, but there's enough to feed two people.  Very good food, fun atmosphere, but the huge tables make it so that you'll probably be dining with strangers.

T895OQGuYj7yjmnf_kpLXA.text: Tried Rolling Smoke for the first time about a week ago & I'm already back. I got the pit special which included ribs, pulled pork, brisket, & chicken. it was all absolutely delicious. Their bbq sauce is unique and semi sweet but amazing. Both times I have come here the staff is very friendly and this time Big Mike was up front and actually thanked me for coming in and told me how happy he was I liked their food. Small business customer appreciation at its best. Would recommend Rolling Smoke to anybody. You won't be let down!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OLtT7LW7j9_FNUsIVeMjFw.text: I am a BBQ lover as other food items. I have tried several places here in town, one of them being a chain which was THE WORST hands down (no names mentioned).  Then my husband was introduced to Rollin Smoke and I have been addicted ever since!  A very small place with a BIG MENU! I have tried many things there and my favorite by far is the Beef Rib order. I  So meaty and tender I can't get enough! The Baked Potato "Spudtastic" is a meal in itself! You can order it with whatever meat you like and it is Loaded! If you are getting sides, don't leave without trying the Kickin Baked Beans, full of meat and flavor with a little spice kick!  No matter what you order, there is NO LET DOWN HERE!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Ribs anyone
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ribs

Ssa7N-B55u94O31qDfANHw.text: EAT IT or BEAT IT!  Coming from SoCal... Phil's BBQ is the standard. Guess what? This has taken the TOP SPOT for bbq in my books. UNBELIEVABLE. It's one thing for ribs to fall off the bone but this just falls and MELTS in your mouth. The beef rib... Wow. Rib tips are so amazing as well. And the corn fritter nuggets... WOW. This place is 6 stars if I could give it. Now each time I visit Vegas... This is a MUST MUST MUST!   EAT IT!!

h7hBaVelcf72ZDszpYNjTw.text: Great Atmosphere! Very BBQ place-ask. Usual wooden bleacher seat, communal seating (first come first serve, find your own seat! clean after yourself) A gentleman behind the host podium took orders was very courteous and took care of us well. Meat were so tender and juicy. Loved potato salad and waffle chips. House BBQ sauce went well with meat. Will be going back! Would be really great for football game day party trays! Yay!!!

WqUuydrzLq9iKNPFCvW2CA.text: Excellent barbecue and very reasonable priced. We really enjoyed the ribs. They were tender and very tasty

AK2KXnOY7bfDNhpmIUQgpQ.text: Great bbq! Many things to choose from. The owner was very friendly.  The food is worth the short wait!  A hidden bbq gem.

on1FNfTzOvuUP1JpRMWY3A.text: Ok again I'm going against the grain and sticking to what I know, good southern bbq! This place is ok but far from the mark. The beef ribs were too fatty, the pork ribs weren't fall off the bone and skimpy. The flavor was pure smoke only. No real sense of the bbq flavor. The yams were drenched in liquid sauce and couldn't mix it in so it ruined it for me. And sorry to say as I was excited for cobbler, but this is far from cobbler! Gosh this is making a trip down south seem overdue!  We called ahead our order and still waited a long time as they just said overwhelmed by orders. The little one wouldn't eat the ribs she was so excited for either. I so wanted to like this place so I can have a bbq place in town based on a lot of people's reviews but needless to say I'll keep on looking....

J3md3t2uPs3qfkdN0d1eMQ.text: Melt in your mouth BBQ.  It lived up to everything it was supposed to be.  I had the slider trio, and the pulled pork was AH MAZE ING.  I wish it had more pickles, but that's because I'm a pickle person.  It's a small place so make sure you grab a table while you can!  Food is quick, came out in about 10mins.  Plenty of big tables for larger groups.

CcEp8pLIqV7vH7m7Kmh4xQ.text: We catered for our job 4th of July party globalindustrial.com. Excellent food and service. Chef pants and Big mike came and set up everything up and served us. They were polite and fast. The ribs were tender and fell off the bone. This was my first time trying brisket and it was good. The chicken was smoked and juicy. It was seasoned. I didnt expect it to be good and it was. The mac and cheese was cheesy and good. The baked beans had a kick to it not to spicy and no where near bland. Next time u are looking for bbq check them out. Catered or go in...

bUrkgeYy1ueOVzyNP8DIjQ.text: Good BBQ but closed on Sunday and hard to get to.

ieoVz-brJoZOMXQhbqdmkg.text: I had the brisket, ribs, collard greens, bacon potato salad, and mac and cheese. All were incredible! The people who work there were a pleasure to meet. I'll certainly return with guests. Also, the sauces were fanflippingtastic (my favorite was this vinegar and the spicier sauce)!!

vGP0S02Kd9n9Oc_3m6Z6SA.text: I have been here a number of times now, and not once has this bbq let me down! The brisket and pork is always on point, the hardest part is picking what sides you want, there is a bunch and they are all amazing!  If you are looking for bbq in Vegas, this is where you need to come!

F0mc46F0_56f8PElLPpHxQ.text: This place is a little hole in the wall dice type place that was simply amazing!! The service was excellent and the food even better. I got the brisket, spare ribs and Mac N Cheese. All were excellent. Mac and cheese was my favorite. Everybody else with me said it was equally as amazing. My brother ordered the chop brisket sandwich with coleslaw, and cheese. He said it was amazing so when you order it that way ask for "the John". Overall excellent place and a must try in Vegas.

fXt4uREcxh2JOpOCO5J06w.text: The Beef ribs are awesome !! I had the combo-plate and still had food to take home. This is where you can get a real meal and get the best deal for your money.

LjyNUfBiJB02sGsrgALckw.text: Items Selected:  AYCE Plate 1 - Brisket, Pulled Pork, Spare Ribs, Corn Nuggets, Hush Puppies Banana Pudding Corn Bread AYCE Plate 2 - Beef Rib, Smoked Chicken, Smoked Meatloaf, Loaded Mashed Potato, Fried Onion Strings Peach Cobbler with Blue Bell Ice Cream  Having recently returned from a Lone Star State tour of smoked meat Meccas ranging from Black's and Snow's to Pecan Lodge and Franklin it was with modest expectations but high hopes that I approached Rollin Smoke, a space many locals and critics have hailed as the best barbeque in Las Vegas, and opting to explore the menu through a generous $24.99 all-you-can eat program I must say I walked away a (very full) believer.  Located on South Highland where outdoor smokers and burning hickory alert the senses to something more than industrial surroundings Rollin Smoke is as small and homey as many a' Texas or Kansas City 'cue spots and staffed by Razorback pitmaster Trey Holland plus a dedicated team of enthusiasts the service is every bit on par with that down south - a True love of the art noted in lengthy answers to questions about woods, temperatures, and process while simultaneously making sure every guest is content.  Featuring a diverse menu with spices and rubs harkening the style of BBQ found across the south but a bit more aggressively sweet than that in Texas it was with a trio of smoked meats, two must-order sides, and buttery cornbread that I began and although brisket was a bit drier than I'd prefer the smoke was prominent and flavor was on point - a trend extending to fatty ribs and supple pulled pork that lacked not for juices, the latter falling just short of KC's Oklahoma Joe's reference standard.  Still nibbling at the creamy corn nuggets as plate two arrived it was here that I sampled Holland's two most raved items and with a blackened caramelized crust overlying tender flesh and melted collagen the beef rib wowed just as much as the signature meatloaf, absolutely rife with hickory notes and light heat amidst a delicately packed beef.  Ignoring decent but mundane chicken and mac n' cheese I found inedibly bland compared to the rich potatoes and previous fried sides it was with a duo of desserts that I rounded out the tasting and suffice it to say that while banana pudding tastes straight from a box the focus should instead be directed to the cobbler, a bubbling bowl of soft peaches with buttery pie crust crowned with Texas' own Blue Bell vanilla - a perfect end to a pretty damned good meal by any standard.

R0W8IPav7C2aMNmLOUuB3g.text: I have been on the look out for outstanding BBQ in Las Vegas, and I finally found It!! I tried this place solely based on the yelp reviews, and you guys did not let me down!!  I went on a Saturday night around 8:30 pm. The parking lot was packed, the outside picnic tables were packed, and there was a line out the door. The line moved quickly & we ordered within 5 or so minutes.  The menu is huge, so it might be worth checking it out ahead of time. I ordered the Outlaw Burger with waffle fries, and my husband got the Duo plate with chicken & brisket. We, also, got a side of corn nuggets & a peach cobbler. With 2 drinks, everything came to $25.  You order at the counter, and seat yourself. Drinks & silverware are self serve. And, when your order is ready, they bring it to your table. While we were waiting, I observed a few people who were obvious regulars. Another good sign.  Every single item we ordered was excellent. The chicken was super moist and flavorful. The brisket had those delicious crispy pieces on the edges. Waffle fries were crispy and well seasoned. The peach cobbler was warm and gooey!! But, the rock star of our meal was definitely the Outlaw Burger. It. Was. Huge. Like 10" high huge!  When we were wrapping up our leftovers, they didn't have a lid for our cobbler...so they gave us a whole 2nd one to go. It was a little thing, but their service really impressed me.  We left super full, and already planning what we were going to order next time. I, also, like that they are open late since I'm a night owl.  If you like BBQ, you need to check this place out!

KwnyiSlxM6AsUKECYUTHsg.text: This was our first time going here to this restaurant which was really good. The burgers and brisket are highly recommended. Not too crispy and not too chewy, it was a great BBQ meal. To top it off, put the delicious barbecue sauce on it. The prices were not high either for such great tasting food. Service was quick and helpful. Overall a fantastic place for lunch or a group dinner.

w3y1btNaYnpxKSxpVatBTQ.text: We had the pleasure of dining at Rolling Smoke BBQ this afternoon, taking a break between watching college basketball games we decided to pop in to this outstanding restaurant. It's located on Highland near the Sahara exit and the 15, close to the Las Vegas Strip. We were greeted by the friendly staff and two of us decided to try the all you can eat option which basically gave us the opportunity to eat anything and everything from the menu for $34.99. Starting with 3 meats and two sides and then two meats and one side on all subsequent orders. If you want good BBQ at reasonable prices, and friendly service I highly recommend you try this place. It's not fancy and you may have a decent wait in line to order but the food is delicious. The burnt ends, baby back ribs, pulled pork, rib tips and brisket were our favorites. The chicken, hot links and fried shrimp also received high marks. As far as the side orders, we all loved the corn nuggets and Mac and cheese, however everything was awesome! The desserts included banana pudding, blueberry cobbler and root beer floats! Our sincere compliments to the entire crew of Chef Damon, Chef Christian, Moises, Brenda, Lizelle and James Monticello who went above and beyond to make our experience so awesome! Keep up the great work Rolling Smoke BBQ! We will be back and wholeheartedly recommend this hidden gem!

UMXobHygk2E3fZ_j8F528Q.text: BEST RIBS EVER!   Everything else we had ranged from: OK to very good. But the ribs are truly something special. I've eaten tons of BBQ in my life and I can say without a doubt that Rollin' Smoke has the best ribs I've ever eaten. Kudos!

YThH24isIzzFoXd5cJZotw.text: This place is the truth. I came here with my family after reading the reviews on yelp. It's in the same neighborhood as a number of strip clubs so be prepared to explain if the kids have questions. There were a lot of choices but I went with the brisket dog. It's a giant all beef hot dog topped with brisket, onion straws, and nacho cheese. This thing didn't mess around. It was big, messy, and delicious! It was a little bit spicy but not overpowering. My wife had the baked potato and she loved it. My son had the sliders and they were bigger than expected and he loved them too. My wife recommends the corn nuggets. I had one and they were great! The decor was fitting for a barbecue joint with benches and picnic tables. The wait wasn't long and I enjoyed myself. I highly recommend it.

5EljFKeZWMuJ-ynh3HbIEw.text: Great BBQ joint! The staff was very friendly (cashier even introduced himself and shoot my hand after ordering!) and the food is great! As you get out of your car you can instantly smell the smoke that goes into making the food so good! The ordering process was easy and my food was quickly delivered. The meats are smoked to perfection and the sauce to is due for! I would highly recommend this place, and I'll be back again for sure!

0X5Vo-Iah7SW31MrVLdNNQ.text: Went to the New Pawn Star location - Nice Place - Great Staff and Good Barbecue which for this southern girl is hard to find in Las Vegas .  And you must try the Mac and Cheese

Gd108R5UWVfv8Up1ROeWqA.text: My favorite spot to eat in Vegas. Highly recommended if your a BBQ fanatics like myself or working on a empty stomach this is definitely the place to go!

pqBTrqU-ryX5kiPqZLzswA.text: We were excited to find out about the new location by Flamingo and the 215 so we headed over. Got there just in time, they close early (8:00) so don't miss out. Of course I had to over do it and do the "all you can eat" and it was fricken awesome!!! I didn't eat again for almost 24 hours.  the staff was fantastic! Donovan took great care of us. He's a great guy they're lucky to have him.

ZD1Gt4a-FNBX-VWDcIDaow.text: I'm not into leaving reviews for places that I go to, but WOW. This place was without a doubt the best bbq I've ever had. If you are visiting from out of town, I definitely recommend taking the time out of your trip to stop by

cJqkSvWQE-ywLHV72fOoUw.text: Great find during a quick stop in Las Vegas. Affordable, quick and excellent. Stopped by around 9 on a Saturday night. Family of 4 shared the 4 meat plate. Added a side of corn nuggets, they were amazing! Good Mac and cheese. Loaded Mashed Potatoes are to die for.

YLhxBPj-oZFlNyGrU4x3Ng.text: Stellar BBQ, solid pricing, and huge portions made the trip to Rollin Smoke worth every red cent. Tried the full slab of Beef Ribs, Rib Tips, and 10 piece Wings. The Beef Ribs were like freakin' brontosaurus bones. Huge ribs, tons of meat, perfect bark, excellent charred rub, and juicy as all get out. Perfect combo of meat and fat, and a sure gut buster considering the slab consists of only four ribs. One order of chicken wings was similar to that of about two full chickens. Served as five pieces, but each is dished up as a whole wing and drum. Judging by the size, the chickens are prehistoric, much like those rearing the beef ribs (freaking monsters). The Rib Tips were fine...great sauce, rub, perfectly smoked and charred. Served as 8 pieces, it was a filler-upper like everything else. GO THERE HUNGRY! You'll absolutely be impressed with what's coming out of Rollin's smoker!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full Slab Beef Ribs, 1/2 lb Rib Tips

fm0jXi9KKbLPi5LqT20_Hg.text: What a great little gem located under the freeway over pass. Just a block away fron the fashion mall. We love good BBQ and we were not disappointed here. Because we had a big lunch earlier, my husband and i shared a 3 meat plate and ordered 2 extra sides. Loved the corn nuggets! It was the perfect amount of food for us. The brisket was cooked to perfection with a nice smokey flavor. We loved the ribs and the pulled pork was melt in your mouth good. The owner came out and welcomed us and insisted on giving us a free dessert (banana cream pie!!!). We also got a tour of the kitchen/smokers. He was like a proud papa and happy to answer our questions and show us around.  We will definitely come back to this joint. Thank you fellow yelpers, we wouldn't have found this place without you.

P--AHxhNZ7GEohiGxbsvcQ.text: Umm.. Am I missing something?! A friend of mine posted a picture on facebook with a caption justifying how good this place is. Like a typical Yelper I checked out the reviews immediately after seeing his post. I was impressed that they have so many reviews and 4 1/2 stars average rating, you really can't beat that. To be quite honest and I hate to put it this way but Rollin' Smoke is meritocracy at it's finest. My friend and I shared the pit special with brisket, pulled pork, chicken and ribs with sides of fried onions, mac n cheese and corn bread. We also ordered banana pudding for desert. I hate to say it, but my favorite part of the meal was the fried onions.. Yah, sad I know? The ribs were pretty tasty, but everything else was kind of blah. I can't really go into detail, maybe because it wasn't that good to me or memorable. Maybe it was a bit too authentic for my liking or the possibility they BBQ theirs Arkansas style. I'm only guessing the owners of this BBQ joint are from Arkansas considering they have University of Arkansas memorabilia around the place.  I tried a BBQ place out last week and I would definitely choose them over Rollin' Smoke. I was not a fan of the sauce either, to the point I scraped it off ribs. The prices here are pretty reasonable, so I can't complain about that. The inside of the restaurant is really rough around the edges, but maybe that's the vibe they are going for? To add to that, the restaurant is the oddest place one could think of. Pretty sketchy in some ways, but that doesn't turn customers away considering there was a good amount of people eating there on a Tuesday night. I was really expecting a lot from this place, but I should of ordered the cat fish like I originally planned?

GwjF0t1Rfkeop2hW4uUM8w.text: I have ate at many Barbecue places all over the country and Rolling Smoke competes with them at a very tasteful pleasure. The sauce is great, I usually get the pulled pork or the trio plate and I must say is very tasteful.  The potato salad and macaroni and cheese is too die for.  Very well blended and hits the right spots on the tongue.  Oh and you have to try the beans!!! The best beans I have tasted. The downside since there from Arkansas, they should know about Sweet Tea....which, when they first opened, there tea was very good but then they contracted with Coke and they supplied them with there version of Sweet Tea, which in my opinion they need to stick to Cola.  So all in all, skip McDonald's take the drive and head over to Highland drive and get your tongue ready for the best barbecue in Vegas.

UnZnVElRCcef3mXOgt2xkg.text: The food is good but their customer service is HORRIBLE!!! I had not one.. but two very rude female workers when I went to pick up my food today.

SVzIxQ8EI4wxEhhoyxXTBw.text: Pulled piggy sandwich was awsome!.. ordered and it was out in 5 min. Sad i ate so fast i forgot to take a picture. The sauce was purrrfect. Cole slaw was ehh. Baked beans were ok.

QdcB921BWcfxSHFb2GSAjw.text: Wanted to try a bbq while in Vegas. I used to go to Ellis Island but this place is soo much better and probably a better deal. We got there no problem with the GPS. I was worried that the place would be crowded since I was dinner time but we just beat the rush.  The plan was to order the "pit special" 4 meats and 3 sides. We got burnt ends, pulled pork, quarter chicken, spare ribs, one beef rib, corn nuggets, loaded smashed potato and bacon potato salad. Everything came out in about 3 minutes which was great since I was starving. The burnt ends were delicious the pulled pork a little dry, the chicken breast was moist since most times chicken breast is dry. I tried the spare ribs and my was I surprised they were the best tasting spare rib I ever had. Great smoke and tender. Not hanging off the bone but still on and but so tender and flavorful and it came off the bone with a bite. The beef rib for me was no disappointment either. Big moist and the same as the pork ribs. They were a little fat but that's the way I like them. Probably too fat for some but that is where the flavor is. Corn nuggets were good and the other sides were average. I would definitely be back next time in town.

Qod0-t9NHmBLexgA48cKqg.text: Best bbq in Las Vegas! The beans are the bomb. The sauces are all homemade and phenomenal.

OIWlw6LVKNUXWVa0DXOp-Q.text: I came here for the 4th and my family and I really enjoyed Rollin smokes BBQ !! The meat fell off the bone and We were so stuffed we couldn't even move. Definitely the place to eat if you want A1 BBQ in Las Vegas !!

OujltxjuM3MaKmDeNnwPnw.text: Might be the best BBQ I've had, but im from the midwest. I love the sides and sauces, especially the collard greens and baked beans. The atmosphere sets the place apart as well. Plenty of space to sit outside.

b2EZ3FF67c7mu5-fmUN_rg.text: Tonight was a good night for new culinary experiences. After watching the new Maleficent movie and having a few glasses of wine, we decided to make our way to Rollin Smoke. I have heard nothing but great things about this place. After checking Yelp, I noticed their 4.5 star overall rating with about 500 reviews. OH-EM-GEE, how have NOT been to this place yet?!?!  It's not surprise, this place is in the middle of an industrial area, right under the freeway and next to all the strip clubs. Sketchy as heck, but holy smoker in their parking lot! The aroma of smoked meats filled the air. I didn't care what the outside looked like, I was more interested in what they had to offer! The inside of the joint is a down home BBQ joint! Different reds and yellows adorn the wall, different rooms to accommodate different types of parties. They have a few rooms and even outside space. There were metal table tops, wooden benches, TVs in each room and a mirage on the back wall of the room we chose to dine in.On every table there was a bottle of their homemade BBQ sauce. It was more of a vinegar base, a little too tangy but that's just my own taste. The staff was super efficient. The guy who took my order, I think was one of the owners. He was super personable and really seemed to care about how things were going, how I liked my food and really thanked me for coming in. For my meal, I wanted to try a few things. Here's what I got:  Half slab of beef ribs, 2 bones, for $15.99. This Smokin Plate came with a side, I chose collard greens, corned bread or roll and a drink. The beef ribs were the best beef ribs I've ever had! It literally just fell off the bone, no joke. The rub they used brought so much flavor to the rib! Every bite was juicy, flavorful and packed with smokey goodness. The collard greens were cooked with brisket, had a little spice and vinegar and so good!  Pulled piggy sandwich for $7.99. **There's a Yelp special when you check in** Every sandwich purchase comes with a free dessert. I chose the peach cobbler (usually for $3.99). The pulled pork sandwich was made with chopped pork, not finely shredded. I loved that because the meat had some depth to it. It was served on a hot dog bun which was different but seemed to work! The corn bread side was buttery and moist, probably the best corn bread I've ever had! I made a comment that my grandma's corn bread was unbelievable but this one gave my grandma's bread a run for it's money (Sorry grandma!).  As my free dessert, the peach cobbler was gooey and filled with chunks of peaches.   I must say, this is THE BEST BBQ joint in Las Vegas, hands down. I've had a few BBQ joints here before but nothing compares to Rollin Smoke. This place really does a great job at serving great food. When I'm here, it's just good ole country fun. Looking around the dining area, every party seemed to have a huge smile on their face. I've been to lots of places down south, from Nashville, to Louisville, to Charlotte. BBQ joints different where every go but when you're in Las Vegas, you REALLY need to get your butts down here. You will NOT be disappointed!

UXl-NDZ2uZznQBWvr9SMVw.text: Oh my gosh I am mad I didn't know about this place sooner! Everything was amazing! If you are in the mood for BBQ and don't really need the "dining" experience that Lucille's or famous Dave's provides this is the place to come! They are by far better then both!  The gentleman taking the orders was helpful to is first timers, funny and knowledgable!  The food comes out quick so if you are in a hurry you won't wait long.  I truly enjoyed everything we ordered - pulled pork, spare ribs, chicken, brisket, cheezy Mac and cheese, kicking beans and waffle fries. In saying that I do need to reiterate how delicious the waffle fries were. Normally when I think waffle fry I think slightly soggy. These were far far far from that in fact they were so crispy that I think you could cut paper with them.

fDFPsVdNNyKuVpvrvjizyg.text: This is a neat place to eat.  It can get packed during lunch.  Glad they added additional space when we were last there.    You can smell the delicious aroma from the street.  My wife is vegetarian and has a limited amount of choices but she loves the corn nuggets.  Request that they rub extra sauce on them.
