YhM5LlOHG_ObvYP90X6a2w.text: We found this restaurant on Yelp while enjoying our Las Vegas weekend.  Brought 3 discerning friends and we all agreed it was very great BBQ, with large portions of meat and fries. Super friends staff and very fast service.  I highly recommend you visit them and enjoy their great meals!

9JCi9vpMiaea0qR73KYuEw.text: Sooo delicious....hush puppies are full of flavor and a little kick. The chicken, brisket, ribs...yummmm. staff is nice. When my mom is not around, I come here for BBQ!

FScKlvqrygivNt7JcdPL5g.text: If I could give this place 10 stars I would!! The best BBQ ever...the service is excellent and the food was even better. I will come here every time I am in Vegas. The brisket, the ribs, the corn bits, the mac n cheese, the burgers, the meatloaf...we tried everything we could and I will be back for more. It was awesome that the guy at the register asked where I was from and knew who their competition was in San Diego (I wont say any names) and claimed that I would love Rollin' better than them and he was right!!

9KqVg4j8KzWl33wAl7pdEw.text: On vacation for a few days. I went there the first night I arrived, and then the next night, and the next. you get the idea. The first night I had the pulled piggy. It was awesome sauce and I ate it too fast so then I ordered the chicken nacho fries. Put me to sleep. While I had the fries someone else ordered the Outlaw burger, at that moment I knew I was coming back. The next day I had the Outlaw Burger and the 3rd day I went with the all you can eat. And with a free dessert with the Yelp check in..Child Please!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onions galore!

D7N35trsYekwi8K1GSEpsg.text: I want to write a review where I describe "how I love putting meat in my mouth", but I'm seriously too full and happy to be witty.  Plain and simple, the brisket and pulled pork were delicious.  They come pretty sauce-less.  Don't fuck it up by throwing 2 gallons of BBQ sauce on them, kids.  I mean, the sauce is legit, but the flavor of the smoke in the meat is amazing.  The jalapeno slaw wasn't super jalapeno-y, which is good.  You could tell there was a kick, but it didn't overpower it.  The greens would have made Popeye's eyeballs explode.  Mine were boss-level.  I do dig greens, though, so I might be biased...  All in all, 6 meals for my coworkers for $77, plus tip, was definitely worth it.

RqXPjnItwngILVvkF7Ipjw.text: Working in kitchens most of my life, ive been exposed to bbq from memphis, texas, north carolina, ect. This place is okay. The service was fast, food came out quick, but it just fell flat. Brisket was dry and along with pulled pork, you gotta coat it in sauce just to get it down. Ribs and chicken were good, great smoke flavor on both but 30 minutes later you still have a smokey taste in your mouth (usually indicates usage of liquid smoke). Hot link was mediocre. Mac and cheese lacked seasoning and needed more cheese in the sauce, slaw was good and the beans were also nice. Overall it was a disappointment. Save yourself some money and go to roadkill grill, better bbq, well seasoned food and lower prices.

7Qijl0ddHX3wxfQBHiiZHg.text: Some of the best low-and-slow smoked BBQ we've had anywhere. This is the real deal. Rollin Smoke is so good at smoking their meat that they slice their brisket on the thick side, but the slices are still perfectly tender. It takes some serious smoking talent to be able to pull that off.   We tried their smoked meatloaf (with brisket in the meatloaf mix), spare ribs, brisket, and pulled pork. All were fantastic. Sides we tried were greens and mac-and-cheese, and it was clear they take pride in their sides as well.   This is a small place in a small strip-mall off the Vegas strip just east of the I-15 freeway. If you blink while driving by you might miss it. You order at a podium then go find a seat and they bring your food out to you. We were there at 4:30 PM on a Tuesday and there was no wait and ample seating available, but it's easy to see how Rollin Smoke might get very crowded and seating might be hard to come by during peak times. Parking might be challenging during peak times as well.   The prices they charge for their food represent an exceptional value in a tourist town like Las Vegas. For the price of a fancy appetizer on the strip you can have a 3-meat platter with a side and a drink. What a find!

fnNLLudgay7S_RAHdDWkWw.text: I was searching for a great BBQ place since moving here and I have found it! This is a staple place that I take all my visiting friends and family. Danny, the host, always takes care of things and you can really tell the people that work there enjoy working together! As a matter of fact, I'll be taking a friend the tonight to show what Las Vegas has to offer.

3-p0XVxt2jkjUjAEKL9BJQ.text: I've been to this place a few times in the last couple years. I'm a local but it's far from my house so only on occasion. I got the beef brisket sandwich and my wife got the Spudtastic(which is the equivalent size to a small baby). Everything was very good as usual. The meat and sauces are fantastic. I've also notice they've remodeled a little since my last visit. This place is excellent, come check it out.

ynr_LguKTQKIun-DepnwCw.text: This place was amazing. Excellent food and service. Restaurant isn't fancy and not in the best location but the food is so worth it. If you want the best bbq then ear here. Chef Tim was awesome and the staff  was willing to stay late because people kept coming in for food. Tim kept his doors open past the closing time. Love this place and so did my 8 yr old son. Two thumbs up. Slap yo mamma good.

w14Li4MKfqFlW9aWKAR8Xg.text: The Best BBQ in Las Vegas! It was amazing.I had the baby back ribs and I have to say I wanted to go to the back and kiss the chef. Very meaty very delish!!!! I will be returning!

1kVJQF6lefRwhzEc3-uNmQ.text: Everything was absolutely delicious here. The prices were reasonable for the amount of food you get as well.  Loved that they made meatloaf out of their brisket!

8AY_6-KkAmdEP3i3aFyAtQ.text: This is the BEST BBQ place in Vegas by far. Outstanding service and Team Smoke makes you feel at home! Must visit!!

cY2QeCKWyOua3clPz0KWyA.text: A friend told me about this place.  Let me start with - everything I ate was excellent.  All good cuts of meat, flavor, sauce, etc.  I had the corn fritters and potato salad as sides and both were perfect.  Their prices are very fair for what you get.  The service was top notch with about 3 people asking me if everything was good.  Unless you are maybe an ultra bbq snob, you will love this place if you love bbq.  This is a place I will definitely remember when I am in town again.  The only downside is that it is in the industrial area of town, and even that really doesn't matter.  The food does.  6 stars.

2UcejXOZ0uUVANYo7dNYBA.text: Yep, I'm in love. Lived up to the hype. Soo tasty. I don't know how this place slipped under my radar for so long but the food is amazing.

ksuTAXOET_0nhMyHHyKtEA.text: Hands down the best BBQ in town,, I am a southern girl transplanted in Vegas.............. I know my southern BBQ and this is the only TRUE southern Q in town.. Price is right... Its not fancy but its perfect

0eUkAfvKJ216xNMziD6pJQ.text: My quest for excellent non-chain restaurants continues, and finding this one was a happy accident.  There are large smokers in the parking lot which is originally what drew our attention to the place.  Usually we find our gems from Yelp, but this time it was a drive-by (or I should say that I find places on Yelp as the bf is in the food industry and like many industry people has a baseless grudge against Yelp).    Since i am not a huge meat eater what I really care about are the sides.  The sides were amazing.  Which is great because a lot of times at BBQ places the focus is on the meat only and the sides are kind of an after thought.  The peach cobbler was insanely good.  And I have been dreaming about the loaded mashed potatoes since I had them.  I also had the mac n cheese.  The waiter (who I assume is also one of the owners since he thanked us about 20 times for coming in) recommended the mac n cheese.  Listen if you can't execute a delicious mac n cheese you should throw yourself off a bridge.  It's macaroni, cheese, cream and bake.  It was really good but I was more impressed with the other sides that are nonstandard and were amazing.  On my next visit I plan on trying the banana pudding.      It does have its advantages and disadvantages, depending on who you are.  It is right down the street from the Rhino - a disadvantage to me, but an advantage to any dirt-bags.  The parking lot is kind of sketchy, again a disadvantage to me, but like home to dirt-bags.  The BBQ sauce is really peppery.  I personally like milder sauces and I am not a big meat eater, but I could still appreciate the execution of the sauce and that it was made in house.  I am not used to eating smoked meat so was a little concerned that the chicken looked pink, but the bf explained to me that that is how smoked meat should look that has actually been smoked in a smoker and not just marinated in smoke "flavor".  All the meat was very tender, but the sauce was a little too intense for me.  That being said I was more than happy to stick with the sides.

mhku_OvHSI4gHHFPnApazQ.text: First of all, I am not a connoisseur of barbecue, so don't take this too seriously. I got a small order of ribs and they were good, but not out of this world, and I thought expensive. I believe I paid $16 for 3-4 ribs and a drink. The place is very crowded and you wait in line to order. I went there with friends who wanted to try it. Everyone was satisfied with their meals, but no one was, like, over the moon. If you are a rib fanatic, this might be the place for you, but otherwise I wouldn't go out of my way.

tuQ-qcrmL-KOVaUkC6_GSw.text: Definitely gotta sit down there and eat.  They rub their meets and my wife loves this flavor of bbq. she doesn't like sweet meats so she usually doesn't like bbqs but this one she does love.    You definitely have to try this at least once

Vni6MPOS4nWug5wQo8tgEw.text: Best BBQ in the west and I'm originally from Kansas city! The beef ribs are big and meaty like Flintstones. The customer service is always excellent. The servers and owners always say hello make sure you're happy and have everything you need. Go early on busy days or holidays. They can run out of certain items they cook one batch per day

nFP5bdYE1eMAcUj6FRbhTQ.text: So good. Loved it. Anyone visiting vegas needs to visit this place. Every time we go the quality is the same. Excellent. The staff checks on you to see if you are ok.

yRYgqeeq2OlrmXntDP0oqQ.text: Right in the curve go too fast and you'll miss it....you order first and they bring it to you....ok I had the bbq sundae omg it was great all the wonderful flavors just melted in my mouth....it comes in about a 24 oz cup clear so you can see the layers I chose brisket add my meat oh my my....bottom is potatoe salad it had jalapenos and u think bacon then beans with links then brisket then top it all off with coleslaw can't beat that for $8. My bf food was a little cold so free banana pudding!!!

XYy-M3wk0WqiD3kzegCP9Q.text: This was my first time here and will definitely be back. My group ordered the brisket, chicken, pulled pork, hot links, spare ribs, beef ribs and baby back ribs. Everything we had was cooked perfectly and absolutely delicious! I highly recommend the bacon potato salad and Mac & Cheese sides.

siHQBG3HkEriiB1cUCqSUg.text: After reading Misti's review we couldn't wait to try Rollin Smoke! The waif of smoky goodness starts to hit about a 1/4 mile from the parking lot, which btw looks pretty barren, except for the sign that mentions YELP and you know you are in the right place.  Simple, reasonable and downright southern style bbq, all was awesome. Staff was super friendly and educated us newbies. Had the sampler of pork, hot link and brisket.... mmmm mmmm good. The jalapeno chipolte laced slaw as well as the hot link sausage were great and packed some substantial heat. Hubby has the rib sampler plate and couldn't finish it was so loaded.   Just an old fashioned joint, order, come as you are and sit yourself down place to eat some great Q.

r-XprhduAnRsheMI-N2iDw.text: Very good.   You get a lot of food (can share portions-and this is advised).  I would recommend just getting platters (no sandwiches-bread will stuff you even more). If you visit Vegas and want barbecue-go here.

I3S6EgGahAEJb7CEipH6fA.text: I've been here twice now and both times have been delicious. The corn nuggets are amazing as well as the Mac n cheese. Waffle fries are great too. Baked beans are "meh" and the coleslaw is pretty spicy. This is the only place in Vegas that makes sweet tea the way it should be, extra syrupy and sweet. The pulled pork is on point but last night it was served cold. I guess maybe that's just the way they have it, I don't know, but still very delicious. Now the only reason I deducted a star is because I absolutely LOVE ribs, last time I came I got the St. Louis spare ribs which were dry and disappointing, and this time I got the "world famous" beef ribs which were also dry but very fatty and just not good. Not only that it was $18.99 for a half slab which is only 2 pieces, kinda pricey IMO. But they do give locals discounts which makes up for it. Next time I go I'm going to try to baby backs, but if those don't impress then I'm going to be really sad because everyone says amazing things about the ribs!

51j0Ns1h_eMwXBxZe0sU7A.text: Decent BBQ. Not going to say it blew me away but it was pretty solid. Nice humble spot just off the strip and away from all the crazy. The baby back ribs were tender and not too fatty - nice smoke ring in the meat. Wish I had tried the burnt ends but there is only so much you can do in one visit!

BKV59SFbUqde85o1F67mfg.text: Husband is a big fan of BBQ. So, I came along with him to this joint. I personally thought the food was below average like a lot worse than The franchise DICKIES that we have in California.   I HAD the lemon pepper chicken wings and had the dirty rice. I also tried the brisket and beans... Which all were not quite good. The wings had waaaaay too much lemon pepper seasoning and the dirty rice was not anything special.   I gave zero stars to the food but service was on point so I gave a two star for that.

qSctObA9XfU7fXjPi4F62A.text: If you are in Vegas you have to come to this place potato salad with bacon BBQ ribs everything on this menu was absolutely delicious

ZTHGYE6CX60dQIrnIdsybQ.text: Delicious!!!! Everything on the Pit special was good!!! 5 meats, 3 sides...can't go wrong with that!

Me2CsCnjMoyZb3H4CHQ1Dg.text: This was truly the best BBQ I have ever had and that includes numerous stops in throughout Texas, Kansas City, and the Carolinas. The Burnt Ends were indescribably excellent. The Baked Beans were perfect and the Brisket melted in your mouth. Nothing that was served required sauce. I did try their original BBQ Sauce and it was very good!    Be prepared to pay cash. When we went in on 22 July, their credit card system was not working,  but they had someone there working on it.   This place is a little hard to find, but absolutely make the effort to get there if you are A BBQ fan.

VZKaeKePQDW-vjj2cs93sA.text: Wasn't all that great to me. Place was really busy. Friendly folks.  Flavor was just meh. Nothing to bring me back another time.

Fd-Iy5HXIgmUVgbL9PioVw.text: WOW! So I was really surprised by this place....  I originally wrote it off because it is a BBQ place in the middle of the desert. If I want BBQ I typically pick it up when I am on business in Texas and South Carolina.   Well let me be the first to say...I WAS WRONG! This place is the real deal!   The BURNT ENDS! That is all I have to say...  All the food is delicious, but certain things on the menu are MIND-BLOWING! (Burnt ends, beef ribs, pulled pork)

cNVf0VoKkg-eq1jDOg4TUw.text: A delicious BBQ place, the portion is definitely worth the price. We had the trio plate which came with 3 choices of meat, 1 side, and a drink for $13. We chose the brisket, pork, and pork ribs. It came smothered in their BBQ sauce, which is slightly tangy and spicy. The pork ribs is the best out of the three...moist and tender; the meat literally falls off the bone. The brisket was a bit dry and the pulled pork was ok, just cover them in BBQ sauce and it'll be fine.   As for the sides, the mac and cheese was super cheesy, and the coleslaw has a spicy kick to it. The coleslaw helps give a taste variety to the richness of the meats. Definitely worth coming back the next time I'm in Vegas.

RA7h2FqDSWxaALQPaifLyw.text: The first time we left the strip on our Vegas strip was to hit up this joint.  The moment our Uber driver dropped us off we were like "I didn't know Las Vegas has a Compton".  The area is near the freeway underpass with a few homeless people that were probably previous high rollers.  I know because I lost $80 and felt like I on the cusp of feeling homeless myself.  We walked in and noticed we were the only Asians.  This is unusual since we've never felt like this living in San Ho.  If something were to go down I know their Ghetto Fu is no match for my martial art skills.  Besides, all these guys probably has clogged arteries anyways so I proceeded to order some food to share with my girl.    We ordered the brisket and beef ribs with a side of their potato salad.  The brisket was quite dry and my clothes had more of smoke ring from the casino than the meat.  The beef rib, although quite large and meaty was also quite fatty and only slightly better.  I just doused it in their BBQ sauce and called it good.  Surprisingly the best part of the meal was actually their potato salad.  It was creamy and topped with plenty of crispy bacon bits.  Not quite representative of the Yelp 4.5 star experience that I expected.  It's about as good as BBQ from a cafeteria.

eqvki9z6KzuV3gOP4Cn3xQ.text: Over 2500 reviews with an average of 4.5 stars, I knew I had to bookmark and check this place out while we were in Vegas!  The fiance and I love good BBQ places and saw that Rollin Smoke Barbeque has beef ribs, not that common where we're from so we knew we had to splurge and substitute for them! We opted for the trio choice of 3 meats: beef ribs, spare ribs & brisket (sliced instead of chopped). This was $17.99 + $6 sub for the beef ribs & it came with cornbread and a side - we chose the bacon potato salad.   Our food came out super quick and was a big portion, definitely enough for 2 people. The bacon potato salad was so good! The beef rib (only one rib) was disappointing because it was immensely fatty and the brisket (~5 pcs) was even worse because it was sooooo dry. Brisket is supposed to be tender with an amazing smoke ring but theirs failed at both. The spare ribs (2 pcs) were good but didn't fall off the bone. I liked the bbq sauce, not super thick like some places. Corn bread was meh, if you like light and cake-like then this is for you. I like mine super crispy at the top.   The location was kinda sketchy and in the middle of no where it felt like. There are some communal tables out front and two small rooms inside with a handful of tables. I feel like this was just average for me. Phil's BBQ is still my favorite on the west coast!

o8pGEPrgI8nsIGMoUQcTwg.text: As first-timers, we pulled into an industrial neighborhood and wondered if this was going to be a hit, or a miss as far as restaurants go... The staff is friendly and helpful as we tried to decide which of the smoky meats to try. They explained their favorites, which are popular with customers, what's unique and which combos would give us a real introduction to the restaurant.  The decor is clean and simple, but Rollin is about the Que, and they bring it! We visited before the lunch rush on a Saturday and the other customers were all locals. There were several catering orders getting ready to go and the quality of the food looked and smelled great! Each order was meticulously double-checked before being loaded up for delivery-a sign of how the business is run!  Our food was served quickly, at the correct temperature. There are several styles of bbq sauce if you prefer vinegary or tomato based, spicy or sweet. The corn nuggets are crunchy and creamy, unique and delicious! The brisket was smoky and unctuous. The chicken moist and the pork had a rich crust from the smoker and was still moist. The meal was huge and fairly priced.  We will be back every time we're in Vegas and if Rollin' Smoke decides to open a restaurant at the beach, I'll be the first in line!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The BBQ is delish and the corn nuggets are crunchy AND creamy (and yummy).

7NAoK1zvscWHcT_yDTh0HQ.text: I visited this place last week, and overall it's amazing. I found about this place from a Stricly Dumpling (Mikey Chen) video on the all you can eat BBQ for $36. That price includes every single thing on the menu. No joke, you can get a burger to burnt ends. The burger and meat loaf is well known, but I stuck to the basics on my trip. That said, during his video the food look amazing, so I had to check it out when I was in town.  For starters, I didn't do the all you can eat, but got the 5 meat platter. I got  2 Ribs, brisket, pork, sausage, and burnt ends in place of the Chicken. It came with three sides including mac and cheese, green beans, and corn nuggets. Before I go into the meats, the sides are amazing. The mac and cheese is rich. The corn nuggets are deep fried to a nice crunch, and are sweet. And the green beans are stir fried in garlic and a little oil. My dad got the baked beans, and they are also good. Overall the sides are amazing.   The meats themselves, overall top notch. Personally the weakest link for me was the burnt ends, but I have had some of the best in KC that had a more smokey flavor that I haven't found anywhere else, so it's my bias opinion. They are still very good, but not the best on the plate for me. The best by far was the brisket and ribs. The rub they use for the brisket really stands out, and the flavor from how long they cook it was amazing. The ribs itself were really good with it's own rub, and they were very tender and flavorful. Right after that the pork and sausage stood out well. The sausage had a nice snap, and it had a good spice and kick to it. Nothing too spicy, but noticeable, and the smoke flavor stood out here. Finally, the pork was good. It was a tad dry for my taste, but roasted pork is very hard, and considering how it was likely 2 pounds of meats, possibly more, with 3 sides for less than 30 bucks, then I can't complained at all.  Overall this is easily a solid BBQ place that can hold up in BBQ cities like KC, or St. Louis. I'm originally from MO and have visited both, and I won't consider myself a BBQ expert, but I've had my fair share of well known BBQ places. This place can hold it's own easily, and the price point is one of the best I've ever seen. If you are in Vegas, or a new local who hasn't been here yet, check it out.

D6eauNA7jVZRQNyBBXTvTA.text: We had a single serving of Rib Ends, a pint serving of corn nuggets and two root beer floats. The Rib Ends were marinaded with flavorful BBQ sauce and the smoke flavoring had a sweet smell that was not overwhelming. Corn nuggets were filling, crunchy and tasty. Great combo for family of three. The staff made us feel very welcomed. Smiles and candid personalities make our dining experience wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome root beer floats!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Store front of Rollin Smoke Barbeque

IDuWYL0C79fLce24_dRP4g.text: If you love BBQ, then this is definitely a place to try at least once. I don't come here often as it's not that close to where I live, but always enjoy myself and the food whenever I am in the area and am able to stop in and get me something delicious to eat.   I usually will get the Outlaw burger. It is a hamburger mixed with brisket, onions, bell pepper, topped with onion strings, red cabbage slaw, lettuce, tomato, cheddar cheese and a chipotle aioli. This monster of a burger costs $13.99 and worth every penny.  I usually make this a combo for an extra $4.   Other great items on their menu are their Club Wrap, BBQ wrap (I didn't see this on their menu anymore, but was told they'll still make it for you), ribs, chopped brisket sandwich, The Spudtastic, bacon potato salad, fried okra, loaded mashed potatoes, mac n cheese and more. There is definitely something for everyone   They have lots of seating from in the main area when you first enter to another whole room and benches outside. This place gets busy and crowded, so if you aren't there at opening, you may need to take your food to go.   Employees are all very friendly.

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NN4-DJqtL8_ihG16hPgukA.text: Frustrating! Frustrating! Frustrating!  We're here in Vegas again and wanted Rollin Smoke BBQ since it's now on our Must Have list. We placed a Yelp Delivery Order which included some of the fantastic sides we had before. Unfortunately, the order was delivered without one of the sides. I contacted the restaurant directly hoping the side can be delivered on the driver's next outing but they directed me to contact Yelp Fulfilled by Grubhub directly. After calling them, they contacted the driver who didn't have it and said their only remedy is to refund us for the missing item. Quite disappointing since we were really looking forward to another wonderful Rollin Smoke experience. Food was alright. Delivery was not. I assume this is the fault of the restaurant since it wasn't included in the delivery. So beware. If you want to make sure your order is correct, visit the restaurant in-person.

And it didnt disappoint.  Saw pictures of the beef ribs from an earlier review so thats what i wanted.   Just as big and juicy as the other reviews.   Full slab for $35.  Was too full to try the sides.    Lots of choices for drinks.   I left feeling like i should have smuggled some on tge plane ride home.   Definitrly will stop again on my next trip.

TcoW1tfIv-LNKnVHgJxF3w.text: Delicious! My favorites were the loaded mash; it's like a twice baked without the skin. The corn bread was sweet, hot and flavorful- I could have eaten a whole pan. Would have loved a more melt in your mouth brisket but the flavor was still good. Ribs were melt in your mouth amazing. I tried 3 different bbq sauce- none of the spicy because I'm a wimp like that. Kids would have been better off having only fries but they're picky- not the restaurants fault. Idk if it's been said before but don't sit down waiting for your order to be taken, didn't happen. We had to go to the counter to order. Attentive friendly staff is always a plus. I'd make a point to come back if I ever find myself in Vegas again

K_SnnP5FjY1ZLAGYRAFRag.text: Small restaurant with large side eating areas. Had the loaded baked potato but wished I didn't. Lots of chili on it and it drowned out the small amount of barbecue meat. My friend had a sandwich with a couple of meat choices on the side, and he thought the meat was tender and tasty.   Sit in the smaller room nearest to restaurant or outside on a nice day. We sat in a large overflow area and it was just a huge room with some TV and restrooms, with no real ambiance.

Cz9XFvW8nvRFnwU_Q62S4A.text: Best in town, tried many places and by far they are the most consistent from location to location. Ribs are and so are the sides. Can't really find anything on the menu I did not like. Love the BURNT ENDS!!!

SV37dIlAgQpGhtY-6W7rOQ.text: OMG.  Come here now.   Good is awesome.  Things you need to know.  They serve coke products.   Price is about 13.00 per person.  Corn bread to die for.   My beef rib had 2 inches of meat on it.   The location looks small.  It is not.  Tables in the back.   Enjoy.  I will be back

JBue222EQzVSrP3OwPVnew.text: Top notch!   We got a sample platter of a bunch of different stuff and we even had some left order when we got home *(we live in LA).    Excellent service, they really care about what they do.  Extremely kind and considerate, (especially for first timers).  One of the best American BBQ experiences of my life.  Highly recommend for anyone coming to Vegas looking to break free of the Buffet monotony.

MPkgV6sy_Q9DNhdqCW8xSg.text: Chopped brisket and corn nuggets were amazing. Sliced brisket was dry and not impressive.  The pork was average.  Sorry to say we won't be back.

N6r2f3Szz450Vnk_fr99tg.text: Okay this is the best barbecue I have ever had. Hands down in a little hole in the wall outside of Vegas. Who would think.

m8FYipgzsuVplrUWHdvG1Q.text: I cant believe I keep forgetting to review this place! This is by far the best bbq I have ever had. Yes the location is questionable. Yes the restaurant itself could use some work. But the food... The food is incredible. The ribs are huge. The sandwiches are huge. The loaded mash side is delicious. The banana pudding is to die for. Get over there now and eat!

J_W-xEgHl6EpQ3R3DJI2Sg.text: First the 10 year old young man who waited on us was remarkable!! He knew the menu and assisted me in making my selection (beef rib, collards and yans).  The food was great, we'll seasoned and just TASTY!  I must say that I will go back cuz I was too full to eat dessert :-)  THANKS little guy for the EXCELLENT customer service.

q3LJXXd5QOpsUhUYiGohEA.text: Best BBQ I've had so far in the city! Came here for lunch and had the rib platter. So much food I had to take some home. Beef rib was huge, pork ribs meat fell off the bone. Didn't even get a chance to dig into the brisket! Will be back again for sure. Wirth the drive!

ZY5bRY1L0ULhkPkbjjqJSA.text: I cannot wait to go back! The food was awesome! I had the brisket and chicken which had great Smokey flavor and wasn't smothered in sauce.  The prices are reasonable and there are a lot menu items to choose from.  My roommate got the burger and enjoyed it.

Da2eD9xIO2TVULGHu569Pw.text: I don't really get all the glowing reviews.  I'd rather go to Famous Dave's.   The bacon potato salad and loaded mashed were really good everything else was just okay.  Nothing special.

w4Qd34vhCU6kvcGZ3JdTfA.text: This is a go-to for my husband...decided I had to try it. Got the trio of sliders with pork, brisket and the spicy sausage. Om nom nom. The Kickin beans are hot and tasty. Bonus: I checked in and got a free peach cobbler. Fantastic. I'll be back to try the ribs.

pea2VEIeFDo5fQH0Fv1_SA.text: Rollin smoke catered a 150+ resident pool party for Sky Las Vegas Condos. Amazing, everyone loved the food. Chef Tim, his crew were on point and everything was served hot, fresh and absolutely delicious! I had so many people tell me "this is their new favorite bbq" We will be using them again!!

cuIt4TtwVZGIn_nQfP6LLw.text: Quite possibly the best rib place I found here in Vegas... While I love other places, not to mention those other places are good... For the price, environment, and service, I definitely will be back here and also continue to being friends... Beef ribs, all kinda of ribs, in fact the whole menu is just bomb...

SHbHnkjLyv3Pchm03MkC4g.text: Was really hoping to have some real deal BBQ but it was not remarkable. Not bad but didn't leave an impression.

MUO_TRlgNYMs6ZZl9fe3IA.text: This place is awesome. I've lived in vegas for 20 years and just found this. I wish I knew about it sooner.

K9RaJg4iWfLaqpF0afTKPg.text: Hands down the best barbecue spot I've been to in Vegas. Highly recommend the brisket and ribs. Mac & cheese and corn bread is also pretty bomb.

d-k_mKxfqgj2gKUv4EkQXw.text: Real Good authentic dry rub smoked BBQ. Total hole in the wall with some of the best pulled pork I've had... huge portions and freindly staff... If you like the corporate heat and serve food nicely packaged in a themed resteraunt, go there and not here. If you want real food and real people, this is the place.. I will always go here when I'm passing through...

vVR4e938wdGYB_DdEWIPIg.text: I moved here from Kansas City, so I was not really set on finding good BBQ here. Then I found Rolling Smoke. The pulled pork is great and the BBQ Nachos are INCREDIBLE. I have nothing but great things to say about this place. If you are wanting to watch sports, there are TV's inside. You can also sit on the picnic tables outside if the weather is nice and doesn't feel like the surface of the sun. I have been 4 times now and the employees have always been great. The manager will even walk around and talk to you to make sure everything is okay if they are there. I am a fan of amazing BBQ but even a bigger fan on customer service. I will continue coming here, forever.

QckjxZR-nJ4AD-QTLZcp4w.text: Best BBQ in Vegas!!! I've tried numerous bbq joints but this one has them all beat. The brisket was excellent, so were the chicken and sausage. The macaroni was outstanding.  It is in a weird location but worth finding.

vrZ2wimEJ-bCQNM8-7g-GA.text: Delicious BBQ! I had the brisket sandwich with the Mac n cheese and it was very flavorful. Tried the corn fritters and those were amazing as well. The only reason I gave it four stars was that a few of our meals were cold.

89v85290p6zf4SF9DRJdVg.text: It seems dumb to write a review for what is undoubtedly an already highly reviewed restaurant, but Rollin Smoke is so good that it deserves all of the praise it can get.  It's the best BBQ in town and it's not even close. My favorite is the Brisket Dog, but I'll happily get pulled pork or hot links if I'm in the mood. I don't like corn bread, but I could eat RSB corn bread for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It's like corn bread and pound cake hooked up and we get to eat their offspring.  I was really glad to see a change in the layout of the restaurant. It used to be really tough to navigate the small space when it got busy, but now it's much better. I like going when its quiet so I can snag a seat by the TV, otherwise I'll sit in the extra space by the fish tank.  Only negative is that they didn't address the bathrooms when they did the remodel. They are clean, but pretty old and small.

6gJ-dRlbx0AiVbN4VCthbw.text: What can I say, best BBQ in Vegas. No question. Everything is yummy but the cornbread is a must. Even the smoked chicken is soft and moist. They don't kill the flavor with too much sauce like some places. Prices are very reasonable, and the staff is super friendly and helpful. The location is in an industrial area but don't let it scare u away. It's a bunch of "normal" people eating inside ;)

hjzdgGJRzxcg7et0K9jDlg.text: I went to Vegas last weekend and we ate here for an early dinner on Saturday. We got there at 5:30pm and already there was about 10-15 people there. There was 6 people in our group. Everyone's food came out pretty fast but unfortunately they forgot to put in my order so my food came out last. Because of that, the manager (or I think it was the manager) brought me our a complimentary dessert which was awesome. As for the actual BBQ, it was pretty darn good! Can't beat it for the price too. I've had BBQ in Houston so it's not the same but as good as you can get for outside of Texas and especially in Vegas!

UIdBNZ_OZghCCnMmRBWtgQ.text: Amazing, delicious, fantastic bbq!  It's hard to believe a place can live up to the hype, but this place does! We had the spare ribs, a rec from an employee, and they were perfection! An unsung hero that deserves praise is the cornbread...moist and slightly sweet, it was the best I've ever had. This will be on our "must eat" list every time we're in Vegas. 5 stars isn't enough! Thanks Rolling Smoke for making such great food! :)

3F_CFqaCuEfvRH5sEaksTw.text: Yelp needs a new star rating for this place. Recently opened an office down the street and stopped in to get some lunch. The place is simple. Large menu on the wall, order counter, self serve soda machine. But that's not what makes them great. I ordered a brisket sandwich. WOW. It was awesome. I have been back every week sense that first visit and have tried many different menu items. Each one has been great. If you like food, you have to eat here. Don't be to choosy, everything is worth trying.

nc1jmBezcEN9IcTdQ_jJfA.text: Never thought I'd find a place better the. Smoques BBQ in Chicago. But Dam this place is good!!!! Have the brisket and burnt ends with bbq beans and Mac. This is the absolute best bbq I've ever had, and if you look at my reviews I've been to many places all over the place. This has to make your "Must Try" list when in Vegas!!!!

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dJ8P1qpV80Ita1_WC7igXg.text: Food was PERFECTION here. We tried brisket sandwich and the platter. Both brisket and robs were really good. There is not too much bbq sauce. Only as much as needed! The ambiance is a bit too casual for my taste, but the food was great. Staff are very friendly too.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket sandwich
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

THIUlbX5c0wjP7M3qpXO-g.text: This place is definitely over hyped.  This was the only placed that I had planned to visit while in Las Vegas for my birthday. The rest of the trip was itinerary free. This location isn't near the strip but it was still relatively crowded the day we went.  The food looked great but was very underwhelming once we started eating.  The ribs were not fall off the bone and the beans were not what I expected.  The most disappointing part of the meal was the long black strand of HAIR that I pulled out of the macaroni and cheese. I literally had only had one bite of everything before discovering the hair. Needless to say I informed the workers and was offered another order of macaroni and cheese, I declined.  There's no way I would ever be able to eat here again and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone either.

nSDyQuoTUjL4nSxM25svPw.text: I should have written this review the first time the BF found this Vegas gem, but I kept forgetting. It's way over due. We were just in Vegas for a mini vacay to celebrate the New Year and could not leave without having some of the BEST damn BBQ I've ever had. I gotta give(oh gosh I hope this her name) Crystal a HUGE shout out; she was the absolute friendliest person ever. The entire staff is on their game. Place is always nice and clean. We always order brisket, ribs and hot links. The meat is always so full of flavor and very tender. Do NOT get me started on the Mac n Cheese. I was tempted to bring some back to LA, but was worried it wouldn't taste as good. If you're ever in Vegas and find yourself craving some BBQ; you will not be disappointed!! Side note: we did purchase and bring back some of their dry rub. We can't wait to use it at our next smoker session.

ENTctVzuaXQcKgEjKjmCwA.text: Ordered Babyback ribs and they were out. Not impressed! How are you going to be a barbecue joint and not have babyback ribs?!? I don't care what time of day it is and the employee didn't try to do anything to make up for the issue. To add to this.....we had to send back most of our meals because the meals were on fire. The employees excuse was "oh we mixed up hot sauce instead of bbq." Wtf kind of place is this?! I was with a party of 12 and every single person sent their order back because it was either wrong or tasted bad! I didn't end up eating mine and sent my whole meal back. This was by far the worst service and bbq I've ever had.

S6vIBEcZu0cyNxieeTzFhA.text: Great food and good people. Thanks for taking care of MY mistake today. You guys are awesome!

y8jmDIhRzwcdP8lFN4UJdw.text: Ordered the catfish plate with collard greens and hushpuppies.  Greens and fish were very tasty just needed cornbread to soak up green juuce. My only issue is there wasn't enough food for the price. As far as location, if you weren't looking for it you would drive right by it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trying a new place. Food is very tasty. Catfish plate is food just needs more fish.

awppxDxhfg7oUcF81R-frg.text: The very best BBQ in all of Las Vegas!  From the burnt ends, chopped brisket, hot links and peach cobbler you can't beat it!

AJEl-ag3Fzn9o1-tL5DP-A.text: Best BBQ in Vegas! So much flavor and so much meat! You may want to share.  Definitely a hole in the wall, however definitely worth heading off strip for some great food! It's hard not to over eat.

N2eerP53zWlLdNph5sYUbg.text: Not happy at all just spent 70$ the yams are watery , beef ribs full of fat , beef brisket decent , cat fish wayyyy over priced and not seasoned hot link sandwich decent banana pudding full of cool whip very disappointed I'll be going to road kill next time.

BfcDbhk93XITuaSOi1uV1Q.text: SMALL PORTIONS PERIODTD NO CAP. Not finna pay $10 for a small sammich GRRRRRRRR it's big beef.... when I come back it's on sight!!!!! This man spilled our drink too! got him sweatin out his edges tryna clean up this water. ITS NOT EVEN WET bye.

Jg8evqR8nONrY_Xrq0dnwg.text: Please don't be turned away by the location. This place does bbq all the way right. "They rub their meat" well lol. Full of flavor perfect amount of smokiness and zero dryness equals topnotch bbq. 1st round of applause to the employees they have the customer service of a 5 star fine dining restaurant no exaggeration. Portions are very plentiful and prices are right. This is real quality food the beef ribs are the star of the show for me which was a hard choice because all the meat was amazing! I love the fact they don't overly sauce the meat which always tells me they are confident on the cook and taste of their meat as they should be. The only improvement was on the sides wasn't not a fan of the collard greens they added brisket to it but it tasted canned, the mac and cheese was not horrible but nothing to talk about. The peach cobbler could use work as well but overall they are pros at what they are in business for smoked meats!!

WZZxcZKaEqRmltAbKxvlkw.text: Rollin Smoke BBQ definitely prides itself on the notoriety that they have earned, and it definitely backs it up!  This is downright the best BBQ joint that I've ever been to, with the most savory meatloaf that I could ever imagine possible. Whenever I come back to Vegas, this is definitely at the top of the list of places to visit :)

yz36x-8EcP-PgR6Til_kcg.text: This place is no big deal on the decor very comfortable for a barbecue restaurant. Now let's talk about the food the ribs are to die for. I enjoyed six different sources that helped the compliment the juicy pork baby backs. I also had chicken which was very well seasoned to my liking. I had the banana pudding which I must say has improved since the last time I visited here. Actually I'm just going to be honest I had the all you can eat and boy oh boy collard greens after eating that meat is the way to go. After you eat all your Meats all your proteins make sure you get some beans and collard greens and by the next morning you'll have an empty stomach because you would have going to the bathroom so much you'll be ready to try it again. The food was absolutely delicious I could not have asked for anything more fulfilling

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their T shirt us a must have
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their T shirt is a must have.

rU2VxYFbrUugWzZ1aVoY9g.text: I must say, this is some of the best American BBQ I've had (and I've been to the Rib Cook Off of the west multiple times). If you are coming here for your first time, I recommend getting the Duo or Trio Choice of 2/3 meats (depending how hungry you are). By doing this, you are able to sample 2 or 3 of their meats while choosing a side. Their mac and cheese is good and gooey with cheese, but my personal favorite and go-to is their mashed potatoes, which is topped with cheese and a heaping amount of bacon bits. As for their meats, you really need to try their spare ribs and brisket. They are both super tender; cutting into the brisket is like cutting into butter. And for the ribs, the meat just falls of so easily.   Definitely will be coming back for their food. And another plus, their staff is so very friendly. I came here twice in one week and they recognized me the second time and saw I had brought someone new to the restaurant, so they gave us free drinks for spreading the word. Really great place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duo of meats - Spare ribs, brisket, Mac and cheese (and the bread is under the meats, soaking up all the wonderful flavors), 4/5

sQMf2TUan6ayYtrPU6QjJQ.text: Average price for BBQ. Pricey as usually.  Food is moist, tasty. Workers are super nice, busy place. Will be back. Not many place can BBQ right and they do a very good job.

80RgI8zvtcDQWlRXi_Bpgw.text: Best bbq in Vegas. Nothing better then the smell of a grill. And the sauces are out of this world. Small parking lot so make sure to get there early. And you get to keep the souvenir cup

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_kKcXMXs-f1-4fA52CPpMQ.text: OMG ... find this "oh so close" to the Strip BBQ spot for the best bite in Vegas! Picnic bench seating creates a very BBQ feel while dining in ... parking can be tough so plan on taking some time to find a spot since this stuff tastes so delish right out the kitchen.  We tried the 3 meat combo + a beef rib (had to taste as many types of meats as possible) and the smoked meatloaf. Every bite was smoky, juicy, and hit the spot. The corn nuggets were different, in a good way - crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside. Kids had the creamy mac and enjoyed every bite. Wish I had room for more!   Was pleasantly surprised to get a veteran/military discount ... awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Single beef rib - tender, juicy, fantastic goodness
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliced brisket, pulled pork, and spareribs with collard greens on the side
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked meatloaf on some of the best mashed potatoes

Sf0D54dWLXx_6HeCjNUX2g.text: Really Awesome Barbecue!!!! I have been in search for the best barbecue from Austin, to Kansas, to South Carolina, etc....  only to find The Best barbecue right here in Las Vegas!!!  My favorites are their sliced brisket, brisket tips, sweet mama's sauce, and the macaroni salad served hot!!  Also love their corn bread.  If you love barbecue, this is the place for it!!!!  Very casual place with no frills.  Just bring your big appetite!   If dining in, eat at their newly added wing on the left side of the building.  The A/C is cool and the place is very clean and brand new.  You still need to place your order in the main section of the restaurant.  They bring the food to you.  I'm so happy to find this place!  You will too!!

SKhubL7KY6WxwODtZAynOA.text: Loved this BBQ place when we went there based on everyone's recommendation.  It was the old location we went to and loved so much we decided to go again the next day but to the new location which is the reason for the 3 stars.  I give 8 stars to the old location but we were very disappointed in the new location due to the double higher prices and the food itself wasn't the same.  Will only go to the original location and stay away from the new one unless they can make it as great.

sCAtBM03WciorsE4-utJew.text: Rollin Smoke is located off the strip away from all the lights and glamour. This makes it easy to get to by car, more difficult to get to by foot. Even though it is located nearly under an overpass and directly adjacent to a strip club it felt strangely southern and comfortable. The people were excellent. Fun and friendly. The decor felt completely original. It enhanced the experience and wasn't distracting. There were a few picnic tables out front which I have come to love about authentic barbecue joints.  Brisket (upgraded to burnt ends), ribs, and coleslaw with a drink and a piece of bread for $22 felt steep for the amount of food we got, yet by the end I was thoroughly stuffed and for that reason, I actually feel like this is a good deal. I believe the quality of the meat and technique were excellent, which deserves a higher price point. Did I mention that it was delicious? It was delicious. The brisket was crispy on the outside with the soft, delicate, juicy interior that I have come to love. The ribs fell right off the bone. They had authentic Carolina vinegar which cut through the fatty brisket. Their mustard base sauce had excellent tang and was good, but I bet it would go better on smoked chicken. Their sweet sauce really shined though. It is tomato based (instead of molasses) and it was just sweet enough. Really complemented the smokiness of the meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket and Ribs

7NFJO2BnmyYBbXk1yZimbw.text: Wow! The BBQ is top notch and the service is fantastic! Shout out to the kick-ass crew: Jordan, Kenna, Lizette, and Ty! You guys rock! You guys have given me another great reason to come to Las Vegas!  I had the "Duo" with burnt-end brisket and short ribs with a side of collard greens. You get a lot of food for your money! The best BBQ in LV! I'm definitely coming back! Thank you!

jPyAvuquADygb747BCWD7g.text: I haven't even had my food yet but y'all know it's gonna be a five solid stars for this place. Lizelle was the chillest cashier, let us take as much time as we needed, joked with us and everything. Antonio delivered some solid food from the back. My boy Adrian (@2_strawzz_ hit him with the follow he fine as hell) and I saw that this place had 4.5 stars out of over 2,000 reviews so we knew something was up. Awesome feel to the restaurant, amazing food, and a great experience.

vUVEApUJH0BZW4sew4lTjQ.text: This place is the best! I knew it would be good but I didn't expect it to be this damn good. LOL The beef ribs are amazing as well as everything else on the menu. Customer service is awesome as well. Wolfgang and Antonio definitely know the definition of customer service. This place deserves 20 stars!!!

AY4glBxHUsvnGIL-4nD9gg.text: I've been in the bbq scene, meaning judging competitions and smoking meats myself. Most restaurants can't even compete with Rollin Smoke. Their brisket, ribs and hot links were my favorite. Just the right amount of smoke paired with flavor of seasonings and meat made for a great experience.   I would highly recommend this as one of Vegas' top bbq spots!

ypsScYVmRxJuryl_slX9Og.text: I first learned about this place from one of the cooking shows so I decided to hit it up. Finding good BBQ in Las Vegas is hard but this place didn't disappoint. I was really good and recommend

qZFpZA1kzUWx8cYPA_PtpQ.text: First stop off of the plane. Had to try this place since nyc doesnt have good bbq. I ordered the sampler & banana pudding. All delicious & their sauces are awesome. Can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AEaOBegAG6EyTmwFtuf58Q.text: So the location is great for folks staying in the strip, close for a cheap ride, but far enough off there aren't any crazy lines. Menu is great, many options, priced well. Food is top notch, came out hot and flavorful. I especially liked the greens.

BBXvFgOc1S-6achKUs8RQw.text: Found this on Tripple D.  Sooooo good.  Not that expensive and the cashier was really helpful. Making this  must return next time I'm in Vegas.

pSgUhc2mJvvR2dNWdGPoIw.text: Solid bbq spot, service is good and fairly quick for a bbq joint. They have a few bbq sauces to choose from and their meats are seasoned very well. The brisket was tender and juicy and the ribs practically fell off the bone. Sausage links were spicy and full of flavor- recommend trying the chipotle coleslaw as a side. Overall, one of the better bbq places in Las Vegas. Leaning more towards 4.5/5

k2r52wvP4zZnkj6rDTwSwA.text: O M G! This is absolutely the best BBQ I have found in either Vegas or Henderson. After reading several great reviews of this place I had to try it out.   Ok, its not in the best area of town and doesn't look like much from the outside, but when you walk in and smell that wonderful smoke and BBQ flavor you know your gonna love it! We of course had to try the Outlaw burger made with brisket and fried onion strings as well as the brisket and rib combo plate with corn fritters. The burger was HUGE and the brisket was so tender and delicious. One of the best burgers ever. The brisket and rib plate was also great. The ribs were probably some of the best I've ever had. They were so smoky and tender and the corn fritters were golden bites of goodness.   Our friends ordered the BBQ nachos which were waffle fries loaded with BBQ pork, cheese, beans and sour cream. So good.   I will definitely be back to try the hot links and baby backs. Thanks for a great meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ nachos...Go ahead and treat yourself!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The famous Outlaw burger! So so good...tender brisket, cheese and fried onion strings. Delicious!!

KJbmpwSLla0CagfgmEgAVA.text: This is one of mine and my bf favorite BBQ spot. I usually get the chopped brisket sandwich and he gets worlds famous beef ribs! Mac n cheese is ok loaded mash is better!

0lMNfWE2f89n8g3PhY0wxQ.text: This place is a must see it's so cool they have multiple trophy's and awards for best bbq well they ain't laying, omg I cannot even begin telling you about this place it's so good they have the best corn bread and ribs and brisket and the desert are delicious is a must try.

K25G0dbj-WiMpD28u_sjGw.text: This was a bbq joint that was on the "hit list" for a few months. This bow place takes pride in what they do ! Food tastes great and customer service is really great.  If you like baby back ribs try them here and next time I'll know what to order : pork spare ribs ! Much better than Lucille's rib shack or even than Bludso's in Compton,CA ! Nice place!!  -- 6-1-2016  Still a great place, things that stand out: Brisket Peach cobbler with cold icecream on top Mac&chese

fd1xvlBtCOMcF1BZhVm49g.text: This BBQ is the best I have had. The St. Louis ribs and hot sausage were outstanding. The ribs were meaty and the sausage was just tight in the spicy.   The prices were a few dollars more than what I would normally spend on BBQ but it was worth it.   These people are obviously from Arkansas (by the decor in the restaurant). GO PIG SOOIE!!!

WwmOmzV38HBVmfEcJLHFgw.text: Very tender BBQ !! We got the dual combo !! It was both enough for two people !! You will find a parking

rxmXgSPAHeBfudiwG7Yz0A.text: The best Barbeque I've ever had. It's a must go to every Friday I try to go and eat there with a couple of my close friends since we started eating there the service was great the food is amazing can't ask for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NLUzR_NIXeWiEEpNqDtMJg.text: This place is probably the best BBQ place I've ever been in the world. The service is fast, the food is incredible and the owner personally came up to us to ask if everything was ok. Such an amazing place!!!!!! Highly recommend that you get off the strip and try this place.

Gqx7p8is5aasbFif3lC-YQ.text: I am a Big BBQ person and I had high expectations for Rollin Smoke's....  Unfortunately, I won't go there again. The spare ribs been really poor, pulled poor was ok/good, size was below average and their signature Burger looked great but the taste was not good at all. Really dry patty and my friend had the entire night stommach issues from the patty.  I have been touring around the westcoast lately to try all the so called best BBQ in town and this one is definitely a one and done thing.  Variety 3/5 Ambience 3/5 Price 2/5 Quality 2/5

xO045_VRkQdo-TBmyyIw-g.text: This place has the best food in Las Vegas! The ribs are tender and juicy and they offer beans with just the right spice and the greens are ummm good! Don't forget get to try the corn puffs and the down home corn bread. They aren't on the strip but it's worth a short Lyft or Uber ride to get to them. We go every time we are in Vegas. You won't be disappointed!

8gr0Y9wqryTzJ3aCOYBBnw.text: Family owned place, great customer service and even better food. I ordered the outlaw burger and my friend had the biggin. We both finished them quick since they were so good and we had our peach and blueberry cobblers waiting (a la mode of course). The cobbler was absolutely delicious, the bluebell ice cream really completed this meal. I wouldn't change a thing about this place. I'll travel from Henderson any day for this kind of service and food.

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MMM

q1TeiaHNF8gCyI749hrdUA.text: Yay, I have a legit bbq place to go to when in Vegas, and one block off the strip so convenience of location without the traffic. The pit special basically covers all the bases 5 meats and 3 sides....corn nuggets are pretty legit

kzpSN-nSQ_-ObW9HlF-tPQ.text: Best BBQ in town and for quite some distance. The staff is great and very concerned that you enjoy your meal. It is a real BBQ joint so be aware of that if you plan on dining inside. The meat is very tender and full of flavor. Their homemade BBQ sauce is possibly laced with crack! It's very addictive. Tender ribs, flavorful pork and brisket, a must try if you want True smoked BBQ.  The smokers outside are worth the experience checking out. There aren't places like this in town that give you the True home cooked feel. This is one of them.

JPMk4WkTB2AGvD3mUv84MA.text: Went last night for a quick dinner and I wasn't expecting to like it very much since I don't eat pork often. I ordered the BBQ Pork wrap with some corn nuggets. I loved the corn nuggets especially dipped in their Arkansauce. My bf got the Outlaw burger and once I tried it I Loved it. It was delicious!! Next time I come to Vegas I will definitely stop by again.

3p1PZB5wmEuzoq7omheLrg.text: Absolutely the best customer service from the cook!!! He made are stay so amazing. The Brisket fabulous. The cornbread fantastic. The overall food great!!!!

eQ9qHiSRN0JuJhJSj8-1gA.text: Came here on advise from a friend, and he was right best BBQ South of Texas Will be coming back again  got the Pit Special 5Meat All their meat are on point   Their BBQ sauce are as well pull together great Carolina sauce  their Sweet  BBQ sauce had just the right amount of sweet  The  service was incredible. You are greeted at the Order counter by the sweetest lady (Brenda) she was very helpful in guiding you Thru  the menu    And for all you Veterans out there they do give military discount  !!! So if your in Las Vegas make the effort  you won't be sorry

U9BZlr1WOLyFQvYy33ohLg.text: Always great food. If your short on money wait till you can afford it. Bit on the expensive side but we'll worth it.

hiYyZF0PokLNF1oyr5SowQ.text: Wife & I are at Rollin Smoke Bar-B-Q for the 2nd time in 3 days with 5 days left I'm sure it won't be the last. We are from Cincinnati in Las Vegas on vacation, Jessica took great care of us. The food here is just incredible, we got a great deal with the pit special, 4 meats , 3 sides & 1 drink for only $19.99. We had double hot links, chicken all-white meat & burnt ends. We also added cornbread which tastes like cake, Yum. The people in Vegas are spoiled to have such an incredible Bar-B-Q place. If you're visiting Las Vegas and don't stop by to eat you missed the best food place in Vegas. We cheated and tried another Bar-B-Q place yesterday called John Mull's Road Kill Grill after seeing it on TV, but after eating their food we realized we wasted our gas, time & money as Rollin Smoke is closer and has way better Bar-B-Q. John Mull's Road Kill Grill not only was not close in quality it wasn't even in the same ballpark. Keep up making such great food and we will never stray again, as Rollin Smoke is "DAM  GOOD"!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Incredible 4 meats &amp; 3 sides for only $19.99.

ARF1OWITKrxZlEaIwQroew.text: Great BBQ and deserts are okay. Place is located in a shady part of town near an overpass but dont let that scare you off. The food will make up for it. Tried the pulled pork sandwich it was really good and the sauce is great !

naLKmSEz5XJOYeLkbcTySg.text: One of my top 5 places to eat in Vegas! Definitely try to 3-4 meat option to get the a spectrum

a7mBZTMAIhBKpQ1HQoUwPQ.text: Really Good BBQ.  They re did their menu recently and their prices almost doubled. Save that crap for the strip and give us locals a break.  No wonder it is empty in here at lunch time.

bqR_F8tYI4bPYBFRncndrA.text: We got a platter with briskit pulled pork chicken and hot links, a spudtastic with briskit and a half rack of baby ribs. Jalapeno slaw, yams, fries, Mac & cheese. The food was out of this world then they gave us free dessert!!! Seriously out of this world. Best bbq I've eaten in Vegas. Ps this was more than enough food for my family of 6!!!

fFONFrbzvKEgyuMVZ3e3GQ.text: This place knows how to cook some BBQ!  I've been going here for quite a while and it's the best!  The prices are starting to go up as they become more busy and popular which I'm not a fan of!.  Beat the crowd before noon or after 130.

qoLLjqvaI-P4md39Yk-jwg.text: Went here simply because we are huge BBQ fans and with all the good reviews we had to check it out. I have to say, I wasn't that thrilled and it may be because of what we order, which was 2 sandwiches - 1 beef brisket and 1 smoked chicken. The beef brisket was very greasy and lacked seasoning this came with waffle fries which were okay- nothing special. The chicken was nice, well seasoned but they were a bit skimpy on the portion and I got a side salad with mine that came with a vinaigrette that was very spicy and certainly not a traditional salad vinaigrette. Overall, good service and decent food but nothing wild.

VP7si1Id1nhuEyji2tqf8A.text: Great BBQ but really disappointing dessert. I know that is not really why you  go to a BBQ place but for almost $6, it should be more than blueberries with yellow cake mix mushed up in it. So, lesson learned...at a BBQ place expect great BBQ but get dessert somewhere else.

Vm9YwsOiUn037R8KX-VqkQ.text: Some of the best BBQ you'll find in Vegas. Just standing in line gets you hungry, the restaurant always smells like smoked meat. The portions are very generous, and the food is great. If you love Southern style BBQ this is one place you won't want to miss.

9J4i2tTHgUUcdjQ5spDj3w.text: Omg.... This is some gooooooood BBQ. I had the smoked meatloaf. You may consider splitting if you want to have room for their bread pudding!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BtyjUrCSwotz302XORedWg.text: Love the BBQ. The place looks a bit under the weather but the food is delicious!!

Y7WPMYyPkvCJwq7fwCNVaQ.text: We had read about the great BBQ here on yelp and was anxious to try it.  Unfortunately, our experience was not good.  My daughter ordered the sample platter.  The ribs were very pink and she was afraid to eat it.  The brisket had black charcoal all over it and again refused to eat it.  Her boyfriend decided to eat the ribs.  The next day he was sick and we are guessing it might have been the food.  The seating leaves something to be desired.  I can handle not so fancy seating for some good barbeque.  We sat at picnic tables and unfortunately my back was to where people line up to order.  Several times I got hit in the back by people's arms, purses etc.  People breathing down your back and gawking at what you are eating.  Go to Dave's Barbeque for a better meal.  The bread pudding was good though.

vunq58S3tu4X8ibLwHaDJw.text: Oh. My. Gosh. This place is absolutely delicious! The Brisket is to die for. Tender and juicy! Sausage is great. You must try the BBQ nacho Fries. Out of this world. Loved, loved Rollin Smoke. Can't wait to go back to Vegas and have it again!

mOegyvKSxniM_mNIrJhVow.text: This is in my top 3 BBQ places ever. We had the smoked meatloaf, ribs, pork, and brisket. All of it was amazing. We had the Mac n cheese side and corn nuggets both great. We had two different sauces the arkansasauce and the country sauce. We preferred the country and it was excellent on the ribs. Finished dinner off with peach cobbler

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf was incredible

aynojD5nh8BitXUk587aiA.text: Holy Rollin Smoke!!! What a BBQ! Yes sir, tastes like home cookin down south! Very casual atmosphere, very friendly staff, too. We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat! Meat! And more Meat!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Meatloaf with a side salad. It DOES taste like someone cooked the meat over a campfire.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat Combo with Collard Greens! So good!

WwEv0BZ6GX7Ww3MAWKUgeg.text: Probably the best BBQ joint in town. The meats, sauces and the prices are amazing. I ordered a meat trio combo for $14. It came with 2 Ribs, hot link, brisket, 1 side, 1 drink and a roll. Their hot sauces lack a little bit of  punch, but that's not a deal breaker for spice lovers. The meats have a good amount of spices from the rub and marination.   Overall this is the best location to go for a lunch on the weekend. Lines can be very long during their busy hours. The parking lot is big, so you won't be driving around for a while to find a parking spot.

UAUFYpR16eK7mJKORR8knw.text: Been coming here since the early days and it never dissappoints. A must least once or twice everytime we're here. Rollin Smoke may actually be the reason I come to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8rU-3UEOnkTJtlm-F7P09g.text: This place is the shining example of how to run a business. Not only was their bbq out of this world, the service, from start to finish, is stellar.  We were in the area so we stopped in after hearing nothing but good things. Lucky us, we scored a parking spot right up front. When we left, people were parking down the street. Well, I know why!!  My sister and I split the four meat combo. We got brisket, chicken, ribs and pulled pork. My favorite was the pulled pork, but all the meat was excellent! For our sides, we had corn nibblers, hush puppies and jalapeno cole slaw.  Sadly, we eat low carb, so we just had a little bit of each side. I was very very sad that I couldn't inhale all of them. The fact that I left three hush puppies behind literally makes me want to cry! Either way, we were finishing up and one of the guys from the back walked up and asked if the cole slaw wasn't good. You could tell he was concerned and wanted to make sure everything was okay. I explained that I am low carb and low sugar and that I WISH I could eat it all. I explained how good it all was and he gave us a high five. Nicest guy!  So not only is the food great, but the customer service was equally as good. You can tell they care about every aspect of their business, from the quality of the food to the people they serve.  As a fellow small business owner, and one in the food industry, it can get VERY hard to just run an establishment, let alone do it in a way that makes people obsessed with your food. Somehow, they make this place work pretty seamlessly and we will most CERTAINLY be back soon. My dad is going to lose his mind once we bring him here!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Four meats, three sides and a soda for $19.99. Reasonably prices and RIDICULOUSLY GOOD!

C1SWe40MGR4Uc3HemrOsOQ.text: A little frustrated after spending just shy of $25 for delivery of "The Big Hawg Sandwich Combo". I got one drink and I did NOT choose 'sweetened tea' I also didn't choose 'unsweetened tea' (although I almost did), I chose 'iced tea and placed a note asking for Splenda' (I received sweet iced tea!). I'll be fair and admit the sugar was 'reasonable' (it wasn't kool-aid).  But that's careless. But the thing that got me frustrated is the crap they put on my bun!!!  Think cold coleslaw with corn soaking into an egg bun.  Disgusting!  The pulled pork was cold.  I'll admit the pork was as good as cold pork can be - which is meh!  The only reason I'm giving (3) stars is because I'm an out of town rookie orderer here and the dirty rice was outstanding!  Oh and the GrubHub driver pretended she wasn't allowed to bring the meal to my room. This after a full 15% tip!  GrubHub tips will be cash here on out!

xg--7482bz27Yv9QFMmQcQ.text: I was Pleasantly surprised by the professional and courteous service that I received at the rolling smoke barbecue particularly by Melissa who not only was the cashier but also she was the server she was super I want I want to visit there again and I dissipate to a wonderful experience all the barbecue was delicious soft tender and I actually had the brisket sandwich with yams yams was perfect not too sweet it was great anyone looking for a wonderful surprise with barbecue this was off of flamingo all or near the 215 exit actually

NtGdcrdPwpPyzHQ0TUnJAg.text: Scoured Yelp to find some BBQ for my In-Laws who were in town from Georgia (shout out to Yelp for the solid recommendation). We were definitely second guessing when the directions took us within a stones throw of a half dozen strip clubs, but we were so glad we went inside.   Both of our Southern guests were blown away with their food. My wife (who was NOT thrilled when she heard we were getting BBQ instead of the salad/juice bar place she suggested) was beyond stoked with her meal, and I was hoping for a good selection of sides since I was the lone vegetarian entering hostile territory.   The in-laws ordered a brisket sandwich, ribs and a handful of sides. My wife had the BBQ salad with white chicken, and my veggie ass had the mac n cheese, side salad, green beans, and waffle fries. We were all SO STOKED with our food that we kept bringing up how good our lunch was throughout the day.   The place was clean, the staff was helpful and friendly, and the food (and wide array of sauces) really hit the spot. Don't let the neighborhood dissuade you, GO HERE, FOOL!

hz4YJ-scwlLejbcwN_c_BQ.text: Amazing service, great crew and to die for BBQ. We were served with a smile. And our group made some fun friends today. They even came out and served us some burnt ends for free to try. I was blown away. Never have I had better service.   So to the point. If you want amazing food and an even better experience. Go here. That was more than lunch. That was a great time. Thanks for making us feel so welcome.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket Three ways...to die for.

o5l0VcGSXGwt-8WPJV5pGA.text: Good juicy food. Short distance from the strip. Well worth the trip. Food is at a very reasonable price.

IjbGSejkuOxRMM3uqfZo5A.text: Amazing bbq at a little hole in the wall place. Be careful what you order.. .portions are out of this world crazy. We could have easily shared either one of the platters my husband and I ordered. I really don't know why they have an all you can eat option on the menu as we could never finish a platter. The food was outstanding. So good it isn't possible to pick a favorite meat. Definitely 7 out of 5 stars. Best bbq ever.

hW3ZKzTb3npHRd1z975RZA.text: Great BBQ, quality is there every single time. Staff is very nice and helpful. I love the baby back ribs.

_V7XPjqSqUGY9Y0Y-qXHaw.text: This place gives you an authentic bbq experience.  When you walk in, you have to order at a register. The staff is very very nice. I took around 5 minutes to order, as the menu is so big, and the person at the register was very patient and polite.  After you order, they ask your name, and you sit down at a table.  The inside is decorated like you'd expect a bbq joint in Alabama would be. There's also outside seating.   I got the All You Can Eat option, because as a foodie I wanted to try EVERYTHING.  Their food is extraordinary. The tri tip squares were my favorite, but the meatloaf was a close second. The catfish was amongst the best I've ever had. The shrimp is very high quality. I also had the beef ribs, hush puppies, corn bread, mashed potatoes, Mac & cheese and fried onions. It was all good to great! The weakest item is probably the corn bread, but the rest is so good I didn't mind.   Overall, if you want a friendly staff and the best bbq in Vegas, this is your place!

N2ylPpEuF5oY7NLqInd-oA.text: There are no words!!! Thank you  Rollin Smoke For the welcome !!  The food is A M A Z I N G Thanks Dave!! ... For our delicious desserts!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #ARK Outreach in the house!!

UD-veN1Kv_EISZDX86QS7A.text: This place is the TRUTH! Some the best BBQ I've ever had & I've had BBQ from all over the southern USA.

hF43mznrvCxwgejwfzCpTQ.text: Fantastic! Wish it was in my town! Service was friendly, food came out in great time. Hot  and tasty! RSB club wrap so good and tons of good. Mac and cheese OMG yes. Khiken beans Spicey and great. Wings are complete drum &  flapper in one, so good. Duo platters chicken &  pork fabulous and tons of food. Duo chicken &  ribs  awesome. Fried okra tasty, crispy and not greasy. Corn fritters moist with real corn. SWEET TEA yes! Will visit again!
