Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duo plate chicken &amp;  pork with yams
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings

qeRkVl6F_DIEjDbVVWvT8Q.text: Just left Rolling Smoke and got a few things to go. Ordered the spare ribs, the sliced brisket, a side order of greens and potato salad with a couple of corn nuggets. Food is always good...no doubt about it. However this has been the second time that I placed an order to go and they missed a few items. I know this was my fault for not checking and having it happened the first time I should have learned. But I drove all the way back to North Las Vegas and come to find out the my did not include the corn nuggets (which are good). I called the store but was unable to reach them as the number requests that you dial an extension. I did call the other store on Flamingo and spoke with Denise and she was apologetic and insisted that we come to her location as she would make up for it and provide us with the corn nuggets. It's unfortunate that I have to consider going to that location again.

RmC8dmp3-TTQoKNW6EZNlQ.text: OMG OMG. Finally a BBQ in Vegas worthy to be called BBQ.  I'm from K.C. and consider myself a bit of a BBQ snob.  All of the other imitation restaurants I've been to here lack some combination of: smoke ring, BBQ taste and tenderness to name a few.  We ordered a brisket sandwich and requested the brisket to not be chopped.  It was wonderful.  Tender, jucy , flavorful.  Just fabulous.  We also ordered a slab of St. Louis style ribs.  Again no sauce needed.  Great smoke ring, tender and delicious.  This is my new BBQ Mecca!!  Go.  Now!

PCymyekkWHZSBNwHiW14CQ.text: SO GOOD. Kinda pricey for lunch, but the food is just WOW. To die for. The brisket. Holy crap. So good.

TBF_qEwvyDksIuGoTh3xUg.text: Been waiting to come here.  Finally made it.   Great place won't be disappointed love the funky atmosphere. Feels like a Southern barbecue joint should be like.

DSgsEZ34YZGRl44VJAoRhw.text: BBQ heaven. Finally it has arrived folks. Ive tried every kind of bbq in vegas looking for that special place. here it is. phenomenal. its a little whole in the wall not in the greatest area but by all means safe. I had the beef ribs and potato bacon salad. my wife had macaroni cheese and the pulled piggy sandwich. Everything was flavorful and very delicious. they didnt over due it with a whole bunch of mediocre food like memphis. very proportionate. id say its a little pricy but the food is to die for. ill pay for it anytime when i want great bbq. props to them hope they expand.

db01wS_TJmVOUS-o4bGInw.text: Amazing!!! This place is a must.  Fantastic BBQ. Super friendly and attentive staff and don't even get me started on the sides... Bacon potato salad, corn bread and banana pudding.  This place is awesome!!!

al58HqwxYibk_mt1i7IqXA.text: best bbq in vegas.  they used to have real brewed iced tee.  they replaced it with this fountain thing and i asked the owner whats up with the fake iced tee fountain.  he looked me in the eye and told me a balled faced lie that it was an automatic tee brewing machine.  LIER!!!!!!!!!!!!!  next time i came in i saw his son changing out the plastic bag of bs gmo garbage fake asss iced tee.  i'll never eat there again.    scum bags  too bad cause i really love there food.  its legit real bad asss down home food. the owner is lying scum.

5ZyVhey9ut5k1xnz0jF-lw.text: My husband and I made a point of stopping here today while on vacation. It's only a few minutes from the strip (2 miles from the Monte Carlo) and is well worth the trip. We both went with the all-you-can-eat deal ($24.99, anything on the menu). I did two rounds: #1 - beef rib, BBQ nacho fries, baby back ribs, cheezy mac and cheese and bacon potato salad. The highlight was definitely the beef rib - juicy and meaty. Round #2 - smoked meatloaf and another baby back rib (no sides). My husband did three rounds - with the shrimp and hot links being his faves. This place is definitely worth getting off the strip for. You won't be sorry.

N-IhVyLrnzGpYDGTXIUMgw.text: First time here and If you want really good BBQ this is the place! Dave's nor Lucille's has anything on this place. Beef brisket was to die for and the ribs fall of the bone, seasoned great, and the homemade BBQ sauce is delicious. Was so good we decided to get a second order to go.We will definitely eat here again!

pphsG57__907aawvr1VqWg.text: we went there for lunch today had 3 meat tro and ala cart white meat chicken. first there sauce is awe full 2 the meat doesnt have a smokey flavor at all brisket uck! spare ribs tuff and no flavor, chicken bland and flavorless tasted boiled.  Only things that were edible were  the hot links and the potato salad was dank. hands down worst bbq Ive ever had   bar none

hd3OJ-ezlRPN0arbU-4BMA.text: The ribs and chicken were good, tender and flavorful.   The brisket was Ok.   I'm not a fan of pulled pork, though others seemed to be enjoying theirs. The sides were fine.   The cornbread was desert quality, very sweet. Dusty at the order booth hepled me not to over order, which I appreciated, especially on the road when I can't take home left overs.  I thought it was a good, meaty meal at a good price.  You may want to take a taxi there and back if you don't have good walking shoes.

NcBiaCpM6F2BjDTTzevQ6g.text: Great and tasty meat! Superb place off the touristic LV strip. The ribs and the Brisket were perfectly cooked. The outlaw burger was huge but had all the flavours it needed. We will for sure visit this place again on our next visit in Sin City :-)

xtLey8Ch37ua9y9W9aNo3A.text: Absolutely delicious. We ordered the outlaw burger, pulled pork, brisket, and chicken. All incredible. Tender high quality meat not overpowered by BBQ sauce. One of the owners greeted us and went out of his way to be kind and helpful. The chef brought us our food and have is free potato salad and banana pudding to try, which were most delicious as well. He even came out to check on us later. The owner was very proud of he and his brother's business and said it was the American Dream. Will definitely return here next time I'm in Vegas. This is some of the best BBQ I've ever had, topped off with excellent customer service.

0fCw4PzVbFQ5xWZ0zb_Czg.text: Great BBQ, quick service, local atmosphere.  Prices are very reasonable and you can get all you can eat for $25. Best BBQ joint in town.

sS437WZ5nfPm8xP1CmMDjw.text: I thought this place lived up to the hype and enjoyed meeting the owner, Lee and he's a really nice guy. I ordered the all you can eat deal for $25 and tried the pulled pork, brisket, sausage and ribs. For my sides, I had the beans, jalapeno coleslaw and collareds. However, the server had two faux pas by forgetting to bring out the greens and they gaved me St. Louis Ribs instead of baby back ribs so Lee went int he back and brought me out the baby back ribs and a beef rib and it was quite meaty. The ice tea was so so and the sweet tea did not have much sweetness either but guess it's better for my teeth! They had some football on the flat screen TV which is a must in September and the joint is nothing fancy but the bbq is definitely worth the trip and I was starving since I just arrived from the East Coast on an empty palate. I'll definitely make a return trip to this joint when I return in January and love the smoke smell whe you enter the restaurant. This place definitely puts Memphis BBQ to shame!

-42-3VTqXQvTkALWUdF17Q.text: These guys really know their barbecue.  Everything was amazing.  The outside of the place is super sketchy looking, but don't let that keep you from going in.  It will change your life.  So good.

WTkj86fSrJhLcl5VQjQIZA.text: This place is awesome! Delicious BBQ, great prices and very friendly staff. The prices are very reasonable for the amount of food you get. The all you can eat is the best deal on the menu. I would definitely recommend that people venture off the strip for delicious food.

lBfvwt6HWVUAivO7VbO8pg.text: Best BBQ I've ever had in my life. Hands down. I don't know how they do it. At one time I truly believed I was a revered BBQ expert, and after eating here, I never want to bust out my grill again, because it is just going to be inferior. The ribs and the chicken here are absolutely phenomenal, and the price is very friendly.

G4OZZz_oOIjc0wwrSVjVJA.text: We were visiting Las Vegas from L.A. We had heard about Rolling Smoke and it was terrific-- everything is delicious, particularly enjoyed the hotlinks and the baked beans. The pork, the beef... just beyond reproach. You will not find a more committed, courteous staff, these folks were serious about business, while being friendly and sincere to patrons. I understood they are from Arkansas; if so, that is one place where manners matter. Will absolutely visit again!

fpgsddnPxBdWaW6xoBIA1g.text: I tried a lunch combo, pulled pork and brisket with mac n cheese and potato salad. I also wanted a sweet tea, which was never made in time for my visit. I was not impressed. The pulled pork was not at all pulled, it was chopped. Not a single piece had any fat, bark or irregular shredded shapes. it was boring dry sliced/chopped meat. The brisket was sliced very thin, cold, tough and had minimal smoke ring, bark etc. The sauce on both was too sweet for my taste. The sides were mediocre. The mac n cheese a bit too watery, tasting more of black pepper than cheese and the potato salad dry and bland. It all came with a dry toasted little dinner roll. Service was minimal, the guy at the podium seemed annoyed to take my order. Order and pay in advance at the podium and the food brought to your table. No one asked me how anything was after the food was brought. They have annoying tiny flimsy horrible plastic cutlery. I would avoid returning just to never have to use those awful plastic forks again. I may try the ribs  someday but am in no rush and certainly wont go out of my way for it.

uNZ0PY4Hoxlvrkm6DJpDIg.text: Great staff and very accommodating anchored with the best BBQ in Vegas. We'll come back and bring the whole clan. Thank you!

R9wYhwKwCW-ZLZziVahxhQ.text: I walked in not really knowing what to expect. Upon opening the door, I see just what looks like a small little shack with some tables you might see at a camp ground. I was with my girlfriend and her mother and they had been here before but we still needed a little help with the menu about what to order to which Brenda the lovely lady at the front was more than happy to give us a hand. They had mentioned that they had been here before and who had helped them the last time they had come here which to our surprise happend to be one of their chefs, chef Tim. Even more surprising was the fact that he took the time to come out and acknowledge us he even said he remembered my girlfriend and her mother last time. I can say that this place has some of the best customer service that I have ever experienced. Everything was smiles and great food from beginning to end. The food was absolutely superb and I can honestly say this is my new favorite place to get BBQ. I would even go as far as saying this is the best BBQ place in las Vegas everything was amazing and definitely will be back. 5/5

hdc0hpwryvVGgxbO6rhHzg.text: For LV this is a 4 star joint, as for the midwest, east coast, and south this is a 3 1/2 star. To become a 4 star elswhere I need a little more flavor and moist ribs. As a previous reviewer stated the pork ribs were a little dry. great beans, warning to light hearted these are spicy with a touch of jalapena, beef rib is moist tender and meaty. Ribs have just the right amount of mesq/hick smoke. Rib portions are proper, can stand alone w/o sauce, and well priced (avg $2.00 per bone). Not a fan of the potato salad to much mayo, not enough sugar and mustard. Bacon added to the potato salad is alright. If the ribs were taken off the grill 10mins earlier and just a little extra rub added before and after cooking, I would rate 5 stars LV and everwhere else. This place is a gem, lets see what happens.

UW5DLQeZDWSH7kdWL5HPOA.text: This place is marvelous. Great Barbeque and Southern cooking. I am thrilled to have found it on Yelp and its now part of my very short "must eat at" list of restaurants.

FGLqmKsAO0FfYk5tWrfHpQ.text: This is my new favorite BBQ place.  My mom ordered the beef ribs.  I made the mistake of tasting the beef ribs first. Not only did I not eat the two meats on my plate, I ordered a full rack.  I had the pleasure of meeting the "smoke master" and his quote, description of the beef ribs was perfect.  Just as tender as a filet.    The corn nuggets were excellent. Sweet tea was not too sweet.  I chatted with a couple who ordered the famous burger and the meatloaf.  The guy couldn't pick his favorite out of the two.  But the lady said the burger was a clear winner.  All I can say about the burger was this is the first time the real food looked better than the pictures.  The interior is not very large but large enough.  Service was excellent.     Excellent job!

vS9c6vgY8pUfwP44_iL4Qg.text: Everyone at work had been raving about this place so I had to take the family there today to check it out. Being from the south we hold a very high standard on BBQ. The joint was a lot smaller than I expected and their webpage mentioned they were kid friendly. I disagree with this--there was only one high chair to be found in the whole place so if you need it hope you're the only person there with a small child. Plus they only have one size drink--I really didn't want to have to buy a big drink for my child to drink two sips of something. All the kids menu items were 10$ which I thought was very pricey for a kids meal. So all in all I vote this place not kid friendly. I wanted to give as much a try as I could so I ordered the 5 meat meal that came with 3 sides; my wife and I shared and had plenty left to bring home. The brisket was fatty and overly peppery. The ribs were pretty good but small in size. The pulled pork I would say was just right along with the sausage. I thought the chicken was a bit dry but flavored up nice when dragged through some sauce. As far as the sides go the mac and cheese was--well mac and cheese; nothing over the top but good nonetheless. The greens had a taste of ash, almost like cigarette ash in them. I definitely never have to have them again. But the corn nuggets, oh yeah they were good, real good.  All in all the food was decent but I don't have to go back there.

hTUcoGwitat-xgctEMjsQg.text: I've never really cared for bbq or smoked foods, but the food here is amazing. They have made a convert out of me!

Qs9vhSh0P0H0LGa0fsPcEg.text: I walked into this place and almost walked out due to the diveyness of the place.  As I was standing in line, 3 separate people told me how good the food was.... and holy crap were they right.  The food was AMAZING!!!  I plan on hitting this place up every time I go to Vegas in the future.  The prices are very reasonable too!  Expect a ghetto ambiance and go there for the food!  You won't regret it!

5I7IHN5VIgE_tSIaAynH-A.text: This place was simply delicious. Perfect recipe for what makes these types of places last. Great food and great service. That's it. That's all it takes. All you chain restaurants out there thinking that your name speaks for itself, do yourself a favor and check out Rollin Smoke. This is how it's done. Keep it up guys. You're doing an awesome job!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Outlaw Burger. Don&#39;t judge me.

Vjh5CCASYyMtXAo7encmJA.text: This is one of my favorite little hidden secrets in Vegas!!  Great prices,  great good,  a gem in my book.  This was my 2nd time here and just as pleased as the first time.  I had the BBQ meatloaf last time,  which was amazing,  I would call it one of their signature dishes for sure.  The ribs are great,  the chicken was a little undercooked today but great flavor my friend said.  I got the catfish as the guy there told me it was the best in town,  and that it was,  big claim but he came through and delivered.  Light,  flaky,  crispy with a ton of flavor,  served with hush puppies,  I got the greens as a side and it came with cornbread and a drink for $10.99. You can't beat that!!!  It is on my foodie list and highly deserved!!

2atdGZ2U5m9idT2jN1aHvQ.text: I ordered brisket with nacho fries with outlaw burger. Ordered before my cousin and he got only the outlaw burger with Mac, and he got his order first. And I look across of me and I see a guy that ordered his food after me, and he got the same exact burger before they got my order.  So I ask the waiter why he got the burger before me when I ordered before him, and he just simply said that yours is coming up, playing it off knowing that he messed up.  So after 10 mins later they bring my food, but I only  got my fries no burger. Waiter said its coming right out.  After another 10 mins I finally get it. Was kind of hard to enjoy my food. But nevertheless fries were good and the burger was just as good. And the price for all the food was just. I would of given 4 stars if they didn't mess up my order and not try to play it off that it wasn't the waiters fault. Don't get me wrong I would definitely come back again and hopefully get better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5pa26YHxYwQRzO-aL_RJ3A.text: Perhaps I'm spoiled because I've been spending a lot of time in the South recently, but my whole party had the same reaction.  The staff was friendly and welcoming, and it was an easy place to be, but the food was just OK. We were ready to be wow'ed based on all these other reviews, but that just didn't happen. I think, between us all, we tried all the big items on the menu.   I wouldn't mind returning, but it definitely didn't live up to its str rating I see on here.   Not bad, but no rave reviews here, sadly.

S6WJ5B5omWWIpOPj4YYknA.text: After sampling the brisket, pulled pork and hot links, I can safely say the meats alone are plenty of reason to come here. The smoke ring on the brisket looks like perfection and tastes like a gift from above. Sampled sides were a delicious mac & cheese (with two home made pickles hiding under the styrofoam bowl) and these fried creamed corn poppers that cannot be properly described in text - they are a delightful experience. The home-made house sauce is bold and flavorful and more than enough for most meals, but there are two more home-made sauces as well - a sweet sauce that compliments the pork very well, and a "damn hot" sauce that is very tasty and has a sneaky heat that gets you after the second mouthful. Great meats, excellent sides, great sauces and a friendly staff make this place a must-visit on your next trip to Sin City.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kAQfHDR2dp5azfcqvxU1WQ.text: Good brisket/pulled pork and the corn bread is insane. Also try the bacon potato salad.  RollingSmoke is tucked back behind the strip on a dark street and they close at 8pm Mon-thurs.  I will go back again, just gotta remember to tell them give me plastic wear... It's kinda hard to eat potato salad and Mac n cheese without them.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Be careful of the door cause I knocked down the heck outta someone trying to leave

vy9t4VbPsQguRdusEqersg.text: Went here today and it was off the hook.  Im from Louisiana and my buddy is from Tennessee and this joint is by far the best BBQ in Vegas.   It definitely brings the southern feel to Vegas....  chef is awesome......

VZMpu6eeZPONARcqvPHadg.text: This is the best BBQ in town. It's a bit pricey but in my opinion you get what you pay for. There was a very long line to order but the food comes out quick. I had the trio platter the pulled pork and hot links were just awesome. Staff was very helpful and polite. Make sure you check out the grill fish tank while you're there.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grill fish tank. Was made by ATM from that show Tanked.

hFylFZFquQsZYpQiwax78Q.text: This place is legit! Headed out of town on Memorial Day, and thanks god it was open. The brisket was stupendous and the pulled pork was so tender. A new favorite of mine, and I will go out of my way to visit next time I am in Vegas!

09IluEoLkIh9R6llTbhnzw.text: Best damn BBQ in Las Vegas, talk about falling off the bone!! The beef rib best I have ever had

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bow heaven

eXfdirt6lClmFzE7MRwcLQ.text: I am so very glad I tried this place!!! I felt like I was in Texas and it was great!!   I'm not gonna say more than TRY ROLLIN SMOKE BBQ!!!! You WILL NOT be disappointed when the cook brings your food out! GO HERE!!!

FBIuuHjhR9pi2jGXZyujag.text: Wanted to try this place for a while. I'm sure glad we did I had two meat plate with chopped brisket an hot links side of mac n cheese Brisket a little fatty but real good hot links great  flavor. GF had pulled pork sandwich and side of beans She loved it The beans were spot on great flavor You must try this place.

Oqnk4W9Q2JRu6KNi1KFlAg.text: I went here just expecting it to be another hyped up BBQ spot that was going to disappoint me, but boy was I wrong.  Immediately when you walk in the menu is right there HUGE on the wall, I loved that. I didn't have to strain my eyes to see anything and the menu was very straight forward. I ended up getting the Outlaw burger.................................................WOW!!!!! it's everything a burger needs to be. Everything complimented each other very well, the amount of sauce and toppings on my burger were perfect. I was just really shocked. As for my side, I grabbed waffle fries....which are always fire. Definitely hit this place up if you're looking for some real deal BBQ. They definitely have my stamp of approval!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seriousness
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw Burger, I put it up there with the best I&#39;m town

zjUUCvi1niCbU4O3DlD_XQ.text: Decided to come here based on the Yelp reviews. It was good! Personally I am a bigger sweet barbecue fan so this wasn't really my taste, but overall the quality Nd service were good. Got the trio or meat plate and was able to share it no problem.

cFZEbN4aP2zAongVbBNdkw.text: Absolutely the best BBQ in the city. I always get the trio combo or the 4 meat combo.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Still the best!!

TQCT9MGPN4W0qUCpo6VeJQ.text: Best BBQ place in Las Vegas! Their food is so delicious that I just crave it all the time!! The employees are always super friendly. And their Hot Damn Bbq Sauce is the hottest barbecue sauce I've ever had! And I just love it. It's definitely a burn your face off sauce! Just a great place!! It's a must try type of place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bAxcZxDkx2EzkW2EsaLcWw.text: I long ago retired from writing Yelp reviews because I figured, "Why should I just DONATE my amazing writing/reviewing talents to Yelp, helping them make millions of dollars off my endorsements?"  I still feel the same way, but every once in a while I come across an experience that calls me back into the Yelp game. This was one.  Had Rolling Smoke last night for the first time. It was the best. No seriously, I think it was the best I've ever had. (I'm writing this at 5am so you know it's real)  I had the 4 meat combo: chopped brisket, burnt ends brisket (OMG), chicken, and beef ribs. I paid extra to have the burnt ends and beef ribs and it might be the best decision of my adult life.  David at the front is super engaging and welcoming. I assumed he was the owner, he made us that comfortable.  ATTENTION ROLLIN SMOKE OWNER/OWNERS/OWNERSHIP GROUP Make this dude an owner or something. Sign him up to a long-term contract or just give him lots of money and make him promise not to leave.  That's about all. It is 5 in the morning and I have a fridge full of leftover bbq and it's not going to eat itself.  Thank God.

8Ym0oub6kR4uv9iJxmyR_A.text: Surprisingly good BBQ in the oddest of strip malls. We missed it the first time around, it's by a Diamonds Cabaret Strip club and when we pulled in the store front is dark so it looks even closed. You'll see large BBQ smokers in the parkinglot so you know you're in the right place. It's open late-ish during the week, and 1:30 am during Fridays and Saturdays!   Bobby, Misti, and Mamie said something about grabbing some food to eat here after a UYE and somehow it struck a cord with everyone that BBQ sounds amazing and talk was rumbling about hunger that the rest of us decided to sort've crash on their idea.   The BF and I shared two dishes, made both a combo (drink and 1 side) -  Smoked meatloaf  was awesome. The BF says one of the best he's had. It's definitely great flavor and is a different style of meatloaf being smoked, then basted in some of the sauce and topped with crispy onion rings. It was on a bed of pretty good red skin mashed potatoes. If you love meatloaf, this is something to try.   Beef ribs are normally something we skip over, but seeing as they looked good and people were actually saying they were quality I decided we should give it a go. It was meaty, juicy and tender which is rarely achieved. I have to compare it to my holy grail of Phils in SD, and while it doesn't have that cracktastic crisp outside to moist (haha CHRISTIE O. ) inside, the quality is definitely there and satisfies that want for a good beef rib. So many places don't even serve it, just because of how hard it is to cook right. These were solid.   Our sides were also solid. The baked BBQ beans had pulled pork pieces in it and was very good and hearty. Potato salad is the red skin potato style mayo (no mustard) style and had crispy bacon bits and green onions on top. I like all kinds of potato salad and this was good.There was a little bread piece on the basket which was kinda stale and dry which was the only hiccup.  They have one kind of BBQ sauce and it's on the zesty and a tad spicy side which I enjoyed it a lot.   I really wanted to try a dessert, but we already had the major meat "itis". Maybe one day I will come back and eat something "lighter", you know, like a sandwich chaulk full of meat.   It's a order up type of place at the counter and serve yourself drinks out of the beverage closet (it'll make sense once you're there). The staff was friendly and made sure to check on us.    Apparently the owners are Arkansas folks and while that is a "fringe" state that normally people don't think about slanggin' the 'que, it takes on influence from the best ideas of the rivalry states, really.   I definitely think even from this first visit, this place raises the bar on BBQ offerings in this town. We will be back, probably really soon.

nWMfppG9Ki6W_aSKoVSxTA.text: Pretty Good! I would go back!!

qIjASittsn2WIotd_z4vOg.text: I love the clever menu like the BBQ Nacho Fries, BBQ Sundae, & the Outlaw Burger.   The $8.99 Smokin Deals are a great value

yyQkALrfdtAEKuhmKG2LJw.text: Went here based on watching the travel channel.  Had the BBQ meatloaf which was the dish covered in the program.  It was the best meatloaf that I have ever eaten.  Amazing dish.  Another in party had salad with smoked pork and said it was also amazing   Very informal you sit at long table but worth it for the great BBQ.  On a backroad but only a few minutes from the Strip

U8K0LFVX8Ijlxr70HcXO3g.text: The best barbecue place I've found so far! Their St. Louis pork ribs and corn nuggets were DELICIOUS!   Would've given a full 5 star review, but my first time going there wasn't very pleasant. The cashier didn't even bother to help out with the menu. She only gave an "Idk there's a lot of those. Idk what's in there." I was a little taken back, but I thought maybe she's having a bad day (oh well). My second time going in there though was WAY better!! Lizelle and everyone there was very hospitable! They made my experience and my last day in Vegas even better!!! Keep it up!!!   Definitely coming back!!!!

WIhvLkGFhhOtyHaysYBB7w.text: Very delicious. We love their BBQ sauce and the sides. We got the brisket and ribs,with cheese curds and baked beans. So tasty!

5r8f3vXYeBxuGLyDlIl9kQ.text: The food was AMAZING!! If you want superb BBQ this is the place to get it!  The reason I only give 4 stars is because we were kept waiting for 35 minutes after we ordered, and people who came in and ordered after us got their food before we did. AND they must have had a VIP come in shortly after we ordered because they were sending out trays and trays of food before we got ours too. I mean, I understand having a VIP, but We shouldn't have to wait 20-25 minutes longer than we were told for what we paid for, and receive our food after others that came in and ordered well after we did.  We will be back again and maybe we'll give 5 stars :) the food is definitely 5 stars, service could have been better.

YwP6pgd_-jctruoGFi_Xjw.text: Love this place it's in a secluded little area under bridges and near wharehouses- feels miles away from the the Vegas trip but it's just around the corner.  You walk in and theres 1 menu on the wall  1 on the counter 2 rooms of seating and a few large tables outside.  The Menu options are plenty and the prices very reasonable I loved the brisket and their hushpuppies they were packed full of flavor and the service was very friendly!  I was lucky to go when it wasn't to busy but I hear this place gets packed during the lunch hour.  must be a local favorite and that's my kind of spot!  Get away from all those long lines at the buffet and try something good here not those mass produced buffet foods.

8VzfNS4dNh0XZRr293ozkw.text: Best pulled pork in Vegas!  You know you're in the right place when you smell the hickory in the air from the smokers in the parking lot. And prepare to fight for parking during the lunch rush. I went to Rollin Smoke days after returning from Lockhart, TX. I went not expecting to be impressed, but the pulled pork wowed me. It's usually something I prefer to make at home because it's not often I like it out. But this is tender, succulent and well smoked. The brisket was less impressive, I found it dry. I'd try it again when the sweet taste of central Texas wasn't so fresh. I might like it better. The combo I ordered also came with a dry burnt bun and I selected the mac & cheese for a side. It was pretty good, but I do prefer a creamier version.  My brother joined me for lunch, he had the baked potato topped with cheese and brisket. His order came out with pulled pork instead. No worries since it was a winner.  This was my first run in with Arkansas BBQ, they definitely make a great pulled pork. The jury is still out on the rest of menu. Must eat more to decide. The staff is super friendly and they're open late on the weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. where the magic happens
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. two meat combo: pork and brisket
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spud with pulled pork and cheese

_XzdXrG-Tn3r82CguL4Ztw.text: It is hard to imaging better BBQ anywhere.  The only place I have tried that compares is IronWorks in Austin, TX.  I had the rib special and the beef rib was perfect.  Clinging to the bone just long enough to fall off with a slight pull.  The pork was equally amazing.  I also sampled the meatloaf which had a unique composition and flavor I loved.  Staff was super friendly.    Right off the strip this place was surprisingly away from the crowds.  Will clearly do this place again.  It just might be worth the 5 hour drive by itself!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v79PBgXB6KdVb-cE_z5kMQ.text: Great BBQ food and the service was awesome. Walking distance from the Wynn hotel off the Las Vegas strip.

zGmMNm1aQR5sGslY35jXXA.text: They practically were out of EVERYTHING when I got there towards the end of the night so my options were limited. I went with the hot links sandwich, cornbread and waffle fries (dinner of champions, right?).    The sausage was seasoned so well I didn't need sauce -- but I would recommend getting peppers, pickles & onions on it. The waffle fries were a little undercooked but whatevs, still decent. The cornbread was AMAZING -- oh my god. I'm a cornbread enthusiast and wow! I highly recommend you give the cornbread a try.

ei0NRtF3mfO5nRw4yASw0Q.text: BBQ alert! Smoker in the parking lot. Fried okra, pinto beans and corn bread on the menu. Open until 1:30am on the weekend! I've been spending all of my life dreaming of this Southern paradise. Well, at least the part of my life during which I have lived in Las Vegas because prior to that I was in the Southern paradise of Hotlanta.   Driving here you will have your doubts that you are actually going to end up at an establishment that serves edible items. You may even believe you are being drawn into a cleverly disguised strip club or an automotive shop, but if you have your windows down about half a mile away you will start to smell the que, and you'll know you're headed in the right direction.  I must say that I think their sides are even more delicious than their meat. I sampled their killer fried okra and baked beans, and I would go go back for those alone. But of course, their meat is delicious as well. I went with the two meat sampler and chose pulled pork and brisket. It is a generous heaping of meat. It was hard to tell where the brisket ended and the pork began, but they were both flavorful thanks to a sauce that is more spicy than sweet. The pork was a tad dry, but I didn't let any of it go to waste.   The environment is definitely casual, and in one room, they are using table cloths because there is apparently a couple of not so attractive tables hiding. However, the table cloths do lead to a lot of stains, so I hope they can wrangle some more attractive tables soon.   As for service, it is spectacular. The nicest bunch of Arkansas boys you could hope to meet. This should definitely be at the top of your short list of must-try BBQ in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Duo!

m1OPxWHDpzej8fHsTiUnmg.text: My fiance' cousin brought us to this restaurant where we tried this place for the first time. He is a driver who delivers there so he knew the place well. However I liked the host, it was an older lively lady with such SOUTHERN Hospitality she REALLY made the place like home.   I didn't like the EXTREME noise factor it was hard to hear, and it was super hot in there. The food was not bad. She led us into the 2nd room, we ate in there.. but didn't like the bathroom right were the table was, made move that table so our backs are facing it would be better.. but the young college crowd was in there so it was noisy as heck.. but it was cool. I enjoyed it. I will be back to eat there.. again.  A little Pricey but its not bad.

nSG9niMd_96dNaIlOyaayw.text: Was craving BBQ in Vegas so I found this place on yelp. The meat was really flavorful, but I did not smell or taste any smoke in any thing but the brisket it had a hint of smoke flavor not as if it was smoked in a smoker tho. I recommend people to come for the meat not the side  they were not that great and came out cold. But that spicy BBQ and house arkanasauce was everything. Chicken tasted like oven chicken not impressed ribs were delicious wish every thing had more smoke taste. Clean, atmosphere was ok cashier was not very friendly nor was she helpful in recommending someone like me coming for the first time a dish. Very expensive also.

bf5Tok8w_eAEc34oTJ0OCg.text: BRING YOUR SMALL PARTY TO ROLLINSMOKE!!  I am a manager at a global enterprise software company and every year we go to Vegas for our Sales meeting.  I was looking for a place to have a relaxed team dinner and wanted to get away from the glitz for a bit.  Also, the team loves BBQ, so that was the criteria.  We went to RollinSmokeBBQ and this restaurant is just great.  Excellent tasting BBQ - the baby back ribs, brisket, hot links - just awesome.  Easy, casual ambiance.  Family owned business.  The owners were very accommodating to us.  The pictures on their website don't really show it but they have two small dining areas - the main area where you order your food, and then another separate eating area off in another room to the side.  That room can easily hold 30 people.  My group of twenty arrived, we sat down, ordered, grabbed drinks and the evening just got rolling.  It was easy as that.  We ordered 20 'all you can eat' packages but had the restaurant just bring it all out family style and place it on the tables.  The team dug in like piranhas - it was excellent.  It didn't take long for everyone to be bursting full.  All the food was great.  Excellent, friendly service.  The owners were very appreciative of our business.  After the meal, it was a nice walk back to the strip.    I highly recommend the RollinSmokeBBQ for your next Vegas team gathering.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The side Dining Room at Rollin Smoke big enough for this group of 20.  Could easily do 30.
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The side Dining Room at Rollin Smoke big enough for this group of 20.  Could easily do 30.

lS2ERdw5pKf5sQp7jk8RFQ.text: Absolutely the best barbecue you could ever imagine!  I live in Southern California and I was working in Las Vegas. For my birthday party, my coworkers ordered from Rollin Smoke (the Highland Avenue store), and it was a revelation !  This little hole in the wall under the freeway overpass makes the best pork and beef ribs I've ever had!  So when it was time for me to return to SoCal I packed my car with 3 pounds of every kind of ribs they make and drove 'em home . And now I'm reaping the benefits . Just had a pool party and the ribs were an enormous hit . They reheat like a dream no matter whether I pulled them from the fridge or from the freezer . The sauce is super sensational  and the ribs are meaty succulent juicy deliciousness! . I'm gonna have to make a rib run up to Vegas next month just to get another hit from Rolling Smoke Barbecue.  Believe me when I say they're too yummy for words!

6zfDfPczfcA9W5Esj2rabg.text: I'm from L.A. And every time I visit Las Vegas i have to have BBQ from Rollin Smoke.  My family and I stopped by to have lunch on April 15, 2017 . We orders the baby back ribs and mac n cheese and my favorite corn nuggets. We received friendly and courteous service from Lizelle and Zack that day and by everyone else that works there.  I recommend the Rollin Smoke to anyone visiting Las Vegas.

H1LJ8uOYyFrh09Nint4oqA.text: Soooo tasty! This place is delish. It's right off the highway and accommodates parking. You order counter style which allows for quick takeout but there are also plenty of tables and TV's if you prefer to eat on site. We shared the trio meat platter - everything was moist and tender, sweet corn bread was awesome, baked beans had a kick of spice. Club wrap was grilled and off the hook delicious!!

-npQuJy_9uJeLf36YAAPMw.text: Heard some good things about this place and being from the South, I had to get my fix on. Justina was super helpful and made sure we taken care of. BBQ was good, tried all the sauces. Rib Tips, Brisket, Hotlinks and Chicken were had by the group we had.  Not a huge place so if you want the A/C get there early it will be worth it.

GNU4ZKnx-jQ01X4rKNc7bA.text: The food was soooo good! Really hit the spot for sure. The staff was friendly, and the place was clean. Can't wait to try more of their food!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cGsF2e8KWjz--Zg4RTbIrQ.text: This place was great. Was told about this place from a friend of mine and it was everything my friend claimed it to be. Great food, can't stress that enough and even though it's off the strip, it's well worth the drive/Lyft you'll take.

YBuziKnvGm429GBVEhytpw.text: Awesome Burnt ends. My beef ribs and corn nuggets were delicious too. Coleslaw was ehh, but good. Sadly, they were sold out of the Outlaw burger for the night so we couldn't experience that. Peach Cobbler was tasty too. More of a cake crust rather than crusty crust. That surprised me. Friendly guy, I'm assuming the owner, came by and talked to us. Jackie, the girl who brought out our food, was awesome too. She was super friendly and funny.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t let the outside push you away.

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extra dinning area

ICoOd5zR4C8itia1_2l6Lw.text: Top Barbeque I've ate in a long time and very fast service!! I give these guy more than 5 stars!!!

BvhtzRhlDwvYMBsM1XErng.text: The barbecue selections at this hidden local dining establishment are really tasty! The portions are big and the meat quality is outstanding. I ordered the duo meat platter consisting of ribs, brisket, potato salad (chosen side), and bread. I ordered online to-go and it said brisket comes chopped but can request otherwise. I requested sliced and my takeout order came chopped. If you order to-go, check your meals before you leave to ensure it is as requested. Nevertheless, I enjoyed my experience here and will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big tasty ribs! I would have enjoyed brisket more if it came sliced as I had requested.

TQe3rC50QtAO2eMWx0fGRw.text: Meh. Let me start by saying I'm from Chicago. We may not have the most renown BBQ in the country but we have some pretty good BBQ spots. Therefore, I must admit that when it comes to recognizing a good BBQ joint, it's hard to pull a wool over my eyes.  So this place, great service. The guy who took our order was nice; our food didn't take ridiculously long to come out. My wife and I split a trio with chicken, hot links and spare ribs. For $17 & some change, I was disappointed with the portion sizes. 1 hot link (not sure why they said linkS), 2 medium size spare ribs, 1 chicken drumstick & 1 thigh. Sorry, I may be spoiled by Chicago's fine eating rep but $17 at a BBQ joint in Chi-town typically gets you A LOT MORE. I also decided to try a blackberry cobbler (the menu says blueberry but they have blackberry)  Food wise, it was ok. The rub on the ribs were "OK" (I've definitely had better). They weren't super tough but they weren't slide off the bone tender, they were somewhere in the middle. The hot link was actually good but it wasn't a smoked hot link that's standard for a BBQ joint but a pork hot link. The chicken was ok. My wife didn't like the seasoning on it so she peeled back the skin & put BBQ sauce on it. The blackberry cobbler was descent but considering the stark tartness of blackberry, it could've been sweeter to offset the tartness. Likely won't be back here next time in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackberry cobbler
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio plate with chicken, hot link and spare ribs

O_UGlw3dK4G7UITSQSTcZg.text: Came here today after a good time on the High Roller. Even though I currently live in the BBQ capital Memphis, something told me to get some BBQ here. Ordered and food came out about 10 minutes later. Got a smoked chicken combo with good ol mac n cheese on the side. Damn, it was good! Definitely a good addition to the Sin City. Nice option if you like to save a few dollars. The only negative is that it's off the strip. Other than that, check it out if the buffet options are not in your plans.

dtyh2VVQpQvWE0W89fQjag.text: They have the best beef ribs I've ever had. The beef brisket dog was amazing as well. Going back before we leave forsure!

a1kNcK_z_w6JJiqlhpy8og.text: Really liking the food. Would reccomend to friends in the future. Yall should do sales

ZlVPhwBZuMPc7BqJst5KDQ.text: So good! The area is kind of sketchy but once you walk in it's totally worth it! We got the Pit Special for two and it was more than enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pit special

Zgh2O13VqnZ9WUMkoddeMQ.text: This place is delicious. I love order by the pound for pot lucks and work lunches. Great quality and the flavors are great. Highly recommend

XrG1CgGTMJ7m31sODmWZdQ.text: This is Barbeque Heaven! Customer Service Awesome Hey Lizelle! I had the rib tips meaty, meaty tasty just done right! The sauces were great!  Lastly, I had to have the Banana Pudding.  Melt in your mouth good perfect banana flavor! I will be back!  Oh don't forget the Coke products!

SSwtp3ZkdCEz9xku49u4_A.text: Only BBQ place we'll eat at in Vegas! True southern BBQ done right!  This southern girl loves that there's real bbq in Vegas.

dWMvgMIhDWDHXFpe2GHGfA.text: Now I understand what all the hype is about and I am so excited. Every restaurant should make the kind of impression that Rollin Smoke Barbecue does.  The location is a little off the beaten path, but it is worth searching for. My husband and I came in late on a Friday Night, close to closing. The staff was very friendly and the wait for our food was painless. We ordered a rib special platter that came with baby back ribs, Louisiana style ribs, and one pork rib. Everything was fall of the bone tender and so buttery. Plus, it wasn't doused in bbq sauce. The spices were enough to carry the meat without it having to be swimming in sauce. When we were finished, I was disappointed that there wasn't more! Haha. We had banana pudding for dessert and it ended the meal on a great note. The only negative thing I can say is that the platter we ordered came with a side and toast. We had bacon potato salad that didn't stand out very much and we also got a piece of toast, which was just that: a piece of sliced toast. It was a little underwhelming. This being a BBQ joint, I was expecting something a little bigger like Texas toast maybe. But the real show stopper of course is the meat and thinking about the meat makes me forget about the sides. I can't wait to go back and try more. I've been raving about it to all of my friends.

yTRPWtKnmSaKV0DdcvkB-g.text: This place is sooo good!! Especially loved the spare ribs, Mac & Cheese, pulled pork, and Sauces! Will most definitely stop here every time I'm in Vegas! I have two picky eating kids who left with smiles on their faces!

w0kn8-tphLbL8DcDtAT0-Q.text: This as a whole is The Best BBQ in the West!  A must try. The burnt ends were litterly Melt in Your Mouth!  I mean wow. The Smokey taste the juicy meat and the texture was perfect. The brisket was also tasty and juicy. We really like baked beans and corn nuggets. Don't miss this place if you want some great BBQ.

XMuMP8XVNTBXRC1U6VSfyA.text: Love the food, takes a little bit of time but the lady at the register was a little rude. I will still give this place another try but attitude is everything in this town.

INQbMQrjmGAZZvgaY9r9_w.text: Wishing I could go to Vegas just for you BBQ. Baby due next month... guess I gotta wait. My husband will rub it in my nose through pictures this month.

89-hdocwyTKfwGsERWHEMQ.text: Meatloaf was fantastic and unlike any meatloaf I've had before. We ordered D's sampler and everything was delicious. We got here on a weekday at and beat a big rush. The staff is helpful and kind.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xpw28MCZYzvuKvga82bSig.text: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! Me and my friends came here after searching on Yelp and this was the top one. And I'm so glad we did. First time being in Vegas since I turned 21 and I'm so happy we did not go to the typical Vegas buffet. They also offer an all you can eat option, which I was eyeballing but glad I  didn't because I was stuffed and didn't finish my tray. MITCHELL is one of the coolest host I've come across. His upbeat personality made my first time here very memorable and he is a man of his word! He said that the food would be out in about 10 minutes and jokingly, I said I was timing him and he was definitely up for the challenge. 3 minutes later, my food was personally delivered by Mitchell himself! He was so hospitable - I am beyond impressed. We were even able to take a tour of the kitchen.   Mitchell, thank you so much for making our time here so memorable. I would give you 10/10 stars because that's what your deserve, but Yelp limited me to just 5. I will definitely come back next time I am in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The D-licious&#39; pit special

nvV4AG_z94iFmt7J07ID9A.text: Great from start to finish! We tried the burnt ends, chopped brisket, ribs, green beans and greens... and WOW. It was ALL GOOD.

7VbEjBD_sfO1Q-j7RlOGDQ.text: Wow! I was under a ton of pressure to host a work meeting and feed 10-12 people. Rollin Smoke Barbeque delivered on time and with the most delicious food ever! I will order from there again and again. My people left full, happy and satisfied. Best trio for a successful business meeting!

PeKDRyBfquT6B6Cy-zUY9w.text: Wow - amazing food and the bear hospitality I've ever seen. I loved every piece of food I had and had no less than 5 people check to make sure I loved it. Can't wait to come back.

rH2TO8BtCEfYGK4QZYiw2Q.text: 4.5 stars,  This is one of the more popular places to eat in Vegas. Located off the strip, it's kinda nice getting away from all the madness and enjoy a good meal. Although this is a smaller restaurant, the food is excellent. It's worth the wait..  We ordered all types of bbq, some of my favorites were the huge chicken wings. You can get them in all types of flavor, we got the honey bbq. They were delicious. Also, we had some tri tip, chopped and whole. The meat was super tender.. and it had the nice bbq/smoked taste I love. Nothing is better than some legit bbq with the smoked flavor, you can tell they spent a lot of time preparing and cooking the meats. They have all types of meat, to satisfy all your cravings.  Prices are pretty decent for some good bbq, it's never cheap. You get what you pay for, and everything is worth it in my opinion. This place is definitely a must go if you're visiting Vegas.

6Rg-XcwESW4_4ieT9B1fJA.text: Mediocre at best, not worth the price.  Some tips for the folks running this restaurant -  *Stop pre cutting your baby back ribs, it dries them out & ruins it  *BBQ sauce is NOT suppose to be liquid runny mess, it is seriously embarrassing   *Stop buying frozen fries with coating, why don't you try making fresh French fries

yh4v6cOsRImZ-WzgOoqWkA.text: The reviews do not lie. Vegas is a must with Rollin' Smoke. We decided to get bbq on our way back home and it really made our trip back home a lot more bearable.   The cashier suspected we were knew and handed us cups of waters and menus and told us to take our time reviewing the menu. There were a lot of open seats so we grabbed a picnic bench and pored over the menu. We settled on the plate with 2 bbq choices and a meatloaf. Good thing we were hungry--the portion sizes are huge.   The meatloaf was the best I ever had. With the crunchy onion and the mashed potatoes, it was heavenly. The ribs were fall of the bone delicious. The brisket was none like I've had before. Their sauces are to die for. My favorite is the vinegar sauce--pure amazingness.  Aside from pesky flies that were bothering me the entire meal, this was a solid experience. I can't wait to be back. Thank you for showing me what real bbq is about!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaffffff
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs and brisket with corn balls

yYkoU5yLS2oVWJBknjq_ng.text: This is one of the best barbecues places I've been to in a long time.  I highly recommend it for anybody who's looking for a good Southern style BBQ.  Kamia was my server and she did an excellent job making the experience even better. Thank you for an excellent meal

snR4Nj6RAZhXIfBEDhqQ1g.text: Second time here. Food is awesome! Had to come back! Try it out! Crystal is a sweetie!

bRO2lVKNFTghlXH9HQCo2Q.text: Wow! Surprisingly really good BBQ. We didn't know what to expect since the street getting to this establishment looked a little shady. We parked in the lot and walked in. Yup, I can deal with this. No ghetto-ness here! There is a large board with the menu and there is also menus provided by the staff.  You walk up and place your order. We ordered a smoking plate of the pork bbq ribs, bread and the mac n cheese combo and the fiancee ordered a smoked brisket sandwich. We also ordered the blueberry cobbler a la mode.  The ribs were really good. I like my ribs with a lot of sauce so luckily there was a bottle of sauce on each table. There are 2 dining areas with TVs, as well as outdoor seating. The outdoor seating is pretty much used for smokers.   The staff is really courteous, friendly and informative. If you're new to the restaurant, they are very helpful in making your decision. We did notice a lot of first timers.  The only issue we had, was that our food came out lukewarm. Not sure if the food was sitting out for a few minutes before serving to us, but it would have been tastier if the food was hot upon arrival.  Definitely recommend this place for those looking for a quick good meal off the strip. We had no wait, but after we placed our order, there was a line out the door. A lot of people ended up taking their food to-go, so that's a good thing if you plan to eat inside the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry cobbler a la mode
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork bbq ribs
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket sandwich

diiHwapKGgLPAZaBB4IAJA.text: This was my first time here and i was utterly surprise the location was right off the street so it was close to the hotel i was staying at. the service was fast and friendly, the location was small but clean. i decided to do the all you can eat special and it was totally worth it. i was able to try all the sides and meats i wanted to try from the menu. I can see why they're voted #1 in Las Vegas.

HPJ3KbYx-YoCc_tF-6I_2Q.text: I never knew food could taste like this. I seriously will never be able to eat at another BBQ place again. When standards are THIS HIGH, how do you pay for ok, or 'decent' bbq again? This was our last big eat in Las Vegas and I'm telling you, we should've eaten here every damn day and not wasted our time on anything else!!! I first found out about this place from a YouTuber I love, and had it bookmarked almost a year ago. I'm glad I remembered to check it out! We ubered here from the Bellagio which was about a ten minute drive, then ordered almost everything! We got a three meat plate and I think it's called the big Dave, a sandwich with brisket, pulled pork and hot links. I added Chipotle slaw and do yourself a favor and ADD IT TO YOUR SANDWICHES! OH MY GOD, my mouth is salivating. The meat was so tender, so caramelized on the outside and just melted in your mouth. Their BBQ sauce is PERFECT.  Seriously, I drowned my food in that BBQ sauce and wanted to plug it into an IV. Their mustard sauce and spicy bbq were great too, and when we ordered our food and found a table I saw a guest eating the moistest piece of cornbread I've ever seen. I went right back to the counter and ordered some! THE MOST PERFECT CORNBREAD IN THE WORLD. Went great with the other 6 sides we ordered! Meat fell RIGHT off the bone on the ribs when you used a fork! Not too tender to be a mess, but perfect in that once your teeth touch the smoked exterior of each rib, the meat comes right off. This will be my last meal before I die. You guys are geniuses, absolutely wonderful.

U4AcmCdlAn8VWwqMUtEBEA.text: Rollin' Smoke is located in a weird business park complex which boasts the corporate headquarters of a place called "Kiesub Electronics", but also has 3 buildings in the same place that bear the Kiesub name. The complex/mini strip mall feels like someone's trying too hard to make their own little sandcastle come across as an empire. Tucked away on the side not visible to us immediately was Rollin' Smoke.   This was also part of my Vegas journey to find a good burger. Rollin' Smoke's got a burger called the Outlaw that they like to pile with brisket. People dig it, so I set out to try it out...only problem was, they were sold out.  I settled for a Brisket Dog instead, because I enjoy a good potato chip sandwich every once in a while. "Puttin' Things on Top of Other Things Cuisine" is totally in my wheelhouse. If it was just the dog, the brisket and the Arkansauce that they serve up, I think I would have enjoyed it a lot more, but the cheese wiz on that sandwich really doesn't tie it together flavor-wise. I ended up scraping off the wiz after a couple bites, and it was much tastier that way.  The brisket...I dunno, man. I dunno what they do down in Texas that nobody else seems to be able to replicate, but this place didn't come close. It's just about Bludsoe's quality. Not quite salty and flavorful enough. Much as I hate being a locale champion, any BBQ that I've had outside of Texas just doesn't cut it anymore. I don't know what it is. The group I was with had the same impressions. It's perfectly fine, and it may very well be the best BBQ in Vegas, but it's pretty low on the totem pole in terms of overall rankings. The links are nothing special, and neither was the pulled pork. I'm not a ribs guy, but one of my group dug the ribs. So maybe order that if they're out of Outlaw Burgers. :)  We did all like their side dishes, though, so they've got that working, and the service was quite nice. People were pleasant and attentive. I probably wouldn't revisit the place, but it's not like it was an unpleasant dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket dog, cheese wiz, and Arkansauce.

vpWpmS_dHstp8Pp3FXRAaw.text: Who said great BBQ doesn't exist beyond Texas. They lied. Walk right in and be prepared to be greeted with all things Arkansas. You can't miss the enormous menu and its gargantuan display.   The menu is part reflection of what they do. I ordered the Rib platter. It comes with three different types of ribs. For $18 this meal is a great value if you want to try them all. Small price to pay for a GLORIOUS meal with big size and taste where the meat falls off the bones (beef).   The sides I ordered were Mac N Cheese with an extra helping of Corn nuggets for another $2.50. The sides are glorious too. By far the best corn nuggets I had to date. I also received the banana pudding just by checking in thru Yelp, a $4 dessert for free. Just GLORIOUS.  Thanks Yelp and Yelpers for making this place possible to find.  Lastly, this place was featured on an episode of Guy Fieri's "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pig Pit

NF7EwoS7HS0ccaYm-w5WlQ.text: This some very good bbq. It only took 6 minutes from time I ordered to receiving my food. Spare ribs are great falling of bone. Chicken was cooked perfectly and Mac and cheese is to die for. I wanna thank Rollin smoke for such great service and food was 10 stars!!!!!! Thank you

rGCQEcm7XgXDyNMdetV3Nw.text: Solid BBQ.  Found it on Yelp and went there for dinner on a recent trip.  We ordered the beef ribs, brisket, chicken and baby backs.  Corn bread and beans were also very good sides (although I prefer Texas style "chili" ie not sweet).   I gave it 4 stars simply because it was located in an industrial part of town and not that easy to walk to, as well as the fact that they were not licensed to serve alcohol.   Neither has anything to do with the food quality, but just rating the whole package.

a-J44kuvWA81nquRXRVBfQ.text: Visited this BBQ joint on my last trip to Vegas and very glad I did! First off, I have to give Mitch at the register some serious credit here as he pointed us in the direction of the all you-can-eat option. $35 and you can literally eat anything you want from the menu in an hour. There was so much I wanted to try, this was really the best option and most cost effective.  Burnt Ends with Mac and Cheese was one of my favorites, as well as the smoked meatloaf. Peach cobbler ala mode for dessert really sealed the deal. Brisket was amazing as well. Honestly, if you're having the same commitment issues I have when there is good BBQ around, save yourself the trouble and try it all!  To top off this awesome visit, Mitch took us on a tour of the whole restaurant. Kitchen, all the smokers, got to meet the chef and our Pit Master! Truly an awesome experience. Will definitely be back on my next stop in Vegas in a few weeks!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iJrqqqwVIdEvmHm4nEdCtA.text: The hype is real. Rollin Smoke is bomb. We had just finished up at my daughters roller deby game in #Vegas ...So we ended up at #MrMamas and they were closing. So "Sean" (the host at Mr. Mamas) suggested that we go here; WE ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT!  So much I came out licking other peoples fingers (I'm kidding)!! We got the AYCE special for $34.99, and the couple with us got a 2 meat combo plate and added a drink. The total was around $60 for both of us. This is an order at the counter, seat yourself place which I don't mind at all.   The AYCE special is anything on the menu any day and any time. The menu consists of a plethora of meats, burgers, sandwiches, sides, and desserts. I think we tried pretty much every meat in the place. Ribs, meatloaf, chicken, pulled pork and wings, just to name a few. If you have a hearty appetite, AYCE is the way to go.  For my meal, I got a 2 meat combo with chopped brisket and spare ribs, and for the sides, my daughter chose yams, collard greens and, mac & cheese. The food was delicious. I really loved the ribs. They were so tender and meaty and fall off the bone. A good rib needs no sauce, and these did not need any. Speaking of sauce, they have like 5 different bbq sauces, ranging from sweet to spicy. I personally love a good tangy yet sweet based sauce, so I enjoyed their bbq sauce the best. But they have something for everyone. The chopped brisket was yummy too, although I would probably get the brisket sliced next time. The only thing I did not like was the mac and cheese. It was really bland, but they have like 10 other sides to choose from. I can't wait to come back for some more yummy BBQ. Oh yeah, and my family does not do creamed corn at all and neither does Sean (from Mr. Mamas). But he strongly suggested we try them and we did. Oh So Good!!!!  #BaptisteClan

5t0UBSf45HRmpzSo5cU4hg.text: The food was good but the chicken was a little dry and I did not like their bbq sauce at all.

CV-dt9XYuVNdqG-33vyDuA.text: I guess I might not be the best person to rate BBQ as I'm really not a big fan of it, but I was disappointed with my dish. I ordered the biggin dad's favorite and I felt big chunks of fat in most of my bites. In addition, I felt that the BBQ was lacking some flavor.  This is a very laid back place, they do not have waitress service. You come in, place your order, pick a table and someone will deliver your food within 8 minutes.  This establishment is well known for their outlaw burger which has been featured on the travel channel... Let me tell you, this burger is huuge! I did not get to try it but if think you can handle it, you should definitely get it!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biggin dad&#39;s favorite

zy_L1CHzOZZRKodze25L1A.text: Great place In the middle of industrial Vegas.. I knew it was going to be good when I saw all the cop cars in the driveway. Eat where the cops eat.. That should be my new motto. We spoke to a cop once inside who said he patrols the area but will come out from Summerlin as this is the best bbq spot in Vegas.   I ordered some baby back ribs and banana pudding. The food came out very quick. The food was amazing. Bbq sauce on the tables so you can put as much as your heart desires. I could only eat about half as it is a large meal for a woman. My husband chowed down his 2 beef ribs no problem.   The onion rings.. Very thin, dipped in batter and fried. Reminded me of the kind you would get on a cheeseburger. They were delish. Banana pudding --pure heaven. As your dug in you got some of the cookies and whip. I pretty much ate it first.  Wish they would open some more locations.. And even maybe expand the location they have. It's so popular and a well loved establishment by all. Share the love!

4UuShm0Zg3TiRmISXFaSTA.text: Don't be weary of the semi sketchy outward appearance. As soon as you open the door, the aroma of BBQ instantly increases appetite.  Lizelle, the cashier,  was friendly and helpful if it is your first time. Ask anything on the menu. Service was also attentive. Both Lizelle and Karina were making rounds, cleaning up spills on floors, and checking that everyone was doing well.   Seating was on picnic tables which I thought was pretty cool.  Different sauces to try and generous if you're taking some to go too. The sweet sauce is like honey mustard, but even their default BBQ sauce is a safe bet for extra flavor. To go boxes and plates are on the counter next to cutlery. It's pretty  easy to get what you need.  I noticed their prices increased since last time I was here which was pretty disappointing though (minus a star) . BBQ is always gonna be a bit pricey, but is it worth it? I say, "try it." Trio plate is a safe bet, and for me, it was good for two people. Ribs, sliced brisket, and pork, a side, and a slice of white bread for $17.99. Old menu prices were much more reasonable and would've kept me coming back.   Oh, Don't forget to bring your cup if you're a local...you save $2 on drinks if you remember to have it

M_LgwQ1XUFe7whpJs6_MCQ.text: Love the brisket! My family loves going there.

K6uRESJ76Lvr3a78D1Dq3A.text: We ate here for dinner after reading other people's reviews. The Corn Nuggets were fantastic! I have never tasted anything like those before. Try dipping them in some of their dipping sauces for additional flavors. I will definitely return here on my next trip to Las Vegas!

nfCu-_Vd4rGEA4_ZKswa-A.text: Very good food..Family owned and they take pride in their BBQ!  Ribs..brisquet..burgers..their sides are to die for..its always full..people can't get enough of it. Though the wait is not long curiously enough?

0PFMjLf4WQN54Ek6ANdNVQ.text: The is the best BBQ place I have ever been to! I always get the brisket 3 ways plate, it's chopped, sliced and burnt ends. It's delicious! I have only tried the Mac and cheese, but other people I have been with said their sides were all very good. They had the baked beans and the loaded mashed potatoes. I recently went around 7 pm and the place was still crowded. It's become a tourist spot, but I would still recommend this place to anyone. It's not in the best area of Vegas but that's a small price to pay to get the best BBQ in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s dam good is right!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket 3 ways and Mac n cheese.

HlKI-FQMIjkOXmkh44YtRQ.text: This is THE place to go in Vegas if you want a ginormous Texas-sized burger that you could never in a million years fit in your mouth.  I ordered the "Outlaw" burger and could only eat 1/4 of it!  My husband did a WAY better job and ate the whole thing minus the bun.  The best part was the red onion strings!  Our friends ordered plates with brisket and chicken. If you want amazing brisket, come to Texas.  But if you want be decent brisket and find yourself in Vegas then go here!  Oh, my husband said the coleslaw was the BEST he's ever had:)

FnPLKm5O5paQLjG4mOQKrg.text: This place often crowded and the prices are high for what it is: average BBQ.  It could use a new floorplan.  As is, during lunch and dinner times there are a lot of choke points.  I've mostly stopped coming here on my own even though it is conveniently located near my office.  Portions are large so that does somewhat offset the price issue but taking food to go isn't always what I want to do.  Can be good for days when I skipped breakfast.  They could really use a lunch special or value menu for those of us who don't care to gorge ourselves on a pile of meat.

pMJSuAWTqi6xEsrn0cpN6g.text: If you go to Vegas, you have to try this place. Amazing food. Antonio S was very helpful and friendly. Best food we had in Vegas!

w9zAb0fPtMZ1nFj_zVgfXw.text: The thing about BBQ is that places tend to specialize. It's few and far between that a BBQ joint does everything well. Either they're great at ribs, or great at pork, or great at brisket. But for whatever reason it's really hard for any barbecue place to be great across the board.  Well, stop the press. Because Rollin Smoke just raised the bar.  Every meat that comes out of the smoker is perfectly done. The ribs are served dry - the melted fat of the meat captures the hickory smoke and the dry rub is as good as they get. The pulled pork is great. The brisket is worth going out of your way for - and I'm somebody who generally isn't a huge brisket fan. The hot link has a nice slow burn to it.  The sauces served alongside the meat complement it well - but they aren't necessary. The Carolina vinegar sauce pairs best with the pulled pork - especially with a little slaw on top.  Their sides are impeccable too. Just really flawless.  Portions are huge too. I'll order a 3-meat combo here at lunch and gnaw on it for another full meal and a half.  I just can't say enough good things about this place. It makes me happy even just Yelping about it.

MKXi8P6xiF1-fhpVpXK1zw.text: Because of how hidden this location is, unless you're a LV strip club connoisseur, I would consider this a hidden gem of the city.    Been here on multiple occasions and their food is consistently delicious. I get beef every time (beef ribs, brisket all ways), however I try their other meats when my friends get them and they are solid as well. Its one of those places that always makes you leave satisfied and feigning for a nap. The staff are warm and welcoming, and the decor is barbecue-y (a lot of Arkansas Razorbacks stuff).   A definite highlight of this place is their sauces. Their sauces have a ton of depth in flavor, and for the spicy lovers, their hot bbq sauce has a kick to it as well.   Prices are decent as I would definitely not consider this cheap eats, but this place is definitely worth the money. Visitors of Vegas should definitely try to visit this place. Oh yes, if you're going to strip clubs at night, pick one that is near this place because they open LATE.   Only downsides of this place is the location of the place (industrial, empty during the daytime, and I haven't been at night) and that parking is hard to come by because their lot is small. If you are not driving, consider using a rideshare program like Uber/Lyft to get there.

JRoVDJA0Jz9sPOc8PYioEA.text: I've heard nothing but great things about this place, but was highly disappointed. First of all, I ordered a delivery through postmates. The first order was cancelled b/c Rollin Smoke said that they were too busy. I called the store and the manager said put the order through again and it wouldn't be a problem. That they were busy but the order would be ready in 60-90 mins. Slow, but I didn't mind much. I thoroughly discussed the order w/ him as the phone call took about 20 minutes.   When the order arrived it is completely wrong! I made a $125 dollar order and couldn't even get the order correct. I called the next day to relay my complaint to the manager, but they were closed. I called back a few days later and an associate told me that there was not a manager who could help me nor was there anyone else at the business who could help me that was in the store. I wasted my time and money, I would not purchase again.

4GDmWhWzw59P6L3Y1RcM0w.text: Pulled pork and burned ends are super delicious! And the green beans are so tasty! Friendly atmosphere too!

pbZR1cB3hOkfUTDYWsJ4Cg.text: Awesome staff great food. Helped us out and made sure we were well taken care of. 10 out of 10.

UigJJkip8unLsWsa4p184A.text: We love BBQ  This place was the best we have had , even better than Memphis Tennessee,  Famous Daves, Lucille s  etc.. Our beef rib were huge.  Moist, tender and a beautiful smoke taste that didn't even need BBQ sauce.   Same for the baby backs and the brisket burnt ends. Then there's the Mama's smoked meatloaf over a bed of mashed potatoes topped with onion rings.  Never has meatloaf tasted so good. You have to try their little corn fritters,  their string beans and potato salad.   Extra large servings. Casual atmosphere,  plenty of seating in and out. Staff was so friendly,  helpful.  Our food was served without much of a wait and hot out of the kitchin. Wish we had one of these in California

5XO1LW7eH_yZbRF3JeohTQ.text: I'm known for flexing two things; my muscles, and my mouth. This BBQ joint forced to flex something entirely new to me; my floating ribs. (You know, so I could stuff more delicious meats into my expanding belly). This was an impromptu visit- I had very little time to prepare, so little that I, (yes me) arrived wearing a pretty teal dress and high heeled boots. Clearly, I wasn't prepared for the feast of sauces and meats that was about to grace both my lips, and outfit.  It's tucked in a gritty strip mall in Vegas, off the strip, near a strip club, and paired, ironically, with a Christian radio station. (WTF?)  We pulled in after a convention, at 6pm, and headed into the small storefront, as the 5-0 pulled someone over in the lot. The interior is coated in a mural, some yellow paint and stocked full of picnic tables in the color of barbecue sauce. (Appropriately) If you make your way towards the giant pig-head mounted chest high on the wall, you'll find the menus. Or read it from the ordering stand in the back right, where you can see a glimpse of the kitchen through a swinging door as you await blurting out your overly excited order. "Meaty sampler for two, for me, but add a half pound of burnt tips, just the tips, that's what she said, sorry, I can't help myself, I meant burnt ends." the guy behind the counter chuckled, and asked what sides, sizing me up in my frilly girly attire. "Corn nuggets" that was the moment. The defining moment of the night. (I also got the Mac & cheese and greenbeens- a girl's gotta be sensible)  I gladly exchanged my cash for the idea that I'd soon have my hands (among other things) on this highly renowned meat. We found an empty picnic table in the side room, and I filled it with napkins and little cups of barbecue sauces in preparation. As I anxiously awaited my trays of food, I was entertained by the 5-0 who were busy just outside the window arresting two hoodlums and launching them into a paddy-wagon. Dinner-and a show? #Winning. I heard my name. "Meg-Ann" (close enough) and jumped up to claim my anticipated treasure. Before me was a tray coated with shredded chicken, smoked sausage, ribs, BBQ chicken and brisket.  I'm fairly certain my eyes grew to a third the size of my face, and I began drooling as I inhaled the scent of southern deliciousness. A second tray graced my presence- I got so giddy I *almost* peed. There they were, Corn-freaking-nuggets.  I squealed. The entire room responded to my outburst. Burnt ends. Ooey, gooey, meaty, melty tips of immense flavor and fat and fabulous that trumped everything else..., everything, that is, but the corn nuggets. Those little fuckers could easily be responsible for my crossing over from the fit-side, to the obese, type 2, side. And all without question. They're sweet, crunchy, and tender, and easily justified by the fact that they contain a vegetable (not that corn is an exemplary veggie). I allowed a few before it began. I rolled my shoulders back, tossed my hair behind them, and wiggled my fingers before diving into the trough of meat before me. I really can't explain what happened in those first few minutes. I remember the blue and red lights flashing across my face, lighting my blond hair in a blaze of color, as I mauled through flavors of carnal deliciousness. There was sauce everywhere... My face, my cheek, my forehead.... My hands, my arms, the table, my dress? And even some on the napkins I laid in preparation. I don't think I had a fork. Maybe I had one, but in the whirl of BBQ sauce and meat stuffs, and smokey flavor and blue and red lights and burnt ends, I can't see where it fit in, how, or if. I annihilated the burnt ends. They were truly the best and most succulent bits of yum that graced my lips (hair/face/clothing....) they didn't need the sauces, so I saved them for the chicken. All the meat was tender, busting with smoky flavor, and cooked with love. (Or lard. I get those two confused)  I wasn't able to eat it all. Those sit-ups only allowed for a slight expansion of my diaphragm, and I wasn't capable of shoveling any more deliciousness in. I tried. I tried so hard. And it was worth the carnage. The other patrons stared at me like I was a mystical unicorn vomiting rainbows. The girl they saw walk in morphed into a ravenous monster hell bent on BBQ domination. This was, by far, my favorite BBQ experience of my existence. I'm still questioning whether they laced the meat with LSD or some other psychotropic drug that could explain the transformation that took place that night. But I'll chalk it up to all that "love" they used in making my meaty meal. Yelp- this place knows BBQ, just don't be afraid to lose yourself in the magic and mayhem that is Rollin Smoke.  Side note- if you do come here on any type of psychotropic drug- be weary the wall mural- lots of faces- staring, judging, watching, waiting to steal what you don't swallow.....
