O-lEQ8PBQYOw6Qlqy84uow.text: This is our sacred home bbq speaking. Every year we travel from Mexico city to NAB and RS bbq. Justin, the cheff really cares for service and flavor; Lou the other cheff really achieves perfection in all of the menu dishes. While Matt and Dan are always friendly, smiling and moving lightning fast to fullfill all your bbq needs. Dont miss this spot in Vegas. Try the D Delicious sampler or the Outlaw burguer for a slice of heaven. Peace.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. :)
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great times are rolling smoke good times!

mTcR5ZrcJz9RvKo1LpCEjg.text: Ok I'm from Tx home of the greatest BBQ on earth! When I'm in Vegas this is my "go to" place. Great food, great service!

r5ZuIikyspPOgpvpDpBLNw.text: Great beef brisket will for sure be back nice quiet spot to get away from the loud music and hustle of the strip

Qc-vu1uocvg-xqW5wKerbw.text: Until otherwise Rollin Smoke is King of Las Vegas BBQ.  This is the best example of a small business that through word of mouth has become a smash hit with people everywhere!!! Rollin Smoke has come along way in such a short time, I remember when you could see the chefs in kitchen cooking up a storm from the front counter and the area when you walked in was the only place to sit.  Situated between the strip and the 15 highway, Rollin is on South Highland Dr inside a small strip mall. You will see the smoker and or food truck out front, so be sure to keep your eyes peeled.  The best recommendation for a Rollin Smoke lunch or dinner is: Everything..... From the Ribs to the Brisket and home made deserts, this place won't disappoint you. If your hungry go after the Outlaw Burger... It's one tough burger to get into, and you will be full after.  I will say due to being on a few tv shows recently, the lines might start to increase, so get in early!!!!!  Overall Price: $$ Drink: 3-5 (soda - no booze) Food: 5-5 Service: 5-5 Come back: everyday if I could   Catering: I'll add In here I had Rollin Smoke come to my house and cater my sons 1st birthday... There wasn't to many kids mostly adults.  The guys were amazing, coming early to setup and checking in on every one to make sure all was good throughout the party.   Bringing in a smoker to cater the party was also a pretty awesome choice, I'm pretty sure the neighborhood was drooling at the smell. Highly recommend for anyone and everyone... Also a real decent price....  Overall: top shelf

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goodbye outlaw
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hello Outlaw
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now this is cool

w3K-NV1r1Hono7Lhu4XyOQ.text: Very good BBQ, first time here, the sauce is what makes it for me, a little cayenne pepper in the barbecue makes it good with just a little kick, I had brisket and ribs and both were tender, brisket is better imo

UQy25O99xfqU0sBlape1gg.text: Finally, real BBQ in las vegas! If you havent been here you better make the trip! I've been to Franklins and Salt Lick in Austin and this is just as good.

vQAwXeoKm7B7TIW-JVdjBQ.text: Good BBQ service is slow and they don't pay much attention to you but food is good..........The all you can eat is way over priced. And they charged me for the sweet and spicy BBQ sauce? But the meat is high quality and deserts are really good when available. Get more consistant and bump up the service and they would get a extra star from me.

L1HIbj5_Alk4gOVOjC-5wg.text: First time here and will be coming back again. Loved the brisket. It was so juicy and well seasoned. You can't leave without trying their corn nuggets.  Always keep an eye out for their daily specials listed on a board next to the drinks

G3Ujh395nqbowL1pbr8-fA.text: We went there last night and the meat is as good as it gets. Just delicious. Had the Rib Plate special. Huge meaty beef ribs, baby backs and St Louis ribs that fell off the bone and melted in your mouth. Deep rich smoke flavor with a crisp flavorful dry rub. The house BBQ sauce is excellent. Not too sweet and complimented the meat. Great spot!!!!

Ndg26t9gOEx0OUJF7XoO3w.text: My husband and I are a regular customer here. We sometimes even come 2 times a week. We went last week and things from their menu had changed. We always got the pit special 4 meats and 3 sides. It was perfect for us to share. Now it's not even available and they aren't letting us double meats. And the prices have gone up dramatically.  I know they are trying to keep up with the popularity.  But I miss the "we don't work on Sunday because we have to thank god for what we have" attitude. It's now all about getting the money from the tourist and forgot about the loyal locals.

4Yb8VyKdpZOQrjOceW5Umg.text: Okay... Last week I'm in Vegas on vacation visiting my besties and for dinner I chose Rolling Smoke and it was by far thee worst BBQ experience ever. Ordered the 5 meat combo and it was garbage. Pulled pork and the pulled beef were both dry as hell, the brisket was tough, the links were cold and the chicken wasn't even worth mentioning but the 2 rib bones weren't too bad (Yes, I said 2). I was extremely disappointed. To make matters worse were ordered multiple 5 meat combos because there was like 6 or 8 people and once we got home we found they neglected to put one of the orders in our bags and refused to answer the phone when we called back. The peach cobbler is made with cake (NOT where I'm from...) They have sweet corn poppers (Eek Methinks not.) And the loaded potato was terrible. I've had better cheese on a movie theater nachos. It's ridiculous. Their prices are way too high for such raggedy service and poor quality food. Never again shall I darken that door. Rolling smoke and keep rolling right on past me.

ocOSD1ijfqojX4wFev3r2w.text: Great BBQ spot near the strip, but not on the strip. its a small place so make sure you spot the grill outside the parking lot. Staff is very friendly, food came out quick and it was delicious!!! A must try!

b1yR2vx_e-yuoMj-eIKpoA.text: Fantastic all round but for me the brisket was a stand out...had to go for a second order! Hot links , ribs and pulled pork with sides of slaw, waffle fries and potato salad rounded out the pit special  The service and hospitality were fantastic! This is a must do in Vegas if bbq is your thing!

3_qaYxw3EK9lJA_qH8AW_A.text: Walked in and saw the Arkansas Razorback flag, and thought this place has to be good. I was wrong.....it's GREAT.  The baby back ribs were the best I've ever had. Ever. And I don't know what they do to the cornbread, but I hope they serve that in heaven. Good job!  WPS!

3hOC0KYPcjQz3AopgOOltA.text: It's not bad. Honestly I just think its overhyped. Their brisket and mac & cheese would really be the only reason I'd go back. The atmosphere is really awesome no doubt, and the employees were awesome. But I think it'll be awhile before I come back again.

P5Mfqup09t6abbraeBqPuQ.text: Came here while on my first visit to Vegas because it was recommended and a close walk from the hotel and boy am I glad I did. We ordered the pit special and everything was fantastic. I got the chicken, hot link, rib, and pork with loaded mashed potatoes, salad and mac n cheese. Literally everything was top notch - especially the hot link which was very spicy and one of the best ive had. They also offer an array of sauces but the carolina was my favorite (spicy was awesome too). Between the two of us we shared the order and still had enough to take home for leftovers and made a tasty lunch the next day. Lizelle and Sofia were also really sweet and helped us make our selections being that it was our first time. We just beat the lunch rush and it got very busy but there is ample seating. Lots of locals come here so that made it feel like a secret little spot we discovered. We even kept our cups as a souvenir! Will definitely be back on my next trip.

cp3wTfGkxhGth-xVxYYLHg.text: Being from North Carolina, my BBQ standards are pretty high (that goes for the fixins that come with it as well). I'm in the military, so I moved out here from NC almost 3 years ago, and in that amount of time I've never found any place that was up to par with what I considered good BBQ. Memphis isn't very good. Famous Dave's is okay. Lucille's is pretty decent, but for the drive to Henderson (and fairly high price), it's just not worth a regular trip. Then I got tip from a new friend (who was also a fellow North Carolinian) about a place that was a little off the beaten path but well worth it... Rollin Smoke Barbecue. So we decided to give it a try. That leads me to this moment, as I sit here with a full belly typing this review. My wife and I both had the pulled pork sandwich. Her sides were Mac & cheese and potato salad, mine were Mac & cheese and hush puppies. All of which were delicious. The meat was tender, the bbq sauce was delicious and had just a little bit of spice to it. All the sides were awesome. And we washed it all down with the only kind of tea that should exist... SWEET. Then to get our sweet tooth fix we shared some banana pudding that was amazing. Even as I stuffed my face I was studying the menu so I could plan my next visit. Rollin Smoke is the real deal. Great barbecue and extremely friendly staff. If you're a local or just passing through and you're looking for an authentic barbecue experience, Rollin Smoke is where it's at!

lMnuIKgQaYkUtRLr-mkDyQ.text: Just came in from out of town. Had no clue what was in store for me at this BBQ pit, but wow I was amazed. From the wide variety of bbq sauces to the large portions offered, they kept us happy! I would definitely recommend this place to a friend and I hope to go back next time I'm in town to try their burger! The employees even walked around the restaurant to check up on everyone to make sure their customers were satisfied! Thank you for the kind service and delicious meal!

veR-qrpVsBdGXCZpOiHSbg.text: Don't be put off by the location.  Great BBQ and a very welcoming atmosphere.

D11sxw8xigzeAw-aen2kww.text: Best BBQ I've had in Vegas!  The bam bam size beef rib was fall off the bone tender, so tender the lady at the next table was trying to put her beef rib in her to go box and the meat from the rib slipped off the bone into her lap :). The spare ribs and baby back ribs were good, but unfortunately after eating the beef rib first, it just didn't compare.  The BBQ sauce here is the perfect mix of sweet, tangy, and spicy.  And the list of sides makes it hard to decide...unfortunately they were out of fried okra so instead I had a side of corn nuggets, and these things are magical, imagine deep fried cream of corn.  The customer service is great as well, they come around and check on you a few times to make sure you are enjoying the experience.  As I'm writing this review, I'm already planning my next order....perhaps beef rib with beef brisket and I'm determined to have some fried okra next time!

frwkAqwhNsquVw50KzfR5w.text: I've been here a few times in the past and the food was always quick to come out and the portions were pretty generous.  I went last week for lunch and got more bread than meat and it took almost a half hour for the food to come out.  Granted they were busy, but it never took that long in the past and when I saw the portion size, I was disappointed.  I dunno what changed but I have to only give it 3 stars because of that.

oAVWxcFtVgzMShpZXE9k8w.text: We waited a while to get our food it was ok not as great as i thought it would be huge portions good to feel 2/3 mouths.

Zh6I340LzmE4S4AuMfmDtg.text: 1 out of 10, I'll give it an 8. All the meat is tender and juicy and has a great flavor. The sauces are amazing and sweet tea is a must! Peach cobbler is a no, banana pudding is a yes! Only downfall...the rib itself was all bones, barely have any meat and platters are way too over priced. Restroom was filthy dirty.

Ng9ATD1TjoLJWRQsCI11Cg.text: Love this place!  Super yummy, prices are very reasonable, and lots of outdoor seating, as long as they aren't too busy.  (There's indoor seating, too.)  The view is of the parking lot, but that's ok. It's so worth it!

5mdN6VZam5CLalAeZ802Yg.text: This place has the most yummy and the biggest variety of side dishes of any BBQ joint right now. I'm not a big rack of ribs kind of guy so my review doesn't really pertain to the ribs, I am a burger guy....The Outlaw burger is awesome and huge... There's spudtastic potato is good for a slightly lighter meal.

MM5Bk3CYjrgHLljtWT6wYQ.text: Drove from Henderson due to seeing it on TV(Food Network). Expectation were high. My husband and I arrived, obviously first timers. We walked in didn't even know what to get, their was so much to pick out off. I let the cashiers know, Hey! It's my first time, what do you recommend? I didn't even get answer. He replied, are you going to order? My husband got a whole rack of spare ribs n I got the Trio Choice of 3 meats. I asked for mashed potato and cole slaw, i only got cole slaw. We didnt get told if their was any sauces or utensils. I came across them because we were walking out after we ordered.  The ribs had no flavor to them, they werent dry which is good. I felt like the service coulve been better, due to being a first timer. Lets not mention my plate! I had to add soooo much sauce so i can ger some taste to it. I could see the rub on the meats but no flavor To them. It was like grilling food myself in my back yard m. I wasnt impressed, really thought it be really good since I seen it on TV! Hi5 on the cool cup, it's reusable!  Btw, I don't think what we paid ($55.00) was worth the drive nor the food.

PCvKHFxOgwMBiPBCcxTPxA.text: This hole in the wall place that is just off the strip is the spot to be for BBQ. I had the Trio plate, and it is "Slap Yo Mamma" Good! Not like the Casinos, this is a sure bet. Prices are great for the Quality BBQ.  If you're still reading this, "stop" and just go To Rollin Smoke BBQ NOW!!! :-)

Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0zIu-Ymp87Bn2afjcTN_nQ.text: This place is amazing!!!  The smoked beef ribs are ridiculous.  The pork ribs are so good.  Best chicken wings I have ever had, they are also smoked!  The smoke does 98% of the flavoring and the BBQ sauce is the final enhancement.   The mac n' cheese is creamy and rich.  The guys that work there are really friendly and helpfull.  This will be a stop for me every time I come back to Las Vegas!

gvgcX7cyc5B0OBIxpu5zVQ.text: Hole in the wall kind of place but nice and full of picnic tables. Incredible BBQ and BBQ sauce. Everything was excellent. Probably the top five BBQ I've had.  Friendly staff. No Alcohol sold there. Did I mention the food was great? This is a definite place I would use if needing to use for catering.

lSDm4_khAKSo7EN23cyeKg.text: While in LV this week I drew on Yelp for a nearby recommendation and was pointed to Rollin Smoke BBQ. While the BBQ meats were very good the sides were great. Couldn't get the potato salad and mac & cheese off my mind so I headed back the next day and everything was better than the day before. I will stop in again anytime I'm visiting the area.

k2L_8zTX0zECxEj_0MQX2w.text: Came back again recently. I had to give them credit where credit is due and up my rating from 4 to 5 stars. Some pretty darn good BBQ, great sides, and awesome sweet tea. I will definitely be back whenever I'm in town. Can't go wrong, $11 for 2 meat, 1 side, & drink.

cTEHXQ8jPUAtixtBQFua2w.text: After reading the reviews I was really excited to try this barbecue spot and unfortunately it was all hype. I ordered the brisket and ribs both were completely dry and very tough. After soaking it in about 2 to 3 cups of barbecue sauce it still didn't make anything better. I tried to let the reviews redeem themselves by ordering the peach cobbler, the crust was very soft and mushy. The peaches were cold and I'm sure they were directly from a can. They stated that the ice cream was Blue Bell and in fact it wasn't. I'm from Texas and know the ice cream very well, and what BBQ should taste like. I've had better ribs at chain restaurants where the meat falls off of the bone. Unfortunately this meat felt like it was fighting for its life to maintain a part of the bone. I was very disappointed to say the least. McDonald's McRib sandwich is a better BBQ choice than this restaurant and I haven't eaten at McDonald's in over 20 years.

-tGRMOmLOZFQu32CqOmM5Q.text: -Reasonable price -Delicious food -Extra friendly staff  A couple of friends suggested my fam and I try this place out. Needless to say, we were all very pleased. They had quite a large menu with some pretty excellent deals. The gentleman who took our order was very friendly and was happy to offer recommendations/opinions on certain dishes. We didn't wait very long for our food to be ready. The guy who brought it to our table was personable and excited for us to try it. The dude who took our order came to check on us shortly after to ensure we were happy with our meal and to make small chat (not in the annoying way we've sometimes experienced at other restaurants, he was actually sincere and nice). He told us how he and his fam moved here from the south and we chatted about the show "Grill Masters".   The food was great! Definitely better than most I've had in the valley and for a much better price. No complaints AT ALL. As long as this place is around, we are never going to Memphis BBQ again. HAHA.

fJAwvp9g3x4XVlyDJajOug.text: So far the best bbq place I've ever been to here in Las Vegas! Mac and cheese good, kickin beans, and greens, bomb. Best local spot for great bbq!

_87FO1c8ERAFV292H-JCSg.text: This place is great! The corn nuggets and the burger that they're so known for! Is just wooooow!!!

CfrCFciVLEjN2U6b5y5-2Q.text: Awesome food!! The pulled pork sandwich is the best. I also loved their corn nuggets and okra. The baked beans are a little too spicy for my personal taste, but if you like a "kick" in your baked beans, you would enjoy them. The restaurant doesn't look like much from the outside, but it is a great place to eat. I will definitely return when I visit Vegas.

rj_NZulIC2HU4Xbvr0BwOQ.text: After reading many reviews the hubby and I decided to give this place a chance and let me tell you it was a HUGE disappointment. Don't get me wrong the staff was really nic e and the place was clean but, the food was totally different. First they got my hubbys order wrong, second our food came out COLD not warm cold, third my Rib Tips were so dry and though most of it was inedible, Fourth all the food that came out was sooo dry and flavorless it had no salt.  What a let down and waste money.    Oh and by the way this food also gave us upset stomach and disgusting burps.  Ps i recommend the Roadkill which beats this place by far.

HZKunbExHhnmbWMEnkdHVw.text: They catered at a party we went to and the food was amazing! Rib meat fell off the bones, beans were sweet and spicy, and the brisket was tender. Definitely a place to go to for BBQ!

R4xd9SGleRG9inZjxyP8pA.text: What a disappointment! I have to wonder about the validity of all the positive reviews.  Great service? It's literally nonexistent.  I had beef ribs and one of them was 95 percent fat. The barbecue sauce tasted putrid for want of a better word, like it was unrefrigerated for a long time.  We split a four meat platter as well and nothing about it was in any way remarkable. My wife commented that the ribs at the Gold Coast buffet are better, and I agree.  She ordered onion laces and they were just a pile of greasy limpness. I wish we would have taken a picture.  This place is nothing more than mediocre at best. Don't believe the hype on here. Plus, it is nearly impossible to find.

3F8Sb5EMhtkhG7atIRMLqQ.text: I visited this restaurant at the end of March because I heard the food was great. I was very disappointed with the customer service. The cashier Caleb was not very friendly as he greeted me .  No smile or have a nice day in fact he didn't seem too pleased to take my order.  The waitress Jessica also wasn't friendly . There was no kind word or smile as she shoved my food into my hands. Never once did I hear , "have a nice day or thank you "  The food was great but the customer service didn't make me want to return .  I visited a place called Yardbird and all their staff smiled and said , Hi .  As I left Yardbird every staff member I came across smiled and said , thank u for coming, have a good day or come back and see us as they smiled .  I felt more welcomed and appreciated at Yardbird.  Good Customer service is very important to me.

-XUORAZKF3ZOYqBP8E92RA.text: Small Hidden place in the industrial section, but was a good find. I've tried other BBQ places in Las Vegas and Los Angeles and Rollin smoke is up there with the other good ones. I had pulled pork/Brisket which was really tender, juicy and sauce wasn't too overpowering. I looked to my left and saw a monster -  the "Outlaw Burger" which looked like a burger on steroids. IT was stacked high with onion rings and brisket or pork (I forgot) and fat meat patty. You gotta see this. I asked the guys after they ate it and said" its amazing". Good food, good prices, good to eat with friends but kinda limited in spaces but open til like 1AM. I will surely go back...

hFxgJbS0A8xQnix7-rXWbQ.text: I had best, most tender ribs from this place! My family has been dying to go here but it's a little out of the way for locals, so we finally made our way here. The line took about 20 minutes and it was a little cramped inside, but there seemed to be enough seating. I got baby back ribs, mac & cheese, criss cross fries, and peach cobbler. The ribs are. so. good. Seriously. As well as everything else. Best BBQ I've had in a long time.

Cog9TEV80LyCgOcLrTJrZA.text: Best BBQ I've had in Vegas in more than 30 years here.  Had brisket, chicken and rib tips, with mac& cheese, and yams.  Excellent quality all the way around...the chicken was perfectly cooked...fully done but still moist...the mac & cheese was nice and creamy.  this is definitely my "go to" for "Q.  Oh, and the sauce was really interesting...a little thinner than some sauces, and with a really nice balance of vinegar and sweetness.  Really glad I tried these guys and looking forward to more.

gE0UFjt_4PsCtxiACDvGEA.text: My Dad always said the very best BBQ are always found in a Hole-in-the-wall-joints and that continues to stand True here! This BBQ joint appears to be the perfect example of this and is incredible! The Pit Special provides a perfect meal of four types of meat and three sides, capable of feeding two adults easily (fed me, my wife, and our 7yr old son). The Corn Nuggets are an absolute MUST! For dessert we had the Butterfingers Bread Pudding a-la-mode, and it was a fine finish to an enjoyable meal of BBQ bliss.

JpxQ0b6ieowR8WJfa8YNCw.text: Hands down THE BEST hole-in-the-wall restaurant in all of Las Vegas!! I'm originally from Texas so I know good BBQ but I've lived in Vegas for the past 3 years. Whenever I'm in the area, I always stop by Rollin Smoke. I love bringing friends here and watch as it changes their lives! So delicious!! If you've never been, don't miss your chance!!!

uInbT0ktlfJ2QYnJDduTeA.text: Was a regular since I work down the street I normally get lunch here but until today I ordered over the phone same thing I normally get when I pick up my food it was more than I usually pay . They obviously didn't mention that they raised their prices . Place is ok but not worth 12.99$ plus tax for a baked potato for lunch . If you raise the prices you would think they would put extra meat  they're very stingy with the meet .

H7uFmDmNzZ1Yt1_47MRzBg.text: Great BBQ, glad to finally find some good smoked BBQ in Vegas. The location is out of the way but the food is worth it. I absolutely love the brisket, can't wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The goods!
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of the building

VjD-erksoWRnl8KhgaLCiw.text: Good BBQ food, I have had the nacho fries each time and even though they have been removed from the menu they will still make them on request.

YaC6XVwUEizvEBQFZbajKw.text: Wow!  This place is awesome.  I was originally introduced to it when they were serving it for the free lunch offered at my favorite strip club (Little Darlings).  Anyways, went to the restaurant and it was even better!   Had the shrimp + mac and cheese + waffle fries.  All excellent.  Quick service.  10% locals discount and excellent friendly staff and a cashier who could explain the menu well.  Overall, A+!!!

qCvTKlydisRzSKIB9FH-Bw.text: Excellent food and service - even if you aren't a BBQ fan you need to give this place a try!

UfUNNGiWgnbhrXK31__Kcg.text: Best BBQ I've had in Las Vegas. I got the rib platter which was about $17.99. It was delicious and the meat just fell of the bone. Service was great and cashiers were nice and courteous. I would highly recommend this place to any meat or BBQ lovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib platter. 3 baby backs, 2 spares, 1 beef rib + Mac n cheese

BEw1-pcCFB0TEtbXzdXPDA.text: Pretty darn good bbq for vegas. I didn't have high hopes at all but their burnt ends and brisket were pretty close to what I ate in Texas. I wish Rolling Smoke was closer to me because I would definitley go there more often!

GHnGzSHKZOctGTqKUu_Aaw.text: Best American bbq in Vegas especially for the price you pay. The service is very pleasant and the decor is appropriate. I came here for my fiances birthday and everyone thought the food was delicious. I can't give it 5 stars because the brisket was not as tender as I had hoped it would be.

8xAVtEICCsgQPJg6vLRGZQ.text: Oh man this place has delicious ribs the meat falls right off and they have this tangy/hot sauce so yummy with the meat. We got some sides with our meal mac and cheese and mashed potatoes I wasn't impressed they didn't have any flavor and the mashed potatoes were room temperature, that's why I gave them 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $19.99 plater

Qm_Wq2aWHPp12jVv9X8z4Q.text: Friendly service and good BBQ.  Both of us got the two meat plate.... pork/brisket and brisket/ribs.  All meats were excellent, potato salad and mac and cheese sides were both just ok.  Sauce on the table was delicious but wish there was a spicy version. Also thought that the plate would come with corn bread but unfortunately it came with a soggy piece of plain white bread.   Service was perfect except that they forgot my blueberry dessert....I asked for it and they forgot it again!  Finally waited and waited... left without even getting it. Booooooo.  (Minus 1 star)

7DiuIPE4XIYih22fW62JRA.text: Literally some of the best bbq I have ever had.  I wish there was better seating, but I'll be back no matter what!

BDNMnMxHfM6Co8_XjZT9tQ.text: Shout out to Mitchell for being the best and courteous host and to Chefmaster Tim for the grand tour. It's rare meeting and seeing the preparers of the menu items. And now about the food; where do I start?!!! I had the brisket and pork ribs, both melt in your mouth and was soooo stick to your ribs good!!! The Mac n' Cheese and the collard greens were very, very tasty and seasoned to perfection. I mean there are not enough adjectives to describe this place and the food. All I can say is, get off the beaten path of the Las Vegas strip and go check out ROLLIN SMOKIN. Don't let the exterior f the building fool ya. The food is all that and more.  It was one of the best meals I had AND I WILL VISIT THEM AGAIN when I come back. This is a restaurant you will want to visit over and over again. Kudos to ya'll.

J64yaCQkBMAPVE_hjY2dCQ.text: Some of the best barbecue I've had in a while. I've been to Kansas City and St. Louis and by far this is some of the best on the west side of the country.

j1JSIW9zbtbGyM7nN9lgvA.text: Rollin Smoke was just ok... It's not the best bbq ive had -- i dont always go for bbqs. It's comparable to famous daves and memphis bbq but a little on the mom and pop's restaurant kind of service and ambience. Though they could use a little upgrade -- the place was tight, bbq were served on plastic basket with a wrap over the basket, sides were served in styro containers, you have to ask for plates or get it yourself if they have some out, the plastic utensils didnt look clean, sprite tasted funky or maybe it was the ice.  We ordered the platter (good for two) with four meats -- brisket, pulled pork, chicken, ribs. Pulled pork was the best out of all of them but again average compared to other bbq places. They only have one sauce on the table and it was watery -- the kind that will squirt on your shirt. The tip of the sauce container was not as clean as my (sort of ocd when it comes to food and food handling) self hoped it would be.  There were a few regulars but mostly tourists it seemed...  Despite of all that ive mentioned about the place being average, it's worth a try.

6W9iJjeJcQbXzr5VgJU4Ew.text: Friendly service but like a review I read before going said, if you like Austin, TX or Memphis bbq you will be disappointed. Good meal but wouldn't recommend to friends. Sorry, love local businesses but I was underwhelmed.

1BT8yGjR6U5QKm4goT0WMg.text: My new favorite spot in Vegas for BBQ. They are a straight up BBQ spot, no frills no thrills. Food is fresh and the guys behind the counter are super cool and really nice. As a guy who normally visits Vegas frequently for work, I'll make this one of my stops from now on. I just wish they had beer, haha! Thanks guys..

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I asked for large...

NT615tOKj7a-qboq2SgsCQ.text: Much better than the Pawn Stars version because you don't get robbed. They offer a good size portion for the money unlike Harrison's joint. My only qualm about the place was that it's a " good ole boy" establishment and I was getting side looks from a few customers because I'm as non " good ole boy" as you can get. Maybe that's what contributed to my heartburn afterwards? I really don't like being a " person of interest" while I'm eating.

kCcMTbRD5ODTjauFlPMEjg.text: The food and the atmosphere are amazing.  This is a must visit place when coming to Vegas.  The people there are great at making you feel like they want you to enjoy your meal.  Everything I've had has a great authentic flavor and I can't wait to go back!!!

ZwF1dm13h6tgTWHXSQRYew.text: Meat, meat, meat! The Outlaw Burger was AMAZING. Piled so high it was difficult to fit it in my mouth. It was worth the effort! :). The ribs had a great flavor and the texture was perfect.  Pull off the bone delicious. Add the banana pudding. You won't regret it. Best banana pudding I've ever had, and I've eaten a monkeys share of banana pudding.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw Burger

nydV0TJtBHGIYNuz9oV3xw.text: Did not expect what we received. What appeared to be a little hole in the wall turned out to be an AMAZING experience.  A gentleman by the name of Mitch took out order and exceeded our expectations. We were with a group so he worked with us and gave us a group discount. Along with that he sat us down and hooked us up big time. Food is amazing and would highly recommend this to anyone.   DO NOT let the outside location cool you. You will see why the inside is packed along with the parking lot.

Hscgz1m_SD0NqMWTuTEuKQ.text: Have not been in the establishment, but they catered a BBQ for Pilot Air Fright. Great ribs, brisket, beans. Will have to go to the restaurant for s sit down dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FF6Cc7ZHG2es9FBmfigy9Q.text: Amazing BBQ, I had the BBQ chicken wrap. It was very good, but that alone wouldn't get me back. Its all about the greens! Best collard greens I've ever had. Place is small, but part of the charm. Definitely worth the visit!

byS5uAyHyh9fS7xFmlc4UQ.text: Food was excellent. The service was even better. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. We finished off with sweet potato pie and it was amazing!! Would highly recommend it!!

T-JzNRcoQ9jxS-V0hFNwSw.text: Love this place are second time going there food was consistent and very good both times definitely worth the effort to find a place stay away from lunch time they get real busy

Y8Eqm4uKt0W5gd6-xgOq5w.text: This place was amazing I have zero complaints other than I wish I had the appetite to try more items. I was in Vegas for about a week and this place stood out to me above most of the places I ate at here. I came here after walking around Fremont Street so it was on my way back to the Hotel.  At night this side street is dark and in an industrial part of town so if you're not used dark back roads come here in the day. The place seems small from outside but once inside it is pretty decent sized with outdoor seating. I got to the counter and the lady was nice enough to recommend the Rib platter special since I wanted to try so many different items. I also ordered the peach cobbler a la mode and a side of baked potato salad with two sauces their signature and their damn hot sauce. I took everything to go and once I drove 15 minutes to my room we tried all the food and it was amazing. It had a good hint of smoke and all the meat was soft and falling off the bone in the best possible way. The signature sauce was like liquid crack and I was about to drink it and the Damn hot was exactly what it says. I love spicy but the hot sauce burns all over your mouth so I am good with that but it had flavor so if you can handle it go for it. AS for the peach cobbler it was good and I like it but my wife likes crust and would have liked a bit more but flavor was on point. So I know I am coming back when I am in town and that happens at least once a year

afHLf2yP-WkERbKvSulG_g.text: Biggest complaint they close too early....8pm and also kind of out in the middle of nowhere...although there is a strip club right beside it if you want deserts after the smokey food.  Ordered the trios which had 3 meats and sides. Portions wise it was big and thr food was cheap. The flavour for sure is smokey. I had the pulled pork,  brisket, and ribs. Ribs were ok. Pulled pork didn't seem to have much sauce (I would prefer some sauce). The brisket was too dry maybe they smoked it too long and dried out the meat. The sides I don't have too much to say... none of they were that great. Fries were a little greasy for my liking.

SrWqKscGNUdzsz5czR3lGQ.text: Ribs are amazing, the duo combo with a side is plenty for two people. Try the chipotle Cole slaw

vaVBMa3nUyTLg6kC6N_ckA.text: There were 4 of us--- 1 from The South (Trio (2) 1/4 Chick and Ribs with Fries);  1 from the Midwest (Duo Brisket and Chick with Bacon Pot Salad); 1 from the East Coast (Pulled Piggy and Fries; and 1 from the Islands (Duo Ribs and Chick with Mac n Cheese).... Plus all meals came with drinks.   1) It was clean... Picnic tables were large, though seating is limited.   2) EVERYONE enjoyed their food... I loved that the Chef came out to see if all we're doing well and even at times delivered food.   3) Again, the food was good ;) It looked good, smelled great, hit the spot and was plenty. Almost all of us brought a part back to our rooms.   4) I read other reviews and came when we wouldn't have to wait in line. It would be worth the wait even if we hadn't.

ODq6YGg2yvkRQRP0KnQOQw.text: Found this place via Yelp when it just opened and have been going there ever since. I take friends and family to try this delicious family-owned BBQ spot. Love Dusty, his dad and everyone who works there; the whole staff is super friendly! The location makes it a diamond in the rough, but it's worth the drive always!   The food is AMAZING! You can't go wrong with anything. My favorite is the pulled piggy topped with jalapeno cole slaw. Just took a friend today and she got and loved "Dad's Favorite." They also have yummy dessert options. I always get the sweet tea when I go; it's a staple.   If you're reading this and haven't gone, what are you waiting for?! :)

RPFfvWnwnmV4U14QoadGBg.text: I really don't write reviews on yelp so I decided to start with this place. I feel this place deserves a 5 star for the simple fact that the service, food, and atmosphere is awesome!! I was on my way to school and my stomach was growling to the max! Luckily and fortunately this place was down the street from school as I was in a hurry for a quick bite. The nice young lady who helped me recommended me the "Outlaw Burger" it won "Best of Vegas" for a reason. That burger was stacked tall with meat, onion strings, bbq sauce and a cherry (pepper) on top with a side of mac and cheese. This burger tested my will, I didn't think I was able to eat this beast. But with determination and a empty stomach, I was able to tame this beast in about 10 minutes :D The burger was tasty and juicy, mac n cheese was delicious! Will be back with a group of my friends to see for themselves how great this place is. Kudos to the staff and the "Outlaw Burger."

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finished this delicious snack in 10 minutes :)
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty big burger, about 8 inches tall!

Do0oz5inIiL-EOMINIF8fw.text: I had been craving beef ribs for quite awhile and found this place while traveling through Vegas. Absolutely awesome! Fall off the bone. I ordered full slab (4 bones) and originally thought it might leave me still hungry. Then they showed up at the table. I went from starving to stuffed. Great service, they were very helpful with explaining the menu and making recommendations. A bit pricey but definitely worth it. The baked beans were  a little under cooked but good flavor.

29Ms7VMWgBIOo1Ty6X_n4w.text: Rollin smoke is excellent bbq authentic tasting like you made it yourself. Never dissapoints.

BquSZl_1R_C44q_4gg9YOw.text: This place is a small hole in the wall and from the outside it doesn't look like much. However the line out the door and the BBQ surrounding the business was a good sign!! The price is $25 for all you can eat dinning in which is extremely affordable. I seen the plates going by while in line and knew one plate was going to be plenty. I ordered the 3 meat combo chicken links and brisket w a side of Mac n cheese!! The sauce was a condiment and the meat w so juicy and seasoned just right!! My God the chicken was AMAZING I was so impressed I got the breast and it literally melted in my mouth!!  I can't say it enough this place was sooooooooo good!!! This is added to my list of must haves when I go to Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xJBdAVs8ZdlEmu5k0JACog.text: Saw them on Drivers, Dine-Ins and Dives with Guy Fieri.  Looked really good and unique. If you blink you'll miss the place because it's behind the casinos in an industrial area.   Menu is extensive and formidable. I would imagine it would take you 3 months of coming everyday to try it all.  The portions seemed a little small to me. The $3 extra to make it a meal with a side and drink with my pulled piggy sandwich was expensive for the tiny portion they served.  BTW, the sandwich was super delicious.    The hostess was goofy, energetic, and knew the menu really well.  She was a pleasure to talk to.  I think I would try the other BBQ places featured on yelp just to have a really good comparison as to which was the best.    Overall, it's a great off the strip place to try.  Really low-key atmosphere.

9v0D1HyeGiOxFwR-vG8ynQ.text: Great BBQ food for a quick meal. They have multiple sauces from sweet to hot with all of them being great. Very friendly staff.

8JtBSr725Tqrl72-gAXLlQ.text: Beef ribs are absolutely amazing! I would go there just for them. You don't associate Vegas with BBQ but this place is incredible.

e_aciT-qsH-Osh6kyhmnmQ.text: Great hole in the wall find. I had the brisket sandwich and waffle fries and my sister had the trio combo with brisket, ribs and waffle fries.  Her brisket was the ticket! The couple next to us recommended Mac and Cheese and the catfish. Can't wait for the next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Texas Girls looking for good BBQ in Vegas

tzZSyJVV1bb4LPsZVxxXEg.text: Reviews are correct, this place is fantastic.   I was surprised how small it was but not at all crowded.   3 guys and we ordered the pit special and the beef BBQ platter - plenty of food!   Could not finish!   Enjoy!

AyPdQx8hrI3Azl2pqCf7QA.text: Amazing beef rib & baby back pork ribs!!! Super cute place & great prices...the outlaw burger was ok..not so great as i expected it to be..

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outlaw burger...ok
Photo of Rollin Smoke Barbeque - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef rib

KhCl7V4j0rjUex2vLXhynA.text: Great food! I love BBQ and have to say it was the best. People need to come try this gem off the strip!

mP1GjG_SUPst2ovV6ViMsg.text: We drove down from Hurricane, Utah and had to try this place. This place did not dissapoint .For starters the corn bread is the best we have ever had! Period. It was light and not dry, didn't need any topping.The different meats, baby back ribs, pork ribs, beef ribs, pulled pork, brisket, and chicken were superb. the beans were spicy  and good. The sauce did have too much kick for us, so we left it off everthing. Can't wait to try something else next time. We talked to the owner, an Arkansaw young guy,, real down home freindly.

HuxeXmkq-g0evZQVfyjowQ.text: Amazing food.  The BBQ nacho fries are to die for.  Wish there was more room inside for moving around and sitting.  I like that they rearranged the main room to make it easier to order and pay.  Hope they build new locations that are closer to my area.

AExWp9AdHTONsNihUQxUyA.text: I love this place. It is the best BBQ place in Las Vegas. Everything on their menu is delicious and cooked to perfection. Staff is very friendly  and seems to be family owned & operated. I would recommend stopping by Rolling Smoke BBQ if you are looking to taste authentic BBQ.

SFbFYm7g9Ix_MkWXnDy9qQ.text: As seen on "Diners Drive-ins and Dives" Southern style BBQ in Las Vegas. It's hard to find, a hole-in-wall type joint with few seats indoors and some outside. The smell of smoked meats fills the air everywhere so just roll your window down and follow your nose. The brisket and ribs were exceptional.  We went at 3pm and the line was still out the door.

mOgE8jVOWLYJUW4kemX99w.text: Rough looking neighborhood, odd order taking arrangement, side order mix-ups but tasty BBQ, "homey" hospitality and lower prices makes this a real find. Far from classy but some of the best ribs, chicken, fried okra and kick'in beans a person can eat!

QEZd0ws8g8SO4X8rVPciYg.text: Lets start with the food. Holy god, it's good. Damn good. The sides are generous and filling, the pulled pork is very satisfying. The hot links are cut and oozing flavor. You get a free dessert if you use yelp too so that's a plus. I also ordered the outlaw burger and was warned it takes about 15 minutes to make. I was okay with that until 35 minutes later it still had not come. The burger was amazing and I had only ordered a 1/2 pound of pulled pork and received well over a pound (I assume it was for the wait)  I ordered for two people and my name was the same as another patron so I'm assuming there was some confusion there. Which brings me to the only reason I give 4 stars instead of 5. The ordering and service wasn't great, but It wasn't bad either and the food more than made up for it.

6AklOI9ADFgqpUqIB9hKuw.text: Ate here with a group.  Everyone enjoyed their meal.  Can wait to return to Vegas to eat their again.  I had the brisket dog, so yummy!

LMqmn_POawlz_mE0Lo_w6Q.text: Nice place.  Friendly.  Made me feel at home and seems to be family oriented.  I ordered the AYCE!  Big mistake,not because it was not delicious, but because it was way too much food.  I started with beef rib, pork ribs, hotlink, mac n cheese,greens, and somehow they threw a piece of fried catfish on my plate too.  Everything was awesome, especially the beef rib, very meaty and smokey. The only problem was that the link was not very hot both in heat and spice. I also had the fried shrimp and hushpuppies (I asked them to half the normal order for me cuz I was so full,  they said no problem) I finished with sweet potato pie and carmel cake. ohhh and i even asked them for a glass of milk to wash it down.  Not bad, not bad all!

dVSEIOyWSb_62vB4ck28Ow.text: I had trio special. Hot link, brisket and chicken.  With corn nuggets. It was fabulous. Service was top notch. Only thing that sucks. Parking.

cQLTjQixGEoji-h9yIdrHw.text: I love this place.  Its the best hole in the wall find that I have come across in a long time.  Its hard to get to and you literally have to know about it to eat there.  Thats the cool part.  I have had the pork ribs and then went back a week later for the beef ribs.  Both were awesome.  I am going to keeping taking my friends here.  These are the best ribs that I have had in town.  They also have a ground beef/brisket hamburger that I am dying to try.  This place has no thrills but incredible food.  Highly recommended for the food and adventure.

VmXSfLwabn0n7-4BG77piw.text: Just ate there for the first time the other day...now I can't see myself going anywhere else for BBQ!  Hands down, the best in Southern Nevada!

eKILuzq-nMi0q9ivpVXxWQ.text: For a bbq place the service is very fast and its great!  The staff is always warm and inviting the food is always fresh.  The prices are very reasonable as well you would be dumb not to try this place at least once!

Z55rqxG_UAfbgdWKKBAEhQ.text: This is one of the best kept secrets in Las Vegas.  This is an awesome treat for the family reserved for Friday night after long weeks.

dYcvrt15QnYVXoqiPJk7cA.text: Best BBQ in Las Vegas hands down. I am originally from Tennessee and have eaten a ton of BBQ. Rollin Smoke is up there with the best i had anywhere.

pRajQZ7xdT60nN0JN6JfeQ.text: I actually signed up to write reviews just because of this delicious BBQ place!  This little BBQ joint is legit southern style great BBQ.  First off, it's not a real BBQ place until it has fried okra as a side and this place delivers on that as well as so many things.  Sweet Tea, yep it's effin delicious too.  The meat we had as our dinner were- ribs (fall off the bone when you pick them up) brisket (tender and it's got that gorgeous pink smoke ring and amazing flavor) and smoked sausage (has just the right amount of spice too it!) sides- okra and mac n cheese.  We are from Oklahoma and miss the craft and care that goes into smoking and creating amazing BBQ but we don't have to miss it anymore!  Service is amazing and friendly and we plan on taking our friends and family that visit us!  Thanks to the staff for the warm welcome and friendly atmosphere, seriously can't wait to come back and next time I'm going to have the berry cobbler too!

4FmO0347ho3KVacZG2BBgQ.text: The food is great the line was horrible but it's worth every wait and penny...This food so tastefully good I felt as if I was in heaven

-VCSnGCeEAdRwyNhY_qg7A.text: I have eaten here once before and loved it but this time was even better.  It seems they have expanded a little and have become even more accomplished at smoked meats and great sides.  It is a little out of the way for the typical tourist but it is totally worth the effort to get there for great BBQ.

USTuxJ6McMcL4P_CjDQLLA.text: This is not Southern style brisket. It's chewy and fatty (i found three large chunks of fatty brisket that somebody could choke on if they tried to swallow it). Listen, I ate at 36 real southern BBQ joints last summer and this brisket would rank last. Website says he is from Arkansas, but I would like proof because the brisket doesn't qualify as southern. You can tell by the way he chops it, real BBQ brisket is more shredded. He also should know nobody serves brisket on a hoagie roll in the south, it comes on a bun. Rollin Smoke has two sauces, one claims to be hot, but both taste exactly the same, nothing stands out in that respect. Moving onto the side dish, which is in a tiny cup and not worth the $2. It was jalapeno coleslaw and wasn't too bad, but I honestly didn't see any jalapeno's in the cup. It also appears he has changed the prices - up of course - after being open a week. The online menu says a combo includes drink, chips and side for $2, now the chips are excluded. The price of 1/2 rack of ribs is $10 online and $12 on another menu that is off to the side inside the place, but on the official menu it is now $16. The big smoker on the outside and good smell makes this place appealing to the eyes and nose, but it doesn't pass the taste test. If you do go, show the website coupon on your phone to save 10 percent and that way when you get home and eat your nasty brisket at least you will have saved some money and won't feel as bad.

fiX_5nv4psrYlC7z2uq7jw.text: Have been to a lot bbq joints across the U.S. And man, this one is up there in the top 5. Been to Vegas for many years and never knew of this place. Everything is amazing and smoked to perfection.
